Source: You don't know? Then you can't be with the Worm Cult.\n\nThose foul necromancers raided our village last night. We trapped three of their lieutenants in our huts, but they're quite dangerous. We're at an impasse.

Source: In a word … murder. You've arrived at a delicate time. Pray you don't bring more troubles to our doorstep.\n\nThe vicecanons would know of any newcomers.
Target: In a word … murder. You've arrived at a delicate time. Pray you don't bring more troubles to our doorstep.\n\nThe vicecanons would know of any newcomers.

Source: Good. Very good. Maybe along the way you would help me make my family proud?\n\nI want to come back from battle with something to remember it by, something I can hang on the wall and tell stories about. I want a war trophy.

Source:
It's just been bad luck, and lately, pure madness. 

Last week, the Ironhand Ogres attacked. They broke the levee, pillaged the place. The Orcs drove them back, but that was just the beginning.

Now bandits are looting everything we have left!

Last week, the Ironhand Ogres attacked. They broke the levee, pillaged the place. The Orcs drove them back, but that was just the beginning.

Target: How do I cleanse it?

Source: For months now I've been studying how the Brothers of Strife were created. These ruins are fascinating, but ruins can reveal only so much.\n\nI need a brave person to visit the past and tell me what actually happened that day.
Target: For months now I've been studying how the Brothers of Strife were created. These ruins are fascinating, but ruins can reveal only so much.\n\nI need a brave person to visit the past and tell me what actually happened that day.

Source: Scouts have sighted a small camp to the north. There aren't enough troops to attack the fort with a frontal assault, but Captain Hjolm believes they're planning some kind of flanking maneuver. \n\nI just returned from a sortie to the west.
Target: Scouts have sighted a small camp to the north. There aren't enough troops to attack the fort with a frontal assault, but Captain Hjolm believes they're planning some kind of flanking maneuver. \n\nI just returned from a sortie to the west.

Source: I followed that Nord warrior-woman, Svanhildr, here from Narsis. I wanted to tell her something—but the Orcs caught her!\n\nI was about to charge in and rescue her when you came along and distracted me.
Target: I followed that Nord warrior-woman, Svanhildr, here from Narsis. I wanted to tell her something—but the Orcs caught her!\n\nI was about to charge in and rescue her when you came along and distracted me.

Source: Those Covenant banners are a source of pride to these louts. Destroying them would be a blow to their morale. \n\nI think you should burn them.
Target: Those Covenant banners are a source of pride to these louts. Destroying them would be a blow to their morale. \n\nI think you should burn them.

Source: My followers and I came here to investigate a great magical disturbance. We were ambushed and fallen upon by Khralek gro-Vortag, an Orc necromancer.\n\nWe were captured. We were beheaded.
Target: My followers and I came here to investigate a great magical disturbance. We were ambushed and fallen upon by Khralek gro-Vortag, an Orc necromancer.\n\nWe were captured. We were beheaded.

Source: Um, yes. When the volcano erupted, my workers got frightened and fled. Now they're attacking anyone who wanders too close.\n\nThey're usually timid, so a good beating should calm them down.
Target: Um, yes. When the volcano erupted, my workers got frightened and fled. Now they're attacking anyone who wanders too close.\n\nThey're usually timid, so a good beating should calm them down.

Source: Our guar. When the Covenant soldiers attacked, the guar panicked and ran into the sulfur pools.\n\nGuar aren't the smartest animals. By now, some of them have probably drowned.
Target: Our guar. When the Covenant soldiers attacked, the guar panicked and ran into the sulfur pools.\n\nGuar aren't the smartest animals. By now, some of them have probably drowned.

Source:
Slavers stormed the lighthouse and put out the signal fire.

I couldn't figure out why, then I realized—it's a trap. They wait for ships to crash on the rocks so they can loot the cargo and capture the crew!

One ship already crashed.
Target:
Slavers stormed the lighthouse and put out the signal fire.

I couldn't figure out why, then I realized—it's a trap. They wait for ships to crash on the rocks so they can loot the cargo and capture the crew!

One ship already crashed.

Source: You must come of spirited stock. If you truly wish to help, speak to Hrogar up at the manor house.\n\nShor's bones, we need more like you at the hold. We've already lost too many to the Goblins.
Target: You must come of spirited stock. If you truly wish to help, speak to Hrogar up at the manor house.\n\nShor's bones, we need more like you at the hold. We've already lost too many to the Goblins.

Source: <The dog looks down the road and then back at you, as if it wants you to follow.>
Target: <The dog looks down the road and then back at you, as if it wants you to follow.>

Source: The Goblins have slaughtered many of my men. Even my eldest son has been fed to the funeral pyre. Now my youngest son, Bjorick, has gone missing.\n\nTroll's blood! These vermin seem unstoppable.
Target: The Goblins have slaughtered many of my men. Even my eldest son has been fed to the funeral pyre. Now my youngest son, Bjorick, has gone missing.\n\nTroll's blood! These vermin seem unstoppable.

Source: The spiders encase their prey in cocoons. If <<1>> and <<2>> were taken, you'll probably find them trapped in one of those silken prisons.
Target: The spiders encase their prey in cocoons. If <<1>> and <<2>> were taken, you'll probably find them trapped in one of those silken prisons.

Source: The Covenant attack. The worst part was the guar. They smelled our blood and stampeded.\n\nNow they're out here in the sulfur pools. Some drowned in the waters. Poor, stupid things.
Target: The Covenant attack. The worst part was the guar. They smelled our blood and stampeded.\n\nNow they're out here in the sulfur pools. Some drowned in the waters. Poor, stupid things.

Source: From what my spies tell me, <<1>> sent most of his forces to <<2>>. He shouldn't have the strength to hold <<3>>, but he's repelling our attacks again and again. \n\nI have an idea of how he's doing this. I don't like it.
Target: From what my spies tell me, <<1>> sent most of his forces to <<2>>. He shouldn't have the strength to hold <<3>>, but he's repelling our attacks again and again. \n\nI have an idea of how he's doing this. I don't like it.

Source: Yes, you! Like me, you have been defiled by the Lord of Brutality.\n\nI've been screaming for so long …. You must destroy us, Empty One! I do not want to be his eyes any longer.
Target: Yes, you! Like me, you have been defiled by the Lord of Brutality.\n\nI've been screaming for so long …. You must destroy us, Empty One! I do not want to be his eyes any longer.

Source: It sounds like her Omen has been twisting the general's mind, convincing him to betray King Emeric. \n\nI suspected the Omen was manipulating events toward that end, but by defeating the ogres, you exposed its plan before it was ready.
Target: It sounds like her Omen has been twisting the general's mind, convincing him to betray King Emeric. \n\nI suspected the Omen was manipulating events toward that end, but by defeating the ogres, you exposed its plan before it was ready.

Source: You see yon tower-topped hill behind me? It's become a haunt of infernal abominations from beyond Mundus, demonic spirits sent here for the torment of mortals. \n\nSorry. Priestess of Stendarr. We always talk like that. Anyway, it's bad.
Target: You see yon tower-topped hill behind me? It's become a haunt of infernal abominations from beyond Mundus, demonic spirits sent here for the torment of mortals. \n\nSorry. Priestess of Stendarr. We always talk like that. Anyway, it's bad.

Source: The Covenant has taken <<1>> and reinforced her walls. Strong Nord reinforcements are waiting for us in The Rift, but this fort keeps them bottled up.\n\nOur catapults can't crack the walls, and they've repelled every attack so far.
Target: The Covenant has taken <<1>> and reinforced her walls. Strong Nord reinforcements are waiting for us in The Rift, but this fort keeps them bottled up.\n\nOur catapults can't crack the walls, and they've repelled every attack so far.

Source: It's a message from <<1>>, the leader of the Dark Elf quarter in Ebonheart.\n\nHe sends his compliments, and he wants you to help the town resist a nearby Covenant invasion.
Target: 에본 헤트의 다크 엘프 지역 지도자 <<1>>께서 보냈습니다.\n\n그는 당신을 칭찬하며, 마을 가까이에 있는 동맹의 침략에 대항하기 위해 당신이 필요하다고 했습니다.

Source: It's time to finish off <<1>> and his abominations. Then we can reclaim <<2>> for the Pact.\n\nHolgunn and Tanval have rallied the Nord and Dark Elf troops. They're just waiting for the signal that the gates are unbarred.
Target: It's time to finish off <<1>> and his abominations. Then we can reclaim <<2>> for the Pact.\n\nHolgunn and Tanval have rallied the Nord and Dark Elf troops. They're just waiting for the signal that the gates are unbarred.

Source: It's my ... remains. My bones. I was caught in the mine when the Daedra appeared. Trapped. And when they found me, they literally tore me to pieces.\n\nNow my bones are strewn across this cavern, carelessly discarded by these awful creatures.
Target: It's my ... remains. My bones. I was caught in the mine when the Daedra appeared. Trapped. And when they found me, they literally tore me to pieces.\n\nNow my bones are strewn across this cavern, carelessly discarded by these awful creatures.

Source: We can't let <<1>> finish his ritual. Garyn and I are ready to dispel his wards.\n\nGet ready for a fight, soldier.
Target: We can't let <<1>> finish his ritual. Garyn and I are ready to dispel his wards.\n\nGet ready for a fight, soldier.

Source: Envoy Darima marches up with an army, claiming she's on a diplomatic mission from King Fahara'jad of Alik'r. She says her message is for Duke Nathaniel alone and demands entry.\n\nAll I have to say is, 'over my dead body'.
Target: Envoy Darima marches up with an army, claiming she's on a diplomatic mission from King Fahara'jad of Alik'r. She says her message is for Duke Nathaniel alone and demands entry.\n\nAll I have to say is, 'over my dead body'.

Source: Absolutely. Troll's Blood, anything could break us apart these days. How do you think the Argonians and my fellow Nords will react to this? If Tanval summons yet another magical juggernaut into the Ashlands, it could very well be the end of the Pact.
Target: Absolutely. Troll's Blood, anything could break us apart these days. How do you think the Argonians and my fellow Nords will react to this? If Tanval summons yet another magical juggernaut into the Ashlands, it could very well be the end of the Pact.

Source: A Covenant force landed west of my town. Their leader, <<1>>, is known to be ruthless. She reports directly to General Serien.\n\nIf <<2>>  doesn't stand together, the Covenant is sure to sack our city, but our citizens are divided.
Target: A Covenant force landed west of my town. Their leader, <<1>>, is known to be ruthless. She reports directly to General Serien.\n\nIf <<2>>  doesn't stand together, the Covenant is sure to sack our city, but our citizens are divided.

Source: The local constable is apparently two arrows shy of a quiver. The town was attacked by slavers, and he's accused me of being involved!\n\nI am a Knight of the Flame, for Mara's sake—sent here to help secure the village!
Target: The local constable is apparently two arrows shy of a quiver. The town was attacked by slavers, and he's accused me of being involved!\n\nI am a Knight of the Flame, for Mara's sake—sent here to help secure the village!

Source: My dear, sweet Eanen. I'm just an Ashlander merchant. He was a noble in his house, but he didn't care. \n\nWe had a secret love, but he was ready to risk his status for me. We were to be married!
Target: My dear, sweet Eanen. I'm just an Ashlander merchant. He was a noble in his house, but he didn't care. \n\nWe had a secret love, but he was ready to risk his status for me. We were to be married!

Source: Ash Mountain. Go north to the mountainside. <<1>> took troops there to deal with Balreth. \n\nThey're still there, if he hasn't killed them all. I'm not going to find out.
Target: Ash Mountain. Go north to the mountainside. <<1>> took troops there to deal with Balreth. \n\nThey're still there, if he hasn't killed them all. I'm not going to find out.

Source: I don't remember how. Don't look at me that way, worm! I'm dead. Details fade over time.\n\nIf you want to learn. I'll conjure a vision of the past. That should show you.
Target: I don't remember how. Don't look at me that way, worm! I'm dead. Details fade over time.\n\nIf you want to learn. I'll conjure a vision of the past. That should show you.

Source: You're the sun on my scales. Your answer lies with Mavos Siloreth. He bound the Brother of Strife long ago.\n\nWe need his knowledge, but a highborn like him could be … um, difficult.
Target: 넌 내 비늘을 내리쬐는 태양같군. 네가 찾는 답은 마보스 실로레쓰가 가지고 있지. 그는 오래 전 투쟁의 형제를 봉인했어.\n\n그의 봉인법을 알아내야 하지만, 그 같은 고귀한 양반은 상대하기 껄끄럽지.

Source: You don't know the half of it. It's the damn Llodos plague. People are scared. Many have already fled Narsis to avoid getting sick.\n\nOf course, that's not what the remaining villagers believe.
Target: You don't know the half of it. It's the damn Llodos plague. People are scared. Many have already fled Narsis to avoid getting sick.\n\nOf course, that's not what the remaining villagers believe.

Source: Those bastards up there. The Vereansu. They torched Muth Gnaar and killed my father. My brothers and I are hoping for a chance to strike back. \n\nThis is about revenge and honor.
Target: Those bastards up there. The Vereansu. They torched Muth Gnaar and killed my father. My brothers and I are hoping for a chance to strike back. \n\nThis is about revenge and honor.

Source: No pants? Oh, let me think. I was escorting a witch to Narsis. She got frisky, but I'm a married man. After that, my memories get hazy.\n\nI think she cast a spell on me and took a valuable axe. It's been in my wife's family for generations.
Target: No pants? Oh, let me think. I was escorting a witch to Narsis. She got frisky, but I'm a married man. After that, my memories get hazy.\n\nI think she cast a spell on me and took a valuable axe. It's been in my wife's family for generations.

Source: They came up the road from the east, killing and looting as they went. A few of us managed to escape.\n\nI wish I knew what happened to Othrys and her family.
Target: They came up the road from the east, killing and looting as they went. A few of us managed to escape.\n\nI wish I knew what happened to Othrys and her family.

Source: Wrong? You don't know? Covenant raiders landed east of here. You'd think the armies of our glorious Pact would have contained them on the beaches, but no!\n\nThe invaders marched up here and drove my family from our stead!
Target: Wrong? You don't know? Covenant raiders landed east of here. You'd think the armies of our glorious Pact would have contained them on the beaches, but no!\n\nThe invaders marched up here and drove my family from our stead!

Source: Kill the Nede troops. Make the river run red with their blood. Take their hearts as trophies. Once you've decimated the front lines, the Nede chieftain must pay. \n\nWe, the Chimer, have paid enough. Now it is the enemy's turn.
Target: Kill the Nede troops. Make the river run red with their blood. Take their hearts as trophies. Once you've decimated the front lines, the Nede chieftain must pay. \n\nWe, the Chimer, have paid enough. Now it is the enemy's turn.

Source: Khajiiti pirates! They're raiding our village—taking slaves and supplies. I gathered our survivors here, but I won't leave without Leel-Vata.\n\nCursed cats! And where were the Dark Elves? Their fleet is supposed to guard the coast.
Target: Khajiiti pirates! They're raiding our village—taking slaves and supplies. I gathered our survivors here, but I won't leave without Leel-Vata.\n\nCursed cats! And where were the Dark Elves? Their fleet is supposed to guard the coast.

Source: Pirates, attacking right now! They're pillaging our homes and taking captives!
Target: Pirates, attacking right now! They're pillaging our homes and taking captives!

Source: The Khajiit use chains and locks to bind the captured villagers. Find the key and set them free.\n\nIt seems so simple when I say it, but I'm sure this river hides jagged rocks. It is beyond my abilities.
Target: The Khajiit use chains and locks to bind the captured villagers. Find the key and set them free.\n\nIt seems so simple when I say it, but I'm sure this river hides jagged rocks. It is beyond my abilities.

Source: Azura's servant said I must face him.
Target: Azura's servant said I must face him.

Source: Well, the scamps running around here for one thing, but I have reason to believe there could be worse things coming if we don't act fast.\n\nThat crazy Sentulus was telling Rosalie about these portals he had opened up around the farm.
Target: Well, the scamps running around here for one thing, but I have reason to believe there could be worse things coming if we don't act fast.\n\nThat crazy Sentulus was telling Rosalie about these portals he had opened up around the farm.

Source: You should immediately report to General Gavryn Redoran at Tal'Deic Keep, on the far side of the compound. \n\nA word of advice? The General has been somewhat … erratic lately. Don't ask him too many questions.
Target: You should immediately report to General Gavryn Redoran at Tal'Deic Keep, on the far side of the compound. \n\nA word of advice? The General has been somewhat … erratic lately. Don't ask him too many questions.

Source: What a mess! We were attacked on the way to Narsis.\n\nDres raiders, with Dwarven machines, came out of nowhere! They took our cargo crates and one of the Dres leaders even took the manifest, as if he could use it.
Target: What a mess! We were attacked on the way to Narsis.\n\nDres raiders, with Dwarven machines, came out of nowhere! They took our cargo crates and one of the Dres leaders even took the manifest, as if he could use it.

Source: No matter how often I punish them, some of these soldiers must adhere to rules and regulations. Where's the fun in that, I ask you?\n\nSince you're here, I think we have a Nord spy in the fort. Expose this spy and I'll make you a captain.
Target: No matter how often I punish them, some of these soldiers must adhere to rules and regulations. Where's the fun in that, I ask you?\n\nSince you're here, I think we have a Nord spy in the fort. Expose this spy and I'll make you a captain.

Source: You've done well here. We could use more like you.\n\nIn fact, we could use more like you at Fort Virak. The Daggerfall Covenant has seized it.
Target: 이곳에서의 일은 잘 해 주었네. 당신같은 사람을 더 써먹고 싶군.\n\n사실, 비락 요새(Fort Virak)가 당신을 필요로 하고 있네. 대거폴 동맹이 그곳을 점령했거든.

Source: Ah. Worry not, nothing too dangerous for one such as you. No, it is merely a game with a hint of danger, but a promise of great reward. You merely need to convince three, ah… friends to give you what I require.
Target: Ah. Worry not, nothing too dangerous for one such as you. No, it is merely a game with a hint of danger, but a promise of great reward. You merely need to convince three, ah… friends to give you what I require.

Source: I am a disciple of the Tribunal. My people come to me for comfort, yet I have none to give. The Three are silent. I lift my voice, but they do not answer. \n\nThe Covenant circles Ebonheart, and I cannot even pray for wisdom.
Target: 나는 트라이뷰널의 신자입니다. 사람들이 위안을 얻기 위해 날 찾아오지만, 그들에게 줄 게 없어요. 삼신은 말이 없습니다. 목소리를 높여봐도 그들은 응답하지 않습니다.\n\n대거폴 동맹이 에본하트 주변을 맴도는데, 지혜를 구하는 기도조차 못하고 있습니다.

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: <This old container has preserved the tattered remnants of a knight's garb, along with a journal and a crude map leading to a series of caves.>
Target: <This old container has preserved the tattered remnants of a knight's garb, along with a journal and a crude map leading to a series of caves.>

Source: When a king sends his army somewhere, are his intentions not clear enough? I always knew the Covenant was a bad idea.\n\nApparently, King Fahara'jad thinks us fools as well. Certainly if he expects us to allow his soldiers past the gates.
Target: When a king sends his army somewhere, are his intentions not clear enough? I always knew the Covenant was a bad idea.\n\nApparently, King Fahara'jad thinks us fools as well. Certainly if he expects us to allow his soldiers past the gates.

Source: The Maulborn have overrun the traders' camp and occupied the pass. By the authority of House Hlaalu, this area is closed. It's a death trap.
Target: The Maulborn have overrun the traders' camp and occupied the pass. By the authority of House Hlaalu, this area is closed. It's a death trap.

Source: For the crime of believing pirates cared about the welfare of the Pact.\n\nRumors say the Dominion is smuggling in supplies through this miserable landing. My questions were not welcome. The so-called leader had me seized and put out here to rot.
Target: For the crime of believing pirates cared about the welfare of the Pact.\n\nRumors say the Dominion is smuggling in supplies through this miserable landing. My questions were not welcome. The so-called leader had me seized and put out here to rot.

Source: Yes, maybe. He works for the vicecanons. Another Dark Elf sticking his nose where it doesn't belong.\n\nIt's a good nose. I could use it to make a fine necklace.
Target: Yes, maybe. He works for the vicecanons. Another Dark Elf sticking his nose where it doesn't belong.\n\nIt's a good nose. I could use it to make a fine necklace.

Source: The soldier in question, <<1>>, announced himself and his intentions to undertake the Trials of the Burnished Scales.\n\nBy holy tradition, pilgrims who declare themselves may not be harmed. The Hist alone decides his worthiness through the trials.
Target: The soldier in question, <<1>>, announced himself and his intentions to undertake the Trials of the Burnished Scales.\n\nBy holy tradition, pilgrims who declare themselves may not be harmed. The Hist alone decides his worthiness through the trials.

Source: We need to find out more about the General's retainer, this Durel Gilveni. Why did the General send him into the ruins? And who are those others the note refers to?
Target: We need to find out more about the General's retainer, this Durel Gilveni. Why did the General send him into the ruins? And who are those others the note refers to?

Source: Ssssh! Not so loud. You're going to get me in trouble. The Sentinels have sent more than a few soldiers to the healers for less.\n\nBesides, you're a stranger here. You shouldn't get involved.
Target: Ssssh! Not so loud. You're going to get me in trouble. The Sentinels have sent more than a few soldiers to the healers for less.\n\nBesides, you're a stranger here. You shouldn't get involved.

Source: Good! I've prepared Hist sap in the bowl beside me. Drink it when you wish to commune with the Hist.
Target: Good! I've prepared Hist sap in the bowl beside me. Drink it when you wish to commune with the Hist.

Source: Three simple stone pieces, part of our heritage. No jewels, no gold, nothing a dryskin could value. Theft isn't unknown in Hissmir, but it's rare enough I wouldn't know where to start looking for the culprit.
Target: Three simple stone pieces, part of our heritage. No jewels, no gold, nothing a dryskin could value. Theft isn't unknown in Hissmir, but it's rare enough I wouldn't know where to start looking for the culprit.

Source: I expected some pilgrims from Forsaken Hamlet today. With the trials at hand I must stay here, and none of the other Root Stewards have the time to search the northeast road.\n\nIf you're headed that way, would you look for them?
Target: I expected some pilgrims from Forsaken Hamlet today. With the trials at hand I must stay here, and none of the other Root Stewards have the time to search the northeast road.\n\nIf you're headed that way, would you look for them?

Source: Sorry hero, you're too late to save the day this time. Look around. The farm's in ashes.\n\nMy daughter Ganise and I stayed only to search for my husband, but at this point, I think we have to assume he was killed in the fire.
Target: Sorry hero, you're too late to save the day this time. Look around. The farm's in ashes.\n\nMy daughter Ganise and I stayed only to search for my husband, but at this point, I think we have to assume he was killed in the fire.

Source: My unit was sent here because a stableboy made it to Ebonheart and reported a slave revolt.\n\nOh, gods! He butchered them. He killed his own soldiers.
Target: My unit was sent here because a stableboy made it to Ebonheart and reported a slave revolt.\n\nOh, gods! He butchered them. He killed his own soldiers.

Source: The Cat-Man's inside the barn in the center of the plantation. Maybe he stayed to watch his monster tear us apart. Wicked animal.\n\nHere, take the idol. I don't want it near me.
Target: The Cat-Man's inside the barn in the center of the plantation. Maybe he stayed to watch his monster tear us apart. Wicked animal.\n\nHere, take the idol. I don't want it near me.

Source: Breakfast. I made his favorite—biscuits and jam. Then he went out to play ….\n\nThat good-for-nothing deputy won't even go look for him, but the slavers could have shipped Lucas off to Morrowind by now!
Target: Breakfast. I made his favorite—biscuits and jam. Then he went out to play ….\n\nThat good-for-nothing deputy won't even go look for him, but the slavers could have shipped Lucas off to Morrowind by now!

Source: A troop of Covenant soldiers happened upon the Keep. They attacked, thinking we were a military outpost. We tried to fend them off, but they fought past our defenses and managed to enter the vault. They smashed a relic, and unleashed the curse.
Target: A troop of Covenant soldiers happened upon the Keep. They attacked, thinking we were a military outpost. We tried to fend them off, but they fought past our defenses and managed to enter the vault. They smashed a relic, and unleashed the curse.

Source: Opening the reliquary must have awakened Keeper Vildras, its guardian spirit.\n\nVildras will know where this curse came from and how to stop it.
Target: Opening the reliquary must have awakened Keeper Vildras, its guardian spirit.\n\nVildras will know where this curse came from and how to stop it.

Source: Murk-Watcher has aged much in these last few years. She often seems confused about where she is. \n\nShe can be incredibly stubborn too. Perhaps you could approach her about leaving?
Target: Murk-Watcher has aged much in these last few years. She often seems confused about where she is. \n\nShe can be incredibly stubborn too. Perhaps you could approach her about leaving?

Source: We woke up this morning and the farm was on fire. Smoke everywhere! It was the scamps! They're all over the place.\n\nI would've left right away, but we couldn't find Mister Nurin. He hadn't been the perfect boss, but I didn't want to leave him.
Target: We woke up this morning and the farm was on fire. Smoke everywhere! It was the scamps! They're all over the place.\n\nI would've left right away, but we couldn't find Mister Nurin. He hadn't been the perfect boss, but I didn't want to leave him.

Source: It's dying. It was never healthy. This isn't Black Marsh, after all, so in the last few weeks, it's withered.\n\nWe've learned that House Dres is poisoning it. It's not enough to have enslaved us for generations. Now they want to carve our hearts out.
Target: 죽어가고 있어요. 결코 건강한 적이 없었죠. 어쨌든 여긴 블랙 마쉬가 아니니까요. 지난 몇 주 동안 시들었습니다.\n\n드레스 가문이 나무를 독살시키고 있다는 걸 알아냈습니다. 대대로 우리를 노예로 삼은 것만으로는 충분하지 않은 거죠. 이제 그들은 우리의 심장을 잘라내고 싶어합니다.

Source: Good. It's not inside you. Now, listen. There's some horror making copies of people. When it kills you, it "twins" you: it makes a copy of your body for its own.\n\nHowever, it's not a perfect copy. It can't mimic speech.
Target: Good. It's not inside you. Now, listen. There's some horror making copies of people. When it kills you, it \\"twins\"\" you: it makes a copy of your body for its own.\n\nHowever
column4: it's not a perfect copy. It can't mimic speech."

Source: I'm watching the pirates and letting my anger rise like the ocean at high tide!\n\nThe Khajiit must pay for their attack on our village, but my courage hasn't yet reached the level of my anger. I demand vengeance!
Target: I'm watching the pirates and letting my anger rise like the ocean at high tide!\n\nThe Khajiit must pay for their attack on our village, but my courage hasn't yet reached the level of my anger. I demand vengeance!

Source: After speaking with King Fahara'jad's envoy, Duchess Lakana asked to go out and negotiate with the Redguard general herself. \n\nClearly, we can't allow that, but the duchess is refusing to let the envoy leave to deliver her message.
Target: After speaking with King Fahara'jad's envoy, Duchess Lakana asked to go out and negotiate with the Redguard general herself. \n\nClearly, we can't allow that, but the duchess is refusing to let the envoy leave to deliver her message.

Source: Indeed. I would very much like to discuss this with you further—but not inside the castle.\n\nMy home is past the market. If you'll give me a moment to settle matters here and check on the duchess, I'll meet you there and we can talk.
Target: Indeed. I would very much like to discuss this with you further—but not inside the castle.\n\nMy home is past the market. If you'll give me a moment to settle matters here and check on the duchess, I'll meet you there and we can talk.

Source: Here's another tip, free of charge. Keep your weapon handy. I've never seen the kwama this aggressive. \n\nIt's such a waste, isn't it?
Target: Here's another tip, free of charge. Keep your weapon handy. I've never seen the kwama this aggressive. \n\nIt's such a waste, isn't it?

Source: No. This will not do. To run would be to surrender to this madwoman's hatred. Falhut is the one who must pay.\n\nThough I don't always agree with him, <<1>> is a good man, and I trust him. Tell him of Falhut's betrayal. He will see justice served.
Target: No. This will not do. To run would be to surrender to this madwoman's hatred. Falhut is the one who must pay.\n\nThough I don't always agree with him, <<1>> is a good man, and I trust him. Tell him of Falhut's betrayal. He will see justice served.

Source: Cause a distraction, something that will slow them down and give you enough time to find our missing people.\n\nEveryone's on edge because of the Llodos plague. We can use that. You know what people think causes the plague? Rats.
Target: Cause a distraction, something that will slow them down and give you enough time to find our missing people.\n\nEveryone's on edge because of the Llodos plague. We can use that. You know what people think causes the plague? Rats.

Source:
I came here on a sacred mission—to slay the notorious bandits known as The Three. 

I ventured into these depths leaving my fellow knights behind with orders to collapse the cave if I did not return.

This cave became my tomb.
Target:
I came here on a sacred mission—to slay the notorious bandits known as The Three.

Source: Drovos managed to create a royal queen egg. If the egg hatches, our native kwama will be wiped out. He's gone mad, sera, and all of Vvardenfell may pay the price.\n\nI need you to destroy this egg, wipe out the scribs-in-waiting, and deal with Drovos.
Target: Drovos managed to create a royal queen egg. If the egg hatches, our native kwama will be wiped out. He's gone mad, sera, and all of Vvardenfell may pay the price.\n\nI need you to destroy this egg, wipe out the scribs-in-waiting, and deal with Drovos.

Source: Why aren't you a thrall like the others?
Target: Why aren't you a thrall like the others?

Source: If you're offering? I suspect Ashlanders are behind the disappearances, but I don't have the numbers to chase them off. \n\nIf you can sneak into their camp near Molag Mar and find me proof of their involvement, I could finally get some reinforcements.
Target: If you're offering? I suspect Ashlanders are behind the disappearances, but I don't have the numbers to chase them off. \n\nIf you can sneak into their camp near Molag Mar and find me proof of their involvement, I could finally get some reinforcements.

Source: All right, I'll read the Psijic Codex.
Target: All right, I'll read the Psijic Codex.

Source: Something drains my energy. Find Archcanon Tarvus in his office and ask if he gleaned anything useful from the ritual. If not, I know his earlier research indicated new avenues to investigate.\n\nGo where he tells you and learn what you can.
Target: Something drains my energy. Find Archcanon Tarvus in his office and ask if he gleaned anything useful from the ritual. If not, I know his earlier research indicated new avenues to investigate.\n\nGo where he tells you and learn what you can.

Source: I'll meet you in the main gallery.
Target: I'll meet you in the main gallery.

Source: You don't have to go alone. I'll help however I can.
Target: You don't have to go alone. I'll help however I can.

Source: Thanks. I'll go see her.
Target: Thanks. I'll go see her.

Source: I'll find Kelmen. But what kind of danger is he in?
Target: I'll find Kelmen. But what kind of danger is he in?

Source: Revus …. I want you to find that scrawny little wizard and tell him the bill's come due. He wants to help? Well, now's the horking time.\n\nIf he doesn't fix this, we'll sic the Redoran on him. He doesn't want that. Believe me.
Target: Revus …. I want you to find that scrawny little wizard and tell him the bill's come due. He wants to help? Well, now's the horking time.\n\nIf he doesn't fix this, we'll sic the Redoran on him. He doesn't want that. Believe me.

Source: You will help? Oh, bless you!\n\nThis one planted his crops in a cavern nearby. Zainsipilu. Please, retrieve my notes and poison the water. Without proper irrigation, the plants will wither. It pains me to kill them, but these bandits must not prosper!
Target: You will help? Oh, bless you!\n\nThis one planted his crops in a cavern nearby. Zainsipilu. Please, retrieve my notes and poison the water. Without proper irrigation, the plants will wither. It pains me to kill them, but these bandits must not prosper!

Source: Unfortunately, yes.\n\nI wonder if we might aid each other? Despite my missteps, I do know a great deal about Ashlander culture. I could help you earn their favor. In return, you could find out if they know anything about my family's tomb.
Target: Unfortunately, yes.\n\nI wonder if we might aid each other? Despite my missteps, I do know a great deal about Ashlander culture. I could help you earn their favor. In return, you could find out if they know anything about my family's tomb.

Source: All right, I'll collect the materials for your painting.
Target: All right, I'll collect the materials for your painting.

Source: I'm interested. What are the details?
Target: I'm interested. What are the details?

Source: You should speak to Councilor Eris. He's opened the kinhouse to interview potential recruits. Freelancers, as it were.\n\nIf you're interested, go speak to the councilor. The longer Veya remains missing, the more distressed Councilor Eris becomes.
Target: You should speak to Councilor Eris. He's opened the kinhouse to interview potential recruits. Freelancers, as it were.\n\nIf you're interested, go speak to the councilor. The longer Veya remains missing, the more distressed Councilor Eris becomes.

Source: The Heart of Lorkhan. As if it even exists.\n\nThe irony is that this ruin really does contain an item of power. A Dwemer relic called a Bthark Prism. If you help me rescue my aides, retrieve my rod, and obtain this prism, I'd happily compensate you.
Target: The Heart of Lorkhan. As if it even exists.\n\nThe irony is that this ruin really does contain an item of power. A Dwemer relic called a Bthark Prism. If you help me rescue my aides, retrieve my rod, and obtain this prism, I'd happily compensate you.

Source: Don't worry. I'll find Nahlia.
Target: Don't worry. I'll find Nahlia.

Source: I'll speak to Sotha Sil.
Target: I'll speak to Sotha Sil.

Source: Thank you.
Target: Thank you.

Source: All right. I'll seek out Elfriede at Honrich Tower.
Target: All right. I'll seek out Elfriede at Honrich Tower.

Source: Thank you.
Target: Thank you.

Source: Any ideas?
Target: Any ideas?

Source: I'll help if I can.
Target: I'll help if I can.

Source: I'm game. What do you need me to do?
Target: I'm game. What do you need me to do?

Source: I'll go find her. Stay put.
Target: I'll go find her. Stay put.

Source: I'll go talk to Sotha Sil.
Target: I'll go talk to Sotha Sil.

Source: The earth's beating heart! It thunders day and night, shaping their twisted Heartstones and wicked blades that thirst for blood. Those of us they take to the Forge never return.\n\nWill you spare the others from that fate?
Target: The earth's beating heart! It thunders day and night, shaping their twisted Heartstones and wicked blades that thirst for blood. Those of us they take to the Forge never return.\n\nWill you spare the others from that fate?

Source: Thank you.
Target: Thank you.

Source: I can help search for your indrik.
Target: I can help search for your indrik.

Source: I'll talk to Provost Piper at the camp.
Target: I'll talk to Provost Piper at the camp.

Source: I'll escort Andewen during her expedition.
Target: I'll escort Andewen during her expedition.

Source: Reachmen and minotaurs with fearless, hungry eyes. They charge our gates howling like mad dogs.\n\nMany fled them from the outlying villages, helpless to stop their loved ones from being dragged off to some ugly fate. The hold was their last hope.
Target: Reachmen and minotaurs with fearless, hungry eyes. They charge our gates howling like mad dogs.\n\nMany fled them from the outlying villages, helpless to stop their loved ones from being dragged off to some ugly fate. The hold was their last hope.

Source: You see right through me, Outlander. I have more worries than a kwama queen has eggs.\n\nI'm talking about Chodala's sister. Seryn claims to want to help, to want peace, but I don't trust her. Seek out Barilzar, but be wary of the Ashlander's sister.
Target: You see right through me, Outlander. I have more worries than a kwama queen has eggs.\n\nI'm talking about Chodala's sister. Seryn claims to want to help, to want peace, but I don't trust her. Seek out Barilzar, but be wary of the Ashlander's sister.

Source: Upsets in planar demarcation are remarkably complex. Study must be free from distraction. An impossibility while constructs continuously spill from the rift.\n\nWe must find their source and shut it down.
Target: Upsets in planar demarcation are remarkably complex. Study must be free from distraction. An impossibility while constructs continuously spill from the rift.\n\nWe must find their source and shut it down.

Source: All right. I'll look for Dame Falhut at Alcaire Castle.
Target: All right. I'll look for Dame Falhut at Alcaire Castle.

Source: I will go to seek out King Fahara'jad.
Target: I will go to seek out King Fahara'jad.

Source: All right, I'll help you break this enchantment.
Target: All right, I'll help you break this enchantment.

Source: All right, I'll help you find your brother.
Target: All right, I'll help you find your brother.

Source: <Take the note.>
Target: <Take the note.>

Source: I'll help you in any way that I can.
Target: I'll help you in any way that I can.

Source: I'll find Oriandra and get the amplification elixir.
Target: I'll find Oriandra and get the amplification elixir.

Source: I'll explore the Aetherian Archive first, then.
Target: I'll explore the Aetherian Archive first, then.

Source: Sure, I'll escort you through Ebon Stadmont.
Target: Sure, I'll escort you through Ebon Stadmont.

Source: I'll deliver your letter.
Target: I'll deliver your letter.

Source: Thanks. I'll have a look around.
Target: Thanks. I'll have a look around.

Source: All right. What do you need me to do?
Target: All right. What do you need me to do?

Source: All right. I'll speak to Captain Sarandil.
Target: All right. I'll speak to Captain Sarandil.

Source: All right. I'll look for your son.
Target: All right. I'll look for your son.

Source: It's just a feeling. That relic had a … I don't know, a draw to it. Like it wanted me to bring it here. It sounds crazy, but her brother sought me out. \n\nHe seemed convinced it was the cause and where it came from was key to where she was heading.
Target: It's just a feeling. That relic had a … I don't know, a draw to it. Like it wanted me to bring it here. It sounds crazy, but her brother sought me out. \n\nHe seemed convinced it was the cause and where it came from was key to where she was heading.

Source: All right, I'll help you investigate the murder.
Target: All right, I'll help you investigate the murder.

Source: I should have listened. Before I knew, my Nevena was gone. Something changed in her eyes. Made my blood run cold. I never even saw the knife.\n\nManaged to stop the bleeding, but I'm not going anywhere soon. I've lost her. Maybe for good.
Target: I should have listened. Before I knew, my Nevena was gone. Something changed in her eyes. Made my blood run cold. I never even saw the knife.\n\nManaged to stop the bleeding, but I'm not going anywhere soon. I've lost her. Maybe for good.

Source: Eventually, but we need to be cautious. If Chodala is as respected as you say, attacking him would start a war we can't afford to partake in.\n\nGo to Ald'ruhn and talk to his sister, Seryn. I don't trust her either, but she worked with you before.
Target: Eventually, but we need to be cautious. If Chodala is as respected as you say, attacking him would start a war we can't afford to partake in.\n\nGo to Ald'ruhn and talk to his sister, Seryn. I don't trust her either, but she worked with you before.

Source: I'll gather their cosmetics and grooming items, as requested.
Target: I'll gather their cosmetics and grooming items, as requested.

Source: No, she has not. All to the good, I guess. A finless fish weakens the shoal.\n\nBut enough about me. You, my friend, are a mighty swimmer. Seek her out in her stone dwelling-place. If I know my heart, she will certainly have a task for you.
Target: No, she has not. All to the good, I guess. A finless fish weakens the shoal.\n\nBut enough about me. You, my friend, are a mighty swimmer. Seek her out in her stone dwelling-place. If I know my heart, she will certainly have a task for you.

Source: I'll bring you more ornate heavy armor.
Target: I'll bring you more ornate heavy armor.

Source: If only there was a way to give Lord Vivec some energy—wait, that's it! A Blessing Stone! Find the Overseer and retrieve another stone from the construction site.\n\nOh please, hurry! I've never seen Lord Vivec in such a desperate state!
Target: If only there was a way to give Lord Vivec some energy—wait, that's it! A Blessing Stone! Find the Overseer and retrieve another stone from the construction site.\n\nOh please, hurry! I've never seen Lord Vivec in such a desperate state!

Source: I'll bring you any ornate heavy armor I acquire.
Target: I'll bring you any ornate heavy armor I acquire.

Source: I'll meet you in the Dreaming Cave.
Target: I'll meet you in the Dreaming Cave.

Source: I'll gather their games and toys, as you requested.
Target: I'll gather their games and toys, as you requested.

Source: Clavicus Vile distracted me, weakened me … all to locate the Clockwork City. Perhaps we require a Daedra … to fight a Daedra.\n\nAzura's champion, Seryn … in Archcanon's office. Seek guidance from her patron. But hurry, my time grows short ….
Target: Clavicus Vile distracted me, weakened me … all to locate the Clockwork City. Perhaps we require a Daedra … to fight a Daedra.\n\nAzura's champion, Seryn … in Archcanon's office. Seek guidance from her patron. But hurry, my time grows short ….

Source: Strange, I know. She's enthralled several sailors with a song enchantment, and now no one can get close to the wreck. Valga Celatus can tell you more. She posted the job and is currently in Vivec City.\n\nHead over to her and see what you can do.
Target: Strange, I know. She's enthralled several sailors with a song enchantment, and now no one can get close to the wreck. Valga Celatus can tell you more. She posted the job and is currently in Vivec City.\n\nHead over to her and see what you can do.

Source: It allows one to archive memories for future generations. I hope to do this for my children, who have grown estranged.\n\nInvoke my stone at the locations I've marked on your map and the memories I wish to archive will manifest.
Target: It allows one to archive memories for future generations. I hope to do this for my children, who have grown estranged.\n\nInvoke my stone at the locations I've marked on your map and the memories I wish to archive will manifest.

Source: Kill them. Again. They seem to think they're still in some old battle, their last I'd wager, and they attack anyone who approaches.\n\nAndromo may know more. He's been studying the tomb for some time now.
Target: Kill them. Again. They seem to think they're still in some old battle, their last I'd wager, and they attack anyone who approaches.\n\nAndromo may know more. He's been studying the tomb for some time now.

Source: Check the fetcherfly nests northwest of our camp near Nchuleftingth. Disturb the nests and eventually Writhing Sveeth will appear to protect them. Just be careful not to take on too many of the pests at once. They like to swarm.
Target: Check the fetcherfly nests northwest of our camp near Nchuleftingth. Disturb the nests and eventually Writhing Sveeth will appear to protect them. Just be careful not to take on too many of the pests at once. They like to swarm.

Source: We call such creatures Mother Jagged-Claw, a name awarded to the largest, most aggressive matriarch to crawl from the churning sea.\n\nIf you want to attract the mother mudcrab's attention, disturb the mud piles where she lays her eggs.
Target: We call such creatures Mother Jagged-Claw, a name awarded to the largest, most aggressive matriarch to crawl from the churning sea.\n\nIf you want to attract the mother mudcrab's attention, disturb the mud piles where she lays her eggs.

Source: Great Zexxin has been spotted to the northeast of the Erabenimsun camp near Nchuleftingth. Nix-ox and other creatures gather near the yellow rocks and pools in the area. Search for signs of Great Zexxin's passing and follow the tracks to your quarry.
Target: Great Zexxin has been spotted to the northeast of the Erabenimsun camp near Nchuleftingth. Nix-ox and other creatures gather near the yellow rocks and pools in the area. Search for signs of Great Zexxin's passing and follow the tracks to your quarry.

Source: We call it Tarra-Suj, which means "powerful hunter" in my people's language. Our camp near Nchuleftingth suffers as the creature becomes ever more bold.\n\nKill common nix-hounds and Tarra-Suj will appear. Try to fare better than my hunters, Outlander.
Target: We call it Tarra-Suj, which means \\"powerful hunter\"\" in my people's language. Our camp near Nchuleftingth suffers as the creature becomes ever more bold.\n\nKill common nix-hounds and Tarra-Suj will appear. Try to fare better than my hunters
column4: Outlander."

Source: I'll ask some questions around the city.
Target: I'll ask some questions around the city.

Source: Perhaps I should look for the brassilisk's owner, Frynga, in the Brass Fortress.
Target: Perhaps I should look for the brassilisk's owner, Frynga, in the Brass Fortress.

Source: Head toward the camp near Nchuleftingth and search for signs of Old Stomper's attacks. A good tracker can follow the blood trail back to the creature's nest.\n\nJust be wary. Old Stomper has survived these many seasons by being ferocious and cruel.
Target: Head toward the camp near Nchuleftingth and search for signs of Old Stomper's attacks. A good tracker can follow the blood trail back to the creature's nest.\n\nJust be wary. Old Stomper has survived these many seasons by being ferocious and cruel.

Source: We recently tracked the kagouti pack east, to the other side of Red Mountain. Pick off the members of its pack and eventually King Razor-Tusk will show its fearsome visage.\n\nJust be wary, for the smell of blood will drive it into a frenzy.
Target: We recently tracked the kagouti pack east, to the other side of Red Mountain. Pick off the members of its pack and eventually King Razor-Tusk will show its fearsome visage.\n\nJust be wary, for the smell of blood will drive it into a frenzy.

Source: East of our village, hiding among the mounds of ash. If you disturb the mounds, you should draw it out—provided it doesn't ambush you first.\n\nOnce the dire ash beetle appears, your skill will determine the outcome of the encounter.
Target: East of our village, hiding among the mounds of ash. If you disturb the mounds, you should draw it out—provided it doesn't ambush you first.\n\nOnce the dire ash beetle appears, your skill will determine the outcome of the encounter.

Source: Head over to his tower and see what's going on. You've also been asked to collect any research notes you may find for the apprentice to study later.\n\nVaram can fill you in on the details. She'll also have your pay if you manage to complete the job.
Target: Head over to his tower and see what's going on. You've also been asked to collect any research notes you may find for the apprentice to study later.\n\nVaram can fill you in on the details. She'll also have your pay if you manage to complete the job.

Source: This may surprise you, but the higher I climb and the more powerful I become, the lonelier it gets.\n\nA true Telvanni life always involves some seclusion, but I value our friendship—and Eoki's affection. I'd hate to lose either of you.
Target: This may surprise you, but the higher I climb and the more powerful I become, the lonelier it gets.\n\nA true Telvanni life always involves some seclusion, but I value our friendship—and Eoki's affection. I'd hate to lose either of you.

Source: I need you to collect Dwemer parts and tools from the ruins of Nchuleft. The Zainab tribe used to loot it for items to trade. \n\nDredase-Hlarar can tell you more. Give the items to him once you're done.
Target: I need you to collect Dwemer parts and tools from the ruins of Nchuleft. The Zainab tribe used to loot it for items to trade. \n\nDredase-Hlarar can tell you more. Give the items to him once you're done.

Source: I suspect slavers were involved. Which means they had help here in town. I find that unacceptable.\n\nDiscover who doused the lamp fire. They'll lead us to the slavers. Question Delms, who was on duty that night. He's in the lighthouse.
Target: I suspect slavers were involved. Which means they had help here in town. I find that unacceptable.\n\nDiscover who doused the lamp fire. They'll lead us to the slavers. Question Delms, who was on duty that night. He's in the lighthouse.

Source: Head to Sulipund Grange, gather some relic pieces, and try to take care of the Hunger that's protecting the area.\n\nTirvina Avani should be in the city with more information. Nervous little thing. She'll have your pay once you're done with the task.
Target: Head to Sulipund Grange, gather some relic pieces, and try to take care of the Hunger that's protecting the area.\n\nTirvina Avani should be in the city with more information. Nervous little thing. She'll have your pay once you're done with the task.

Source: That may be an oversimplification, but I suppose your statement is accurate.\n\nI walk a narrow path between House Councilor and loving father. Unfortunately, the former often supersedes the latter. That's why I want to speak to Veya again.
Target: That may be an oversimplification, but I suppose your statement is accurate.\n\nI walk a narrow path between House Councilor and loving father. Unfortunately, the former often supersedes the latter. That's why I want to speak to Veya again.

Source: I pledge to seek out Moon Hunter Keep and return Undaunted.
Target: I pledge to seek out Moon Hunter Keep and return Undaunted.

Source: Don't worry. I'll seal these time breaches.
Target: Don't worry. I'll seal these time breaches.

Source: I'll find your dog and your husband.
Target: I'll find your dog and your husband.

Source: I'll search the gryphon nesting grounds and find your friends.
Target: I'll search the gryphon nesting grounds and find your friends.

Source: That gap in the model—that's where we'll find the lost Library of Andule! Once you go and locate the exact spot, we can start examining the records related to our earliest Velothi settlers.\n\nWhat do you say? Ready for one more adventure?
Target: That gap in the model—that's where we'll find the lost Library of Andule! Once you go and locate the exact spot, we can start examining the records related to our earliest Velothi settlers.\n\nWhat do you say? Ready for one more adventure?

Source: I can help you take down this werewolf pack.
Target: I can help you take down this werewolf pack.

Source: Head along the coast, to the ruins of Yasammidan that overlooks the sea. It was once a shrine to Mehrunes Dagon. Find any relics you can and bring them to me.\n\nHistory fades if measures aren't taken.
Target: Head along the coast, to the ruins of Yasammidan that overlooks the sea. It was once a shrine to Mehrunes Dagon. Find any relics you can and bring them to me.\n\nHistory fades if measures aren't taken.

Source: All right, I'll travel to Skyrim and Morrowind and seal these time breaches.
Target: All right, I'll travel to Skyrim and Morrowind and seal these time breaches.

Source: If these treasonous malcontents insist on harboring sticks firmly in their hindquarters, then they can at least have the decency to keep them in bloom!\n\nFind the grumps in my domain and pelt them with these enchanted petals until morale improves!
Target: If these treasonous malcontents insist on harboring sticks firmly in their hindquarters, then they can at least have the decency to keep them in bloom!\n\nFind the grumps in my domain and pelt them with these enchanted petals until morale improves!

Source: I'll return to Sadrith Mora and continue my studies. Talk to Eoki. Bury myself in a good novel. \n\nCome and visit. It would be great to just sit and talk for a while, as friends. I still owe you that cup of tea, right?
Target: I'll return to Sadrith Mora and continue my studies. Talk to Eoki. Bury myself in a good novel. \n\nCome and visit. It would be great to just sit and talk for a while, as friends. I still owe you that cup of tea, right?

Source: Head to the northern coast, west of the Forgotten Wastes, and find the ruins. Clear out as many exiles as you can. There's no hope for them now and they have become a blight on the land. \n\nRecover the relics and bring them to me for safekeeping.
Target: Head to the northern coast, west of the Forgotten Wastes, and find the ruins. Clear out as many exiles as you can. There's no hope for them now and they have become a blight on the land. \n\nRecover the relics and bring them to me for safekeeping.

Source: The ruins lie far to the north, west of the Forgotten Wastes. I do not know what dangers surround the ancient shrine, so tread carefully.\n\nReturn to me when you've collected a good amount of relics.
Target: The ruins lie far to the north, west of the Forgotten Wastes. I do not know what dangers surround the ancient shrine, so tread carefully.\n\nReturn to me when you've collected a good amount of relics.

Source: To the south, between here and Balmora. Slay the brigands and recover any relics they may have stolen.\n\nBring the relics back to me and the Urshilaku will keep them safe for the day when Daedric worship returns to the fore.
Target: To the south, between here and Balmora. Slay the brigands and recover any relics they may have stolen.\n\nBring the relics back to me and the Urshilaku will keep them safe for the day when Daedric worship returns to the fore.

Source: The ruins lie to the north, to the east of West Gash. Go there and put an end to the cult and remove temptation from the House of Troubles. \n\nReturn any relics they removed from the shrine to me for safekeeping.
Target: The ruins lie to the north, to the east of West Gash. Go there and put an end to the cult and remove temptation from the House of Troubles. \n\nReturn any relics they removed from the shrine to me for safekeeping.

Source: The ruins lie to the northwest of Ald'ruhn. Travel to the shrine and slay as many of these vampires as you can. They lair deep below ground where we cannot go, but every death you deal weakens the pack.\n\nRetrieve any relics you find and return to me.
Target: The ruins lie to the northwest of Ald'ruhn. Travel to the shrine and slay as many of these vampires as you can. They lair deep below ground where we cannot go, but every death you deal weakens the pack.\n\nRetrieve any relics you find and return to me.

Source: Travel north and west from Ald'ruhn and seek out the ruins near the coast. Gather whatever relics you can find from the exterior ruins and bring them back to me.\n\nAvoid the interior of the shrine, however. The place is cursed.
Target: Travel north and west from Ald'ruhn and seek out the ruins near the coast. Gather whatever relics you can find from the exterior ruins and bring them back to me.\n\nAvoid the interior of the shrine, however. The place is cursed.

Source: I'll go to Ceporah Tower and talk to the Ritemaster.
Target: I'll go to Ceporah Tower and talk to the Ritemaster.

Source: I'll set Cainar, Grog, and Miriya free from their mind traps.
Target: I'll set Cainar, Grog, and Miriya free from their mind traps.

Source: I'll collect your wine bottles for you.
Target: I'll collect your wine bottles for you.

Source: I'll set Cainar, Grog, and Miriya free from the mind trap.
Target: I'll set Cainar, Grog, and Miriya free from the mind trap.

Target: I'll see if I can calm her down.

Target: I could deal with the stranglers for you.

Target: I'll find Oriandra and get the amplification elixir.

Target: Scouts are needed for a vital mission. We must have information on the defenses around Faregyl Farm. Those who return with reports will be well rewarded.

Target: The farm at Castle Alessia provides support for our foe's troops. Grand Warlord Sorcalin needs scouting reports on this farm to determine its importance to the enemy.

Target: By order of Grand Warlord Sorcalin, a scouting mission to Drakelowe Farm is now a priority for all Dominion troops. Volunteers must leave immediately.

Source: You can steal from the bandits that which they stole from us! The motherless swine somehow got their hands on our tabards, and now they're robbing travelers on the road to Wrothgar! \n\nKill as many as you can, but mainly, get our tabards back!
Target: You can steal from the bandits that which they stole from us! The motherless swine somehow got their hands on our tabards, and now they're robbing travelers on the road to Wrothgar! \n\nKill as many as you can, but mainly, get our tabards back!

Source: Haven't the foggiest. My people will explain their needs when you find them. The details aren't my concern, I only care about results. \n\nEnsure they cleanse Valenvaryon, the ruin east of here, and you'll be handsomely rewarded. Do we have a deal?
Target: Haven't the foggiest. My people will explain their needs when you find them. The details aren't my concern, I only care about results. \n\nEnsure they cleanse Valenvaryon, the ruin east of here, and you'll be handsomely rewarded. Do we have a deal?

Source: Your anger is understandable.  \n\nA true Telvanni life always involves some seclusion. The higher I climb, the lonelier it gets. But I truly value our friendship, and Eoki's affection. I'd hate to lose either of you.
Target: Your anger is understandable.  \n\nA true Telvanni life always involves some seclusion. The higher I climb, the lonelier it gets. But I truly value our friendship, and Eoki's affection. I'd hate to lose either of you.

Source: I'll head to the shrine.
Target: I'll head to the shrine.

Source: I'll go find Riivel.
Target: I'll go find Riivel.

Source: I'll get to work.
Target: I'll get to work.

Source: Your hands, crow-friend! Our wings lack such ugly but useful appendages!\n\nNow listen well. Plunder armor of the most ornate sort. Pieces that make a statement! Impractical things, but pretty when polished and shined. Yes, bring such items to me!
Target: Your hands, crow-friend! Our wings lack such ugly but useful appendages!\n\nNow listen well. Plunder armor of the most ornate sort. Pieces that make a statement! Impractical things, but pretty when polished and shined. Yes, bring such items to me!

Source: Check his rectory in the west wing of the Basilica. He hides in there sometimes to nurse a bruised ego, or write passive-aggressive memoranda.\n\nI'll try to settle the apostles nerves. Honestly, my nerves could use some settling.
Target: Check his rectory in the west wing of the Basilica. He hides in there sometimes to nurse a bruised ego, or write passive-aggressive memoranda.\n\nI'll try to settle the apostles nerves. Honestly, my nerves could use some settling.

Source: Consider it done.
Target: Consider it done.

Source: I'll look.
Target: I'll look.

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: I'll see what I can do.
Target: I'll see what I can do.

Source: I'll look for him at the castle.
Target: I'll look for him at the castle.

Source: I'll go talk to your captain.
Target: I'll go talk to your captain.

Source: I'll get you the skulls, but how do you know so much about this ritual?
Target: I'll get you the skulls, but how do you know so much about this ritual?

Source: "There is no hope. Please do not make me dig your grave too.\n\n—<<1>>"
Target: \\"There is no hope. Please do not make me dig your grave too.\n\n—<<1>>\"\""

Source: I'll find Narir and see what I can do.
Target: I'll find Narir and see what I can do.

Source: I'll travel to the Rift and find Vigrod.
Target: I'll travel to the Rift and find Vigrod.

Source: The skimmer requires a specific kind of wire mesh, and we've only been able to find it in the Halls of Regulation. <<1>> will need more of the stuff if we want to continue collecting. She can tell you more about the process, if you're still willing.
Target: The skimmer requires a specific kind of wire mesh, and we've only been able to find it in the Halls of Regulation. <<1>> will need more of the stuff if we want to continue collecting. She can tell you more about the process, if you're still willing.

Source: I know it's not exactly proper, but I've always felt a connection to Azura. My father was a Spirit Warden. \n\nThe real problem is that I can't leave my post. I wonder—is there any way you'd take this to Brother Doumant at Pariah Abbey?
Target: I know it's not exactly proper, but I've always felt a connection to Azura. My father was a Spirit Warden. \n\nThe real problem is that I can't leave my post. I wonder—is there any way you'd take this to Brother Doumant at Pariah Abbey?

Source:
Well, there's a bit more to it. 

You'll also need to gather the metal pellets used to help with the grinding process.
We can only find the darn things in the Fundament. Belan would be happy to talk your ear off about if you want to know more.
Target:
Well, there's a bit more to it. 

You'll also need to gather the metal pellets used to help with the grinding process.
We can only find the darn things in the Fundament. Belan would be happy to talk your ear off about if you want to know more.

Source: Terari Heladren was … ahead of her time. It was fear that led to her expulsion, not reason. I see that now.\n\nPlease, find her. Tell her I'll make it right, if she'll save my life. There is no one among the order I can turn to. She is my only hope.
Target: Terari Heladren was … ahead of her time. It was fear that led to her expulsion, not reason. I see that now.\n\nPlease, find her. Tell her I'll make it right, if she'll save my life. There is no one among the order I can turn to. She is my only hope.

Source: That would be a big help. We have small detail of Clan Murtag soldiers stationed near the at-Tura estate, and they've been waiting to hear something for weeks.\n\nIf you could deliver this dispatch, that would really take a load off my back.
Target: That would be a big help. We have small detail of Clan Murtag soldiers stationed near the at-Tura estate, and they've been waiting to hear something for weeks.\n\nIf you could deliver this dispatch, that would really take a load off my back.

Source: If you're willing to face a few more of these blood-suckers, I wouldn't turn you away.\n\nWe've tracked the vampires to three different locations. Can you deal with this problem for me?
Target: If you're willing to face a few more of these blood-suckers, I wouldn't turn you away.\n\nWe've tracked the vampires to three different locations. Can you deal with this problem for me?

Source: That's as good a term as any. Civil war. It's like mad King Ranser all over again.\n\nLook. Montclair's dangerous and the Countess needs all the help she can get. If you could join her in the chapel at Shornhelm, that would be a start.
Target: That's as good a term as any. Civil war. It's like mad King Ranser all over again.\n\nLook. Montclair's dangerous and the Countess needs all the help she can get. If you could join her in the chapel at Shornhelm, that would be a start.

Source: I'll go find Dame Falhut then.
Target: I'll go find Dame Falhut then.

Source: Well, we can't collect the strands without more lodestones, and the one <<1>> created attracts the stuff like nothing else. You'll find the parts needed in the Mnemonic Planisphere, but be careful. I've heard there's trouble about there lately.
Target: Well, we can't collect the strands without more lodestones, and the one <<1>> created attracts the stuff like nothing else. You'll find the parts needed in the Mnemonic Planisphere, but be careful. I've heard there's trouble about there lately.

Source: Issue is we got to keep the sap warm or it becomes useless. We've discovered a type of coal that does the trick. You'll need to go to the Reactor District to find it, but it's the only thing that stays hot long enough.\n\n<<1>> can tell you more.
Target: Issue is we got to keep the sap warm or it becomes useless. We've discovered a type of coal that does the trick. You'll need to go to the Reactor District to find it, but it's the only thing that stays hot long enough.\n\n<<1>> can tell you more.

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: I'll go find Dame Falhut then.
Target: I'll go find Dame Falhut then.

Source: I'm in.
Target: I'm in.

Source: Just another mystery of Clockwork I don't understand.\n\nOh, and you'll need to get us more runelights. You'll find them behind this strange portal, not quite sure where it leads. Everyone but <<1>> was too afraid to go in, so you'll have to ask her.
Target: Just another mystery of Clockwork I don't understand.\n\nOh, and you'll need to get us more runelights. You'll find them behind this strange portal, not quite sure where it leads. Everyone but <<1>> was too afraid to go in, so you'll have to ask her.

Source: Sure, I can help out. I'll see what I can find.
Target: Sure, I can help out. I'll see what I can find.

Source: That half his army is freezing its legs off while Montclair tears his city a new portcullis!\n\nBetter yet, just help him get Northpoint back. I saw what you did in Shornhelm. We could really use a little of that approach right now.
Target: That half his army is freezing its legs off while Montclair tears his city a new portcullis!\n\nBetter yet, just help him get Northpoint back. I saw what you did in Shornhelm. We could really use a little of that approach right now.

Source: I need to make sure no one else wanders into the portal.\n\nBut maybe you could go in and find Acolyte Variah. This perception tabulator automatically records whatever you experience and should be able to locate my associate. Take it and use it well.
Target: I need to make sure no one else wanders into the portal.\n\nBut maybe you could go in and find Acolyte Variah. This perception tabulator automatically records whatever you experience and should be able to locate my associate. Take it and use it well.

Source: Ha! And will you want an introduction, as well?\n\nLook, if you really want in, talk to Commander Yjarnn. He decides who comes and goes.
Target: Ha! And will you want an introduction, as well?\n\nLook, if you really want in, talk to Commander Yjarnn. He decides who comes and goes.

Source: Now these satchels work, but they turn the plants so bitter no one will drink the tonics Aveberl makes. We've found a sweet syrup in the Wellspring that makes them tolerable, but you'll have to deal with the patrol factotums. \n\nStill interested?
Target: Now these satchels work, but they turn the plants so bitter no one will drink the tonics Aveberl makes. We've found a sweet syrup in the Wellspring that makes them tolerable, but you'll have to deal with the patrol factotums. \n\nStill interested?

Source: You were able to drive off Reezal-Jul and rescue Shornhelm. No small feat, I assure you. But Emeric still needs our help to restore Rivenspire's tranquility.\n\nWalk with me and I will explain. There is much I need to show you and time grows short.
Target: You were able to drive off Reezal-Jul and rescue Shornhelm. No small feat, I assure you. But Emeric still needs our help to restore Rivenspire's tranquility.\n\nWalk with me and I will explain. There is much I need to show you and time grows short.

Source: In the short-term, I need Divayth Fyr. He took his leave to attend to matters outside my fortress. I wish to speak with both of you in a more private setting. \n\nPlease, find Fyr and then meet me at the Elegiac Replication.
Target: In the short-term, I need Divayth Fyr. He took his leave to attend to matters outside my fortress. I wish to speak with both of you in a more private setting. \n\nPlease, find Fyr and then meet me at the Elegiac Replication.

Source: The woman Aranias and her companion Andur, the one who burns everything in his path. \n\nI am not sure which is more dangerous, but they must both be stopped if the Wilderking is to be saved. Cross the bridge and follow the trail of fire. Go quickly.
Target: The woman Aranias and her companion Andur, the one who burns everything in his path. \n\nI am not sure which is more dangerous, but they must both be stopped if the Wilderking is to be saved. Cross the bridge and follow the trail of fire. Go quickly.

Source: Fyr casts a long Aetherial shadow—it makes him difficult to miss. I sense … yes, he is in Mournhold. The Tribunal Temple. Conferring with Almalexia, perhaps?\n\nFind Divayth and tell him what is at stake. With any luck, we will find common cause.
Target: Fyr casts a long Aetherial shadow—it makes him difficult to miss. I sense … yes, he is in Mournhold. The Tribunal Temple. Conferring with Almalexia, perhaps?\n\nFind Divayth and tell him what is at stake. With any luck, we will find common cause.

Source: Hmm. I crossed staves with an Argonian mage once. He could leap through shadows—crossing long distances in seconds. Maybe that's the answer? Shadow portals of some kind?\n\nWe need more information. Inside perspective.
Target: Hmm. I crossed staves with an Argonian mage once. He could leap through shadows—crossing long distances in seconds. Maybe that's the answer? Shadow portals of some kind?\n\nWe need more information. Inside perspective.

Source: Something about Her Majesty's speech, I assume. Normally I'd be happy to head south. But visitors stream through the Skywatch gates. And the guard needs my help here. \n\nWould you take on this task? See this message delivered?
Target: Something about Her Majesty's speech, I assume. Normally I'd be happy to head south. But visitors stream through the Skywatch gates. And the guard needs my help here. \n\nWould you take on this task? See this message delivered?

Source: You know I don't put much stock in hope. Sotha Sil prepares for every conceivable eventuality, but the Shadow is Sotha Sil. It's difficult to create countermeasures for yourself.\n\nWe can't count on Sotha Sil. This task falls to us. Are you ready?
Target: You know I don't put much stock in hope. Sotha Sil prepares for every conceivable eventuality, but the Shadow is Sotha Sil. It's difficult to create countermeasures for yourself.\n\nWe can't count on Sotha Sil. This task falls to us. Are you ready?

Source: Yes, the ancient Dark Elf sorcerer.\n\nWhile Divayth and I do not always see eye to eye, he does not deserve to be slaughtered by his own shadow. My visions tell me that he is currently in Mournhold. You will find him in the Tribunal Temple.
Target: Yes, the ancient Dark Elf sorcerer.\n\nWhile Divayth and I do not always see eye to eye, he does not deserve to be slaughtered by his own shadow. My visions tell me that he is currently in Mournhold. You will find him in the Tribunal Temple.

Source: In all the confusion, I'm embarrassed to admit that I lost track of my brother, Dethisam. He's the town consul. Yesterday, he went to check on the townsfolk afflicted by the plague, but he's disappeared.\n\nCan you help me find my brother?
Target: In all the confusion, I'm embarrassed to admit that I lost track of my brother, Dethisam. He's the town consul. Yesterday, he went to check on the townsfolk afflicted by the plague, but he's disappeared.\n\nCan you help me find my brother?

Source: Oh, you know. Unity under the Eagle banner and such. Why don't you head down there? Find a guard to report into. They're taking names at the gates, you know. Security.\n\nAnyway, head down there. You might see history firsthand!
Target: Oh, you know. Unity under the Eagle banner and such. Why don't you head down there? Find a guard to report into. They're taking names at the gates, you know. Security.\n\nAnyway, head down there. You might see history firsthand!

Source: I might be able to help, but I'll need to know more.
Target: I might be able to help, but I'll need to know more.

Source: Thank you, Valaste.
Target: Thank you, Valaste.

Source: Of course. But if you do not come, he will find another. And you will be left behind—forever saddled with a coward's regret. Hardly a choice, by my estimation. \n\nService to Divayth Fyr is a great honor, sera. Think hard before refusing.
Target: Of course. But if you do not come, he will find another. And you will be left behind—forever saddled with a coward's regret. Hardly a choice, by my estimation. \n\nService to Divayth Fyr is a great honor, sera. Think hard before refusing.

Source: That's what you will find out when you speak to him. Though, I admit I'm not sure exactly where he is at this very minute.\n\nHazazi's paws itch to race into combat! Warriors are not meant to stand around like glorified signposts!
Target: That's what you will find out when you speak to him. Though, I admit I'm not sure exactly where he is at this very minute.\n\nHazazi's paws itch to race into combat! Warriors are not meant to stand around like glorified signposts!

Source: I'll take care of it.
Target: I'll take care of it.

Source: I should try to find the bird totem mentioned in the letter.
Target: I should try to find the bird totem mentioned in the letter.

Source: Sure.
Target: Sure.

Source: Hmm. Well, the fact that they arrived so soon after you revealed the Shadow is suspicious, but they seem more interested in simple mischief than anything else.\n\nAsk around the Chancel of Transaction. Perhaps one of our constables can tell you more.
Target: Hmm. Well, the fact that they arrived so soon after you revealed the Shadow is suspicious, but they seem more interested in simple mischief than anything else.\n\nAsk around the Chancel of Transaction. Perhaps one of our constables can tell you more.

Target: I'll take the hearts to Eidolon's Hollow.

Source: The Everwound Wellspring, a wondrous oasis in this mechanical desert! Sotha Sil created the place, but the lector made plants grow in the metallic soil. Once every year, he distributes food and chooses an apprentice. You should come with me and see!
Target: The Everwound Wellspring, a wondrous oasis in this mechanical desert! Sotha Sil created the place, but the lector made plants grow in the metallic soil. Once every year, he distributes food and chooses an apprentice. You should come with me and see!

Source: We do not know. The Battlereeve sent a soldier, Hazazi, to negotiate with the Bramblebreach Clan, but he has made no progress.\n\nNow Raz needs to hunt for the Staff of Magnus. So he asks you. Will you find Hazazi and sort this out?
Target: We do not know. The Battlereeve sent a soldier, Hazazi, to negotiate with the Bramblebreach Clan, but he has made no progress.\n\nNow Raz needs to hunt for the Staff of Magnus. So he asks you. Will you find Hazazi and sort this out?

Source: Yes! We're no strangers to battle, but these Hollow … they're unstoppable. Strike one down and another comes forth.\n\nPlease. If you are as able as you look, Indanas still fights to drive them back. She needs help … and fast!

Source: Yes, exactly. You're a quick learner.\n\nI need someone who can fight off these cultists and help me return the stars to the Planisphere's sky. Please, you have to help us. This task is of the most vital importance!
Target: Yes, exactly. You're a quick learner.\n\nI need someone who can fight off these cultists and help me return the stars to the Planisphere's sky. Please, you have to help us. This task is of the most vital importance!

Source: The Forge takes on a life of its own when it's gorged on slaughter. Once you've stoked it with the blood of your enemies, invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before you shatter the murderous Earthgore Amalgam that's formed in its molten heart.
Target: The Forge takes on a life of its own when it's gorged on slaughter. Once you've stoked it with the blood of your enemies, invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before you shatter the murderous Earthgore Amalgam that's formed in its molten heart.

Source: The Reach army is led by a real titan of a minotaur. Wades through men like ants and spits fire, if you believe that.\n\nSounds the Jarl's warhorn in defiance of the beast and you're sure to have it seeing red before you lock horns!
Target: The Reach army is led by a real titan of a minotaur. Wades through men like ants and spits fire, if you believe that.\n\nSounds the Jarl's warhorn in defiance of the beast and you're sure to have it seeing red before you lock horns!
