Source: Truly? Why, that's most excellent! \n\nNow, the very fate of Clockwork City's clean water supply rests in our hands, so we must act quickly. I know the locations of the machines in need of repairs, but we'll have to search around for specific parts.
Target: Truly? Why, that's most excellent! \n\nNow, the very fate of Clockwork City's clean water supply rests in our hands, so we must act quickly. I know the locations of the machines in need of repairs, but we'll have to search around for specific parts.

Source: Do you always skip ahead in the story? No one has an iota of patience anymore.\n\nBut yes, I need a few bottles of the curative. I'm sure you'll be able to find some inside the quarantine. Then we'll see what's in this "proprietary" formula.
Target: Do you always skip ahead in the story? No one has an iota of patience anymore.\n\nBut yes, I need a few bottles of the curative. I'm sure you'll be able to find some inside the quarantine. Then we'll see what's in this \\"proprietary\"\" formula."

Target: I'll see what I can find, but tell me what you mean by \\"evidence.\"\""

Source: Yes, a clockwork apostle named Varuni Arvel. Apparently, she's a member of the Congress of Calibration—the governing body here in the city.\n\nMy associates, Kireth and Raynor, are already working on a plan to earn her trust. Will you help us?
Target: Yes, a clockwork apostle named Varuni Arvel. Apparently, she's a member of the Congress of Calibration—the governing body here in the city.\n\nMy associates, Kireth and Raynor, are already working on a plan to earn her trust. Will you help us?

Target: No, and I can't imagine how hard something like that is to come by in Clockwork City. Maurice never did say how he came by a case of it, but I'm not one to pry.\n\nCouldn't hurt to do some asking around though, right?

Target: Worse. Initially, I dismissed it as boredom, fatigue, or even the first signs of senility. But now, after observing him at length, I can say with certainty—this is not the Sotha Sil I know.\n\nThere's Daedric mischief here, and we will root it out.

Target: One more thing, a special request. Tubabi loved nix-hound meat before she wound up here.\n\n<<1>> raises the best you can find, but I can't afford his prices. I'd really like to impress her and I know where he keeps his stash.

Source: Call me Titus. It's a long story, but I'm familiar with Tarish-Zi and his army of Anka-Ra.\n\nCenturies ago, they were part of the Ra Gada, the Yokudan invasion force that subdued and conquered Craglorn. But Tarish-Zi and his army were among the worst.
Target: Call me Titus. It's a long story, but I'm familiar with Tarish-Zi and his army of Anka-Ra.\n\nCenturies ago, they were part of the Ra Gada, the Yokudan invasion force that subdued and conquered Craglorn. But Tarish-Zi and his army were among the worst.

Target: I'll get the power core for you.

Target: Trapped on the other side of a broken bridge, I'm afraid. \n\nSay, you look capable. Would you mind escorting me through the <<1>> in order to reach my companions? It's vitally important we continue our expedition.

Source: The way deeper into Fang Lair is barred by powerful magic. I've yet to find a discreet way through, but with you here we might be able to disrupt the barrier by force. Give those necromancers a real taste of death and go from there.\n\nInterested?

Source: Sure, I'll look for your partner.
Target: Sure, I'll look for your partner.

Source: If they insist on not dying, then a different tribute must be collected. Steal their tools of eating! Bring me their plates and bowls! If we can't eat, then neither can they. A fair and meaningful tribute that also teaches a lesson, yes?
Target: If they insist on not dying, then a different tribute must be collected. Steal their tools of eating! Bring me their plates and bowls! If we can't eat, then neither can they. A fair and meaningful tribute that also teaches a lesson, yes?

Source: "To be a child of the Blood Matron is to forsake the Divines. If you are ready to join us, step through the portal. Otherwise, return to your city and speak to a cursed Priest of Arkay. The Blood Matron will not induct the unworthy or weak."

Source: Crunch, crackle, and snap. Hides and carapaces from the corpses of creatures, and Daedric husks that the Court can crumble and crush! Those would be most excellent!\n\nAnd for your assistance, I offer the usual compensation.

Source: An oracle of sorts. It's an unusual factotum with a penchant for the mystical and the dramatic.\n\nI fear Kamid plans to do something foolish—and dangerous. Perhaps you'd be willing to go to the Outlaws Refuge and talk to him? Keep him safe?
Target: An oracle of sorts. It's an unusual factotum with a penchant for the mystical and the dramatic.\n\nI fear Kamid plans to do something foolish—and dangerous. Perhaps you'd be willing to go to the Outlaws Refuge and talk to him? Keep him safe?

Source: With Astanya's death we're … well, we're a bit disorganized. Please, you handled the Captain so well. \n\nGo to Silsailen, northeast of Vulkhel Guard. Find the Canonreeve or his daughter Elenwen, and help those people.
Target: With Astanya's death we're … well, we're a bit disorganized. Please, you handled the Captain so well. \n\nGo to Silsailen, northeast of Vulkhel Guard. Find the Canonreeve or his daughter Elenwen, and help those people.

Source: Before I wounded his pride, we were planning to explore this marvelous machine world. He charged off to prove he didn't need my help, and we know how that's going to turn out!\n\nI'll let him cool off, but could you make sure he stays out of trouble?
Target: Before I wounded his pride, we were planning to explore this marvelous machine world. He charged off to prove he didn't need my help, and we know how that's going to turn out!\n\nI'll let him cool off, but could you make sure he stays out of trouble?

Source: All I know is that anyone who drinks the water gets strong—really strong—and then attacks anything that moves.\n\nOur leader, Sali'ma, is inside, looking for a way to end the curse and save our researchers. If you want to help, talk to him.
Target: All I know is that anyone who drinks the water gets strong—really strong—and then attacks anything that moves.\n\nOur leader, Sali'ma, is inside, looking for a way to end the curse and save our researchers. If you want to help, talk to him.

Source: Coral crab eggs, from the reef between Corgrad and Lillandril. Handle them carefully, and beware the Queen of the Reef. That giant coral crab has killed many an ambitious gourmand, but if she has been perverted by unholy powers she must be purged.
Target: Coral crab eggs, from the reef between Corgrad and Lillandril. Handle them carefully, and beware the Queen of the Reef. That giant coral crab has killed many an ambitious gourmand, but if she has been perverted by unholy powers she must be purged.

Source: Please, go find Telenger in our camp. He's always looking for new people to boss around. You look capable. Maybe you can figure out what's going on here, where our people have gone.
Target: Please, go find Telenger in our camp. He's always looking for new people to boss around. You look capable. Maybe you can figure out what's going on here, where our people have gone.

Source: Very perceptive. I knew you were the right person for the job!\n\nTalk to <<1>> if you want more details. Otherwise, head into the Shadow Cleft, locate the missing mage and the perception tabulator we provided, and return to claim your reward.

Target: We've also been requested to collect the beasts' feathers. Some Wood Elf merchants have offered us quite a bit of gold for them. It seems the Bosmer prize such things.\n\nIt should be easy enough to find some in the surrounding nests.

Source: A researcher. Very bright, but often too absorbed in his work, if you ask me. Still, I like to help him when I can. Right now, he's on the trail of … oh, it's better if you just ask him about it. \n\nI'd just get it all wrong.

Target: My crops are failing this year. I don't understand why, Aquil seems to be doing fine, and we're in lock-step when it comes to methods of cultivation...\n\nCould he be sabotaging my crops so he can raise prices? I hate to think of it...

Target: I freed a Nord named Svanhildr from the Orcs in Malak's Maw. Now she has a plan to deal with the Orcs.

Target: All right, I'll help you rid this burial site of graverobbers.

Target: I'm ready. Let's go to the Abbey of Blades and meet with Sai Sahan.

Target: I'll help fix your skooma problem.

Target: All right. I'll destroy the coven and try to find your compatriots.

Source: All right, I'll help you rescue your friends, Tajahir and Marekki.
Target: All right, I'll help you rescue your friends, Tajahir and Marekki.

Source: I'll find Nishzo and see what he knows about the tapestry pieces.
Target: I'll find Nishzo and see what he knows about the tapestry pieces.

Target: I'll talk to Nahfahlaar.

Target: I'll speak with Renmus and see if he has any information on Nahfahlaar.

Target: I think I'll look into this wrecked caravan. Thanks.

Target: I'll help you deal with this Dragon threat.

Source: All right, I'll help you get out of this.
Target: All right, I'll help you get out of this.

Target: I'll help you with your exorcism.

Source: I'll meet Aeliah at Senchal Palace then.
Target: I'll meet Aeliah at Senchal Palace then.

Source: Hey there so and so, do something cool for me. Oh, be a dear and fetch my laundry.
Target: Hey there so and so, do something cool for me. Oh, be a dear and fetch my laundry.

Target: I'll accompany you to the Dragon's lair, Sai.

Target: I'll go to the Dragonguard Sanctum and talk to Sai Sahan.

Target: I'll talk to Khamira and see what she thinks.

Target: I'll choose a companion who's familiar with Elsweyr and search for Yahgrondu.

Target: I'll meet Sai Sahan at the Dragonguard Sanctum as soon as I can.

Target: I'll talk to Nahfahlaar.

Source: Very well, I'll meet with Blademaster Kasura.
Target: Very well, I'll meet with Blademaster Kasura.

Source: I'll take the seal and help you. How do I find these glyphs?
Target: I'll take the seal and help you. How do I find these glyphs?

Source: I'll do it.
Target: I'll do it.

Source: I can get your things back. What am I looking for?
Target: I can get your things back. What am I looking for?

Source: All right, I'll look into it.
Target: All right, I'll look into it.

Source: All right, I'll kill Thannar the Graveprowler and settle the restless dead.
Target: All right, I'll kill Thannar the Graveprowler and settle the restless dead.

Source: I'll go speak to Khamira.
Target: I'll go speak to Khamira.

Source: All right, I'll kill this pair of criminals and smash their contraband.
Target: All right, I'll kill this pair of criminals and smash their contraband.

Source: Eager to begin? Good. Eagerness is just what we need.\n\nYour first lesson begins now. The Order has detected a number of … irregularities on Tamriel. Small breaches in the fabric of time. I would like you to seal them for me.
Target: Eager to begin? Good. Eagerness is just what we need.\n\nYour first lesson begins now. The Order has detected a number of … irregularities on Tamriel. Small breaches in the fabric of time. I would like you to seal them for me.

Source: I'm not entirely sure. By Oblivion, I'm not even sure what day it is. The bottles must be somewhere along the winery grounds. I probably dropped them as we went along. \n\nI can barely see straight right now. Could you fetch them for me?
Target: I'm not entirely sure. By Oblivion, I'm not even sure what day it is. The bottles must be somewhere along the winery grounds. I probably dropped them as we went along. \n\nI can barely see straight right now. Could you fetch them for me?

Source: A member of the Mages Guild murdered a Sapiarch, but now the murderer's friend is railing against the conviction. Loudly.\n\nTalk some sense into her, would you? She might listen to another … guest. You'll find her outside the Fighters Guild.
Target: A member of the Mages Guild murdered a Sapiarch, but now the murderer's friend is railing against the conviction. Loudly.\n\nTalk some sense into her, would you? She might listen to another … guest. You'll find her outside the Fighters Guild.

Source: Let me attune you to my spell. There! Now we're connected through my mental link.\n\nFind the three adventurers, Cainar, Grog, and Miriya. When you examine them, the spell should take you into their individual mind traps. I can direct you from there.
Target: Let me attune you to my spell. There! Now we're connected through my mental link.\n\nFind the three adventurers, Cainar, Grog, and Miriya. When you examine them, the spell should take you into their individual mind traps. I can direct you from there.

Source: Not just a garden, the very art of gardening! Eslion is waging a war on Altmer horticulture. I represent everything he despises, so he's targeting my work. He's gone too far this time, planting stranglers to ward me away.\n\nThey could kill someone.
Target: Not just a garden, the very art of gardening! Eslion is waging a war on Altmer horticulture. I represent everything he despises, so he's targeting my work. He's gone too far this time, planting stranglers to ward me away.\n\nThey could kill someone.

Source: Let me attune you to my spell. There! Now we're connected through the mental links.\n\nFind the three adventurers, Cainar, Grog, and Miriya. When you get close, the spell should send you into their individual mind traps. I can direct you from there.
Target: Let me attune you to my spell. There! Now we're connected through the mental links.\n\nFind the three adventurers, Cainar, Grog, and Miriya. When you get close, the spell should send you into their individual mind traps. I can direct you from there.

Source: While I head inside to begin the augury ritual, I'd like you to go to Sotha Sil's study in the tower. Find my acolyte, Oriandra, and ask her for Sotha Sil's amplification elixir. We may need it if the pearl proves to be resistant to our magic.
Target: While I head inside to begin the augury ritual, I'd like you to go to Sotha Sil's study in the tower. Find my acolyte, Oriandra, and ask her for Sotha Sil's amplification elixir. We may need it if the pearl proves to be resistant to our magic.

Source: He's with Valsirenn, using the scrying pool to try to track down the missing pearl. If it's anywhere on Artaeum, the Ritemaster will find it. That's what the scrying pool is for.\n\nPlease, head into Ceporah Tower and see what the Ritemaster needs.
Target: He's with Valsirenn, using the scrying pool to try to track down the missing pearl. If it's anywhere on Artaeum, the Ritemaster will find it. That's what the scrying pool is for.\n\nPlease, head into Ceporah Tower and see what the Ritemaster needs.

Source: Really? I have to warn you, the gryphons in there are quite nasty. They'd do anything to protect their nests from invaders.\n\nBut if you're willing, I'd be mighty grateful. Even pay you for your efforts!
Target: Really? I have to warn you, the gryphons in there are quite nasty. They'd do anything to protect their nests from invaders.\n\nBut if you're willing, I'd be mighty grateful. Even pay you for your efforts!

Source: Into the wilderness, off toward that old Wayshrine. How far could they have really gone?\n\nI would give anything to have my precious Eustasia safely in my arms again. Find her for me and I will make it worth your while.
Target: Into the wilderness, off toward that old Wayshrine. How far could they have really gone?\n\nI would give anything to have my precious Eustasia safely in my arms again. Find her for me and I will make it worth your while.

Source: Yes. Take this map of the region, more Psijic Seals, and the Augur. I hope the breaches haven't grown more powerful.\n\nStay safe. And … just make sure Alik'r weathers this, all right? I know I shouldn't … I have to stay detached. Never mind.
Target: Yes. Take this map of the region, more Psijic Seals, and the Augur. I hope the breaches haven't grown more powerful.\n\nStay safe. And … just make sure Alik'r weathers this, all right? I know I shouldn't … I have to stay detached. Never mind.

Source: Dead or imprisoned, depending on Vykosa's will.\n\nWhat I wouldn't give for a chance to strike back. This pack of curs needs to be taken down, before they can cause any more harm to the innocents of Tamriel.
Target: Dead or imprisoned, depending on Vykosa's will.\n\nWhat I wouldn't give for a chance to strike back. This pack of curs needs to be taken down, before they can cause any more harm to the innocents of Tamriel.

Source: The Loremaster and I. While you made your way across Alik'r, we reached out with projections—looking for objects of power. We found one. The Staff of Towers.\n\nThe Loremaster's confident we can find it. You should speak with him when you return.
Target: The Loremaster and I. While you made your way across Alik'r, we reached out with projections—looking for objects of power. We found one. The Staff of Towers.\n\nThe Loremaster's confident we can find it. You should speak with him when you return.

Source: Vykosa is going to be your toughest opponent. Legends say she was turned into a werewolf by Hircine himself. A worthy adversary if I ever heard of one.\n\nEvoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle, and make your fight even more legendary.
Target: Vykosa is going to be your toughest opponent. Legends say she was turned into a werewolf by Hircine himself. A worthy adversary if I ever heard of one.\n\nEvoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle, and make your fight even more legendary.

Source: Well … yes, he is. My father transformed into a werewolf before he died. As such, his spirit is forced to remain within the Hunting Grounds.\n\nThe only way I can free my father's soul is to hunt down Tarcyr and win Hircine's favor.
Target: Well … yes, he is. My father transformed into a werewolf before he died. As such, his spirit is forced to remain within the Hunting Grounds.\n\nThe only way I can free my father's soul is to hunt down Tarcyr and win Hircine's favor.

Source: Ancestor of ours, Gjadil the Keel-Hauler, cached her loot around here.\n\nIf you grab the chest for us, there's no chance for a sneak attack. The map over there will lead you right to it. And, obviously, I'll pay you for the trouble.
Target: Ancestor of ours, Gjadil the Keel-Hauler, cached her loot around here.\n\nIf you grab the chest for us, there's no chance for a sneak attack. The map over there will lead you right to it. And, obviously, I'll pay you for the trouble.

Source: Hircine revels in the brutal combat between his contestants. And the way I hear it, your greatest competition is the werewolf Balorgh.\n\nTaunt the Orc by burning his pack's banner, and show Hircine what you're truly made of.
Target: Hircine revels in the brutal combat between his contestants. And the way I hear it, your greatest competition is the werewolf Balorgh.\n\nTaunt the Orc by burning his pack's banner, and show Hircine what you're truly made of.

Source: It might be worth talking to the Loremaster. He would never admit it, but I think something is bothering him. Something about the staff fragments.
Target: It might be worth talking to the Loremaster. He would never admit it, but I think something is bothering him. Something about the staff fragments.

Source: The better question might be, what can't they do? If they locate a large source of nirncrux and figure out how to use it, well … anything is possible!\n\nSo tell me. Have you come to stop these Serpent-loving, thrice-damned nuisances or what?
Target: The better question might be, what can't they do? If they locate a large source of nirncrux and figure out how to use it, well … anything is possible!\n\nSo tell me. Have you come to stop these Serpent-loving, thrice-damned nuisances or what?

Source: An order of Summerset knights, which I'm honored to be a part of.\n\nZ'Maja was able to capture and somehow replicate my three companions. Even if fought alone, these shadows will be difficult to defeat. Do you think yourself capable of such a task?
Target: An order of Summerset knights, which I'm honored to be a part of.\n\nZ'Maja was able to capture and somehow replicate my three companions. Even if fought alone, these shadows will be difficult to defeat. Do you think yourself capable of such a task?

Source: Please, just take a moment and discuss this matter of the staff with Josajeh. I fear that she still resents my decision to lock the fragments away.\n\nShe suffered a … trauma. The promise of this staff could create an unwelcome distraction.
Target: Please, just take a moment and discuss this matter of the staff with Josajeh. I fear that she still resents my decision to lock the fragments away.\n\nShe suffered a … trauma. The promise of this staff could create an unwelcome distraction.

Source: We do. As always, the Augur, map, and Psijic Seals are prepared for your use. Josajeh will provide them.\n\nReturn to me once you have closed the breaches. We will solve this problem of the staff soon. You have my word.
Target: We do. As always, the Augur, map, and Psijic Seals are prepared for your use. Josajeh will provide them.\n\nReturn to me once you have closed the breaches. We will solve this problem of the staff soon. You have my word.

Source: Yes, I'm afraid I do. Could you travel to Cloudrest and seek out my mother, Belarin?\n\nI must warn you though, should my dreams be true, such a journey may come at great risk. You'll want to gather many allies by your side before heading off.
Target: Yes, I'm afraid I do. Could you travel to Cloudrest and seek out my mother, Belarin?\n\nI must warn you though, should my dreams be true, such a journey may come at great risk. You'll want to gather many allies by your side before heading off.

Source: You will no doubt find more time breaches near these landmarks. Once the Augur attunes to them, it should light a path to the hidden artifacts.\n\nYou must move quickly, initiate. Only the Psijic Order is prepared to deal with objects this dangerous.
Target: You will no doubt find more time breaches near these landmarks. Once the Augur attunes to them, it should light a path to the hidden artifacts.\n\nYou must move quickly, initiate. Only the Psijic Order is prepared to deal with objects this dangerous.

Source: Not for long. A familiar place can serve as a temporal anchor. If she went to Divad's Chagrin, she almost certainly plans to use it as a springboard into an unfamiliar place … an unfamiliar time.\n\nTake the Augur and these seals and find this mine.
Target: Not for long. A familiar place can serve as a temporal anchor. If she went to Divad's Chagrin, she almost certainly plans to use it as a springboard into an unfamiliar place … an unfamiliar time.\n\nTake the Augur and these seals and find this mine.

Source: Yes. Precisely. \n\nJosajeh will provide the items you need. I was hesitant to give her this task at first. But keeping her involved to some degree seemed prudent … and perhaps humane? You should go speak with her. She needs friendly counsel.
Target: Yes. Precisely. \n\nJosajeh will provide the items you need. I was hesitant to give her this task at first. But keeping her involved to some degree seemed prudent … and perhaps humane? You should go speak with her. She needs friendly counsel.

Source: Pelin Graveyard in Bangkorai, Leki's Blade in Alik'r, the great Hist in Shadowfen, and the Fang Spires in Deshaan.\n\nOnce you arrive at a breach, activate the Augur and it should light a path to the artifacts. Josajeh can tell you more. Safe travels.
Target: Pelin Graveyard in Bangkorai, Leki's Blade in Alik'r, the great Hist in Shadowfen, and the Fang Spires in Deshaan.\n\nOnce you arrive at a breach, activate the Augur and it should light a path to the artifacts. Josajeh can tell you more. Safe travels.

Source: I've seen you in action. You're my best hope for stopping the mantikoras. Unnatural beasts! Did you know the Court created them?\n\nThe creation process starts in Fearfangs Cavern. There, we must destroy the scorpion matron and her nests.
Target: I've seen you in action. You're my best hope for stopping the mantikoras. Unnatural beasts! Did you know the Court created them?\n\nThe creation process starts in Fearfangs Cavern. There, we must destroy the scorpion matron and her nests.

Source: Indeed. Until they find a suitable third investigator, the jurisreeves and revelators are left to sit on their hands. Nonsense.\n\nWhy not go lend them a hand? They'll likely just tell you to go jump into the sea, but it can't hurt to ask.
Target: Indeed. Until they find a suitable third investigator, the jurisreeves and revelators are left to sit on their hands. Nonsense.\n\nWhy not go lend them a hand? They'll likely just tell you to go jump into the sea, but it can't hurt to ask.

Source: Yes, I'm sure of it. I couldn't find them anywhere.\n\nI did meet a High Elf named Esterdel. He wouldn't tell me much, but he was definitely searching around the grove. He may know more about the situation than I do.
Target: Yes, I'm sure of it. I couldn't find them anywhere.\n\nI did meet a High Elf named Esterdel. He wouldn't tell me much, but he was definitely searching around the grove. He may know more about the situation than I do.

Source: The Ritemaster is in his study in Ceporah Tower. Go there and see what you can do to help him remember what happened.
Target: The Ritemaster is in his study in Ceporah Tower. Go there and see what you can do to help him remember what happened.

Source: You're my better plan! Between my cheerful optimism and your proclivity for violence, there's no way we can lose.\n\nAnyway, you'll help, right? Meet me in the ruined tower on the nearby hill.
Target: You're my better plan! Between my cheerful optimism and your proclivity for violence, there's no way we can lose.\n\nAnyway, you'll help, right? Meet me in the ruined tower on the nearby hill.

Source: We also need to convince the Clockwork God to share the news he brought with us. But without the Ritemaster, he may simply take his leave. Like the other members of the Dark Elf Tribunal, he can be very enigmatic.\n\nPerhaps if you talked to him ….
Target: We also need to convince the Clockwork God to share the news he brought with us. But without the Ritemaster, he may simply take his leave. Like the other members of the Dark Elf Tribunal, he can be very enigmatic.\n\nPerhaps if you talked to him ….

Source: No. He thinks the language is ancient and he feels we need to determine what the memory means before we attempt to breach the barrier.\n\nThe Ritemaster is waiting for you in the Dreaming Cave. Go and talk to him as soon as you can.
Target: No. He thinks the language is ancient and he feels we need to determine what the memory means before we attempt to breach the barrier.\n\nThe Ritemaster is waiting for you in the Dreaming Cave. Go and talk to him as soon as you can.

Source: I'm sure the Ritemaster will provide more details, but I suppose it involves the augury spell he plans to cast upon the abyssal pearl that you and Valsirenn discovered.\n\nYou can find the Ritemaster in Ceporah Tower on Artaeum.
Target: I'm sure the Ritemaster will provide more details, but I suppose it involves the augury spell he plans to cast upon the abyssal pearl that you and Valsirenn discovered.\n\nYou can find the Ritemaster in Ceporah Tower on Artaeum.

Source: Him and Valsirenn were going to try to use the scrying pool to track down the missing pearl. Please, return to Artaeum and go to Ceporah Tower. The Ritemaster was very insistent that I find you and send you there at the first opportunity.
Target: Him and Valsirenn were going to try to use the scrying pool to track down the missing pearl. Please, return to Artaeum and go to Ceporah Tower. The Ritemaster was very insistent that I find you and send you there at the first opportunity.

Source: I don't have time to make polite conversation with the Proxy Queen. I need you to talk to Alwinarwe and secure her permission to enter the College of Sapiarchs. The Ritemaster has already requested an audience, so the Palace should be expecting you.
Target: I don't have time to make polite conversation with the Proxy Queen. I need you to talk to Alwinarwe and secure her permission to enter the College of Sapiarchs. The Ritemaster has already requested an audience, so the Palace should be expecting you.

Source: The Goblins, ah, dragged her off. Along with all my notes too. I've been reciting every tale I know for inspiration on a valorous rescue, but I find them sorely lacking in the specifics.\n\nPlease help me. I'm lost without Naliara and my notes.
Target: The Goblins, ah, dragged her off. Along with all my notes too. I've been reciting every tale I know for inspiration on a valorous rescue, but I find them sorely lacking in the specifics.\n\nPlease help me. I'm lost without Naliara and my notes.

Source: I'm sure the Ritemaster will provide details, though I can tell you it involves the augury spell he plans to cast upon the abyssal pearl that you and Valsirenn discovered.\n\nYou can find the Ritemaster in Ceporah Tower, in the main gallery.
Target: I'm sure the Ritemaster will provide details, though I can tell you it involves the augury spell he plans to cast upon the abyssal pearl that you and Valsirenn discovered.\n\nYou can find the Ritemaster in Ceporah Tower, in the main gallery.

Source: I'd like you to make polite conversation with Proxy Queen Alwinarwe. Get her to give you permission to enter the College of Sapiarchs. The Ritemaster has already requested an audience, so the Palace should be expecting you.
Target: I'd like you to make polite conversation with Proxy Queen Alwinarwe. Get her to give you permission to enter the College of Sapiarchs. The Ritemaster has already requested an audience, so the Palace should be expecting you.

Source: He and a few of the others have staked out a camp up on the ridge. He is foolish to stay. This place is cursed.
Target: He and a few of the others have staked out a camp up on the ridge. He is foolish to stay. This place is cursed.

Source: Please don't tell anyone, but I think she stole a seeing stone called the Eye of Remembrance and took it to Traitor's Vault. \n\nI told her to put it back! The Relicmaster will be furious! I thought she'd seen reason, but when she missed breakfast ….
Target: Please don't tell anyone, but I think she stole a seeing stone called the Eye of Remembrance and took it to Traitor's Vault. \n\nI told her to put it back! The Relicmaster will be furious! I thought she'd seen reason, but when she missed breakfast ….

Source: Destroy the geysers. Find them and obliterate them as quickly as you can.\n\nYou'll need to fight through the creatures spawned by the geysers, so bring allies with you if you can. And make sure to destroy the pearls. That's the source of the magic.
Target: Destroy the geysers. Find them and obliterate them as quickly as you can.\n\nYou'll need to fight through the creatures spawned by the geysers, so bring allies with you if you can. And make sure to destroy the pearls. That's the source of the magic.

Source: Well, yes. But the Relicmaster didn't seem too upset by the whole ordeal. He probably already saw how we were going to get them back. Maybe you have something to with that?\n\nJust go ahead into the College ruins over there. You can't miss him!
Target: Well, yes. But the Relicmaster didn't seem too upset by the whole ordeal. He probably already saw how we were going to get them back. Maybe you have something to with that?\n\nJust go ahead into the College ruins over there. You can't miss him!

Target: QUEST: A Miner's Vengeance

Source: Perhaps. I thought he was nothing more than a myth before I entered the catacombs. But then I heard a voice inside my mind, beckoning me into the depths.\n\nI fled to seek the blessing of the Eight, for without it I know my soul will be forfeit.
Target: Perhaps. I thought he was nothing more than a myth before I entered the catacombs. But then I heard a voice inside my mind, beckoning me into the depths.\n\nI fled to seek the blessing of the Eight, for without it I know my soul will be forfeit.
