Source: I'll find the book and see if I can rescue the Chief Archivist while I'm at it.
Target: I'll find the book and see if I can rescue the Chief Archivist while I'm at it.

Source: All right, I'll do it.
Target: All right, I'll do it.

Source: I'll find Lyris and Fenn.
Target: I'll find Lyris and Fenn.

Source: I'll make my way to the base and report in to the general.
Target: I'll make my way to the base and report in to the general.

Source: I'll seek him out and find out where he's been.
Target: I'll seek him out and find out where he's been.

Source: I'll find Viggol and keep him safe.
Target: I'll find Viggol and keep him safe.

Source: I'll help you find your ancestor's remains.
Target: I'll help you find your ancestor's remains.

Source: I'll make my way to the base and report in to the general.
Target: I'll make my way to the base and report in to the general.

Source: I'll search for this relic.
Target: 제가 그 유물을 찾겠습니다.

Source: I'll go talk to your commander.
Target: I'll go talk to your commander.

Source: Let's go see the high queen.
Target: Let's go see the high queen.

Source: I'll help. What do you need me to do?
Target: I'll help. What do you need me to do?

Source: What needs to be done?
Target: What needs to be done?

Source: Gwendis? I'll find her.
Target: Gwendis? I'll find her.

Source: I'll help stop the Reachmen in the Shadowgreen.
Target: I'll help stop the Reachmen in the Shadowgreen.

Source: All right, I'll help you find your sister.
Target: All right, I'll help you find your sister.

Source: I'll go recover the missing instrument.
Target: I'll go recover the missing instrument.

Source: I'll search the barrow for any survivors.
Target: I'll search the barrow for any survivors.

Source: I'll read Fennorian's message.
Target: I'll read Fennorian's message.

Source: I'll look for the people you mentioned at the stables.
Target: I'll look for the people you mentioned at the stables.

Source: I'll go to the Blue Palace and talk to Svana.
Target: I'll go to the Blue Palace and talk to Svana.

Source: I'll get Arkay's sacred oil from the Temple of the Divines.
Target: I'll get Arkay's sacred oil from the Temple of the Divines.

Source: All right, I'll go to Solitude and warn them about the Icereach Coven.
Target: All right, I'll go to Solitude and warn them about the Icereach Coven.

Source: Hold on!
Target: Hold on!

Source: I'll find some meat for your crew.
Target: I'll find some meat for your crew.

Source: I can investigate the farm for you.
Target: I can investigate the farm for you.

Source: I'll find some meat for your crew.
Target: I'll find some meat for your crew.

Source: I'll go to the Blue Palace and speak with Svana.
Target: I'll go to the Blue Palace and speak with Svana.

Source: I'll talk to Nahfahlaar.
Target: I'll talk to Nahfahlaar.

Source: I'll go with you to the Grinning Horker inn, Lyris.
Target: I'll go with you to the Grinning Horker inn, Lyris.

Source: I'll meet you at the Blue Palace.
Target: I'll meet you at the Blue Palace.

Source: I'll help you look for them.
Target: I'll help you look for them.

Source: I'll talk to Fenn about countering the harrowstorms.
Target: I'll talk to Fenn about countering the harrowstorms.

Source: Go to Bok-Xul and retrieve the stolen grave-stakes. Also, make sure to kill the necromancer Baxilt-Gah. \n\nThen take the grave-stakes and return them to swamp. Just place them where rot gas spews. That will set things right again.
Target: Go to Bok-Xul and retrieve the stolen grave-stakes. Also, make sure to kill the necromancer Baxilt-Gah. \n\nThen take the grave-stakes and return them to swamp. Just place them where rot gas spews. That will set things right again.

Source: I sigh at the innocence of outsiders. Killing plants isn't enough. You must burn the heart-roots!\n\nGo to Bok-Xul. Burn the corrupted heart-roots and kill the necromancer, Baxilt-Gah. Then the tribe will be safe. For a while.
Target: I sigh at the innocence of outsiders. Killing plants isn't enough. You must burn the heart-roots!\n\nGo to Bok-Xul. Burn the corrupted heart-roots and kill the necromancer, Baxilt-Gah. Then the tribe will be safe. For a while.

Source: First, kill the necromancer. He is a blight upon the land. \n\nThen recover the bones of the fallen Dead-Water warriors. They need to be fashioned into weapons so they can be used in battles once again. Anything less would dishonor their memories.
Target: First, kill the necromancer. He is a blight upon the land. \n\nThen recover the bones of the fallen Dead-Water warriors. They need to be fashioned into weapons so they can be used in battles once again. Anything less would dishonor their memories.

Source: One of Murkmire's miregaunts. It's a huge, lumbering creature we call Walks-Like-Thunder. Very strong. Very dangerous.\n\nBest to kill it before you try to gather the vines.
Target: One of Murkmire's miregaunts. It's a huge, lumbering creature we call Walks-Like-Thunder. Very strong. Very dangerous.\n\nBest to kill it before you try to gather the vines.

Source: It is a huge, lumbering miregaunt called Walks-Like-Thunder. It guards the Echoing Hollow. Best to kill it before you gather the relics from the ancient ruins behind the Hollow.\n\nI have shared the location. Will you gather relics for the Naga-Kur?
Target: It is a huge, lumbering miregaunt called Walks-Like-Thunder. It guards the Echoing Hollow. Best to kill it before you gather the relics from the ancient ruins behind the Hollow.\n\nI have shared the location. Will you gather relics for the Naga-Kur?

Source: Enter the ruins and set fire to the supply caches! Also, kill the miregaunt that the stupid Blackguards awakened. Walks-Like-Thunder is too dangerous to live.\n\nDo these things for the Naga-Kur tribe and Bolu will reward you.
Target: Enter the ruins and set fire to the supply caches! Also, kill the miregaunt that the stupid Blackguards awakened. Walks-Like-Thunder is too dangerous to live.\n\nDo these things for the Naga-Kur tribe and Bolu will reward you.

Source: After my egg-relative joined them, the Legion vanished. At long last, I believe I know where they disappeared to—Tsofeer Cavern. However, the cavern is rumored to be the home of the Wuju-Ka. I can't face that monster on my own. Will you go with me?
Target: After my egg-relative joined them, the Legion vanished. At long last, I believe I know where they disappeared to—Tsofeer Cavern. However, the cavern is rumored to be the home of the Wuju-Ka. I can't face that monster on my own. Will you go with me?

Source: Yes. You are clearly the best at what you do. I can think of no one more qualified to lead this endeavor.\n\nYou and Xukas have grown close, correct? He knows a great deal about the Remnant, I'm sure. Please, convince him we only want to help.
Target: Yes. You are clearly the best at what you do. I can think of no one more qualified to lead this endeavor.\n\nYou and Xukas have grown close, correct? He knows a great deal about the Remnant, I'm sure. Please, convince him we only want to help.

Source: "If you care about history and seek to correct the mistakes of the past, then Cyrodilic Collections wants you. Please look for <<1>> in Vulkhel Guard, Davon's Watch, or Daggerfall. Help us beat the competition and preserve Argonian culture."
Target: \\"If you care about history and seek to correct the mistakes of the past
column4: then Cyrodilic Collections wants you. Please look for <<1>> in Vulkhel Guard
column5: Davon's Watch
column6: or Daggerfall. Help us beat the competition and preserve Argonian culture.\"\""

Source: Yes. What blood she does not drink is spilled on the altars of the temple. For what purpose, I do not know, but many have died for the sake of her terrible rituals.\n\nShuxaltsei must be stopped.
Target: Yes. What blood she does not drink is spilled on the altars of the temple. For what purpose, I do not know, but many have died for the sake of her terrible rituals.\n\nShuxaltsei must be stopped.

Source: Jaxsik chases her prey into the Deepmire, northeast of here. It is an old-fear-place, beeko. No Saxhleel hunts there—not even the bravest kaals.\n\nThis will not stop Jaxsik. Naga fury makes her strong, but also reckless. She will need your help.
Target: Jaxsik chases her prey into the Deepmire, northeast of here. It is an old-fear-place, beeko. No Saxhleel hunts there—not even the bravest kaals.\n\nThis will not stop Jaxsik. Naga fury makes her strong, but also reckless. She will need your help.

Source: We need to follow the trail. Whatever Margus found inside the idol, he's going to need Argonian experts to help him decipher it.\n\nTalk to Jee-Lar. He knows a few local Argonians with knowledge of Murkmire. That's who Margus will seek out as well.
Target: We need to follow the trail. Whatever Margus found inside the idol, he's going to need Argonian experts to help him decipher it.\n\nTalk to Jee-Lar. He knows a few local Argonians with knowledge of Murkmire. That's who Margus will seek out as well.

Source: To preserve it for future generations, of course! So much of the Argonians' unique history has been lost. With your help, we can pull this antiquity out of the mud and share it with the world!\n\nDiscovery! Adventure! What could be better?
Target: To preserve it for future generations, of course! So much of the Argonians' unique history has been lost. With your help, we can pull this antiquity out of the mud and share it with the world!\n\nDiscovery! Adventure! What could be better?

Source: I think they're right. Aside from the word of the Hist—which I've learned is very persuasive—legends say that the Vakka-Bok Xanmeer holds a great treasure. It has to be the Remnant!\n\nNow, we should get moving, right? We've got to stop Kassandra!
Target: I think they're right. Aside from the word of the Hist—which I've learned is very persuasive—legends say that the Vakka-Bok Xanmeer holds a great treasure. It has to be the Remnant!\n\nNow, we should get moving, right? We've got to stop Kassandra!

Source: Go fetch … yes, go fetch Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn. I can only hold the Remnant. The three of you have a larger role to play. I'll explain when you get back.\n\nPlease, hurry. I … I can only bear the weight of it for a little while longer.
Target: Go fetch … yes, go fetch Xukas and Jaxsik-Orrn. I can only hold the Remnant. The three of you have a larger role to play. I'll explain when you get back.\n\nPlease, hurry. I … I can only bear the weight of it for a little while longer.

Source: Imperial documents from that era were often written in code. See if you can also find a cypher ring or the scrolls will be worthless to Tia. Then bring whatever you find back to me.
Target: Imperial documents from that era were often written in code. See if you can also find a cypher ring or the scrolls will be worthless to Tia. Then bring whatever you find back to me.

Source: I will lend my expertise in all things Dwemer. In exchange, you act as escort for our expedition. You may take the lion's share of any valuables, but the items of historical significance are mine.\n\nIs that agreeable to you?
Target: I will lend my expertise in all things Dwemer. In exchange, you act as escort for our expedition. You may take the lion's share of any valuables, but the items of historical significance are mine.\n\nIs that agreeable to you?

Source: You're catching on.\n\nIf you can get past the Blackguards and bring those texts back in one piece, there'll be a fair bit of gold in it for you.
Target: You're catching on.\n\nIf you can get past the Blackguards and bring those texts back in one piece, there'll be a fair bit of gold in it for you.

Source: You need to exchange the galvanic engine's used commutators with new ones. Replacements can be found within the factotums. Naturally we offer a reward for anyone who can complete this task.\n\nFor more information talk to <<1>>.
Target: You need to exchange the galvanic engine's used commutators with new ones. Replacements can be found within the factotums. Naturally we offer a reward for anyone who can complete this task.\n\nFor more information talk to <<1>>.

Source: Really? Well, if you got me some fresh ones from the Halls of Regulation that'd be a start, but they aren't much good like that. Salas has some trick to making them edible he keeps closely guarded.\n\nMaybe you could pilfer his secret recipe for me?
Target: Really? Well, if you got me some fresh ones from the Halls of Regulation that'd be a start, but they aren't much good like that. Salas has some trick to making them edible he keeps closely guarded.\n\nMaybe you could pilfer his secret recipe for me?

Source: Yes. A massive sea adder. It suns itself in the bay south of Sea Keep. Our navy won't be safe until it's dealt with.\n\nWorse, the ships it destroyed carried sensitive intelligence. I need you to search the shore and recover any logs you can.
Target: Yes. A massive sea adder. It suns itself in the bay south of Sea Keep. Our navy won't be safe until it's dealt with.\n\nWorse, the ships it destroyed carried sensitive intelligence. I need you to search the shore and recover any logs you can.

Source: Replacement water filters need to be taken from factotums and installed. Naturally the Clockwork Apostles will reward you for this most important of tasks.\n\nFor more information speak to <<1>>. She's leading all maintenance.
Target: Replacement water filters need to be taken from factotums and installed. Naturally the Clockwork Apostles will reward you for this most important of tasks.\n\nFor more information speak to <<1>>. She's leading all maintenance.

Source: The madness that erodes their minds seems to grant frightening power to their mechanical bodies. I can no longer keep them calm and stable, nor do I have the power to overcome them, should they escape this sanctum.\n\nI pray Seht will grant an answer.
Target: The madness that erodes their minds seems to grant frightening power to their mechanical bodies. I can no longer keep them calm and stable, nor do I have the power to overcome them, should they escape this sanctum.\n\nI pray Seht will grant an answer.

Source: Ask some questions. Determine the mood in Shimmerene and see how the newcomers are faring.\n\nRumors have reached the Queen and she is concerned. So Razum-dar comes to see what is happening and fights strange creatures. Now Raz is concerned as well.
Target: Ask some questions. Determine the mood in Shimmerene and see how the newcomers are faring.\n\nRumors have reached the Queen and she is concerned. So Razum-dar comes to see what is happening and fights strange creatures. Now Raz is concerned as well.

Source: <It looks like the brassilisk emerged from the nearby pipeline, which likely leads to the Brass Fortress.>
Target: <It looks like the brassilisk emerged from the nearby pipeline, which likely leads to the Brass Fortress.>

Source: The Court's honor is at stake! They treat us like lowly pigeons even though we are sleek and beautiful. Well, let us show them dirty!\n\nBring me their tools of grooming and cleaning, then we'll see how they like it when their feathers turn dull.
Target: The Court's honor is at stake! They treat us like lowly pigeons even though we are sleek and beautiful. Well, let us show them dirty!\n\nBring me their tools of grooming and cleaning, then we'll see how they like it when their feathers turn dull.

Source: Only what's right. If the featherless curs won't share, then the Court will teach them some manners!\n\nBring me their toys and their games, their frivolous trinkets. Then the Court will bask in leisure while they become bored to tears.
Target: Only what's right. If the featherless curs won't share, then the Court will teach them some manners!\n\nBring me their toys and their games, their frivolous trinkets. Then the Court will bask in leisure while they become bored to tears.

Source: I knew the Court could count on you! You always were my favorite of all the featherless curs.\n\nI'm feeling bold! Brazen, even. I desire ornate and heavy armor from far off lands. Bring me these things and I'll reward you in kind.
Target: I knew the Court could count on you! You always were my favorite of all the featherless curs.\n\nI'm feeling bold! Brazen, even. I desire ornate and heavy armor from far off lands. Bring me these things and I'll reward you in kind.

Source: I opened a portal, but I can't recall where it went. Something intentionally blocked the destination from my sight. I entered the portal and time passed. Then I was back in the cave and the Heart was gone.\n\nWill you accompany me to the Dreaming Cave?
Target: I opened a portal, but I can't recall where it went. Something intentionally blocked the destination from my sight. I entered the portal and time passed. Then I was back in the cave and the Heart was gone.\n\nWill you accompany me to the Dreaming Cave?

Source: Your hands, crow-friend! Our wings lack such ugly but useful appendages!\n\nNow listen well. Plunder armor of the heaviest sort. Robust pieces that make a statement! Impractical things, but pretty when polished and shined. Yes, bring such items to me!
Target: Your hands, crow-friend! Our wings lack such ugly but useful appendages!\n\nNow listen well. Plunder armor of the heaviest sort. Robust pieces that make a statement! Impractical things, but pretty when polished and shined. Yes, bring such items to me!

Source: We're about to enter a crucial stage of the augury ritual, so none of us can leave this chamber. If you could find my acolyte, Oriandra, she'll provide you with the amplification elixir we require.\n\nShe's in Sotha Sil's study, upstairs.
Target: We're about to enter a crucial stage of the augury ritual, so none of us can leave this chamber. If you could find my acolyte, Oriandra, she'll provide you with the amplification elixir we require.\n\nShe's in Sotha Sil's study, upstairs.

Source:
"Perhaps you will know, one day soon. On that day, seek out the fine-looking Khajiiit by the bridge to <<1>> and I'll trade curiosity for coin."

"Your new friend,"
"—Razum-dar"
Target: \\"Perhaps you will know
column4: one day soon. On that day
column5: seek out the fine-looking Khajiiit by the bridge to <<1>> and I'll trade curiosity for coin.\"\"\n\n\"\"Your new friend

Source: He's a pacifist, for Mara's sake!\n\nThe Sapiarchs' investigation was a joke. They just took Emile at his word and handed down the sentence. Of course, the local Guild Magister rolled over like she always does. Coward. Please, I need your help.
Target: He's a pacifist, for Mara's sake!\n\nThe Sapiarchs' investigation was a joke. They just took Emile at his word and handed down the sentence. Of course, the local Guild Magister rolled over like she always does. Coward. Please, I need your help.

Source: It drove my classmates mad! They were all quite sane before, but now they seem possessed by characters from novels and storybooks. They're snorting like pigs, running from cats … it's lunacy!\n\nI have some ideas on how to fix this, but I need help.
Target: It drove my classmates mad! They were all quite sane before, but now they seem possessed by characters from novels and storybooks. They're snorting like pigs, running from cats … it's lunacy!\n\nI have some ideas on how to fix this, but I need help.

Source: No. He vanished! They say he escaped. Can you believe it? Why would he turn himself in only to escape a few hours later? They're hiding something, I know it!\n\nPlease, ceruval, help me find my boy. He would never hurt anyone, I swear it!
Target: No. He vanished! They say he escaped. Can you believe it? Why would he turn himself in only to escape a few hours later? They're hiding something, I know it!\n\nPlease, ceruval, help me find my boy. He would never hurt anyone, I swear it!

Source: I suspect that the language is ancient. It may actually predate the languages of Tamriel. I feel that the memory is connected to the barrier in the Dreaming Cave and where I hid the Heart.\n\nMy friend, we need to discover the meaning of these words.
Target: I suspect that the language is ancient. It may actually predate the languages of Tamriel. I feel that the memory is connected to the barrier in the Dreaming Cave and where I hid the Heart.\n\nMy friend, we need to discover the meaning of these words.

Source: I fear he's already signed up, and that's why I require you as an ally. I'll need you to infiltrate the acting troupe. Larydel—my brother—knows my face, but he does not know yours. \n\nYou must find him for me so I can talk him out of this!
Target: I fear he's already signed up, and that's why I require you as an ally. I'll need you to infiltrate the acting troupe. Larydel—my brother—knows my face, but he does not know yours. \n\nYou must find him for me so I can talk him out of this!

Source: Please visit the throne of the king at the heart of sun-drenched Sentinel. Your audience would do him well in this time of great need.
Target: Please visit the throne of the king at the heart of sun-drenched Sentinel. Your audience would do him well in this time of great need.

Source: Travelers become lost, sometimes for days. From what I heard, the forest appears to … shift as you move through it. We'll need to keep close together.\n\nSo? Want to help me unlock an ancient mystery? I must say, I do pay well.
Target: Travelers become lost, sometimes for days. From what I heard, the forest appears to … shift as you move through it. We'll need to keep close together.\n\nSo? Want to help me unlock an ancient mystery? I must say, I do pay well.

Source: My brother Gendyn oversees the forge at Artisans Craftworks. It's the largest smithy in Mournhold! He promised me he'd take care of my order personally, but something must have gone wrong.\n\nCould you deliver this letter to my brother in Mournhold?
Target: My brother Gendyn oversees the forge at Artisans Craftworks. It's the largest smithy in Mournhold! He promised me he'd take care of my order personally, but something must have gone wrong.\n\nCould you deliver this letter to my brother in Mournhold?

Source: That would certainly help. At the very least, we need to know whether the Redguards really mean to attack.\n\nDon't go straight to Sir Hughes though. Look for Dame Falhut at the castle's main gate. Get the lay of the land. They may need your help.
Target: That would certainly help. At the very least, we need to know whether the Redguards really mean to attack.\n\nDon't go straight to Sir Hughes though. Look for Dame Falhut at the castle's main gate. Get the lay of the land. They may need your help.

Source: We don't exactly see eye-to-eye when it comes to hunting baddies. So now they're going to spend weeks questioning soldiers and measuring footprints while more people get turned to jerky.\n\nActually, maybe you could help me with that?
Target: We don't exactly see eye-to-eye when it comes to hunting baddies. So now they're going to spend weeks questioning soldiers and measuring footprints while more people get turned to jerky.\n\nActually, maybe you could help me with that?

Source: Yes. It is really just a formality. Very few even know the Staff of Magnus is in the city, but the queen wants to make sure the guard is doing its job.\n\nGo to Marbruk and seek our Captain Sarandil. He will be expecting you.
Target: Yes. It is really just a formality. Very few even know the Staff of Magnus is in the city, but the queen wants to make sure the guard is doing its job.\n\nGo to Marbruk and seek our Captain Sarandil. He will be expecting you.

Source: Some folk say she was an innocent girl, buried alive by an evil sister. Others say she was a necromancer, put to the sword. Who knows?\n\nIf you manage to run her off, you'll be doing all of Summerset a favor. Just don't expect us to go in after you.
Target: Some folk say she was an innocent girl, buried alive by an evil sister. Others say she was a necromancer, put to the sword. Who knows?\n\nIf you manage to run her off, you'll be doing all of Summerset a favor. Just don't expect us to go in after you.

Source: In the belly of a dragon? Lost in some hollow? You never know with the Undaunted. We had agreed to meet here, at this tower in Craglorn, but we are easily distracted. Brave and adventurous, but easily distracted.\n\nMaybe Brulo found a tavern.
Target: In the belly of a dragon? Lost in some hollow? You never know with the Undaunted. We had agreed to meet here, at this tower in Craglorn, but we are easily distracted. Brave and adventurous, but easily distracted.\n\nMaybe Brulo found a tavern.

Source: Lotus has only ever known kindness. Gentle as a lamb. I hand reared her from birth.\n\nShe fled in the chaos, but she won't make it on her own. I have to find Lotus before she's hurt … or worse.
Target: Lotus has only ever known kindness. Gentle as a lamb. I hand reared her from birth.\n\nShe fled in the chaos, but she won't make it on her own. I have to find Lotus before she's hurt … or worse.

Source: Something about the Red Rooks and the Bloodthorns. The Provost can tell you more, if you're really that interested.\n\nNow get out of here before you bring the entire bandit gang down on my head.
Target: Something about the Red Rooks and the Bloodthorns. The Provost can tell you more, if you're really that interested.\n\nNow get out of here before you bring the entire bandit gang down on my head.

Source: Well, if Wuuthrad was really shattered, we need to search for the shards, but we also need to find a way to stop the Worms.\n\nMy master is Elfriede. She wants you to seek her out at Honrich Tower to the west. The Worm Cult's leader is near there.
Target: Well, if Wuuthrad was really shattered, we need to search for the shards, but we also need to find a way to stop the Worms.\n\nMy master is Elfriede. She wants you to seek her out at Honrich Tower to the west. The Worm Cult's leader is near there.

Source: Andewen should have known better. An Altmer fights for glory, not coin. Crawling through the muck, just to find some insignificant little temple? Simply outrageous.\n\nSo, are we agreed? You'll take this off my hands?
Target: Andewen should have known better. An Altmer fights for glory, not coin. Crawling through the muck, just to find some insignificant little temple? Simply outrageous.\n\nSo, are we agreed? You'll take this off my hands?

Source: You should still head over to the Eastern Elsweyr gate. To skip training, you need to talk to Grand Warlord Sorcalin over there.
Target: You should still head over to the Eastern Elsweyr gate. To skip training, you need to talk to Grand Warlord Sorcalin over there.

Source: We also need to convince Sotha Sil to share the news he brought with us. But without the Ritemaster, he may decide to simply depart. Like all the members of the Dark Elf Tribunal, he can be very enigmatic.\n\nMaybe you should talk to him.
Target: We also need to convince Sotha Sil to share the news he brought with us. But without the Ritemaster, he may decide to simply depart. Like all the members of the Dark Elf Tribunal, he can be very enigmatic.\n\nMaybe you should talk to him.

Source: You are the best judge of that. Even so, the Southern High Rock gate should be your destination. Once there, speak with Grand Warlord Dortene if you wish to bypass training.
Target: You are the best judge of that. Even so, the Southern High Rock gate should be your destination. Once there, speak with Grand Warlord Dortene if you wish to bypass training.

Source: Both decided to return? I'm surprised. Meridia's knight has a stake in this, but why would Leythen volunteer to return? It makes no sense.\n\nWell, go and talk to Sotha Sil. Perhaps he can shed light on what we can expect in the Crystal Tower.
Target: Both decided to return? I'm surprised. Meridia's knight has a stake in this, but why would Leythen volunteer to return? It makes no sense.\n\nWell, go and talk to Sotha Sil. Perhaps he can shed light on what we can expect in the Crystal Tower.

Source: Sarvith, our Master of Incunabula, hopes to evoke a vision that shows us the events surrounding Faolchu's first death. \n\nWe're collecting historic artifacts to use as focus objects, but the spirits are making our task difficult.
Target: Sarvith, our Master of Incunabula, hopes to evoke a vision that shows us the events surrounding Faolchu's first death. \n\nWe're collecting historic artifacts to use as focus objects, but the spirits are making our task difficult.

Source: If you are not the storm-tossed leaf I assumed, still you should travel to the Northern Morrowind gate. Speak with Grand Warlord Zimmeron there; he can excuse you from training.
Target: If you are not the storm-tossed leaf I assumed, still you should travel to the Northern Morrowind gate. Speak with Grand Warlord Zimmeron there; he can excuse you from training.

Source: The scroll on this altar says something about it. I think you have to use the prayer wheel by the door.\n\nOnce you open the way, I'll show you where the others went. I can't help much, but I'll do what I can.
Target: The scroll on this altar says something about it. I think you have to use the prayer wheel by the door.\n\nOnce you open the way, I'll show you where the others went. I can't help much, but I'll do what I can.

Source: We need to find a way inside. To the core. But getting in will require an unprecedented amount of magical energy.
Target: We need to find a way inside. To the core. But getting in will require an unprecedented amount of magical energy.

Source: Good question. I found this memory stone in the grand reliquary. It's called the Eye of Remembrance. Using it near the library pedestals here might show us why these ruins were sealed.\n\nYou look stronger than most. How about you lend me a hand?
Target: Good question. I found this memory stone in the grand reliquary. It's called the Eye of Remembrance. Using it near the library pedestals here might show us why these ruins were sealed.\n\nYou look stronger than most. How about you lend me a hand?

Source: I don't know. Some kind of spell? I'm no mage, just a butcher with a shop in the market square.\n\nMinerva Lauzon's the only mage in the city that isn't madder than an Elf on Hist sap. She's in the sewerworks, helping the survivors escape.
Target: I don't know. Some kind of spell? I'm no mage, just a butcher with a shop in the market square.\n\nMinerva Lauzon's the only mage in the city that isn't madder than an Elf on Hist sap. She's in the sewerworks, helping the survivors escape.

Source: I need someone to improve the reputation of my properties. A hero type who people look up to. And I have a feeling about you. You've done something great, and are probably on the way to do something greater.\n\nSeems like we can help each other here.
Target: I need someone to improve the reputation of my properties. A hero type who people look up to. And I have a feeling about you. You've done something great, and are probably on the way to do something greater.\n\nSeems like we can help each other here.

Source: It's no natural formation. The Sea Elves are conjuring it. If I could get within striking distance of their Sea Mage, I could break his hold on the storm and prevent the destruction to come … but that's a desperate hope for one Mer.
Target: It's no natural formation. The Sea Elves are conjuring it. If I could get within striking distance of their Sea Mage, I could break his hold on the storm and prevent the destruction to come … but that's a desperate hope for one Mer.

Source: Reagents! Ingredients! Naturally, of course. I require that you gather the supplies needed to make the vivid paint this masterwork requires.\n\nJust take this list. Oh, and this tea of course. You'll need it to acquire the first item. Now, hurry along.
Target: Reagents! Ingredients! Naturally, of course. I require that you gather the supplies needed to make the vivid paint this masterwork requires.\n\nJust take this list. Oh, and this tea of course. You'll need it to acquire the first item. Now, hurry along.

Source: Meet me in the main gallery. We can consult with the rest of the Conclave and use the scrying pool to continue our probe of the pearl.\n\nAs much as this situation concerns me, I must admit, I somewhat enjoy being in the middle of the action again.
Target: Meet me in the main gallery. We can consult with the rest of the Conclave and use the scrying pool to continue our probe of the pearl.\n\nAs much as this situation concerns me, I must admit, I somewhat enjoy being in the middle of the action again.

Source: Oh, right. She's upstairs in her study—those two men, Kelmen and Titus, are with her.\n\nI guess she wanted to meet in private. But she said it was very important that you be there.
Target: Oh, right. She's upstairs in her study—those two men, Kelmen and Titus, are with her.\n\nI guess she wanted to meet in private. But she said it was very important that you be there.

Source: That's what I need you to learn.\n\nA conjurer named Kelmen Locke was present when the atronachs were first summoned. When they turned, his fellow summoners were killed. He was the only one to escape, and I fear he is in grave danger.
Target: That's what I need you to learn.\n\nA conjurer named Kelmen Locke was present when the atronachs were first summoned. When they turned, his fellow summoners were killed. He was the only one to escape, and I fear he is in grave danger.

Source: You would take on the duties of the admanen, the listening eye. An auspicious role! The admanen serves as the fulcrum, balancing competing theories. They also collect evidence, interview suspects, and the like.\n\nWhat do you say?
Target: You would take on the duties of the admanen, the listening eye. An auspicious role! The admanen serves as the fulcrum, balancing competing theories. They also collect evidence, interview suspects, and the like.\n\nWhat do you say?

Source: Exactly so! And you'll be the one to help us collect them again, hopefully before anyone comes to harm. Why, these items could cause all sorts of mischief.\n\nFirst though, let's have you read the Psijic Codex. That should help bring you up to speed.
Target: Exactly so! And you'll be the one to help us collect them again, hopefully before anyone comes to harm. Why, these items could cause all sorts of mischief.\n\nFirst though, let's have you read the Psijic Codex. That should help bring you up to speed.

Source: You may call me Nhalan. I was a priest of the cult of the stars in this city when it came under attack by Yokudans from across the sea.\n\nIt was then that we made our unholy bargain: we forsook the stars and pledged ourselves to the Nereids, to Shada.
Target: You may call me Nhalan. I was a priest of the cult of the stars in this city when it came under attack by Yokudans from across the sea.\n\nIt was then that we made our unholy bargain: we forsook the stars and pledged ourselves to the Nereids, to Shada.

Source: High Elves who were cast out from their families as children. A horrible fate in our society.\n\nSummerset may appear as perfect as a pastoral painting, but darkness lies backstage. I want to face our taboos without blinking. Will you help me?
Target: High Elves who were cast out from their families as children. A horrible fate in our society.\n\nSummerset may appear as perfect as a pastoral painting, but darkness lies backstage. I want to face our taboos without blinking. Will you help me?

Source: Well, she's certainly missing, and I'm not risking my scaly hide going in to find her. \n\nHmm. You look scrappy enough. If you can grab those tokens and what's left of my apprentice, I'll make it worth your while. What do you say?
Target: Well, she's certainly missing, and I'm not risking my scaly hide going in to find her. \n\nHmm. You look scrappy enough. If you can grab those tokens and what's left of my apprentice, I'll make it worth your while. What do you say?

Source: I had sellswords with me. They charged through the Gate, but I was attacked by Daedra. I … don't know if anyone survived. I fled.\n\nIf you'll help, give me another chance at this, I don't care what it costs—I'm going through that portal.
Target: I had sellswords with me. They charged through the Gate, but I was attacked by Daedra. I … don't know if anyone survived. I fled.\n\nIf you'll help, give me another chance at this, I don't care what it costs—I'm going through that portal.

Source: I sent Valsirenn to Lillandril, where the College of Sapiarchs is located, to scout the area and see if the Court of Bedlam has made any moves against them.\n\nI need you to travel to Alinor to secure the Proxy Queen's permission to enter the College.
Target: I sent Valsirenn to Lillandril, where the College of Sapiarchs is located, to scout the area and see if the Court of Bedlam has made any moves against them.\n\nI need you to travel to Alinor to secure the Proxy Queen's permission to enter the College.

Source: They're research for Mehdze's recital at the Illumination Academy. I've been transcribing them for weeks.\n\nThe Goblins tossed them all over—not big readers, I guess—but this tribe is bigger than I thought.
Target: They're research for Mehdze's recital at the Illumination Academy. I've been transcribing them for weeks.\n\nThe Goblins tossed them all over—not big readers, I guess—but this tribe is bigger than I thought.

Source: In truth, I only wish to attend to check on Tableau. Her invitation came with a note, outlining concerns for her safety. \n\nCould you perhaps … go in and check on her? Make sure things run smoothly? It would mean a good deal to me if you would.
Target: In truth, I only wish to attend to check on Tableau. Her invitation came with a note, outlining concerns for her safety. \n\nCould you perhaps … go in and check on her? Make sure things run smoothly? It would mean a good deal to me if you would.

Source: These tall, skinny Elves, they have so many rules! Did you know Queen Ayrenn isn't even on Summerset? And to get an audience with her Proxy Queen requires some sort of proper introduction.\n\nVindilween won't let me set foot in the palace without one.
Target: These tall, skinny Elves, they have so many rules! Did you know Queen Ayrenn isn't even on Summerset? And to get an audience with her Proxy Queen requires some sort of proper introduction.\n\nVindilween won't let me set foot in the palace without one.

Source: The item we were ordered to transport. It's tied to the yaghra, mysterious creatures that keep attacking our shores. \n\nWe have no idea what devastation the pearl's capable of, but we can't allow it to be used to dark ends. It must be destroyed.
Target: The item we were ordered to transport. It's tied to the yaghra, mysterious creatures that keep attacking our shores. \n\nWe have no idea what devastation the pearl's capable of, but we can't allow it to be used to dark ends. It must be destroyed.

Source: I'll find her, Elder.
Target: I'll find her, Elder.

Source: They've stood quiet for decades. But now? New, yawning sinkholes. Eerie sounds at night. I don't jump at shadows, but missing people? That's a warning I can heed. \n\nIf you head down there, take a look around for our friends. Will you?
Target: They've stood quiet for decades. But now? New, yawning sinkholes. Eerie sounds at night. I don't jump at shadows, but missing people? That's a warning I can heed. \n\nIf you head down there, take a look around for our friends. Will you?

Source: So many! Held for torture, for parts. For amusement. You can't hear the screams from up here, but I assure you they are uttered.
Target: So many! Held for torture, for parts. For amusement. You can't hear the screams from up here, but I assure you they are uttered.

Source: Certainly not risk my life, if that's what your implying.\n\nYou know, you have the look of a ruffian. Want to take on the task? If you collect Niralin, or at least what's left of her, I'll make sure you're paid handsomely.
Target: Certainly not risk my life, if that's what your implying.\n\nYou know, you have the look of a ruffian. Want to take on the task? If you collect Niralin, or at least what's left of her, I'll make sure you're paid handsomely.

Source: Very well, I'll go after the Dreadlord.
Target: Very well, I'll go after the Dreadlord.

Source: Destroy the Maormer's supplies, gathered along the shore. Rescue any citizen you find captured. And free Sunnawel, a gryphon, from capture. She's not only the city's symbol, she's also the best weapon we have at our disposal.\n\nWill you help?
Target: Destroy the Maormer's supplies, gathered along the shore. Rescue any citizen you find captured. And free Sunnawel, a gryphon, from capture. She's not only the city's symbol, she's also the best weapon we have at our disposal.\n\nWill you help?

Source: I'm probably over-concerned. The weather's been fair and the winds mild. Perhaps their fishing has been so fruitful they dare not waste their good fortune, but I'd feel better if I knew what to make of their delay.
Target: I'm probably over-concerned. The weather's been fair and the winds mild. Perhaps their fishing has been so fruitful they dare not waste their good fortune, but I'd feel better if I knew what to make of their delay.

Source: Of course. Hang on a moment while I let you out.
Target: Of course. Hang on a moment while I let you out.

Source: Im on it!
Target: Im on it!

Source: Sure. Let me help you out.
Target: Sure. Let me help you out.

Source: How in Oblivion would I know? These Elves have rules for everything—how to eat, how to sleep …. Of course they've got rules about how to beat each other up.\n\nSay, you wouldn't be interested in helping me figure this out would you?
Target: How in Oblivion would I know? These Elves have rules for everything—how to eat, how to sleep …. Of course they've got rules about how to beat each other up.\n\nSay, you wouldn't be interested in helping me figure this out would you?

Source: Sure, let me just get this open.
Target: Sure, let me just get this open.

Source: Defeating a Dragon Priest is no small feat, but why not challenge yourself a little more?\n\nOnce you've dealt with the petty creatures and cultists, invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle to call forth Zaan the Scalecaller in all her terrible might.
Target: Defeating a Dragon Priest is no small feat, but why not challenge yourself a little more?\n\nOnce you've dealt with the petty creatures and cultists, invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle to call forth Zaan the Scalecaller in all her terrible might.

Source: Sounds like Orryn the Black is summoning something nasty. I say let him. Better yet, read his notes and help make it the meanest stack of bones to take up walking. Then grind them both to dust.\n\nThat'll prove who's the real Undaunted here.
Target: Sounds like Orryn the Black is summoning something nasty. I say let him. Better yet, read his notes and help make it the meanest stack of bones to take up walking. Then grind them both to dust.\n\nThat'll prove who's the real Undaunted here.

Source: No. They're assuredly dead. King's Haven Pass is very dangerous, teeming with goblins and gryphons, but the cult considers the pilgrimage a test of faith. \n\nRecovering their articles would be viewed favorably by the religious authorities.
Target: No. They're assuredly dead. King's Haven Pass is very dangerous, teeming with goblins and gryphons, but the cult considers the pilgrimage a test of faith. \n\nRecovering their articles would be viewed favorably by the religious authorities.

Source: We've already seen the devastation that's possible when the tower falls into the wrong hands. And the recent attack by Nocturnal only reinforces the need for greater protection.\n\nI want you there to help plead our case. Will you join us?
Target: We've already seen the devastation that's possible when the tower falls into the wrong hands. And the recent attack by Nocturnal only reinforces the need for greater protection.\n\nI want you there to help plead our case. Will you join us?

Source: Something awakened in the Citadel—or took residence. We Undaunted decided to find out what, and I still mean to. Whatever it is, it's fierce. Undaunted don't just disappear.\n\nI came here searching for anyone else willing to go.
Target: Something awakened in the Citadel—or took residence. We Undaunted decided to find out what, and I still mean to. Whatever it is, it's fierce. Undaunted don't just disappear.\n\nI came here searching for anyone else willing to go.

Source: We've gotten some troubling reports of the Daedra creating cocoons. There's dozens of them now, spreading throughout the cave. We need you to destroy them.\n\nOh, and burn any sacrilegious text you find. No need for that material to remain.
Target: We've gotten some troubling reports of the Daedra creating cocoons. There's dozens of them now, spreading throughout the cave. We need you to destroy them.\n\nOh, and burn any sacrilegious text you find. No need for that material to remain.

Source: They're asking the Star-Gazers to help them put the pieces back together or some such nonsense. Even offered to let me touch some strange relic to see the truth.\n\nBut let me tell you, nothing good has ever come from touching strange relics.
Target: They're asking the Star-Gazers to help them put the pieces back together or some such nonsense. Even offered to let me touch some strange relic to see the truth.\n\nBut let me tell you, nothing good has ever come from touching strange relics.

Source: I'm afraid that Archon's Grove has been recently taken over by a pack of werewolves. Most dreadful, but the Divine Prosecution cannot reassign resources to manage the outbreak. You'll have to go in alone.\n\nAre you willing to take on this assignment?
Target: I'm afraid that Archon's Grove has been recently taken over by a pack of werewolves. Most dreadful, but the Divine Prosecution cannot reassign resources to manage the outbreak. You'll have to go in alone.\n\nAre you willing to take on this assignment?

Source: I'll bear that in mind.
Target: I'll bear that in mind.

Source: They've stolen many valuable relics, and we need you to recover them.\n \nWe also wish to keep tabs on their movements. I suspect most of the Sagacians have written plans on their person. Collect those plans using any means necessary.
Target: They've stolen many valuable relics, and we need you to recover them.\n \nWe also wish to keep tabs on their movements. I suspect most of the Sagacians have written plans on their person. Collect those plans using any means necessary.

Source: She's in Stros M'Kai, adding to her crew. The ship's got enough sailors to keep her afloat, but that's about it.\n\nIf you want to lend a hand, talk to our boatswain, <<1>>. He's on deck.
Target: She's in Stros M'Kai, adding to her crew. The ship's got enough sailors to keep her afloat, but that's about it.\n\nIf you want to lend a hand, talk to our boatswain, <<1>>. He's on deck.

Source: I will do this for you.
Target: I will do this for you.

Source: Renzir's most precious treasure is his wife, sweet Nubani. Last he saw, she was near our ship. This one suspects she has cleverly hidden herself, but will need help to escape.\n\nDo all this, and Renzir will make sure you are rewarded.
Target: Renzir's most precious treasure is his wife, sweet Nubani. Last he saw, she was near our ship. This one suspects she has cleverly hidden herself, but will need help to escape.\n\nDo all this, and Renzir will make sure you are rewarded.

Source: Squeamish? How disappointing.\n\nBut our interests are aligned. The Scaled Court threatens all of Craglorn. If my acolytes lend them their considerable power, the task of defeating the cult becomes that much harder. Kill them for me and we both win.
Target: Squeamish? How disappointing.\n\nBut our interests are aligned. The Scaled Court threatens all of Craglorn. If my acolytes lend them their considerable power, the task of defeating the cult becomes that much harder. Kill them for me and we both win.

Source: Yes, indeed! The Sea Elves regularly goad their nasty pets into our water ways. If left unchecked they'll devastate the local fauna and move on to do it all again.\n\nWe need to root out these nests before the vipers spread to the mainland coast.
Target: Yes, indeed! The Sea Elves regularly goad their nasty pets into our water ways. If left unchecked they'll devastate the local fauna and move on to do it all again.\n\nWe need to root out these nests before the vipers spread to the mainland coast.

Source: In the belly of a dragon? Lost in some hollow? You never know with the Undaunted. The title for first at the top is still up for grabs. You know, if you live that long.
Target: In the belly of a dragon? Lost in some hollow? You never know with the Undaunted. The title for first at the top is still up for grabs. You know, if you live that long.

Source: No, no. A colleague of mine, Esulo, has already seen to that. He just needs some help ensuring the books are safely removed from Summerset.\n\nYou'll find him in Golden Gryphon—at the bar, no doubt.
Target: No, no. A colleague of mine, Esulo, has already seen to that. He just needs some help ensuring the books are safely removed from Summerset.\n\nYou'll find him in Golden Gryphon—at the bar, no doubt.

Source: That's generous of you, though I hope you know what you offer.\n\nNerien'eth is more powerful than any lich I've ever encountered. If you're going to help, we should head to his study. He controls these Crypts, and I'll wager that's where he'll be.
Target: That's generous of you, though I hope you know what you offer.\n\nNerien'eth is more powerful than any lich I've ever encountered. If you're going to help, we should head to his study. He controls these Crypts, and I'll wager that's where he'll be.

Source: Leave it to me.
Target: Leave it to me.

Source: I sent a group of adventurers and a squad of marines to investigate the Sea Sload threat. After an initial report about a promising lead, they sent no further word.\n\nCainar, Grog, and Miriya seem capable enough, but their silence has me concerned.
Target: I sent a group of adventurers and a squad of marines to investigate the Sea Sload threat. After an initial report about a promising lead, they sent no further word.\n\nCainar, Grog, and Miriya seem capable enough, but their silence has me concerned.

Source: I can tell you that the Battlereeve sent three adventurers and a squad of marines to determine the extent of the problem. After an initial report, contact with the group was lost.\n\nWhat the Battlereeve will ask of you, well, that's for her to impart.
Target: I can tell you that the Battlereeve sent three adventurers and a squad of marines to determine the extent of the problem. After an initial report, contact with the group was lost.\n\nWhat the Battlereeve will ask of you, well, that's for her to impart.

Source: Very well.
Target: Very well.

Source: He was headed to <<1>>, an old fort on <<2>>.\n\nMy ship won't return there for some time, but a boatswain on the far dock can take you. Look for <<3>>.
Target: He was headed to <<1>>, an old fort on <<2>>.\n\nMy ship won't return there for some time, but a boatswain on the far dock can take you. Look for <<3>>.

Source: I sent a group of adventurers and a squad of marines to investigate the threat. They reported in. Said they were exploring a promising lead. That was the last I heard.\n\nCainar, Grog, and Miriya seem capable enough, but I'm concerned for their safety.
Target: I sent a group of adventurers and a squad of marines to investigate the threat. They reported in. Said they were exploring a promising lead. That was the last I heard.\n\nCainar, Grog, and Miriya seem capable enough, but I'm concerned for their safety.

Source: Someone named Rana needs aid on Bleakrock. She asked for volunteers, but we've our own problems in <<1>>. No one signed up.\n\nHer boatswain <<2>> is down by the docks if you want to ask about it. Or you can stay here. Either choice means danger.
Target: Someone named Rana needs aid on Bleakrock. She asked for volunteers, but we've our own problems in <<1>>. No one signed up.\n\nHer boatswain <<2>> is down by the docks if you want to ask about it. Or you can stay here. Either choice means danger.

Source: I'm ready to compete.
Target: I'm ready to compete.

Source: I will find the crystal fragments.
Target: I will find the crystal fragments.

Source: I understand.
Target: I understand.

Source: I'm ready.
Target: I'm ready.

Source: I'll take care of it.
Target: I'll take care of it.

Source: I'll get those caves closed, Sergeant.
Target: I'll get those caves closed, Sergeant.

Source: Thank you, Walks-in-Ash.
Target: Thank you, Walks-in-Ash.

Source: Let's find Nervyna. I'll go in first.
Target: Let's find Nervyna. I'll go in first.

Source: I'll meet <<1>> in <<2>>.
Target: I'll meet <<1>> in <<2>>.

Source: You too. I'll make for Vivec's Antlers.
Target: You too. I'll make for Vivec's Antlers.

Source: I understand.
Target: I understand.

Source: I'll do it.
Target: I'll do it.

Source: I'll deliver the letter.
Target: I'll deliver the letter.

Source: I'll see what I can find out.
Target: I'll see what I can find out.

Source: I should take the letter and confront Fadeel.
Target: I should take the letter and confront Fadeel.

Source: I'll get started.
Target: I'll get started.

Source: I'll deliver your fertilizer.
Target: I'll deliver your fertilizer.

Source: Then let me look into it.
Target: Then let me look into it.

Source: A vision of the future. A future where that spirit escapes these caverns and runs rampant across the continent. I saw the cities of Tamriel, shattered and over-grown.\n\nThat spirit wants us dead—Men, Mer, Khajiit. It doesn't give a damn.
Target: A vision of the future. A future where that spirit escapes these caverns and runs rampant across the continent. I saw the cities of Tamriel, shattered and over-grown.\n\nThat spirit wants us dead—Men, Mer, Khajiit. It doesn't give a damn.

Source: I'll see if I can find him.
Target: I'll see if I can find him.

Source: I'll see what I can do.
Target: I'll see what I can do.

Source: I'll see what I can do.
Target: I'll see what I can do.

Source: I'll see if I can find him.
Target: I'll see if I can find him.

Source: I can take word to your wife.
Target: I can take word to your wife.

Source: It understands! The Scaled Court invades our valley. Tricks our chief with false promises. And it's all because of the liar, Agganor! \n\nBurn their standards. Kill Agganor and mount his helmet on a pike. Do this, little goat, and the stones will sing!
Target: It understands! The Scaled Court invades our valley. Tricks our chief with false promises. And it's all because of the liar, Agganor! \n\nBurn their standards. Kill Agganor and mount his helmet on a pike. Do this, little goat, and the stones will sing!

Source: Into the Valley of Scars, but they may as well have gone to Secunda. The valley's a fortress. Still, you look tougher than a five-legged wamasu.\n\nSave my guards if you can. If you can't, bring back something we can give to their families.
Target: Into the Valley of Scars, but they may as well have gone to Secunda. The valley's a fortress. Still, you look tougher than a five-legged wamasu.\n\nSave my guards if you can. If you can't, bring back something we can give to their families.

Source: <Take <<1>>'s token.>
Target: <Take <<1>>'s token.>

Source: Maybe I can help.
Target: Maybe I can help.

Source: I'll bring any medallions I find to you.
Target: I'll bring any medallions I find to you.

Source: Auriel must guide your steps for you to return today.  I … accept your offer.\n\nNerien'eth is more powerful than I have ever known him to be. If we're to contest with him, we should go to his study up ahead—it's where he'll be.
Target: Auriel must guide your steps for you to return today.  I … accept your offer.\n\nNerien'eth is more powerful than I have ever known him to be. If we're to contest with him, we should go to his study up ahead—it's where he'll be.

Target: Done. I'll return shortly.

Target: All right. I'll help you disrupt the wards.

Source: Sure, I'll tell him.

Source: Destroy the geysers. Find them and obliterate them as quickly as you can.\n\nYou'll need to fight through the creatures spawned by the geysers, so bring allies with you if you can. And make sure to destroy the pearls. That's the source of the magic.

Source: Queen Ayrenn has departed for Hectahame with as many as we can spare. I have heard dark rumors that a lich has taken residence there, and is responsible for the strife in Greenshade.\n\nThe queen left me here in case you returned. Go to her. Aid her.

Source: What kind of help? The helpful kind, of course.\n\nI meant to arrive before evil invaded this hamlet. Find Constable Maldred and provide what help I could. But this one was detained and the constable is nowhere to be seen. Moira's Hope is lost.
Target: What kind of help? The helpful kind, of course.\n\nI meant to arrive before evil invaded this hamlet. Find Constable Maldred and provide what help I could. But this one was detained and the constable is nowhere to be seen. Moira's Hope is lost.

Source: I am the Daedric Prince of Dawn and Dusk, who weeps for <<1>>'s suffering. I am the Mother of the Rose, who sealed <<2>> away from your world. \n\nI am Azura, mortal. And I would have you end <<1>>'s endless torment.
Target: I am the Daedric Prince of Dawn and Dusk, who weeps for <<1>>'s suffering. I am the Mother of the Rose, who sealed <<2>> away from your world. \n\nI am Azura, mortal. And I would have you end <<1>>'s endless torment.

Source: She's the village's mayor. They say Kerbol can cure any disease, but once cured, you can never leave the village.\n\nI'm not sick, but my husband Draven is. And if we have to live in a hovel for the rest of our lives to save him, that's fine by me.
Target: She's the village's mayor. They say Kerbol can cure any disease, but once cured, you can never leave the village.\n\nI'm not sick, but my husband Draven is. And if we have to live in a hovel for the rest of our lives to save him, that's fine by me.

Source: There's an old ruin in the Lorkrata Hills, northeast of Shornhelm. Verandis said his research led him there and he needs your help.\n\nWhy he needs you when he has me, I'll never understand. But he is the master. As he constantly reminds me.
Target: There's an old ruin in the Lorkrata Hills, northeast of Shornhelm. Verandis said his research led him there and he needs your help.\n\nWhy he needs you when he has me, I'll never understand. But he is the master. As he constantly reminds me.

Source: Have you not seen? Colovians are everywhere! \n\nI'm busy gathering intel. If you can help, go find the Captain. Odreth is in the central tree.
Target: Have you not seen? Colovians are everywhere! \n\nI'm busy gathering intel. If you can help, go find the Captain. Odreth is in the central tree.

Source: "It seems a Redguard warrior named Ulbazar is believed to have died within the Crypt of Exiles. Ulbazar committed a blasphemous crime before fleeing from the Alik'r desert—he stole a precious Redguard artifact, the Memory Stone of Makela Leki."
Target: \\"It seems a Redguard warrior named Ulbazar is believed to have died within the Crypt of Exiles. Ulbazar committed a blasphemous crime before fleeing from the Alik'r desert—he stole a precious Redguard artifact

Source: No, it was the skeevers … of course it was the trolls!\n\nMe and a few others came down here looking for loot, but the trolls caught us. One by one they've eaten all my friends. They were saving me for dessert. Probably because I'm so sweet.
Target: No, it was the skeevers … of course it was the trolls!\n\nMe and a few others came down here looking for loot, but the trolls caught us. One by one they've eaten all my friends. They were saving me for dessert. Probably because I'm so sweet.

Source: Brackenleaf is one of the first trees of Grahtwood, planted by Y'ffre herself. \n\nBrackenleaf's Briars are sworn to protect Brackenleaf from an enemy called the Outsider and accept all who want to follow the path of the hunter.

Source: We're searching these caverns for a sacred shrine that's been lost for ages. Our problem is that dreugh and Goblins are overrunning the place. \n\nGoblins are slow-witted. If you kill their chieftain, they must accept you as their leader.
Target: We're searching these caverns for a sacred shrine that's been lost for ages. Our problem is that dreugh and Goblins are overrunning the place. \n\nGoblins are slow-witted. If you kill their chieftain, they must accept you as their leader.

Target: Eiman is inside this cave … somewhere.\n\nThe Frozen Man does all sorts of things to people who enter his domain. I can't leave Eiman in there. Since Father died and Mother left, he's all I have.

Target: With the collapse of the Empire, lawlessness rules Cyrodiil. Chief among the culprits are bandits called the Black Daggers. Sebazi holds contracts to thin their ranks. Are you interested?

Target: What do I regret? I regret everything. But most of all, I regret betraying Rosalind.\n\nBeyond lies Westtry. Or what remains of the place. This was my home. Until the day the Nords attacked and the curse fell upon us.

Source: Of course. I'm sure she'll be happy to see you.\n\nI didn't think about it before, but I suppose this means the Reachmen are no longer a threat to Evermore either.
Target: Of course. I'm sure she'll be happy to see you.\n\nI didn't think about it before, but I suppose this means the Reachmen are no longer a threat to Evermore either.

Source: Save our idiot clutch-brother, <<1>>. He came to this dismal village to work in the <<2>> mine. Now Goblins have seized it, and our brother's inside.\n\nA group of us came to rescue him. What were we thinking? We're not warriors.

Source: Giants attacked our village. Many villagers died in Lower Yorgrim at the hands of these degenerate giants.\n\nI gathered the few survivors I could find and fled to this fishing camp.
Target: Giants attacked our village. Many villagers died in Lower Yorgrim at the hands of these degenerate giants.\n\nI gathered the few survivors I could find and fled to this fishing camp.

Source: The terrible magic that infects these creatures. I've heard stories, but I've never seen it used. Reach magic.\n\nI don't know how this happened. Even the guardians of the Wyrd are silent. This is much worse than I originally imagined.
Target: The terrible magic that infects these creatures. I've heard stories, but I've never seen it used. Reach magic.\n\nI don't know how this happened. Even the guardians of the Wyrd are silent. This is much worse than I originally imagined.

Target: The king of the Wood Elves informs me there's some manner of discontent in <<1>>, our capital city.\n\nMeet with <<2>> and work to end the discord. Once local matters are in hand, I'll meet you in <<1>>.

Source: This honorable and—if I may say so—very sleek guard has mistaken me for a common sugar-thief! Please, help me clear up this misunderstanding.\n\nHush, <<1>>, if you don't have anything constructive to say, don't say anything.
Target: This honorable and—if I may say so—very sleek guard has mistaken me for a common sugar-thief! Please, help me clear up this misunderstanding.\n\nHush, <<1>>, if you don't have anything constructive to say, don't say anything.

"The work at Hozzin's goes slowly. Capture any villagers you find and bring them back to camp.

Source: No, I'm … I'm just very tired. Thanks to Shalidor, we were able to decipher the deeper ritual hidden within the tomes as a set. \n\nHe's ready and waiting. Together, you'll perform the ritual that will … hah. Perform. Like a dancing midget!

Source:
Yes, thank you for pointing that out. 

The last place I saw our dog, <<1>>, was near the fork in the road that leads to <<2>>, just west of here.

Take this whistle. Use it when you get to the fork in the road. I'll wait here in case he comes home.
