Target: We've walked the Two Moons Path, the path of Jone and Jode. But there is a third moon: The Dark Moon, the enemy of the Khajiit. Lorkhaj, the Missing God. This is the secret at the end of the Path … we must travel to the Den of Lorkhaj.

Source: How are you at building embassies?\n\nYou see, <<1>> promised one would be built for the Khajiit, as a gesture of goodwill. But now a year has passed, and there's still no Khajiit Embassy. This has led to no end of headaches.
Target: How are you at building embassies?\n\nYou see, <<1>> promised one would be built for the Khajiit, as a gesture of goodwill. But now a year has passed, and there's still no Khajiit Embassy. This has led to no end of headaches.

Source: The Stormfists came out of nowhere and forced us to retreat from the fort. We escaped, as did Lieutenant Koruni and a few of her soldiers.\n\nI don't know what the Stormfists want, but we haven't seen that clan around here for almost a decade.
Target: The Stormfists came out of nowhere and forced us to retreat from the fort. We escaped, as did Lieutenant Koruni and a few of her soldiers.\n\nI don't know what the Stormfists want, but we haven't seen that clan around here for almost a decade.

Source: Maybe you've heard of the Right of Theft? A Wood Elf tradition. If you pull off a particularly clever theft, you can demand payment from the owner for their things.\n\nWell, I stole this treethane's bow. And then <<1>> stole the bow from me.
Target: Maybe you've heard of the Right of Theft? A Wood Elf tradition. If you pull off a particularly clever theft, you can demand payment from the owner for their things.\n\nWell, I stole this treethane's bow. And then <<1>> stole the bow from me.

Source: Fildgor is King Jorunn's twin brother. When Queen Nurnhilde fell in battle, the brothers joined forces to defeat the Akaviri, but then they fought over the throne. Jorunn won the day and exiled his brother.\n\nNow Fildgor has returned.
Target: Fildgor is King Jorunn's twin brother. When Queen Nurnhilde fell in battle, the brothers joined forces to defeat the Akaviri, but then they fought over the throne. Jorunn won the day and exiled his brother.\n\nNow Fildgor has returned.

Source: It's my fault. I was going on and on about a silk dress I saw on a High Elf in Elden Root the other day.\n\nFiraelion swore he'd get me the dress—I didn't think he'd venture into a cave full of spiders to do it!
Target: It's my fault. I was going on and on about a silk dress I saw on a High Elf in Elden Root the other day.\n\nFiraelion swore he'd get me the dress—I didn't think he'd venture into a cave full of spiders to do it!

Source: Montclair loyalists still operate out of Shornhelm, yes? Whatever they are planning, we must know. They use couriers to pass messages, and that is how we shall find their informer. Their spy.
Target: Montclair loyalists still operate out of Shornhelm, yes? Whatever they are planning, we must know. They use couriers to pass messages, and that is how we shall find their informer. Their spy.

Source: I have heard troubling news from Sentinel. Rumors say that enemies from my father's past have returned.\n\nI wrote to him right away, of course, but as everyone knows … King Fahara'jad can be slow to respond. Still, I fear for his safety.
Target: I have heard troubling news from Sentinel. Rumors say that enemies from my father's past have returned.\n\nI wrote to him right away, of course, but as everyone knows … King Fahara'jad can be slow to respond. Still, I fear for his safety.

Source: We're half of what's left of Fort Morvunskar's garrison. The other half is at Captain Hamar's camp on the other side of the fort. \n\nThey hit us hard from out of nowhere and forced us to abandon the fort.
Target: We're half of what's left of Fort Morvunskar's garrison. The other half is at Captain Hamar's camp on the other side of the fort. \n\nThey hit us hard from out of nowhere and forced us to abandon the fort.

Source: I work for the king. I keep an eye on <<1>> for impressive people, should he have need of aid. He does, and you are most impressive.\n\nHead to his throne room in <<2>>. Say "the vines are strongest at dusk." He'll know you're a friend to the throne.
Target: I work for the king. I keep an eye on <<1>> for impressive people, should he have need of aid. He does, and you are most impressive.\n\nHead to his throne room in <<2>>. Say \\"the vines are strongest at dusk.\"\" He'll know you're a friend to the throne."

Source: You should have been here a few days ago. A skeleton lurched in and chased villagers around. Atugol bashed its head in with a hammer before it killed anyone, but it was a close call. It must have come from the graveyard to the southwest.
Target: You should have been here a few days ago. A skeleton lurched in and chased villagers around. Atugol bashed its head in with a hammer before it killed anyone, but it was a close call. It must have come from the graveyard to the southwest.

Source: <A finely crafted bow lies near a fallen Orc. It seems to have been damaged in a struggle, but it could still be valuable to the right person.>
Target: <A finely crafted bow lies near a fallen Orc. It seems to have been damaged in a struggle, but it could still be valuable to the right person.>

Source: I fear she's been eaten by nix-hounds. I'm terrified of them.\n\nShe made me a flute. Said it would calm them. To prove her point, she went up the trail behind me. A pack of beasts lives up there.
Target: I fear she's been eaten by nix-hounds. I'm terrified of them.\n\nShe made me a flute. Said it would calm them. To prove her point, she went up the trail behind me. A pack of beasts lives up there.

Source: Studying the ruins—the Ayleid Well, specifically. It's said the light from Ayleid Wells has rejuvenating properties. I'd hoped to discover whether the light could be stored in a container such as this.
Target: Studying the ruins—the Ayleid Well, specifically. It's said the light from Ayleid Wells has rejuvenating properties. I'd hoped to discover whether the light could be stored in a container such as this.

Source: With the crows as her spies, Uela is everywhere, but the Hagraven's physical form is assuredly deep in Reachmen-held territory.\n\nMy sisters have been searching for her, but it will take time. The foul creature has wards that block Wyrd magic.
Target: With the crows as her spies, Uela is everywhere, but the Hagraven's physical form is assuredly deep in Reachmen-held territory.\n\nMy sisters have been searching for her, but it will take time. The foul creature has wards that block Wyrd magic.

Source: Thank you. I have one last favor to ask of you, though. Would you bury our family's ashes?\n\nMayla and I think it would be appropriate, considering all you've done for us.
Target: Thank you. I have one last favor to ask of you, though. Would you bury our family's ashes?\n\nMayla and I think it would be appropriate, considering all you've done for us.

Source: The ratification ceremony ends with <<c:1>>, an ancient device beneath <<2>>. It will divine <<3>>'s capacity to become empress, or somesuch.\n\nBut <<4>> assisted in the preparations. I must assume she tried to sabotage the proceedings.
Target: The ratification ceremony ends with <<c:1>>, an ancient device beneath <<2>>. It will divine <<3>>'s capacity to become empress, or somesuch.\n\nBut <<4>> assisted in the preparations. I must assume she tried to sabotage the proceedings.

Source: A madwoman named Lady Laurent. She hired me in the Alik'r to guide her through the desert, but this is as far as I go for her.\n\nShe's already lost one of her traveling companions. I won't be the victim of her next "accident."
Target: A madwoman named Lady Laurent. She hired me in the Alik'r to guide her through the desert, but this is as far as I go for her.\n\nShe's already lost one of her traveling companions. I won't be the victim of her next \\"accident.\"\""

Source: "Many scholars have attempted to find Urenenya's last resting place, but I am the first to uncover evidence she was acquainted with the Dwemeri architect Klathzgar. I have come to Klathzgar's long-abandoned workshop in search of clues to her fate."
Target: \\"Many scholars have attempted to find Urenenya's last resting place
column4: but I am the first to uncover evidence she was acquainted with the Dwemeri architect Klathzgar. I have come to Klathzgar's long-abandoned workshop in search of clues to her fate.\"\""

Source: Adusa has been studying this code book. Gathering information, learning what she can. It seems Montclair's forces are resolved. They hired Two-Blades to eliminate a list of targets. \n\nWe need that list.
Target: Adusa has been studying this code book. Gathering information, learning what she can. It seems Montclair's forces are resolved. They hired Two-Blades to eliminate a list of targets. \n\nWe need that list.

Source: Oh! Yes, yes. This proves Montclair's allies are still plotting and scheming. While you were tracking the spy, Adusa did some tracking of her own. Arcorion Two-Blades, a ruthless killer, is now on the Montclair payroll.
Target: Oh! Yes, yes. This proves Montclair's allies are still plotting and scheming. While you were tracking the spy, Adusa did some tracking of her own. Arcorion Two-Blades, a ruthless killer, is now on the Montclair payroll.

Source: Yes, the legacy of Arkay's saints, imbued with his power. Our sacred mission is to find these relics and use them to stem the undead tide.
Target: Yes, the legacy of Arkay's saints, imbued with his power. Our sacred mission is to find these relics and use them to stem the undead tide.

Source: We should really head in there and get started. The ratification ceremony isn't going to perform itself, after all!\n\nAnd from what I understand, Conservator <<1>> wanted to speak with you personally.
Target: We should really head in there and get started. The ratification ceremony isn't going to perform itself, after all!\n\nAnd from what I understand, Conservator <<1>> wanted to speak with you personally.

Source: You'll hear our story repeated around Rivenspire, I expect. The roads just aren't safe anymore.\n\nBandits from the Orc's Finger Ruins hit our farm. They slaughtered livestock and looted the place. We only escaped because we hid. Then we ran.
Target: You'll hear our story repeated around Rivenspire, I expect. The roads just aren't safe anymore.\n\nBandits from the Orc's Finger Ruins hit our farm. They slaughtered livestock and looted the place. We only escaped because we hid. Then we ran.

Source: All? All is a very big number, Five-Claw. This one smells more of them. All around. In the shadows. We'll meet them here, in the open! No, no. Too open. Into the castle! Less directions to defend against. \n\nQuickly, Five-Claw! Follow Adusa!
Target: All? All is a very big number, Five-Claw. This one smells more of them. All around. In the shadows. We'll meet them here, in the open! No, no. Too open. Into the castle! Less directions to defend against. \n\nQuickly, Five-Claw! Follow Adusa!

Source: <Inside the bottle is a note, carefully rolled and tied with some waxed string.>
Target: <Inside the bottle is a note, carefully rolled and tied with some waxed string.>

Source: <<1>>, <<2>>. They were hired by Montclair's nephew. A diseased worm named Rohlbert. He seeks to turn Montclair's remaining forces into an army, bolstered by hired blades.
Target: <<1>>, <<2>>. They were hired by Montclair's nephew. A diseased worm named Rohlbert. He seeks to turn Montclair's remaining forces into an army, bolstered by hired blades.

Source: We were at Crestshade. Ignobert and Xandier were trying to get some merchants to safety when a swarm came down the street. We planned to meet up at that tower in the distance, but the undead … there are too many of them.
Target: We were at Crestshade. Ignobert and Xandier were trying to get some merchants to safety when a swarm came down the street. We planned to meet up at that tower in the distance, but the undead … there are too many of them.

Source: Our house is just a shell of what it once was …. I doubt anyone survived.\n\nBut you can save the city. Help the Evermore soldiers keep these animals from going any farther!
Target: Our house is just a shell of what it once was …. I doubt anyone survived.\n\nBut you can save the city. Help the Evermore soldiers keep these animals from going any farther!

Source: Me? No. Why would I be frustrated? Ten years as town constable and the mayor just up and decides to fire me the other day! Can you imagine?\n\nSays I'm getting too old and the new constable will do a better job. The dungheap bastard!
Target: Me? No. Why would I be frustrated? Ten years as town constable and the mayor just up and decides to fire me the other day! Can you imagine?\n\nSays I'm getting too old and the new constable will do a better job. The dungheap bastard!

Source: I've been researching ancient Yokudan ruins to see what light they cast on modern Redguard culture. It's quite fascinating, but not without peril.\n\nMy erstwhile assistant was, er, incapacitated during one of my experiments, and I hope to recover him.
Target: I've been researching ancient Yokudan ruins to see what light they cast on modern Redguard culture. It's quite fascinating, but not without peril.\n\nMy erstwhile assistant was, er, incapacitated during one of my experiments, and I hope to recover him.

Source: It may be too late for the villagers, but I noticed the Evermore soldiers have secured the windmill.\n\nIf you can find the captain there, see what he needs. These Reachmen are vicious animals. We can't let them attack the city!
Target: It may be too late for the villagers, but I noticed the Evermore soldiers have secured the windmill.\n\nIf you can find the captain there, see what he needs. These Reachmen are vicious animals. We can't let them attack the city!

Source: Yes. I admit—I was with them, and I admit that I did bad things. I have robbed and I have beaten … but I have never just cut down an innocent person.\n\nWhen the Bitterhand began this practice of murdering people, that is when I decided to leave.
Target: Yes. I admit—I was with them, and I admit that I did bad things. I have robbed and I have beaten … but I have never just cut down an innocent person.\n\nWhen the Bitterhand began this practice of murdering people, that is when I decided to leave.

Source: Head to Davon's Watch and report in. <<1>> should be on duty.\n\nClear skies and firm roads, my friend.
Target: Head to Davon's Watch and report in. <<1>> should be on duty.\n\nClear skies and firm roads, my friend.

Source: The Countess sent a priest to sanctify the dead. Those of us particularly devoted to the Light fear rising as undead creatures more than anything else. The priest is here to make sure that doesn't happen.
Target: The Countess sent a priest to sanctify the dead. Those of us particularly devoted to the Light fear rising as undead creatures more than anything else. The priest is here to make sure that doesn't happen.

Source: Head to Davon's Watch and speak with <<1>>.\n\nMake sure they've been warned about the Covenant.
Target: Head to Davon's Watch and speak with <<1>>.\n\nMake sure they've been warned about the Covenant.

Source: Well, I can't very well go on pretending the nobles can share the throne. Everyone knows what a colossal mistake I made there.\n\nI'm going to have to crown someone—a king or a queen of Shornhelm, someone to rule Rivenspire, don't you think?
Target: Well, I can't very well go on pretending the nobles can share the throne. Everyone knows what a colossal mistake I made there.\n\nI'm going to have to crown someone—a king or a queen of Shornhelm, someone to rule Rivenspire, don't you think?

Source: Grand Warlord Zimmeron believes the farm at Drakelowe Keep is poorly defended. He wants this taken from the enemy.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron believes the farm at Drakelowe Keep is poorly defended. He wants this taken from the enemy.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: This silly cult threw me in this cage for me to rot, just because I took back my Crystal.  Get me out of this cage at once!
Target: This silly cult threw me in this cage for me to rot, just because I took back my Crystal.  Get me out of this cage at once!

Source: We need the farm at Castle Alessia to help feed our troops. Grand Warlord Zimmeron calls for attackers!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: We need the farm at Castle Alessia to help feed our troops. Grand Warlord Zimmeron calls for attackers!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: Northpoint was my home for the last few years, so I know the place pretty well. Never snuck in through a smuggler's tunnel, though. That's going to be a new experience.\n\nJust remember that we're part of House Montclair and things should go fine.
Target: Northpoint was my home for the last few years, so I know the place pretty well. Never snuck in through a smuggler's tunnel, though. That's going to be a new experience.\n\nJust remember that we're part of House Montclair and things should go fine.

Source: You don't know? The big folk prepare to march to war. I sense that you and the big folk share a common foe.\n\nI'd say you arrived just in time. I like that in a champion.
Target: You don't know? The big folk prepare to march to war. I sense that you and the big folk share a common foe.\n\nI'd say you arrived just in time. I like that in a champion.

Source: Faregyl Farm must no longer support our foes. Join the assault, warriors of the Pact!\n\n- General Jeggord
Target: Faregyl Farm must no longer support our foes. Join the assault, warriors of the Pact!\n\n- General Jeggord

Source: Grand Warlord Zimmeron believes the farm at Castle Roebeck is poorly defended. He wants this taken from the enemy.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron believes the farm at Castle Roebeck is poorly defended. He wants this taken from the enemy.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: Grand Warlord Zimmeron wants Warden Mine captured. Answer the call, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron wants Warden Mine captured. Answer the call, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: You? Can you even read Ayl— Never mind. You have the look of an adventurer, and maybe that is what I need now more than another scholar. It was a stone fragment etched with Ayleid runes, found by a fisherman who claimed it washed up on shore.
Target: You? Can you even read Ayl— Never mind. You have the look of an adventurer, and maybe that is what I need now more than another scholar. It was a stone fragment etched with Ayleid runes, found by a fisherman who claimed it washed up on shore.

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: Stone from Rayles Mine strengthens our foes' keeps. Warriors are needed to take this resource from them.\n\n- General Jeggord
Target: Stone from Rayles Mine strengthens our foes' keeps. Warriors are needed to take this resource from them.\n\n- General Jeggord

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: <<1>> tried to stop the Worm Cult from defiling this burial site. They took her! I saw her near the center of Ouze, held captive at one of the altars.\n\nI can't imagine what they'll do to her if someone doesn't stop them!
Target: <<1>> tried to stop the Worm Cult from defiling this burial site. They took her! I saw her near the center of Ouze, held captive at one of the altars.\n\nI can't imagine what they'll do to her if someone doesn't stop them!

Source: We need stone to strengthen our keeps. The mine at Fort Glademist is vulnerable. Take it for the Pact!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: We need stone to strengthen our keeps. The mine at Fort Glademist is vulnerable. Take it for the Pact!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: It's Kaleen. She's missing. She was supposed to meet me back here hours ago and, well … it's been too long. I think something's happened to her. No, I know something's happened.
Target: It's Kaleen. She's missing. She was supposed to meet me back here hours ago and, well … it's been too long. I think something's happened to her. No, I know something's happened.

Source: Ah, yes. The scouting reports. He wants you to sneak into Skuldafn while we distract the bulk of the Orcthane's army.\n\nSkuldafn is special to the Nords. Jorunn always planned to hold the moot there. But then Fildgor moved in.
Target: Ah, yes. The scouting reports. He wants you to sneak into Skuldafn while we distract the bulk of the Orcthane's army.\n\nSkuldafn is special to the Nords. Jorunn always planned to hold the moot there. But then Fildgor moved in.

Source: I convinced my performers to come here, to spread High Elf culture in these lands. Bring a little piece of Summerset to <<1>>, you see?\n\nBut the trained bugs are sick, our magician's supplies are missing, and our storyteller's stories fell flat!
Target: I convinced my performers to come here, to spread High Elf culture in these lands. Bring a little piece of Summerset to <<1>>, you see?\n\nBut the trained bugs are sick, our magician's supplies are missing, and our storyteller's stories fell flat!

Source: As many stories as there have been Silvenars. Going back to the first Bosmer, no doubt!\n\nBut the story the spinners are telling now, it's all wrong. It must change back before it's too late.
Target: As many stories as there have been Silvenars. Going back to the first Bosmer, no doubt!\n\nBut the story the spinners are telling now, it's all wrong. It must change back before it's too late.

Source: We need the farm at Castle Brindle to help feed our troops. Grand Warlord Zimmeron calls for attackers!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: We need the farm at Castle Brindle to help feed our troops. Grand Warlord Zimmeron calls for attackers!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: They say all wounds heal in time. This is true even for the Valenwood. Yet some wounds are more grievous than others, and if left to fester can only bring death. The ruin of Gil-Var-Delle suffered so, and the mark left behind is one of rot and decay.
Target: They say all wounds heal in time. This is true even for the Valenwood. Yet some wounds are more grievous than others, and if left to fester can only bring death. The ruin of Gil-Var-Delle suffered so, and the mark left behind is one of rot and decay.

Source: The name is Finvir. I was part of the circle of mages that summoned the Dremora Lord now posing as the Bad Man. I can help keep his power in check, but I'll need your help.
Target: The name is Finvir. I was part of the circle of mages that summoned the Dremora Lord now posing as the Bad Man. I can help keep his power in check, but I'll need your help.

Source: Black Boot Farm must no longer support our foes. Join the assault, warriors of the Pact!\n\n- General Jeggord
Target: Black Boot Farm must no longer support our foes. Join the assault, warriors of the Pact!\n\n- General Jeggord

Source: It's simple really, I need someone to travel to <<1>> and inquire about my lost shipment with <<2>>, the customs clerk.\n\nIt's incredibly late and the alchemist that ordered it is not the most patient of clients.
Target: It's simple really, I need someone to travel to <<1>> and inquire about my lost shipment with <<2>>, the customs clerk.\n\nIt's incredibly late and the alchemist that ordered it is not the most patient of clients.

Source: Grand Warlord Zimmeron believes the farm at Castle Bloodmayne is poorly defended. He wants this taken from the enemy.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron believes the farm at Castle Bloodmayne is poorly defended. He wants this taken from the enemy.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: I'm privileged to be a Vinedusk Ranger. We report directly to <<1>>, ruler of the Wood Elves. We protect his rule against all threats, without or within.
Target: I'm privileged to be a Vinedusk Ranger. We report directly to <<1>>, ruler of the Wood Elves. We protect his rule against all threats, without or within.

Source: We're hunters who seek balance in all things. Most of us are Wood Elves native to <<1>>, but any who wish to learn the ways of the forest can undertake our trials and join our ranks.\n\nAssuming they survive.
Target: We're hunters who seek balance in all things. Most of us are Wood Elves native to <<1>>, but any who wish to learn the ways of the forest can undertake our trials and join our ranks.\n\nAssuming they survive.

Source: Grand Warlord Zimmeron wants Ash Mine captured. Answer the call, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron wants Ash Mine captured. Answer the call, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: Stone from Aleswell Mine strengthens our foes' keeps. Warriors are needed to take this resource from them.\n\n- General Jeggord
Target: Stone from Aleswell Mine strengthens our foes' keeps. Warriors are needed to take this resource from them.\n\n- General Jeggord

Source: For one thing, I still haven't seen Septima. I just have to find out how the years have treated the old girl.\n\nThere's also the matter of liberating southern Bangkorai. It's Covenant territory, you know.
Target: For one thing, I still haven't seen Septima. I just have to find out how the years have treated the old girl.\n\nThere's also the matter of liberating southern Bangkorai. It's Covenant territory, you know.

Source: We need stone to strengthen our keeps. The mine at Fort Dragonclaw is vulnerable. Take it for the Pact!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: We need stone to strengthen our keeps. The mine at Fort Dragonclaw is vulnerable. Take it for the Pact!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: Who tied you up?
Target: Who tied you up?

Source: Grand Warlord Zimmeron wants Farragut Mine captured. Answer the call, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron wants Farragut Mine captured. Answer the call, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: I was assaulted by the same creatures that attacked Cragwallow. You track these monsters?\n\nThen I implore you to aid a dying old man.
Target: I was assaulted by the same creatures that attacked Cragwallow. You track these monsters?\n\nThen I implore you to aid a dying old man.

Source: Stone from Blue Road Mine strengthens our foes' keeps. Warriors are needed to take this resource from them.\n\n- General Jeggord
Target: Stone from Blue Road Mine strengthens our foes' keeps. Warriors are needed to take this resource from them.\n\n- General Jeggord

Source: One of my bosses, <<1>>, ran into these ruins seeking some magic travel altar to whisk her out of Hammerfell. She ran up that tower over there, amid all those ugly Daedric types.\n\nMy other boss wants me to help her out, but I'm … disinclined.
Target: One of my bosses, <<1>>, ran into these ruins seeking some magic travel altar to whisk her out of Hammerfell. She ran up that tower over there, amid all those ugly Daedric types.\n\nMy other boss wants me to help her out, but I'm … disinclined.

Source: <<1>> tried to stop the Worm Cult from defiling this burial site. They took her! I saw her near the center of Ouze, held captive at one of the altars.\n\nI can't imagine what they'll do to her if someone doesn't stop them!

Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron wants Alessia Mine captured. Answer the call, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: "Those Orcs were two of a kind. Get this, each hired me to kill the other! So I took their gold, poisoned them both, and set their lodge on fire to make it look accidental."\n\n"Never killed an Orc chief's wife before. Today I killed two!"
Target: \\"Those Orcs were two of a kind. Get this
column4: each hired me to kill the other! So I took their gold
column5: poisoned them both
column6: and set their lodge on fire to make it look accidental.\"\"\n\n\"\"Never killed an Orc chief's wife before. Today I killed two!\"\""

Source: The notes you discovered suggest two weaknesses in the fort's defenses—the gates and the captive mammoths. Once you get inside, you must free the mammoths to cause havoc and unlock the gates to let us in.
Target: The notes you discovered suggest two weaknesses in the fort's defenses—the gates and the captive mammoths. Once you get inside, you must free the mammoths to cause havoc and unlock the gates to let us in.

Source: Grand Warlord Zimmeron wants Chalman Mine captured. Answer the call, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron wants Chalman Mine captured. Answer the call, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: Caravan contract job east of here in those old Ayleid ruins—Silaseli they call the place. Some mage out there wants an armed escort and I'm the only one available to go.\n\nI can't stand dealing with mages, especially when it's just me.
Target: Caravan contract job east of here in those old Ayleid ruins—Silaseli they call the place. Some mage out there wants an armed escort and I'm the only one available to go.\n\nI can't stand dealing with mages, especially when it's just me.

Source: Stone from Arrius Mine strengthens our foes' keeps. Warriors are needed to take this resource from them.\n\n- General Jeggord
Target: Stone from Arrius Mine strengthens our foes' keeps. Warriors are needed to take this resource from them.\n\n- General Jeggord

Source: A notorious band of treasure-hunters from the First Era. They went all over Morrowind looting and pillaging, stealing our people's most sacred relics.\n\nI studied them and tracked down a lockbox holding their greatest treasure, but I can't open it.
Target: A notorious band of treasure-hunters from the First Era. They went all over Morrowind looting and pillaging, stealing our people's most sacred relics.\n\nI studied them and tracked down a lockbox holding their greatest treasure, but I can't open it.

Source: Taking a break, waiting for some friends. I'm a royal road worker. Do you appreciate the flat, even roads throughout Eastmarch? You can thank us for those.\n\nWe've earned a little relaxation. We're throwing a celebration in Cragwallow.
Target: Taking a break, waiting for some friends. I'm a royal road worker. Do you appreciate the flat, even roads throughout Eastmarch? You can thank us for those.\n\nWe've earned a little relaxation. We're throwing a celebration in Cragwallow.

Target: We need stone to strengthen our keeps. The mine at Kingscrest Keep is vulnerable. Take it for the Pact!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: My partner, <<1>>, darted into these ruins seeking some ancient magical travel device to get her out of Bangkorai.
Target: My partner, <<1>>, darted into these ruins seeking some ancient magical travel device to get her out of Bangkorai.

Source: I work for Dragonstar Caravans, and the mage hired us to come out and give him an armed escort. \n\nI hate working for mages, but I was the only one available to accomodate this bastard's schedule. So I hiked all the way out here, and now this ….
Target: I work for Dragonstar Caravans, and the mage hired us to come out and give him an armed escort. \n\nI hate working for mages, but I was the only one available to accomodate this bastard's schedule. So I hiked all the way out here, and now this ….

Source: <Continue reading.>
Target: <Continue reading.>

Source: <A fragment of what appears to be Ayleid origin has washed up on shore, likely debris from the sunken ruins off the coast.>
Target: <A fragment of what appears to be Ayleid origin has washed up on shore, likely debris from the sunken ruins off the coast.>

Source: I've been unable to research this site properly before moving on, but my travel arrangements are already made. \n\nDo you understand what that means?
Target: I've been unable to research this site properly before moving on, but my travel arrangements are already made. \n\nDo you understand what that means?

Source: I don't know, but can I help?
Target: I don't know, but can I help?

Source: I'm the sentry captain. To me, there's always a problem! It's in the details. That kind of thinking keeps us secure.\n\nCould you light the watchfires near the east and south gates? The fires keep the Stormfists from sneaking too close to the walls.
Target: I'm the sentry captain. To me, there's always a problem! It's in the details. That kind of thinking keeps us secure.\n\nCould you light the watchfires near the east and south gates? The fires keep the Stormfists from sneaking too close to the walls.

Source: A giant bear has been attacking travellers to the northeast. The locals call it "Gaping Maw." Even the wildlife around here is against us. Would you kill it, please?
Target: A giant bear has been attacking travellers to the northeast. The locals call it \\"Gaping Maw.\"\" Even the wildlife around here is against us. Would you kill it
column4: please?"

Source: "These ruins are the perfect place to contemplate the light of Jone and Jode. Their cooling rays slice through the crack in the ceiling. They fill me with calm, with peace."
Target: \\"These ruins are the perfect place to contemplate the light of Jone and Jode. Their cooling rays slice through the crack in the ceiling. They fill me with calm
column4: with peace.\"\""

Source: "Sister and I have tried so hard to make a life, but <<1>> is getting sicker by the day. No one is willing to hire a "cannibal Elf" from the southern jungles … I have to leave her here in Northpoint, leave her to find the gold for her balm."
Target: \\"Sister and I have tried so hard to make a life
column4: but <<1>> is getting sicker by the day. No one is willing to hire a \"\"cannibal Elf\"\" from the southern jungles … I have to leave her here in Northpoint
column5: leave her to find the gold for her balm.\"\""

Source: Many have come here fleeing the war. They left their homes with only a few prized possessions. \n\nThey were preyed upon by bandits en route. Many lost their lives; the lucky ones only lost all their possessions.
Target: Many have come here fleeing the war. They left their homes with only a few prized possessions. \n\nThey were preyed upon by bandits en route. Many lost their lives; the lucky ones only lost all their possessions.

Source: I'm in disguise. Don't you like it? \n\nWe're trying to sneak into Northpoint. Find out why the Montclairs sealed the city. I'm not usually good at sneaking, but Countess Tamrith and Darien helped us get this far.
Target: I'm in disguise. Don't you like it? \n\nWe're trying to sneak into Northpoint. Find out why the Montclairs sealed the city. I'm not usually good at sneaking, but Countess Tamrith and Darien helped us get this far.

Source: My father is still weak from the poison, but he's recovering. I'm organizing things while he gets his strength back.\n\nI need to regain the confidence of our Dark Elf and Argonian allies. My regrettable actions at Fort Amol have made them wary.
Target: My father is still weak from the poison, but he's recovering. I'm organizing things while he gets his strength back.\n\nI need to regain the confidence of our Dark Elf and Argonian allies. My regrettable actions at Fort Amol have made them wary.

Source: "The blood-curse burning through my body matters not. Nor do I regret my coming demise. I regret only that I will never see <<1>> again. At least, I pray I never see her again."
Target: \\"The blood-curse burning through my body matters not. Nor do I regret my coming demise. I regret only that I will never see <<1>> again. At least

Source: You can't look for her now. \n\nSome fishermen are trapped in the windmill. Free them before they burn.
Target: You can't look for her now. \n\nSome fishermen are trapped in the windmill. Free them before they burn.

Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron commands all warriors to attack the enemy at Castle Black Boot. This fortress must fall to the Pact.\n\n- General Jeggord

Source: It must be magic. No other explanation. This is the only entrance or exit to the ruin.\n\nThe Redguards must be using a portal to enter the ruin. They probably thought they could avoid detection until they had a force big enough to attack.
Target: It must be magic. No other explanation. This is the only entrance or exit to the ruin.\n\nThe Redguards must be using a portal to enter the ruin. They probably thought they could avoid detection until they had a force big enough to attack.

Target: How can I help?

Target: Goblins! The Rock Bone tribe has set up camp to the northeast. Only a matter of time before they attack. How about if you visit them first?

Source: We need the farm at Fort Warden to help feed our troops. Grand Warlord Zimmeron calls for attackers!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: We need the farm at Fort Warden to help feed our troops. Grand Warlord Zimmeron calls for attackers!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: As I set up camp in the central chamber of this cave, a large spider bit my leg.\n\nI awoke to find myself in this unfortunate position, while the man I accompany wanders unattended.
Target: As I set up camp in the central chamber of this cave, a large spider bit my leg.\n\nI awoke to find myself in this unfortunate position, while the man I accompany wanders unattended.

Source: Just what I know. Skyrim's royal family and their honored servants are interred below. Well, the dead ones, anyway.\n\nThe fort was built to protect the crypts. There are precious relics, to be sure, but nothing to make these brigands risk so much.
Target: Just what I know. Skyrim's royal family and their honored servants are interred below. Well, the dead ones, anyway.\n\nThe fort was built to protect the crypts. There are precious relics, to be sure, but nothing to make these brigands risk so much.

Target: Rayles Farm must no longer support our foes. Join the assault, warriors of the Pact!\n\n- General Jeggord

Source: You were attacked by a vampire, were you not? The blood of Mother Lamae flows within you.\n\nI wonder. Will you embrace it or will you fight it?
Target: You were attacked by a vampire, were you not? The blood of Mother Lamae flows within you.\n\nI wonder. Will you embrace it or will you fight it?

Source: I feel strong. I'm ready to spill some Imperial blood. This will be remembered as the place where the Imperials made their last stand in Bangkorai.\n\nDespite my advisors' concerns, I decided I had to be here and lead the charge myself.
Target: I feel strong. I'm ready to spill some Imperial blood. This will be remembered as the place where the Imperials made their last stand in Bangkorai.\n\nDespite my advisors' concerns, I decided I had to be here and lead the charge myself.

Source: He's inside, up at the keep. He's keeping the centurion sane with his sage advice.\n\nHead inside. And stay moist.
Target: He's inside, up at the keep. He's keeping the centurion sane with his sage advice.\n\nHead inside. And stay moist.

Source: Think about it. Run into a wild creature lately? Suffer any unusual injuries? Maybe you felt a little drowsy earlier? And then your senses grew sharper.\n\nI'm talking about Sanies Lupinus. Hircine's gift. Lycanthropy.
Target: Think about it. Run into a wild creature lately? Suffer any unusual injuries? Maybe you felt a little drowsy earlier? And then your senses grew sharper.\n\nI'm talking about Sanies Lupinus. Hircine's gift. Lycanthropy.

Source: He's inside, up at the keep. He's keeping the centurion sane with his wise advice.\n\nHead inside. And good luck

Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron has declared an assault on Castle Brindle. All Pact warriors are urged to join the attack!\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: To the Far Shores, of course. This is it. This is the path the souls of heroes take to move on to the … afterlife, as some call it. \n\nSouls used to be flying through here all the time. Guess there just aren't as many heroes any more ….
Target: To the Far Shores, of course. This is it. This is the path the souls of heroes take to move on to the … afterlife, as some call it. \n\nSouls used to be flying through here all the time. Guess there just aren't as many heroes any more ….

Source: The Duke of Camlorn was kidnapped while I was guarding him. Bloodthorns were reported near the lighthouse and he insisted on investigating. \n\nWe were going to check it out when the cultists jumped us and took the Duke hostage.
Target: The Duke of Camlorn was kidnapped while I was guarding him. Bloodthorns were reported near the lighthouse and he insisted on investigating. \n\nWe were going to check it out when the cultists jumped us and took the Duke hostage.

Target: During my time on Tamriel, I developed a very useful spell. A memory charm of sorts. Rather than wasting my time puttering around in libraries trying to find a book, the spell allows me to recall it instantly.\n\nIf you'll allow me?

Source: <<1>> has been taken over by ghosts who can somehow control flame atronachs. As if regular ghosts weren't bad enough! Ayleid ruins just seem to attract evil.\n\nThe ruins are to the north. Will you help us?
Target: <<1>> has been taken over by ghosts who can somehow control flame atronachs. As if regular ghosts weren't bad enough! Ayleid ruins just seem to attract evil.\n\nThe ruins are to the north. Will you help us?

Target: The Bad Man is one of the old gods, the source of all strife and the god of crop failure. According to local tradition, appeasing him will ensure a good harvest. Superstitious nonsense, but an excellent excuse for a festival!

Source: Verandis sent me to keep an eye on things. He's learned that Reezal-Jul is in the area. It was nice of the Captain to set up a camp for the refugees, but it was also foolhardy.\n\nAll those people. It's like ringing the dinner bell for the vampires.
Target: Verandis sent me to keep an eye on things. He's learned that Reezal-Jul is in the area. It was nice of the Captain to set up a camp for the refugees, but it was also foolhardy.\n\nAll those people. It's like ringing the dinner bell for the vampires.

Source: Our resident artist, Nayya, is sulking. She insists she needs silver scales to create her next piece. Sadly, Silverscale Pond has been overfished by poachers. If you can steal some of the scales from them, I'll pay for them.
Target: Our resident artist, Nayya, is sulking. She insists she needs silver scales to create her next piece. Sadly, Silverscale Pond has been overfished by poachers. If you can steal some of the scales from them, I'll pay for them.

Source: It is my wife—my beautiful Adeena. Something dark claimed her, wayfarer. It's using her … like a puppet. By Tu'whacca's breath, I think it might be Daedra!\n\nIt's been luring people into the ruins. My wife is down there! Please, help me!
Target: It is my wife—my beautiful Adeena. Something dark claimed her, wayfarer. It's using her … like a puppet. By Tu'whacca's breath, I think it might be Daedra!\n\nIt's been luring people into the ruins. My wife is down there! Please, help me!

Source: We were patrolling the ruins. Rumor was that Redguard insurgents were camped out here storing food and supplies. It didn't take long for the spiders to find us. Soldiers started disappearing … one at a time.\n\nI beg you, help me find them.

Target: What is the mission?

Source: What I want to do is go after Gavendien myself. But that's not going to happen any time soon and I don't want him to slip away. \n\nIf you're willing, then yes. Do whatever it takes. Just put him down. Oh, and retrieve the jewels, too.
Target: What I want to do is go after Gavendien myself. But that's not going to happen any time soon and I don't want him to slip away. \n\nIf you're willing, then yes. Do whatever it takes. Just put him down. Oh, and retrieve the jewels, too.

Source: Yes, I'm ready.
Target: Yes, I'm ready.

Source: I am, Grand Warlord.
Target: I am, Grand Warlord.

Source: The city is sealed against me … something I would not have thought possible. It would take the power of—\n\nOf course! The three spinners! They could do it, if they were forced by someone powerful. Someone like the Hound.
Target: The city is sealed against me … something I would not have thought possible. It would take the power of—\n\nOf course! The three spinners! They could do it, if they were forced by someone powerful. Someone like the Hound.

Source: Came from Stormhold. Betrayed from within.\n\nWarn <<1>>, in <<2>>. Tell him … not to trust ….
Target: Came from Stormhold. Betrayed from within.\n\nWarn <<1>>, in <<2>>. Tell him … not to trust ….

Source: I'm Laen the Doorwalker, a simple bard.\n\nMy fellow minstrels and I were chosen from throughout the Dominion to perform at the celebrations for the Silvenar and the Green Lady, but something went horribly wrong!
Target: I'm Laen the Doorwalker, a simple bard.\n\nMy fellow minstrels and I were chosen from throughout the Dominion to perform at the celebrations for the Silvenar and the Green Lady, but something went horribly wrong!

Source: You've already forgotten the Remly brothers, eh? I wish I could. The three of us were hired to drive off the harpies infesting the cliffs.\n\nArmel and Balin are supposed to be setting up traps, and I'm here to protect the village while they work.
Target: You've already forgotten the Remly brothers, eh? I wish I could. The three of us were hired to drive off the harpies infesting the cliffs.\n\nArmel and Balin are supposed to be setting up traps, and I'm here to protect the village while they work.

Source: Command me, Grand Warlord.
Target: Command me, Grand Warlord.

Source: I was once the Green Lady. When I died, I was drawn to rest in this sacred grove—Treehenge. All past Green Ladies rest here, since the first set foot in Valenwood.\n\nSomething blocks my entrance. Something vile!
Target: I was once the Green Lady. When I died, I was drawn to rest in this sacred grove—Treehenge. All past Green Ladies rest here, since the first set foot in Valenwood.\n\nSomething blocks my entrance. Something vile!

Source: A sacred place, where Argonians are hatched by the will of the Hist. The rites performed there make us who we are. If the Dominion has captured it, then countless Argonian hatchlings are in jeopardy.
Target: A sacred place, where Argonians are hatched by the will of the Hist. The rites performed there make us who we are. If the Dominion has captured it, then countless Argonian hatchlings are in jeopardy.

Source: Refugees from Narsis. We came here to escape the plague, but were set upon by highwaymen. I was separated from the group, and my husband. \n\nPlease, I must find Garil, but the half-wit at the barricade won't let me through!
Target: Refugees from Narsis. We came here to escape the plague, but were set upon by highwaymen. I was separated from the group, and my husband. \n\nPlease, I must find Garil, but the half-wit at the barricade won't let me through!

Source: Betrayed by an old friend. On our way to <<1>>, to fight.\n\nGet to … to <<2>>. Tell him … tell him to watch his ….
Target: Betrayed by an old friend. On our way to <<1>>, to fight.\n\nGet to … to <<2>>. Tell him … tell him to watch his ….

Source: Yes.
Target: Yes.

Source: King Jorunn and the Ebonheart Pact leaders are meeting here. Between the Nords, the Argonians, and the Dark Elf contingent, they've filled up the inn. They even had to set up tents on the far side of town.
Target: King Jorunn and the Ebonheart Pact leaders are meeting here. Between the Nords, the Argonians, and the Dark Elf contingent, they've filled up the inn. They even had to set up tents on the far side of town.

Source: Faolchu's already been brought back to life once. We need to make sure that can't happen again.
Target: Faolchu's already been brought back to life once. We need to make sure that can't happen again.

Source: Julien Rissiel. That's his name. He seems like a sharp young man, and he's had a little training. The problem is that Julien is more interested in chasing girls than glory. Some might even say he's pathetic. But he is a prospect.
Target: Julien Rissiel. That's his name. He seems like a sharp young man, and he's had a little training. The problem is that Julien is more interested in chasing girls than glory. Some might even say he's pathetic. But he is a prospect.

Source: I returned triumphantly from glorious mission to Dark Elf lands and Thane Mera put me in charge of Skald-King's big party. \n\n"You like a good party," she says. "Of course!" I say. "No one parties like Rigurt!" Turns out whole thing is mammoth dung.
Target: I returned triumphantly from glorious mission to Dark Elf lands and Thane Mera put me in charge of Skald-King's big party. \n\n\\"You like a good party
column4: \"\" she says. \"\"Of course!\"\" I say. \"\"No one parties like Rigurt!\"\" Turns out whole thing is mammoth dung."

Source: What other battle is brewing?
Target: What other battle is brewing?

Source: My kwama mine's been taken over by thugs! They're tearing the place up—ruining it.\n\nWorse, I can't find my partner, Selos.
Target: My kwama mine's been taken over by thugs! They're tearing the place up—ruining it.\n\nWorse, I can't find my partner, Selos.

Source: A forgotten tumble of ruins in the desolate Lorkrata Hills. We need to reach the chambers below, but the door I found is locked.\n\nSearch for a method to grant us access and I'll meet you at the western tower.
Target: A forgotten tumble of ruins in the desolate Lorkrata Hills. We need to reach the chambers below, but the door I found is locked.\n\nSearch for a method to grant us access and I'll meet you at the western tower.

Source: I hate the thought of Garil wandering through those godsforsaken chambers all alone.
Target: I hate the thought of Garil wandering through those godsforsaken chambers all alone.

Source: Working up my nerve to get out of here. My master <<1>> charged several of us to find holy relics of Arkay's saints. \n\nPraise Arkay, I was successful. I have a fragment of the scythe that killed Saint Octavien. I must get this relic to Alvaren.
Target: Working up my nerve to get out of here. My master <<1>> charged several of us to find holy relics of Arkay's saints. \n\nPraise Arkay, I was successful. I have a fragment of the scythe that killed Saint Octavien. I must get this relic to Alvaren.

Source: Not a single one. Montclair's war has decimated our ranks and people now see enlisting in the guard as a foolhardy proposition. \n\nI have a few prospects, but they seem to have no sense of duty. I don't know. Maybe my manner is just too harsh.
Target: Not a single one. Montclair's war has decimated our ranks and people now see enlisting in the guard as a foolhardy proposition. \n\nI have a few prospects, but they seem to have no sense of duty. I don't know. Maybe my manner is just too harsh.

Source: No! Don't touch the tomb! You'll be trapped forever with <<1>>!\n\nThose I hired as protection tricked me into this tomb and left me to rot. Thieves! I shouldn't have trusted them.
Target: No! Don't touch the tomb! You'll be trapped forever with <<1>>!\n\nThose I hired as protection tricked me into this tomb and left me to rot. Thieves! I shouldn't have trusted them.

Source: The Bloodthorn cultists stole our portal stones! I swore off violence when I left the guard, but killing cultists might be the only way to recover the portal stones.
Target: The Bloodthorn cultists stole our portal stones! I swore off violence when I left the guard, but killing cultists might be the only way to recover the portal stones.

Source: I'm hiding. I didn't know the Bloodthorns were going to desecrate this burial site. My ancestors are buried here!\n\nMy great-great-grandfather appeared before me. Demanded I atone for the desecration. If I don't, he said he'd haunt me. Forever!
Target: I'm hiding. I didn't know the Bloodthorns were going to desecrate this burial site. My ancestors are buried here!\n\nMy great-great-grandfather appeared before me. Demanded I atone for the desecration. If I don't, he said he'd haunt me. Forever!

Source: That's the plan. The meeting will take place in Skyrim instead of Mournhold. The Nord ruler has his own artifact to contribute to the moot.\n\nTime to set sail for the land of ice and snow.
Target: That's the plan. The meeting will take place in Skyrim instead of Mournhold. The Nord ruler has his own artifact to contribute to the moot.\n\nTime to set sail for the land of ice and snow.

Source: The kind that would help fatten Ildani's purse, yours too.\n\nThis one sailed into Sentinel docks before the dead. Guards don't stop the dead, but they stopped Ildani. Locked this one in chains!
Target: The kind that would help fatten Ildani's purse, yours too.\n\nThis one sailed into Sentinel docks before the dead. Guards don't stop the dead, but they stopped Ildani. Locked this one in chains!

Source: I'm not sure I'd put it that way, but yes. Montclair forces have locked the gates and are razing the farms outside. \n\nI sent a small team to find a way inside. We need to know what's going on in there before I order a full-scale attack.
Target: I'm not sure I'd put it that way, but yes. Montclair forces have locked the gates and are razing the farms outside. \n\nI sent a small team to find a way inside. We need to know what's going on in there before I order a full-scale attack.

Source: If Darien's still alive, his friend Alinon will be with him. \n\nAlinon can be difficult to deal with, but he's the best alchemist I know. He's working on a way to cure the victims of Faolchu's lycanthropy.
Target: If Darien's still alive, his friend Alinon will be with him. \n\nAlinon can be difficult to deal with, but he's the best alchemist I know. He's working on a way to cure the victims of Faolchu's lycanthropy.

Source: She wouldn't admit it, but I think she's some kind of bandit and that's why she doesn't think much of the Shornhelm Guard. \n\nShe called me some rather rude names. In fact, I lost my temper. But you … you have more patience.
Target: She wouldn't admit it, but I think she's some kind of bandit and that's why she doesn't think much of the Shornhelm Guard. \n\nShe called me some rather rude names. In fact, I lost my temper. But you … you have more patience.

Source: <<1>>. She helped us escape, but no one's seen her since.\n\nAnd <<2>> is overrun with all manner of undead and their vile masters!
Target: <<1>>. She helped us escape, but no one's seen her since.\n\nAnd <<2>> is overrun with all manner of undead and their vile masters!

Source: There is a place to the northeast, a sacred place called Tu'whacca's Throne. It is a place of quiet and of honor. Many, many heroes have been laid to rest there. \n\nI worry what would happen if the Withered Hand were to go there.
Target: There is a place to the northeast, a sacred place called Tu'whacca's Throne. It is a place of quiet and of honor. Many, many heroes have been laid to rest there. \n\nI worry what would happen if the Withered Hand were to go there.

Source: Montclair is here. I have no doubt of that. He hides atop the Doomcrag, behind ancient defenses that he has activated to block our path.\n\nWe need to circumvent these defenses and set up portals. That's the best way to move troops up the mountain.
Target: Montclair is here. I have no doubt of that. He hides atop the Doomcrag, behind ancient defenses that he has activated to block our path.\n\nWe need to circumvent these defenses and set up portals. That's the best way to move troops up the mountain.

Source: Grand Warlord Dortene wants Warden Farm taken from the enemy. Attack, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Grulzul
Target: Grand Warlord Dortene wants Warden Farm taken from the enemy. Attack, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Grulzul

Source: To the ruins in the Lorkrata Hills, just to the northeast of Shornhelm. Verandis' research has led him to the ruins and he needs your help.\n\nWhy he needs you when he has me, I'll never understand. But he is the master. As he constantly reminds me.
Target: To the ruins in the Lorkrata Hills, just to the northeast of Shornhelm. Verandis' research has led him to the ruins and he needs your help.\n\nWhy he needs you when he has me, I'll never understand. But he is the master. As he constantly reminds me.

Source: Rayles Farm must no longer feed our foes. Join the assault, warriors of the Covenant!\n\n- General Am-Shadal
Target: Rayles Farm must no longer feed our foes. Join the assault, warriors of the Covenant!\n\n- General Am-Shadal

Source: You'll find his majesty in the encampment just up the road. Watch yourself. The Worms have moved in force against us.
Target: You'll find his majesty in the encampment just up the road. Watch yourself. The Worms have moved in force against us.

Source: For too long, the farm at Fort Glademist has fed our enemies. Grand Warlord Dortene calls for this farm to be overwhelmed!\n\n- Scribe Grulzul
Target: For too long, the farm at Fort Glademist has fed our enemies. Grand Warlord Dortene calls for this farm to be overwhelmed!\n\n- Scribe Grulzul

Source: The race is part of the festival to celebrate the South Winds, which bring health and plenty to our crops.
Target: The race is part of the festival to celebrate the South Winds, which bring health and plenty to our crops.

Source: The king speaks with his advisors in the camp just up the road. Be wary. The Worm Cult moves against us in force.
Target: The king speaks with his advisors in the camp just up the road. Be wary. The Worm Cult moves against us in force.

Source: Grand Warlord Dortene wants Ash Farm taken from the enemy. Attack, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Grulzul
Target: Grand Warlord Dortene wants Ash Farm taken from the enemy. Attack, warriors!\n\n- Scribe Grulzul

Source: I've learned from certain ancient writings that this may not be the first time the Celestials have appeared in Craglorn!\n\nThese legends describe a link between Mundus and the stars, right here in Craglorn. Apex Stones, they call them.
Target: I've learned from certain ancient writings that this may not be the first time the Celestials have appeared in Craglorn!\n\nThese legends describe a link between Mundus and the stars, right here in Craglorn. Apex Stones, they call them.

Source: Perhaps you can help her, then. There was an attempt on Thane Fjora's life. Her housecarl, the bastard. The sergeant and her squad arrived just afterward, to investigate.
Target: Perhaps you can help her, then. There was an attempt on Thane Fjora's life. Her housecarl, the bastard. The sergeant and her squad arrived just afterward, to investigate.

Source: I've just arrived from <<1>>. Preparations are underway for my Arlie and I to be married! When I returned, the estates were deserted. Her family, the servant … gone! I don't know what could have happened to them!
Target: I've just arrived from <<1>>. Preparations are underway for my Arlie and I to be married! When I returned, the estates were deserted. Her family, the servant … gone! I don't know what could have happened to them!

Source: Baron Dorell considers Northpoint to be his seat of power. He has a number of holdings there, including a lucrative maritime endeavor.\n\nIt makes sense that Montclair would send Lleraya there. If they control Northpoint, they control the north.
Target: Baron Dorell considers Northpoint to be his seat of power. He has a number of holdings there, including a lucrative maritime endeavor.\n\nIt makes sense that Montclair would send Lleraya there. If they control Northpoint, they control the north.

Source: Magister Osanne. She searches the deeper chambers. \n\nWe broke into an ice cave and found an ore we had never seen. It seems to have magical properties. Before we could determine anything else, these thugs arrived.
Target: Magister Osanne. She searches the deeper chambers. \n\nWe broke into an ice cave and found an ore we had never seen. It seems to have magical properties. Before we could determine anything else, these thugs arrived.

Source: Yes. But how am I having this conversation? I mean, I feel different … I don't even think my heart's beating, but …. \n\nThen why am I not ambling about mindlessly trying to kill the living? Isn't that what undead do?
Target: Yes. But how am I having this conversation? I mean, I feel different … I don't even think my heart's beating, but …. \n\nThen why am I not ambling about mindlessly trying to kill the living? Isn't that what undead do?

Source: As our ship neared <<1:)>>, a black fog spread across the waters. Soon after, Maormer raiding parties attacked and boarded the ship.\n\nMany of my shipmates were slaughtered.
Target: As our ship neared <<1:)>>, a black fog spread across the waters. Soon after, Maormer raiding parties attacked and boarded the ship.\n\nMany of my shipmates were slaughtered.

Source: This Maormer whelp says <<1>> took the captain to a nearby cave, not far from where you saved me. And, he says, there's a back way out.
Target: This Maormer whelp says <<1>> took the captain to a nearby cave, not far from where you saved me. And, he says, there's a back way out.

Source: You could say that. I want to burn the Maormer sailboats. Make it difficult for them to attack other ships in distress. It's hard to sneak up on someone while rowing.\n\nHm. Interested in lighting some fires?
Target: You could say that. I want to burn the Maormer sailboats. Make it difficult for them to attack other ships in distress. It's hard to sneak up on someone while rowing.\n\nHm. Interested in lighting some fires?

Source: Thank you. The gods know I could use your help.\n\nIt's taking all my energy to maintain this projection. The Drublog captured me and my traveling companions. They're holding us prisoner in Jathsogur.
Target: Thank you. The gods know I could use your help.\n\nIt's taking all my energy to maintain this projection. The Drublog captured me and my traveling companions. They're holding us prisoner in Jathsogur.

Source: "Harass <<1>>. No casualties! Wear them down."\n\n"Return to camp if injured. Study the map on the back so you don't get lost."
Target: \\"Harass <<1>>. No casualties! Wear them down.\"\"\n\n\"\"Return to camp if injured. Study the map on the back so you don't get lost.\"\""

Source: The Orcthane Fildgor … his troops have commandeered the mine and taken our ore.\n\nThey force half of us to work and serve as hostages. Then at the end of the shift, they take our tools and keep the ore. My family is down there right now.
Target: The Orcthane Fildgor … his troops have commandeered the mine and taken our ore.\n\nThey force half of us to work and serve as hostages. Then at the end of the shift, they take our tools and keep the ore. My family is down there right now.

Source: I was working in the carnival near <<1>>. It wasn't a bad job, but the owner, <<2>>? Doesn't know what she's doing.\n\nWe came all the way from the Summerset Isles, and now the performers can't put on their acts.
Target: I was working in the carnival near <<1>>. It wasn't a bad job, but the owner, <<2>>? Doesn't know what she's doing.\n\nWe came all the way from the Summerset Isles, and now the performers can't put on their acts.

Source: <<1>>, along the Broken Coast. It's a quiet little town … the perfect place for a wedding.\n\nHead there and inform the locals of the impending nuptuals. I'll be along soon, to bring the Green Lady her Silvenar.
Target: <<1>>, along the Broken Coast. It's a quiet little town … the perfect place for a wedding.\n\nHead there and inform the locals of the impending nuptuals. I'll be along soon, to bring the Green Lady her Silvenar.

Source: <The desire to drink grows stronger as you pour the wine from the keg. The drink is clearly magically infused. Perhaps an alchemist in Riften can analyze it.>
Target: <The desire to drink grows stronger as you pour the wine from the keg. The drink is clearly magically infused. Perhaps an alchemist in Riften can analyze it.>

Source: The Worm Cult killed him to fuel their dark magic.\n\nMy Treva, and some of the farm hands … they're trapped, enslaved in the cult's Animus Geodes!
Target: The Worm Cult killed him to fuel their dark magic.\n\nMy Treva, and some of the farm hands … they're trapped, enslaved in the cult's Animus Geodes!

Source: <A barely legible sheaf of notes lies next to the campfire. Perhaps one of the residents left some clue as to their fate.>
Target: <A barely legible sheaf of notes lies next to the campfire. Perhaps one of the residents left some clue as to their fate.>

Source: My name is Treva, and I built the blasted farm with my own two hands. Those cult bastards murdered me and stuffed my family into their damned geodes.
Target: My name is Treva, and I built the blasted farm with my own two hands. Those cult bastards murdered me and stuffed my family into their damned geodes.

Source: Most of us won't go into the barrow these days. We prefer to let the dead rest undisturbed. The strange noises that have been coming from inside don't help, except for my fool brother who decided he should investigate.
Target: Most of us won't go into the barrow these days. We prefer to let the dead rest undisturbed. The strange noises that have been coming from inside don't help, except for my fool brother who decided he should investigate.

Source: QUEST: Divide and Conquer
Target: QUEST: Divide and Conquer

Source: Why do you say it's doomed?
Target: Why do you say it's doomed?

Source: Just a couple of things, really. Thunderbug hearts from the wild thunderbugs down the hill. And some maggots.\n\nAnd, well, if you want to know, there's something else bothering me.
Target: Just a couple of things, really. Thunderbug hearts from the wild thunderbugs down the hill. And some maggots.\n\nAnd, well, if you want to know, there's something else bothering me.

Source: Yeah, the Remly brothers. The three of us were hired by the village here to drive off the harpies infesting the cliffs. Those geniuses are supposed to be setting up harpy traps. I'm here to protect the encampment while they work.
Target: Yeah, the Remly brothers. The three of us were hired by the village here to drive off the harpies infesting the cliffs. Those geniuses are supposed to be setting up harpy traps. I'm here to protect the encampment while they work.

Source: We've done what we can for Shor's Stone. The villagers can deal with the aftermath. We have other concerns.\n\nWhile we were here, the Reachmen attacked Fallowstone Hall!
Target: We've done what we can for Shor's Stone. The villagers can deal with the aftermath. We have other concerns.\n\nWhile we were here, the Reachmen attacked Fallowstone Hall!

Source: Perhaps I can help?
Target: Perhaps I can help?

Source: Someone's let the mammoths out of their pen. They're acting drunk. Someone must have slipped rotmeth into their water again.\n\nA few of us got injured trying to sober them up.
Target: Someone's let the mammoths out of their pen. They're acting drunk. Someone must have slipped rotmeth into their water again.\n\nA few of us got injured trying to sober them up.

Source: Passing through? A tomb? Well, I hope you aren't here to rob my ancestors. If you are one of those adventuring types, maybe you can help. I followed a strange man down here only to be captured by him. He's doing something … unsavory here.
Target: Passing through? A tomb? Well, I hope you aren't here to rob my ancestors. If you are one of those adventuring types, maybe you can help. I followed a strange man down here only to be captured by him. He's doing something … unsavory here.

Source: My cousin, on my pa's side. Her father's missing, and the family says Yiri saw what happened. Problem is, he went missing during the attack. But he wasn't anywhere near the west wall.
Target: My cousin, on my pa's side. Her father's missing, and the family says Yiri saw what happened. Problem is, he went missing during the attack. But he wasn't anywhere near the west wall.

Source: My time as <<c:1>> has passed. When I died upon the shores of Pyandonea, I was drawn to rest in this sacred grove—Treehenge. All of my kindred rest here, since they first set foot upon Valenwood.\n\nSomething blocks my entrance. Something vile.
Target: My time as <<c:1>> has passed. When I died upon the shores of Pyandonea, I was drawn to rest in this sacred grove—Treehenge. All of my kindred rest here, since they first set foot upon Valenwood.\n\nSomething blocks my entrance. Something vile.

Source: We're Pact soldiers. We were sent here to clean out the bandits, but there's something strange going on here. Cult-like. This isn't your average patchwork band of thieves and murderers.\n\nThey took my brother Nathon below. You must free him.
Target: We're Pact soldiers. We were sent here to clean out the bandits, but there's something strange going on here. Cult-like. This isn't your average patchwork band of thieves and murderers.\n\nThey took my brother Nathon below. You must free him.

Source: I don't want to alarm Jomund, after all we've been through today. But I think that Magister Osanne sent word to the Orcrthane about the strange magical ore.  \n\nLooks like Filgdor sent someone to investigate. They set up a small camp down the road.
Target: I don't want to alarm Jomund, after all we've been through today. But I think that Magister Osanne sent word to the Orcrthane about the strange magical ore.  \n\nLooks like Filgdor sent someone to investigate. They set up a small camp down the road.

Source: <<1>> is the Dominion lifeline to <<2>>, and it's under siege.\n\n<<3>> is tasked with defending the city. He called for any available assistance, and you look like you fit the bill. It pays, I'm sure.
Target: <<1>> is the Dominion lifeline to <<2>>, and it's under siege.\n\n<<3>> is tasked with defending the city. He called for any available assistance, and you look like you fit the bill. It pays, I'm sure.

Source: I'm almost sorry we discovered that mysterious metal. I don't know what to do with it, but I don't want King Jorunn's enemies to have it, either.\n\nA friend of mine at Fort Amol might be able to tell us more about the metal.
Target: I'm almost sorry we discovered that mysterious metal. I don't know what to do with it, but I don't want King Jorunn's enemies to have it, either.\n\nA friend of mine at Fort Amol might be able to tell us more about the metal.

Source: The dead. They've haunted the place ever since Ranser's War. I'm not much of a reader, so I don't know all the details.\n\nYou should go around to the southeast and talk to Scholar Cantier. He'll talk your ear off. I know that from personal experience.
Target: The dead. They've haunted the place ever since Ranser's War. I'm not much of a reader, so I don't know all the details.\n\nYou should go around to the southeast and talk to Scholar Cantier. He'll talk your ear off. I know that from personal experience.

Source: They are building an army of Daedra! Their leader, that bastard, Thalik Wormfather stole Ysgramor's axe, Wuuthrad. He has roused the ghost giant Sinmur.
Target: They are building an army of Daedra! Their leader, that bastard, Thalik Wormfather stole Ysgramor's axe, Wuuthrad. He has roused the ghost giant Sinmur.

Source: The cultists, the Daedra. They overwhelm every force we send against them. These men and women need our help.
Target: The cultists, the Daedra. They overwhelm every force we send against them. These men and women need our help.

Source: Because that's the scenario here. I've tracked down a man named Gerard Althen.\n\nAlthen ordered the massacre of hundreds of innocent people during Ranser's War and then vanished. After ten years, I finally found him. I just need help bringing him in.
Target: Because that's the scenario here. I've tracked down a man named Gerard Althen.\n\nAlthen ordered the massacre of hundreds of innocent people during Ranser's War and then vanished. After ten years, I finally found him. I just need help bringing him in.

Source: I am. I overheard Magister Osanne say she sent word to the Orcthane about an unusual discovery.\n\nAfter I told Tridi what I heard, she decided to scout the area. We don't want any more surprises.
Target: I am. I overheard Magister Osanne say she sent word to the Orcthane about an unusual discovery.\n\nAfter I told Tridi what I heard, she decided to scout the area. We don't want any more surprises.

Source: "Eyes in Stormhold report killings in the holdfast."\n\n"Failure by local government to resolve these murders has led to a lack of confidence in <<1>> and the gerents beneath him. This is a weakness we would be well served to exploit."
Target: \\"Eyes in Stormhold report killings in the holdfast.\"\"\n\n\"\"Failure by local government to resolve these murders has led to a lack of confidence in <<1>> and the gerents beneath him. This is a weakness we would be well served to exploit.\"\""

Source: Me and the other refugees, we're from Crestshade. It was such a peaceful little town, before the mad Argonian came.\n\nHe released some kind of blood-curse, turned people into monsters. We fled, but my wife is still up there.
Target: Me and the other refugees, we're from Crestshade. It was such a peaceful little town, before the mad Argonian came.\n\nHe released some kind of blood-curse, turned people into monsters. We fled, but my wife is still up there.

Source: What do I need to do?
Target: What do I need to do?

Source: Were you asked to help fight Covenant soldiers?
