Source: Still itching for more adventure? Smashing! Have you ever wondered what would've happened if you'd woken up somewhere else? Washed up on a different beach?\n\nMy new mistress provided me with the means to help you, if you're up for the challenge!
Target: Still itching for more adventure? Smashing! Have you ever wondered what would've happened if you'd woken up somewhere else? Washed up on a different beach?\n\nMy new mistress provided me with the means to help you, if you're up for the challenge!

Source: Ha! Is that right?\n\nWell then. Sounds to me like you could be one of the Undaunted.
Target: Ha! Is that right?\n\nWell then. Sounds to me like you could be one of the Undaunted.

Source: If you aren't a soldier, I really shouldn't speak with you. They said we should send outsiders to <<1>>. She's in the tent just north of <<Ac:2>>.\n\nI'm sorry, I should really get back to fishing.
Target: If you aren't a soldier, I really shouldn't speak with you. They said we should send outsiders to <<1>>. She's in the tent just north of <<Ac:2>>.\n\nI'm sorry, I should really get back to fishing.

Source: I'm not supposed to talk with you. The soldiers told us to send all outsiders to <<1>>. She's in the Dominion tent, just beyond the northern barricade in <<Ac:2>>.\n\nI erect the spine of farewell, my friend.
Target: I'm not supposed to talk with you. The soldiers told us to send all outsiders to <<1>>. She's in the Dominion tent, just beyond the northern barricade in <<Ac:2>>.\n\nI erect the spine of farewell, my friend.

Source: I do not know exactly, but the ruins, the Hall of Heroes, this is a sacred place—only the gods themselves and the spirits of the fallen are permitted to walk there.
Target: I do not know exactly, but the ruins, the Hall of Heroes, this is a sacred place—only the gods themselves and the spirits of the fallen are permitted to walk there.

Source: "What ruin?" As if any other mattered. <<1>>. Sealed up tighter than an Ansei tomb. Twice as dangerous.\n\nThat's the kind of thing that happens when Daedric Princes start feuding with one another. Shame what happened to <<2>>, though.
Target: \\"What ruin?\"\" As if any other mattered. <<1>>. Sealed up tighter than an Ansei tomb. Twice as dangerous.\n\nThat's the kind of thing that happens when Daedric Princes start feuding with one another. Shame what happened to <<2>>
column4: though."

Source: Thank me? You're the one doing all the work, what with all your heroics and the derring-do! \n\nBut if you enjoyed that, there's more in store for you!
Target: Thank me? You're the one doing all the work, what with all your heroics and the derring-do! \n\nBut if you enjoyed that, there's more in store for you!

Source: You've probably fought—what—some mudcrabs and malnourished bandits?\n\nUndaunted tackle the big things. Scary things, found only in the dark places of the world. Things with flesh-eating-fists hungry for your face.
Target: You've probably fought—what—some mudcrabs and malnourished bandits?\n\nUndaunted tackle the big things. Scary things, found only in the dark places of the world. Things with flesh-eating-fists hungry for your face.

Source: Not so fast, my enthusiastic friend. My agents have learned that Reezal-Jul struck in the west and is still in the area.\n\nCaptain Janeve, Countess Tamrith's younger sister, has established a camp for displaced refugees. She must be warned about this.
Target: Not so fast, my enthusiastic friend. My agents have learned that Reezal-Jul struck in the west and is still in the area.\n\nCaptain Janeve, Countess Tamrith's younger sister, has established a camp for displaced refugees. She must be warned about this.

Source: The Worm Cult. Swarmed the farm, cutting and burning. Our screams must have alerted the giant camp nearby.\n\nThey went berserk and stomped down out of the hills. That's when I ran.
Target: The Worm Cult. Swarmed the farm, cutting and burning. Our screams must have alerted the giant camp nearby.\n\nThey went berserk and stomped down out of the hills. That's when I ran.

Source: The Worm Cult, Shor take them. Came out of nowhere, burning and killing. Our screams must have carried over the hill to the giant camp. They went berserk!
Target: The Worm Cult, Shor take them. Came out of nowhere, burning and killing. Our screams must have carried over the hill to the giant camp. They went berserk!

Source: Sorry, sorry. I thought you were supposed to find me. <<1>> has run us ragged for weeks. No wonder Rakhad quit. Her last assistant had the right idea!
Target: Sorry, sorry. I thought you were supposed to find me. <<1>> has run us ragged for weeks. No wonder Rakhad quit. Her last assistant had the right idea!

Source: You've an air of honesty about you. I'll have to trust you.\n\nThese folks are leaving Bangkorai and I need your help. Imperials attacked and stole some of their valuables. They're understandably jittery.
Target: You've an air of honesty about you. I'll have to trust you.\n\nThese folks are leaving Bangkorai and I need your help. Imperials attacked and stole some of their valuables. They're understandably jittery.

Source: Of course, and now you'll have some help. I've brought as many Lion Guard as I could muster. We were hoping to spill some Reachman blood for old times' sake, but the Imperials will suffice.\n\nAre you ready to retake the garrison, then?
Target: Of course, and now you'll have some help. I've brought as many Lion Guard as I could muster. We were hoping to spill some Reachman blood for old times' sake, but the Imperials will suffice.\n\nAre you ready to retake the garrison, then?

Source: An army of Reachmen is just a day's march from the city, and when they get there, it's not going to be pretty.\n\nWe've done all we can, but frankly I think it may have been in vain. The knights we sent haven't returned or sent word.
Target: An army of Reachmen is just a day's march from the city, and when they get there, it's not going to be pretty.\n\nWe've done all we can, but frankly I think it may have been in vain. The knights we sent haven't returned or sent word.

Source: Yes. There is something you could do for me, outsider. I have a cousin who left the sisterhood and returned to the stinking pile of rocks that is Evermore. \n\nIf you are going there, find her and tell her to leave the city now.
Target: Yes. There is something you could do for me, outsider. I have a cousin who left the sisterhood and returned to the stinking pile of rocks that is Evermore. \n\nIf you are going there, find her and tell her to leave the city now.

Source: Captain Helenus and her Imperial troops stole the Old Tower right from under us. We returned from our patrol to find the position taken by Imperial runts!\n\nThey must have known we were … weak. They must have been warned.
Target: Captain Helenus and her Imperial troops stole the Old Tower right from under us. We returned from our patrol to find the position taken by Imperial runts!\n\nThey must have known we were … weak. They must have been warned.

Source: Our orders were to look for Redguard insurgents in these ruins. Sounded simple enough … but then the spiders showed up. Legionnaires disappeared.\n\nBy the time we figured out what was going on, two-thirds of my company was gone. Please, help me.
Target: Our orders were to look for Redguard insurgents in these ruins. Sounded simple enough … but then the spiders showed up. Legionnaires disappeared.\n\nBy the time we figured out what was going on, two-thirds of my company was gone. Please, help me.

Source: <A skeleton hangs here, picked clean by birds. Based on the condition of the rope this individual seems to have died fairly recently. The only object of note on the deceased is a curiously glowing amulet.>
Target: <A skeleton hangs here, picked clean by birds. Based on the condition of the rope this individual seems to have died fairly recently. The only object of note on the deceased is a curiously glowing amulet.>

Source: We are growing concerned with the number of refugees coming through the pass. We aren't sufficiently equipped to screen every group that comes through. This is a request for more men. Please take it to Seneschal Andras.
Target: We are growing concerned with the number of refugees coming through the pass. We aren't sufficiently equipped to screen every group that comes through. This is a request for more men. Please take it to Seneschal Andras.

Source: We need to warn the settlements west of here. You put a stop to Stral and the Reachmen, but the Worms are a far bigger menace.
Target: We need to warn the settlements west of here. You put a stop to Stral and the Reachmen, but the Worms are a far bigger menace.

Source: QUEST: Waste of the Wood
Target: QUEST: Waste of the Wood

Source: I must make for the ancient site known as Tanzelwil. Normally, a new monarch communes quietly with the dead.\n\nWe're supposed to show willingness to heed the wisdom of our ancestors.
Target: I must make for the ancient site known as Tanzelwil. Normally, a new monarch communes quietly with the dead.\n\nWe're supposed to show willingness to heed the wisdom of our ancestors.

Source: I'm not entirely certain. But it does look menacing, doesn't it? \n\nThese stones appeared overnight, at key locations throughout the ruins. It's no coincidence that the ancestral spirits went mad that very day. I'm certain there's a connection.
Target: I'm not entirely certain. But it does look menacing, doesn't it? \n\nThese stones appeared overnight, at key locations throughout the ruins. It's no coincidence that the ancestral spirits went mad that very day. I'm certain there's a connection.

Source: Just keeping a low profile. Since you found me, want to help me get some revenge?\n\nThe Black Dagger bandits in Hackdirt wiped out my gang. Kill ten of them and I'll reward you.
Target: Just keeping a low profile. Since you found me, want to help me get some revenge?\n\nThe Black Dagger bandits in Hackdirt wiped out my gang. Kill ten of them and I'll reward you.

Source: Your valor strikes a mighty bell! The heroes have come here themselves—Makela Leki, Derik Hallin, and both Frandar and Divad Hunding!\n\nTheir spirits have come here, to meet you, to challenge you, and to teach you.
Target: Your valor strikes a mighty bell! The heroes have come here themselves—Makela Leki, Derik Hallin, and both Frandar and Divad Hunding!\n\nTheir spirits have come here, to meet you, to challenge you, and to teach you.

Source: Maormer raiding parties attacked and boarded our ship in the midst of a black fog.\n\nIn the chaos, I saw them kill many of my shipmates. So many dead.
Target: Maormer raiding parties attacked and boarded our ship in the midst of a black fog.\n\nIn the chaos, I saw them kill many of my shipmates. So many dead.

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: Maormer boarded us as our ship neared <<1:)>>. How they found us in that black fog, I'll never know.\n\nThey slaughtered most of the crew. Only a few of us escaped.
Target: Maormer boarded us as our ship neared <<1:)>>. How they found us in that black fog, I'll never know.\n\nThey slaughtered most of the crew. Only a few of us escaped.

Source: The Black Daggers have been plaguing this part of Cyrodiil. With the empire at war, there's no one to stop them. \n\nA few days ago, they broke into the priory and stole the Claw of Akatosh.
Target: The Black Daggers have been plaguing this part of Cyrodiil. With the empire at war, there's no one to stop them. \n\nA few days ago, they broke into the priory and stole the Claw of Akatosh.

Source: An errand of mercy. Two of my friends—Laudine and Varius—were taken by vampires in Lipsand Tarn. By now, they are dead, or worse. No one should suffer such a fate.\n\nI beg you to find their bodies and burn them.
Target: An errand of mercy. Two of my friends—Laudine and Varius—were taken by vampires in Lipsand Tarn. By now, they are dead, or worse. No one should suffer such a fate.\n\nI beg you to find their bodies and burn them.

Source: Never mind me! It was a balance, a sacred trust. The Worm Cult came and broke that trust with the mammoths, and now ….\n\nWe were simply observers! But they struck, destroying countless documents ….
Target: Never mind me! It was a balance, a sacred trust. The Worm Cult came and broke that trust with the mammoths, and now ….\n\nWe were simply observers! But they struck, destroying countless documents ….

Source: <<1>>. Again. I bet the Worm Cult caught her. She said she'd meet me here after going back for <<2>>. They're both long overdue.\n\nI'd go back, but someone's got to keep watch. Maybe you could help me.
Target: <<1>>. Again. I bet the Worm Cult caught her. She said she'd meet me here after going back for <<2>>. They're both long overdue.\n\nI'd go back, but someone's got to keep watch. Maybe you could help me.

Source: Slow down. Who took whom?
Target: Slow down. Who took whom?

Source: They're camped all over Abamath, preparing some dark ritual. They planned to sacrifice us.\n\n<<1>> helped me escape. She was right behind me! Please, I'm too weak to face them alone. Will you search their camps for her?
Target: They're camped all over Abamath, preparing some dark ritual. They planned to sacrifice us.\n\n<<1>> helped me escape. She was right behind me! Please, I'm too weak to face them alone. Will you search their camps for her?

Source: The Red Rooks took control of the mines when they arrived. They work the miners night and day. And they also use the mines as a prison for anyone who causes trouble. \n\nCouncilor Lia, Smith Suriel, and Len the Innkeeper were all sent into the mines.
Target: The Red Rooks took control of the mines when they arrived. They work the miners night and day. And they also use the mines as a prison for anyone who causes trouble. \n\nCouncilor Lia, Smith Suriel, and Len the Innkeeper were all sent into the mines.

Source: We came to Vernim expecting to find Reachmen, those stinking beasts. Instead we found the place ripe with the smell of necromancy. The Worm Cult is here, in Skyrim.
Target: We came to Vernim expecting to find Reachmen, those stinking beasts. Instead we found the place ripe with the smell of necromancy. The Worm Cult is here, in Skyrim.

Source: Did you hear me? This is no common spell. It was cast by Altmer wizards long since dead. This is a true curse. The task is beyond you.\n\nOf course, a fool would still try! Do as you wish. I won't harbor faint hope.
Target: Did you hear me? This is no common spell. It was cast by Altmer wizards long since dead. This is a true curse. The task is beyond you.\n\nOf course, a fool would still try! Do as you wish. I won't harbor faint hope.

Source: Riften … giant … attacked! Pact army in pursuit … many wounded. <<1>> leading recovery effort. North of town. We need help.
Target: Riften … giant … attacked! Pact army in pursuit … many wounded. <<1>> leading recovery effort. North of town. We need help.

Source: Well, I discovered this fabulous portal in the Ayleid ruins. I sent my assistant through, and … it was a mistake.\n\nThe portal apparently leads to somewhere in the Grahtwood, and … basically, he returned with the Aldmeri army at his heels.
Target: Well, I discovered this fabulous portal in the Ayleid ruins. I sent my assistant through, and … it was a mistake.\n\nThe portal apparently leads to somewhere in the Grahtwood, and … basically, he returned with the Aldmeri army at his heels.

Source: Well, it's not just the Reachmen. The Worm Cult haunts these woods. They perform foul rituals amid the old stones.
Target: Well, it's not just the Reachmen. The Worm Cult haunts these woods. They perform foul rituals amid the old stones.

Source: Sort of. <<1>> has translated Sheogorath's tome, but we're having some trouble understanding it. She may need your assistance.  Seek her out, soon as you can.
Target: Sort of. <<1>> has translated Sheogorath's tome, but we're having some trouble understanding it. She may need your assistance.  Seek her out, soon as you can.

Source: <<1>> has finished final analysis of the tomes! We're ready to get my island back!
Target: <<1>> has finished final analysis of the tomes! We're ready to get my island back!

Source: Now our enemies stoop so low as to ally themselves with Daedra?\n\nThe poison will kill the King before we can get him to the healers in Windhelm. And no one here can cure a poison like this. We need to ask the Ternion monks for help.
Target: Now our enemies stoop so low as to ally themselves with Daedra?\n\nThe poison will kill the King before we can get him to the healers in Windhelm. And no one here can cure a poison like this. We need to ask the Ternion monks for help.

Source: Business? We have no business, stranger! No war, no Orcs, and no giants. We just relax and enjoy the hot springs.\n\nBut now that you mention it ….
Target: Business? We have no business, stranger! No war, no Orcs, and no giants. We just relax and enjoy the hot springs.\n\nBut now that you mention it ….

Source: A stranger offers aid? You dare to put your own life in danger for the benefit of others?\n\nThat sounds too good to be true.
Target: A stranger offers aid? You dare to put your own life in danger for the benefit of others?\n\nThat sounds too good to be true.

Source: The Sigil represents our bond. The forest and my clan … we have an understanding. We take wood, we build. \n\nBut as we do, we honor the forest. And the spirit of the forest protects us.
Target: The Sigil represents our bond. The forest and my clan … we have an understanding. We take wood, we build. \n\nBut as we do, we honor the forest. And the spirit of the forest protects us.

Source: Can't you smell the smoke? Silsailen is under attack! I barely got my father out alive! The Canonreeve, almost slain!\n\nThese brutes may wear the uniforms of the First Auridon Marines, but they're imposters.
Target: Can't you smell the smoke? Silsailen is under attack! I barely got my father out alive! The Canonreeve, almost slain!\n\nThese brutes may wear the uniforms of the First Auridon Marines, but they're imposters.

Source: If there are no more attacks, the tree will be fine. \n\nA hunter, <<1>>, came looking for help while you were inside the tree. I'm ashamed to say we turned her away. We couldn't divert our attention when the outcome of your battle was still unclear.
Target: If there are no more attacks, the tree will be fine. \n\nA hunter, <<1>>, came looking for help while you were inside the tree. I'm ashamed to say we turned her away. We couldn't divert our attention when the outcome of your battle was still unclear.

Source: I'm sorry?
Target: I'm sorry?

Source: We stand upon a rift between the planes. Here, the border between the living and dead blurs.\n\nI died many years ago. During the Akaviri invasion. Yet here I stand, hoping that help will arrive.
Target: We stand upon a rift between the planes. Here, the border between the living and dead blurs.\n\nI died many years ago. During the Akaviri invasion. Yet here I stand, hoping that help will arrive.

Source: An excellent question, for which I have no answer. \n\nMy dear sister, your Queen, brought us here to perform a ceremonial ritual. It's a bit of political theater, really. Gain the blessings of the dead and all that rubbish.
Target: An excellent question, for which I have no answer. \n\nMy dear sister, your Queen, brought us here to perform a ceremonial ritual. It's a bit of political theater, really. Gain the blessings of the dead and all that rubbish.

Source: That fiend Alasan is here!  With Uwafa dead, he has the Withered Hand dedicated to his own twisted designs. \n\nHe seeks power. The reason they aren't raising these people—it's because Alasan plans to turn himself into a lich!
Target: That fiend Alasan is here!  With Uwafa dead, he has the Withered Hand dedicated to his own twisted designs. \n\nHe seeks power. The reason they aren't raising these people—it's because Alasan plans to turn himself into a lich!

Source: Ha! Confidence and swagger! I like that. \n\nWell, let's see you beat my record. Even Eastmarch's best hunter over there couldn't catch that many rabbits in under a minute. But I'll make it easy for you. One rabbit keeps eluding me. Nab it and you win.
Target: Ha! Confidence and swagger! I like that. \n\nWell, let's see you beat my record. Even Eastmarch's best hunter over there couldn't catch that many rabbits in under a minute. But I'll make it easy for you. One rabbit keeps eluding me. Nab it and you win.

Source: So you say. But you weren't just stabbed in the back by House Montclair troops!\n\nWe barely managed to make it to this tower and set up a defense after the traitorous scum attacked us.
Target: So you say. But you weren't just stabbed in the back by House Montclair troops!\n\nWe barely managed to make it to this tower and set up a defense after the traitorous scum attacked us.

Source: I'll travel to Dragonhome and find your belongings.
Target: I'll travel to Dragonhome and find your belongings.

Source: Name's Bragur. I tend the books and artifacts here. A thousand stories in every one. You're up and around. Ask your help? Pint of mead in it for you! If I ever go drinking again.
Target: Name's Bragur. I tend the books and artifacts here. A thousand stories in every one. You're up and around. Ask your help? Pint of mead in it for you! If I ever go drinking again.

Source: Lady Laurent, a Daggerfall noble who collects ancient artifacts. She's come to the tombs in search of lost treasures.\n\nI only hope she hasn't gotten into trouble again.
Target: Lady Laurent, a Daggerfall noble who collects ancient artifacts. She's come to the tombs in search of lost treasures.\n\nI only hope she hasn't gotten into trouble again.

Source: <Take the note.>
Target: <Take the note.>

Source: Truly? This is the last time I trust an order to that Bosmer. It fits, though. Ezduiin has been one disaster after another. First, the spirits. Now the supplies. And to top it off, my top scholar and her team are missing!
Target: Truly? This is the last time I trust an order to that Bosmer. It fits, though. Ezduiin has been one disaster after another. First, the spirits. Now the supplies. And to top it off, my top scholar and her team are missing!

Source: I'm afraid not. There was just no easy solution. Perhaps to call everyone inside the castle and lock the doors? \n\nKing Fahara'jad would not have liked that. Of course, the king will be extremely disturbed to hear what has befallen here regardless.
Target: I'm afraid not. There was just no easy solution. Perhaps to call everyone inside the castle and lock the doors? \n\nKing Fahara'jad would not have liked that. Of course, the king will be extremely disturbed to hear what has befallen here regardless.

Source: All right, I'll find this incantation and dispel the illusion.
Target: All right, I'll find this incantation and dispel the illusion.

Source: A fair day, indeed. I'm studying the spirits that now haunt these ruins. I believe they can be released. Sent on to their final reward.\n\nPerhaps you'd be willing to help with an experiment?
Target: A fair day, indeed. I'm studying the spirits that now haunt these ruins. I believe they can be released. Sent on to their final reward.\n\nPerhaps you'd be willing to help with an experiment?

Source: The leader of the dig? The one who ordered the supplies? You're an odd merchant.\n\nYou'll find him at the camp just up the path. Fair day.
Target: The leader of the dig? The one who ordered the supplies? You're an odd merchant.\n\nYou'll find him at the camp just up the path. Fair day.

Source: Teldur asked Canonreeve Valano for a word outside. When they didn't return, I went to look for them. I caught a glimpse of them heading towards the manor. Teldur was holding a knife to my father's side!
Target: Teldur asked Canonreeve Valano for a word outside. When they didn't return, I went to look for them. I caught a glimpse of them heading towards the manor. Teldur was holding a knife to my father's side!

Source: I can go to Chillwind Depths and help your family.
Target: I can go to Chillwind Depths and help your family.

Source: Maormer pirates. They've taken South Beacon. My captain, my crew. All captured.\n\nThey took control of the lighthouse. This is bad. With South Beacon as a staging area they can raid the Summerset Isles at will.
Target: Maormer pirates. They've taken South Beacon. My captain, my crew. All captured.\n\nThey took control of the lighthouse. This is bad. With South Beacon as a staging area they can raid the Summerset Isles at will.

Target: <Examine Notice>

Target: QUEST: Clean Up the Dead

Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: Aye! Most come just to drink and dance. But a brave few come to earn the title of Geirmund's Guardian.\n\nIf you're interested, talk to the Thane. He's our host, after all.
Target: Aye! Most come just to drink and dance. But a brave few come to earn the title of Geirmund's Guardian.\n\nIf you're interested, talk to the Thane. He's our host, after all.

Source: I'll get rid of the Dwarven colossus and any scrap nearby.

Source: I'll just write that down. By order of the First Auridon Marines, your presence in Vulkhel Guard has been registered.\n\nDo your best to stay out of trouble and out of the way. Fare you well.
Target: I'll just write that down. By order of the First Auridon Marines, your presence in Vulkhel Guard has been registered.\n\nDo your best to stay out of trouble and out of the way. Fare you well.

Source: You're damned right there's something wrong! I needed to sail for Velyn Harbor hours ago. I've got cargo still to load, and crew members deep in their cups around town. \n\nI'd let the guard have the lot of them, if I could afford it.
Target: You're damned right there's something wrong! I needed to sail for Velyn Harbor hours ago. I've got cargo still to load, and crew members deep in their cups around town. \n\nI'd let the guard have the lot of them, if I could afford it.

Source: What would you have me do, stranger? You realize our people, and my guards, are very superstitious about this kind of thing? They will not fight the undead.\n\nI must confess, I am at something of a loss here.
Target: What would you have me do, stranger? You realize our people, and my guards, are very superstitious about this kind of thing? They will not fight the undead.\n\nI must confess, I am at something of a loss here.

Source: She sent word. She's moved to protect the Queen. That'll be at the manor house.\n\nStars guide your steps now.
Target: She sent word. She's moved to protect the Queen. That'll be at the manor house.\n\nStars guide your steps now.

Source: So glad you asked! In a word: poison. Well, poisoned mead. Well, over-fermented mead.\n\nHere, just take this brew. It's the key to the door you're about to open.
Target: So glad you asked! In a word: poison. Well, poisoned mead. Well, over-fermented mead.\n\nHere, just take this brew. It's the key to the door you're about to open.

Source: Jakaral, Logod, and I went to the giant camp near Ivarstead. We had a few meads, and well, we thought we could charm the beasts with our music. Like in the tales?\n\nIt didn't go well.
Target: Jakaral, Logod, and I went to the giant camp near Ivarstead. We had a few meads, and well, we thought we could charm the beasts with our music. Like in the tales?\n\nIt didn't go well.

Target: <Examine Notice>

Target: I'll gather some forces and deal with these harrowstoms.

Target: Worm Cultists! Captain Viveka led our patrol against their camp but they ambushed us. We tried to fight our way out. I'm the only one who escaped. The others are either dead or captive.

Target: If you go north, you should be able to catch up with the Lion Guard forces.\n\nFind an officer and tell him what we learned. Knowing Faolchu's weakness might make all the difference.

Source: Want to get knocked about, eh? Lots of folk around looking for a brawl. Go pick a few.\n\nReport back once you've knocked in some teeth.
Target: Want to get knocked about, eh? Lots of folk around looking for a brawl. Go pick a few.\n\nReport back once you've knocked in some teeth.

Source: Ahh, yes. Like the skalds of old, this will be a trial of riddles and rhymes.\n\nI tell you the riddle. The answer to each can be found around the island. You find it, place it in this sack, and bring it to me. Got it?
Target: Ahh, yes. Like the skalds of old, this will be a trial of riddles and rhymes.\n\nI tell you the riddle. The answer to each can be found around the island. You find it, place it in this sack, and bring it to me. Got it?

Target: The Red Rooks have taken over Crosswych. I plan to help these people get back their town. I've roused some of them, but we still don't have the numbers to face the bandits.\n\nMy … revenge … starts here. I will find a way to make the bandits pay.

Source: Thrice-damned lowlifes are no marines, I can tell you that much. In fact, Commander Tendil's detachment should have been here a long time ago. I think they were ambushed.

Source: I hope so. An old friend of mine, Captain Minwe, died and was buried near Narsinfel ruins. But someone's raised her, to haunt the ruins. I'd like her to be at rest. You interested in granting her some peace?
Target: I hope so. An old friend of mine, Captain Minwe, died and was buried near Narsinfel ruins. But someone's raised her, to haunt the ruins. I'd like her to be at rest. You interested in granting her some peace?

Target: Freezing to death. You? Jorunn dispatched me to follow a group of cultists. The damned cats didn't know about my mission. Cut me up bad. \n\nI felt like I was going to be fine … until I ran out of wood. It's right over there. Taunting me.

Source: I planned to meet my friend Valinwe in Aldcroft after I recovered the keep's treasures. She's in the Mages Guild. I suppose you could tell her what you found.\n\nAnd tell her what happened to me, I guess.
Target: I planned to meet my friend Valinwe in Aldcroft after I recovered the keep's treasures. She's in the Mages Guild. I suppose you could tell her what you found.\n\nAnd tell her what happened to me, I guess.

Source: I should take the stolen items to the Wayrest Guard Captain.
Target: I should take the stolen items to the Wayrest Guard Captain.

Source: I await your orders.
Target: I await your orders.

Source: At your service, Grand Warlord.
Target: At your service, Grand Warlord.

Source: Command me, Grand Warlord.
Target: Command me, Grand Warlord.

Source: Where's Deleyn's Mill?
Target: Where's Deleyn's Mill?

Source: Tell me what to do.
Target: Tell me what to do.

Source: I am yours to command, Grand Warlord.
Target: I am yours to command, Grand Warlord.

Source: There is. I maintain vigil here to ensure that certain ancient heroes … let's just say, if they're raised, that's a problem.\n\nWith what's happened here, I need someone to check their graves. If they're up and about, they need to be put down.
Target: There is. I maintain vigil here to ensure that certain ancient heroes … let's just say, if they're raised, that's a problem.\n\nWith what's happened here, I need someone to check their graves. If they're up and about, they need to be put down.

Source: Isn't the Covenant sending troops?
Target: Isn't the Covenant sending troops?

Source: Yes. I've heard of the Midnight Union.
Target: Yes. I've heard of the Midnight Union.

Source: What can I do to help?
Target: What can I do to help?

Source: I am ready to serve.
Target: I am ready to serve.

Source: I'll see to it.
Target: I'll see to it.

Source: Where is she?
Target: Where is she?

Source: The Ansei Wards? Stolen? There is no way … the Impervious Vault … how? \n\nThis does explain how they raised the consecrated dead, though. It also explains why Tu'whacca is so angry. He speaks to me. He says the temple must be cleansed—and now!
Target: The Ansei Wards? Stolen? There is no way … the Impervious Vault … how? \n\nThis does explain how they raised the consecrated dead, though. It also explains why Tu'whacca is so angry. He speaks to me. He says the temple must be cleansed—and now!

Source: Where's your father?
Target: Where's your father?

Source: What kind of evidence are you looking for?
Target: What kind of evidence are you looking for?

Source: Do you know how to free him?
Target: Do you know how to free him?

Source: Then you have to go! They're doing the same thing to her they wanted to do to me, but worse!\n\nThere's something about that scroll… Please, get that scroll and find a way to pull her back. You have to!
Target: Then you have to go! They're doing the same thing to her they wanted to do to me, but worse!\n\nThere's something about that scroll… Please, get that scroll and find a way to pull her back. You have to!

Source: The Red Rook enforcers have threatened, extorted, or beaten us at every turn. They claim it's for our own protection, but they just want our gold. They're not even honest about their thievery!\n\nI say it's time to fight back.
Target: The Red Rook enforcers have threatened, extorted, or beaten us at every turn. They claim it's for our own protection, but they just want our gold. They're not even honest about their thievery!\n\nI say it's time to fight back.

Source: Maybe you didn't hear me. The city has fallen. The werewolves have overrun our siege camp. \n\nWe're regrouping for a counterattack, but I think it's a lost cause. You can't just charge in there.
Target: Maybe you didn't hear me. The city has fallen. The werewolves have overrun our siege camp. \n\nWe're regrouping for a counterattack, but I think it's a lost cause. You can't just charge in there.

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: I seek a challenge.
Target: I seek a challenge.

Source: He's taken over the mayor's house. Since the resistance started, he never leaves the place. You'll have to fight through his personal guards to reach him. \n\nFortunately, you'll have some help, if you want.
Target: He's taken over the mayor's house. Since the resistance started, he never leaves the place. You'll have to fight through his personal guards to reach him. \n\nFortunately, you'll have some help, if you want.

Source: When the Pearl is uncovered, the time of Sep's Hunger will be over, and water will run from the Pearl all over the dead skins, and the Hungry Stomach will at last be full.\n\nThe Spawn of Satakal are weakened by the waters. They are hungry.
Target: When the Pearl is uncovered, the time of Sep's Hunger will be over, and water will run from the Pearl all over the dead skins, and the Hungry Stomach will at last be full.\n\nThe Spawn of Satakal are weakened by the waters. They are hungry.

Source: The damned Red Rooks are what happened! They're trying to turn our town into their base of operations.\n\nThey took over the mine and threaten or kill anyone who gets in their way. Tamien Sellan is organizing a resistance to take back Crosswych!
Target: The damned Red Rooks are what happened! They're trying to turn our town into their base of operations.\n\nThey took over the mine and threaten or kill anyone who gets in their way. Tamien Sellan is organizing a resistance to take back Crosswych!

Target: What can I do to help?

Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: In exactly just a few moments, a wind storm will appear right over there, and you, my friend … you will race it across the desert.
Target: In exactly just a few moments, a wind storm will appear right over there, and you, my friend … you will race it across the desert.

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: <Examine Notice>
Target: <Examine Notice>

Source: I'm an Orc. Don't laugh—it's true.\n\nI just got cheated by this damn Baandari potion-maker! She sold me a potion that turned me into … this! A puny little monkey!
Target: I'm an Orc. Don't laugh—it's true.\n\nI just got cheated by this damn Baandari potion-maker! She sold me a potion that turned me into … this! A puny little monkey!

Source: Where should I go?
Target: Where should I go?

Source: What do you want me to do?
Target: What do you want me to do?

Source: Where can I get some?
Target: Where can I get some?

Source: What can I do to help?
Target: What can I do to help?

Source: How can I buy you some time?
Target: How can I buy you some time?

Source: Where do you want me?
Target: Where do you want me?

Source: What do you need to make these poultices?
Target: What do you need to make these poultices?

Source: What can be done?
Target: What can be done?

Source: Why?
Target: Why?

Source: Gorgath Deadeye is after a Redguard called Varnedo. Rumor has Varnedo in Ivarstead and Gorgath will give me a reward for tracking him down.
Target: Gorgath Deadeye is after a Redguard called Varnedo. Rumor has Varnedo in Ivarstead and Gorgath will give me a reward for tracking him down.

Source: Sounds like trouble. Want me to look into it?
Target: Sounds like trouble. Want me to look into it?

Source: The Spirit Wardens of Pariah Abbey. They dabble in daedric rituals, but they are benevolent.\n\nSpeak to Brother Muran at the abbey. Ask him if the appearance of this Omen should be cause for wider concerns. If so, we should warn High King Emeric.
Target: The Spirit Wardens of Pariah Abbey. They dabble in daedric rituals, but they are benevolent.\n\nSpeak to Brother Muran at the abbey. Ask him if the appearance of this Omen should be cause for wider concerns. If so, we should warn High King Emeric.

Source: Let's do it.
Target: Let's do it.

Source: And how will you do this?
Target: And how will you do this?

Source: Can I do anything to aid you now?
Target: Can I do anything to aid you now?

Source: "Circle of mages"?
Target: \\"Circle of mages\"\"?"

Source: I'll cut you loose.
Target: I'll cut you loose.

Source: What's the plan?
Target: What's the plan?

Source: No. Tu'whacca is quiet now. He is not worried about you. He is more worried about me getting the temple cleaned up.\n\nI have a suggestion though. I think you should start your search in the city of Bergama.
Target: No. Tu'whacca is quiet now. He is not worried about you. He is more worried about me getting the temple cleaned up.\n\nI have a suggestion though. I think you should start your search in the city of Bergama.

Source: Tu'whacca says you will have the pleasure of killing this Uwafa … with his help, of course.\n\nFirst, you must light the final brazier over there, then Tu'whacca's Breath will come.
Target: Tu'whacca says you will have the pleasure of killing this Uwafa … with his help, of course.\n\nFirst, you must light the final brazier over there, then Tu'whacca's Breath will come.

Source: Is that how you got captured? Consecrating bones?
Target: Is that how you got captured? Consecrating bones?

Source: I am ready.
Target: I am ready.

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: What are your orders, Grand Warlord?
Target: What are your orders, Grand Warlord?

Source: I could scout the camp. What should I look for?
Target: I could scout the camp. What should I look for?

Source: What's so important about this piece of coral?
Target: What's so important about this piece of coral?

Source: I'll stand with you, Holgunn.
Target: I'll stand with you, Holgunn.

Source: I'll speak with General Godrun.
Target: I'll speak with General Godrun.

Source: I could talk to them for you.
Target: I could talk to them for you.

Source: No one else can take charge of Wind Keep?
Target: No one else can take charge of Wind Keep?

Source: But now the spirits are blocking you?
Target: But now the spirits are blocking you?

Source: A crazy person on the beach directed me toward the bridge into Castle Rilis. Said people claiming to be relatives of Rilis the Twelfth were searching through the ruins. I should look into this.
Target: A crazy person on the beach directed me toward the bridge into Castle Rilis. Said people claiming to be relatives of Rilis the Twelfth were searching through the ruins. I should look into this.

Source: But you've refused them all?
Target: But you've refused them all?

Source: A Lion Guard initiate, Recruit Gorak, is lost in the swamp outside of Aldcroft. He was apparently trying to recover a military dispatch when he went missing.
Target: A Lion Guard initiate, Recruit Gorak, is lost in the swamp outside of Aldcroft. He was apparently trying to recover a military dispatch when he went missing.

Source: I ran across a Lion Guard recruit who had been captured by the Bloodthorn cult in the swamps outside of Aldcroft. He wants me to help him complete his mission.
Target: I ran across a Lion Guard recruit who had been captured by the Bloodthorn cult in the swamps outside of Aldcroft. He wants me to help him complete his mission.

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: Why tell me this?
Target: Why tell me this?

Source: I found a staff with Nord markings. Perhaps someone at Fallowstone Hall can identify it.
Target: I found a staff with Nord markings. Perhaps someone at Fallowstone Hall can identify it.

Source: <This amulet is inscribed with the name of the fallen soldier. Other Pact bodies may also have identifying amulets.>
Target: <This amulet is inscribed with the name of the fallen soldier. Other Pact bodies may also have identifying amulets.>

Source: The guild has accepted an unusual contract. We've agreed to eradicate Daedric Anchors when they drop from the sky. Wherever they appear, Molag Bal's minions soon follow.
Target: The guild has accepted an unusual contract. We've agreed to eradicate Daedric Anchors when they drop from the sky. Wherever they appear, Molag Bal's minions soon follow.

Source: A Redguard force made landfall and assaulted Velyn Harbor! They must've made a deal with the Drublog clan of Wood Orcs, as they attacked from the hills at the same time.\n\n<<1>> was at the docks. She's either dead or cut off. That leaves me in charge.
Target: A Redguard force made landfall and assaulted Velyn Harbor! They must've made a deal with the Drublog clan of Wood Orcs, as they attacked from the hills at the same time.\n\n<<1>> was at the docks. She's either dead or cut off. That leaves me in charge.

Source: Oh, it will not be me. Or you, I'm afraid. We extend this courtesy to our Gold Coast friends.\n\nI have a powder that causes deep sleep for many days. Afterwards, the user is too groggy to move, much less fight.
Target: Oh, it will not be me. Or you, I'm afraid. We extend this courtesy to our Gold Coast friends.\n\nI have a powder that causes deep sleep for many days. Afterwards, the user is too groggy to move, much less fight.

Source: <<1>>, the leader of the Drublog. I didn't realize what he'd done until I got in here. When it was too late ….\n\nI bet he's in the town hall—the big, unburnt building behind this one.
Target: <<1>>, the leader of the Drublog. I didn't realize what he'd done until I got in here. When it was too late ….\n\nI bet he's in the town hall—the big, unburnt building behind this one.

Source: While you were aiding the King, a runner arrived from Fort Morvunskar. The fort is under attack! Fildgor and the Stormfist clan are certainly behind the attack. It can't be mere coincidence!\n\nWindhelm must be protected, but we can't abandon the fort.
Target: While you were aiding the King, a runner arrived from Fort Morvunskar. The fort is under attack! Fildgor and the Stormfist clan are certainly behind the attack. It can't be mere coincidence!\n\nWindhelm must be protected, but we can't abandon the fort.

Source: Fildgor Orcthane and his Stormfists! Nothing but cowards and thieves, if you ask me.\n\nSoldiers are supposed to be honorable, noble. But they slaughtered the Voljar family. They killed unarmed civilians! And they killed my brother's wife.
Target: Fildgor Orcthane and his Stormfists! Nothing but cowards and thieves, if you ask me.\n\nSoldiers are supposed to be honorable, noble. But they slaughtered the Voljar family. They killed unarmed civilians! And they killed my brother's wife.

Source: I hired the Gold Coast mercenaries, just beyond our gates. For protection. But now, they're more of a threat than anything else.\n\nSoon, they'll tire of our excuses.
Target: I hired the Gold Coast mercenaries, just beyond our gates. For protection. But now, they're more of a threat than anything else.\n\nSoon, they'll tire of our excuses.

Source: What? Who do you think …? Oh … you want to help me?\n\nHow generous of you. I actually could use help. I'm a traveler, you see. I was touring the residential district when the Drublog attacked.
Target: What? Who do you think …? Oh … you want to help me?\n\nHow generous of you. I actually could use help. I'm a traveler, you see. I was touring the residential district when the Drublog attacked.

Source: "Nordahl showed us the shard of Wuuthrad tonight. It was very impressive! He's shown great cunning to find it. Our brothers and sisters scour the Smokefrost Peaks looking for Ysgramor's legacy."
Target: \\"Nordahl showed us the shard of Wuuthrad tonight. It was very impressive! He's shown great cunning to find it. Our brothers and sisters scour the Smokefrost Peaks looking for Ysgramor's legacy.\"\""

Source: Your kind abandoned this place to rot, so my sisters and I took it back. Made it grow again.\n\nBut now it's lost to us, and we must hide—for evil serpents have come, and driven the wild things mad.
Target: Your kind abandoned this place to rot, so my sisters and I took it back. Made it grow again.\n\nBut now it's lost to us, and we must hide—for evil serpents have come, and driven the wild things mad.

Source: We must fight past the last of the Worm Cultists ahead of us. Then we face Sinmur and Thallik. That merging is a foe worthy of Ysgramor, yet it falls to us to face them.
Target: We must fight past the last of the Worm Cultists ahead of us. Then we face Sinmur and Thallik. That merging is a foe worthy of Ysgramor, yet it falls to us to face them.

Source: Somebody needs to take the fight to the Red Rooks! I'm sick of enforcers coming round and taking all our hard-earned gold.\n\n<<1>> says it has to stop, and he's right, by Zenithar.
Target: Somebody needs to take the fight to the Red Rooks! I'm sick of enforcers coming round and taking all our hard-earned gold.\n\n<<1>> says it has to stop, and he's right, by Zenithar.

Source: Torinaan has been assaulted by Daedric energies and foul beasts.\n\nThis is a holy site, a beacon of divine light to the faithful. Now the penitent writhe with foul magics while scamps and clannfear rampage through her fields.
Target: Torinaan has been assaulted by Daedric energies and foul beasts.\n\nThis is a holy site, a beacon of divine light to the faithful. Now the penitent writhe with foul magics while scamps and clannfear rampage through her fields.

Source: <<1>> breeds racing lizards, but won't enter them in my races. She wants me to fail so she can take over.\n\nMaybe you can convince her to give you a winning lizard.
Target: <<1>> breeds racing lizards, but won't enter them in my races. She wants me to fail so she can take over.\n\nMaybe you can convince her to give you a winning lizard.

Source: I'm the relic-keeper here at Torinaan. You must help me move the holy treasures! \n\nLest they be co-opted by the corruption that plagues this site.
Target: I'm the relic-keeper here at Torinaan. You must help me move the holy treasures! \n\nLest they be co-opted by the corruption that plagues this site.

Source: Kill their Spirit Healer, Kerelia Lucullus. Her power enables them to summon the giants.
Target: Kill their Spirit Healer, Kerelia Lucullus. Her power enables them to summon the giants.

Source: We were digging and then there was a rumbling … and the ceiling began to fall! \n\nI thought he was right beside me, but alas, he did not emerge. I would go back, but I have inhaled too much dust. I cannot catch my breath!
Target: We were digging and then there was a rumbling … and the ceiling began to fall! \n\nI thought he was right beside me, but alas, he did not emerge. I would go back, but I have inhaled too much dust. I cannot catch my breath!

Source: The Spider Cult recently attacked this Grotto and wiped out the indigenous Goblins. They control this region, now.\n\nThe Fighters Guild sent my men to investigate shortly thereafter, but our ranks have been devastated.
Target: The Spider Cult recently attacked this Grotto and wiped out the indigenous Goblins. They control this region, now.\n\nThe Fighters Guild sent my men to investigate shortly thereafter, but our ranks have been devastated.

Source: Rumor has it that one of the most dangerous of our missing relics—<<1>>—is being held in Faldar's Tooth. Would you return it to us?
Target: Rumor has it that one of the most dangerous of our missing relics—<<1>>—is being held in Faldar's Tooth. Would you return it to us?

Source: <Read the Will.>
Target: <Read the Will.>

Source: I know you by reputation. Look, I'm supposed to be acting as troop support out here. But an elite ranger in the Lion Guard is stalking our people. I need backup.\n\nWill you help me?
Target: I know you by reputation. Look, I'm supposed to be acting as troop support out here. But an elite ranger in the Lion Guard is stalking our people. I need backup.\n\nWill you help me?

Source: Your next assignment will be to capture the farm. The benefit will be two-fold: Our troops will eat; our enemies will starve. It is quite simple really. Capture a farm, return to me when you do.
Target: Your next assignment will be to capture the farm. The benefit will be two-fold: Our troops will eat; our enemies will starve. It is quite simple really. Capture a farm, return to me when you do.

Source: We have to secure a foothold here in Balfiera. To that end, we will need to capture the keep to serve as a strong point. The Dominion needs you once again.
Target: We have to secure a foothold here in Balfiera. To that end, we will need to capture the keep to serve as a strong point. The Dominion needs you once again.

Source: Dirt-eater by the name of Varnedo. Heard he was here, but now I hear he's in Ivarstead. \n\nChasin' him is getting old. I've got other places to be.
Target: Dirt-eater by the name of Varnedo. Heard he was here, but now I hear he's in Ivarstead. \n\nChasin' him is getting old. I've got other places to be.

Source: <The dog almost seems to nod and paws at the mound of sand again.>
Target: <The dog almost seems to nod and paws at the mound of sand again.>

Source: After the recent disruptions, many of our most sacred relics are missing. The dangerous ones are what I worry about.
Target: After the recent disruptions, many of our most sacred relics are missing. The dangerous ones are what I worry about.

Source: I traveled to an island off the coast of Skyrim, to a village called Bleakrock. The outpost offers early warnings of attacks on the shore.
Target: I traveled to an island off the coast of Skyrim, to a village called Bleakrock. The outpost offers early warnings of attacks on the shore.

Source: Who's trying to burn the place down?
Target: Who's trying to burn the place down?

Source: Who's trying to burn the place down?
Target: Who's trying to burn the place down?

Source: The Worm Cult is all over the Ragged Hills Altar. One of their filthy rituals, I'm sure of it.
Target: The Worm Cult is all over the Ragged Hills Altar. One of their filthy rituals, I'm sure of it.

Source: We have to ensure that our enemies do not outpace us in war materials. For every asset we claim, there is one less available for them. Capture the mine for the Dominion.
Target: We have to ensure that our enemies do not outpace us in war materials. For every asset we claim, there is one less available for them. Capture the mine for the Dominion.

Source: We are in need of lumber to bolster our fortifications and build supports for our mines. Secure the Lumber Mill for the Covenant.
Target: We are in need of lumber to bolster our fortifications and build supports for our mines. Secure the Lumber Mill for the Covenant.

Source: Our enemies lack the wisdom to see the benefit of our rule and have chosen to defy us. Your worth to the Dominion will be put to the test recruit, seek out our enemies do not return until you have slain thirty of them.
Target: Our enemies lack the wisdom to see the benefit of our rule and have chosen to defy us. Your worth to the Dominion will be put to the test recruit, seek out our enemies do not return until you have slain thirty of them.

Source: We have received reports of enemy troop movements near the nearby lumber mill. If this is the case we need to know immediately. Go to the Lumber Mill and return to me with your findings.
Target: We have received reports of enemy troop movements near the nearby lumber mill. If this is the case we need to know immediately. Go to the Lumber Mill and return to me with your findings.

Source: I got separated from my friends. We were drinking at the festival. I guess you could say we overdid it. Then Jofarr dared me and Nivene to explore those old catacombs. \n\nIt was a lark. We didn't expect to find undead right here beneath the city!
Target: I got separated from my friends. We were drinking at the festival. I guess you could say we overdid it. Then Jofarr dared me and Nivene to explore those old catacombs. \n\nIt was a lark. We didn't expect to find undead right here beneath the city!

Source: The amount of resources required to maintain an effective war-machine is truly mind boggling. It is essential that we know what materials are available to enemy and ourselves.
Target: The amount of resources required to maintain an effective war-machine is truly mind boggling. It is essential that we know what materials are available to enemy and ourselves.

Source: Jorunn's party, obviously! That king knows how to entertain!\n\nThese catacombs are amazing. I thought I saw a girl I knew, but it was just a dead Nord. Have you seen my friends?
Target: Jorunn's party, obviously! That king knows how to entertain!\n\nThese catacombs are amazing. I thought I saw a girl I knew, but it was just a dead Nord. Have you seen my friends?

Source: The Altmer have not forgotten the crimes the Bretons and Redguard have committed against us. Now they openly make war against us and think that we will do nothing. Deliver a message for the Dominion, recruit.
Target: The Altmer have not forgotten the crimes the Bretons and Redguard have committed against us. Now they openly make war against us and think that we will do nothing. Deliver a message for the Dominion, recruit.

Source: My friends and I got drunk at King Jorunn's party. One thing led to another and now we're lost in tunnels full of undead. Not an uncommon occurrence back in Vvardenfell, but I don't think my Nord friends will handle it too well. Not Borald, at least.
Target: My friends and I got drunk at King Jorunn's party. One thing led to another and now we're lost in tunnels full of undead. Not an uncommon occurrence back in Vvardenfell, but I don't think my Nord friends will handle it too well. Not Borald, at least.

Source: Do not make the mistake of underestimating the threat of the Ebonheart Pact. Your assignment is to thin out their numbers.
Target: Do not make the mistake of underestimating the threat of the Ebonheart Pact. Your assignment is to thin out their numbers.

Source: The Altmer have not forgotten the crimes the Bretons and Redguard have committed against us. Now they openly make war against us and think that we will do nothing. Deliver a message for the Dominion, recruit.
Target: The Altmer have not forgotten the crimes the Bretons and Redguard have committed against us. Now they openly make war against us and think that we will do nothing. Deliver a message for the Dominion, recruit.

Source: The Withered Hand launched a surprise attack against Tava's Blessing. They killed everyone and everything, even the livestock.\n\nThe strange thing is, they have not raised the dead.
Target: The Withered Hand launched a surprise attack against Tava's Blessing. They killed everyone and everything, even the livestock.\n\nThe strange thing is, they have not raised the dead.

Source: We have come too far to allow the basic needs of our fighting forces to slip past our notice. Our forces need food and to provide for them we will need to know what farms are available to us.
Target: We have come too far to allow the basic needs of our fighting forces to slip past our notice. Our forces need food and to provide for them we will need to know what farms are available to us.

Source: Nobody knows. Started popping up in some of the kids, then spread. Soldiers aren't worth much around here. Don't expect a lot of help.
Target: Nobody knows. Started popping up in some of the kids, then spread. Soldiers aren't worth much around here. Don't expect a lot of help.

Source: Well, not necessarily you exactly, but certainly someone like you. Strong, brave, capable. Carries a well-used weapon.\n\nThe Lion Guard has need of you! Go see Commander Ales. He's in our fortified camp up on the hill.
Target: Well, not necessarily you exactly, but certainly someone like you. Strong, brave, capable. Carries a well-used weapon.\n\nThe Lion Guard has need of you! Go see Commander Ales. He's in our fortified camp up on the hill.

Source: You're not the killer, I suppose; that would be too easy. But I don't want to leave Raerana alone while I search for clues. The killer might still be around.
Target: You're not the killer, I suppose; that would be too easy. But I don't want to leave Raerana alone while I search for clues. The killer might still be around.

Source: With your help, I hope!  I have a set of bones here which allow me to glimpse one's fate. I will now look at your fate … hmm.\n\nOh. Oh my! Such a gruesome death. Let us hope fate can be denied.
Target: With your help, I hope!  I have a set of bones here which allow me to glimpse one's fate. I will now look at your fate … hmm.\n\nOh. Oh my! Such a gruesome death. Let us hope fate can be denied.

Source: Plague. Stay away if you value your life. A dozen people afflicted over the last week.
Target: Plague. Stay away if you value your life. A dozen people afflicted over the last week.

Source: Plague. Coin's the only reason I'm here. My crew is under contract.
Target: Plague. Coin's the only reason I'm here. My crew is under contract.

Source: A kidnapping? What do you mean?
Target: A kidnapping? What do you mean?

Source: Barothlas and I hoped this would be the year Falinesti returned to its Summer Site. We found nothing but a hole in the ground at first.\n\nThen a few days ago, we saw flashes of lightning in the valley!
Target: Barothlas and I hoped this would be the year Falinesti returned to its Summer Site. We found nothing but a hole in the ground at first.\n\nThen a few days ago, we saw flashes of lightning in the valley!

Source: Where's your commander?
Target: Where's your commander?

Source: Harnald sent me here to investigate Worm Cult sightings. Turns out they're enacting some nasty ritual up there. \n\nHe expects me to stop it but there's no way. Those cultists would murder me!
Target: Harnald sent me here to investigate Worm Cult sightings. Turns out they're enacting some nasty ritual up there. \n\nHe expects me to stop it but there's no way. Those cultists would murder me!

Target: What's the next step in the plan?

Source: That poor man over there had his cane stolen by a couple of hooligans. Go help him, why don't you?
Target: That poor man over there had his cane stolen by a couple of hooligans. Go help him, why don't you?

Source: No, citizen. The Queen is here! The First Auridon Marines insist we log everyone who enters the city. No exceptions.
Target: No, citizen. The Queen is here! The First Auridon Marines insist we log everyone who enters the city. No exceptions.

Source: Her majesty set this one a task—investigate the leadership of the Veiled Heritance. The Veil's trail leads here, to the town of Mathiisen. \n\nWell known for their steel blades, yes? But also, apparently, weaponsmiths for anarchists.
Target: Her majesty set this one a task—investigate the leadership of the Veiled Heritance. The Veil's trail leads here, to the town of Mathiisen. \n\nWell known for their steel blades, yes? But also, apparently, weaponsmiths for anarchists.

Source: All right, now. You trust in Razum-dar, yes? He must ask you to trust him further. Malanie, Condalin. They are in the town barracks. You must go in, make a big noise. \n\nThey will almost certainly capture you.
Target: All right, now. You trust in Razum-dar, yes? He must ask you to trust him further. Malanie, Condalin. They are in the town barracks. You must go in, make a big noise. \n\nThey will almost certainly capture you.

Source: Auri-El forgive us. We rendezvoused with a Covenant officer and her husband. She wanted to defect. \n\nThe damned Daggers caught wind of it and chased us all the way from Khefrem.
Target: Auri-El forgive us. We rendezvoused with a Covenant officer and her husband. She wanted to defect. \n\nThe damned Daggers caught wind of it and chased us all the way from Khefrem.

Target: QUEST: Cleansing Spirits

Source: No, no. You're fine. The Queen herself has come to Vulkhel Guard. Her royal guard, the First Auridon Marines, require us to log everyone entering the city.
Target: No, no. You're fine. The Queen herself has come to Vulkhel Guard. Her royal guard, the First Auridon Marines, require us to log everyone entering the city.

Source: Dear Gabrielle's spell seems to have misfired. Luckily, a few of us were able to find each other. \n\nI also convinced a Bloodthorn cultist to tell me how to reach Angof. I can be very persuasive when I put my mind to it.
Target: Dear Gabrielle's spell seems to have misfired. Luckily, a few of us were able to find each other. \n\nI also convinced a Bloodthorn cultist to tell me how to reach Angof. I can be very persuasive when I put my mind to it.

Source: Nothing wrong. The Queen is in town. Her royal guard, the First Auridon Marines, insist everyone be logged.\n\nYou know how it is.
Target: Nothing wrong. The Queen is in town. Her royal guard, the First Auridon Marines, insist everyone be logged.\n\nYou know how it is.

Source: The Queen's here in town. Her royal guard, the First Auridon Marines, require everyone check in for security purposes.
Target: The Queen's here in town. Her royal guard, the First Auridon Marines, require everyone check in for security purposes.

Source: Then why are you here?
Target: Then why are you here?

Source: I'll find Garyn and tell him what I've learned.
Target: I'll find Garyn and tell him what I've learned.

Source: What do you need from me?
Target: What do you need from me?

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: You know how these things can get blown out of proportion.\n\nSome people are paranoid, speaking as if respectable citizens were disappearing left and right. It's true, a few people have gone missing, but they were mostly beggars and vagrants.
Target: You know how these things can get blown out of proportion.\n\nSome people are paranoid, speaking as if respectable citizens were disappearing left and right. It's true, a few people have gone missing, but they were mostly beggars and vagrants.

Source: To win this war, our troops will need full bellies. For that to happen, we will need a reliable source of food. I need you to take Balfiera Farm.
Target: To win this war, our troops will need full bellies. For that to happen, we will need a reliable source of food. I need you to take Balfiera Farm.

Target: Do you know where Uela is?

Source: A hungry man makes the worst guard. If we can deny our enemies food, overwhelming their defenses is within reach. Go and claim Balfiear Farm for the Covenant recruit.
Target: A hungry man makes the worst guard. If we can deny our enemies food, overwhelming their defenses is within reach. Go and claim Balfiear Farm for the Covenant recruit.

Target: What can I do to help?

Target: Othrys?

Target: You may be a member of the Daggerfall Covenant, but if you wish to be truly accepted, you'll have to prove you're willing to serve. Eliminate ten of our enemies and return here alive.

Target: I need to kill one of their leaders?

Target: Who is Leel-Vata?

Target: My husband, Esmaeel, and I were kidnapped by Oathbound! I fought my way out, but my husband couldn't get through. Damn Osgrikh! I should kill him for this!

Target: Yes. I will speak to the Ash'abah for you.

Target: We need to relight the signal fire.

Target: \\"The target's name is Malsia. The Mages Guild wants her dead
column4: something about her trying to open a portal. Whatever the reason
column5: she must die.\"\""

Source: Broken bones. Bruises. These things I can heal. But he is taken by a fever this one cannot treat. \n\nI managed to ease his pain, but he is still fading. I have tried everything I know. Well, almost everything.
Target: Broken bones. Bruises. These things I can heal. But he is taken by a fever this one cannot treat. \n\nI managed to ease his pain, but he is still fading. I have tried everything I know. Well, almost everything.

Source: If we are to take and hold Cyrodiil we have to know what fortifications the enemy has and which ones we may take. You will be our eyes.
Target: If we are to take and hold Cyrodiil we have to know what fortifications the enemy has and which ones we may take. You will be our eyes.

Source: Do not make the mistake of underestimating the threat of the Ebonheart Pact. Though they may be an unwashed collection of backwards savages, they are cunning and underhanded. Your assignment is to thin out their numbers.
Target: Do not make the mistake of underestimating the threat of the Ebonheart Pact. Though they may be an unwashed collection of backwards savages, they are cunning and underhanded. Your assignment is to thin out their numbers.

Source: Our enemies cannot be allowed even the thought of being secure. Make an example of twenty of their guards.
Target: Our enemies cannot be allowed even the thought of being secure. Make an example of twenty of their guards.

Source: Shack? This is my home! It's not much, but it keeps the weather off my head. My home is the least of my problems!
Target: Shack? This is my home! It's not much, but it keeps the weather off my head. My home is the least of my problems!

Source: Our enemies cannot be allowed even the thought of being secure. Make an example of one of their guards. This will lower their morale and make our offensives all the easier.
Target: Our enemies cannot be allowed even the thought of being secure. Make an example of one of their guards. This will lower their morale and make our offensives all the easier.

Source: Stars, yes. The dig site leader. Look, he's just up the path.\n\nJust keep your mouth shut about me.
Target: Stars, yes. The dig site leader. Look, he's just up the path.\n\nJust keep your mouth shut about me.

Source: The Dominion has decided that if the upstarts are engaged with replacing their losses the less time they will have to mount any tangible offense. Cull their guards and we will be that much closer to overwhelming them.
Target: The Dominion has decided that if the upstarts are engaged with replacing their losses the less time they will have to mount any tangible offense. Cull their guards and we will be that much closer to overwhelming them.

Source: Huh? So you're here to work? Why didn't you say so?\n\nIf you want to make yourself useful, we've got a nasty bug problem in our hay. Horses won't go near it if those things have nested inside. I guess they can smell 'em.
Target: Huh? So you're here to work? Why didn't you say so?\n\nIf you want to make yourself useful, we've got a nasty bug problem in our hay. Horses won't go near it if those things have nested inside. I guess they can smell 'em.

Source: The actions of the Ebonheart Pact have started to become more and more of a hindrance to our plans. Kill an Ebonheart guard, the fewer we have to concern ourselves with, the better.
Target: The actions of the Ebonheart Pact have started to become more and more of a hindrance to our plans. Kill an Ebonheart guard, the fewer we have to concern ourselves with, the better.

Source: The name is Malana, Archmage to King Jorunn. Or, I was until a few weeks ago ….
Target: The name is Malana, Archmage to King Jorunn. Or, I was until a few weeks ago ….

Source: Our enemies lack the wisdom to see the benefit of our rule and have chosen to defy us. Your worth to the Dominion will be put to the test recruit, seek out our enemies do not return until you have slain ten of them.
Target: Our enemies lack the wisdom to see the benefit of our rule and have chosen to defy us. Your worth to the Dominion will be put to the test recruit, seek out our enemies do not return until you have slain ten of them.

Target: Why aren't you gathering them?

Target: Did you find anything?

Target: Beheaded? Why?

Target: Go into the past? How?

Source: She sent word. She's moved to protect the Queen. That'll be at the manor house.\n\nStars guide your steps now.
Target: She sent word. She's moved to protect the Queen. That'll be at the manor house.\n\nStars guide your steps now.

Source: The Aldmeri Dominion has captured Farwatch Tower. They're using it to signal their ships at sea. \n\nI was ordered to intercept messages passing between the tower and the Dominion camp, but we're spread too thin and I need to defend this position.
Target: The Aldmeri Dominion has captured Farwatch Tower. They're using it to signal their ships at sea. \n\nI was ordered to intercept messages passing between the tower and the Dominion camp, but we're spread too thin and I need to defend this position.

Source: HoonDing's Watch. The Withered Hand is seeking out the birthplaces of the Ansei who forged the Wards. Just as Alasan did here, they can use these locations to corrupt the Wards.\n\nThe third Ansei—Halelah—was born near HoonDing's Watch.
Target: HoonDing's Watch. The Withered Hand is seeking out the birthplaces of the Ansei who forged the Wards. Just as Alasan did here, they can use these locations to corrupt the Wards.\n\nThe third Ansei—Halelah—was born near HoonDing's Watch.

Target: A cult of Daedra worshipers! They called themselves \\"Supernal Dreamers.\"\"\n\nWe were returning from Daggerfall on a mission from the High King …."

Target: I just found out that this land belongs to me. \n\nYou see, my father recently passed away. I was reading his journals and learned of this place. I wasn't sure why he kept it a secret until I got here.

Source: Can you handle a room full of drunken Nords? I need to get a book from that tavern across the street.\n\nThe author is sitting in there drinking right now! Can you believe it? Skald Skullsplitter is here!
Target: Can you handle a room full of drunken Nords? I need to get a book from that tavern across the street.\n\nThe author is sitting in there drinking right now! Can you believe it? Skald Skullsplitter is here!

Source: The Cult. They killed us all. Our loved ones in Riften must be told. Help us, please!
Target: The Cult. They killed us all. Our loved ones in Riften must be told. Help us, please!

Source: There was an attempt on the thane's life. Her housecarl, of all people. Bastard. Sergeant Aera and her squad arrived just recently to look into the matter.
Target: There was an attempt on the thane's life. Her housecarl, of all people. Bastard. Sergeant Aera and her squad arrived just recently to look into the matter.

Source: Aye. I've finally found my way in the world. The Pact has given me purpose, a reason to live beyond Bleakrock. \n\nI'm actually here on a mission, but I'm a bit over my head. Can I ask an old friend for help?
Target: Aye. I've finally found my way in the world. The Pact has given me purpose, a reason to live beyond Bleakrock. \n\nI'm actually here on a mission, but I'm a bit over my head. Can I ask an old friend for help?
