Source: The King's Arrow, yes? Well met.\n\nTell no one that Betar-Nes was a member of the Worm Cult. I won't have Nimalten fall into chaos. We're on his trail. My advisor and the court mage search for any hint of the cult as we speak.
Target: The King's Arrow, yes? Well met.\n\nTell no one that Betar-Nes was a member of the Worm Cult. I won't have Nimalten fall into chaos. We're on his trail. My advisor and the court mage search for any hint of the cult as we speak.

Source: The Drublog have been raiding villages all over. We survived, but just barely.\n\nAll I can offer my people is a place to mourn. But their children's bodies are still out there, being scavenged by Drublog … and worse.
Target: The Drublog have been raiding villages all over. We survived, but just barely.\n\nAll I can offer my people is a place to mourn. But their children's bodies are still out there, being scavenged by Drublog … and worse.

Source: I'll follow you as soon as the soldiers get here.\n\nOh! Even better! Take this binding stone. Find a secure location inside the catacombs and use it to call me to you. I'll even bring some of the soldiers with me!
Target: I'll follow you as soon as the soldiers get here.\n\nOh! Even better! Take this binding stone. Find a secure location inside the catacombs and use it to call me to you. I'll even bring some of the soldiers with me!

Source: Shattered? Wuuthrad? What is this nonsense? You think to deceive me with wild tales?\n\nI know why you're really here. The Jarls sent you to spy on me. Either that, or you're in league with the risen dead!
Target: Shattered? Wuuthrad? What is this nonsense? You think to deceive me with wild tales?\n\nI know why you're really here. The Jarls sent you to spy on me. Either that, or you're in league with the risen dead!

Source: Those gibbering Broken Coast bastards won't leave me be! They seek my treasure, but they'll not have it! Not cup nor bone!\n\nIf my cursed eyes could see, I'd take up an axe and crack some skulls like the old days.
Target: Those gibbering Broken Coast bastards won't leave me be! They seek my treasure, but they'll not have it! Not cup nor bone!\n\nIf my cursed eyes could see, I'd take up an axe and crack some skulls like the old days.

Source: Teldur asked Canonreeve Valano for a word outside. When they didn't return, I went to look for them. I caught a glimpse of them heading towards the manor. Teldur was holding a knife to my father's side!
Target: Teldur asked Canonreeve Valano for a word outside. When they didn't return, I went to look for them. I caught a glimpse of them heading towards the manor. Teldur was holding a knife to my father's side!

Source: I'll handle it. The duke sent me here to find him.
Target: I'll handle it. The duke sent me here to find him.

Source: The Black Daggers have set an ambush for me, north of here. I'd like to show them that I still have friends. Feel like triggering a trap?
Target: The Black Daggers have set an ambush for me, north of here. I'd like to show them that I still have friends. Feel like triggering a trap?

Source: Each gate is maintained by a sigil stone. Enter the portal, find the stone, and destroy it. \n\nRaz is going to guess they will be guarded.
Target: Each gate is maintained by a sigil stone. Enter the portal, find the stone, and destroy it. \n\nRaz is going to guess they will be guarded.

Source: You're one of Raz's? Thank Mara! We could use you. \n\nThere are Daedra everywhere. Portals to Oblivion opened within the city and an army of beasts threatens to take Firsthold.
Target: You're one of Raz's? Thank Mara! We could use you. \n\nThere are Daedra everywhere. Portals to Oblivion opened within the city and an army of beasts threatens to take Firsthold.

Source: Well, that lava fissure running through town is dangerous. The heat and fumes are bad enough, but flame atronachs are issuing from it, attacking citizens. If you'd kill four of them and thin out the herd, we'd all appreciate it.
Target: Well, that lava fissure running through town is dangerous. The heat and fumes are bad enough, but flame atronachs are issuing from it, attacking citizens. If you'd kill four of them and thin out the herd, we'd all appreciate it.

Source: As you should be. She could use your help.\n\nThe Queen is here to perform a ritual. She seeks a blessing, but the dead have grown angry. They attack without provocation.
Target: As you should be. She could use your help.\n\nThe Queen is here to perform a ritual. She seeks a blessing, but the dead have grown angry. They attack without provocation.

Source: I see that Aldmeri spies have infiltrated the celebration. Sanguine welcomes all, but all must partake of his drink. If these spies wish to remain, they must drink from Sanguine's goblet. Then they will be bound to the party.
Target: I see that Aldmeri spies have infiltrated the celebration. Sanguine welcomes all, but all must partake of his drink. If these spies wish to remain, they must drink from Sanguine's goblet. Then they will be bound to the party.

Source: You've worked with the Eyes? Auri-El provides. \n\nDaedra run rampant, portals to Oblivion have opened within the city, and an army from the Deadlands threatens to take Firsthold.
Target: You've worked with the Eyes? Auri-El provides. \n\nDaedra run rampant, portals to Oblivion have opened within the city, and an army from the Deadlands threatens to take Firsthold.

Source: Everyone in town is so grateful to Hendil. But I don't trust him. Or that little toad Amuur. My youngest son's been down there for a week! Why?
Target: Everyone in town is so grateful to Hendil. But I don't trust him. Or that little toad Amuur. My youngest son's been down there for a week! Why?

Source: I'm incredibly bored. I got lost on a long trip, and I'm stuck in the middle of nowhere.\n\nOnly two things relieve my stultifying boredom: a book sitting next to me and the book sitting next to that one.
Target: I'm incredibly bored. I got lost on a long trip, and I'm stuck in the middle of nowhere.\n\nOnly two things relieve my stultifying boredom: a book sitting next to me and the book sitting next to that one.

Source: My situation here is precarious. If the Black Daggers find out I'm still alive, they'll come after me, hard. I need supply caches in case I need to run. Want to fill one up for me?
Target: My situation here is precarious. If the Black Daggers find out I'm still alive, they'll come after me, hard. I need supply caches in case I need to run. Want to fill one up for me?

Source: The Queen's entourage. They were taken right out of our camp.\n\nA madman—a mage—teleported them away. The look in his eye!
Target: The Queen's entourage. They were taken right out of our camp.\n\nA madman—a mage—teleported them away. The look in his eye!

Source: Well, it's safe here. Outside, not as much, with the Gold Coast mercenaries looking for trouble.\n\nFrom the looks of it, you know how to take care of yourself. Honored Eraral-dro should meet you, I think.
Target: Well, it's safe here. Outside, not as much, with the Gold Coast mercenaries looking for trouble.\n\nFrom the looks of it, you know how to take care of yourself. Honored Eraral-dro should meet you, I think.

Source: <<1>> led the bulk of our army to Trolhetta, but there's a snag. The Worms have dug in. We'll root them out, don't worry. But it's taking time.\n\nJorunn sent me to update you. Apparently, you're important.
Target: <<1>> led the bulk of our army to Trolhetta, but there's a snag. The Worms have dug in. We'll root them out, don't worry. But it's taking time.\n\nJorunn sent me to update you. Apparently, you're important.

Source: Perhaps. I hear the merchant Bar-Neeus may be peddling illegal goods in the central market. If this could be proved, he'd be ruined and we would take his place.
Target: Perhaps. I hear the merchant Bar-Neeus may be peddling illegal goods in the central market. If this could be proved, he'd be ruined and we would take his place.

Source: Yes, but don't go looking to pull me up, you'll likely break my back. I need my cane. Those two ruffians dancing like idiots over there stole it from me.
Target: Yes, but don't go looking to pull me up, you'll likely break my back. I need my cane. Those two ruffians dancing like idiots over there stole it from me.

Source: The Reachmen are gathering in the Wood. Gjakil needs all able blades to head there right away!
Target: The Reachmen are gathering in the Wood. Gjakil needs all able blades to head there right away!

Source: What do you mean?
Target: What do you mean?

Source: Why are you so sad, spirit?
Target: Why are you so sad, spirit?

Source: What happened to you?
Target: What happened to you?

Source: Sometimes in pairs. They slam shut on your ear tips, then flutter off. It seems half the library has tormented us since we tripped the wards.\n\nI've been trying to settle things down, but it's slow going without my assistants.
Target: Sometimes in pairs. They slam shut on your ear tips, then flutter off. It seems half the library has tormented us since we tripped the wards.\n\nI've been trying to settle things down, but it's slow going without my assistants.

Source: Thank the Eight! Forgive me. It seems like everything in this horrible swamp is trying to kill me!\n\nI saw brigands on the road earlier and hid my belongings for fear they'd be stolen. Now I can't remember where I left them! I was so frightened.
Target: Thank the Eight! Forgive me. It seems like everything in this horrible swamp is trying to kill me!\n\nI saw brigands on the road earlier and hid my belongings for fear they'd be stolen. Now I can't remember where I left them! I was so frightened.

Source: What do you mean?
Target: What do you mean?

Source: Do you need some help getting to those tents?
Target: Do you need some help getting to those tents?

Source: Silsailen's under attack! I don't care what <<1>> thinks, I am leaving!
Target: Silsailen's under attack! I don't care what <<1>> thinks, I am leaving!

Source: Orcs?
Target: Orcs?

Source: Who doesn't want help?
Target: Who doesn't want help?

Source: I'm investigating the nature of magicka. My current assistant, <<1>>, refuses to continue. \n\nI am fairly certain I've perfected my amulet, but the coward refuses to play his part.
Target: I'm investigating the nature of magicka. My current assistant, <<1>>, refuses to continue. \n\nI am fairly certain I've perfected my amulet, but the coward refuses to play his part.

Source: Who's arguing? What are you talking about?
Target: Who's arguing? What are you talking about?

Source: The Maormer happened. Damned vipers struck, took the town by surprise. \n\nWait. You said you're not with the reinforcements? We're in trouble. Unless … will you help us?
Target: The Maormer happened. Damned vipers struck, took the town by surprise. \n\nWait. You said you're not with the reinforcements? We're in trouble. Unless … will you help us?

Source: Crocodiles! This route has always been safe before. I left the road to avoid wasps, and the crocodiles attacked. My favorite guar, <<1>>, fled into the swamp. The rest of my guar followed.
Target: Crocodiles! This route has always been safe before. I left the road to avoid wasps, and the crocodiles attacked. My favorite guar, <<1>>, fled into the swamp. The rest of my guar followed.

Source: Trying to figure out my next move. \n\nI'm with the Fighters Guild. We were attacked. By Daedra! They captured my companions. Took them into that prison down there. I'm just a scout. I can't fight Daedra! But I bet you could.
Target: Trying to figure out my next move. \n\nI'm with the Fighters Guild. We were attacked. By Daedra! They captured my companions. Took them into that prison down there. I'm just a scout. I can't fight Daedra! But I bet you could.

Source: Then we must hurry. To create the Water Stone, she'll infuse all those memory essences into something—probably the relics she's stolen. \n\nWe need to find them. I think I know where the nereid's lair is, but I'll need a distraction to get there.
Target: Then we must hurry. To create the Water Stone, she'll infuse all those memory essences into something—probably the relics she's stolen. \n\nWe need to find them. I think I know where the nereid's lair is, but I'll need a distraction to get there.

Source: I tried to infiltrate the Imperial camp … falsify their orders … wanted to send them far from here. \n\nIt was a great plan but flawed, for I am not the man I once was. Idle days have stolen my strength. I fled into the rocks after I was wounded.
Target: I tried to infiltrate the Imperial camp … falsify their orders … wanted to send them far from here. \n\nIt was a great plan but flawed, for I am not the man I once was. Idle days have stolen my strength. I fled into the rocks after I was wounded.

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: Let's do it!
Target: Let's do it!

Source: Relics from within the ruins. Ancient devices the Ayleids crafted to hold the secrets of water.\n\nUnwittingly, in their efforts to secure their secrets, the Primeval Seekers have unearthed the very things I could not find. We must simply take them.
Target: Relics from within the ruins. Ancient devices the Ayleids crafted to hold the secrets of water.\n\nUnwittingly, in their efforts to secure their secrets, the Primeval Seekers have unearthed the very things I could not find. We must simply take them.

Source: Yes. I serve Hermaeus Mora, the Lord of Fate and Knowledge. These ruins were once a shrine to my lord, a storehouse of secrets forbidden to mortals.\n\nThe shrine is but a memory now, but an entity invades the ruins seeking to steal the secrets.
Target: Yes. I serve Hermaeus Mora, the Lord of Fate and Knowledge. These ruins were once a shrine to my lord, a storehouse of secrets forbidden to mortals.\n\nThe shrine is but a memory now, but an entity invades the ruins seeking to steal the secrets.

Source: Because of the snakes. I was prepared to defend the caravan from bandits, even dunerippers, but not snakes. Snakes scare the Oblivion out of me, they always have. \n\nSo I fled, and now, I lack the courage to go back. Will you help them?
Target: Because of the snakes. I was prepared to defend the caravan from bandits, even dunerippers, but not snakes. Snakes scare the Oblivion out of me, they always have. \n\nSo I fled, and now, I lack the courage to go back. Will you help them?

Source: Because they are worshipers of Molag Bal. They spit on our faith. They spit on our culture. They spit on our gods!\n\nNot only did they kill the other priests, but they ransacked the building, taking everything of value, and destroying the rest.
Target: Because they are worshipers of Molag Bal. They spit on our faith. They spit on our culture. They spit on our gods!\n\nNot only did they kill the other priests, but they ransacked the building, taking everything of value, and destroying the rest.

Source: The actions of the Ebonheart Pact have started to become more and more of a hindrance to our plans. Kill an Ebonheart guard, the fewer we have to concern ourselves with, the better.
Target: The actions of the Ebonheart Pact have started to become more and more of a hindrance to our plans. Kill an Ebonheart guard, the fewer we have to concern ourselves with, the better.

Source: You're going to abandon the plantation?
Target: You're going to abandon the plantation?

Source: Kingscrest Farm must be scouted immediately, by order of Grand Warlord Zimmeron. Volunteers are needed.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Kingscrest Farm must be scouted immediately, by order of Grand Warlord Zimmeron. Volunteers are needed.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: So you're here to reclaim the sword?
Target: So you're here to reclaim the sword?

Source: A number of our guards have been laid low by the enemy in an attempt to lower our morale. Foolishly they believe we will not retaliate in kind. I want one of their guards dead - see to it.
Target: A number of our guards have been laid low by the enemy in an attempt to lower our morale. Foolishly they believe we will not retaliate in kind. I want one of their guards dead - see to it.

Source: Why do you have so many suitors?
Target: Why do you have so many suitors?

Source: I will return to Skywatch and see what can be learned there. Speak to Captain Tendil when you arrive. He will know where to find me.
Target: I will return to Skywatch and see what can be learned there. Speak to Captain Tendil when you arrive. He will know where to find me.

Source: The actions of the Ebonheart Pact have started to become more and more of a hindrance to our plans. Kill an Ebonheart guard, the fewer we have to concern ourselves with, the better.
Target: The actions of the Ebonheart Pact have started to become more and more of a hindrance to our plans. Kill an Ebonheart guard, the fewer we have to concern ourselves with, the better.

Source: What's wrong with the countess?
Target: What's wrong with the countess?

Source: Never! The game is sacrosanct! But I can alter the rules to keep the contestants guessing and to keep my own interest in the proceedings high.\n\nReport to the one you pledged your allegiance to. The game begins now.
Target: Never! The game is sacrosanct! But I can alter the rules to keep the contestants guessing and to keep my own interest in the proceedings high.\n\nReport to the one you pledged your allegiance to. The game begins now.

Source: Our enemies cannot be allowed even the thought of being secure. Make an example of their guards. This will lower their morale and make our offensives all the easier.
Target: Our enemies cannot be allowed even the thought of being secure. Make an example of their guards. This will lower their morale and make our offensives all the easier.

Source: Never! The game is sacrosanct! But I can alter the rules to keep the contestants guessing and to maintain my own interest in the proceedings.\n\nReport to the one you have pledged your allegiance to. The game begins now.
Target: Never! The game is sacrosanct! But I can alter the rules to keep the contestants guessing and to maintain my own interest in the proceedings.\n\nReport to the one you have pledged your allegiance to. The game begins now.

Source: The Daggerfall Covenant will scour Balfiera of the Aldmeri Dominion. To accomplish this we need to eliminate their defenses. Kill one of their guards.
Target: The Daggerfall Covenant will scour Balfiera of the Aldmeri Dominion. To accomplish this we need to eliminate their defenses. Kill one of their guards.

Source: The Pact thirsts for information on the forces defending Blue Road Farm. Rewards are offered for reports.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: The Pact thirsts for information on the forces defending Blue Road Farm. Rewards are offered for reports.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: Drakelowe Farm must be scouted immediately, by order of Grand Warlord Zimmeron. Volunteers are needed.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Drakelowe Farm must be scouted immediately, by order of Grand Warlord Zimmeron. Volunteers are needed.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: Grand Warlord Zimmeron needs information on the farm at Castle Alessia. Scouts are urgently needed for this mission.\n\n- General Dar-Liurz
Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron needs information on the farm at Castle Alessia. Scouts are urgently needed for this mission.\n\n- General Dar-Liurz

Source: My friend is in that camp. Marq. He's lost his mind.\n\nThe Goblins stole Marq's special brew. Expensive stuff. Losing it broke him. He went mad and ran off to "join his tribe."
Target: My friend is in that camp. Marq. He's lost his mind.\n\nThe Goblins stole Marq's special brew. Expensive stuff. Losing it broke him. He went mad and ran off to \\"join his tribe.\"\""

Source: I'm Peras. My ship was boarded by bandits calling themselves Crimson Raiders. They captured me and the crew. Brought us here. Told us we were slaves. \n\nI was lucky. Rescued by a Mer named Glanir. Told me to run. But I've not seen anyone else.
Target: I'm Peras. My ship was boarded by bandits calling themselves Crimson Raiders. They captured me and the crew. Brought us here. Told us we were slaves. \n\nI was lucky. Rescued by a Mer named Glanir. Told me to run. But I've not seen anyone else.

Source: Grand Warlord Zimmeron needs information on the farm at Farragut Keep. Scouts are urgently needed for this mission.\n\n- General Dar-Liurz
Target: Grand Warlord Zimmeron needs information on the farm at Farragut Keep. Scouts are urgently needed for this mission.\n\n- General Dar-Liurz

Source: How goes the battle?
Target: How goes the battle?

Source: <The corpse clutches a note.>
Target: <The corpse clutches a note.>

Source: Sorry. I'm Glanir, Senior Proctor.\n\nI tracked the Crimson Raiders here, to their hideout. They're bandits—just a domestic concern, but lately they've been hindering the Dominion war effort. They attacked a dozen ships this month.
Target: Sorry. I'm Glanir, Senior Proctor.\n\nI tracked the Crimson Raiders here, to their hideout. They're bandits—just a domestic concern, but lately they've been hindering the Dominion war effort. They attacked a dozen ships this month.

Source: I'm long dead, stranger. But I suffer torment unending thanks to my husband, Nerien'eth. The Daedra gripped their wretched claws on his soul—turned him wicked. Turned him against me.\n\nAll that you see … was the result.
Target: I'm long dead, stranger. But I suffer torment unending thanks to my husband, Nerien'eth. The Daedra gripped their wretched claws on his soul—turned him wicked. Turned him against me.\n\nAll that you see … was the result.

Source: The mine at Castle Faregyl is vital to our foes' war effort. Volunteers are needed to scout the mine and report back on its defenses.
Target: The mine at Castle Faregyl is vital to our foes' war effort. Volunteers are needed to scout the mine and report back on its defenses.

Source: A horde of damn Sea Drakes attacked our camp. They kidnapped Iriana, left me and the rest for dead. Please, rescue her!
Target: A horde of damn Sea Drakes attacked our camp. They kidnapped Iriana, left me and the rest for dead. Please, rescue her!

Source: We just came here today for some water. The snakes were on us before we knew what was happening. They bit <<1>>, and we ran.\n\nWhen we stopped running, we discovered my son <<2>> was missing.
Target: We just came here today for some water. The snakes were on us before we knew what was happening. They bit <<1>>, and we ran.\n\nWhen we stopped running, we discovered my son <<2>> was missing.

Source: Raggedy Elanwe and her impudent son Sorondil. Crazy! Said they were related to Rilis. Hah! Who would claim that?
Target: Raggedy Elanwe and her impudent son Sorondil. Crazy! Said they were related to Rilis. Hah! Who would claim that?

Source: Mother sent me here to kill some big monster. But I don't think I can do it.
Target: Mother sent me here to kill some big monster. But I don't think I can do it.

Source: Warriors of the Pact—Grand Warlord Zimmeron is in need of your bravery and cunning! The mine near Kingscrest Keep must be scouted before an attack can be planned.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm
Target: Warriors of the Pact—Grand Warlord Zimmeron is in need of your bravery and cunning! The mine near Kingscrest Keep must be scouted before an attack can be planned.\n\n- Scribe Dreet-Wulm

Source: I will, Grand Warlord.
Target: I will, Grand Warlord.

Source: Certainly.
Target: Certainly.

Source: I'll do it.
Target: I'll do it.

Source: What type of opportunity are you talking about?
Target: What type of opportunity are you talking about?

Source: No one has come to your aid?
Target: No one has come to your aid?

Source: What happened in Bangkorai?
Target: What happened in Bangkorai?

Source: What's the problem? Perhaps I can help.
Target: What's the problem? Perhaps I can help.

Source: I accept.
Target: I accept.

Source: Yes.
Target: Yes.

Source: I will.
Target: I will.

Source: What have you discovered?
Target: What have you discovered?

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: What do you need from me?
Target: What do you need from me?

Source: A Red Rook Spy has stolen our battle plans! Will you track him down and kill him before he can report to his superior?
Target: A Red Rook Spy has stolen our battle plans! Will you track him down and kill him before he can report to his superior?

Source: How may I serve the Pact?
Target: How may I serve the Pact?

Source: We will recover the scroll.
Target: We will recover the scroll.

Source: Vivec didn't send me, but maybe I can help.
Target: Vivec didn't send me, but maybe I can help.

Source: Worse. They poisoned them, corrupted them, turned them into monstrosities—those lurchers.\n\nThis is the only spriggan left, and the Reachmen's poison already courses through her branches. She will soon transform unless I am able to treat her.
Target: Worse. They poisoned them, corrupted them, turned them into monstrosities—those lurchers.\n\nThis is the only spriggan left, and the Reachmen's poison already courses through her branches. She will soon transform unless I am able to treat her.

Source: Yes. Many of them. And pilgrims come from all over Hammerfell to honor them—the heroes of our greatest wars. \n\nIt is usually a quiet affair, but when one such as you arrives, spirits of friend and foe alike awaken to create a portrait of the past.
Target: Yes. Many of them. And pilgrims come from all over Hammerfell to honor them—the heroes of our greatest wars. \n\nIt is usually a quiet affair, but when one such as you arrives, spirits of friend and foe alike awaken to create a portrait of the past.

Source: What needs to be done?
Target: What needs to be done?

Source: How'd they get into Davon's Watch?
Target: How'd they get into Davon's Watch?

Source: What do you need?
Target: What do you need?

Source: What is it you need?
Target: What is it you need?

Source: Why aren't they talking to each other?
Target: Why aren't they talking to each other?

Source: What's the plan?
Target: What's the plan?

Source: What's the problem?
Target: What's the problem?

Source: QUEST: Sealed Spirits
Target: QUEST: Sealed Spirits

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: Tell me what's happening.
Target: Tell me what's happening.

Source: Is something wrong?
Target: Is something wrong?

Source: Haras, the hunter, has asked me to hunt the rare pale senche. I must follow the tracks to find the pale senche.
Target: Haras, the hunter, has asked me to hunt the rare pale senche. I must follow the tracks to find the pale senche.

Source: This is Camp Tamrith, a shelter we threw together for the sake of refugees from Crestshade and the surrounding countryside.\n\nWe were on the trail of the villainous Reezal-Jul when we came across these poor, displaced people.
Target: This is Camp Tamrith, a shelter we threw together for the sake of refugees from Crestshade and the surrounding countryside.\n\nWe were on the trail of the villainous Reezal-Jul when we came across these poor, displaced people.

Source: I met Erinel, a Wood Elf who was captured as part of a Mourning War by the Falinesti Faithful. She revelead that she has an Altmer betrothed in Marbruk.
Target: I met Erinel, a Wood Elf who was captured as part of a Mourning War by the Falinesti Faithful. She revelead that she has an Altmer betrothed in Marbruk.

Source: Please speak to me again when you're ready to start the event.
Target: Please speak to me again when you're ready to start the event.

Target: I met Laurosse, a lovelorn Altmer, who believes his Wood Elf bride-to-be has been kidnapped.

Source: That's the Night Terror at work.

Source: Dragged him off? To where?
Target: Dragged him off? To where?

Source: Do you want me to help you?
Target: Do you want me to help you?

Source: QUEST: dummyQuest
Target: QUEST: dummyQuest

Source: How do we ask for Azura's help?
Target: How do we ask for Azura's help?

Source: The staff has Nord markings. Perhaps a Companion at Fallowstone Hall would know more about it.
Target: The staff has Nord markings. Perhaps a Companion at Fallowstone Hall would know more about it.

Source: The name is Malana. This is the entrance to tomb of Lodorr, a necromancer of some renown. I intend to raise and destroy him. If you're willing to assist, I'll see to it that the King rewards you.
Target: The name is Malana. This is the entrance to tomb of Lodorr, a necromancer of some renown. I intend to raise and destroy him. If you're willing to assist, I'll see to it that the King rewards you.

Source: That dumb Harnald sent me to find out what the Worm Cult is doing at the dragonshrine here. I can't even get close enough, there's too many of them.\n\nWhat sort of brother sends his sisters into danger like this?
Target: That dumb Harnald sent me to find out what the Worm Cult is doing at the dragonshrine here. I can't even get close enough, there's too many of them.\n\nWhat sort of brother sends his sisters into danger like this?

Source: "We've located an amazing site, circled by a series of caves. The Spinner says she senses a strong connection to Z'en, as though he called her here for some great purpose."
Target: \\"We've located an amazing site
column4: circled by a series of caves. The Spinner says she senses a strong connection to Z'en
column5: as though he called her here for some great purpose.\"\""

Source: You could say that. The Red Rook bandits have decided to make our town their base of operations. They threaten and even kill whoever gets in their way.\n\nWe're going to put a stop to it. Tamien Sellan is organizing a resistance group.
Target: You could say that. The Red Rook bandits have decided to make our town their base of operations. They threaten and even kill whoever gets in their way.\n\nWe're going to put a stop to it. Tamien Sellan is organizing a resistance group.

Source: My apologies. These past few days have pushed all of Hlaalu's resources to the breaking point trying to find answers.\n\nLet's just say we're not any closer than we were when we started.
Target: My apologies. These past few days have pushed all of Hlaalu's resources to the breaking point trying to find answers.\n\nLet's just say we're not any closer than we were when we started.

Source: Oh, it's no trouble at all. Our mutual Khajiit friend said he was happy to meet you. \n\nThe Festival—the High Kinlady's veneration ceremony. It's all very exciting!
Target: Oh, it's no trouble at all. Our mutual Khajiit friend said he was happy to meet you. \n\nThe Festival—the High Kinlady's veneration ceremony. It's all very exciting!

Source: One of them is a traitor. Has to be. They knew we were coming. Trouble is, I don't know which one, and I need someone to investigate. \n\nYou look capable. You willing to help me out?
Target: One of them is a traitor. Has to be. They knew we were coming. Trouble is, I don't know which one, and I need someone to investigate. \n\nYou look capable. You willing to help me out?

Source: Damn. We found a full Lion Guard forward base right on our doorstep. Their perimeter guard ambushed my scouts, and most of them were captured. \n\nWe may never get a better opportunity to hit them, but without reinforcements, my hands are tied.
Target: Damn. We found a full Lion Guard forward base right on our doorstep. Their perimeter guard ambushed my scouts, and most of them were captured. \n\nWe may never get a better opportunity to hit them, but without reinforcements, my hands are tied.

Source: Argonians as a people are, yes. But these troops are no friends of mine. \n\nI want to teach these pigs a lesson. I help you, you help me?
Target: Argonians as a people are, yes. But these troops are no friends of mine. \n\nI want to teach these pigs a lesson. I help you, you help me?

Source: The Veiled Heritance. I tracked her here. Managed to take out this sentry before he could raise the alarm.\n\nBut—damn it! I'm an old man now. My sword arm is useless.
Target: The Veiled Heritance. I tracked her here. Managed to take out this sentry before he could raise the alarm.\n\nBut—damn it! I'm an old man now. My sword arm is useless.

Source: Consider yourself most welcome at the College of Aldmeri Propriety. The Thalmor founded the place to teach us "lesser members" of the Dominion what we need to join the Guard.
Target: Consider yourself most welcome at the College of Aldmeri Propriety. The Thalmor founded the place to teach us \\"lesser members\"\" of the Dominion what we need to join the Guard."

Source: Recruit Gorak. A new initiate sent from Wayrest along with a tide of untested soldiers. And he really is green. He's an Orc!\n\nThere's not many of them in the Lion Guard.
Target: Recruit Gorak. A new initiate sent from Wayrest along with a tide of untested soldiers. And he really is green. He's an Orc!\n\nThere's not many of them in the Lion Guard.

Source: These Covenant upstarts are like children playing at being warriors. The price of making the Pact your enemy is death. Find one of these striplings and exact that price.
Target: These Covenant upstarts are like children playing at being warriors. The price of making the Pact your enemy is death. Find one of these striplings and exact that price.

Source: Our enemies will be shaken if we strike them where they feel most secure. Find and kill one of their guards, then report back to me.
Target: Our enemies will be shaken if we strike them where they feel most secure. Find and kill one of their guards, then report back to me.

Source: The three standing beside me have either failed the Lord of Schemes in life or become bound to him in death.\n\nRedemption calls to each of them. But to win back the Dark Lord's favor, they must first win my game. And no one has ever won my game.
Target: The three standing beside me have either failed the Lord of Schemes in life or become bound to him in death.\n\nRedemption calls to each of them. But to win back the Dark Lord's favor, they must first win my game. And no one has ever won my game.

Source: If we are to defeat the Aldmeri, all under my command must be up to the task. Kill one of their guards and return to tell the tale.
Target: If we are to defeat the Aldmeri, all under my command must be up to the task. Kill one of their guards and return to tell the tale.

Source: The walls of our fortifications will need repair. To make this possible we will need to know what mines we have available to us.
Target: The walls of our fortifications will need repair. To make this possible we will need to know what mines we have available to us.

Source: I'm a projection, silly! My brother and I are part of the Mages Guild expedition. Well, freelancers, really. We got separated from the others as soon as we arrived in Coldharbour.\n\nBut we're not slacking off. We're investigating this old library.
Target: I'm a projection, silly! My brother and I are part of the Mages Guild expedition. Well, freelancers, really. We got separated from the others as soon as we arrived in Coldharbour.\n\nBut we're not slacking off. We're investigating this old library.

Source: The Ebonheart needs you to be its eyes and ears; I need for you to scout Balfiera Lumbermill; we are in need of fresh supplies.
Target: The Ebonheart needs you to be its eyes and ears; I need for you to scout Balfiera Lumbermill; we are in need of fresh supplies.

Source: We have come too far to allow the basic needs of our fighting forces to slip past our notice. Our forces need food and to provide for them we will need to know what farms are available to us.
Target: We have come too far to allow the basic needs of our fighting forces to slip past our notice. Our forces need food and to provide for them we will need to know what farms are available to us.

Source: The spell seems to be a combination of glamours and illusions. It snared my brother and the other scholarly types.\n\nAnyway, we can't leave them like that. We have to snap them out of it.
Target: The spell seems to be a combination of glamours and illusions. It snared my brother and the other scholarly types.\n\nAnyway, we can't leave them like that. We have to snap them out of it.

Source: Have you come to prove your worth, recruit? Balfieral has become a land of war and death, a land with no place for the weak. Show us your worth: enter this land of death, and do not return until you have slain ten of our enemies.
Target: Have you come to prove your worth, recruit? Balfieral has become a land of war and death, a land with no place for the weak. Show us your worth: enter this land of death, and do not return until you have slain ten of our enemies.

Source: Daedra. Poor town was devastated by the beasts. We managed to crush the assault, but the place is still a mess. We need to get the villagers clear so recovery efforts can begin.
Target: Daedra. Poor town was devastated by the beasts. We managed to crush the assault, but the place is still a mess. We need to get the villagers clear so recovery efforts can begin.

Source: The guards of the Daggerfall covenant reek of weakness and fear. Kill one of them and let the rest know why they should fear us.
Target: The guards of the Daggerfall covenant reek of weakness and fear. Kill one of them and let the rest know why they should fear us.

Source: Our enemies cannot be allowed even the thought of being secure. Make an example of twenty of their guards.
Target: Our enemies cannot be allowed even the thought of being secure. Make an example of twenty of their guards.

Source: I was hoping you'd offer. \n\nFirsthold is just a short journey from here. Follow the road to the northwest, and bring the news to one of the Marines there, if not Urcelmo himself.
Target: I was hoping you'd offer. \n\nFirsthold is just a short journey from here. Follow the road to the northwest, and bring the news to one of the Marines there, if not Urcelmo himself.

Source: The Covenant wants walls and if I have thing to say about, the Covenant will have 'em. Go capture Fort Balfiera!
Target: The Covenant wants walls and if I have thing to say about, the Covenant will have 'em. Go capture Fort Balfiera!

Source: My son, Sorondil—scion of the last High Kinsman, Rilis the Twelfth.\n\nI … I was Rilis's mistress. And now my son risks his life for some fool treasure.
Target: My son, Sorondil—scion of the last High Kinsman, Rilis the Twelfth.\n\nI … I was Rilis's mistress. And now my son risks his life for some fool treasure.

Source: The Aldmeri Dominion are lost to their arrogance and ancient ways. Thin their numbers recruit,  the less of them we have to deal with later, the better.
Target: The Aldmeri Dominion are lost to their arrogance and ancient ways. Thin their numbers recruit,  the less of them we have to deal with later, the better.

Source: Falarel happened. The arcane jester to the cruel Rilis the Twelfth. I didn't appreciate his act. \n\nSo he tortured me to death and trapped my soul.
Target: Falarel happened. The arcane jester to the cruel Rilis the Twelfth. I didn't appreciate his act. \n\nSo he tortured me to death and trapped my soul.

Source: An army fights on its stomach but to properly feed an army we need to know what farms we have access to. Head into Balfiera and scout out Balfiera Farm.
Target: An army fights on its stomach but to properly feed an army we need to know what farms we have access to. Head into Balfiera and scout out Balfiera Farm.

Source: We have received reports of enemy troop movements near the nearby lumber mill. If this is the case we need to know immediately. Go to the Lumber Mill and return to me with your findings.
Target: We have received reports of enemy troop movements near the nearby lumber mill. If this is the case we need to know immediately. Go to the Lumber Mill and return to me with your findings.

Source: Yeah. Yeah, I'll be fine. Nasty little banekin took a bite out of me and I got separated from my squad.\n\nWe were heading back to the village to evacuate people.
Target: Yeah. Yeah, I'll be fine. Nasty little banekin took a bite out of me and I got separated from my squad.\n\nWe were heading back to the village to evacuate people.

Source: We are in need of lumber to bolster our fortifications and build supports for our mines. Secure the Lumber Mill for the Covenant.
Target: We are in need of lumber to bolster our fortifications and build supports for our mines. Secure the Lumber Mill for the Covenant.

Source: Now we find the spook that ensorcelled my crew and destroy it. \n\nWasting good treasure by putting a curse on it—now that's foul play, by Sithis.
Target: Now we find the spook that ensorcelled my crew and destroy it. \n\nWasting good treasure by putting a curse on it—now that's foul play, by Sithis.

Source: We have to ensure that our enemies do not outpace us in war materials. For every asset we claim, there is one less available for them. Capture the mine for the Covenant!
Target: We have to ensure that our enemies do not outpace us in war materials. For every asset we claim, there is one less available for them. Capture the mine for the Covenant!

Source: QUEST: Forbidden Worship - Old Ver.
Target: QUEST: Forbidden Worship - Old Ver.

Source: You may be a member of the Daggerfall Covenant, but if you wish to be truly accepted, you'll have to prove you're willing to serve. Eliminate ten of our enemies and return here alive.
Target: You may be a member of the Daggerfall Covenant, but if you wish to be truly accepted, you'll have to prove you're willing to serve. Eliminate ten of our enemies and return here alive.

Source: Do not make the mistake of underestimating the threat of the Ebonheart Pact. Your assignment is to thin out their numbers.
Target: Do not make the mistake of underestimating the threat of the Ebonheart Pact. Your assignment is to thin out their numbers.

Source: We need to know what mines are available to us. That's where you come in. I need you to scout out BalfieraMine, the sooner the better.
Target: We need to know what mines are available to us. That's where you come in. I need you to scout out BalfieraMine, the sooner the better.

Source: Never! The game is sacrosanct! But I can alter the rules to keep the contestants guessing and to keep my own interest in the proceedings high.\n\nReport to the one you pledged your allegiance to. The game begins now.
Target: Never! The game is sacrosanct! But I can alter the rules to keep the contestants guessing and to keep my own interest in the proceedings high.\n\nReport to the one you pledged your allegiance to. The game begins now.

Source: The keep in Balfiera trade owners almost on a daily basis. We need to know which ones are available for us to take. Head into the wild and scout out Fort Balfiera.
Target: The keep in Balfiera trade owners almost on a daily basis. We need to know which ones are available for us to take. Head into the wild and scout out Fort Balfiera.

Source: It's more subtle than that. My campaign will take me through Dawnbreak, but my Eyes tell me the Canonreeve there, Sinyon, supports the Veiled Heritance. If Estre has fled, she may seek reinforcements there.
Target: It's more subtle than that. My campaign will take me through Dawnbreak, but my Eyes tell me the Canonreeve there, Sinyon, supports the Veiled Heritance. If Estre has fled, she may seek reinforcements there.

Source: The Aldmeri are lost to their arrogance and ancient ways. Thin their numbers recruit,  the less of them we have to deal with later, the better.
Target: The Aldmeri are lost to their arrogance and ancient ways. Thin their numbers recruit,  the less of them we have to deal with later, the better.

Source: Razum-dar has been investigating threads in the Veiled Heritance plot. We think he's caught a break in Mathiisen, and he could use some help. \n\nHead up there and lend him a hand, will you?
Target: Razum-dar has been investigating threads in the Veiled Heritance plot. We think he's caught a break in Mathiisen, and he could use some help. \n\nHead up there and lend him a hand, will you?

Source: The fewer Ebonheart Pact members roaming free out in Cyrodiil, the better. Head out into Balfiera and bring down one of the savages. Return to me when you have slain one of our enemies.
Target: The fewer Ebonheart Pact members roaming free out in Cyrodiil, the better. Head out into Balfiera and bring down one of the savages. Return to me when you have slain one of our enemies.

Source: Headaches! Enough for three!\n\nThese people, they think everything is magic. They say to me, "<<1>>, this ancient spoon is just a spoon." Of course it is a spoon! Ayleids ate too, yes?
Target: Headaches! Enough for three!\n\nThese people, they think everything is magic. They say to me, \\"<<1>>
column4: this ancient spoon is just a spoon.\"\" Of course it is a spoon! Ayleids ate too
column5: yes?"

Source: The Eyes of the Queen. Well enough, then.\n\nMaormer raiders hit the cove. I've called for reinforcements, but … if they don't show soon.
Target: The Eyes of the Queen. Well enough, then.\n\nMaormer raiders hit the cove. I've called for reinforcements, but … if they don't show soon.

Source: No, I haven't.
Target: No, I haven't.

Source: The guards caught me sneaking around. They don't believe I'm trying to save the village. \n\nThe Bloodthorn are gathering the villagers at the docks for sacrifice. They kill them and raise them as zombies! I don't want my friends to end up like that!
Target: The guards caught me sneaking around. They don't believe I'm trying to save the village. \n\nThe Bloodthorn are gathering the villagers at the docks for sacrifice. They kill them and raise them as zombies! I don't want my friends to end up like that!

Source: QUEST: Merchant Matters
Target: QUEST: Merchant Matters

Source: The Bloodthorn have been draining my essence to fuel their necromantic rituals. They're transporting the animated dead from the docks. They've sent zombies as far north as Cath Bedraud, and Daggerfall is next.
Target: The Bloodthorn have been draining my essence to fuel their necromantic rituals. They're transporting the animated dead from the docks. They've sent zombies as far north as Cath Bedraud, and Daggerfall is next.

Source: These Bloodthorn cretins ambushed me! And while I was on a mission of incredible importance! There were dozens of them!\n\nBut I didn't go down without a fight. What will the Lion Guard do without me?
Target: These Bloodthorn cretins ambushed me! And while I was on a mission of incredible importance! There were dozens of them!\n\nBut I didn't go down without a fight. What will the Lion Guard do without me?

Source: Before you lies three trials—endurance, intelligence, and strength. A Heritance officer must embody all three of these virtues or they're no officer.\n\nI recruited you. Don't fail me.
Target: Before you lies three trials—endurance, intelligence, and strength. A Heritance officer must embody all three of these virtues or they're no officer.\n\nI recruited you. Don't fail me.

Source: Canonreeve Oraneth, an Altmer politician, has hired Wood Orc mercenaries to dig up bones buried in the Hollow.\n\nThe Canonreeve is up to something, and we would stop her before she goes any further.
Target: Canonreeve Oraneth, an Altmer politician, has hired Wood Orc mercenaries to dig up bones buried in the Hollow.\n\nThe Canonreeve is up to something, and we would stop her before she goes any further.

Source: Belarata? It's a very old structure of Ayleid origin. She's never been opened! That's why I came. I'd heard he's been inside.\n\nComplete waste of time, though. She's still sealed up, no matter what that Khajiit <<1>> says!
Target: Belarata? It's a very old structure of Ayleid origin. She's never been opened! That's why I came. I'd heard he's been inside.\n\nComplete waste of time, though. She's still sealed up, no matter what that Khajiit <<1>> says!

Source: Something's definitely not right in the village. Whatever the Bloodthorn are up to, it's taking a lot of effort. They're moving around a lot, and we've seen boats sailing into and away from the docks.\n\nMaybe the Red Rook bandit we caught knows more.
Target: Something's definitely not right in the village. Whatever the Bloodthorn are up to, it's taking a lot of effort. They're moving around a lot, and we've seen boats sailing into and away from the docks.\n\nMaybe the Red Rook bandit we caught knows more.

Source: The Sea Drakes! When it gets foggy, like last night, they play tricks with the lighthouse, lure ships aground.\n\nThe Maiden's Breath—my ship—they lured us in and wrecked us.
Target: The Sea Drakes! When it gets foggy, like last night, they play tricks with the lighthouse, lure ships aground.\n\nThe Maiden's Breath—my ship—they lured us in and wrecked us.

Source: The more mines we claim, the fewer there are for our enemies. Capture Balfiera Mine for the Ebonheart Pact.
Target: The more mines we claim, the fewer there are for our enemies. Capture Balfiera Mine for the Ebonheart Pact.

Source: The Veiled Council meets in the grand hall. It's north of here, near the top of the island.
Target: The Veiled Council meets in the grand hall. It's north of here, near the top of the island.

Source: The time of the Aldmeri is over. They are stuck in the past, and must be shown that we of the Ebonheart Pact now rule in Tamriel. Decrease their forces by thirty... permanently.
Target: The time of the Aldmeri is over. They are stuck in the past, and must be shown that we of the Ebonheart Pact now rule in Tamriel. Decrease their forces by thirty... permanently.

Source: <You notice the nearly invisible seam of a circular disk at the center of the stone.>
Target: <You notice the nearly invisible seam of a circular disk at the center of the stone.>

Source: Have you come to prove your worth, recruit? Balfiera has become a land of war and death, a land with no place for the weak. Enter this land of death, and do not return until you have slain thirty of our enemies.
Target: Have you come to prove your worth, recruit? Balfiera has become a land of war and death, a land with no place for the weak. Enter this land of death, and do not return until you have slain thirty of our enemies.

Source: A whirlpool. It pulled in our ship and dropped us here. We fell right out of the sky!\n\nWe went looking for the shipwrecks of the Lost Fleet. Never expected to find them in another world entirely.
Target: A whirlpool. It pulled in our ship and dropped us here. We fell right out of the sky!\n\nWe went looking for the shipwrecks of the Lost Fleet. Never expected to find them in another world entirely.

Source: Have you come to prove your worth, recruit? Balfiera has become a land of war and death, a land with no place for the weak. Enter this land of death, and do not return until you have slain thirty of our enemies.
Target: Have you come to prove your worth, recruit? Balfiera has become a land of war and death, a land with no place for the weak. Enter this land of death, and do not return until you have slain thirty of our enemies.

Source: <<1>>? He's my guide to Alik'r. He shows me the best routes and helps me make camp, but he doesn't know much about the great history of this land.\n\nI need someone to look around the ruins for an ancient sword.
Target: <<1>>? He's my guide to Alik'r. He shows me the best routes and helps me make camp, but he doesn't know much about the great history of this land.\n\nI need someone to look around the ruins for an ancient sword.

Source: Ah, so you understand simple Tamrielic. Good. I'll keep it short.\n\nYou—outsider. Leave. Or else.
Target: Ah, so you understand simple Tamrielic. Good. I'll keep it short.\n\nYou—outsider. Leave. Or else.

Source: Our scouting party was ambushed. With all the fighting and confusion, we got separated. \n\nNow I'm too badly hurt to find my scouts.
Target: Our scouting party was ambushed. With all the fighting and confusion, we got separated. \n\nNow I'm too badly hurt to find my scouts.

Source: Our foes foolishly think that walls of stone will be enough to still our hand. Tear the very walls down around Fort Balfiera!
Target: Our foes foolishly think that walls of stone will be enough to still our hand. Tear the very walls down around Fort Balfiera!

Source: Not sure. I have orders to send you to the royal manse at once.
Target: Not sure. I have orders to send you to the royal manse at once.

Source: "Grand Warlord Sorcalin has placed a bounty upon the heads of all enemy soldiers. Any Dominion soldier slaying 20 of our enemies is entitled to a bonus.\n\nReturn when you have completed this mission."
Target: \\"Grand Warlord Sorcalin has placed a bounty upon the heads of all enemy soldiers. Any Dominion soldier slaying 20 of our enemies is entitled to a bonus.\n\nReturn when you have completed this mission.\"\""

Source: The Ebonheart Pact needs for you to take Balfiera Lumbermill; the resources will go a long way towards seeing our work here done.
Target: The Ebonheart Pact needs for you to take Balfiera Lumbermill; the resources will go a long way towards seeing our work here done.

Source: If we are to take and hold Cyrodiil we have to know what fortifications the enemy has and which ones we may take. You will be our eyes.
Target: If we are to take and hold Cyrodiil we have to know what fortifications the enemy has and which ones we may take. You will be our eyes.

Source: What's going on?
Target: What's going on?

Source: What did I do?
Target: What did I do?

Source: We do keep meeting in the most interesting places.
Target: We do keep meeting in the most interesting places.

Source: Did I do something wrong?
Target: Did I do something wrong?

Source: Bandits! They look like they're with the Midnight Union, but …. there's no time to explain.\n\nJust please, go to the northwest entrance and talk to Sister Safia. She'll tell you how you can help.
Target: Bandits! They look like they're with the Midnight Union, but …. there's no time to explain.\n\nJust please, go to the northwest entrance and talk to Sister Safia. She'll tell you how you can help.

Source: All right, I'll dance the Lava Foot Stomp.
Target: All right, I'll dance the Lava Foot Stomp.

Source: The Covenant is here?
Target: The Covenant is here?

Source: Bandits! They look like they're with the Midnight Union, but …. there's no time to explain.\n\nJust please, go up the path and talk to Sister Safia. She'll tell you how you can help.
Target: Bandits! They look like they're with the Midnight Union, but …. there's no time to explain.\n\nJust please, go up the path and talk to Sister Safia. She'll tell you how you can help.

Source: Slow down. I might be willing to help, but I don't know if I want to buy a slave.
Target: Slow down. I might be willing to help, but I don't know if I want to buy a slave.

Source: I'm ready.
Target: I'm ready.

Source: I'll find your witch and get her to release you.
Target: I'll find your witch and get her to release you.

Source: What do you have in mind?
Target: What do you have in mind?

Source: All right. I'll keep an eye out for these stones.
Target: All right. I'll keep an eye out for these stones.

Source: I'll pay Savarak a visit.
Target: I'll pay Savarak a visit.

Source: Is there something wrong?
Target: Is there something wrong?

Source: All right, I'll introduce them to Mud Ball Merriment.
Target: All right, I'll introduce them to Mud Ball Merriment.

Source: I'll see what I can do.
Target: I'll see what I can do.

Source: Do you have any other problems?
Target: Do you have any other problems?

Source: What is it? Something in the sand?
Target: What is it? Something in the sand?

Source: I went to Wayrest to buy a gift for my love, Miranda. When I returned, the estate was overrun!\n\nThey're holding her for ransom. It's my wife's family that has money, not me! If I can't bargain from a position of strength, they'll kill her.
Target: I went to Wayrest to buy a gift for my love, Miranda. When I returned, the estate was overrun!\n\nThey're holding her for ransom. It's my wife's family that has money, not me! If I can't bargain from a position of strength, they'll kill her.

Source: Who you looking for?
Target: Who you looking for?

Source: I've created a sleep potion using the puffball caps. Take it and pour some into each of the drinking kegs around the estate.\n\nPut enough of those kidnappers to sleep and we'll have some real leverage to bargain.
Target: I've created a sleep potion using the puffball caps. Take it and pour some into each of the drinking kegs around the estate.\n\nPut enough of those kidnappers to sleep and we'll have some real leverage to bargain.

Source: He went back inside the Watch to look for survivors. He sent me to find reinforcements. Can you pitch in?
Target: He went back inside the Watch to look for survivors. He sent me to find reinforcements. Can you pitch in?

Source: How may I serve the Dominion?
Target: How may I serve the Dominion?

Source: How may I serve the Dominion?
Target: How may I serve the Dominion?

Source: Do I know you?
Target: Do I know you?

Source: What can I do?
Target: What can I do?

Source: What happened here?
Target: What happened here?

Source: A cult of Daedra worshipers! They called themselves "Supernal Dreamers."\n\nWe were returning from Daggerfall on a mission from the High King ….
Target: A cult of Daedra worshipers! They called themselves \\"Supernal Dreamers.\"\"\n\nWe were returning from Daggerfall on a mission from the High King …."

Source: I might have something that will interest you. We captured a Red Rook messenger prowling around our camp.\n\nWe think he was going to a Red Rooks and Bloodthorns meeting. Rumor is they're forming an alliance, but we can't get the messenger to talk.
Target: I might have something that will interest you. We captured a Red Rook messenger prowling around our camp.\n\nWe think he was going to a Red Rooks and Bloodthorns meeting. Rumor is they're forming an alliance, but we can't get the messenger to talk.

Source: Oh, my ruined leg... I can't walk. There's a Lurker! In the swamp. It came at us!\n\nWe should have kept to the road, but a detour would save us a day, and... oh, I hope Isabelle's safe. Aurore, my wife, went looking. Please find them? In the swamp?
Target: Oh, my ruined leg... I can't walk. There's a Lurker! In the swamp. It came at us!\n\nWe should have kept to the road, but a detour would save us a day, and... oh, I hope Isabelle's safe. Aurore, my wife, went looking. Please find them? In the swamp?

Target: What do you mean?

Target: Where have they taken it?

Source: We knew Shiri believed the third Ward was here … and that you came this way, so we were hoping ….\n\nAlas, there is one other place she might be, but I am too weak to make the journey. Will you take on the search for Shiri in my stead?
Target: We knew Shiri believed the third Ward was here … and that you came this way, so we were hoping ….\n\nAlas, there is one other place she might be, but I am too weak to make the journey. Will you take on the search for Shiri in my stead?

Target: What happened here? Who attacked you?

Source: Thank you. Most of the Ash'abah live together, wandering the desert, going gods-know-where.\n\nTrack them down and tell their leader Marimah that the Alik'r needs him again. We need the Ash'abah to fight the Withered Hand.
Target: Thank you. Most of the Ash'abah live together, wandering the desert, going gods-know-where.\n\nTrack them down and tell their leader Marimah that the Alik'r needs him again. We need the Ash'abah to fight the Withered Hand.

Target: Alexandra Conele leads a force that outnumbers us five to one. If the dreugh hadn't ambushed both of us, she'd have wiped us out.\n\nWe must deal with the dreugh. Then we'll stop Conele from getting the Coral Heart.

Source: Problem? I've got a battlefield full of ghosts! Sprung out of the ground like corn in the month of Mid Year.\n\nThey killed those Covenant bastards, which is great. But how do you kill what's already dead? My Mages can't even agree on what to do!
