Target: We know the largest threats in the keep consist of several bosses controlling the undead, most notibly the evil lord Therion Direblood himself. Take out these menaces to ensure our victory over this horrible evil that has befallen our lands.

Source: In taking our vengeance against the Baron, we mustn't forget our code. The Baron practices dark magics, and we must catch him in the act. There must be some dark creatures here. Find them, so that we can properly spread the tale.
Target: In taking our vengeance against the Baron, we mustn't forget our code. The Baron practices dark magics, and we must catch him in the act. There must be some dark creatures here. Find them, so that we can properly spread the tale.

Source: Baron Blackmoore's death needs to be a message. I'll make sure no one can get in from here while you go and make his death memorable. The coward will likely flee at the sight of you. Don't let him escape.
Target: Baron Blackmoore's death needs to be a message. I'll make sure no one can get in from here while you go and make his death memorable. The coward will likely flee at the sight of you. Don't let him escape.

Source: Thank you for the opportunity, Cadwell.
Target: Thank you for the opportunity, Cadwell.

Source: A local around Black Heights told me that a Twilight Cantor recently arrived in town and believes that spells trouble for their community.
Target: A local around Black Heights told me that a Twilight Cantor recently arrived in town and believes that spells trouble for their community.

Source: Who are you?
Target: Who are you?

Source: <Search the camp.>
Target: <Search the camp.>

Source: I'm sorry. Is there anything I can do to help?
Target: I'm sorry. Is there anything I can do to help?

Source: Has anyone gone to look for him?
Target: Has anyone gone to look for him?

Source: Where is the Green Lady, exactly?
Target: Where is the Green Lady, exactly?

Source: <Pour some wine from the keg.>
Target: <Pour some wine from the keg.>

Source: Carnival? What do you mean?
Target: Carnival? What do you mean?

Source: Has something happened?
Target: Has something happened?

Source: Please help me find my midget.  He keeps wandering off to play with that damn wolf.\n\nI'm so sad without my midget at my side... please find him.
Target: Please help me find my midget.  He keeps wandering off to play with that damn wolf.\n\nI'm so sad without my midget at my side... please find him.

Source: I'll try to help you.
Target: I'll try to help you.

Source: Paying the Maormer back already?
Target: Paying the Maormer back already?

Source: Greetings Adventurer. I'm in need of someone with your skills.  There is a magical tome hidden somewhere inside that I'm in dire need of. Could you fetch it for me?\n\nThere is no telling the evils abound... once you find it, return to me quickly!
Target: Greetings Adventurer. I'm in need of someone with your skills.  There is a magical tome hidden somewhere inside that I'm in dire need of. Could you fetch it for me?\n\nThere is no telling the evils abound... once you find it, return to me quickly!

Source: Any news of the captain?
Target: Any news of the captain?

Source: What happened?
Target: What happened?

Source: You were killed?
Target: You were killed?

Source: You mentioned the leader of the Stormfists?
Target: You mentioned the leader of the Stormfists?

Source: King Kurog has asked me to perform favors in his name for the clans that still haven't accepted his authority. In this way, he hopes that their chiefs will feel obligated to attend his Great Moot.
Target: King Kurog has asked me to perform favors in his name for the clans that still haven't accepted his authority. In this way, he hopes that their chiefs will feel obligated to attend his Great Moot.

Source: All is not right in Morkul Stronghold. <<1>>, the chief's eldest daughter, seeks a long lost relic in <<2>>.
Target: All is not right in Morkul Stronghold. <<1>>, the chief's eldest daughter, seeks a long lost relic in <<2>>.

Source: I suspect you are a Numinous, and should therefore report to the Queen at the Immaculate Tabernacle. State your name and condition.
Target: I suspect you are a Numinous, and should therefore report to the Queen at the Immaculate Tabernacle. State your name and condition.

Source: A wagon caravan suffered an attack on the road. The wreckage likely contains valuables—treasures that might draw the eye of someone trying to get ahead in crime-ridden South Guard.
Target: A wagon caravan suffered an attack on the road. The wreckage likely contains valuables—treasures that might draw the eye of someone trying to get ahead in crime-ridden South Guard.

Source: "This stone contains a private message of vital importance for <<1>> from Vanus Galerion of the Mages Guild. Activate the stone to receive the message."
Target: \\"This stone contains a private message of vital importance for <<1>> from Vanus Galerion of the Mages Guild. Activate the stone to receive the message.\"\""

Source: "This voucher provides the bearer with one cake for special occasions from the renowned baker, Chef Donolon."
Target: \\"This voucher provides the bearer with one cake for special occasions from the renowned baker
column4: Chef Donolon.\"\""

Source: The Sea Sloads have unleashed abyssal geysers that can sink the island. They assumed we'd be so concerned with the creatures that bubbled out of them that we'd fail to realize the true danger until it was too late.\n\nLet's disappoint them, shall we?
Target: The Sea Sloads have unleashed abyssal geysers that can sink the island. They assumed we'd be so concerned with the creatures that bubbled out of them that we'd fail to realize the true danger until it was too late.\n\nLet's disappoint them, shall we?

Source: Confused? Bah! You sound like that scrawny mage, Erudil!\n\nMy course is plain! I must make my way to the dwelling place of my honored ancestors, to bathe my beard in meade and sing the shield-thane's song of battle! Make way, or taste skyforged steel!
Target: Confused? Bah! You sound like that scrawny mage, Erudil!\n\nMy course is plain! I must make my way to the dwelling place of my honored ancestors, to bathe my beard in meade and sing the shield-thane's song of battle! Make way, or taste skyforged steel!

Source: A gang of Alfiq thieves destroyed a priceless Khajiit tapestry and ran off with the pieces. I should find the pieces so that the masterpiece can be restored to its former glory.
Target: A gang of Alfiq thieves destroyed a priceless Khajiit tapestry and ran off with the pieces. I should find the pieces so that the masterpiece can be restored to its former glory.

Source: The Ritemaster holds you in high regard. That is proof enough of your worthiness.\n\nThe Psijic Order requires practical wisdom. Outside perspective. Unless I miss my guess, you can provide both. You would be a worthy addition to our ranks.
Target: The Ritemaster holds you in high regard. That is proof enough of your worthiness.\n\nThe Psijic Order requires practical wisdom. Outside perspective. Unless I miss my guess, you can provide both. You would be a worthy addition to our ranks.

Source: I recently received a message that was apparently meant for you. From an Oracle. It came to me in a most … unsettling manner.\n\nAnyway, I determined the chances of meeting you here and there you are! Saves me the trouble of crafting a message stone.
Target: I recently received a message that was apparently meant for you. From an Oracle. It came to me in a most … unsettling manner.\n\nAnyway, I determined the chances of meeting you here and there you are! Saves me the trouble of crafting a message stone.

Source: We are the Psijic Order, friend of Valsirenn. There is very little we cannot accomplish through the application of the Old Ways.\n\nEvery object remembers its history. The trick involves selecting the correct ritual to reveal those buried memories.
Target: We are the Psijic Order, friend of Valsirenn. There is very little we cannot accomplish through the application of the Old Ways.\n\nEvery object remembers its history. The trick involves selecting the correct ritual to reveal those buried memories.

Source: My garden—my art—has been violated. Desecrated by some vulgar Wood Elf who thinks being raised in the wild gives him the right to pervert my designs.\n\nNow he's threatening my life. Can you believe it?
Target: My garden—my art—has been violated. Desecrated by some vulgar Wood Elf who thinks being raised in the wild gives him the right to pervert my designs.\n\nNow he's threatening my life. Can you believe it?

Source: A dark entity called K'Tora set a trap for a group of adventurers. It locked them in their own minds. I've established a mental link with the group, but I can't maintain it and also perform the tasks necessary to set them free.\n\nI need your help.
Target: A dark entity called K'Tora set a trap for a group of adventurers. It locked them in their own minds. I've established a mental link with the group, but I can't maintain it and also perform the tasks necessary to set them free.\n\nI need your help.

Source: My wine bottles! They should be right here. Father's going to kill me if I come home empty-handed. Again.\n\nI must have lost them during the winery tour. I may have had one too many tastings. It's all still very … hazy.
Target: My wine bottles! They should be right here. Father's going to kill me if I come home empty-handed. Again.\n\nI must have lost them during the winery tour. I may have had one too many tastings. It's all still very … hazy.

Source: What keen ears you have! You heard us discussing a private matter from way over there? Impressive.\n\nPerhaps you can put that inquisitive nature to good use. A newcomer, much like you, is stirring up trouble here in Lillandril.
Target: What keen ears you have! You heard us discussing a private matter from way over there? Impressive.\n\nPerhaps you can put that inquisitive nature to good use. A newcomer, much like you, is stirring up trouble here in Lillandril.

Source: <Z'Maja's amulet has cracked and is no longer able to summon shadows. It's useless to you, but may be valuable to one who wishes to learn more about Z'Maja's magic.>
Target: <Z'Maja's amulet has cracked and is no longer able to summon shadows. It's useless to you, but may be valuable to one who wishes to learn more about Z'Maja's magic.>

Source: I looked through her things. An abominable breach of confidence, I know.\n\nIn any event, I found some renderings of a mine her family once owned—Divad's Chagrin. It is both remote and largely untouched by world events. Perfect for her endeavor.
Target: I looked through her things. An abominable breach of confidence, I know.\n\nIn any event, I found some renderings of a mine her family once owned—Divad's Chagrin. It is both remote and largely untouched by world events. Perfect for her endeavor.

Source: The staff comprises eight pieces—one for each of Nirn's girding towers. Whatever force drew the staff back to Tamriel scattered these pieces across the continent.\n\nWe managed to scry the locations of four of them. The others elude us. For now.
Target: The staff comprises eight pieces—one for each of Nirn's girding towers. Whatever force drew the staff back to Tamriel scattered these pieces across the continent.\n\nWe managed to scry the locations of four of them. The others elude us. For now.

Source: <On the remains of the Celestial Mage, a single gem fall loose. This can serve as proof to the Undaunted of your conquest.>
Target: <On the remains of the Celestial Mage, a single gem fall loose. This can serve as proof to the Undaunted of your conquest.>

Source: According to our scryers' visions, fragments lay buried near the Brothers of Strife in Stonefalls, the Weeping Giant in Stormhaven, Greenheart in Greenshade, and the Spellscar in Craglorn.\n\nEach of these locations hold great Aurbic significance.
Target: According to our scryers' visions, fragments lay buried near the Brothers of Strife in Stonefalls, the Weeping Giant in Stormhaven, Greenheart in Greenshade, and the Spellscar in Craglorn.\n\nEach of these locations hold great Aurbic significance.

Source: "The Star-Gazers, a group of scholars devoted to the study of the stars, seek able-bodied warriors from across Tamriel to face these threats. If you would lend your aid, please contact Hara at the hilltop observatory in Belkarth."
Target: \\"The Star-Gazers
column4: a group of scholars devoted to the study of the stars
column5: seek able-bodied warriors from across Tamriel to face these threats. If you would lend your aid
column6: please contact Hara at the hilltop observatory in Belkarth.\"\""

Source: Even with the staff fragments removed from Tamriel, time breaches continue to open across the continent. This time, in the forbidding land of Rivenspire.\n\nI only pray that they do not grow stronger now that the staff is so close to completion.
Target: Even with the staff fragments removed from Tamriel, time breaches continue to open across the continent. This time, in the forbidding land of Rivenspire.\n\nI only pray that they do not grow stronger now that the staff is so close to completion.

Source: <This is a piece of the Serpent's Apex Stone.>
Target: <This is a piece of the Serpent's Apex Stone.>

Source: Now that we can labor over the staff without the … complications Josajeh introduced, I am confident we will render the artifact harmless soon.\n\nUnfortunately, one cluster of time breaches remains. This time, in the barren land of Craglorn.
Target: Now that we can labor over the staff without the … complications Josajeh introduced, I am confident we will render the artifact harmless soon.\n\nUnfortunately, one cluster of time breaches remains. This time, in the barren land of Craglorn.

Source: Bad dreams. A great darkness, devouring Cloudrest as it filled the streets.\n\nMy mother's last letter spoke of the Welkynars capturing the Sea Sload Z'Maja, just a few days ago. If there's anything powerful enough to destroy a city, it's a Sload.
Target: Bad dreams. A great darkness, devouring Cloudrest as it filled the streets.\n\nMy mother's last letter spoke of the Welkynars capturing the Sea Sload Z'Maja, just a few days ago. If there's anything powerful enough to destroy a city, it's a Sload.

Source: Another cluster of time breaches appeared in the Wood Elves' homeland. Valenwood. We need you to seal these breaches, just as you did before. Josajeh will provide the tools you need.\n\nMay I ask another favor of you?
Target: Another cluster of time breaches appeared in the Wood Elves' homeland. Valenwood. We need you to seal these breaches, just as you did before. Josajeh will provide the tools you need.\n\nMay I ask another favor of you?

Source: <Amongst the ashes of the Celestial Warrior sits a battered and broken shield, likely taken as a trophy from one of the slain Undaunted.>
Target: <Amongst the ashes of the Celestial Warrior sits a battered and broken shield, likely taken as a trophy from one of the slain Undaunted.>

Source: Despite my position in the Scaled Court, I've grown wary of the Serpent. I realize now that we don't have the same goals. I want to make the world better. The Serpent just wants to destroy it and start over.\n\nWill you help me stop the Scaled Court?
Target: Despite my position in the Scaled Court, I've grown wary of the Serpent. I realize now that we don't have the same goals. I want to make the world better. The Serpent just wants to destroy it and start over.\n\nWill you help me stop the Scaled Court?

Source: You need to speak to Iachesis about this. All he said to me was that he remembers a whisper, a woman speaking the same words over and over. He thinks it has something to do with the barrier and where he hid the Heart of Transparent Law.
Target: You need to speak to Iachesis about this. All he said to me was that he remembers a whisper, a woman speaking the same words over and over. He thinks it has something to do with the barrier and where he hid the Heart of Transparent Law.

Source: We need to stop the Iron Orcs! They're building an army of trolls! \n\nRegent Cassipia sent me to convince them to disband the army, but they took my gold and tossed me out! Now that you're here, I have a better plan.
Target: We need to stop the Iron Orcs! They're building an army of trolls! \n\nRegent Cassipia sent me to convince them to disband the army, but they took my gold and tossed me out! Now that you're here, I have a better plan.

Source: Suddenly the ground opened, spewing water and strange creatures! They attacked us! Luckily, one of the newcomers, a Khajiit, leaped in and drove them back. Called himself Razum-dar.\n\nHe could probably use some help, if you're so inclined.
Target: Suddenly the ground opened, spewing water and strange creatures! They attacked us! Luckily, one of the newcomers, a Khajiit, leaped in and drove them back. Called himself Razum-dar.\n\nHe could probably use some help, if you're so inclined.

Source: That's the conundrum. Sotha Sil said he had information, but it was for the Ritemaster's ears only. He asked me to send the Ritemaster to see him when he returned from traveling the Dreaming Cave.\n\nI haven't told him what happened yet.
Target: That's the conundrum. Sotha Sil said he had information, but it was for the Ritemaster's ears only. He asked me to send the Ritemaster to see him when he returned from traveling the Dreaming Cave.\n\nI haven't told him what happened yet.

Source: Not exactly. He saw himself enter the Dreaming Cave beneath Ceporah Tower, carrying the Heart in his own two hands. And he didn't have it when he reemerged a short time later.
Target: Not exactly. He saw himself enter the Dreaming Cave beneath Ceporah Tower, carrying the Heart in his own two hands. And he didn't have it when he reemerged a short time later.

Source: "Adventure awaits! Queen Ayrenn has opened Summerset, home of the High Elves, to trade and travel. Come and explore the jewel of the sea, the birthplace of magic! A boat leaves regularly from most major cities. Talk to a navigator to book passage."
Target: \\"Adventure awaits! Queen Ayrenn has opened Summerset
column4: home of the High Elves
column5: to trade and travel. Come and explore the jewel of the sea
column6: the birthplace of magic! A boat leaves regularly from most major cities. Talk to a navigator to book passage.\"\""

Source: Brengas got caught up in a love affair, see. Decided to run off with some High Elf named Niralin. I was supposed to meet them in Archon's Grove, help them get off the island.\n\nBut when I got there all I saw were werewolves!
Target: Brengas got caught up in a love affair, see. Decided to run off with some High Elf named Niralin. I was supposed to meet them in Archon's Grove, help them get off the island.\n\nBut when I got there all I saw were werewolves!

Source: Just what I heard from one of the bailiffs. Apparently some daffy Bosmer called the Ghost of the Green did it, but no one knows for sure. The investigation's hit a snag. Something about the Rule of Three.\n\nSuperstitious nonsense if you ask me.
Target: Just what I heard from one of the bailiffs. Apparently some daffy Bosmer called the Ghost of the Green did it, but no one knows for sure. The investigation's hit a snag. Something about the Rule of Three.\n\nSuperstitious nonsense if you ask me.

Source: A traveler bade me seek out a suspicious Khajiit lurking near the Abode of Ignominy.
Target: A traveler bade me seek out a suspicious Khajiit lurking near the Abode of Ignominy.

Source: I'm not sure. It was in the scrying pool in the main gallery one moment, and then the next it was gone.\n\nThat's why the Ritemaster sent me to look for you. He needs your help.
Target: I'm not sure. It was in the scrying pool in the main gallery one moment, and then the next it was gone.\n\nThat's why the Ritemaster sent me to look for you. He needs your help.

Source: K'Tora has imprisoned a group of adventurers in mind traps, just as the dark entity did to you. I've established mental links with each member of the group, but I can't maintain the links and also perform the tasks necessary to set them free.
Target: K'Tora has imprisoned a group of adventurers in mind traps, just as the dark entity did to you. I've established mental links with each member of the group, but I can't maintain the links and also perform the tasks necessary to set them free.

Source: A certification will allow you to fulfill jewelry crafting writs. But first, you must demonstrate an understanding of the fundamentals.\n\nCreate for me a simple ring. Yes, that task will be suitable to show me your craft.
Target: A certification will allow you to fulfill jewelry crafting writs. But first, you must demonstrate an understanding of the fundamentals.\n\nCreate for me a simple ring. Yes, that task will be suitable to show me your craft.

Source: Our seers detected a new cluster of breaches in the lands of Morrowind and Skyrim. The elder members of the Order don't want to admit it, but I'm afraid these distortions are growing stronger.\n\nBut there's good news! We think we found the cause.
Target: Our seers detected a new cluster of breaches in the lands of Morrowind and Skyrim. The elder members of the Order don't want to admit it, but I'm afraid these distortions are growing stronger.\n\nBut there's good news! We think we found the cause.

Source: Can you now? I thought I could take care of myself, too. But even alongside the finest soldiers of the Silver Dawn, I couldn't take back this keep.\n\nAnd now here I am, entertainment for the very mongrels I swore to eradicate.
Target: Can you now? I thought I could take care of myself, too. But even alongside the finest soldiers of the Silver Dawn, I couldn't take back this keep.\n\nAnd now here I am, entertainment for the very mongrels I swore to eradicate.

Source: Our seers detected more of these time breaches. This time, in the Iliac Bay region. My homeland.\n\nThe Loremaster and I will keep searching for the cause of the disturbances. In the meantime, we need you to seal them.
Target: Our seers detected more of these time breaches. This time, in the Iliac Bay region. My homeland.\n\nThe Loremaster and I will keep searching for the cause of the disturbances. In the meantime, we need you to seal them.

Source: Me? Why, I just got a little lost, is all.\n\nI would have left already, if not for my friends. We were separated, you see, running away from those damn beasts. I'm not much of a fighter, so I'm just hoping they'll make their way out.
Target: Me? Why, I just got a little lost, is all.\n\nI would have left already, if not for my friends. We were separated, you see, running away from those damn beasts. I'm not much of a fighter, so I'm just hoping they'll make their way out.

Source: Of course they're missing. My fool husband let our prized hound off her leash to frolic along the beach. Poor Eustasia didn't know what to make of her freedom and went charging off after a hare. Durell took off in pursuit and I've seen neither since.
Target: Of course they're missing. My fool husband let our prized hound off her leash to frolic along the beach. Poor Eustasia didn't know what to make of her freedom and went charging off after a hare. Durell took off in pursuit and I've seen neither since.

Source: Moon Hunter Keep used to be a base for the Silver Dawn, an order of werewolf hunters. Now it's overrun by the very beasts they seek to eradicate. Talk about ironic.\n\nWe need you to clear the place out. Hope you're not allergic to dogs.
Target: Moon Hunter Keep used to be a base for the Silver Dawn, an order of werewolf hunters. Now it's overrun by the very beasts they seek to eradicate. Talk about ironic.\n\nWe need you to clear the place out. Hope you're not allergic to dogs.

Source: I admire your bravery, but defeating her will be no easy task.\n\nZ'Maja was almost impossible to take down alone. Now she commands shadow replicas of the Welkynars, dark imitations that possess all of their legendary skill in combat.
Target: I admire your bravery, but defeating her will be no easy task.\n\nZ'Maja was almost impossible to take down alone. Now she commands shadow replicas of the Welkynars, dark imitations that possess all of their legendary skill in combat.

Source: <Z'Maja's amulet has shattered, and only its chain remains. It's useless to you, but may be valuable to one who wishes to learn more about Z'Maja's magic.>
Target: <Z'Maja's amulet has shattered, and only its chain remains. It's useless to you, but may be valuable to one who wishes to learn more about Z'Maja's magic.>

Source: Yes, nirncrux. A crimson stone found only in this region.\n\nWe considered the rare element to be dangerous and worthless. But the Scaled Court calls it "the blood of Nirn." They've shown that the power contained within the stone is quite phenomenal.
Target: Yes, nirncrux. A crimson stone found only in this region.\n\nWe considered the rare element to be dangerous and worthless. But the Scaled Court calls it \\"the blood of Nirn.\"\" They've shown that the power contained within the stone is quite phenomenal."

Source: A family squabble, of sorts. You see, one of these cozies went and killed Vareda.\n\nProblem is, none of us are about to go treasure hunting with a murderer at our back. When killing for gold, you don't stop at one. Or so I hear.
Target: A family squabble, of sorts. You see, one of these cozies went and killed Vareda.\n\nProblem is, none of us are about to go treasure hunting with a murderer at our back. When killing for gold, you don't stop at one. Or so I hear.

Source: A new cluster of time distortions appeared in the swamps and fields north of Black Marsh—Shadowfen and Deshaan specifically.\n\nTake the Augur, the seals, and this map of the region. At this point, I'm sure you know what to do with them.
Target: A new cluster of time distortions appeared in the swamps and fields north of Black Marsh—Shadowfen and Deshaan specifically.\n\nTake the Augur, the seals, and this map of the region. At this point, I'm sure you know what to do with them.

Source: The Great Hunt. A savage contest hosted by Hircine himself. You'll have to fight your way through his realm of Oblivion in order to capture his grand prize.\n\nHe calls the place the March of Sacrifices. For obvious reasons.
Target: The Great Hunt. A savage contest hosted by Hircine himself. You'll have to fight your way through his realm of Oblivion in order to capture his grand prize.\n\nHe calls the place the March of Sacrifices. For obvious reasons.

Source: A traveler said he ran into a strange Khajiit lurking near the entrance of an old Akaviri tomb along the road to Rimmen. I've offered to speak to her.
Target: A traveler said he ran into a strange Khajiit lurking near the entrance of an old Akaviri tomb along the road to Rimmen. I've offered to speak to her.

Source: The prize of the Great Hunt, of course! \n\nWhoever slays the indrik and presents its heart to Hircine shall earn a boon from the Daedric Prince. A boon that I very much, desperately need if I ever wish to rescue my father from this wretched place.
Target: The prize of the Great Hunt, of course! \n\nWhoever slays the indrik and presents its heart to Hircine shall earn a boon from the Daedric Prince. A boon that I very much, desperately need if I ever wish to rescue my father from this wretched place.

Source: Where are the instruments now?
Target: Where are the instruments now?

Source: The fool I followed out here. I lost track of him after these wretched Goblins stole my pack. Hopefully he can manage not to get himself killed long enough for me recover our notes.
Target: The fool I followed out here. I lost track of him after these wretched Goblins stole my pack. Hopefully he can manage not to get himself killed long enough for me recover our notes.

Source: Why don't you check on them?
Target: Why don't you check on them?

Source: The glorious Pact sent Rigurt to bargain with Queen Ayrenn. To use my considerable charms to woo High Elves to talk of peace and an end to the Three Banners War. I even brought gifts to bestow upon the pretty Queen.\n\nBut Rigurt has failed. Again.
Target: The glorious Pact sent Rigurt to bargain with Queen Ayrenn. To use my considerable charms to woo High Elves to talk of peace and an end to the Three Banners War. I even brought gifts to bestow upon the pretty Queen.\n\nBut Rigurt has failed. Again.

Source: The Sapiarchs are Summerset's foremost scholars. They are the keepers of the Crystal Tower and the custodians of the College of Sapiarchs. Among their many responsibilities, they have trained every heir who ever sat upon Alinor's throne.
Target: The Sapiarchs are Summerset's foremost scholars. They are the keepers of the Crystal Tower and the custodians of the College of Sapiarchs. Among their many responsibilities, they have trained every heir who ever sat upon Alinor's throne.

Source: As a matter of fact, I do.\n\nI've heard rumors of a hulkynd in the forest outside Rellenthil, a perfect subject for my work. I'd like you to serve as my proxy and arrange a meeting between us. The sinkhole nearby should serve my purpose.
Target: As a matter of fact, I do.\n\nI've heard rumors of a hulkynd in the forest outside Rellenthil, a perfect subject for my work. I'd like you to serve as my proxy and arrange a meeting between us. The sinkhole nearby should serve my purpose.

Source: Tableau has left the House of Reveries, and tonight is her art debut. I received an invitation, but I suspect her patron caught wind of my arrival. \n\nLilawen doesn't quite … accept me as an acquaintance.
Target: Tableau has left the House of Reveries, and tonight is her art debut. I received an invitation, but I suspect her patron caught wind of my arrival. \n\nLilawen doesn't quite … accept me as an acquaintance.

Source: You just ran away?
Target: You just ran away?

Source: No idea. Erilthel asked to take the lead, and I obligingly took a nap. Didn't think it would be any trouble, even for a lackwit like her. Sneak past some cultists, grab the tokens, get out clean. Easy.\n\nBut now the place is swarming with Daedra.
Target: No idea. Erilthel asked to take the lead, and I obligingly took a nap. Didn't think it would be any trouble, even for a lackwit like her. Sneak past some cultists, grab the tokens, get out clean. Easy.\n\nBut now the place is swarming with Daedra.

Source: Those who drink the waters become unstoppable, it's true. And then their flesh whithers, along with their minds, and they become thralls to the one called Shada, the Nereid sorceress who first "blessed" the waters.
Target: Those who drink the waters become unstoppable, it's true. And then their flesh whithers, along with their minds, and they become thralls to the one called Shada, the Nereid sorceress who first \\"blessed\"\" the waters."

Source: "My name is Ozozur. If found, please deliver me to Gaireth at the Skywatch Mages Guild. A reward awaits. Just touch my necklace to contain me."
Target: \\"My name is Ozozur. If found
column4: please deliver me to Gaireth at the Skywatch Mages Guild. A reward awaits. Just touch my necklace to contain me.\"\""

Source: Well, yes, I would dare say you wouldn't! Not yet, anyway.\n\nYou see, this happens to be the Vault of Moawita, where the Psijic Order keeps its most cursed relics. It's a tad bit emptier than usual though. It seems we've had a break in.
Target: Well, yes, I would dare say you wouldn't! Not yet, anyway.\n\nYou see, this happens to be the Vault of Moawita, where the Psijic Order keeps its most cursed relics. It's a tad bit emptier than usual though. It seems we've had a break in.

Source: What do you mean the mountain's going to explode?
Target: What do you mean the mountain's going to explode?

Source: Long story. My wife sacrificed herself to save our village. Leapt into an Oblivion Gate, closed it behind her.\n\nAnd I couldn't let her go. Spent months trying to re-open the portal. I succeeded! But my success was short-lived.
Target: Long story. My wife sacrificed herself to save our village. Leapt into an Oblivion Gate, closed it behind her.\n\nAnd I couldn't let her go. Spent months trying to re-open the portal. I succeeded! But my success was short-lived.

Source: Are you going to send out more soldiers?
Target: Are you going to send out more soldiers?

Source: As you can see, a murder took place here. My proteges, Lorne and Soravil, came to investigate, but I fear they may lack perspective. The particulars of this murder …. Forgive me, I'm getting ahead of myself.\n\nThey need fresh eyes. Yours, I believe.
Target: As you can see, a murder took place here. My proteges, Lorne and Soravil, came to investigate, but I fear they may lack perspective. The particulars of this murder …. Forgive me, I'm getting ahead of myself.\n\nThey need fresh eyes. Yours, I believe.

Source: So, she's conscripting the vampires into an army?
Target: So, she's conscripting the vampires into an army?

Source: Have you found anything?
Target: Have you found anything?

Source: What do you think happened to your supplies?
Target: What do you think happened to your supplies?

Source: Where is this base?
Target: Where is this base?

Source: To what end?
Target: To what end?

Source: So what do we do if High King Svargrim refuses to see us?
Target: So what do we do if High King Svargrim refuses to see us?

Source: My father, Curtaros, runs a boat in an angler fleet. They're long overdue, and while his stride tends to be a leisurely one, I've never seen the whole fleet gone for so long.
Target: My father, Curtaros, runs a boat in an angler fleet. They're long overdue, and while his stride tends to be a leisurely one, I've never seen the whole fleet gone for so long.

Source: Why does your kind do anything?\n\nPerhaps you want to see what spoils you can mine from this place. Or maybe you want to help the mortals trapped deep below. Your kind has such baffling sensibilities.
Target: Why does your kind do anything?\n\nPerhaps you want to see what spoils you can mine from this place. Or maybe you want to help the mortals trapped deep below. Your kind has such baffling sensibilities.

Source: For centuries, Sunhold has been the first line of defense against Maormer raiders. Many of their soldiers have fallen by my family's command. And now, with our fleet gone and soldiers depleted, they've decided to strike.\n\nI need your help.
Target: For centuries, Sunhold has been the first line of defense against Maormer raiders. Many of their soldiers have fallen by my family's command. And now, with our fleet gone and soldiers depleted, they've decided to strike.\n\nI need your help.

Source: I will rescue the civilians and send them your way.
Target: I will rescue the civilians and send them your way.

Source: I'll go to Castle Dour and talk to Svana.
Target: I'll go to Castle Dour and talk to Svana.

Source: You want me to kill Xivkyn?
Target: You want me to kill Xivkyn?

Source: More than a few of us have disappeared recently. Karnhar's group are just the latest. They set out to search for the missing and vanished themselves.\n\nWe're giving those buried ruins a wide berth now.
Target: More than a few of us have disappeared recently. Karnhar's group are just the latest. They set out to search for the missing and vanished themselves.\n\nWe're giving those buried ruins a wide berth now.

Source: Pickle?
Target: Pickle?

Source: I will rescue the civilians and send them your way.
Target: I will rescue the civilians and send them your way.

Source: In all honesty, I'd rather leave her in this cave. She's certainly earned such a fate. \n\nBut if word got out that I left her to die, or if she managed to escape and actually marry that Wood Elf …. Suffice to say, I simply can't just leave her.
Target: In all honesty, I'd rather leave her in this cave. She's certainly earned such a fate. \n\nBut if word got out that I left her to die, or if she managed to escape and actually marry that Wood Elf …. Suffice to say, I simply can't just leave her.

Source: I'll look for him. Any idea where he might be?
Target: I'll look for him. Any idea where he might be?

Source: I almost forgot about that.
Target: I almost forgot about that.

Source: What do you think is in this book they refuse to burn?
Target: What do you think is in this book they refuse to burn?

Source: Justiciar Avanaire. She struck me down, ran off to this ruin.\n\nI was able to follow her this far. The rest of my squad went in after her, but I fear the worst. With that pearl, who knows what she's capable of?
Target: Justiciar Avanaire. She struck me down, ran off to this ruin.\n\nI was able to follow her this far. The rest of my squad went in after her, but I fear the worst. With that pearl, who knows what she's capable of?

Source: Where is this relic?
Target: Where is this relic?

Source: Where is this base?
Target: Where is this base?

Source: He must be at Alcaire Castle. He's advised Duke Nathaniel for years and with this Redguard Army in the region, the duke must be relying on him.\n\nStill, why he would issue such orders to Sir Croix … it makes no sense. He needs to come and explain.
Target: He must be at Alcaire Castle. He's advised Duke Nathaniel for years and with this Redguard Army in the region, the duke must be relying on him.\n\nStill, why he would issue such orders to Sir Croix … it makes no sense. He needs to come and explain.

Source: See for yourself. Ever since the head mage of Elinhir, Yamanu-ko, sealed herself in the Apex Tower, the Blackcaster mages have run wild in the streets. They're killing everyone—even each other!
Target: See for yourself. Ever since the head mage of Elinhir, Yamanu-ko, sealed herself in the Apex Tower, the Blackcaster mages have run wild in the streets. They're killing everyone—even each other!

Source: Faolchu, the beast you defeated at Camlorn, also fought and died here long ago.\n\nWe hoped your victory would provoke some reaction from the spirits. Sadly, though, nothing happened. We must find another way.
Target: Faolchu, the beast you defeated at Camlorn, also fought and died here long ago.\n\nWe hoped your victory would provoke some reaction from the spirits. Sadly, though, nothing happened. We must find another way.

Source: Some sort of celestial object. A few of the locals call it the Mage's staff. They say it fell from above just before the constellations vanished.\n\nIt's extremely volatile, and every magic-addicted sorcerer and atronach in the region is drawn to it.
Target: Some sort of celestial object. A few of the locals call it the Mage's staff. They say it fell from above just before the constellations vanished.\n\nIt's extremely volatile, and every magic-addicted sorcerer and atronach in the region is drawn to it.

Source: Something to do with the Crystal Tower, no doubt. Sotha Sil has never been forthcoming, though for some reason it appears that he's taken a liking to you.\n\nBut tell me, what of Darien and Leythen?
Target: Something to do with the Crystal Tower, no doubt. Sotha Sil has never been forthcoming, though for some reason it appears that he's taken a liking to you.\n\nBut tell me, what of Darien and Leythen?

Source: Our betters don't like to talk about it. When they do, they call it Traitor's Vault.\n\nAccording to my research, it used to serve as a retreat for the Order's most talented pupils. But then, without warning, the Ritemaster barred it shut.
Target: Our betters don't like to talk about it. When they do, they call it Traitor's Vault.\n\nAccording to my research, it used to serve as a retreat for the Order's most talented pupils. But then, without warning, the Ritemaster barred it shut.

Source: Your path begins with these munitions. Bring them to Adalmor at the siege range near the Northern Morrowind gate. The Transitus Shrine will speed you on your way.
Target: Your path begins with these munitions. Bring them to Adalmor at the siege range near the Northern Morrowind gate. The Transitus Shrine will speed you on your way.

Source: It's the Worm Cult. There are rumors that they've stolen Ysgramor's axe—Wuuthrad. My master says it has powers that we cannot understand and that the Worms are working some kind of dark magic with it.\n\nSome even say that Wuuthrad's been shattered!
Target: It's the Worm Cult. There are rumors that they've stolen Ysgramor's axe—Wuuthrad. My master says it has powers that we cannot understand and that the Worms are working some kind of dark magic with it.\n\nSome even say that Wuuthrad's been shattered!

Source: Sotha Sil said he had information meant only for Ritemaster Iachesis's ears. He asked me to send the Ritemaster to see him when he returned from traveling the Dreaming Cave.
Target: Sotha Sil said he had information meant only for Ritemaster Iachesis's ears. He asked me to send the Ritemaster to see him when he returned from traveling the Dreaming Cave.

Source: The simplest of tasks to begin. Carry these munitions to Bugbesh, master of the siege range near the Southern High Rock gate. The Transitus Shrine will take you there faster than the swiftest steed.
Target: The simplest of tasks to begin. Carry these munitions to Bugbesh, master of the siege range near the Southern High Rock gate. The Transitus Shrine will take you there faster than the swiftest steed.

Source: Some madness seized them when they drank the water. They kept talking about someone named Shada … and something about a sacrifice?\n\nPlease. There were three of them—Klause, Squan, and Zifri. They went through the sealed door. You must stop them.
Target: Some madness seized them when they drank the water. They kept talking about someone named Shada … and something about a sacrifice?\n\nPlease. There were three of them—Klause, Squan, and Zifri. They went through the sealed door. You must stop them.

Source: The coven isn't acting alone. Someone called the Ashen Lord commands vampires and werewolves.
Target: The coven isn't acting alone. Someone called the Ashen Lord commands vampires and werewolves.

Source: She wished to meet at her camp. Given the manner of the riffraff one sees on the road these days, I cut through the forest. \n\nIt's a maze in there! I was hired to defend a respectable research expedition, not to tramp through the woods in full armor.
Target: She wished to meet at her camp. Given the manner of the riffraff one sees on the road these days, I cut through the forest. \n\nIt's a maze in there! I was hired to defend a respectable research expedition, not to tramp through the woods in full armor.

Source: You think the people who responded to the flier we found are in danger?
Target: You think the people who responded to the flier we found are in danger?

Source: The Royal Menagerie. It holds exotic species from all over Tamriel. Now they're running loose, attacking the keepers, and each other. It's a slaughter.\n\nIt's too dangerous for a gentle indrik like Lotus. Please, can you help me search for her?
Target: The Royal Menagerie. It holds exotic species from all over Tamriel. Now they're running loose, attacking the keepers, and each other. It's a slaughter.\n\nIt's too dangerous for a gentle indrik like Lotus. Please, can you help me search for her?

Source: Why would wolves attack farmhands?
Target: Why would wolves attack farmhands?

Source: The Provost? He commands the Lion Guard camp near the old ruins. Tell him you want to help and he'll probably give you a commission!\n\nWe captured a Red Rook messenger. He was on his way to a secret meeting when we snatched up the lout.
Target: The Provost? He commands the Lion Guard camp near the old ruins. Tell him you want to help and he'll probably give you a commission!\n\nWe captured a Red Rook messenger. He was on his way to a secret meeting when we snatched up the lout.

Source: What do you think might have happened?
Target: What do you think might have happened?

Source: Nothing too hard. Start by bringing these munitions over to Zan at the siege range near the Eastern Elsweyr gate. Use the Transitus Shrine to get there fast.
Target: Nothing too hard. Start by bringing these munitions over to Zan at the siege range near the Eastern Elsweyr gate. Use the Transitus Shrine to get there fast.

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: And you don't agree with that approach?
Target: And you don't agree with that approach?

Source: We must separate them. Great damage to Sinmur will tear their spirits asunder. Then both are vulnerable.\n\nEither the shards of Wuuthrad or mighty companions are needed for this task!
Target: We must separate them. Great damage to Sinmur will tear their spirits asunder. Then both are vulnerable.\n\nEither the shards of Wuuthrad or mighty companions are needed for this task!

Source: Svana didn't say what she wanted?
Target: Svana didn't say what she wanted?

Source: As we speak, two of my guardians investigate rumored anchor sites. Merric and Aelif are the best the guild has to offer. Meet up with them in the hills west of Davon's Watch. You can proceed from there.
Target: As we speak, two of my guardians investigate rumored anchor sites. Merric and Aelif are the best the guild has to offer. Meet up with them in the hills west of Davon's Watch. You can proceed from there.

Source: Important business? And what friend?
Target: Important business? And what friend?

Source: The mages called on the power of the Celestial Mage. They summoned ancient and powerful atronachs to defeat the Dark Anchors and battle Molag Bal.\n\nBut as soon as the Dark Anchors were defeated, the atronachs turned against Craglorn.
Target: The mages called on the power of the Celestial Mage. They summoned ancient and powerful atronachs to defeat the Dark Anchors and battle Molag Bal.\n\nBut as soon as the Dark Anchors were defeated, the atronachs turned against Craglorn.

Source: I don't know. It was strange. Hara said something about the Celestial Thief and visions you've been having.\n\nI heard how the Serpent corrupted the Mage and the Warrior. I hope the same thing doesn't happen to the Thief.
Target: I don't know. It was strange. Hara said something about the Celestial Thief and visions you've been having.\n\nI heard how the Serpent corrupted the Mage and the Warrior. I hope the same thing doesn't happen to the Thief.

Source: It marks a fresh start to the new year, for all who walk beneath the sun. Everyone in Tamriel celebrates!\n\nWell, perhaps not the Maormer—but everyone else. You should try it for yourself and see!
Target: It marks a fresh start to the new year, for all who walk beneath the sun. Everyone in Tamriel celebrates!\n\nWell, perhaps not the Maormer—but everyone else. You should try it for yourself and see!

Source: <A simple map directs revelers to Breda, a New Life Herald in Eastmarch. There is a small note scrawled on the map.>\n\n"All are welcome to celebrate the New Life Festival!"
Target: <A simple map directs revelers to Breda, a New Life Herald in Eastmarch. There is a small note scrawled on the map.>\n\n\\"All are welcome to celebrate the New Life Festival!\"\""

Source: <Crude letters are carved into this stone. This could be a grave marker, but the inscribed letters seem random. They don't seem to mean anything at all. Perhaps Hermaeus Mora would be interested in such a strange find.>
Target: <Crude letters are carved into this stone. This could be a grave marker, but the inscribed letters seem random. They don't seem to mean anything at all. Perhaps Hermaeus Mora would be interested in such a strange find.>

Source: <The text is written in Dwemeris characters that are difficult to make out because of chips in the stone. Surprisingly, the stone is light, light enough to carry with ease.\n\nHermaeus Mora may be interested in this stone.>
Target: <The text is written in Dwemeris characters that are difficult to make out because of chips in the stone. Surprisingly, the stone is light, light enough to carry with ease.\n\nHermaeus Mora may be interested in this stone.>

Source: The augury ritual revealed the connection to the Court of Bedlam and pointed to trouble in Rellenthil. Now we need to determine where K'Tora and the Sea Sloads are hiding. \n\nThe abyssal pearl should be able to point us in the right direction.
Target: The augury ritual revealed the connection to the Court of Bedlam and pointed to trouble in Rellenthil. Now we need to determine where K'Tora and the Sea Sloads are hiding. \n\nThe abyssal pearl should be able to point us in the right direction.

Source: I suppose it is, but we were driven from the keep long before the tempest began forming. Sea Elves infiltrated our defenses and slaughtered the garrison. We're all that survived.\n\nThat storm will finish the job unless I manage to stop it.
Target: I suppose it is, but we were driven from the keep long before the tempest began forming. Sea Elves infiltrated our defenses and slaughtered the garrison. We're all that survived.\n\nThat storm will finish the job unless I manage to stop it.

Source: Who's coming? The ones who attacked you?
Target: Who's coming? The ones who attacked you?

Source: "Are you an adventurer of good reputation? How would you like a free inn room? That's right, completely free! No catch! Seek out Felande Demarie for more information about this amazing deal!"
Target: \\"Are you an adventurer of good reputation? How would you like a free inn room? That's right
column4: completely free! No catch! Seek out Felande Demarie for more information about this amazing deal!\"\""

Source: Tell me about Solitude.
Target: Tell me about Solitude.

Source: "Are you an adventurer of good reputation? Have low to moderate homicidal tendencies?\n\n Looking for a cozy home to call your own, but too low on funds to afford one?"
Target: \\"Are you an adventurer of good reputation? Have low to moderate homicidal tendencies?\n\n Looking for a cozy home to call your own
column4: but too low on funds to afford one?\"\""

Source: Lyris and I know a scholar of sorts who's trying to understand the harrowstorm ritual.
Target: Lyris and I know a scholar of sorts who's trying to understand the harrowstorm ritual.

Source: <The runes are too small to read. However, Hermaeus Mora may be able to decipher what mortal eyes cannot.>
Target: <The runes are too small to read. However, Hermaeus Mora may be able to decipher what mortal eyes cannot.>

Source: Look, empty rooms are just bad for business. The upkeep alone costs me more than the place is worth. But I think we can come to a sort of arrangement.\n\nAnd not the sort of arrangement that involves a few drinks, let me be clear about that.
Target: Look, empty rooms are just bad for business. The upkeep alone costs me more than the place is worth. But I think we can come to a sort of arrangement.\n\nAnd not the sort of arrangement that involves a few drinks, let me be clear about that.

Source: Oh, well. I can hardly keep track of every face I hire. An artist's work is endless.\n\nI need colors! Rich, rare, vibrant. After all, this painting will be the masterpiece of my career. I simply cannot work with mediocre shades.
Target: Oh, well. I can hardly keep track of every face I hire. An artist's work is endless.\n\nI need colors! Rich, rare, vibrant. After all, this painting will be the masterpiece of my career. I simply cannot work with mediocre shades.

Source: Svargrim is a vampire. He's working with the Gray Host.
Target: Svargrim is a vampire. He's working with the Gray Host.

Source: Where do you want me to look?
Target: Where do you want me to look?

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: How do we stop the harrowstorm?
Target: How do we stop the harrowstorm?

Source: They wanted free mead. Can you believe it? Savages, the lot of them!\n\nMy brother Haraldar plans to get the meadery up and running again. If you want to lend a hand, talk to Haraldar. He's over by the farmhouse.
Target: They wanted free mead. Can you believe it? Savages, the lot of them!\n\nMy brother Haraldar plans to get the meadery up and running again. If you want to lend a hand, talk to Haraldar. He's over by the farmhouse.

Source: Civilians are trapped in the Trade Hall and Mages Guild by the Drublog. Rescue them. The sergeant can arm them and organize a counterattack under the Fists of Thalmor banner.\n\nTell them to get to the Fighters Guild barracks. We'll meet them there.
Target: Civilians are trapped in the Trade Hall and Mages Guild by the Drublog. Rescue them. The sergeant can arm them and organize a counterattack under the Fists of Thalmor banner.\n\nTell them to get to the Fighters Guild barracks. We'll meet them there.

Source: The young ones' eyes shine at the thought, but I won't let their blood be shed for my actions.\n\nAnd to act, I must know the Gold Coast's plans. Perhaps you'd be willing to help?
Target: The young ones' eyes shine at the thought, but I won't let their blood be shed for my actions.\n\nAnd to act, I must know the Gold Coast's plans. Perhaps you'd be willing to help?

Source: Much as I want that bastard's blood on my sword, I can't. I told the lieutenant I'd protect the civilians.\n\nI'll start moving the militia toward the warehouse district. Meet me at the bridge when <<1>> is dead.
Target: Much as I want that bastard's blood on my sword, I can't. I told the lieutenant I'd protect the civilians.\n\nI'll start moving the militia toward the warehouse district. Meet me at the bridge when <<1>> is dead.

Source: It's not as simple as that. But yes, that is the first step.\n\nTake this powder and add it to the kegs in their camp. I've taken the liberty of offering some of my own vintage to them. A gift for their valiant battle with the werewolves.
Target: It's not as simple as that. But yes, that is the first step.\n\nTake this powder and add it to the kegs in their camp. I've taken the liberty of offering some of my own vintage to them. A gift for their valiant battle with the werewolves.

Source: It makes sense strategically, but we weren't prepared for this. We weren't expecting to fight a war while the Pact leaders were in council.\n\nI need your help. Captain Hamar sent the runner. Report to him. Find out what's going on at the fort.
Target: It makes sense strategically, but we weren't prepared for this. We weren't expecting to fight a war while the Pact leaders were in council.\n\nI need your help. Captain Hamar sent the runner. Report to him. Find out what's going on at the fort.

Source: All right, I will.
Target: All right, I will.

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: How do I know you're not one of these Stormfists?
Target: How do I know you're not one of these Stormfists?

Source: What's so special about these ruins?
Target: What's so special about these ruins?

Source: Where can I find them?
Target: Where can I find them?

Source: Is there a way to release you?
Target: Is there a way to release you?

Source: I'll find the other vicecanons.
Target: I'll find the other vicecanons.

Source: Do you know what Svana wants to talk to me about?
Target: Do you know what Svana wants to talk to me about?

Source: Why do you say that?
Target: Why do you say that?

Source: Is there something I can do to help?
Target: Is there something I can do to help?

Source: Do you know what Svana wants?
Target: Do you know what Svana wants?

Source: <Take the whistle.>
Target: <Take the whistle.>

Source: I should return this to <<1>>.
Target: I should return this to <<1>>.

Source: Who is she with?
Target: Who is she with?

Source: Where would I start?
Target: Where would I start?

Source: "He told us his plan to ascend Forelhost, and search the crypts of the Dragon Priests. There was muttering in the ranks. Cowards. Why should we fear the dead? The dead are toys to the likes of us!"
Target: \\"He told us his plan to ascend Forelhost
column4: and search the crypts of the Dragon Priests. There was muttering in the ranks. Cowards. Why should we fear the dead? The dead are toys to the likes of us!\"\""

Source: I'll help.
Target: I'll help.

Source: I've been there. Anything else?
Target: I've been there. Anything else?

Source: I would, but I lost very specialized tools. I fear the Drublog took them, or hid them among these burnt-out ruins. Can you retrieve them for me?\n\nI'll make my way toward the docks. I could meet you in the warehouse district there.
Target: I would, but I lost very specialized tools. I fear the Drublog took them, or hid them among these burnt-out ruins. Can you retrieve them for me?\n\nI'll make my way toward the docks. I could meet you in the warehouse district there.

Source: Maybe I can help.
Target: Maybe I can help.

Source: An old cult. Worship totem gods. Call them monks or witches as you will, but they wield strong healing magic.\n\nTheir rituals are complex, and those who seek their help must bring their own ritual components.
Target: An old cult. Worship totem gods. Call them monks or witches as you will, but they wield strong healing magic.\n\nTheir rituals are complex, and those who seek their help must bring their own ritual components.

Source: What relics?
Target: What relics?

Source: So you don't think there's a need for these ghost hunters?
Target: So you don't think there's a need for these ghost hunters?

Source: Fight the serpent women by ourselves? They are too terrible!\n\nWill you help? Find my sisters. Perhaps, together, we can drive out the lamias.
Target: Fight the serpent women by ourselves? They are too terrible!\n\nWill you help? Find my sisters. Perhaps, together, we can drive out the lamias.

Source: What kind of help?
Target: What kind of help?

Source: So what's the problem?
Target: So what's the problem?

Source: Draugr problem?
Target: Draugr problem?

Source: Well, I would be foolish to turn down help, wherever it comes from.\n\nI need certain materials to perform the ritual. Can you gather them for me?
Target: Well, I would be foolish to turn down help, wherever it comes from.\n\nI need certain materials to perform the ritual. Can you gather them for me?

Source: My friend Grida heard about some special bath salts. They're made at the Darkwater Crossing apothecary. She went to get some, but she hasn't returned.\n\nSee if you can find her. Or better yet, just bring us those salts!
Target: My friend Grida heard about some special bath salts. They're made at the Darkwater Crossing apothecary. She went to get some, but she hasn't returned.\n\nSee if you can find her. Or better yet, just bring us those salts!

Source: My sister took it. She was going to hide it, keep it safe. But … I don't think she made it very far.\n\nAwyn fled south, through the mountain pass. Find her. Save the Sigil, and our accord.
Target: My sister took it. She was going to hide it, keep it safe. But … I don't think she made it very far.\n\nAwyn fled south, through the mountain pass. Find her. Save the Sigil, and our accord.

Source: What will talking to Lord Vurlop accomplish?
Target: What will talking to Lord Vurlop accomplish?

Source: What was your caravan carrying?
Target: What was your caravan carrying?

Source: Where are they?
Target: Where are they?

Source: Does he need anything else?
Target: Does he need anything else?

Source: So you're going to send more soldiers up to the keep?
Target: So you're going to send more soldiers up to the keep?

Source: What can I do?
Target: What can I do?

Source: Tell me about these fanatics.
Target: Tell me about these fanatics.

Source: <Continue reading.>
Target: <Continue reading.>

Source: Where are these farmers now?
Target: Where are these farmers now?

Source: <I should travel to the Memorial District rally point and make sure it is secure.>
Target: <기념 지구에 가서 집결 지점을 확실하게 확보해야 한다.>

Source: I should bring the Amulet of Bats to Thane Ogvar.
Target: I should bring the Amulet of Bats to Thane Ogvar.

Source: I should bring the Bloodstone Chalice to Thane Ogvar.
Target: I should bring the Bloodstone Chalice to Thane Ogvar.

Source: What kind of entrance?
Target: What kind of entrance?

Source: Maybe they're all dead.
Target: Maybe they're all dead.

Source: So, Falgravn invaded Kyne's Aegis?
Target: So, Falgravn invaded Kyne's Aegis?

Source: So what's the job?
Target: So what's the job?

Source: They're agents of The Veiled Heritance, I'm sure of it! Teldur, my father's assistant, is trying to organize a defense. \n\nYou look capable. Will you help Silsailen?
Target: They're agents of The Veiled Heritance, I'm sure of it! Teldur, my father's assistant, is trying to organize a defense. \n\nYou look capable. Will you help Silsailen?

Source: A tree spirit. It could speak—had a face out of a fever dream. It leads an entire army of cultists in the caverns ahead.\n\nIt slaughtered us, showed us … showed us a vision of what it plans to do to all of Tamriel.
Target: A tree spirit. It could speak—had a face out of a fever dream. It leads an entire army of cultists in the caverns ahead.\n\nIt slaughtered us, showed us … showed us a vision of what it plans to do to all of Tamriel.

Source: I long for my daughters to be returned to me.\n\nDuring the war, my husband's mind broke. He murdered our daughters. To save them from Akaviri torture, he claimed. He scattered their remains across Eastmarch. And left me here alone.
Target: I long for my daughters to be returned to me.\n\nDuring the war, my husband's mind broke. He murdered our daughters. To save them from Akaviri torture, he claimed. He scattered their remains across Eastmarch. And left me here alone.

Source: How should I collect this information?
Target: How should I collect this information?

Source: Aldcroft. She said werewolves captured Camlorn and the Duke had fled. \n\nWe weren't able to aid her, but perhaps you can. <<1>> in <<2>> would know more.
Target: Aldcroft. She said werewolves captured Camlorn and the Duke had fled. \n\nWe weren't able to aid her, but perhaps you can. <<1>> in <<2>> would know more.

Source: Get me books back! Her nightmares crawled all over the shelves, pulled out anything that referenced herself or her Dreamers. Now they're out there in the cold, getting ratty.
Target: Get me books back! Her nightmares crawled all over the shelves, pulled out anything that referenced herself or her Dreamers. Now they're out there in the cold, getting ratty.

Source: <I should travel to the Arboretum rally point and make sure it is secure.>
Target: <수목원에 가서 집결 지점을 확실하게 확보해야 한다.>

Source: <I should travel to the Arena District rally point and make sure it is secure.>
Target: <투기장 지구에 가서 집결 지점을 확실하게 확보해야 한다.>

Source: If danger doesn't find her, she'll seek it out and invite it home to dinner. \n\nShe's in the ruins just ahead, conspiring with the Battlereeve. They're determined to complete the ceremony. Do be a loyal subject and see that she survives. Won't you?
Target: If danger doesn't find her, she'll seek it out and invite it home to dinner. \n\nShe's in the ruins just ahead, conspiring with the Battlereeve. They're determined to complete the ceremony. Do be a loyal subject and see that she survives. Won't you?

Source: He has corrupted one of the Ansei Wards, and he's using some kind of necromantic focuses to channel energy from the the dead for a ritual he's conducting in the lighthouse. \n\nHe says this ritual will make him a lich. Will you help me stop him?
Target: He has corrupted one of the Ansei Wards, and he's using some kind of necromantic focuses to channel energy from the the dead for a ritual he's conducting in the lighthouse. \n\nHe says this ritual will make him a lich. Will you help me stop him?

Source: Well, supper is nearly ready. It's not like her ladyship to be late for dinner. Especially when she asked me to open a bottle of her finest wine.\n\nDo you suppose something unpleasant might have befallen her in the tomb?
Target: Well, supper is nearly ready. It's not like her ladyship to be late for dinner. Especially when she asked me to open a bottle of her finest wine.\n\nDo you suppose something unpleasant might have befallen her in the tomb?

Source: Those are the rules. The one rabbit. He's quick. I call him Golden Jack. You nab him, you win.\n\nGrab the bow by the river and let me know when you're ready to start.
Target: Those are the rules. The one rabbit. He's quick. I call him Golden Jack. You nab him, you win.\n\nGrab the bow by the river and let me know when you're ready to start.

Source: Now hold on. Let's not be too hasty. If you want to help, our healer Heloise is low on supplies.\n\nWe had to abandon our carts along the road when the Montclairs ambushed us. Gather the healing supplies and bring them back here.
Target: Now hold on. Let's not be too hasty. If you want to help, our healer Heloise is low on supplies.\n\nWe had to abandon our carts along the road when the Montclairs ambushed us. Gather the healing supplies and bring them back here.

Source: Maybe I could talk to Thulsgreg for you.
Target: Maybe I could talk to Thulsgreg for you.

Source: What method is that?
Target: What method is that?

Source: Any idea what caused the collapse?
Target: Any idea what caused the collapse?

Source: Where is this base?
Target: Where is this base?

Source: A salskap?
Target: A salskap?

Source: Where is this base?
Target: Where is this base?

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: Two High Elves inside the tavern claim—quite loudly, in fact—that they are aspects of the Mage. The very Celestial that fell from our starry skies!\n\nI took my drink and came out here. My companion … not so lucky.
Target: Two High Elves inside the tavern claim—quite loudly, in fact—that they are aspects of the Mage. The very Celestial that fell from our starry skies!\n\nI took my drink and came out here. My companion … not so lucky.

Source: The Divine Prosecution has been tasked to recover Rose-Of-Archon blossoms on behalf of the Sapiarchs. Not life threatening perhaps, but still of vital importance to several of their religious ceremonies. Well worth the risks, I assure you.
Target: The Divine Prosecution has been tasked to recover Rose-Of-Archon blossoms on behalf of the Sapiarchs. Not life threatening perhaps, but still of vital importance to several of their religious ceremonies. Well worth the risks, I assure you.

Source: I was set to adventure with the Undaunted—to explore Hel Ra Citadel in the mountains.\n\nHowever, my fledgling allies—newcomers, all of them—entered without me. Probably thought it was funny. They never returned.
Target: I was set to adventure with the Undaunted—to explore Hel Ra Citadel in the mountains.\n\nHowever, my fledgling allies—newcomers, all of them—entered without me. Probably thought it was funny. They never returned.

Source: Some bony pit called Fang Lair. Got a ring to it. One of our Trailblazers, Yisareh, says the place has got a mess of necromancers stuck in its teeth.\n\nHow about you work out the unsightly bits with something pointy and show me a killer smile?
Target: Some bony pit called Fang Lair. Got a ring to it. One of our Trailblazers, Yisareh, says the place has got a mess of necromancers stuck in its teeth.\n\nHow about you work out the unsightly bits with something pointy and show me a killer smile?

Source: We've been gathering reports of a Meridia cult for years, but only recently were we able to find them in Eton Nir Grotto. However, it seems that their worship attracted the attention of Daedra. Most of the cultists, if not all, are dead.
Target: We've been gathering reports of a Meridia cult for years, but only recently were we able to find them in Eton Nir Grotto. However, it seems that their worship attracted the attention of Daedra. Most of the cultists, if not all, are dead.

Source: It will take an influence far stronger than you and I, of that I'm sure.\n\nWe'll call a meeting of Summerset's most influential leaders. Perhaps, with such a force behind us, we can persuade the Sapiarchs to see reason.
Target: It will take an influence far stronger than you and I, of that I'm sure.\n\nWe'll call a meeting of Summerset's most influential leaders. Perhaps, with such a force behind us, we can persuade the Sapiarchs to see reason.

Source: Scalecaller Peak was once a Dragon Priest's temple, but now it belongs to some truly sickening cultists. The place is riddled with the strange disease they've cooked up, infecting and enraging all the creatures that live there.
Target: Scalecaller Peak was once a Dragon Priest's temple, but now it belongs to some truly sickening cultists. The place is riddled with the strange disease they've cooked up, infecting and enraging all the creatures that live there.

Source: Stars, yes. Andewen and her team are somewhere in the ruins, looking for the Mallari-Mora. They're long overdue.\n\nIf you're not here with supplies, perhaps you'd go look for them?
Target: Stars, yes. Andewen and her team are somewhere in the ruins, looking for the Mallari-Mora. They're long overdue.\n\nIf you're not here with supplies, perhaps you'd go look for them?

Source: I did not want to send word to the king until I was certain necromancy was involved. Now though, he should be informed right away.\n\nI must stay here and oversee the cleanup. You are the one who turned the tide here. Will you inform the king as well?
Target: I did not want to send word to the king until I was certain necromancy was involved. Now though, he should be informed right away.\n\nI must stay here and oversee the cleanup. You are the one who turned the tide here. Will you inform the king as well?

Source: All right. Where are these records then?
Target: All right. Where are these records then?

Source: I can make it back to Vulkhel Guard. You have to find <<1>>. She'll know what to do. \n\nShe's a prisoner at the Maormer camp down the beach. Please … hurry.
Target: I can make it back to Vulkhel Guard. You have to find <<1>>. She'll know what to do. \n\nShe's a prisoner at the Maormer camp down the beach. Please … hurry.

Source: Where are your companions?
Target: Where are your companions?

Source: The cult of Phynaster has petitioned us to recover articles of faith from King's Haven Pass, so they may pay proper respects to their pilgrims lost there.\n\nVery significant work, just not pressing … so perfect for you!
Target: The cult of Phynaster has petitioned us to recover articles of faith from King's Haven Pass, so they may pay proper respects to their pilgrims lost there.\n\nVery significant work, just not pressing … so perfect for you!

Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: Where is this base?
Target: Where is this base?

Source: Because I'm not an idiot. Guards see an Orc thumping the ears off an Elf in the middle of the street? You know how that turns out.\n\nThought if I challenged him to a duel we could make it legal, but he won't fight unless I challenge him properly.
Target: Because I'm not an idiot. Guards see an Orc thumping the ears off an Elf in the middle of the street? You know how that turns out.\n\nThought if I challenged him to a duel we could make it legal, but he won't fight unless I challenge him properly.

Source: Take this crystal. I've etched a series of microrunes onto its surface. Weaken the spirit's hold on the physical world and then focus your will.\n\nThat should sever the spirit's hold on Nirn. Allow it to pass into Aetherius.
Target: Take this crystal. I've etched a series of microrunes onto its surface. Weaken the spirit's hold on the physical world and then focus your will.\n\nThat should sever the spirit's hold on Nirn. Allow it to pass into Aetherius.
