Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: You're studying the art of the Morkul clan?
Target: You're studying the art of the Morkul clan?

Source: Is there anything I can do?
Target: Is there anything I can do?

Source: Where was it lost?
Target: Where was it lost?

Source: Our home, the Canonreeve's residence. Teldur's quarters are there, as well. Please, you must go there, quickly! I fear for my father's life!
Target: Our home, the Canonreeve's residence. Teldur's quarters are there, as well. Please, you must go there, quickly! I fear for my father's life!

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: Where is this base?
Target: Where is this base?

Source: As you saw today, my reign so far has been anything but normal. I worry there will be complications.\n\nAnd the presence of my newest Eye would assuage that worry.
Target: As you saw today, my reign so far has been anything but normal. I worry there will be complications.\n\nAnd the presence of my newest Eye would assuage that worry.

Source: Nimalten. Thane Fjora is a brave, intelligent woman. And she has the resources to protect the rest of the Ragged Hills. Grab a guardsman when you reach the town. They'll direct you where you need to go.
Target: Nimalten. Thane Fjora is a brave, intelligent woman. And she has the resources to protect the rest of the Ragged Hills. Grab a guardsman when you reach the town. They'll direct you where you need to go.

Source: No, it doesn't, does it? There are dark forces at work here. \n\nI have a powerful Altmer Holy Symbol used for blessings at this site. I thought I might try using it on the stone, but I'm afraid I haven't the nerve. Would you be willing to try it?
Target: No, it doesn't, does it? There are dark forces at work here. \n\nI have a powerful Altmer Holy Symbol used for blessings at this site. I thought I might try using it on the stone, but I'm afraid I haven't the nerve. Would you be willing to try it?

Source: Who's Priest Bavian?
Target: Who's Priest Bavian?

Source: I'll meet you when it's done.
Target: I'll meet you when it's done.

Source: I should talk to <<1>> in Solitude about what these tasks entail.
Target: I should talk to <<1>> in Solitude about what these tasks entail.

Source: All right, I'll do it.
Target: All right, I'll do it.

Source: What do you need?
Target: What do you need?

Source: A chaurus?
Target: A chaurus?

Source: I'll deal with these Daedra and bring you what records I can find.
Target: I'll deal with these Daedra and bring you what records I can find.

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: Is that all?
Target: Is that all?

Source: There are eager ears everywhere, so keep your voice low. The situation involves Sea Sload. The Battlereeve has been informed that you dispatched one of the foul creatures.\n\nI find that implausible, but as a lowly squire my opinion doesn't matter.
Target: There are eager ears everywhere, so keep your voice low. The situation involves Sea Sload. The Battlereeve has been informed that you dispatched one of the foul creatures.\n\nI find that implausible, but as a lowly squire my opinion doesn't matter.

Source: Didn't think you were still breathing when they dragged you out of the drink! But here you are, plain as day.\n\nYou owe a lot to the crew from Bleakrock. A shame they didn't find anyone willing to help.
Target: Didn't think you were still breathing when they dragged you out of the drink! But here you are, plain as day.\n\nYou owe a lot to the crew from Bleakrock. A shame they didn't find anyone willing to help.

Source: Oh, I see. You must be the newcomer the Queen's cat was going on and on about.\n\nIf this threat is real and you actually killed one of the Sea Sload, then I suppose I could use your help. Will you lend your talents to the defense of our island?
Target: Oh, I see. You must be the newcomer the Queen's cat was going on and on about.\n\nIf this threat is real and you actually killed one of the Sea Sload, then I suppose I could use your help. Will you lend your talents to the defense of our island?

Source: It's an Ayleid ruin north of Fort Rayles. Be careful. I don't want your soul on my conscience as well.
Target: It's an Ayleid ruin north of Fort Rayles. Be careful. I don't want your soul on my conscience as well.

Source: Straight to the point. Yes, I've chosen well. \n\nThree of my most trusted acolytes have turned their back on Satakal and joined the Scaled Court. The task is simple. Kill my acolytes. All three of them. As publicly and brutally as possible.
Target: Straight to the point. Yes, I've chosen well. \n\nThree of my most trusted acolytes have turned their back on Satakal and joined the Scaled Court. The task is simple. Kill my acolytes. All three of them. As publicly and brutally as possible.

Source: And you have my thanks for that, but Summerset isn't out of danger yet. The Sea Sload remain a threat.\n\nWill you once again lend your talents to the defense of our island?
Target: And you have my thanks for that, but Summerset isn't out of danger yet. The Sea Sload remain a threat.\n\nWill you once again lend your talents to the defense of our island?

Source: No. You will not cross blades. The Sword Singers were as much mages as warriors. They sought strength of body, and of mind.\n\nThese spirits will speak to you. Choose your words with care though. Tu'whacca says they seek to teach … and to test.
Target: No. You will not cross blades. The Sword Singers were as much mages as warriors. They sought strength of body, and of mind.\n\nThese spirits will speak to you. Choose your words with care though. Tu'whacca says they seek to teach … and to test.

Source: Is there something I can do to help?
Target: Is there something I can do to help?

Source: Razum-dar is here on a mission of some … delicacy. You are just what the Baandari ordered. Between your hands and Raz's good looks, we are certain to see this through.
Target: Razum-dar is here on a mission of some … delicacy. You are just what the Baandari ordered. Between your hands and Raz's good looks, we are certain to see this through.

Source: This one has three trade shipments scattered across the port in caches. Recover them, and he can start a new life.  \n\nMadja must also be disposed of, for she will not rest until Renzir is hunted down.
Target: This one has three trade shipments scattered across the port in caches. Recover them, and he can start a new life.  \n\nMadja must also be disposed of, for she will not rest until Renzir is hunted down.

Source: You don't remember? A Khajiit named <<1>> fished you out of the ocean.\n\nHe paid me a small fortune to bring you here. We barely made it out of <<2>> before the hurricane hit!
Target: You don't remember? A Khajiit named <<1>> fished you out of the ocean.\n\nHe paid me a small fortune to bring you here. We barely made it out of <<2>> before the hurricane hit!

Source: They trussed up the captain and a few others, then hauled them away. The rest of us scattered overboard.\n\nThe Maormer aren't gentle with their captives. We've got to rescue them!
Target: They trussed up the captain and a few others, then hauled them away. The rest of us scattered overboard.\n\nThe Maormer aren't gentle with their captives. We've got to rescue them!

Source: Samples of what?
Target: Samples of what?

Source: So what's your plan?
Target: So what's your plan?

Source: The locals call it the Aetherian Archive. It was built thousands of years ago, and sealed until crisis struck Craglorn. But the Undaunted and I heard rumors that its door had opened.\n\nWe Undaunted agreed to meet at the tower; climb the Archive.
Target: The locals call it the Aetherian Archive. It was built thousands of years ago, and sealed until crisis struck Craglorn. But the Undaunted and I heard rumors that its door had opened.\n\nWe Undaunted agreed to meet at the tower; climb the Archive.

Source: We've seen a precipitous rise in the sale and exchange of forbidden books. And not just the coarse literature from the mainland. I'm talking about something dangerous—Worm Cult tomes.\n\nNeedless to say, we can't have books like that floating about.
Target: We've seen a precipitous rise in the sale and exchange of forbidden books. And not just the coarse literature from the mainland. I'm talking about something dangerous—Worm Cult tomes.\n\nNeedless to say, we can't have books like that floating about.

Source: Yes! I dove into the water and swam ashore. I turned back and saw the captain and a few others being bound and taken away.\n\nThe Maormer must plan to interrogate them. Please you must help them!
Target: Yes! I dove into the water and swam ashore. I turned back and saw the captain and a few others being bound and taken away.\n\nThe Maormer must plan to interrogate them. Please you must help them!

Source: What happened to the cure?
Target: What happened to the cure?

Source: <Take documents.>
Target: <문서를 가져간다.>

Source: The cultists! Aren't you listening? No time! Take whatever ivory you can find to <<1>>. And my notes - he'll want them. The cultists took so many carvings for their own purposes. Got to retrieve them somehow.\n\nThe poison … my time has come.
Target: The cultists! Aren't you listening? No time! Take whatever ivory you can find to <<1>>. And my notes - he'll want them. The cultists took so many carvings for their own purposes. Got to retrieve them somehow.\n\nThe poison … my time has come.

Source: What is it you need?
Target: What is it you need?

Source: Kill legionaries and bait traps. Got it.
Target: Kill legionaries and bait traps. Got it.

Source: You're the one they pulled from the drink! Captain Kaleen found you floating out in Iliac Bay.\n\nShe said to send you 'round if you woke up with half a mind left. Though, I won't stop you if you want to run off.
Target: You're the one they pulled from the drink! Captain Kaleen found you floating out in Iliac Bay.\n\nShe said to send you 'round if you woke up with half a mind left. Though, I won't stop you if you want to run off.

Source: The Divine Prosecution has been following the Sagacians for quite some time, a group of researchers who are truly no better than bandits.\n\nWe've discovered that they are currently holed up in the ruins of Tor-Hame-Khard.
Target: 디바인의 종사는 꽤 오랫동안 사가시안들을 추적했는데, 그들은 정말 도적들과 다를 바 없는 연구자 집단이라네.\n\n우리는 그들이 현재 토-헤임-카드의 폐허에 은신해 있다는 것을 찾아냈어.

Source: Their nearest camp is on an island west of here. I believe they took the claw there.
Target: Their nearest camp is on an island west of here. I believe they took the claw there.

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: I'll take care of it.
Target: I'll take care of it.

Source: My husband, Nerien'eth, has made a Daedric pact that granted him lichdom. He … slayed me, slayed my students. \n\nHis minions have been torturing our spirits for years within these walls. He means to ensure our suffering continues.
Target: My husband, Nerien'eth, has made a Daedric pact that granted him lichdom. He … slayed me, slayed my students. \n\nHis minions have been torturing our spirits for years within these walls. He means to ensure our suffering continues.

Source: We've got another invasive species making their homes here on Summerset and disrupting the natural order! It's the reef vipers this time. Vicious vermin.\n\nI have reports that they're breeding in record numbers out in Wasten Coraldale.
Target: 서머셋에 또 다른 침입 종이 서식지를 만들고 자연 질서를 어지럽히고 있어! 이번엔 암초 독사야. 악독한 해충이지.\n\n그들이 황량한 산호계곡에서 기록적인 숫자로 번식하고 있다는 보고가 있다네.

Source: Check the camps near Abamath's ruins for <<1>>. I'm not as worried about <<2>>. She can outrun anything, especially when she's scared.\n\nAnd watch out for the Worm Cult. They've taken over <<3>>.
Target: Check the camps near Abamath's ruins for <<1>>. I'm not as worried about <<2>>. She can outrun anything, especially when she's scared.\n\nAnd watch out for the Worm Cult. They've taken over <<3>>.

Target: Kill you? There must be another way. I'll see what I can do.

Target: That would be perfect! If you can free Len, Suriel, and Councilor Lia, the entire town will gain confidence.\n\nLet them know we're organizing. Maybe help some of the miners, as well. Then meet me behind the inn when you're finished.

Source: The renowned treasure of Dresan Keep, of course!\n\nYou could finish my quest for me! There are three statues, the Heralds. Take the offerings I brought in my backpack and present them to the proper Heralds. That should open a passage under the well.
Target: The renowned treasure of Dresan Keep, of course!\n\nYou could finish my quest for me! There are three statues, the Heralds. Take the offerings I brought in my backpack and present them to the proper Heralds. That should open a passage under the well.

Source: Bloodthorns desecrate the Lion Guard soldiers killed in the ruins. They raise them as zombies!\n\nIf you use my sacred emblem, you can sanctify the corpses. That will prevent them from being raised as undead.
Target: Bloodthorns desecrate the Lion Guard soldiers killed in the ruins. They raise them as zombies!\n\nIf you use my sacred emblem, you can sanctify the corpses. That will prevent them from being raised as undead.

Source: Please. He usually camped at Coldcorn Ruin to the east.\n\nI hope he hasn't fallen afoul of bandits, or worse, on the road.

Source: I borrowed this wine from Sanguine's private stock. It controls the dead. Pour it on the remains of the entertainers, then command their ghosts to go back to work. \n\nIf they resume their old jobs, I can finally get out of here.

Target: Yes, please. If the lich isn't destroyed, evil will spread from Lindai, consuming all in its path. I have no doubt this is the Shadowed Path's plan.

Source: They store their supplies in an abandoned warehouse west of here. Would you please go taint their food with this poison? That should slow them down.
Target: They store their supplies in an abandoned warehouse west of here. Would you please go taint their food with this poison? That should slow them down.

Source: My husband, Nerien'eth, made a Daedric pact that granted him lichdom. He … slayed me, slayed our students. \n\nThen his minions tortured our spirits for years within these walls before you set us free. But he's returned.
Target: My husband, Nerien'eth, made a Daedric pact that granted him lichdom. He … slayed me, slayed our students. \n\nThen his minions tortured our spirits for years within these walls before you set us free. But he's returned.

Target: One of the villagers you rescued said he saw bound men being herded into the cellar of a house north of the village square. I can't leave my post, but perhaps you could investigate?

Source: A necromancer—goes by the name Garron. Don't know how long they had him in their pocket. For all I know, he's the ringleader.\n\nWhen we came through the entrance, he and a group of deviants ambushed us. He took the others inside—left me for dead.
Target: A necromancer—goes by the name Garron. Don't know how long they had him in their pocket. For all I know, he's the ringleader.\n\nWhen we came through the entrance, he and a group of deviants ambushed us. He took the others inside—left me for dead.

Source: She didn't say, and I didn't ask.\n\nIt's probably got something to do with this Remnant you're all so excited about. Frankly, I don't care. She wanted you to get the message and I delivered it.

Source: I do.\n\nOne of your native companions warned you off of it, didn't they? Believe me, I sympathize. But despite my lifestyle, I'm still an Argonian—one with ample means. Who would I be if I didn't use that wealth to help my people?
Target: I do.\n\nOne of your native companions warned you off of it, didn't they? Believe me, I sympathize. But despite my lifestyle, I'm still an Argonian—one with ample means. Who would I be if I didn't use that wealth to help my people?

Source: Depends on the source, but all the legends indicate that the skull contains powerful magic. Not to mention a curse that could destroy Murkmire. I shudder at the very notion of someone like Margus or the Blackguards getting their hands on it!
Target: Depends on the source, but all the legends indicate that the skull contains powerful magic. Not to mention a curse that could destroy Murkmire. I shudder at the very notion of someone like Margus or the Blackguards getting their hands on it!

Source: Got a lead on some ancient Argonian texts preserved at the Teeth of Sithis. Problem is, the temple got overrun by Blackguards recently. Whatever those scum are doing there, it won't involve keeping old tablets from crumbling to dust.
Target: Got a lead on some ancient Argonian texts preserved at the Teeth of Sithis. Problem is, the temple got overrun by Blackguards recently. Whatever those scum are doing there, it won't involve keeping old tablets from crumbling to dust.

Target: One of our benefactors, a scholar named Tia Doran, needs someone to explore the newly opened Tsofeer Cavern. She believes the old Imperial scrolls dating back to the First Era might be scattered throughout the caves.

Source: Touching the Remnant, I can hear their voices. Old, like stone and willow roots. The souls inside are confused. They escaped the Ayleids, but then … a life in amber.\n\nThe Hist kept them safe inside—but it was never meant to last this long ….
Target: Touching the Remnant, I can hear their voices. Old, like stone and willow roots. The souls inside are confused. They escaped the Ayleids, but then … a life in amber.\n\nThe Hist kept them safe inside—but it was never meant to last this long ….

Source: Oh, the most worthy kind of expedition—a journey into the distant past! Not the literal past, I mean. That would be crazy.\n\nWe're exploring one of the Argonians' ancient xanmeer pyramids to find a priceless relic: the Kajin-Jat Crystal!
Target: Oh, the most worthy kind of expedition—a journey into the distant past! Not the literal past, I mean. That would be crazy.\n\nWe're exploring one of the Argonians' ancient xanmeer pyramids to find a priceless relic: the Kajin-Jat Crystal!

Source: Well, I should tell you, we've officially left the realm of verified research, and entered the world of legend and wild-eyed conjecture.\n\nIf that last ruin was Xul-Thuxis, then this next xanmeer must be Vakka-Bok—the Bowl of the Sun, I think.
Target: Well, I should tell you, we've officially left the realm of verified research, and entered the world of legend and wild-eyed conjecture.\n\nIf that last ruin was Xul-Thuxis, then this next xanmeer must be Vakka-Bok—the Bowl of the Sun, I think.

Source: I met a traveler who warned me that the Stiches has a new and unpopular leader named Khasda. He also told me that a rival of Khasda's by the name of Tasnasi is offering a job well suited to someone passing through.
Target: I met a traveler who warned me that the Stiches has a new and unpopular leader named Khasda. He also told me that a rival of Khasda's by the name of Tasnasi is offering a job well suited to someone passing through.

Source: Frostvault. The Trailblazers caught wind of an expedition into some recently unearthed Dwarven ruin that's been trapped under ice for who knows how long.\n\nCan't let some twiggy academics be the first ones to set foot in the place in a thousand years.
Target: Frostvault. The Trailblazers caught wind of an expedition into some recently unearthed Dwarven ruin that's been trapped under ice for who knows how long.\n\nCan't let some twiggy academics be the first ones to set foot in the place in a thousand years.

Source: A Dwemer vault—hidden in the ice for ages—finally reveals itself and you just happen to wander in here? You are either very lucky … or someone tipped you off.\n\nI'm not letting this discovery slip through my fingers. I have a proposal.
Target: A Dwemer vault—hidden in the ice for ages—finally reveals itself and you just happen to wander in here? You are either very lucky … or someone tipped you off.\n\nI'm not letting this discovery slip through my fingers. I have a proposal.

Source: Ah, the tasks are many and the workers are few.\n\nI told many adventurers about our expedition—about the great discoveries and constant mortal danger, but few agree to join us. Odd. Anyway, I am sure you will have better luck.
Target: Ah, the tasks are many and the workers are few.\n\nI told many adventurers about our expedition—about the great discoveries and constant mortal danger, but few agree to join us. Odd. Anyway, I am sure you will have better luck.

Source: We have a problem. Bugs.\n\nYou see, the air in my homeland is often thick with swarms of biting insects. Luckily, I have made contact with a candlemaker named Tamira Dobar. Her products are guaranteed to keep even the largest bugs at bay!
Target: We have a problem. Bugs.\n\nYou see, the air in my homeland is often thick with swarms of biting insects. Luckily, I have made contact with a candlemaker named Tamira Dobar. Her products are guaranteed to keep even the largest bugs at bay!

Source: Spindleclutch! Only this time it's crawling with vampires instead of spiders. They both want nothing but to sink their fangs in you, so what's the difference, really?
Target: 스핀들클러치! 이번에는 거미대신 뱀파이어가 우글우글 해. 그놈들은 네게 자신의 송곳니를 박아 넣고 싶어 하지, 그럼 대체 차이가 뭐야, 진짜?

Source: We almost died during our trial of ascension. We would have, too, except Kishi interfered and saved us.\n\nNow, by the laws of the Naga-Kur, the Dead-Water tribe, Kishi has been sentenced to death. He should not have helped us, but I am glad he did.
Target: We almost died during our trial of ascension. We would have, too, except Kishi interfered and saved us.\n\nNow, by the laws of the Naga-Kur, the Dead-Water tribe, Kishi has been sentenced to death. He should not have helped us, but I am glad he did.

Source: Our agents in Murkmire are always in danger of being bitten by some gross snake or spiky snail. We need to supply them with reliable curatives. Luckily, I know a brilliant Wood Elf alchemist named Mindileth. She makes a really good-good anti-venom!
Target: Our agents in Murkmire are always in danger of being bitten by some gross snake or spiky snail. We need to supply them with reliable curatives. Luckily, I know a brilliant Wood Elf alchemist named Mindileth. She makes a really good-good anti-venom!

Source: The Depths of Malatar. A sunken ruin filled with Meridia's eternal Purified. Slaves to her command, cleansed of disease, death, and free will. \n\nNot a bad deal, minus the last part. I'll leave it to you to find a way to kill the undying.
Target: The Depths of Malatar. A sunken ruin filled with Meridia's eternal Purified. Slaves to her command, cleansed of disease, death, and free will. \n\nNot a bad deal, minus the last part. I'll leave it to you to find a way to kill the undying.

Source: Cyrodilic Collections relies on the generosity of benefactors to fund our expeditions. In return, we sometimes take on odd jobs related to historic inquiries and antiquities.\n\nTake Tia Doran, for example. She needs someone to enter Tsofeer Cavern.
Target: Cyrodilic Collections relies on the generosity of benefactors to fund our expeditions. In return, we sometimes take on odd jobs related to historic inquiries and antiquities.\n\nTake Tia Doran, for example. She needs someone to enter Tsofeer Cavern.

Target: You really don't know, do you? Huh. I assumed Quintus neglected to tell me that he let this location slip during one of his fool binges, or soliciting a patron to fund his next expedition.\n\nHowever you got here, I have an offer for you.

Source: Seeking skilled jewelry crafters to hammer out some rings and necklaces. Remember, the wealth you wear is always with you! Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!
Target: Seeking skilled jewelry crafters to hammer out some rings and necklaces. Remember, the wealth you wear is always with you! Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!

Source: I impart the following details. Naga-Kur warriors assaulted the necromancer's fen before I sought outsiders to aid us. My egg-siblings fell before Baxilt-Gah's vile magic.\n\nIf the remains are not recovered, the necromancer will use them against us.
Target: I impart the following details. Naga-Kur warriors assaulted the necromancer's fen before I sought outsiders to aid us. My egg-siblings fell before Baxilt-Gah's vile magic.\n\nIf the remains are not recovered, the necromancer will use them against us.

Source: You know of Cyrodilic Collections? The outsiders who pay gold for old Saxhleel baubles? Well, the Naga-Kur know a place where you can pick antiquities like fruit from a tree. Gather relics and we will split the reward. Just beware of the guardian.
Target: You know of Cyrodilic Collections? The outsiders who pay gold for old Saxhleel baubles? Well, the Naga-Kur know a place where you can pick antiquities like fruit from a tree. Gather relics and we will split the reward. Just beware of the guardian.

Source: Carnivorous plants. The necromancer of Bok-Xul corrupts harmless plants. Turns them into monsters. They spread from the ritual site, endangering the tribe's hunters and gatherers.\n\nI need someone to get to the root of the problem and cut it out.
Target: Carnivorous plants. The necromancer of Bok-Xul corrupts harmless plants. Turns them into monsters. They spread from the ritual site, endangering the tribe's hunters and gatherers.\n\nI need someone to get to the root of the problem and cut it out.

Source: Sacred grave-stakes. The necromancer of the fen stole grave-stakes to use in foul rituals at Bok-Xul. Now noxious gas spews from desecrated burial sites, and the necromancer uses cherished ancestors to power his evil spells.
Target: Sacred grave-stakes. The necromancer of the fen stole grave-stakes to use in foul rituals at Bok-Xul. Now noxious gas spews from desecrated burial sites, and the necromancer uses cherished ancestors to power his evil spells.

Source: Go to the Echoing Hollow, far across the land. In that secluded bog, the rare nightbloom vine grows like weeds. Gather nightblooms and bring them here.\n\nBeware the guardian of the Hollow, though. It dislikes intruders.
Target: Go to the Echoing Hollow, far across the land. In that secluded bog, the rare nightbloom vine grows like weeds. Gather nightblooms and bring them here.\n\nBeware the guardian of the Hollow, though. It dislikes intruders.

Source: Shuxaltsei. Devours-the-Sun. High-Priestess of the Teeth. She has many names, all of them spoken softly.\n\nShe has returned from dusk to reclaim her temple and we are the offerings she makes for Sithis's favor.
Target: Shuxaltsei. Devours-the-Sun. High-Priestess of the Teeth. She has many names, all of them spoken softly.\n\nShe has returned from dusk to reclaim her temple and we are the offerings she makes for Sithis's favor.

Source: I have suffered shame for the actions of my ancestor. When the Imperial Ninth Legion marched into Murkmire, my distant relative agreed to serve as their scout, and ever since my egg-family has carried the mark of traitors.\n\nI want to erase that mark.
Target: I have suffered shame for the actions of my ancestor. When the Imperial Ninth Legion marched into Murkmire, my distant relative agreed to serve as their scout, and ever since my egg-family has carried the mark of traitors.\n\nI want to erase that mark.

Source: "Cyrodilic Collections, the foremost society dedicated to the retrieval, restoration, preservation, and return of Argonian antiquities to their rightful owners in Murkmire, seeks the best and brightest to join its ranks."
Target: \\"Cyrodilic Collections
column4: the foremost society dedicated to the retrieval
column5: restoration
column7: and return of Argonian antiquities to their rightful owners in Murkmire
column8: seeks the best and brightest to join its ranks.\"\""

Source: I rage at marauding Blackguards! They raid our land, attack our tribe. Now they place supply caches in the Echoing Hollow ruins. The Naga-Kur need a brave outsider to enter the ruins and destroy the caches.\n\nDo I speak to a brave outsider, ojel?
Target: I rage at marauding Blackguards! They raid our land, attack our tribe. Now they place supply caches in the Echoing Hollow ruins. The Naga-Kur need a brave outsider to enter the ruins and destroy the caches.\n\nDo I speak to a brave outsider, ojel?

Source: In the wake of the Serpent's defeat, I found a shattered piece of the Apex Stone.
Target: In the wake of the Serpent's defeat, I found a shattered piece of the Apex Stone.

Source: Volenfell. A newly-discovered Dwemer ruin. Bold treasure hunters vie to be the first to explore its halls. Would you be outdone by them?
Target: 볼른펠. 새로 발견된 드웨머 유적이지. 용감한 보물 사냥꾼들이 첫 번째로 홀을 탐사하기 위해 다투는 중이지. 넌 그들보다 능숙하겠지?

Source: <The pack contains some dried meat, a few pieces of fruit, and a handful of root vegetables. It also contains a signet that identifies it as having belonged to a member of the Fighters Guild.>
Target: <The pack contains some dried meat, a few pieces of fruit, and a handful of root vegetables. It also contains a signet that identifies it as having belonged to a member of the Fighters Guild.>

Source: Blackheart Haven. A paradise spoiled by pirates. \n\nCut through the jungle and ruthless plunderers. Stop their tireless pillaging and shepherd their treasures into more deserving hands.
Target: 블랙하트 안식처. 해적들이 더럽힌 낙원이지. \n\n정글과 무자비한 약탈자들을 헤쳐나가게. 그들의 지칠 줄 모르는 약탈을 멈추고 그들의 보물을 좀 더 가치 있는 자의 손에 맡겨주게나.

Source: <<AC:1>> was created to preserve knowledge. This we already knew. \n\nBut the book speaks of a deeper level, closed off from the rest of the ruin. I suspected <<Ac:2>> was hidden somewhere in the ruin, and now I know where.
Target: <<AC:1>> was created to preserve knowledge. This we already knew. \n\nBut the book speaks of a deeper level, closed off from the rest of the ruin. I suspected <<Ac:2>> was hidden somewhere in the ruin, and now I know where.

Source: An antique Argonian renewal charm. Without one, they'll never let me observe the ritual of renewal. And that's the whole reason I came to this backwater in the first place.\n\nNow if only Stibbons would stop playing in the mud and find the damn thing.
Target: An antique Argonian renewal charm. Without one, they'll never let me observe the ritual of renewal. And that's the whole reason I came to this backwater in the first place.\n\nNow if only Stibbons would stop playing in the mud and find the damn thing.

Source: A provisioner condenses the essence of ingredients into food or drink. A true artist balances palate with nutrition.\n \nI can share this noble profession, but I can only certify one craft at a time. Understood?
Target: 요리사는 재료의 본질을 음식이나 음료로 응축시키는 과정입니다. 진정한 예술가는 미각과 영양의 균형을 유지하는 법이죠.\n\n저는 이 고귀한 직업을 함께 할 생각있지만,당신은 오직 한 번에 하나의 자격만 인증받을 수 있습니다. 알겠나요?

Source: We are amidst the preparations for our tribe's most vital ceremony. Now a warped and withered stranger has died at our roots. An ill omen for the arrival of our guests.\n\nI am troubled, ojel, because I do not hear what the Hist is trying to tell me.
Target: We are amidst the preparations for our tribe's most vital ceremony. Now a warped and withered stranger has died at our roots. An ill omen for the arrival of our guests.\n\nI am troubled, ojel, because I do not hear what the Hist is trying to tell me.

Source: Bandits, running themselves onto our swords. Drove them off for now.\n\nThing is, there are far more bandits than we have swords. With so many afflicted by the curse, we can't hunt them down and kill them in their beds.
Target: Bandits, running themselves onto our swords. Drove them off for now.\n\nThing is, there are far more bandits than we have swords. With so many afflicted by the curse, we can't hunt them down and kill them in their beds.

Source: We can't shore up the keel with saboteurs around. But we spotted a soldier nearby … looks like Khajiit royal guard and some refugees.\n\nWe'll keep the pirates off our own backs. Head to that soldier and see if you can help the refugees!
Target: We can't shore up the keel with saboteurs around. But we spotted a soldier nearby … looks like Khajiit royal guard and some refugees.\n\nWe'll keep the pirates off our own backs. Head to that soldier and see if you can help the refugees!

Source: No—well, for a moment there—I was practicing my swamp jelly calls when I saw you passing by. It takes just the right amount of saliva to get their tenor.\n\nI'll have to work up another mouthful, but there'll be time for that now that you're here!
Target: No—well, for a moment there—I was practicing my swamp jelly calls when I saw you passing by. It takes just the right amount of saliva to get their tenor.\n\nI'll have to work up another mouthful, but there'll be time for that now that you're here!

Source: A good woodworker sees the final product before cutting the first block of wood.\n\nBut I can't teach two crafts once. If you commit yourself to the training, I'll certify you.
Target: 좋은 목세공사라면 첫 나무를 자르기 전에 마지막 결과물을 볼 줄 아는 법이죠.\n\n하지만 저는 한 번에 두 가지 제작을 가르쳐 줄 수는 없어요. 훈련을 받겠다고 한다면 인증을 해줄게요.

Source: I must remain here and see my husband recovers. If you are willing, you should track down <<1>> and … put an end to his madness.
Target: I must remain here and see my husband recovers. If you are willing, you should track down <<1>> and … put an end to his madness.

Source: Danlai was skinned alive. Whoever did that to him wanted to send a message. They left his body on display. He was not dead when we found him, but there was nothing we could do other than wet his tongue before the end.
Target: Danlai was skinned alive. Whoever did that to him wanted to send a message. They left his body on display. He was not dead when we found him, but there was nothing we could do other than wet his tongue before the end.

Source: Tempest Island. The Maormer are attacking off the coast of Malabal Tor. They wield the storm and the sea. You wield Undaunted determination. Which will be the victor?
Target: 폭풍의 섬. 마오머들이 말라발 토르 해안을 공격하고 있다. 그들에게는 바다와 폭풍이 있다. 자네는 언던티드로서의 결의가 있다. 어느 쪽이 승리자가 될까?

Source: Someone deliberately poisoned our stronghold's well. The sickness began the day of the bandits' first attack. It couldn't have been them, not directly.\n\nYou should speak with <<1>>, one of <<2>>'s wives.
Target: Someone deliberately poisoned our stronghold's well. The sickness began the day of the bandits' first attack. It couldn't have been them, not directly.\n\nYou should speak with <<1>>, one of <<2>>'s wives.

Source: I wish to create a monument dedicated to the forces of change and chaos. I will take that which time has broken, and create it anew in the name of Sithis.\n\nThat is where your aid comes in.
Target: I wish to create a monument dedicated to the forces of change and chaos. I will take that which time has broken, and create it anew in the name of Sithis.\n\nThat is where your aid comes in.

Source: Is-is it that obvious? Yes, I am … well, no. Not really.\n\nI've come to ask Sulahkeesh, a former agent of the Shadowscales, to help arbitrate a dispute. But speaking to an assassin, even a retired one, is a … terrifying prospect, to say the least.
Target: Is-is it that obvious? Yes, I am … well, no. Not really.\n\nI've come to ask Sulahkeesh, a former agent of the Shadowscales, to help arbitrate a dispute. But speaking to an assassin, even a retired one, is a … terrifying prospect, to say the least.

Source: A plain wooden box, the length of my forearm.\n\nLast I saw, it was nestled in the beak of one of the hackwings that attacked me. I believe it may have brought the box back to its nest, just north-west of this dock.
Target: A plain wooden box, the length of my forearm.\n\nLast I saw, it was nestled in the beak of one of the hackwings that attacked me. I believe it may have brought the box back to its nest, just north-west of this dock.

Source: Well, surrounding you is a town full of statues. It's problematic.
Target: Well, surrounding you is a town full of statues. It's problematic.

Source: Varona and her beloved pet, <<1>>, went for a walk in the swamp hours ago and they still haven't returned.\n\nMy wife can take care of herself, but she's as unfamiliar with this terrain as I am. I fear the worst may have happened.
Target: Varona and her beloved pet, <<1>>, went for a walk in the swamp hours ago and they still haven't returned.\n\nMy wife can take care of herself, but she's as unfamiliar with this terrain as I am. I fear the worst may have happened.

Source: <A broken bit of metal rests atop an ancient letter.>
Target: <A broken bit of metal rests atop an ancient letter.>

Source: My employer, an innkeeper. We were headed through a nearby marsh to pick up supplies when the pirates hit <<1>>. <<2>>, the workers … we all scattered into the marsh.\n\nI ran back to town and hid. Then the <<3>> arrived. It has been a strange day.
Target: My employer, an innkeeper. We were headed through a nearby marsh to pick up supplies when the pirates hit <<1>>. <<2>>, the workers … we all scattered into the marsh.\n\nI ran back to town and hid. Then the <<3>> arrived. It has been a strange day.

Source: Oh, hah! Sorry, the rank and file aren't passing on the word very well. Our ranks have swelled in recent months, and our coffers are overflowing with jewels and gold. We want to see the spoils go to the best among us.
Target: 오, 하!미안해요, 일반 대중들에게 그 말을 잘 전달을 못하고 있는 중입니다.저희들의 순위가 최근 몇달간 올랐고, 우리의 금고 안에는 보석과 금이 넘치고 있습니다.우리는 그 전리품들이 우리들중 최고한테 가는것을 보고 싶습니다.

Source: Why, it recently came alive! Though perhaps "awake" is the more appropriate word. One of my fellow Mages Guild scholars leads the excavation, if you care to learn more.\n\nCome to think of it, I haven't seen <<1>> or her assistants in quite some time.
Target: Why, it recently came alive! Though perhaps \\"awake\"\" is the more appropriate word. One of my fellow Mages Guild scholars leads the excavation
column4: if you care to learn more.\n\nCome to think of it
column5: I haven't seen <<1>> or her assistants in quite some time."

Source: My unit came here with the Speaker for the Mane. A great honor to travel in his company, to visit the capital of the Dominion.\n\nBut it seems pirates captured <<1>>. They must have overwhelmed the defenders.
Target: My unit came here with the Speaker for the Mane. A great honor to travel in his company, to visit the capital of the Dominion.\n\nBut it seems pirates captured <<1>>. They must have overwhelmed the defenders.

Source: I was part of a research expedition sent to investigate the ruins of Root Sunder, an Altmer city swallowed by the jungle centuries ago.\n\nI took a short leave to retrieve supplies, and when I got back, the ruins were swarming with wild animals.
Target: I was part of a research expedition sent to investigate the ruins of Root Sunder, an Altmer city swallowed by the jungle centuries ago.\n\nI took a short leave to retrieve supplies, and when I got back, the ruins were swarming with wild animals.

Source: "Cyrodilic Collections, the foremost society dedicated to the retrieval, restoration, preservation, and return of Argonian antiquities to their rightful owners in Murkmire, seeks the best and brightest to join its ranks."
Target: \\"Cyrodilic Collections
column4: the foremost society dedicated to the retrieval
column5: restoration
column7: and return of Argonian antiquities to their rightful owners in Murkmire
column8: seeks the best and brightest to join its ranks.\"\""

Source: If you convince me you know how to use a needle and thread, I'll certify you.\n\nHowever, you must commit. I can't certify two things at once.
Target: 바늘과 실을 사용하는 방법을 아는지 증명한다면, 인증해드릴게요.\n\n하지만, 명심하세요. 한 번에 두 가지를 인증 받을 수는 없어요.

Source: I couldn't figure it out at first either, but as soon as it got dark, I realized—they want ships to crash on the rocks! Then it's just easy pickings for them.\n\nWe need to get the signal fire relit, and fast.
Target: I couldn't figure it out at first either, but as soon as it got dark, I realized—they want ships to crash on the rocks! Then it's just easy pickings for them.\n\nWe need to get the signal fire relit, and fast.

Source: The Vaults of Madness. Misshapen as its creator's mind. Filled with the horrors of Oblivion. Only eternal torment awaits any who would enter. Does that entice you?
Target: 광기의 지하실이네. 만든 자의 머리처럼 괴상한 장소야. 오블리비온의 공포로 가득 차 있어 들어가는 자에게는 영원한 고통만이 기다리지. 들어갈 마음이 생겼나?

Source: Captain Angarthal—the fobbing dog! Cruelest slaver in the Azurian Sea and now in Iliac Bay. He must've put out the signal fire in the lighthouse.\n\nIt was pitch black. We hit the rocks and the slavers were all over us. Captured the entire crew.
Target: Captain Angarthal—the fobbing dog! Cruelest slaver in the Azurian Sea and now in Iliac Bay. He must've put out the signal fire in the lighthouse.\n\nIt was pitch black. We hit the rocks and the slavers were all over us. Captured the entire crew.

Source: The bonding ritual? Are you not here to witness our most sacred tradition? It's a beautiful, lively affair …! Usually.\n\nOur guests have not seen fit to join us for the ceremony.
Target: The bonding ritual? Are you not here to witness our most sacred tradition? It's a beautiful, lively affair …! Usually.\n\nOur guests have not seen fit to join us for the ceremony.

Source: I was short on some supplies. I planned to meet with a trader to restock. Then, pirates.\n\nEveryone ran in different directions. I heard some screams out in the marsh, but I twisted my ankle.
Target: I was short on some supplies. I planned to meet with a trader to restock. Then, pirates.\n\nEveryone ran in different directions. I heard some screams out in the marsh, but I twisted my ankle.

Source: With all the dangers surrounding us, our warriors and hunters are in desperate need for newly crafted leather armor. Unfortunately, no member of our tribe is skilled enough to hunt the hackwings needed to create such armor.
Target: With all the dangers surrounding us, our warriors and hunters are in desperate need for newly crafted leather armor. Unfortunately, no member of our tribe is skilled enough to hunt the hackwings needed to create such armor.

Source: The Blessed Crucible. A contest of blood and fire. Warriors across Tamriel vie for the Brimstone Crown. Represent us in this competition and prove the Undaunted are aptly named.
Target: 축복받은 시련. 피와 불의 경연 대회. 탐리엘 전역의 전사들이 유황 왕관을 두고 경쟁하지. 이 대회에서 우리를 대표하고 언던티드의 이름이 헛되지 않다는 것을 증명하게!

Source: A few days ago, several envoys from our tribe left to travel to local villages. We wished to introduce ourselves, establish relationships, and, most importantly, request aid.\n\nHowever, it seems these envoys never arrived at their destinations.
Target: A few days ago, several envoys from our tribe left to travel to local villages. We wished to introduce ourselves, establish relationships, and, most importantly, request aid.\n\nHowever, it seems these envoys never arrived at their destinations.

Source: It is customary for tribes to send offerings of aid to a newly formed village. Several of these offerings were recently collected by one of our envoys.\n\nUnfortunately, the envoy was attacked by Blackguards before she could return.
Target: It is customary for tribes to send offerings of aid to a newly formed village. Several of these offerings were recently collected by one of our envoys.\n\nUnfortunately, the envoy was attacked by Blackguards before she could return.

Source: Within Vakka-Bok grows a most useful aloe. It's properties are unlike anything our healers have ever seen before. Wounds heal in days, burns are soothed in seconds.\n\nYet our supplies of this aloe run desperately low.
Target: Within Vakka-Bok grows a most useful aloe. It's properties are unlike anything our healers have ever seen before. Wounds heal in days, burns are soothed in seconds.\n\nYet our supplies of this aloe run desperately low.

Source: Selene's Web. No place for the civilized. Or even my brutish peers. The beasts and their Bosmer keepers are formidable and deadly. Will you be the one to tame this wild place?
Target: 셀린의 거미줄.사람의 손길이 닿지 않은 장소 입니다.심지어 제 잘난 척하는 동료들도 말이죠.그 짐승들과 보스머 관리자들은 무서울정도로 치명적입니다.이 야생의 장소를 길들일 사람이 되어 주시겠습니까?

Source: <These papers show plans to take over the Koeglin Lighthouse and extinguish the lights.>
Target: <These papers show plans to take over the Koeglin Lighthouse and extinguish the lights.>

Source: The mushrooms that grow in Blight Bog Sump can be used to create powerful fertilizer. Plant a seed within such soil, and the sprouts are assured to grow fast and strong.\n\nUnfortunately, the caverns themselves are filled with dangerous foes.
Target: The mushrooms that grow in Blight Bog Sump can be used to create powerful fertilizer. Plant a seed within such soil, and the sprouts are assured to grow fast and strong.\n\nUnfortunately, the caverns themselves are filled with dangerous foes.

Source: Darkshade Caverns! The Kwama burrowed into some Dwarven ruins at the heart of the place and activated something that's driving everyone mad.\n\nMan, machine, and beast tearing themselves apart! A true test for you, Undaunted.
Target: 어둠의 동굴! 드워븐 유적 중심지에는 크와마가 파묻혀 있고 모두를 미치게 만드는 무언가가 작동된 곳이지.\n\n사람, 기계, 괴수들이 서로 물어 뜯어며 싸우고 있어! 네게 딱 맞는 시련이야, 언던티드.

Source: Darkshade Caverns! Pretty straightforward sweep and clear, really. Local thugs have claimed a kwama mine. Go knock their heads in and move on.
Target: 어둠의 동굴! 꽤 직선적이고 깔끔한 곳이지. 그 지역 깡패들이 크와마 광산의 소유권을 주장하고 있어. 그들에게 매운맛을 보여주고 돌아와.

Source: The bonding ritual is very important to the tribe. Everyone is under a lot of pressure to make sure everything is perfect.\n\nThere's some commotion in the village right now. Raised voices, tempers high. Not the best time for visitors.
Target: The bonding ritual is very important to the tribe. Everyone is under a lot of pressure to make sure everything is perfect.\n\nThere's some commotion in the village right now. Raised voices, tempers high. Not the best time for visitors.

Source: Well, after you defeated the Razor Master during your last visit, my wife Gilraen leapt into the Oblivion Gate he left behind. It closed behind her—she saved the forest.\n\nBut I couldn't let her go. I opened the portal—tried to find her.
Target: Well, after you defeated the Razor Master during your last visit, my wife Gilraen leapt into the Oblivion Gate he left behind. It closed behind her—she saved the forest.\n\nBut I couldn't let her go. I opened the portal—tried to find her.

Source: It is my home, you see, and I have just returned from Shadowfen. I have supplies meant for our bonding ritual preparations, but I must arrange for their transport. It would mean so much if you could tell my tree-minder that I will be home soon.
Target: It is my home, you see, and I have just returned from Shadowfen. I have supplies meant for our bonding ritual preparations, but I must arrange for their transport. It would mean so much if you could tell my tree-minder that I will be home soon.

Source: Kassandra wants to see you at the Cyrodilic Collections headquarters. Now.\n\nThat little tea party Famia's hosting won't last much longer. They want to get going to the Swallowed Grove.
Target: Kassandra wants to see you at the Cyrodilic Collections headquarters. Now.\n\nThat little tea party Famia's hosting won't last much longer. They want to get going to the Swallowed Grove.

Source: The Crypt of Hearts. A place of love and hope twisted by jealousy and hatred into a perverse dungeon of eternal torment. The dead cry out for rest. Deliver it to them.
Target: 마음의 묘실. 한때 사랑과 희망이 넘쳤던 곳이 질투와 증오로 인해 비뚤어져 영원한 고문만이 있는 감옥이지. 망자들은 안식을 취하고 싶어 울부짖는 곳이야. 그들에게 안식을 선사해 줘.

Source: Cyrodilic Collections can't outfit our expeditions without the generous donations of benefactors. In return, we sometimes perform services for these benefactors. Services related to historic investigation and research.\n\nFor example, take Tia Doran.
Target: Cyrodilic Collections can't outfit our expeditions without the generous donations of benefactors. In return, we sometimes perform services for these benefactors. Services related to historic investigation and research.\n\nFor example, take Tia Doran.

Source: Wayrest Sewers. As if the place didn't reek to High Hrothgar under normal circumstances, now it's teeming with foul undeath!\n\nFlush out the soggy remnants of the Pellingare's failed rebellion and let us all breath a little easier.
Target: 웨이레스트 하수구야.  평소에 하이 흐로스가까지 악취를 풍기는 곳은 아니었는데, 이제는 더러운 언데드놈들로 가득해!\n\n펠렝게어의 실패한 반역의 잔재들을 청소하고 숨 좀 편하게 쉬도록 만들어줘.

Source: Increased business for me, extra gold for you! I believe the Imperials call it a win-win situation.\n\nThe prominent trader, Captain Jimila, arrived in port. If we can convince her to export my vossa-satls, the possibilities for profit are endless!
Target: Increased business for me, extra gold for you! I believe the Imperials call it a win-win situation.\n\nThe prominent trader, Captain Jimila, arrived in port. If we can convince her to export my vossa-satls, the possibilities for profit are endless!

Source: Elden Hollow! Daedra are springing up like weeds in the shadows of the Elden Tree. Must be something in the soil.\n\nPick up a scythe and get hacking!
Target: 엘든 할로우! 데이드라는 엘든 나무 그림자 아래서 잡초처럼 자라나고 있어. 그 땅에는 뭔가 있나봐.\n\n낫을 들고 잡초를 베어낼 때야!

Source: Elden Hollow! There's a great big hole under the Elden Tree, a whole complex of caves and tombs. Some Daedra-summoning thick-heads have gotten in there. Need to be rooted out.
Target: 엘든 할로우! 엘든 나무에는 커다란 구멍이 있어, 그 구멍은 복잡한 동굴과 무덤이지. 데이드라를 불러내는 멍청이들이 거기 있다고 해.  뿌리를 뽑아버려.

Source: My homeland is very beautiful, but also very dangerous. Knifeberries, toadskin peppers, ghost truffles … these foods look very fine, but will kill most anyone who eats them. Without a guide, explorers can easily starve in the marsh.
Target: My homeland is very beautiful, but also very dangerous. Knifeberries, toadskin peppers, ghost truffles … these foods look very fine, but will kill most anyone who eats them. Without a guide, explorers can easily starve in the marsh.

Source: Gathering food in Murkmire is a dangerous proposition, even for Argonians. To keep our explorers robust, we have to ship in hearty food—salted meat mostly. It does not rot so easily in the dampness of the swamp. Our supply is short, however.
Target: Gathering food in Murkmire is a dangerous proposition, even for Argonians. To keep our explorers robust, we have to ship in hearty food—salted meat mostly. It does not rot so easily in the dampness of the swamp. Our supply is short, however.

Source: Wayrest Sewers! Some damned fool nobles want to take over the city. They've raised an army of bandits to get the job done!
Target: 웨이레스트 하수구! 어떤 저주받을 바보 귀족이 도시를 차지하고 싶어해. 그걸 위해 도적의 군대를 양성했더군!

Source: As you may know, the weather in Murkmire can be nastier than a crocodile's bite. The last storm to hit our expedition set us back an entire week!\n\nWe need an ally who can help us prepare, and that's a fact.
Target: As you may know, the weather in Murkmire can be nastier than a crocodile's bite. The last storm to hit our expedition set us back an entire week!\n\nWe need an ally who can help us prepare, and that's a fact.

Source: The grove is north of Alten Meerhleel—tucked away near a roaring waterfall, if memory serves.\n\nI will make my personal ferry available to all here assembled. Join us. Or walk, if you prefer. I'd only ask that you avoid any unnecessary delays.
Target: The grove is north of Alten Meerhleel—tucked away near a roaring waterfall, if memory serves.\n\nI will make my personal ferry available to all here assembled. Join us. Or walk, if you prefer. I'd only ask that you avoid any unnecessary delays.

Source: Crypt of Hearts. The dark spirit of Nerien'eth has returned to the ruins. He leads an army of Daedric monsters. Cleansing the Crypt of Oblivion-spawn will be … challenging.
Target: 마음의 묘실이다. 네리에네스의 어두운 영혼이 폐허에 돌아왔네. 그는 데이드라 괴물들의 군대를 이끌고 있어. 오블리비언의 묘실을 청소하는 것은… 어려울 것이다.

Source: It's my missing companions, Eshraf and Dinia—the explorers whose bags we found out in the marsh. Remember?\n\nI told you I sent them to recover vakka stones, but that wasn't all they were looking for. They were looking for the Remnant of Argon.
Target: It's my missing companions, Eshraf and Dinia—the explorers whose bags we found out in the marsh. Remember?\n\nI told you I sent them to recover vakka stones, but that wasn't all they were looking for. They were looking for the Remnant of Argon.

Source: Did you not come to see the monument?\n\nThe Xinchei-Konu is an ancient calendar. Each of its twelve tablets represent a month in the year's cycle. Unfortunately, all of these tablets were recently stolen.
Target: Did you not come to see the monument?\n\nThe Xinchei-Konu is an ancient calendar. Each of its twelve tablets represent a month in the year's cycle. Unfortunately, all of these tablets were recently stolen.

Source: Arx Corinium. A relic of the fallen Empire. Drowned and consumed by swamps and serpents, as you will be should you travel there. Or will you, Undaunted?
Target: 악스 코리늄. 멸망한 제국의 유물. 물에 잠긴 채 늪과 뱀들이 삼켜버린 곳. 그곳을 여행하면 자네도 같은 운명이다. 그래도 갈건가, 언던티드?

Source: Did you not come to see the monument?\n\nThe Xinchei-Konu is an ancient calendar. Each of its twelve tablets represent a month in the year's cycle. Unfortunately, all of these tablets were recently stolen.
Target: Did you not come to see the monument?\n\nThe Xinchei-Konu is an ancient calendar. Each of its twelve tablets represent a month in the year's cycle. Unfortunately, all of these tablets were recently stolen.

Source: Unfortunately, I am … unsure of the components needed to complete the ritual.\n\nWill you ask the aid of my mentor, Nisswo Paraxeeh? He watched over the monument before I was granted the honor, but now serves as a priest of Sithis.
Target: Unfortunately, I am … unsure of the components needed to complete the ritual.\n\nWill you ask the aid of my mentor, Nisswo Paraxeeh? He watched over the monument before I was granted the honor, but now serves as a priest of Sithis.

Source: Direfrost Keep. The cycle of vengeance between witch and witch hunter plays out once again. This time on a stage of ice. Will you stand frozen as the scene plays out, or seek center stage for yourself?
Target: 혹심서리 아성. 마녀와 마녀 사냥꾼 사이의 물고 물리는 복수의 무대가 다시 한번 펼쳐진다. 이번엔 빙하가 그 무대지. 장면이 펼쳐지면 자네는 얼어 붙겠나, 아니면 스스로 그 무대 한복판에 서겠나?

Source: Cyrodilic Collections needs someone to gather old remains from the Teeth of Sithis. Something about a theory and live sacrifices. I didn't ask. All you need to do is poke around the xanmeers and bring back anything that might have walked on two legs.
Target: Cyrodilic Collections needs someone to gather old remains from the Teeth of Sithis. Something about a theory and live sacrifices. I didn't ask. All you need to do is poke around the xanmeers and bring back anything that might have walked on two legs.

Source: City of Ash. When forests burn, they might yet be given new life. So too may it be for Whisper Grove, but not while the throngs of Mehrunes Dagon continue to spill forth from Oblivion.\n\nFace the Daedric horde. Scatter it, and return to me Undaunted.
Target: 재의 도시. 숲이 불타버리면 새로운 생명을 얻게 되는 법이지. 속삭이는 숲(Whisper Grove)도 마찬가지겠지만, 메이룬스 데이건의 부하들이 계속해서 오블리비언에서 쏟아져 나오는 동안에는 그럴 수 없네.\n\n데이드라의 무리를 상대해라. 쫓아내 버리고, 언던티드로 돌아오게나.

Source: Truly? Then perhaps you'd be willing to help!\n\nMy boss Seeks-the-Dark has been captured by these ruffians. And as tempting as a daring rescue sounds, there's no way I could possibly infiltrate Blackrose Prison alone.
Target: Truly? Then perhaps you'd be willing to help!\n\nMy boss Seeks-the-Dark has been captured by these ruffians. And as tempting as a daring rescue sounds, there's no way I could possibly infiltrate Blackrose Prison alone.

Target: I suppose, but it feels strange to be making deals with creatures that were our enemies only moments ago.\n\nPlease, go speak to Valsirenn. She carries the burden of the Ritemaster's death like a weight upon her shoulders. She could use your help.

Source: No. We should not interfere until we know more, but if you are willing, I would ask that you carry word of this development to Commander Ahla at Bangkorai Garrison. \n\nShe will know best what should be done.
Target: No. We should not interfere until we know more, but if you are willing, I would ask that you carry word of this development to Commander Ahla at Bangkorai Garrison. \n\nShe will know best what should be done.

Source: Priestess of Azura. Molag Bal's been torturing her longer than you, me, maybe even these trees have been alive—and he's not like to stop unless someone makes him.\n\nOld <<1>> tried. Haven't seen her since.
Target: Priestess of Azura. Molag Bal's been torturing her longer than you, me, maybe even these trees have been alive—and he's not like to stop unless someone makes him.\n\nOld <<1>> tried. Haven't seen her since.

Source: Touch Meridia's light and see the world through the eyes of your former enemies.\n\nBut fair warning—you will no longer be seen as a great champion. Even familiar faces will see you as a soulless drifter, lost in an unfamiliar land. What say you?
Target: Touch Meridia's light and see the world through the eyes of your former enemies.\n\nBut fair warning—you will no longer be seen as a great champion. Even familiar faces will see you as a soulless drifter, lost in an unfamiliar land. What say you?

Source: A league of like-minded adventurers. Every one of us eager for riches and glory. Sound like anyone you know? \n\nSo what do you say? Think you can be one of the Undaunted?
Target: A league of like-minded adventurers. Every one of us eager for riches and glory. Sound like anyone you know? \n\nSo what do you say? Think you can be one of the Undaunted?

Source: Sounds like you could use some help.
Target: 제가 도와드릴 수 있을 것 같군요.

Source: "Notice to all Covenant warriors:\n\nGrand Warlord Dortene has decreed a bounty upon Dominion and Pact Templars. Slay 20 of them and you will earn a reward."
Target: 모든 대거폴 동맹 전사들에게 공지함:\n\n돌틴 대장군님께서 알드메리 자치령과 에본하트 조약의 템플러에게 현상금을 걸기로 결정하셨소. 20명을 죽인다면 보상을 받게 될 것이오.

Source: "Warriors:\n\nIt is the will of Grand Warlord Zimmeron that bounties be offered for killing Dominion and Covenant Templars. Slay 20 or more of these foes and you are entitled to a reward."
Target: "Warriors:\n\nIt is the will of Grand Warlord Zimmeron that bounties be offered for killing Dominion and Covenant Templars. Slay 20 or more of these foes and you are entitled to a reward."

Source: The Sea Sloads have unleashed abyssal geysers that can sink the island. They assumed we'd be so concerned with the creatures that bubbled out of them that we'd fail to realize the true danger until it was too late.\n\nLet's disappoint them, shall we?
Target: The Sea Sloads have unleashed abyssal geysers that can sink the island. They assumed we'd be so concerned with the creatures that bubbled out of them that we'd fail to realize the true danger until it was too late.\n\nLet's disappoint them, shall we?

Source: Where is this temple?
Target: 이 신전은 어디 있어?

Source: You know, I didn't think to ask. Maybe it has to do with the missing relics? Yes, that sounds about right.
Target: You know, I didn't think to ask. Maybe it has to do with the missing relics? Yes, that sounds about right.

Source: I had hoped you would make such an offer. My instincts tell me that Reezal-Jul allowed the refugees to survive. It's a trap. It has to be.\n\nFind the camp and tell the Captain what I have learned. Then help her end this threat once and for all.
Target: I had hoped you would make such an offer. My instincts tell me that Reezal-Jul allowed the refugees to survive. It's a trap. It has to be.\n\nFind the camp and tell the Captain what I have learned. Then help her end this threat once and for all.

Source: Who are these pirates you keep mentioning?
Target: 당신이 계속 언급한 이 해적들은 누굽니까?

Source: Ulliceta gra-Kogg. We're not friends, exactly. More like colleagues. Well … perhaps we are friends. I'm not sure. She doesn't make it easy.\n\nAnyway, none of that matters. What matters is that she's put herself in harm's way. Again.
Target: Ulliceta gra-Kogg. We're not friends, exactly. More like colleagues. Well … perhaps we are friends. I'm not sure. She doesn't make it easy.\n\nAnyway, none of that matters. What matters is that she's put herself in harm's way. Again.

Target: 지휘부관 아피니아가 정확히 무슨 짓을 한 거야?

Source: I'll speak with <<1>>.
Target: <<1>>와 대화해 볼게.

Source: Well, you've experienced two of the three alliances. Care to finish the set? Fill out your map? Collect all the … metaphors?\n\nIf you're game, just touch Meridia's light and you'll be off again!
Target: Well, you've experienced two of the three alliances. Care to finish the set? Fill out your map? Collect all the … metaphors?\n\nIf you're game, just touch Meridia's light and you'll be off again!

Source: We are! Thrill-seeking adventurers, every one. We aren't mercenaries like the Fighters Guild, or patriots like the Dominion. We fight to prove we're the toughest of the litter.\n\nYou want in? You'll have to prove yourself.
Target: We are! Thrill-seeking adventurers, every one. We aren't mercenaries like the Fighters Guild, or patriots like the Dominion. We fight to prove we're the toughest of the litter.\n\nYou want in? You'll have to prove yourself.

Source: Crafting writs are daily requests for crafted goods. You must be a certified crafter to fulfill them.\n\nProve you know what you're doing, and I'll certify you.
Target: Crafting writs are daily requests for crafted goods. You must be a certified crafter to fulfill them.\n\nProve you know what you're doing, and I'll certify you.

Target: <Take Flute>

Source: What does the other part think?
Target: What does the other part think?

Source: <<1>>, the farm's matron. I saw her run for the barn. She's got the soul of Ysgramor. She wouldn't have left anyone behind.
Target: <<1>>, the farm's matron. I saw her run for the barn. She's got the soul of Ysgramor. She wouldn't have left anyone behind.

Source: What is Spikeball?
Target: What is Spikeball?

Source: Need any help?
Target: 도움이 필요해?

Source: The great warrior paces about outside the observatory in Belkarth. Like a caged tiger, he is!\n\nHe urged me to find you and ask you to hurry. I fear something dreadful is about to take place.
Target: The great warrior paces about outside the observatory in Belkarth. Like a caged tiger, he is!\n\nHe urged me to find you and ask you to hurry. I fear something dreadful is about to take place.

Source: <A crude map of the area shows the location of <<1>>.>
Target: <A crude map of the area shows the location of <<1>>.>

Source: What can I expect?
Target: What can I expect?

Source: My champion, Titus, who I called across the sands of time in my moment of need, is fading. His mortal mind can't deal with the shift in his reality.\n\nThe longer he remains here, the more likely he will lose all that he is.
Target: My champion, Titus, who I called across the sands of time in my moment of need, is fading. His mortal mind can't deal with the shift in his reality.\n\nThe longer he remains here, the more likely he will lose all that he is.

Source: I need you to rescue my advisors. They can tell you more about the attack and perhaps help you free me from my prison. I'm being weakened by some powerful magic. \n\nThey won't be much use to you as fighters, but they're very clever.
Target: I need you to rescue my advisors. They can tell you more about the attack and perhaps help you free me from my prison. I'm being weakened by some powerful magic. \n\nThey won't be much use to you as fighters, but they're very clever.

Source: Is there anything I can do?
Target: Is there anything I can do?

Source: <<1>> is there. She's the farm's matron.\n\nShe ran for the barn while … while we were trying to escape.
Target: <<1>> is there. She's the farm's matron.\n\nShe ran for the barn while … while we were trying to escape.

Source: Sure, I'll deliver your letter.
Target: Sure, I'll deliver your letter.

Source: Spindleclutch, dark home of the Whisperer! Hope you're not afraid of spiders. The marsh fens of northern Glenumbra are the perfect breeding ground for twitchy multi-legged horrors.
Target: 스핀들크러치, 속삭이는 자의 어둠의 집! 네가 거미를 무서워 하지 않기를 바랄게. 글렌움브라 북부 늪지는 다리많은 흉물들이 번식하기 완벽한 장소거든.

Source: We need weapons. Overpower a few Stormfists, grab their weapons, and give them to my husband, Jomund. He's in the mine.\n\nAnd set some of the miners free along the way. Look for my siblings, Tridi and Nedrek. I need to know they're safe.
Target: We need weapons. Overpower a few Stormfists, grab their weapons, and give them to my husband, Jomund. He's in the mine.\n\nAnd set some of the miners free along the way. Look for my siblings, Tridi and Nedrek. I need to know they're safe.

Source: I don't know the details.\n\nLook, <<1>> can tell you herself. Me? I'm done with that operation.
Target: I don't know the details.\n\nLook, <<1>> can tell you herself. Me? I'm done with that operation.

Source: We hid the sample and our research notes, but I think the magister is suspicious. She's looking for something back there.\n\nI'd like you to retrieve the research notes and the ore sample.
Target: We hid the sample and our research notes, but I think the magister is suspicious. She's looking for something back there.\n\nI'd like you to retrieve the research notes and the ore sample.

Source: I've sent a striker to assist you inside the cave's entrance. My remaining crew and I will secure the exit.\n\nBe wary. The Maormer feared the very mention of <<1>>. Light of Aldmeris guide you.
Target: I've sent a striker to assist you inside the cave's entrance. My remaining crew and I will secure the exit.\n\nBe wary. The Maormer feared the very mention of <<1>>. Light of Aldmeris guide you.

Source: The Maormer bound the captain and some crew, then took them away. They killed those who didn't dive overboard, like I did, and captured several others as they swam ashore.\n\nI fear the Maormer will torture their captives if they aren't rescued soon!
Target: The Maormer bound the captain and some crew, then took them away. They killed those who didn't dive overboard, like I did, and captured several others as they swam ashore.\n\nI fear the Maormer will torture their captives if they aren't rescued soon!

Source: I don't know. If the dead here are rising and this is the royal crypt, have any of my ancestors risen? Maybe they can give us some answers.\n\nWould you consider venturing into the royal crypt to find out?
Target: I don't know. If the dead here are rising and this is the royal crypt, have any of my ancestors risen? Maybe they can give us some answers.\n\nWould you consider venturing into the royal crypt to find out?

Source: Burn the Maormer sailboats. The rowboats aren't a threat to our fleet. We can take our time with those.\n\nLook for me on the hillside above our shipwreck when you're done. I'll be at my favorite overlook. You can't miss it.
Target: Burn the Maormer sailboats. The rowboats aren't a threat to our fleet. We can take our time with those.\n\nLook for me on the hillside above our shipwreck when you're done. I'll be at my favorite overlook. You can't miss it.

Target: I'll find your apprentice.

Target: What do you want me to do?

Target: <의뢰를 수락한다.>

Source: I can go to Kvatch.

Target: <Take Note>

Source: Yes! Go after the Worm Cultists. Break the geodes and release those poor souls.\n\nAnd see that my husband gets to Sovngarde.
Target: Yes! Go after the Worm Cultists. Break the geodes and release those poor souls.\n\nAnd see that my husband gets to Sovngarde.

Source: The hengekeeper would know better than I. She is nearby, in the roots below.\n\nSeek her out. Banish whatever darkness shadows this grove.
Target: The hengekeeper would know better than I. She is nearby, in the roots below.\n\nSeek her out. Banish whatever darkness shadows this grove.

Source: I'll meet you at the bridge.
Target: I'll meet you at the bridge.

Source: Here, take this cold water. Most of them are lolling around in a stupor now. Toss it on the mammoths to wake them up.\n\nThey'll be cantankerous and you'll have to defend yourself, but they'll run on home once you've beaten some sense into them.
Target: Here, take this cold water. Most of them are lolling around in a stupor now. Toss it on the mammoths to wake them up.\n\nThey'll be cantankerous and you'll have to defend yourself, but they'll run on home once you've beaten some sense into them.

Source: I'll speak with her.
Target: I'll speak with her.

Source: Crush every geode you find, youngin. Start with the one in this bloody bag. That'll send my family to Sovngarde and our damned-well deserved reward!
Target: Crush every geode you find, youngin. Start with the one in this bloody bag. That'll send my family to Sovngarde and our damned-well deserved reward!

Source: Maybe it's nothing. There have always been stories about the barrow. It's just that … well, lately it seems a little more real. Like something or someone disturbed the dead inside. My brother is a capable fighter, but I still worry about him.
Target: Maybe it's nothing. There have always been stories about the barrow. It's just that … well, lately it seems a little more real. Like something or someone disturbed the dead inside. My brother is a capable fighter, but I still worry about him.

Source: Is there any way to repair the seals?
Target: Is there any way to repair the seals?

Source: All right, I'll meet her there.
Target: 좋아요, 거기서 그녀를 만날게요.

Source: She swears something pulled him into one of the canals. Poor thing's shocked out of her gourd. As you can see, I'm a little occupied. Get Yiri talking. Tell the Pact's commander, Centurion Andrin, what you learn.
Target: She swears something pulled him into one of the canals. Poor thing's shocked out of her gourd. As you can see, I'm a little occupied. Get Yiri talking. Tell the Pact's commander, Centurion Andrin, what you learn.

Source: They've been out there for hours. I don't know what's taking them so long. Could you look for them? I'd go myself, but I've got to keep watch over the village. I'd be very grateful … and so would my gold pouch.
Target: They've been out there for hours. I don't know what's taking them so long. Could you look for them? I'd go myself, but I've got to keep watch over the village. I'd be very grateful … and so would my gold pouch.

Source: Necromancy is foul enough, but it's something more he's after. He's experimenting on the living, too. I was likely next in line. I don't know what his goal is and I don't care. You have to stop him before he kills more innocents.
Target: Necromancy is foul enough, but it's something more he's after. He's experimenting on the living, too. I was likely next in line. I don't know what his goal is and I don't care. You have to stop him before he kills more innocents.

Source: Perhaps you could take care of that last little bit of business for us?  Get rid of the threat and destroy their orders. \n\nWe've had enough trouble here to last a lifetime.
Target: Perhaps you could take care of that last little bit of business for us?  Get rid of the threat and destroy their orders. \n\nWe've had enough trouble here to last a lifetime.

Source: The Companions' Hall, our ancient headquarters. It perches on the mountainside above Shor's Stone. \n\nWe must see if any are left to save. And then we take the Hall back. Can I count on you?
Target: The Companions' Hall, our ancient headquarters. It perches on the mountainside above Shor's Stone. \n\nWe must see if any are left to save. And then we take the Hall back. Can I count on you?

Source: Can you meet me by Cold Cave when you're done? It's right below our feet, so to speak. The entry's on the hillside.\n\nYou can't miss the cold air coming from it. Promise you'll meet me there?
Target: Can you meet me by Cold Cave when you're done? It's right below our feet, so to speak. The entry's on the hillside.\n\nYou can't miss the cold air coming from it. Promise you'll meet me there?

Source: I heard him talking to Lavinia. He's working alongside the cultists.
Target: I heard him talking to Lavinia. He's working alongside the cultists.

Source: What kind of help do you need?
Target: 어떤 도움이 필요하세요?

Source: Is there anything else I should know about?
Target: Is there anything else I should know about?

Source: <Continue reading.>
Target: <계속 읽는다.>

Source: If I rescue your eggs, you'll show me how to get into the tower?
Target: If I rescue your eggs, you'll show me how to get into the tower?

Source: Then what?
Target: Then what?

Source: You want me to help you kill someone?
Target: You want me to help you kill someone?

Source: Why does he want to meet at the ruins?
Target: Why does he want to meet at the ruins?

Source: Prove you know your way around a forge and I'll certify you.\n\nBut you have to commit. I can only train one discipline at a time.
Target: 대장간 일에 익숙하는 것을 증명하세요. 그럼 인증해드릴게요.\n\n하지만 명심하세요. 전 오직 한번에 한 가지만 가르쳐 드릴 수 있어요.

Source: My wife is the mayor of Crestshade. She's stubborn, but devoted to her job. She refused to leave while the town was still in danger. \n\nCould you go to Crestshade and make sure she's all right?
Target: My wife is the mayor of Crestshade. She's stubborn, but devoted to her job. She refused to leave while the town was still in danger. \n\nCould you go to Crestshade and make sure she's all right?

Source: I should investigate Yldzuun.
Target: I should investigate Yldzuun.

Source: The Banished Cells! High Kinlord Rilis has only grown more cunning and dangerous since the Keepers split his soul.\n\nIf they can't contain him, someone's got to put him down for good. Someone like you.
Target: 추방자의 감옥! 고위 혈족군주 릴리스는 관리자들이 그의 영혼을 분할 한 이후로 점점 더 교활하고 위험해졌습니다.\n\n만약 그들이 그를 가둬둘 수 없다면, 모두를 위해 누군가가 그를 감옥에 쳐넣어야합니다. 당신같은 사람이요.

Source: Regent Cassipia went to Dragonstar to deal with another part of the Serpent's plan she doesn't want to see come to fruition. I know she's a powerful regent and all, but I'm worried about her.\n\nCan you go to Dragonstar and see if she needs any help?
Target: Regent Cassipia went to Dragonstar to deal with another part of the Serpent's plan she doesn't want to see come to fruition. I know she's a powerful regent and all, but I'm worried about her.\n\nCan you go to Dragonstar and see if she needs any help?

Source: That would be extremely helpful. The Argonian, Aleeto, is an alchemist. She tinkers with metals and crystals and dabbles in all kinds of magic. She'd be able to identify the metal.\n\nYou can find her in the Alchemist Shop in Fort Amol.
Target: That would be extremely helpful. The Argonian, Aleeto, is an alchemist. She tinkers with metals and crystals and dabbles in all kinds of magic. She'd be able to identify the metal.\n\nYou can find her in the Alchemist Shop in Fort Amol.

Source: <Take the listing.>
Target: <Take the listing.>

Source: Fungal Grotto! A Dark Elf spider cult found some Daedric shrine in its depths and made themselves at home. It'll take fire and steel to clear them out of there now. \n\nNot afraid of a few extra legs, are you?
Target: 곰팡이 동굴! 다크 엘프의 거미 교단은 오지의 데이드릭의 성소를 찾아내고 귀환했어. 그것들을 그곳에서 치울려면 불과 철이 필요할 거야.\n\n다리가 많이 달린 것을 두려워 하진 않겠지?

Source: The Fungal Grotto! The western Ashlands hide a mushroom-choked cavern. It seethes with Goblins and dreugh. We need to clear it, or they'll pour into Stonefalls like an emptied chamberpot.
Target: 바로 곰팡이 동굴이지! 애쉬랜드 서쪽의 버섯으로 가득한 동굴이지. 고블린과 드레그가 점령한거 같아. 거길 쓸어버리지 않으면 스톤폴즈로 쏟아져 나와 버릴거야.

Source: Take this supply of bandages. They're treated with an herbal mixture. Should get the wounded back on their feet. Know that our soldiers have traveled through the portals. I'm sure wounded lie there, as well. Thank you, my friend.
Target: Take this supply of bandages. They're treated with an herbal mixture. Should get the wounded back on their feet. Know that our soldiers have traveled through the portals. I'm sure wounded lie there, as well. Thank you, my friend.

Source: I need someone to fight their way into the barrows and find his hiding place.\n\nIt shouldn't be too hard. One of Althen's old cronies came to help him escape. Trolls got to him, but he must've been carrying a clue to Althen's hiding place.
Target: I need someone to fight their way into the barrows and find his hiding place.\n\nIt shouldn't be too hard. One of Althen's old cronies came to help him escape. Trolls got to him, but he must've been carrying a clue to Althen's hiding place.

Source: Many have gone to Sovngarde today, many more will follow unless we close the portals and stop Thallik Wormfather. \n\nNo ordinary soldier can deal with this. For this task, I need you.
Target: Many have gone to Sovngarde today, many more will follow unless we close the portals and stop Thallik Wormfather. \n\nNo ordinary soldier can deal with this. For this task, I need you.

Source: If I had to guess, yes. I just don't know what's taking them so long. They've been out there for hours.\n\nCould you help out your old friends, go look for them? I'd go myself but I've got to keep watch here.
Target: If I had to guess, yes. I just don't know what's taking them so long. They've been out there for hours.\n\nCould you help out your old friends, go look for them? I'd go myself but I've got to keep watch here.

Source: What would you have me do?
Target: What would you have me do?

Source: Yes! That Hircine-worshiper wants to keep me from the handfast.\n\nMy scouts saw his Houndsmen in the ravine below, bearing silver shards that radiate magicka. Can you wrest the shards from them? They're key to unlocking the city, and this puzzle.
Target: Yes! That Hircine-worshiper wants to keep me from the handfast.\n\nMy scouts saw his Houndsmen in the ravine below, bearing silver shards that radiate magicka. Can you wrest the shards from them? They're key to unlocking the city, and this puzzle.

Source: I should investigate Aldunz.
Target: I should investigate Aldunz.

Source: Is there something going on in that old tomb?
Target: Is there something going on in that old tomb?
