Target: 추방자의 감옥! 아우리돈 지하에 흑마법과 가족의 증오가 들끓는 곳이지. 혈족군주와 사악한 괴물 클렌피어 쉐도우랜드를 무찔러.

Source: I hope not, but who can say? Could you watch for any of Fildgor's soldiers? A courier, maybe? \n\nWe don't want word about that mysterious metal reaching the wrong ears.
Target: I hope not, but who can say? Could you watch for any of Fildgor's soldiers? A courier, maybe? \n\nWe don't want word about that mysterious metal reaching the wrong ears.

Source: What about Andur and Aranias? Will you be safe?
Target: What about Andur and Aranias? Will you be safe?

Source: Many regents serve the Scaled Court. That's why things occur within its coils that aren't under my control.\n\nFor example, the Iron Orcs are raising an army. I sent my seneschal, Little Leaf, to stop their efforts. Perhaps you could lend her a hand?
Target: Many regents serve the Scaled Court. That's why things occur within its coils that aren't under my control.\n\nFor example, the Iron Orcs are raising an army. I sent my seneschal, Little Leaf, to stop their efforts. Perhaps you could lend her a hand?

Source: I don't know. The hengekeeper may. I sense her nearby, in the roots below.\n\nPlease, seek out the hengekeeper. Put an end to whatever darkness shadows our holy grove!
Target: I don't know. The hengekeeper may. I sense her nearby, in the roots below.\n\nPlease, seek out the hengekeeper. Put an end to whatever darkness shadows our holy grove!

Source: I am sworn to remain here. I shall meet <<1>>, who is on her way with a contingent of soldiers. But you are not so bound.\n\nGo to <<Ac:2>>. Find <<3>>, if he still draws breath. Help him protect our future.
Target: I am sworn to remain here. I shall meet <<1>>, who is on her way with a contingent of soldiers. But you are not so bound.\n\nGo to <<Ac:2>>. Find <<3>>, if he still draws breath. Help him protect our future.

Source: Some of the Houndsmen didn't like our music. I think they know it's a music of freedom and joy!\n\nTheir werewolves attacked us while we were practicing! We escaped into this ravine, but got separated. Are they even alive?
Target: Some of the Houndsmen didn't like our music. I think they know it's a music of freedom and joy!\n\nTheir werewolves attacked us while we were practicing! We escaped into this ravine, but got separated. Are they even alive?

Source: The delvers found an ancient puzzle and gathered notes about it - clues. The Worms killed the delvers to get their notes. Whatever they're after, we can't let them get it.\n\nSave who you can, but we need those notes.
Target: The delvers found an ancient puzzle and gathered notes about it - clues. The Worms killed the delvers to get their notes. Whatever they're after, we can't let them get it.\n\nSave who you can, but we need those notes.

Target: Certainly. I have one prospect who should be simple—Martin Dathieu. He's in the stocks for Mara's sake, but I can get him released if he enlists.\n\nWhen I spoke to him, however, he was stubborn and rude. Perhaps you can talk to him?

Source: I don't see how I can get through to Selos without help. He's probably at the bottom of the mine, beyond all these invaders. \n\nWe're going to have to cut our way through. If we kill the thugs' leaders, they'll probably run for it.
Target: I don't see how I can get through to Selos without help. He's probably at the bottom of the mine, beyond all these invaders. \n\nWe're going to have to cut our way through. If we kill the thugs' leaders, they'll probably run for it.

Target: The pickled fish from Lower Yorgrim and the mead from Voljar's have not yet arrived. Worse, my Dark Elf assistant never returned with my fancy Dunmer clothing from Mournhold.\n\nEverything goes wrong, and I am stuck here doing organizing things!

Source: There's a new Khajiit in charge, Khasda, and he enjoys throwing his weight around. Between this one and you, most in the Stitches find Khasda's leadership lacking, but none will stand up to him.\n\nThough this one heard rumors Tasnasi is back.
Target: There's a new Khajiit in charge, Khasda, and he enjoys throwing his weight around. Between this one and you, most in the Stitches find Khasda's leadership lacking, but none will stand up to him.\n\nThough this one heard rumors Tasnasi is back.

Source: I'll help you find your lost love.
Target: I'll help you find your lost love.

Source: A thief named <<1>> needs a partner for a difficult job.
Target: <<1>>이라는 이름의 도둑은 어려운 일을 함께할 파트너가 필요하다. 나는 그녀의 제안을 고려하기로 했다.

Source: I'll crack the puzzle and get the implements.
Target: I'll crack the puzzle and get the implements.

Source: I have some experience with this kind of thing. Can I talk to someone at the kinhouse?
Target: I have some experience with this kind of thing. Can I talk to someone at the kinhouse?

Source: I'll try to find the witch. And the axe.
Target: I'll try to find the witch. And the axe.

Source: I'll find you on the road outside Muth Gnaar after the deed is done.
Target: I'll find you on the road outside Muth Gnaar after the deed is done.

Source: I'll do this.
Target: I'll do this.

Source: What? Did you just wander up here like a lost mountain goat? This is Predator Mesa! The hunter's highland! Really? Nothing? Ziss'vo.\n\nHunters come here to test their claws against savage beasts—a trial of strength and cunning. But mostly strength.
Target: What? Did you just wander up here like a lost mountain goat? This is Predator Mesa! The hunter's highland! Really? Nothing? Ziss'vo.\n\nHunters come here to test their claws against savage beasts—a trial of strength and cunning. But mostly strength.

Source: Oh, forgive Tahara. Her worry gets the better of her.\n\nOne of my menagerie's most terrifying beasts escaped from its cage! I turned my back for only a moment to speak to an onlooker, you see? And pow! The monster burst free!
Target: Oh, forgive Tahara. Her worry gets the better of her.\n\nOne of my menagerie's most terrifying beasts escaped from its cage! I turned my back for only a moment to speak to an onlooker, you see? And pow! The monster burst free!

Source: An abduction, to be precise. No ransom, no demands. No obvious suspects or motives. Just a heartbroken father and a missing young lady.\n\nBut that is why Mizzik was hired, yes? He steps in when all other justice fails.
Target: An abduction, to be precise. No ransom, no demands. No obvious suspects or motives. Just a heartbroken father and a missing young lady.\n\nBut that is why Mizzik was hired, yes? He steps in when all other justice fails.

Source: My apologies. Kiseravi hoped you heard the spirit too.\n\nThe spirit protects Akaviri relics in the Tomb of the Serpents. She wants Kiseravi to share their secrets with the world, but the tomb is too dangerous. She won't let me leave without them.
Target: My apologies. Kiseravi hoped you heard the spirit too.\n\nThe spirit protects Akaviri relics in the Tomb of the Serpents. She wants Kiseravi to share their secrets with the world, but the tomb is too dangerous. She won't let me leave without them.

Source: An ancient mural called the Rithana-di-Renada, otherwise known as the Song of Kingdoms. It chronicles the time when Elsweyr was sixteen united kingdoms, working in harmony.\n\nUnfortunately, it was shattered when the kingdoms entered into conflict.
Target: An ancient mural called the Rithana-di-Renada, otherwise known as the Song of Kingdoms. It chronicles the time when Elsweyr was sixteen united kingdoms, working in harmony.\n\nUnfortunately, it was shattered when the kingdoms entered into conflict.

Source: The mural is called the Song of Kingdoms, yes? Legends say this because it plays a most beautiful song, representing the harmony of our people.\n\nAfter all, it is traditional for Khajiit to express themselves through music.
Target: The mural is called the Song of Kingdoms, yes? Legends say this because it plays a most beautiful song, representing the harmony of our people.\n\nAfter all, it is traditional for Khajiit to express themselves through music.

Source: Ah, yes. Mazdurr entered this den of vagrants with the most honorable of intentions. He only wished to share the wisdom of our Lady of Dusk and Dawn.\n\nThis is the unfortunate result.
Target: Ah, yes. Mazdurr entered this den of vagrants with the most honorable of intentions. He only wished to share the wisdom of our Lady of Dusk and Dawn.\n\nThis is the unfortunate result.

Source: The storytellers speak of the time of Dragons, and of the warriors who fought against them. These legends tell us of weapons imbued with the soul of a Daedra, and their effectiveness against the beasts.\n\nTo fight, we need Daedric souls.
Target: The storytellers speak of the time of Dragons, and of the warriors who fought against them. These legends tell us of weapons imbued with the soul of a Daedra, and their effectiveness against the beasts.\n\nTo fight, we need Daedric souls.

Source: I am an exile of the Tenarr Zalviit vampire clan. This wasteland has long been our home. Unforgiving, but we survived in peaceful seclusion through the wisdom of our Clan Mother. She is gone now and my clan strays down a treacherous path without her.
Target: I am an exile of the Tenarr Zalviit vampire clan. This wasteland has long been our home. Unforgiving, but we survived in peaceful seclusion through the wisdom of our Clan Mother. She is gone now and my clan strays down a treacherous path without her.

Source: <<1>> heard sounds of battle from the Worm Cult camp below <<2>>. She suspects the cultists attacked travelers, and suggested I try to aid one of their number named "<<3>>".
Target: <<1>> heard sounds of battle from the Worm Cult camp below <<2>>. She suspects the cultists attacked travelers, and suggested I try to aid one of their number named \\"<<3>>\"\"."

Source: I can try.
Target: I can try.

Source: I'll try to find him.
Target: I'll try to find him.

Source: Forge-Mother Alga, in the name of the mighty King Kurog, invites you to test your mettle in the wilds of majestic Wrothgar.\n\nTo begin your journey, find Ambassador Lazgara in one of the following cities: Daggerfall, Davon's Watch, or Vulkhel Guard.
Target: 위대한 왕 쿠로그의 전언 아래, 대장간대모 알가는 웅장한 로스가에서 당신의 용기를 시험하기 위해  초대했습니다.\n\n여행을 시작하려면 다음 도시에서 라즈가라 대사를 찾으십시오: 대거폴, 다본의 감시대, 벌켈 가드.

Source: My alliance is locked in an epic struggle for control of the Imperial City. The forces of Molag Bal hold the city in an iron grip, but enemy bannermen also vie for power. My alliance needs my help.
Target: 나의 동맹은 임페리얼 시티의 통치권을 두고 엄청난 분쟁에 휩싸여 있다. 몰라그 발(Molag Bal)의 힘은 도시를 강철과도 같이 움켜쥐고 있지만, 그들의 적인 기수들은 여전히 권력만을 위해 경쟁하고 있다. 동맹은 나의 도움을 필요로 한다.

Source: Very well. Give me the whistle.
Target: Very well. Give me the whistle.

Source: Right. I'll see if I can find this Nord.
Target: Right. I'll see if I can find this Nord.

Source: I will reclaim the skulls.
Target: I will reclaim the skulls.

Source: Look for a Dark Elf Scout by the mouth of the pass. I'll meet you there.
Target: Look for a Dark Elf Scout by the mouth of the pass. I'll meet you there.

Source: <<1>> and his brothers want to take revenge on the Vereansu for killing their father, who was afflicted with the Llodos plague and was being cared for by the monks of Muth Gnaar.
Target: <<1>> and his brothers want to take revenge on the Vereansu for killing their father, who was afflicted with the Llodos plague and was being cared for by the monks of Muth Gnaar.

Source: <Read the note>
Target: <Read the note>

Source: <Look closer.>
Target: <Look closer.>

Source: "I watched as Fadeel grew from a young colt into a proud stallion, and I have watched as Master Ozalan abused this noble creature, using him as a packhorse. I vowed that some day, I would buy Fadeel and set him free."
Target: \\"I watched as Fadeel grew from a young colt into a proud stallion
column4: and I have watched as Master Ozalan abused this noble creature
column5: using him as a packhorse. I vowed that some day
column6: I would buy Fadeel and set him free.\"\""

Source: The letter you carried. Zamarak must confess that he read it while you were recovering. This one has heard of Abnur Tharn. He is a battlemage and former advisor to the Emperor.\n\nHe seeks allies to stand against this rage of Dragons.
Target: The letter you carried. Zamarak must confess that he read it while you were recovering. This one has heard of Abnur Tharn. He is a battlemage and former advisor to the Emperor.\n\nHe seeks allies to stand against this rage of Dragons.

Source: Right to business, huh? Not even a "Hi, good to see you?" Fine, fine.\n\nAnyway, High Priestess Solgra needs our help. She wants us to work together on this. When you have a moment, you need to go see her.
Target: Right to business, huh? Not even a \\"Hi
column4: good to see you?\"\" Fine
column5: fine.\n\nAnyway
column6: High Priestess Solgra needs our help. She wants us to work together on this. When you have a moment
column7: you need to go see her."

Source: Our new recruits are eager for blood, but have seen little of the battlefield. They need the aid of an experienced warrior if ever they are to become true soldiers.\n\nA warrior such as yourself, yes?
Target: Our new recruits are eager for blood, but have seen little of the battlefield. They need the aid of an experienced warrior if ever they are to become true soldiers.\n\nA warrior such as yourself, yes?

Source: Our recruits sharpen their claws in the safety of camps, but few have seen the blood of battle. We need someone of true experience to prepare these soldiers for what lies ahead.
Target: Our recruits sharpen their claws in the safety of camps, but few have seen the blood of battle. We need someone of true experience to prepare these soldiers for what lies ahead.

Source: Yes! This one is lucky to have made it out alive.\n\nBut her companions, not so lucky. Iokkas sent Pahleena to seek aid. He wishes to research the fumes in order to make an antidote, but needs help to do so.
Target: Yes! This one is lucky to have made it out alive.\n\nBut her companions, not so lucky. Iokkas sent Pahleena to seek aid. He wishes to research the fumes in order to make an antidote, but needs help to do so.

Source: Though our new recruits are eager, they have had little practice in combat. As a warrior of experience, Zahari requests your aid in training our soldiers.
Target: Though our new recruits are eager, they have had little practice in combat. As a warrior of experience, Zahari requests your aid in training our soldiers.

Source: Yes. It's a little thing, but I could use some help. I know someone who's willing to pay for the return of their lost lute. A real music lover that one.
Target: Yes. It's a little thing, but I could use some help. I know someone who's willing to pay for the return of their lost lute. A real music lover that one.

Source: It just so happens I already have one. It involves distracting my half-sister with wit, charm, and words she barely comprehends. \n\nOh, and you. Euraxia never could resist a pretty face. You'll pretend to be my bodyguard and personal valet.
Target: It just so happens I already have one. It involves distracting my half-sister with wit, charm, and words she barely comprehends. \n\nOh, and you. Euraxia never could resist a pretty face. You'll pretend to be my bodyguard and personal valet.

Source: Many recruits have answered our call, but they are unskilled and untested. We are in desperate need for experienced warriors to show them the ways of battle.\n\nPerhaps you would be willing to help?
Target: Many recruits have answered our call, but they are unskilled and untested. We are in desperate need for experienced warriors to show them the ways of battle.\n\nPerhaps you would be willing to help?

Source: There is a sickness here. Namiira's dark litter, the dro-m'Athra, have taken the temple. These are the only survivors. Most are half-mad. It's the Zha'ja Lorkhaj—the Bent Dance. The rhythm beats the mind like a kettle drum. Difficult to watch, yes?
Target: There is a sickness here. Namiira's dark litter, the dro-m'Athra, have taken the temple. These are the only survivors. Most are half-mad. It's the Zha'ja Lorkhaj—the Bent Dance. The rhythm beats the mind like a kettle drum. Difficult to watch, yes?

Source: Many moons ago, the Nords fought their own battle against Dragons. They wrote many scrolls detailing these battles, ensuring their descendants would never lose such knowledge.\n\nOur legion would benefit greatly from these scrolls.
Target: Many moons ago, the Nords fought their own battle against Dragons. They wrote many scrolls detailing these battles, ensuring their descendants would never lose such knowledge.\n\nOur legion would benefit greatly from these scrolls.

Source: Lair of Maarselok. Some foul Dragon's taken up roost between Grahtwood and Elsweyr and he's turning the place into a pit of decay. He's more than the Wood Elves can handle, so how about you show them how the Undaunted handle a pesky Dragon?
Target: Lair of Maarselok. Some foul Dragon's taken up roost between Grahtwood and Elsweyr and he's turning the place into a pit of decay. He's more than the Wood Elves can handle, so how about you show them how the Undaunted handle a pesky Dragon?

Source: Moongrave Fane. Trailblazers saw a Dragon crash into the jungles of Southern Elsweyr and followed it to a long abandoned temple crawling with long-toothed cats. Khajiit vampires, actually. Sounds like they're going to have a scaly banquet. Wreck it.
Target: Moongrave Fane. Trailblazers saw a Dragon crash into the jungles of Southern Elsweyr and followed it to a long abandoned temple crawling with long-toothed cats. Khajiit vampires, actually. Sounds like they're going to have a scaly banquet. Wreck it.

Source: A Dragon, Maarselok, has made its lair on the other side of this mountain. I don't know why, but its presence is corrupting the wilderness in this valley and it's creeping farther with every passing day. Soon it'll reach the Green.
Target: A Dragon, Maarselok, has made its lair on the other side of this mountain. I don't know why, but its presence is corrupting the wilderness in this valley and it's creeping farther with every passing day. Soon it'll reach the Green.

Source: <A soft wind blows over Rakkhat's ashes revealing an ancient lunar talisman. This weathered relic likely belonged to Kulan-dro before his fall into madness.>
Target: <A soft wind blows over Rakkhat's ashes revealing an ancient lunar talisman. This weathered relic likely belonged to Kulan-dro before his fall into madness.>

Source: A clan of vampires with ambitions above their abilities. They convinced my dear comrade, Grundwulf, to help them capture a Dragon. They intend to drink its blood. Gain its power. If he goes through with this fool plan, it will be the end of him.
Target: A clan of vampires with ambitions above their abilities. They convinced my dear comrade, Grundwulf, to help them capture a Dragon. They intend to drink its blood. Gain its power. If he goes through with this fool plan, it will be the end of him.

Source: <A soft wind blows over Rakkhat's ashes revealing an ancient lunar talisman. This weathered relic likely belonged to Kulan-dro before his fall into madness.>
Target: <A soft wind blows over Rakkhat's ashes revealing an ancient lunar talisman. This weathered relic likely belonged to Kulan-dro before his fall into madness.>

Source: Long ago, the Nords also fought back against a Dragon invasion. They documented their battles in scrolls, which they then hid within their crypts.\n\nThose scrolls would greatly help the Khajiit prepare for our own battles.
Target: Long ago, the Nords also fought back against a Dragon invasion. They documented their battles in scrolls, which they then hid within their crypts.\n\nThose scrolls would greatly help the Khajiit prepare for our own battles.

Source: A long time ago, the Nords fought their own battle against Dragons. They wrote of their fighting techniques on many scrolls, and hid them within their crypts.\n\nThe knowledge in these scrolls could prove most useful for our legion.
Target: A long time ago, the Nords fought their own battle against Dragons. They wrote of their fighting techniques on many scrolls, and hid them within their crypts.\n\nThe knowledge in these scrolls could prove most useful for our legion.

Source: We need more farmhands. You see, our farmhands have gone missing lately. So we need more.
Target: We need more farmhands. You see, our farmhands have gone missing lately. So we need more.

Source: The former residents of the Hidden Moon Temple. They vanished centuries ago, but the ruins of their sanctuary remain.\n\nIf they managed to seal a lich like Arum-Khal away, they clearly possessed skills and techniques we can use.
Target: The former residents of the Hidden Moon Temple. They vanished centuries ago, but the ruins of their sanctuary remain.\n\nIf they managed to seal a lich like Arum-Khal away, they clearly possessed skills and techniques we can use.

Source: I told you before, Arum-Khal's phylactery felt different, somehow. Cavernous. Now I see, it wasn't a vessel. It was a gate to another realm. A realm of horror that he controls.\n\nThis Moonlight Blade serves as a gate, too. A door to the afterlife.
Target: I told you before, Arum-Khal's phylactery felt different, somehow. Cavernous. Now I see, it wasn't a vessel. It was a gate to another realm. A realm of horror that he controls.\n\nThis Moonlight Blade serves as a gate, too. A door to the afterlife.

Source: An undead awakening—as intense as it is unstable.\n\nThe corpses emerge in fits and starts, for now. But I can sense more stirring below. Hundreds more. If left unchecked, these creatures may spill out into larger Elsweyr. Perhaps even lands beyond.
Target: An undead awakening—as intense as it is unstable.\n\nThe corpses emerge in fits and starts, for now. But I can sense more stirring below. Hundreds more. If left unchecked, these creatures may spill out into larger Elsweyr. Perhaps even lands beyond.

Source: We have many eager soldiers in Elsweyr, but most have had little time to sharpen their claws. As an experienced warrior, we could use your help in training our recruits.
Target: We have many eager soldiers in Elsweyr, but most have had little time to sharpen their claws. As an experienced warrior, we could use your help in training our recruits.

Source: "The disadvantaged children of Orsinium require simple furnishings. Craft them, and deliver them to a writ turn-in site.\n\nI request you keep your charitable actions, and mine, in confidence." — R. H.
Target: \\"The disadvantaged children of Orsinium require simple furnishings. Craft them
column4: and deliver them to a writ turn-in site.\n\nI request you keep your charitable actions
column5: and mine

Source: Nothing specific. Not really. I guess this sense of worry will stay with me until I know the fate of Gharesh-ri, Zamarak … even Prefect Calo. I would return to the Moon Gate, but other matters require my attention.\n\nNamely, the envoy of the Mane.
Target: Nothing specific. Not really. I guess this sense of worry will stay with me until I know the fate of Gharesh-ri, Zamarak … even Prefect Calo. I would return to the Moon Gate, but other matters require my attention.\n\nNamely, the envoy of the Mane.

Source: Oh. Well then. Greetings! My name is Narama-ko, and I intend to walk right into this spooky cave and find the works of a brilliant Khajiiti mage.\n\nBefore you ask, yes, it is full of slavering undead. And yes, I am petrified to the point of weeping.
Target: Oh. Well then. Greetings! My name is Narama-ko, and I intend to walk right into this spooky cave and find the works of a brilliant Khajiiti mage.\n\nBefore you ask, yes, it is full of slavering undead. And yes, I am petrified to the point of weeping.

Source: The Vosh Rakh … they attacked our stronghold … crying for our blood in the name of Trinimac.\n\nThey came for the sacred words … the hidden sanctuary … but they made a mistake. They misinterpreted the blood rite that opens … the way.
Target: 보쉬 라크 ... 그들이 우리 요새를 공격했습니다 ... 트리니막의 이름으로 우리들의 피를 부르짖었죠.\n\n그들은  sacred words 때문에 왔습니다 ... 숨겨진 성역에 ... 하지만 그들을 실수를 범하고 말았습니다. 그들은 길을 여는 피의 의식을 잘못 해석 해버린겁니다.

Source: More like a summons, really. Comes from Abnur Tharn, who once advised Emperor Varen of Cyrodiil.\n\nHe wants to see you in Riverhold, in Northern Elsweyr. Said it involves the Khajiiti Defense Force and a rage of Dragons, if you can believe it.
Target: More like a summons, really. Comes from Abnur Tharn, who once advised Emperor Varen of Cyrodiil.\n\nHe wants to see you in Riverhold, in Northern Elsweyr. Said it involves the Khajiiti Defense Force and a rage of Dragons, if you can believe it.

Source: Absolutely nothing. And everything.\n\nHow would you like to help a humble Moth Priest and the Empress Regent herself with an urgent, even critical task?
Target: Absolutely nothing. And everything.\n\nHow would you like to help a humble Moth Priest and the Empress Regent herself with an urgent, even critical task?

Source: So much better than flock or herd, don't you think?\n\nThe Khajiiti Defense Force isn't prepared to deal with a threat as big as Dragons. Especially since they were in the process of trying to liberate Rimmen when the great creatures arrived.
Target: So much better than flock or herd, don't you think?\n\nThe Khajiiti Defense Force isn't prepared to deal with a threat as big as Dragons. Especially since they were in the process of trying to liberate Rimmen when the great creatures arrived.

Source: A bloody Dragon swept through here recently. Can you believe that? Burned out a decent chunk of the Prowl, and ate up the animals too. Now, a flock of poachers have moved in to kill the few beasts we have left!\n\nWe could really use some help.
Target: A bloody Dragon swept through here recently. Can you believe that? Burned out a decent chunk of the Prowl, and ate up the animals too. Now, a flock of poachers have moved in to kill the few beasts we have left!\n\nWe could really use some help.

Source: <This is a piece of the Serpent's Apex Stone.>
Target: <This is a piece of the Serpent's Apex Stone.>

Source: The Mages Guild has sent a search party into Elden Hollow where the mage Bakkhara was last seen. She was thought lost to dark magic within the Hollow. Bakkhara's brother, Kargand, leads this new expedition, and refuses to give up on his sister.
Target: The Mages Guild has sent a search party into Elden Hollow where the mage Bakkhara was last seen. She was thought lost to dark magic within the Hollow. Bakkhara's brother, Kargand, leads this new expedition, and refuses to give up on his sister.

Source: Sneak up on you? It's what I do. Now, what are you doing here?
Target: Sneak up on you? It's what I do. Now, what are you doing here?

Source: <<1>> ordered me to rescue civilians trapped in the Trade Hall and the Mages Guild.\n\nThe Redguards and the Drublog Wood Orc clan attacked. They're everywhere, and we scattered. Even the captain's missing.
Target: <<1>> ordered me to rescue civilians trapped in the Trade Hall and the Mages Guild.\n\nThe Redguards and the Drublog Wood Orc clan attacked. They're everywhere, and we scattered. Even the captain's missing.

Source: The Blessed Crucible is a dangerous, but profitable place to make your fortune. As it happens, I have some coin to wager, but I've been waiting for a group of competitors that are worth the risk. You look to fit the bill.
Target: The Blessed Crucible is a dangerous, but profitable place to make your fortune. As it happens, I have some coin to wager, but I've been waiting for a group of competitors that are worth the risk. You look to fit the bill.

Source: True enough, you don't look like a Houndsman.\n\nWe used to have a regular influx of pilgrims to <<1>> to pray at the shrine of the Green Lady. That is, until recently.
Target: True enough, you don't look like a Houndsman.\n\nWe used to have a regular influx of pilgrims to <<1>> to pray at the shrine of the Green Lady. That is, until recently.

Source: Lyrrsazhi has a message for you, five-claw. Queen Khamira wants you to attend her in Rimmen Palace immediately.\n\nNow, this one isn't certain of all the details, but she heard something about a Dragonhorn. You discovered that, didn't you?
Target: Lyrrsazhi has a message for you, five-claw. Queen Khamira wants you to attend her in Rimmen Palace immediately.\n\nNow, this one isn't certain of all the details, but she heard something about a Dragonhorn. You discovered that, didn't you?

Source: <The shipwreck dislodged a chest buried underneath the sand.  Inside the chest, you find a sealed letter and a shovel.>
Target: <The shipwreck dislodged a chest buried underneath the sand.  Inside the chest, you find a sealed letter and a shovel.>

Source: As soon as Rigurt returned home from successful diplomatic endeavoring, the Skald-King sent him to Elsweyr with gifts for the cats. Rigurt is always given the most important, most far away missions.\n\nProblem is, Rigurt lost the gifts.
Target: As soon as Rigurt returned home from successful diplomatic endeavoring, the Skald-King sent him to Elsweyr with gifts for the cats. Rigurt is always given the most important, most far away missions.\n\nProblem is, Rigurt lost the gifts.

Source: Quest is starting now.
Target: 퀘스트 지금 시작됩니다.

Source: Resting my twisted ankle. I was sent to Mournhold to get help for Master Raston, but an alit chased me into the swamp. Stupid alit.\n\nPlease, go to our trading post and speak to Tevynni Hadran. She could really use your help.
Target: Resting my twisted ankle. I was sent to Mournhold to get help for Master Raston, but an alit chased me into the swamp. Stupid alit.\n\nPlease, go to our trading post and speak to Tevynni Hadran. She could really use your help.

Source: "This voucher provides the bearer with one cake for special occasions from the renowned baker, Chef Donolon."
Target: \\"This voucher provides the bearer with one cake for special occasions from the renowned baker
column4: Chef Donolon.\"\""

Source: Well, to be specific, Lyrrsazhi was told to watch for you exactly. To deliver a message.\n\nThe fragrant Abnur Tharn demands your presence in the war council. You know, Riverhold's K'har Zhab Hall. Trouble is coming. This one can feel it in her tail!
Target: Well, to be specific, Lyrrsazhi was told to watch for you exactly. To deliver a message.\n\nThe fragrant Abnur Tharn demands your presence in the war council. You know, Riverhold's K'har Zhab Hall. Trouble is coming. This one can feel it in her tail!

Source: Take the Staff of Arkay, a potent weapon against undead. You must first charge the staff, then use it to destroy the foul abominations summoned by these necromancers.
Target: Take the Staff of Arkay, a potent weapon against undead. You must first charge the staff, then use it to destroy the foul abominations summoned by these necromancers.

Source: Bloodthorn Cult. They're raising zombies all over the graveyard. I'm here to keep the people out until War Chief Tazgol arrives and crushes them all.
Target: Bloodthorn Cult. They're raising zombies all over the graveyard. I'm here to keep the people out until War Chief Tazgol arrives and crushes them all.

Source: Oh, not this one, five-claw. Lyrrsazhi is only the messenger. A sad state of affairs for a master spy, but we must do what we must do.\n\nQueen Khamira requests your presence in Rimmen Palace. What a wonder, a Khajiit once again on the Anequina throne!
Target: Oh, not this one, five-claw. Lyrrsazhi is only the messenger. A sad state of affairs for a master spy, but we must do what we must do.\n\nQueen Khamira requests your presence in Rimmen Palace. What a wonder, a Khajiit once again on the Anequina throne!

Source: Thank the Moons. We hid our most valuable items before the Worm Cult arrived, but there's no one to retrieve them.\n\nWon't be long before they burn this temple down around us. Please. If you can find the artifacts—take them to Orthuna, our handler.
Target: Thank the Moons. We hid our most valuable items before the Worm Cult arrived, but there's no one to retrieve them.\n\nWon't be long before they burn this temple down around us. Please. If you can find the artifacts—take them to Orthuna, our handler.

Source: No, no I jumped out.\n\nSay, I know this is a little sudden, but are you looking to make a bit of gold? Meet me at the Sugar Bowl here in Rimmen. Got some business that might interest you.
Target: No, no I jumped out.\n\nSay, I know this is a little sudden, but are you looking to make a bit of gold? Meet me at the Sugar Bowl here in Rimmen. Got some business that might interest you.

Source: My ship may be a pile of driftwood, but my crew's alive, and Captain Helane has them. I won't leave without them.\n\nHelp me rescue my crew and I'll help you with Kaleen's heist.
Target: My ship may be a pile of driftwood, but my crew's alive, and Captain Helane has them. I won't leave without them.\n\nHelp me rescue my crew and I'll help you with Kaleen's heist.

Source: Just so, sleek one, just so. You walk tall, with the heavy footfalls that signify an abundance of pride and gold.\n\nUnless you wish to keep low and beneath notice, like Humble Zaham, there is a price to be paid. Willingly or not.
Target: Just so, sleek one, just so. You walk tall, with the heavy footfalls that signify an abundance of pride and gold.\n\nUnless you wish to keep low and beneath notice, like Humble Zaham, there is a price to be paid. Willingly or not.

Source: <Keep reading.>
Target: <계속 읽는다.>

Source: Chief Tazgol doesn't see the danger. The Bloodthorns are after an ancient Ayleid weapon that we know nothing about. We must catch up to Tazgol and stop him from rushing in!
Target: Chief Tazgol doesn't see the danger. The Bloodthorns are after an ancient Ayleid weapon that we know nothing about. We must catch up to Tazgol and stop him from rushing in!

Source: It seems a rowdy necromancer named Na'ruzz the Boneweaver has claimed the Bone Pits near Orcrest. It's not the first time, walker. Na'ruzz clings to that gulch like the Dagis cling to trees.\n\nAnyway, we need him dead. No surprise there, eh?
Target: It seems a rowdy necromancer named Na'ruzz the Boneweaver has claimed the Bone Pits near Orcrest. It's not the first time, walker. Na'ruzz clings to that gulch like the Dagis cling to trees.\n\nAnyway, we need him dead. No surprise there, eh?

Source: "My name is <<1>>. My restless and reckless nature led me to this place ….\n\n"I don't have long to live …. I'm not afraid, but I do have one sorrow. The amulet my mother gave me was lost when the snake delivered the poison that's now killing me."
Target: \\"My name is <<1>>. My restless and reckless nature led me to this place ….\n\n\"\"I don't have long to live …. I'm not afraid
column4: but I do have one sorrow. The amulet my mother gave me was lost when the snake delivered the poison that's now killing me.\"\""

Source: Old Ri'hirr hears tell that an ancient dro-m'Athra named Zalsheem reappeared in the Hidden Moon shrine near Predator Mesa.\n\nA handful of Twilight Cantors banished her centuries ago, but evil spirits like Zalsheem never stay gone for long.
Target: Old Ri'hirr hears tell that an ancient dro-m'Athra named Zalsheem reappeared in the Hidden Moon shrine near Predator Mesa.\n\nA handful of Twilight Cantors banished her centuries ago, but evil spirits like Zalsheem never stay gone for long.

Source: Captain Rama has fled Cumberland's Watch. \n\nHis comrades' blood is on his hands. He must be brought to justice for his crimes.
Target: Captain Rama has fled Cumberland's Watch. \n\nHis comrades' blood is on his hands. He must be brought to justice for his crimes.

Source: <This book about Vaemina glows with an inner light. Some kind of reaction to the intruding Daedric realm.>
Target: <This book about Vaemina glows with an inner light. Some kind of reaction to the intruding Daedric realm.>

Source: Yes, walker. A terror bird needs killing.\n\nThe Baandari call her Wily Kee'va, on account of her cleverness. Old Ri'hirr likes his birds slow and stupid. Kee'va, unfortunately, is neither. Now she's taken to thieving—rustling camels near Scar's End.
Target: Yes, walker. A terror bird needs killing.\n\nThe Baandari call her Wily Kee'va, on account of her cleverness. Old Ri'hirr likes his birds slow and stupid. Kee'va, unfortunately, is neither. Now she's taken to thieving—rustling camels near Scar's End.

Source: The message is short and to the point. Queen Khamira requires your presence at Rimmen Palace, posthaste.\n\nOf course, Lyrrsazhi can elaborate, provided you are interested.
Target: The message is short and to the point. Queen Khamira requires your presence at Rimmen Palace, posthaste.\n\nOf course, Lyrrsazhi can elaborate, provided you are interested.

Source: You might not look like a Houndsman, but I don't trust you. I don't know who to trust any longer.\n\nGood thing the pilgrims stopped coming to pray at <<1>>'s shrine to the Green Lady.
Target: You might not look like a Houndsman, but I don't trust you. I don't know who to trust any longer.\n\nGood thing the pilgrims stopped coming to pray at <<1>>'s shrine to the Green Lady.

Source: Yeah. A Goutfang master fled an adeptorium, taking scrolls. The Khajiit want the scrolls back. Badly. They also want this pariah, as they call the master, dead.\n\nIf you find out what this pariah did, let me know.
Target: Yeah. A Goutfang master fled an adeptorium, taking scrolls. The Khajiit want the scrolls back. Badly. They also want this pariah, as they call the master, dead.\n\nIf you find out what this pariah did, let me know.

Source: Sounds good. I'm in.
Target: 괜찮은 것 같아. 내가 네 파트너가 될게.

Source: An insufferable Akaviri swordmistress, Vhysradue, planted her flag on the Hill of Shattered Swords about a century back. We thought she'd pass of old age eventually, but she's still up there, gloating and spitting challenges at anyone who wanders by.
Target: An insufferable Akaviri swordmistress, Vhysradue, planted her flag on the Hill of Shattered Swords about a century back. We thought she'd pass of old age eventually, but she's still up there, gloating and spitting challenges at anyone who wanders by.

Source: The Watch soldiers threw me in here just before the Goblins attacked. You've got to help me!
Target: The Watch soldiers threw me in here just before the Goblins attacked. You've got to help me!

Source: Hadamnargo prefers to remain positive, so he thinks of it as more of a pest opportunity. Wasps are nesting in his fields, but he can't get rid of them because he's busy consoling his horse over our lost guar, Gordon.\n\nThis is a very sensitive horse.
Target: Hadamnargo prefers to remain positive, so he thinks of it as more of a pest opportunity. Wasps are nesting in his fields, but he can't get rid of them because he's busy consoling his horse over our lost guar, Gordon.\n\nThis is a very sensitive horse.

Source: A traveler, eh? Then welcome to <<1>>.\n\nPilgrims like you came from all over Valenwood to pray at the shrine of the Green Lady before. Not many lately, though.
Target: A traveler, eh? Then welcome to <<1>>.\n\nPilgrims like you came from all over Valenwood to pray at the shrine of the Green Lady before. Not many lately, though.

Source: <Keep reading.>
Target: <계속 읽는다.>

Source: What does Sheogorath always want? I am the Mad Star! The Mad God! Ironically, I'm actually quite happy.\n\nBut I'm neither here nor anywhere. All that matters at the moment is infusing some entertainment into this dreadfully dull bloodshed.
Target: What does Sheogorath always want? I am the Mad Star! The Mad God! Ironically, I'm actually quite happy.\n\nBut I'm neither here nor anywhere. All that matters at the moment is infusing some entertainment into this dreadfully dull bloodshed.

Source: Yes, walker! Divine Alkosh has returned to this perch to call the Khajiit who have strayed back to him! Though any who hear his word and obey are welcome here.
Target: Yes, walker! Divine Alkosh has returned to this perch to call the Khajiit who have strayed back to him! Though any who hear his word and obey are welcome here.

Source: "Thane Fjora,\n\n"I pray this reaches you in time. Strangers recently visited our farm. Helgith glimpsed a charm bearing the sigil of the Worm Cult. We've seen it on the official warnings from Riften."
Target: \\"Thane Fjora
column4: \n\n\"\"I pray this reaches you in time. Strangers recently visited our farm. Helgith glimpsed a charm bearing the sigil of the Worm Cult. We've seen it on the official warnings from Riften.\"\""

Source: It's <<1>>! She's tricked me in the last four Boasts! She always gets the better of me. This year I want to best her, and I know just how to do it. She's obsessed with Khajiiti puzzle boxes. I saw one in Yanabir's tent ….
Target: It's <<1>>! She's tricked me in the last four Boasts! She always gets the better of me. This year I want to best her, and I know just how to do it. She's obsessed with Khajiiti puzzle boxes. I saw one in Yanabir's tent ….

Source: Yes, but Gharesh-ri's scouts report that they're on their way. Our parley seems to have aroused Euraxia's anger.\n\nWhat remains of Elsweyr's militia has taken up positions around town, but I fear they are too few in number. They need your help.
Target: Yes, but Gharesh-ri's scouts report that they're on their way. Our parley seems to have aroused Euraxia's anger.\n\nWhat remains of Elsweyr's militia has taken up positions around town, but I fear they are too few in number. They need your help.

Source: At the moment, I'm fishing. I was sent to Selfora to get help for Master Raston, but it seems Selfora has problems of its own.  \n\nIf you're not doing anything, go to our trading post and speak to Tevynni Hadran. She could really use your help.
Target: At the moment, I'm fishing. I was sent to Selfora to get help for Master Raston, but it seems Selfora has problems of its own.  \n\nIf you're not doing anything, go to our trading post and speak to Tevynni Hadran. She could really use your help.

Source: Some, but not a lot. Luckily, we anticipated the connection to the Moon Gate and sent Gharesh-ri ahead with whatever forces we could spare—which was not as much as I would like. \n\nI just wish we had something else to fall back on.
Target: Some, but not a lot. Luckily, we anticipated the connection to the Moon Gate and sent Gharesh-ri ahead with whatever forces we could spare—which was not as much as I would like. \n\nI just wish we had something else to fall back on.

Source: I'm going to Dra'bul, the Wood Orcs' nearest settlement. If <<1>> arrives, I'll send him on ahead.\n\nWhen you can, I'd appreciate your help in Dra'bul. You have a spear in this pig too, since you fought the Drublog here.
Target: I'm going to Dra'bul, the Wood Orcs' nearest settlement. If <<1>> arrives, I'll send him on ahead.\n\nWhen you can, I'd appreciate your help in Dra'bul. You have a spear in this pig too, since you fought the Drublog here.

Source: Nisuzi's clan often travels by lantern-light. Easier to avoid robbers and pesky guards at night, yes?\n\nIn the past, we fueled our lamps with oil from Darkpool Mine—a cavern to the southwest. But now, we must give it a wide berth.
Target: Nisuzi's clan often travels by lantern-light. Easier to avoid robbers and pesky guards at night, yes?\n\nIn the past, we fueled our lamps with oil from Darkpool Mine—a cavern to the southwest. But now, we must give it a wide berth.

Source: No, no. The Grave is the prison in that cave ahead. Jakarn described it as a ghastly place. Traps block the exit and most criminals roam freely inside. \n\nBhosek accused him of stealing a gem and this Orc monster threw him in.
Target: No, no. The Grave is the prison in that cave ahead. Jakarn described it as a ghastly place. Traps block the exit and most criminals roam freely inside. \n\nBhosek accused him of stealing a gem and this Orc monster threw him in.

Source: My shiny ancestor here. We got along fine when he was ashes in an urn, but something stirred his spirit, and now he won't leave me alone. He says Saviwa spends too much time drinking and napping. As if there's something better to spend time on.
Target: My shiny ancestor here. We got along fine when he was ashes in an urn, but something stirred his spirit, and now he won't leave me alone. He says Saviwa spends too much time drinking and napping. As if there's something better to spend time on.

Source: What do I not need help with?\n\nWe had a shrine to Azura here, but the Supernal Dreamers came and killed everyone, defiled the shrine, and stole our relics. I just want to get the relics back and take them to Pariah Abbey.
Target: What do I not need help with?\n\nWe had a shrine to Azura here, but the Supernal Dreamers came and killed everyone, defiled the shrine, and stole our relics. I just want to get the relics back and take them to Pariah Abbey.

Source: As you can see, I put together a proper expedition this time, including a translator who was supposed to secure us safe passage through Goblin territory. He's made little headway, so it's your turn to clear our path to Frostvault.
Target: As you can see, I put together a proper expedition this time, including a translator who was supposed to secure us safe passage through Goblin territory. He's made little headway, so it's your turn to clear our path to Frostvault.

Source: <<1>>. That's where the chieftain sent our warriors to lie in wait.\n\nIf the Silvenar's held by our clan, he will be there.
Target: <<1>>. That's where the chieftain sent our warriors to lie in wait.\n\nIf the Silvenar's held by our clan, he will be there.

Source: A wondrous thing! A true miracle! The Dragon King of Cats, Alkosh incarnate, has descended on the temple to lead his stray kin back to the righteous path! Will you heed his call?
Target: A wondrous thing! A true miracle! The Dragon King of Cats, Alkosh incarnate, has descended on the temple to lead his stray kin back to the righteous path! Will you heed his call?

Source: Master Raston went into the Mabrigash camp and never returned. He wanted to open trade negotiations with the tribe, but I think something went wrong. He's been gone so long!\n\nWhat did he expect in a place called the Vale of the Ghost Snake?
Target: Master Raston went into the Mabrigash camp and never returned. He wanted to open trade negotiations with the tribe, but I think something went wrong. He's been gone so long!\n\nWhat did he expect in a place called the Vale of the Ghost Snake?

Source: <Teeth from the false Alkosh lay strewn about from from our battle. I should take them to Bishop Azin-jo as proof of the heretic Dragon's defeat.>
Target: <Teeth from the false Alkosh lay strewn about from from our battle. I should take them to Bishop Azin-jo as proof of the heretic Dragon's defeat.>

Source: <I cut the lying tongue from the false Alkosh after our battle. I should take it to Bishop Azin-jo as proof of the heretic Dragon's defeat.>
Target: <I cut the lying tongue from the false Alkosh after our battle. I should take it to Bishop Azin-jo as proof of the heretic Dragon's defeat.>

Source: Maybe. Can you get up there and stop whatever they're doing? They can't be up to any good.
Target: Maybe. Can you get up there and stop whatever they're doing? They can't be up to any good.

Source:
"We dedicate this site to Z'en and will begin the stonework for the shrine immediately.

"With luck, we will find the missing histories. May our toil be rewarded in kind!

" - Spinner Sandaerion"
Target: \\"We dedicate this site to Z'en and will begin the stonework for the shrine immediately.\n\n\"\"With luck
column4: we will find the missing histories. May our toil be rewarded in kind!\n\n\"\" - Spinner Sandaerion\"\""

Source: I did. And I will again, once Lodorr is destroyed. Will you help me?
Target: I did. And I will again, once Lodorr is destroyed. Will you help me?

Source: Ah, she's gone to talk some sense into the Drublog Orcs. If anyone can do it, it's her.\n\nSay, weren't you the one helping out in Velyn Harbor? She said to send you on in if you passed by.
Target: Ah, she's gone to talk some sense into the Drublog Orcs. If anyone can do it, it's her.\n\nSay, weren't you the one helping out in Velyn Harbor? She said to send you on in if you passed by.

Source: Part of me hopes that all we find are a bunch of old crates that nobody cares about. But I've got one of those feelings. And I'm pretty sure it involves the Maulborn.
Target: Part of me hopes that all we find are a bunch of old crates that nobody cares about. But I've got one of those feelings. And I'm pretty sure it involves the Maulborn.

Source: My husband <<1>> ate too many moon-sugar candies. He started babbling to himself, then ran into the forest screaming, "This one likes Bosmer! Plants are best friends!"\n\nI said he'd eat himself sick, but would he listen? No! Typical cat.
Target: My husband <<1>> ate too many moon-sugar candies. He started babbling to himself, then ran into the forest screaming, \\"This one likes Bosmer! Plants are best friends!\"\"\n\nI said he'd eat himself sick
column4: but would he listen? No! Typical cat."

Source: Musty old crypts do not frighten you, do they? No no no, of course not!\n\nWe need a five-clawed warrior to settle some business in the Tomb of the Serpents. Nisuzi's clan often plucks Akaviri snake-man relics from this tomb. Good for trading, you see?
Target: Musty old crypts do not frighten you, do they? No no no, of course not!\n\nWe need a five-clawed warrior to settle some business in the Tomb of the Serpents. Nisuzi's clan often plucks Akaviri snake-man relics from this tomb. Good for trading, you see?

Source: I have a heist planned, a big one. Anyone who helps is going to be rich.\n\nBut I need people who aren't local, who aren't in the pocket of Headman Bhosek. Still interested?
Target: I have a heist planned, a big one. Anyone who helps is going to be rich.\n\nBut I need people who aren't local, who aren't in the pocket of Headman Bhosek. Still interested?

Source: We Baandari indulge in many passions, walker. Song, dancing, sweet foods, stories …. But a cup of strong tea makes all these things better, yes?\n\nNisuzi knows a place called the Tangle, where precious tea shrubs grow thick as senche manes!
Target: We Baandari indulge in many passions, walker. Song, dancing, sweet foods, stories …. But a cup of strong tea makes all these things better, yes?\n\nNisuzi knows a place called the Tangle, where precious tea shrubs grow thick as senche manes!

Source: They are a dreadful people. From the Worm Cult, I believe.\n\nThey destroyed numerous priceless artifacts, ruined decor, killed my employees. Then turned my employees into their employees by raising them as undead!
Target: They are a dreadful people. From the Worm Cult, I believe.\n\nThey destroyed numerous priceless artifacts, ruined decor, killed my employees. Then turned my employees into their employees by raising them as undead!

Source: Baan Dar teaches us to be clever and swift, but wise most of all. Wisdom means foresight, yes? And no one peers into the future like a Baandari soothsayer.\n\nThe Moons have much to tell us, but we need bijous and talismans to hear their truth.
Target: Baan Dar teaches us to be clever and swift, but wise most of all. Wisdom means foresight, yes? And no one peers into the future like a Baandari soothsayer.\n\nThe Moons have much to tell us, but we need bijous and talismans to hear their truth.

Source: Damn it. Without reinforcements Fort Grimwatch has fallen. And not from assault by an army. We were taken from within by Dro-m'Athra spirits! It was the Mane that let them loose!
Target: Damn it. Without reinforcements Fort Grimwatch has fallen. And not from assault by an army. We were taken from within by Dro-m'Athra spirits! It was the Mane that let them loose!

Source: Hmm. You will think us superstitious. Maybe you are superstitious, too?\n\nWe give thanks to Baan Dar for our quick wits and swiftness, but sometimes, strong claws and sharp senses serve us better. For those things, we call on the Hungry Cat. Hircine.
Target: Hmm. You will think us superstitious. Maybe you are superstitious, too?\n\nWe give thanks to Baan Dar for our quick wits and swiftness, but sometimes, strong claws and sharp senses serve us better. For those things, we call on the Hungry Cat. Hircine.

Source: Yet he managed to offend and insult nearly everyone. My visions tell me that you will decide this man's fate, as well as the fate of my tribe. \n\nYou will walk the Coiled Path and seek counsel with the Ghost Snake.
Target: Yet he managed to offend and insult nearly everyone. My visions tell me that you will decide this man's fate, as well as the fate of my tribe. \n\nYou will walk the Coiled Path and seek counsel with the Ghost Snake.

Source: Now, this one isn't supposed to know such things, but what kind of spy would Lyrrsazhi be if she didn't stick her nose in council business from time to time?\n\nThis one heard the Speaker and the Tharn. They discussed a direct assault on Rimmen.
Target: Now, this one isn't supposed to know such things, but what kind of spy would Lyrrsazhi be if she didn't stick her nose in council business from time to time?\n\nThis one heard the Speaker and the Tharn. They discussed a direct assault on Rimmen.

Source: Thank the Moons. We hid our most valuable items before the Worm Cult arrived, but there's no one to retrieve them.\n\nWon't be long before they burn this temple down around us. Please. If you can find the artifacts—take them to Orthuna, our handler.
Target: Thank the Moons. We hid our most valuable items before the Worm Cult arrived, but there's no one to retrieve them.\n\nWon't be long before they burn this temple down around us. Please. If you can find the artifacts—take them to Orthuna, our handler.

Source: It concerns Euraxia's soldiers. Nisuzi's cousin, Hatha, says that many of these unclawed, soft-headed brutes gather in the Desert Wind Caverns.\n\nThey mean to pick the place clean—to claim all our people's wisdom. For them, nothing is sacred!
Target: It concerns Euraxia's soldiers. Nisuzi's cousin, Hatha, says that many of these unclawed, soft-headed brutes gather in the Desert Wind Caverns.\n\nThey mean to pick the place clean—to claim all our people's wisdom. For them, nothing is sacred!

Source: Abnur Tharn demands your presence in the war council. You know, K'har Zhab Hall. In Riverhold. \n\nTrouble is coming, five-claw. This one can feel it in her tail!
Target: Abnur Tharn demands your presence in the war council. You know, K'har Zhab Hall. In Riverhold. \n\nTrouble is coming, five-claw. This one can feel it in her tail!

Source: Everything is wrong! My friend Marthine entered this flu-ridden city to recruit followers for Peryite, but he hasn't returned. I fear the diseased beasts inside have devoured him like a massive scab.\n\nPlease tell me you can help.
Target: Everything is wrong! My friend Marthine entered this flu-ridden city to recruit followers for Peryite, but he hasn't returned. I fear the diseased beasts inside have devoured him like a massive scab.\n\nPlease tell me you can help.

Source: How should Khali know? Look, this one knows a few spells. Can't have known my sister as long as I have without picking up a few things. Other than a few incantations, though, Khali leaves the heavy thinking to Shazah.
Target: How should Khali know? Look, this one knows a few spells. Can't have known my sister as long as I have without picking up a few things. Other than a few incantations, though, Khali leaves the heavy thinking to Shazah.

Source: I'm glad you wish to help. We need valiant folk to slow down the spread of Dragons.\n\nIt is regrettable enough that they're causing suffering here. Let's try to prevent that from happening outside Elsweyr, as well.
Target: I'm glad you wish to help. We need valiant folk to slow down the spread of Dragons.\n\nIt is regrettable enough that they're causing suffering here. Let's try to prevent that from happening outside Elsweyr, as well.

Source: This crystal, take it. The Pact has unloaded arcane cargo all around the cove.\n\nSimply touch the crystal to the cargo. The results should be … impressive.
Target: This crystal, take it. The Pact has unloaded arcane cargo all around the cove.\n\nSimply touch the crystal to the cargo. The results should be … impressive.

Source: Auri-El protect you. Before he died, this bastard told me she's held in some ruins.\n\nTake this note and this elixir of invisibility. The note holds everything I learned from this scum. The elixir's for Palith.
Target: Auri-El protect you. Before he died, this bastard told me she's held in some ruins.\n\nTake this note and this elixir of invisibility. The note holds everything I learned from this scum. The elixir's for Palith.

Source: Help? Sounds good to me, but I'm not in charge here.\n\nThe House leaders are probably bickering in the kinhouse even as we speak. Talk to one of them if you really want to get involved in this mess.
Target: Help? Sounds good to me, but I'm not in charge here.\n\nThe House leaders are probably bickering in the kinhouse even as we speak. Talk to one of them if you really want to get involved in this mess.

Source: Oh, fancy. Look, don't believe me? Go talk to Tanion, the headmaster. Ask that smug son of a bitch what this place is really like. Maybe someone with the Queen's ear can get a real look at this hole.
Target: Oh, fancy. Look, don't believe me? Go talk to Tanion, the headmaster. Ask that smug son of a bitch what this place is really like. Maybe someone with the Queen's ear can get a real look at this hole.

Source: Their names are Hilka, Hald, and Fjar. They were taken off to be interrogated.\n\nFind out which one is the traitor and free the others—there should be interrogation transcripts up ahead. Leave the traitor to die. I'll meet you further up the hill.
Target: Their names are Hilka, Hald, and Fjar. They were taken off to be interrogated.\n\nFind out which one is the traitor and free the others—there should be interrogation transcripts up ahead. Leave the traitor to die. I'll meet you further up the hill.

Source: Exactly! Up at the manse. He's eager to discuss all the things you'll do on your visit to Skywatch. Should be a lot of fun.\n\nEnjoy your time in the city.
Target: Exactly! Up at the manse. He's eager to discuss all the things you'll do on your visit to Skywatch. Should be a lot of fun.\n\nEnjoy your time in the city.

Source: Before they were ambushed, my team identified three high-ranking Bretons in the camp: Senior Scout Justal, Ranger Menoit, and Commander Derre. Taking them out will give me enough time to return with reinforcements.
Target: Before they were ambushed, my team identified three high-ranking Bretons in the camp: Senior Scout Justal, Ranger Menoit, and Commander Derre. Taking them out will give me enough time to return with reinforcements.

Source: Maybe, but they've taken over the whole town. If you decide to help, talk to Tamien Sellan. You can find him at the inn.\n\nJust don't do anything to call attention to yourself and the Red Rooks should let you wander around in peace.
Target: Maybe, but they've taken over the whole town. If you decide to help, talk to Tamien Sellan. You can find him at the inn.\n\nJust don't do anything to call attention to yourself and the Red Rooks should let you wander around in peace.

Source: Can I try the weapons?
Target: Can I try the weapons?

Source: How do I win?
Target: 어떻게 이길수 있지?

Target: I'll go speak with her.

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Source: What I always do! I'm exploring! I'm kind of an expert dungeon-delver. Sort of.\n\nMy brother and I answered the king's summons and here we are, cataloging another Dwarven ruin. Hey, where is my brother? Is he still afraid of the mechanical spiders?
Target: What I always do! I'm exploring! I'm kind of an expert dungeon-delver. Sort of.\n\nMy brother and I answered the king's summons and here we are, cataloging another Dwarven ruin. Hey, where is my brother? Is he still afraid of the mechanical spiders?

Source: Word came in the dreugh were attacking the district of Dreughside. \n\nSergeant Stegine led us out of Wayrest to investigate. We found dreugh attacking citizens, and citizens fighting back. Madness!
Target: Word came in the dreugh were attacking the district of Dreughside. \n\nSergeant Stegine led us out of Wayrest to investigate. We found dreugh attacking citizens, and citizens fighting back. Madness!

Source: Well, there are some chests around the camp. Used to be property of my masters. What's inside is too important to fall into the hands of these scavangers, though.\n\nSadly, I can't get to the keys. That would look too suspicious.
Target: Well, there are some chests around the camp. Used to be property of my masters. What's inside is too important to fall into the hands of these scavangers, though.\n\nSadly, I can't get to the keys. That would look too suspicious.

Source: No, of course not. That would have been too easy.\n\nThis is what I get for hiring a tuskless runt! He said he could "improve efficiency" in Graystone Quarry. What did we get for our trouble? First the fog. Then the screams. Then … nothing.
Target: 오, 물론 아니겠지. 그건 정말 쉬울뻔 했어.\n\n이게 바로 내가 엄니가 없는 난장이를 고용하는 이유이지! 그는 그레이스톤 채석장의 \\"효율성을 높일수 있다\"\"라고 말했었어. 우리가 무슨 문제들이 생긴지 아나? 처음엔 안개. 그런 다음 비명들. 그리고 ... 아무것도 남지 않았어."

Source: I usually leave the dirty tricks to Sylvian, but I can't pass this up. I've been given a spice that will cause all sorts of trouble if added to the Imperials' food. Willing to make some Imperials sick?
Target: I usually leave the dirty tricks to Sylvian, but I can't pass this up. I've been given a spice that will cause all sorts of trouble if added to the Imperials' food. Willing to make some Imperials sick?

Source: I oversee an ore mine behind the village. The Goblins we employ started a labor dispute. Now some of my best workers are trapped inside.\n\nNormally the Goblins are easy to control, but now that they have their <<1>> they think they're unstoppable.
Target: I oversee an ore mine behind the village. The Goblins we employ started a labor dispute. Now some of my best workers are trapped inside.\n\nNormally the Goblins are easy to control, but now that they have their <<1>> they think they're unstoppable.

Source: Ah, an inquisitive sort! I like it!\n\nI'm searching for a Nord beast-master named Nikolvara. My contacts tell me she possesses an enchanted whistle that can tame any creature in Tamriel. Marvelous, yes? Apparently she lives in a durzog lair nearby.
Target: 아, 탐구심이라고 할까! 난 그런 걸 좋아하네!\n\n난 Nikolvara라는 노드 야생동물 조련사를 찾고 있다네. 내 연락책이 말하길 그녀는 탐리엘에 있는모든 동물을 길들일 수 있는 마법의 호루라기를 가지고 있다고 하더군. 멋지지 않나? 분명히 그녀는 이 근처에 있는 Durzog lair에 살고 있을 걸세.

Source: Then you're not …. Thank the Eight Divines, I thought one of them snuck up on me!\n\nStay alert, it isn't safe here. A shipful of pirates came in the dead of night. All of <<1>> is lost unless the Cat Lord comes through for us.
Target: Then you're not …. Thank the Eight Divines, I thought one of them snuck up on me!\n\nStay alert, it isn't safe here. A shipful of pirates came in the dead of night. All of <<1>> is lost unless the Cat Lord comes through for us.

Source: When Cheydinhal erupted in warfare, a group of bandits known as The Thorns made off with all our valuables. \n\nIf we had the items back, we could trade them for supplies and equipment that we desperately need.
Target: When Cheydinhal erupted in warfare, a group of bandits known as The Thorns made off with all our valuables. \n\nIf we had the items back, we could trade them for supplies and equipment that we desperately need.

Source: Who are they? Where are they?
Target: Who are they? Where are they?

Source: Every ten years some idiot Orcs try to crack this place. They show up with a flawed plan to find riches and power. They're never heard from again.\n\n<<1>> had a plan. He said we'd find riches and power. Should've known he just needed some idiot Orcs.
Target: 십 년마다 어떤 얼간이 오크들이 이 곳을 부수려한다. 그들은 부와 힘을 찾기 위해 나사가 빠진 계획을 가지고 나타나지. 그들의 소식을 다시는 들을 수 없게 되지만 말이야.\n\n<<1>>에게 계획이 있다. 그는 우리가 부와 힘을 찾겠다고 했지. 그에겐 그저 얼간이 오크가 필요했다는것을 알아챘어야만 했어.

Source: I would sacrifice much to free Cheydinhal, but there is something I hope not to lose. Hidden in the cathedral across the river, I left an ancient strongbox. Inside is a treasured heirloom of my family. Retrieve it for me and I will reward you.
Target: I would sacrifice much to free Cheydinhal, but there is something I hope not to lose. Hidden in the cathedral across the river, I left an ancient strongbox. Inside is a treasured heirloom of my family. Retrieve it for me and I will reward you.

Source: Sure. What do you need me to do?
Target: Sure. What do you need me to do?

Source: The Orc that stands … er … sits … before you represents the future of the Lion Guard! I am Recruit Gorak, pride of New Orsinium!\n\nPlease untie me. We have work to do. We must recover the General's dispatch and return to Captain Vistra.
Target: The Orc that stands … er … sits … before you represents the future of the Lion Guard! I am Recruit Gorak, pride of New Orsinium!\n\nPlease untie me. We have work to do. We must recover the General's dispatch and return to Captain Vistra.

Source: He got himself lost in the swamp. Again. He tried to show up the other recruits and recover General Gautier's lost dispatch.\n\nListen, I can't spare many soldiers. If you head out into the swamp, can you keep an eye out for Gorak?
Target: He got himself lost in the swamp. Again. He tried to show up the other recruits and recover General Gautier's lost dispatch.\n\nListen, I can't spare many soldiers. If you head out into the swamp, can you keep an eye out for Gorak?

Source: "I, your new king, must inform you the situation has changed. The Orcs are our staunch allies whom I have allowed to rebuild Orsinium.\n\n"Your long vigil is over. It's time to come home. Cease your banditry and murder of Orc travelers."

Target: The Wood Orc mercenaries have constructed a ritual altar just inside this cave, made of the bones they've unearthed.\n\nWe don't know the altar's purpose, but we would disable it, then pursue Oraneth within. Will you handle her brutes for us?

Source: Tell these people I made no false promises! What I sold came from Belarata, yes, but not everything brims with magicka.\n\nTell them, and I will share the way—the secret way—into Belarata! You will tell them, yes?
Target: Tell these people I made no false promises! What I sold came from Belarata, yes, but not everything brims with magicka.\n\nTell them, and I will share the way—the secret way—into Belarata! You will tell them, yes?

Source: That no one else can enter, and the only way to study Belarata is to buy the garbage he sells! \n\nShe's locked up tighter than the Crystal Tower of Summerset Isle. It's unconscionable. He's profiting on trash when I've got work to do inside.
Target: That no one else can enter, and the only way to study Belarata is to buy the garbage he sells! \n\nShe's locked up tighter than the Crystal Tower of Summerset Isle. It's unconscionable. He's profiting on trash when I've got work to do inside.

Source: My father's a mage. His signature spell is a spell of hiding that I know can protect the villagers. If you can reach our house and prepare the spell, I can rescue the villagers and meet you there.\n\nYou just need to convince Dame Clarique to free me.
Target: My father's a mage. His signature spell is a spell of hiding that I know can protect the villagers. If you can reach our house and prepare the spell, I can rescue the villagers and meet you there.\n\nYou just need to convince Dame Clarique to free me.

Target: Perhaps! There's an ancient device on the eastern cliffs, Aldmeri harbor defense. Should have stopped this bunch before they started. Not sure why it didn't.\n\nIf you can get it working again, we'll have a much easier time of it.

Target: 누군가—혹은 무언가가—오크들을 변화시켰다. 정밀한 상흔과 골절이 있다는걸 눈치챘나? 그들은 잔인하고 체계적으로 고문을 당했고, 뜯어 고쳤으며, 지금의 모습으로 다시 만들어졌다.

Source: We woke up to the farm burning this morning and these nasty little scamps were everywhere. Worse still, William had gone missing. It was his farm.\n\nFor the family's sake, I stuck around today and helped search, but I'm afraid it's a lost cause.
Target: We woke up to the farm burning this morning and these nasty little scamps were everywhere. Worse still, William had gone missing. It was his farm.\n\nFor the family's sake, I stuck around today and helped search, but I'm afraid it's a lost cause.

Source: A few years ago, my deplorable sibling broke protocol and conquered a portion of Elsweyr. I assume she wants the weapon to secure her territory and increase the size of her holdings.\n\nEuraxia's ruthlessness is exceeded only by her ambition.
Target: A few years ago, my deplorable sibling broke protocol and conquered a portion of Elsweyr. I assume she wants the weapon to secure her territory and increase the size of her holdings.\n\nEuraxia's ruthlessness is exceeded only by her ambition.

Source: Imperial archers posted on the river banks have made crossing impossible. If our troops can get across, we might be able to push back the Imperials. We need those archers eliminated!
Target: Imperial archers posted on the river banks have made crossing impossible. If our troops can get across, we might be able to push back the Imperials. We need those archers eliminated!

Source: I'm investigating a rumor about the town's leader, Magnate Feina-Darak. Word has it that she's a descendant of the Akaviri Potentate.\n\nA rather curious rumor, given that the Potentate's bloodline should have been wiped out over a century ago.
Target: I'm investigating a rumor about the town's leader, Magnate Feina-Darak. Word has it that she's a descendant of the Akaviri Potentate.\n\nA rather curious rumor, given that the Potentate's bloodline should have been wiped out over a century ago.

Source: Alchemists are masters of the elixir. They trap magic in a bottle for later use.\n\nBut I can only certify you in one discipline at a time. If this is agreeable, we can begin your training.
Target: 연금술사들은 영약의 대가입니다. 그들은 나중에 쓸 용도로 마법을 병 안에 가두어 두죠.\n\n하지만 저는 한 번에 한 가지만 인증을 해 줄 수 있습니다. 여기에 동의한다면,  훈련을 시작하도록 하죠.

Source: Abbot Durak and a few others went to the Cave of Dreams on the north ridge. Durak wanted to get something to help put out the fires.\n\nBrother Hakam went after them with a Scroll of Return, to help get them back sooner. Now I worry about Hakam, too.
Target: Abbot Durak and a few others went to the Cave of Dreams on the north ridge. Durak wanted to get something to help put out the fires.\n\nBrother Hakam went after them with a Scroll of Return, to help get them back sooner. Now I worry about Hakam, too.

Source: Half-sister. And, yes, if it comes to that. Euraxia conquered Rimmen without authorization. She oppressed the Khajiit, unleashed hordes of undead, and made a deal with the Dragons.\n\nIf we don't depose her, I hate to imagine what she'll do next.
Target: Half-sister. And, yes, if it comes to that. Euraxia conquered Rimmen without authorization. She oppressed the Khajiit, unleashed hordes of undead, and made a deal with the Dragons.\n\nIf we don't depose her, I hate to imagine what she'll do next.

Source: Enchanters harness the possibility of runes, transforming them into the certainty of glyphs.\n\nI'll teach you, but I can only focus on one certification at a time. Is this agreeable?
Target: 마법부여가들은 룬들의 잠재력을 활용하여 그것들을 글리프로 변형시킵니다.\n\n당신에게 알려줄 순 있지만, 한번에 하나의 자격 인증을 배울 수 있어요.  동의하시겠어요?

Source: You need to find Mister Nurin. \n\nWhen the sun rose this morning, the farm was on fire. I tried to put it out, but most of the farm was destroyed, and then we realized that Mister Nurin was missing. We need your help.
Target: You need to find Mister Nurin. \n\nWhen the sun rose this morning, the farm was on fire. I tried to put it out, but most of the farm was destroyed, and then we realized that Mister Nurin was missing. We need your help.

Source: I know how a horn works, five-claw, but this is a relic of ancient magic. I do not want to damage it before we learn the true significance of its power. I will have Tharn do more research.\n\nIn the meantime, we have another matter to deal with.
Target: I know how a horn works, five-claw, but this is a relic of ancient magic. I do not want to damage it before we learn the true significance of its power. I will have Tharn do more research.\n\nIn the meantime, we have another matter to deal with.

Source: Our adeptorium, S'rendarr's Cradle, is parched by a drought. We rely on the Anequina Aqueduct to supply our water, but something halted the flow. Now, adepts and pilgrims go thirsty.\n\nWe tend to the sick here. Without water, many of them may die!
Target: Our adeptorium, S'rendarr's Cradle, is parched by a drought. We rely on the Anequina Aqueduct to supply our water, but something halted the flow. Now, adepts and pilgrims go thirsty.\n\nWe tend to the sick here. Without water, many of them may die!

Source: Water. Or rather, the lack of it. Something stopped the flow from the aqueduct to S'rendarr's Cradle.\n\nI've been hauling water for them in the meantime. But they can't keep this up forever.

column5: but I think I figured out the cause of the disappearances. I witnessed the warlord's lover
column7: use a stuffed bird totem to transform one of our prisoners into a bird.\"\""

Source: Who would I talk to if I wanted to lend a hand?
Target: Who would I talk to if I wanted to lend a hand?

Source: Why me?
Target: Why me?

Source: <<1>> headed to explore <<Ac:2>>. Once the wards broke, I sent <<3>> to fetch him. Neither returned.\n\nMages Guild protocol says I should remain in place until aid arrives. I'm hoping that's you.
Target: <<1>> headed to explore <<Ac:2>>. Once the wards broke, I sent <<3>> to fetch him. Neither returned.\n\nMages Guild protocol says I should remain in place until aid arrives. I'm hoping that's you.

Source: I should try to return the lute to its owner.
Target: I should try to return the lute to its owner.

Source: <Make a note of the request.>
Target: <Make a note of the request.>

Source: Bandits have taken advantage of the chaos in Cheydinhal to overrun several outlying estates. \n\nOne such group—the Shadowed Path—now controls an estate southwest of town.
Target: Bandits have taken advantage of the chaos in Cheydinhal to overrun several outlying estates. \n\nOne such group—the Shadowed Path—now controls an estate southwest of town.

Source: Would you, really? I'm not used to kindness from strangers. I'd welcome your help!\n\nI put my things in several hollow tree stumps, then I got all turned around. All of the stumps here look alike, and there are crocodiles everywhere!
Target: Would you, really? I'm not used to kindness from strangers. I'd welcome your help!\n\nI put my things in several hollow tree stumps, then I got all turned around. All of the stumps here look alike, and there are crocodiles everywhere!

Source: I've cleared the way. You'll be fine. I'll find the others.
Target: I've cleared the way. You'll be fine. I'll find the others.

Target: <Accept this contract.>

Target: <Continue reading.>

Target: How can I protect him?

Target: <Accept this contract.>
