Target: What do you need?

Source: <Accept this contract.>
Target: <Accept this contract.>

Source: I'll go talk to Astara in the Sanctuary.
Target: I'll go talk to Astara in the Sanctuary.

Source: When a king sends his army somewhere, I think his intentions are pretty clear. Always knew the Covenant was a bad idea.\n\nApparently, King Fahara'jad thinks we're stupid too if he expects us to just welcome his soldiers into the castle.
Target: When a king sends his army somewhere, I think his intentions are pretty clear. Always knew the Covenant was a bad idea.\n\nApparently, King Fahara'jad thinks we're stupid too if he expects us to just welcome his soldiers into the castle.

Source: I'll go talk to Kor in the Sanctuary.
Target: I'll go talk to Kor in the Sanctuary.

Source: I'll destroy the gem.
Target: I'll destroy the gem.

Source: I should find <<1>> or <<2>> and return this pendant.
Target: I should find <<1>> or <<2>> and return this pendant.

Source: He was supposed to tell Astara and the Speaker what he discovered.
Target: He was supposed to tell Astara and the Speaker what he discovered.

Source: What would you have me do?
Target: What would you have me do?

Source: Valaste has finished translating the tome. Once you're ready, join us at the Mages Guild. Speak to Valaste when you arrive. I'll be making preparations for your first trial.
Target: Valaste has finished translating the tome. Once you're ready, join us at the Mages Guild. Speak to Valaste when you arrive. I'll be making preparations for your first trial.

Source: The canonreeve's daughter. She's trying to organize an evacuation up the road. Go talk to her if you want to help, I'm getting out while I still can!
Target: The canonreeve's daughter. She's trying to organize an evacuation up the road. Go talk to her if you want to help, I'm getting out while I still can!

Source: Everything! I thought I was so clever, trading all my gold for a large ruby. So much easier to hide from thieves.\n\nIt's in one of the guar's bags and now it's gone. I beg you—find my guar and ruby, please!
Target: Everything! I thought I was so clever, trading all my gold for a large ruby. So much easier to hide from thieves.\n\nIt's in one of the guar's bags and now it's gone. I beg you—find my guar and ruby, please!

Source: Oh, it's perfectly safe, I assure you. I just need someone to put on the amulet and then irritate a wamasu until it emits lightning.\n\nWould you convince <<1>> to continue our work? Or failing that, perhaps you can take his place.
Target: Oh, it's perfectly safe, I assure you. I just need someone to put on the amulet and then irritate a wamasu until it emits lightning.\n\nWould you convince <<1>> to continue our work? Or failing that, perhaps you can take his place.

Source: Follow me. We'll find the other survivors.
Target: Follow me. We'll find the other survivors.

Source: <Continue the examination.>
Target: <Continue the examination.>

Source: <Accept this contract.>
Target: <Accept this contract.>

Source: I've cleared the way. You'll be fine. I'll go find the others.
Target: I've cleared the way. You'll be fine. I'll go find the others.

Source: There was a portal. The Daedra used it. But it disappeared. Near as I can figure, the only way in now is to jump down into the water.\n\nIf you're brave enough to take the leap, look for Skordo. Big Orc fellow. He always knows what to do.
Target: There was a portal. The Daedra used it. But it disappeared. Near as I can figure, the only way in now is to jump down into the water.\n\nIf you're brave enough to take the leap, look for Skordo. Big Orc fellow. He always knows what to do.

Source: What would you have me do?
Target: What would you have me do?

Source: <Accept this contract.>
Target: <Accept this contract.>

Source: I'm called Pirondil, an investigator for the First Auridon Marines. I spotted a Goblin sneaking into this cave … it was wearing Elven armor.\n\nI followed it, but I was ambushed by that woman.
Target: I'm called Pirondil, an investigator for the First Auridon Marines. I spotted a Goblin sneaking into this cave … it was wearing Elven armor.\n\nI followed it, but I was ambushed by that woman.

Source: There's an ancient device on the eastern cliffs, Aldmeri harbor defense. If you can get it working again, we'll have a much easier time of it.\n\nMy Captain sent a runner to find out how to activate it. Hasn't come back.
Target: There's an ancient device on the eastern cliffs, Aldmeri harbor defense. If you can get it working again, we'll have a much easier time of it.\n\nMy Captain sent a runner to find out how to activate it. Hasn't come back.

Source: What happened to the designs?
Target: What happened to the designs?

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: <Accept this contract.>
Target: <Accept this contract.>

Source: Of course! Dear old Baan Dar holds the Boast every year. Folk come from far and wide to play tricks on one another. It's a festival of fun. And the best tricksters get to dance and drink the night away in Baan Dar's realm.
Target: Of course! Dear old Baan Dar holds the Boast every year. Folk come from far and wide to play tricks on one another. It's a festival of fun. And the best tricksters get to dance and drink the night away in Baan Dar's realm.

Source: Yes. Go into the cavern and burn the disciples' food supplies—that should suffice.\n\nThen come and find me on the upper levels. That's where I think we'll find the entrance to her lair.
Target: Yes. Go into the cavern and burn the disciples' food supplies—that should suffice.\n\nThen come and find me on the upper levels. That's where I think we'll find the entrance to her lair.

Target: Where do you want me?

Target: Do you know why this is happening?

Target: <Read the note.>

Target: Why are you just sitting here?

Target: Thank you.

Target: Yes, I'll get what you need.

Target: Why aren't you frozen?

Target: Thank you.

Target: What happens if I put on the armor?

Target: What strengths are you referring to?

Target: I'll let you know if I see anything suspicious.

Target: What Orc?

Target: Why is that a good thing?

Target: What happened to your father?

Target: What are you after? Their loot?

Target: The harpies took everything?

Target: I wonder where this came from?

Source: Does he have a plan?
Target: Does he have a plan?

Source: So we're going to join him?
Target: So we're going to join him?

Source: Indeed. You will find the Daedric cultists are uncovering the vessels on the east side of the ruins even now.\n\nGet them for me. Get as many as you can, and we will have what we need to create the Water Stone.
Target: Indeed. You will find the Daedric cultists are uncovering the vessels on the east side of the ruins even now.\n\nGet them for me. Get as many as you can, and we will have what we need to create the Water Stone.

Source: Open the portal.
Target: Open the portal.

Source: You're after the pirates' treasure?
Target: You're after the pirates' treasure?

Source: I don't know … perhaps? \n\nAll these other things can be replaced, but they took the temple's relics—sacred ornaments that date back to the time of the Ra Gada. If you could reclaim these relics, that would be a start.
Target: I don't know … perhaps? \n\nAll these other things can be replaced, but they took the temple's relics—sacred ornaments that date back to the time of the Ra Gada. If you could reclaim these relics, that would be a start.

Source: A spirit? A Daedra? This is part of what must be exposed.\n\nWhatever it is, it has enslaved local villagers—calling them Rain Disciples. It taps their minds for its power. To what end I do not know, but I believe you can unmask its intentions.
Target: A spirit? A Daedra? This is part of what must be exposed.\n\nWhatever it is, it has enslaved local villagers—calling them Rain Disciples. It taps their minds for its power. To what end I do not know, but I believe you can unmask its intentions.

Source: They once called me the Sly Scarab, but my given name is Mazrahil. \n\nOther questions must wait—those orders are of paramount importance. If you get them, I can hobble unnoticed to the ruins below the gate and await you there. Will you help me?
Target: They once called me the Sly Scarab, but my given name is Mazrahil. \n\nOther questions must wait—those orders are of paramount importance. If you get them, I can hobble unnoticed to the ruins below the gate and await you there. Will you help me?

Source: Take this antidote. I fear some of them may have been poisoned by the snakes and now lack the strength to escape.\n\nI hope it is not too late.
Target: Take this antidote. I fear some of them may have been poisoned by the snakes and now lack the strength to escape.\n\nI hope it is not too late.

Target: What's going on out here?

Target: What's wrong, spirit?

Target: You look uninjured.

Target: What do you recommend?

Target: Who's Larousse? Your kidnapper?

Target: Sure, what do you need?

Target: Not even the faintest clue.

Target: I take it you found trouble anyway.

Target: Do you have any idea where she might be?

Target: To teach you. If you are to be champion of the Alik'r, you must understand the spirit of this desert and its people.\n\nTu'whacca says you must walk in the steps of our heroes, battle the spirits of the enemies they faced. Then you will understand.

Target: My sisters would not want me to trust an outsider, but they are not here, and I cannot leave her side.\n\nFrankly, I am surprised you share my concerns. You are sure you wish to help me?

Target: With Countess Tamrith here, I must secure the camp before we resume the hunt. To this end, I need someone to find Jonah Marose and his mother.\n\nJonah claimed he could sense <<1>>. After upsetting everyone, Jonah and his mother fled the camp.

The Night Terror? Vaermina's own consort? 

Then this does not even compare to the threat the Omens represented!

Source: To enter Davon's Watch, you'll need to prove your wild claims of immunity.\n\nSouth of here lies Fort Arand. We saw signs of a Blightstorm, and know not their fate. Affirm our suspicions, and if you return unharmed, your immunity is confirmed.
Target: To enter Davon's Watch, you'll need to prove your wild claims of immunity.\n\nSouth of here lies Fort Arand. We saw signs of a Blightstorm, and know not their fate. Affirm our suspicions, and if you return unharmed, your immunity is confirmed.

Source: I've told the knights positioned around the castle to attack on our signal. \n\nThere's a siege horn mounted atop Firebrand Keep's main hall. If you are willing, I would ask you to go there and blow the horn. That will signal everyone to attack.
Target: I've told the knights positioned around the castle to attack on our signal. \n\nThere's a siege horn mounted atop Firebrand Keep's main hall. If you are willing, I would ask you to go there and blow the horn. That will signal everyone to attack.

Source: Our leader, Sir Hughes, sent us a confusing message—to attack the Redguard army camped outside Alcaire Castle—an act that would destroy the Daggerfall Covenant.\n\nSome of us want to hear a justification before we do such a thing.
Target: Our leader, Sir Hughes, sent us a confusing message—to attack the Redguard army camped outside Alcaire Castle—an act that would destroy the Daggerfall Covenant.\n\nSome of us want to hear a justification before we do such a thing.

Source: Is there a problem?
Target: Is there a problem?

Source: A former student requires my assistance, but I cannot do what is necessary on my own.\n\nYou have heard that Dragons threaten Elsweyr? We seek the wisdom of the ancient Dragonguard who once hunted them nearly to extinction.
Target: A former student requires my assistance, but I cannot do what is necessary on my own.\n\nYou have heard that Dragons threaten Elsweyr? We seek the wisdom of the ancient Dragonguard who once hunted them nearly to extinction.

Source: I do not have all the details, but I believe it has something to do with a Dragonguard tomb. A former student seeks a solution to the threat facing Elsweyr among the remains of that ancient order, and Kasura agreed to assist him.
Target: I do not have all the details, but I believe it has something to do with a Dragonguard tomb. A former student seeks a solution to the threat facing Elsweyr among the remains of that ancient order, and Kasura agreed to assist him.

Source: A Dragon's words have power few mortals understand. When we swear an oath, we are bound by it. That is our way.\n\nThe Dragon Yahgrondu vowed to aid me in a time of need. We must seek him out and remind him of his oath.
Target: A Dragon's words have power few mortals understand. When we swear an oath, we are bound by it. That is our way.\n\nThe Dragon Yahgrondu vowed to aid me in a time of need. We must seek him out and remind him of his oath.

Source: Abnur Tharn. According to his letter, you and he worked together. He thinks very highly of you. I'd ask how you accomplished such a feat, but there isn't time.\n\nThe old snake says we have important business to discuss. And he's bringing a friend.
Target: Abnur Tharn. According to his letter, you and he worked together. He thinks very highly of you. I'd ask how you accomplished such a feat, but there isn't time.\n\nThe old snake says we have important business to discuss. And he's bringing a friend.

Source: Sai Sahan received a letter from the High Chancellor. The great Imperial battlemage, Abnur Tharn. \n\nAccording to Sai, the letter indicates you all need to meet as soon as possible.
Target: Sai Sahan received a letter from the High Chancellor. The great Imperial battlemage, Abnur Tharn. \n\nAccording to Sai, the letter indicates you all need to meet as soon as possible.

Source: The journals indicated that the horn was indestructible. And Stendarr knows that Dragons are as close to immortal and unchanging as the earth and sky.\n\nFate has placed the Horn of Ja'darri in our path for a purpose. I believe that with all my heart.
Target: The journals indicated that the horn was indestructible. And Stendarr knows that Dragons are as close to immortal and unchanging as the earth and sky.\n\nFate has placed the Horn of Ja'darri in our path for a purpose. I believe that with all my heart.

Source: Aeliah believes the cult is recruiting in Senchal. I want you to find a recruiter and join their ranks. As a member of the cult, you'll be privy to a great deal of information.\n\nBut first, you'll want to speak with General Renmus.
Target: Aeliah believes the cult is recruiting in Senchal. I want you to find a recruiter and join their ranks. As a member of the cult, you'll be privy to a great deal of information.\n\nBut first, you'll want to speak with General Renmus.

Source: I considered that option, but without a mage of Abnur Tharn's abilities and experience, we have no way to activate the aeonstones.\n\nNo, we'll need to come up with a different solution.
Target: I considered that option, but without a mage of Abnur Tharn's abilities and experience, we have no way to activate the aeonstones.\n\nNo, we'll need to come up with a different solution.

Source: Not as of yet. That's why he sent me to find you. Sai Sahan fears that time is running out and he wants all of us at the sanctum.\n\nKaalgrontiid must be close to completing his ascension.
Target: Not as of yet. That's why he sent me to find you. Sai Sahan fears that time is running out and he wants all of us at the sanctum.\n\nKaalgrontiid must be close to completing his ascension.

Source: Adara'hai is a Twilight Cantor. She sings the Dusk-Canticles so Khajiit are not swayed by the beat of Lorkhaj's heart, and to drive off the Bent Cats already lost.\n\nIf Ka'ishka's fears are well founded, her husband's soul is in grave peril.
Target: Adara'hai is a Twilight Cantor. She sings the Dusk-Canticles so Khajiit are not swayed by the beat of Lorkhaj's heart, and to drive off the Bent Cats already lost.\n\nIf Ka'ishka's fears are well founded, her husband's soul is in grave peril.

Source: <<1>> asked me to help <<2>> in <<A:3>>. Dominion forces overran the area.
Target: <<1>> asked me to help <<2>> in <<A:3>>. Dominion forces overran the area.

Source: I received another message from King Kurog. He requested that I come to the throne room at Scarp Keep. Apparently, he has a new mission he needs me to deal with.
Target: I received another message from King Kurog. He requested that I come to the throne room at Scarp Keep. Apparently, he has a new mission he needs me to deal with.

Source: Oh, this one was just …. Ugh, I will not fib. Daini meant to rob this caravan. Do not judge! I swear on the Moons I did not … this was an accident! Even if it was not, those muskarses were slavers, killers, and worse!\n\nDull-witted terror birds!
Target: Oh, this one was just …. Ugh, I will not fib. Daini meant to rob this caravan. Do not judge! I swear on the Moons I did not … this was an accident! Even if it was not, those muskarses were slavers, killers, and worse!\n\nDull-witted terror birds!

Source: What do you mean? Who are you?
Target: What do you mean? Who are you?

Source: Murder, terror, you know what I mean!\n\nA whole flock of them knocked over a caravan down the road. Like kicking over an anthill, see? Boxes and carts are all wrecked. It's a mess! Then again, there might be some shinies scattered about. Never know.
Target: Murder, terror, you know what I mean!\n\nA whole flock of them knocked over a caravan down the road. Like kicking over an anthill, see? Boxes and carts are all wrecked. It's a mess! Then again, there might be some shinies scattered about. Never know.

Source: Blademaster Sai Sahan is near Senchal's palace, at the center of the city. Last we spoke, he was trying to secure an audience with someone in the palace. I'm not certain why.\n\nWill you meet with him?
Target: Blademaster Sai Sahan is near Senchal's palace, at the center of the city. Last we spoke, he was trying to secure an audience with someone in the palace. I'm not certain why.\n\nWill you meet with him?

Source: A Dragon nests on a nearby island. I believe it plans to attack Senchal. We need to slay the creature before it strikes.\n\nUnfortunately, there's not a ship in this city that will sail us to a Dragon's lair. Believe me, I've asked.
Target: A Dragon nests on a nearby island. I believe it plans to attack Senchal. We need to slay the creature before it strikes.\n\nUnfortunately, there's not a ship in this city that will sail us to a Dragon's lair. Believe me, I've asked.

Source: Seeking skilled provisioners to fulfill simple contracts. Your food or drink could make the difference! Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!
Target: 간단한 계약을 수행할 수 있는 숙련된 요리사를 찾습니다. 당신의 음식과 음료는 차이를 만들어낼 수 있습니다! 구체적인 의뢰를 잘 읽어 보시고 게시판에서 의뢰서를 가져가세요!

Source: Got tipped off on some New Moon plotting in Deshaan. One of their couriers paid a visit to a nasty clan of Orcs in the mountains southwest of Narsis. Word is they're still in the area.\n\nCatch up to the courier and see what sort of deal they cut.
Target: Got tipped off on some New Moon plotting in Deshaan. One of their couriers paid a visit to a nasty clan of Orcs in the mountains southwest of Narsis. Word is they're still in the area.\n\nCatch up to the courier and see what sort of deal they cut.

Source: Bit of treasure hunting. There's a little snippet in this book about the terms of the Akaviri surrender at Pale Pass. One of the concessions was offering the Akaviri war dead proper burial. Problem is, by that time there were a lot of hasty graves.
Target: Bit of treasure hunting. There's a little snippet in this book about the terms of the Akaviri surrender at Pale Pass. One of the concessions was offering the Akaviri war dead proper burial. Problem is, by that time there were a lot of hasty graves.

Source: Nahfahlaar might. He's dealt with Laatvulon in the past and may have a better understanding of the cult's motives. Why don't you talk with our Dragon ally?\n\nMeanwhile, I'll rally the rest of our companions and head to Pridehome.
Target: Nahfahlaar might. He's dealt with Laatvulon in the past and may have a better understanding of the cult's motives. Why don't you talk with our Dragon ally?\n\nMeanwhile, I'll rally the rest of our companions and head to Pridehome.

Target: Sep's Scales. Why would he challenge Laatvulon on his own?\n\nThis is no time for anger. I may not agree with Nahfahlaar's actions, but we need to defeat the cult. We must find our Dragon ally.

Target: He returned shortly after we did, but he's been acting strangely. He won't talk to me. Won't tell me what happened up there after Abnur ….\n\nHe trusts you. Can you check on him for me?

Source: Sidura is just the look-out. This messenger stuff requires memorizing more information than this one cares to keep in her head all at once.\n\nJust return to the Dragonguard Sanctum. The bearded one wants to have words with you, yes?
Target: Sidura is just the look-out. This messenger stuff requires memorizing more information than this one cares to keep in her head all at once.\n\nJust return to the Dragonguard Sanctum. The bearded one wants to have words with you, yes?

Target: One of the guards from the caravan brought me a message. It seems that King Kurog has requested my presence at his cornerclub in Orsinium.

Source: Something went wrong with Vanus' spell and I'm all alone in Coldharbour. I found a mostly deserted city—the Hollow City—and its caretaker, who calls herself the Groundskeeper.
Target: Something went wrong with Vanus' spell and I'm all alone in Coldharbour. I found a mostly deserted city—the Hollow City—and its caretaker, who calls herself the Groundskeeper.

Source: I found a recruitment letter offering membership in a scholarly society called the Antiquarian Circle. Joining this fellowship could lead to some exciting discoveries.
Target: I found a recruitment letter offering membership in a scholarly society called the Antiquarian Circle. Joining this fellowship could lead to some exciting discoveries.

Source: One of Fennorian's contacts delivered a message to me from Princess Svana. She wants to talk to me at the Lonely Troll before she meets with the high king.
Target: One of Fennorian's contacts delivered a message to me from Princess Svana. She wants to talk to me at the Lonely Troll before she meets with the high king.

Source: Warchief Tazgol took his army to attack the Bloodthorn Cult at Carzog's Demise.
Target: Warchief Tazgol took his army to attack the Bloodthorn Cult at Carzog's Demise.

Target: I met a scholar named Verita Numida who offered me a place within the Antiquarian Circle—a scholarly society dedicated to recovering lost relics for study. Joining this fellowship could lead to some exciting discoveries.

Source: It's more about what was not said than what was, yes? For example, the queen said nothing about how the Mane sent an envoy to determine if she is really the heir of Anequina.\n\nAbout the Dragons and the strange eclipse, she has been equally silent.
Target: It's more about what was not said than what was, yes? For example, the queen said nothing about how the Mane sent an envoy to determine if she is really the heir of Anequina.\n\nAbout the Dragons and the strange eclipse, she has been equally silent.

Target: Who are you?

Source: A necromancer called Thannar the Graveprowler reappeared recently, just southwest of here at Scar's Edge.\n\nDon't expect to find some scrawny, dull-fanged wizard, rhook. Thannar is a Senche-raht—as big and as dangerous as they come.
Target: A necromancer called Thannar the Graveprowler reappeared recently, just southwest of here at Scar's Edge.\n\nDon't expect to find some scrawny, dull-fanged wizard, rhook. Thannar is a Senche-raht—as big and as dangerous as they come.

Source: I can handle myself.
Target: I can handle myself.

Source: Many Khajiit have a … loose definition of what is legal and what is not. Old Ri'hirr included! But some take it too far.\n\nTake these two: Zav'i and Akumjhargo. They lead a pride of bandits out of Red Hands Run. Muskarsed villains, both of them!
Target: Many Khajiit have a … loose definition of what is legal and what is not. Old Ri'hirr included! But some take it too far.\n\nTake these two: Zav'i and Akumjhargo. They lead a pride of bandits out of Red Hands Run. Muskarsed villains, both of them!

Source: The Ruddy Fangs are the biggest bandit pride this side of the Scar. And probably south of the Scar too. This bunch has been preying on refugees fleeing the Dragons. As if they haven't lost enough.\n\nShook me down too, bastards.
Target: The Ruddy Fangs are the biggest bandit pride this side of the Scar. And probably south of the Scar too. This bunch has been preying on refugees fleeing the Dragons. As if they haven't lost enough.\n\nShook me down too, bastards.

Source: This one saw a stranger setting up camp outside the cave nearby.\n\nLocal legend says that Mafala-worshipers used to lurk there. Risen dead too, I think. To venture so close to such a place …. It does not seem wise.
Target: This one saw a stranger setting up camp outside the cave nearby.\n\nLocal legend says that Mafala-worshipers used to lurk there. Risen dead too, I think. To venture so close to such a place …. It does not seem wise.

Source: What do you propose?
Target: What do you propose?

Source: Is the castle safe? Did you take care of all of Montclair's assassins?
Target: Is the castle safe? Did you take care of all of Montclair's assassins?

Source: I am grateful that you wish to help. We could use assistance stopping the spread of Dragons beyond Elsweyr. Optimally, we want to stop them altogether, so any effort you can throw into this goal would be appreciated.
Target: I am grateful that you wish to help. We could use assistance stopping the spread of Dragons beyond Elsweyr. Optimally, we want to stop them altogether, so any effort you can throw into this goal would be appreciated.

Source: There's a Khajiit digging through the rubble of an old Akaviri tomb, just up the trail here. She kept muttering to herself, so I thought she might need help.\n\nBut after talking to her, I suspect she's just crazed.
Target: There's a Khajiit digging through the rubble of an old Akaviri tomb, just up the trail here. She kept muttering to herself, so I thought she might need help.\n\nBut after talking to her, I suspect she's just crazed.

Target: I met an injured bookseller, on his way to open a shop in Orsinium. Along the way, he and his partners were set upon by Winterborn marauders, and now his two partners are missing.

Source: An accident at the Mor Khazgur Stronghold trapped many Orc workers inside the mine. Unfortunately, a conflict between the clan's chief and the mine's overseer have only added to the crisis.
Target: An accident at the Mor Khazgur Stronghold trapped many Orc workers inside the mine. Unfortunately, a conflict between the clan's chief and the mine's overseer have only added to the crisis.

Source: The White-Gold Tower! The hordes of Molag Bal took it in their invasion of Imperial City. They mock us from the Ruby Throne! Toss those damn Daedra out from the highest window and put the Empire back in mortal hands!
Target: The White-Gold Tower! The hordes of Molag Bal took it in their invasion of Imperial City. They mock us from the Ruby Throne! Toss those damn Daedra out from the highest window and put the Empire back in mortal hands!

Source: Dragons sail across Elsweyr, burning everything in their wake. Most run and hide. We do not.\n\nBut, to kill a thing we must catch it first, yes? Only a fool would chase them on the wing. No, we must hunt them where they feed.
Target: Dragons sail across Elsweyr, burning everything in their wake. Most run and hide. We do not.\n\nBut, to kill a thing we must catch it first, yes? Only a fool would chase them on the wing. No, we must hunt them where they feed.

Source: With good reason! The undead walk the ruins of Culotte just to the southwest of here. If you'd eliminate some of them for us, I'd sleep a lot easier.
Target: With good reason! The undead walk the ruins of Culotte just to the southwest of here. If you'd eliminate some of them for us, I'd sleep a lot easier.

Source: Know anything about flowers?\n\nI should explain. A clan mother came to me with a heart-warming request. Apparently, Moonlit Cove holds some spiritual significance for the Khajiit. Doubly personal for her, since her grandmother often prayed there.
Target: Know anything about flowers?\n\nI should explain. A clan mother came to me with a heart-warming request. Apparently, Moonlit Cove holds some spiritual significance for the Khajiit. Doubly personal for her, since her grandmother often prayed there.

Source: Gather and deposit resources in the collector to make an atronach. The atronach will attempt to capture the crystal in the center of the battleground. You can attack enemy atronachs to prevent them from capturing the crystal!
Target: Gather and deposit resources in the collector to make an atronach. The atronach will attempt to capture the crystal in the center of the battleground. You can attack enemy atronachs to prevent them from capturing the crystal!

Source: Yes. Milk-Eyes has been in S'ren-ja for as long as I can remember. He likes to take care of himself, but I worry about that kind old man crawling down into his well.
Target: Yes. Milk-Eyes has been in S'ren-ja for as long as I can remember. He likes to take care of himself, but I worry about that kind old man crawling down into his well.

Source: The New Moon's recruiting again. Poaching from another cult, actually. Guess they figure Daedra worshiping suckers are easier to sway than sensible Divine worshiping folk. I have it on good word that there's a recruiter in Stormhaven right now.
Target: The New Moon's recruiting again. Poaching from another cult, actually. Guess they figure Daedra worshiping suckers are easier to sway than sensible Divine worshiping folk. I have it on good word that there's a recruiter in Stormhaven right now.

Source: I'm Nicolene! I work for Captain Kaleen. She sent me to find you, see if you'd had any luck recruiting for our heist. Looks like you're already making new friends.
Target: I'm Nicolene! I work for Captain Kaleen. She sent me to find you, see if you'd had any luck recruiting for our heist. Looks like you're already making new friends.

Source: Dragons sail across Elsweyr, burning everything in their wake. Most run and hide. We do not.\n\nBut, to kill a thing we must catch it first, yes? Only a fool would chase them on the wing. No, we must hunt them where they feed.
Target: Dragons sail across Elsweyr, burning everything in their wake. Most run and hide. We do not.\n\nBut, to kill a thing we must catch it first, yes? Only a fool would chase them on the wing. No, we must hunt them where they feed.

Source: We've got our hands full just trying to stop the Aldmeri Dominion forces. They're using the tower to signal their ships and we know that messages are being relayed between their commanders.\n\nWe need to see one of those messages.
Target: We've got our hands full just trying to stop the Aldmeri Dominion forces. They're using the tower to signal their ships and we know that messages are being relayed between their commanders.\n\nWe need to see one of those messages.

Source: One of my clients suffers from an unhealthy obsession with all things pointy. Swords, daggers … particularly intimidating forks. Frankly, it's a bit unsettling.\n\nAnyway, he expressed a keen interest in some old swords from the Forsaken Citadel.
Target: One of my clients suffers from an unhealthy obsession with all things pointy. Swords, daggers … particularly intimidating forks. Frankly, it's a bit unsettling.\n\nAnyway, he expressed a keen interest in some old swords from the Forsaken Citadel.

Source: Oh, you'll like this one! Maybe. Settling the undead appeals to your heroic sensibilities, doesn't it? If so, excellent! If not, there's gold involved!\n\nA mage I know crafted these unique candle orbs. She wants them placed in the Forsaken Citadel.
Target: Oh, you'll like this one! Maybe. Settling the undead appeals to your heroic sensibilities, doesn't it? If so, excellent! If not, there's gold involved!\n\nA mage I know crafted these unique candle orbs. She wants them placed in the Forsaken Citadel.

Source: Apparently her house is haunted. She's Ezzag's niece, so normally I'd be suspicious. Shiftless family ties, you know? But she's a good sort. Never known her to lie, and a sweet lass to boot.
Target: Apparently her house is haunted. She's Ezzag's niece, so normally I'd be suspicious. Shiftless family ties, you know? But she's a good sort. Never known her to lie, and a sweet lass to boot.

Source: Yours truly dug up a bit of dirt on a grave in Deshaan. Turns out there's an Akaviri soldier buried in the Siltreen Sanitary Mortuary. Not sure what they did to earn a place in a Dark Elf crypt. Being Dragonguard, it was probably something big.
Target: Yours truly dug up a bit of dirt on a grave in Deshaan. Turns out there's an Akaviri soldier buried in the Siltreen Sanitary Mortuary. Not sure what they did to earn a place in a Dark Elf crypt. Being Dragonguard, it was probably something big.

Source: The battered crown you took from <<1>>'s corpse looks valuable. Perhaps you can sell it in <<2>>.
Target: The battered crown you took from <<1>>'s corpse looks valuable. Perhaps you can sell it in <<2>>.

Source: Got a beauty of a lead, if I say so myself. Picked up the trail of a Dragonguard leader who trained new recruits to the old order. He's long gone, of course, but there were rumors he took scrolls on the art of Dragon hunting when the order disbanded.
Target: Got a beauty of a lead, if I say so myself. Picked up the trail of a Dragonguard leader who trained new recruits to the old order. He's long gone, of course, but there were rumors he took scrolls on the art of Dragon hunting when the order disbanded.

Source: A mining accident at the Mor Khazgur Stonghold has trapped miners in the tunnels with strange, bloodthirsty creatures. To rescue the trapped Orcs, I'll need to navigate a tense relationship between the clan chief and the mine's overseer.
Target: A mining accident at the Mor Khazgur Stonghold has trapped miners in the tunnels with strange, bloodthirsty creatures. To rescue the trapped Orcs, I'll need to navigate a tense relationship between the clan chief and the mine's overseer.

Source: One of my snitches in Grahtwood told me the New Moon is looking for a necromancer named Ethruin. Stinks of an unholy scheme to me, and I know trouble when I smell it, always followed Za'ji like a bad cologne.\n\nNeed you to go break up their meeting.
Target: One of my snitches in Grahtwood told me the New Moon is looking for a necromancer named Ethruin. Stinks of an unholy scheme to me, and I know trouble when I smell it, always followed Za'ji like a bad cologne.\n\nNeed you to go break up their meeting.

Source: I discovered a merchant's permit lying unattended. The permit mentions three trading partners from Daggerfall seeking to establish a shop in Orsinium.
Target: 쓰러진 사람 옆에 있던 상점 허가증을 찾았습니다.  이 허가증은 오시니움에 가게를 열려고 하는 대거폴에서 온 세명의 무역상들의 이름이 적혀있습니다.

Source: <<1>>'s spying revealed much of the Worm Cult's plans, but his superiors want more information. He asked me to help once more.
Target: <<1>>'s spying revealed much of the Worm Cult's plans, but his superiors want more information. He asked me to help once more.

Source: Good. I'm sure she'll want to thank you for everything you've done for the village. Bright moons.
Target: Good. I'm sure she'll want to thank you for everything you've done for the village. Bright moons.

Source: Fine! I'm sure she'll want to thank you for solving my problem, enough though she wouldn't have given me the time of day. Bah!
Target: Fine! I'm sure she'll want to thank you for solving my problem, enough though she wouldn't have given me the time of day. Bah!

Source: Fungus, my stalwart friend. Of the comestible variety, I mean.\n\nOne of my clients runs a small eatery out of his wagon. Selling bitter-grilled mushrooms, you see. He insists that the very best mushrooms—Prune Morels—grow only in Moonlit Cove.
Target: Fungus, my stalwart friend. Of the comestible variety, I mean.\n\nOne of my clients runs a small eatery out of his wagon. Selling bitter-grilled mushrooms, you see. He insists that the very best mushrooms—Prune Morels—grow only in Moonlit Cove.

Source: Stinking husks, clutching like roots for the unwary. Phantoms!\n\nWhen they attacked, it was all I could do to rally the men and retreat! Thankfully, the monsters do not leave the forest.
Target: Stinking husks, clutching like roots for the unwary. Phantoms!\n\nWhen they attacked, it was all I could do to rally the men and retreat! Thankfully, the monsters do not leave the forest.

Source: Goblins of the Bloody Hand tribe have been seen on the outskirts of town. They're spying on the village, looking for weaknesses. If you see one of them, kill it. Then let me know.
Target: Goblins of the Bloody Hand tribe have been seen on the outskirts of town. They're spying on the village, looking for weaknesses. If you see one of them, kill it. Then let me know.

Source: Not any more. The Dark Elf said he could help us with our draugr problem and headed up to the barrow.\n\nI probably shouldn't have let him go, but he seemed confident and said he was an expert and everything.
Target: Not any more. The Dark Elf said he could help us with our draugr problem and headed up to the barrow.\n\nI probably shouldn't have let him go, but he seemed confident and said he was an expert and everything.

Source: Take word to my wife. <<1>> should know I didn't make it. Please tell her I love her.
Target: Take word to my wife. <<1>> should know I didn't make it. Please tell her I love her.

Source: My friends and I became separated at the quarry. We sought the strange aeonstone that we heard about. Figured we'd take a little. Bring it back to my father's jewelry shop in Murkmire.\n\nThat's when the cultists decided to run us off.
Target: My friends and I became separated at the quarry. We sought the strange aeonstone that we heard about. Figured we'd take a little. Bring it back to my father's jewelry shop in Murkmire.\n\nThat's when the cultists decided to run us off.

Source: The king insisted on a Morkul daughter for his forge-wife. But then he decided to pass over my eldest!\n\nNow <<1>> wants to prove him a fool for marrying her little sister.
Target: The king insisted on a Morkul daughter for his forge-wife. But then he decided to pass over my eldest!\n\nNow <<1>> wants to prove him a fool for marrying her little sister.

Source: I do, actually. The Hedoran family lives—well, used to live—southeast of Cropsford. But bandits killed the family and are now using the estate as a camp.
Target: I do, actually. The Hedoran family lives—well, used to live—southeast of Cropsford. But bandits killed the family and are now using the estate as a camp.

Source: Oh, friend, you see to the depths of Rigurt's heart, riddled as it is to overflowing with Frela's pointy arrows of affection!\n\nIf only Rigurt knew how to express such feelings to the lovely Ambassador Lazdutha!
Target: Oh, friend, you see to the depths of Rigurt's heart, riddled as it is to overflowing with Frela's pointy arrows of affection!\n\nIf only Rigurt knew how to express such feelings to the lovely Ambassador Lazdutha!

Source: <This tomb urn is clearly stolen. The name <<1>> and an address in Wayrest are etched on it.>
Target: <This tomb urn is clearly stolen. The name <<1>> and an address in Wayrest are etched on it.>

Source: The Fists of Thalmor! They sent a patrol, but they were attacked. I couldn't watch. There was nothing I could do! If you're not with them ….
Target: The Fists of Thalmor! They sent a patrol, but they were attacked. I couldn't watch. There was nothing I could do! If you're not with them ….

Source: "We can't afford to send more troops to Farwatch. Do what you can to stop the Dominion from establishing a foothold in Glenumbra. Pen them in, but do not engage. Use scouts to gather information."\n\n<The note contains writing in a different hand.>
Target: \\"We can't afford to send more troops to Farwatch. Do what you can to stop the Dominion from establishing a foothold in Glenumbra. Pen them in
column4: but do not engage. Use scouts to gather information.\"\"\n\n<The note contains writing in a different hand.>"

Source: Well, the flame at Crown Point has gone out again. We need someone to re-light it, someone who can survive the trip there. Would you do it? \n\nYou can pick up wood at Bosekus's house along the way.
Target: Well, the flame at Crown Point has gone out again. We need someone to re-light it, someone who can survive the trip there. Would you do it? \n\nYou can pick up wood at Bosekus's house along the way.

Source: A special recipe. Drink it down and you can see and hear beings that exist beyond the spectrum of our pedestrian perceptions.\n\nIt's really a remarkable experience. You haven't lived until you've heard the song of the elusive sand-whales of Elsweyr.
Target: A special recipe. Drink it down and you can see and hear beings that exist beyond the spectrum of our pedestrian perceptions.\n\nIt's really a remarkable experience. You haven't lived until you've heard the song of the elusive sand-whales of Elsweyr.

Source: Ugh. Something very unpleasant.\n\nApparently a new variety of skooma made landfall in Senchal recently. This new formula prompts even more intense hallucinations, but claims the lives of users at three-times the rate of traditional skooma.
Target: Ugh. Something very unpleasant.\n\nApparently a new variety of skooma made landfall in Senchal recently. This new formula prompts even more intense hallucinations, but claims the lives of users at three-times the rate of traditional skooma.

Source: "Your old granny Alyxe needs a few extra elixirs for bubbling and rubbing.\n\nBrew up what I need and deliver it to one of those crafting boxes near big towns." —Alyxe
Target: \\"Your old granny Alyxe needs a few extra elixirs for bubbling and rubbing.\n\nBrew up what I need and deliver it to one of those crafting boxes near big towns.\"\" —Alyxe"

Source: I need to meet with Jorunn the Skald-King's agent in Solitude, the capital city of Western Skyrim's Haafingar Hold. The agent is investigating a potential threat to not only Skyrim, but to all of Tamriel.
Target: I need to meet with Jorunn the Skald-King's agent in Solitude, the capital city of Western Skyrim's Haafingar Hold. The agent is investigating a potential threat to not only Skyrim, but to all of Tamriel.

Source: The Dominion set up a camp at Bogmother, possibly looking for relics they can use to control the nearby dreugh.
Target: The Dominion set up a camp at Bogmother, possibly looking for relics they can use to control the nearby dreugh.

Source: An Orc shaman named Grodagur is investigating dark rituals among Ayleid ruins. He's asked me to seek Laganakh in the village to learn more.
Target: An Orc shaman named Grodagur is investigating dark rituals among Ayleid ruins. He's asked me to seek Laganakh in the village to learn more.

Source: Seeking skilled alchemists to fulfill simple requisitions. Your potions may change a life! Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!
Target: 간단한 의뢰를 수행할 수 있는 숙련된 연금술사를 찾습니다. 당신의 포션이 인생을 바꿀 수도 있습니다! 구체적인 의뢰를 잘 읽어 보시고 게시판에서 의뢰서를 가져가세요!

Source: Seeking skilled provisioners to fulfill simple contracts. Your food or drink could make the difference! Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!
Target: 간단한 계약을 수행할 수 있는 숙련된 요리사를 찾습니다. 당신의 음식과 음료는 차이를 만들어낼 수 있습니다! 구체적인 의뢰를 잘 읽어 보시고 게시판에서 의뢰서를 가져가세요!

Source: I do. The crew of the Perfect Pounce already helped us on one Dragon hunt. I'd like you to see if they'd join us for many more.\n\nSpeak to Za'ji and see if he and his crew want to join our order.
Target: I do. The crew of the Perfect Pounce already helped us on one Dragon hunt. I'd like you to see if they'd join us for many more.\n\nSpeak to Za'ji and see if he and his crew want to join our order.

Source: Seeking skilled provisioners to fulfill simple contracts. Your food or drink could make the difference! Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!
Target: 간단한 계약을 수행할 수 있는 숙련된 요리사를 찾습니다. 당신의 음식과 음료는 차이를 만들어낼 수 있습니다! 구체적인 의뢰를 잘 읽어 보시고 게시판에서 의뢰서를 가져가세요!

Source: Seeking skilled alchemists to fulfill simple requisitions. Your potions may change a life! Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!
Target: 간단한 의뢰를 수행할 수 있는 숙련된 연금술사를 찾습니다. 당신의 포션이 인생을 바꿀 수도 있습니다! 구체적인 의뢰를 잘 읽어 보시고 게시판에서 의뢰서를 가져가세요!

Source: This room housed a priceless tapestry called Khajiit of the Moons, but a gang of Alfiq degenerates shredded it and ran off with the pieces.\n\nThe damage cannot be undone, but if Bebbia had the pieces, she could restore some of its glory.
Target: This room housed a priceless tapestry called Khajiit of the Moons, but a gang of Alfiq degenerates shredded it and ran off with the pieces.\n\nThe damage cannot be undone, but if Bebbia had the pieces, she could restore some of its glory.

Source: Seeking skilled provisioners to fulfill simple opportunities. Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!
Target: 간단한 의뢰를 수행할 수 있는 숙련된 요리사를 찾습니다. 구체적인 의뢰를 잘 읽어 보시고 게시판에서 의뢰서를 가져가세요!

Source: A Dragon punted that wagon like a vosh ball. With me inside.\n\nThere were two others in there with me. I think the kidnappers dragged them out. Tough to remember. I banged my head pretty good. My skull's thick, but it ain't that thick, you know?
Target: A Dragon punted that wagon like a vosh ball. With me inside.\n\nThere were two others in there with me. I think the kidnappers dragged them out. Tough to remember. I banged my head pretty good. My skull's thick, but it ain't that thick, you know?

Source: Icereach. It's a spooky island fortress out in the Sea of Ghosts. Used to belong to the Nords, now it belongs to a coven of witches. The worst sort!\n\nI don't make a habit of angering witches, but you're braver than most, eh?
Target: Icereach. It's a spooky island fortress out in the Sea of Ghosts. Used to belong to the Nords, now it belongs to a coven of witches. The worst sort!\n\nI don't make a habit of angering witches, but you're braver than most, eh?

Source: You don't know the half of it! For a Khajiit raised by Orcs in Wrothgar, I always hoped to visit the land of my natural parents. But was I welcomed? No! I was robbed!\n\nMy uncle trusted me. I was going to prove myself. Instead, I'm just a failure.
Target: You don't know the half of it! For a Khajiit raised by Orcs in Wrothgar, I always hoped to visit the land of my natural parents. But was I welcomed? No! I was robbed!\n\nMy uncle trusted me. I was going to prove myself. Instead, I'm just a failure.

Source: The Sea of Ghosts doesn't suffer fools. Never has. But now, some dark magic's driven it mad! Great gales whip around this island, breaking masts like kindling-wood and drowning sailors by the dozens.\n\nHigh King Jorunn sent us to investigate.
Target: The Sea of Ghosts doesn't suffer fools. Never has. But now, some dark magic's driven it mad! Great gales whip around this island, breaking masts like kindling-wood and drowning sailors by the dozens.\n\nHigh King Jorunn sent us to investigate.

Source: Yes! Sacrilegious smugglers and sugar-tooths! They came in their skiffs and turned our sacred shrines into skooma stills! Now the waters stink of their scummy stock.\n\nShaveskins, the lot of them!
Target: Yes! Sacrilegious smugglers and sugar-tooths! They came in their skiffs and turned our sacred shrines into skooma stills! Now the waters stink of their scummy stock.\n\nShaveskins, the lot of them!

Source: Blademaster Sai Sahan is ready to journey to Southern Elsweyr and search for the Horn of Ja'darri. He has requested your aid in this matter.\n\nWe should depart at once for the Abbey of Blades.
Target: Blademaster Sai Sahan is ready to journey to Southern Elsweyr and search for the Horn of Ja'darri. He has requested your aid in this matter.\n\nWe should depart at once for the Abbey of Blades.

Source: Seeking skilled alchemists to fulfill simple requisitions. Your potions may change a life! Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!
Target: 간단한 의뢰를 수행할 수 있는 숙련된 연금술사를 찾습니다. 당신의 포션이 인생을 바꿀 수도 있습니다! 구체적인 의뢰를 잘 읽어 보시고 게시판에서 의뢰서를 가져가세요!

Source: Seeking skilled alchemists to fulfill simple requisitions. Your potions may change a life! Carefully examine specific orders as you take them from the board!
Target: 간단한 의뢰를 수행할 수 있는 숙련된 연금술사를 찾습니다. 당신의 포션이 인생을 바꿀 수도 있습니다! 구체적인 의뢰를 잘 읽어 보시고 게시판에서 의뢰서를 가져가세요!

Source: Maugh delivered a message to me from Princess Svana. She wants to talk to me at the Lonely Troll before she meets with the high king.
Target: Maugh delivered a message to me from Princess Svana. She wants to talk to me at the Lonely Troll before she meets with the high king.

Source: I found a whistle in a backpack in a cave full of durzog. I should try to use the whistle on the durzogs and then see if anyone in Orsinium is interested in the thing.
Target: I found a whistle in a backpack in a cave full of durzog. I should try to use the whistle on the durzogs and then see if anyone in Orsinium is interested in the thing.

Source: The Unhallowed Grave. Way I hear it, a band of good-for-nothing graverobbers and necromancers called the Draugrkin descended on the place. Scooping up bones and ash, for some reason.\n\nI wager those rascals will provide a fair challenge.
Target: The Unhallowed Grave. Way I hear it, a band of good-for-nothing graverobbers and necromancers called the Draugrkin descended on the place. Scooping up bones and ash, for some reason.\n\nI wager those rascals will provide a fair challenge.

Source: I'M LOOKING FOR SOMETHING. PLEASE BRING IT.
Target: I'M LOOKING FOR SOMETHING. PLEASE BRING IT.

Source: You … I see no deception in your eyes. Perhaps Tu'whacca has not forsaken us after all.\n\nI belong to an ancient fraternity of guardians called the Pyre Watch. We have but one duty: to protect this burial site from the servants of evil. We failed.
Target: You … I see no deception in your eyes. Perhaps Tu'whacca has not forsaken us after all.\n\nI belong to an ancient fraternity of guardians called the Pyre Watch. We have but one duty: to protect this burial site from the servants of evil. We failed.

Source: Lucky for us, I have work. It's tough, but it pays well.\n\nBasically, a scholar decided to study a temple. Ran astray of a guardian. Now we want that guardian dead. Oh, and the scholar's friends want any notes you can find.
Target: Lucky for us, I have work. It's tough, but it pays well.\n\nBasically, a scholar decided to study a temple. Ran astray of a guardian. Now we want that guardian dead. Oh, and the scholar's friends want any notes you can find.

Source: Yeah. A supply wagon driver, in their infinite wisdom, ignored our scouts' advice and took a shortcut through a guarded temple. We're short arrows now.\n\nI need people who can destroy the guardian and retrieve some of our arrows.
Target: Yeah. A supply wagon driver, in their infinite wisdom, ignored our scouts' advice and took a shortcut through a guarded temple. We're short arrows now.\n\nI need people who can destroy the guardian and retrieve some of our arrows.

Source: And I'm recruiting people who need work. Happy coincidence, yeah?\n\nA rogue Goutfang and his students waylaid one of our supply caravans. Took a bunch of rice. We need that rice. We also need that group of adepts dead.
Target: And I'm recruiting people who need work. Happy coincidence, yeah?\n\nA rogue Goutfang and his students waylaid one of our supply caravans. Took a bunch of rice. We need that rice. We also need that group of adepts dead.

Source: Yeah, I do. I have a territorial Meridian guardian that needs killing. Some folk also need temple dust, which, coincidentally, the guardian protects.
Target: Yeah, I do. I have a territorial Meridian guardian that needs killing. Some folk also need temple dust, which, coincidentally, the guardian protects.

Source: Yeah, I do. A rogue Goutfang master's training students right on a patch of springmint. Our healers need it. Got to keep people fighting Dragons.
Target: Yeah, I do. A rogue Goutfang master's training students right on a patch of springmint. Our healers need it. Got to keep people fighting Dragons.

Source: Honestly? No. Far from it. I find myself plagued by unsettling dreams.\n\nEvery night since my mother died, my mind returns to this place. I see a man scribbling a letter. I hold my mother's necklace out to him. His eyes turn to me, then I wake.
Target: Honestly? No. Far from it. I find myself plagued by unsettling dreams.\n\nEvery night since my mother died, my mind returns to this place. I see a man scribbling a letter. I hold my mother's necklace out to him. His eyes turn to me, then I wake.

Source: Straight to the heart of things, eh? Excellent!\n\nA wealthy client of mine pays through the nose for any foreign books I can get my hands on. Apparently, a few sealed Akaviri tomes still rest on the bookshelves in the Forsaken Citadel.
Target: Straight to the heart of things, eh? Excellent!\n\nA wealthy client of mine pays through the nose for any foreign books I can get my hands on. Apparently, a few sealed Akaviri tomes still rest on the bookshelves in the Forsaken Citadel.

Source: I found a blood-stained chalice on Lord Falgravn's corpse. I should deliver it to Thane Ogvar.
Target: I found a blood-stained chalice on Lord Falgravn's corpse. I should deliver it to Thane Ogvar.

Source: I found a vile amulet on Lord Falgravn's corpse. I should deliver it to Thane Ogvar.
Target: I found a vile amulet on Lord Falgravn's corpse. I should deliver it to Thane Ogvar.

Source: What makes you think that?
Target: What makes you think that?

Source: <Accept this contract.>
Target: <Accept this contract.>

Source: <<1>> robbed me of my husband's mind, but <<2>> is to blame. She secretly worships Boethiah—the Daedric Prince of murder.\n\nHer prayers brought about <<3>>'s death. I just … I haven't found the proof.
Target: <<1>> robbed me of my husband's mind, but <<2>> is to blame. She secretly worships Boethiah—the Daedric Prince of murder.\n\nHer prayers brought about <<3>>'s death. I just … I haven't found the proof.

Source: It's Prince Naemon. Poor old boy's been raised from the dead himself. But he's not himself … no trace of the hero Ayrenn says he was in life. \n\nHe's pure evil now, and from what we can tell he's the one leading the undead army.
Target: It's Prince Naemon. Poor old boy's been raised from the dead himself. But he's not himself … no trace of the hero Ayrenn says he was in life. \n\nHe's pure evil now, and from what we can tell he's the one leading the undead army.

Source: <Accept this contract.>
Target: <Accept this contract.>

Source: Of course I know what the king wants. He wants to see you. Immediately.\n\nDo you have any other pointless questions you'd like me to answer for you?
Target: Of course I know what the king wants. He wants to see you. Immediately.\n\nDo you have any other pointless questions you'd like me to answer for you?

Source: The Sea Vipers are after a relic called the Sphere of Storms. The stormwardens use it to control weather, so they say.\n\nI must run for reinforcements. Please, will you help <<1>> protect the sphere until I return?
Target: The Sea Vipers are after a relic called the Sphere of Storms. The stormwardens use it to control weather, so they say.\n\nI must run for reinforcements. Please, will you help <<1>> protect the sphere until I return?

Source: You. Coming here, thinking you're better than us? Think again.
Target: You. Coming here, thinking you're better than us? Think again.

Source: The Mane … we were escorting him to the handfast, when something happened. He stumbled as we crossed the bridge. We stopped to help him and he … he just went mad. He attacked us with tooth and claw … and something else.
Target: The Mane … we were escorting him to the handfast, when something happened. He stumbled as we crossed the bridge. We stopped to help him and he … he just went mad. He attacked us with tooth and claw … and something else.

Source: I am Mezha-dro, follower of Meridia. \n\nColdharbour has been merging with choice regions of Tamriel, and this border realm alone has taken three villages, absorbed them through tears in space. My Lady tasked me to hinder this. It's been … difficult.
Target: I am Mezha-dro, follower of Meridia. \n\nColdharbour has been merging with choice regions of Tamriel, and this border realm alone has taken three villages, absorbed them through tears in space. My Lady tasked me to hinder this. It's been … difficult.

Source: Look around! There are Colovians everywhere! \n\nI'm taking stock, gathering some intel. If you want to jump in yourself, go find the Captain. Odreth will be in the central tree.
Target: Look around! There are Colovians everywhere! \n\nI'm taking stock, gathering some intel. If you want to jump in yourself, go find the Captain. Odreth will be in the central tree.

Source: Oh, that's just great! I fall unconscious for a moment or two and Raynor runs off into the wilderness without me!\n\nIt was that Dwarven power core you got for us in Zthenganaz. Raynor had to go and tinker again! That's always how the trouble starts.
Target: Oh, that's just great! I fall unconscious for a moment or two and Raynor runs off into the wilderness without me!\n\nIt was that Dwarven power core you got for us in Zthenganaz. Raynor had to go and tinker again! That's always how the trouble starts.

Source: Ritemaster Iachesis of the Psijic Order hopes to learn more from the abyssal pearl. Specifically, he wants to determine where K'Tora and the Sea Sload cabal are hiding. I agreed to help in any way I can.

Source: Hermaeus Mora asked me to bring him unique relics from across Craglorn in exchange for knowledge of the Celestials.
Target: Hermaeus Mora asked me to bring him unique relics from across Craglorn in exchange for knowledge of the Celestials.

Source: I learned of a free inn room being offered to a tenant of good reputation. I should seek out the broker in order to ask for more information about this amazing deal.
Target: I learned of a free inn room being offered to a tenant of good reputation. I should seek out the broker in order to ask for more information about this amazing deal.

Source: I learned of a free inn room being offered to a tenant of good reputation. I should seek out the broker in order to ask for more information about this amazing deal.
Target: I learned of a free inn room being offered to a tenant of good reputation. I should seek out the broker in order to ask for more information about this amazing deal.

Source: Hermaeus Mora asked me to bring him unique relics from across Craglorn. In exchange for such offerings, he promised to grant me knowledge of the Celestials.
Target: Hermaeus Mora asked me to bring him unique relics from across Craglorn. In exchange for such offerings, he promised to grant me knowledge of the Celestials.

Source: For the moment—but it's early yet. Still plenty of chances to get killed, right?\n\nBut enough small talk. Can you manage a few more civilian rescues? Same trick as last time, if you're up for it.
Target: For the moment—but it's early yet. Still plenty of chances to get killed, right?\n\nBut enough small talk. Can you manage a few more civilian rescues? Same trick as last time, if you're up for it.

Source: I hate to say it, but we can't save everyone. I can smuggle out maybe a dozen at a time without being caught. Any more than that and it's suicide.\n\nI've scrounged up a bit of coin. Help me rescue these people and it's yours. What do you say?
Target: I hate to say it, but we can't save everyone. I can smuggle out maybe a dozen at a time without being caught. Any more than that and it's suicide.\n\nI've scrounged up a bit of coin. Help me rescue these people and it's yours. What do you say?

Source: Viggol reached seventy-three years old last month, but still thinks he can adventure like he's twenty! He heard rumors about strange creatures picking off miners down here, so he and Pickle set out to kill a few for old times' sake.
Target: Viggol reached seventy-three years old last month, but still thinks he can adventure like he's twenty! He heard rumors about strange creatures picking off miners down here, so he and Pickle set out to kill a few for old times' sake.

Source: My contact in Legion Zero, Captain Regilus, is missing. He's sharp. Tenacious. A good man—I guess. Anyway, I haven't heard from him in weeks. He drank that Coldharbour brew to maintain his cover. I'm afraid it may have gotten the better of him.
Target: My contact in Legion Zero, Captain Regilus, is missing. He's sharp. Tenacious. A good man—I guess. Anyway, I haven't heard from him in weeks. He drank that Coldharbour brew to maintain his cover. I'm afraid it may have gotten the better of him.

Source: Not officially … at least I don't think so. I feel like the whole world's crumbling around me. But the city's still standing, so that's something.\n\nI'm more worried about our friends. We left Lyris and Fenn to hold off a horde of harrowfiends.
Target: Not officially … at least I don't think so. I feel like the whole world's crumbling around me. But the city's still standing, so that's something.\n\nI'm more worried about our friends. We left Lyris and Fenn to hold off a horde of harrowfiends.

Source: That's the spirit! \n\nOur sappers have established a forward base in the city's sewers. The position is defensible, but they need more troops. The Daedra are dug in like hoarvors, and the Covenant and Dominion are making steady gains.
Target: That's the spirit! \n\nOur sappers have established a forward base in the city's sewers. The position is defensible, but they need more troops. The Daedra are dug in like hoarvors, and the Covenant and Dominion are making steady gains.

Source: How should I know. She's just staring out over the city like some kind of gargoyle. She could use someone to talk to, I think.\n\nThat's not me anymore.
Target: How should I know. She's just staring out over the city like some kind of gargoyle. She could use someone to talk to, I think.\n\nThat's not me anymore.

Source: I found a cache of auricular geodes. We can use them to spy on the Worm Cult's plans.\n\nBut you see, the geodes are dormant. Proximity to a dying Xivkyn should empower them … but my superiors refuse to test the theory.
Target: I found a cache of auricular geodes. We can use them to spy on the Worm Cult's plans.\n\nBut you see, the geodes are dormant. Proximity to a dying Xivkyn should empower them … but my superiors refuse to test the theory.

Source: The Cane and the something, something …. It's fiction. Useless. But it's still part of our heritage. We have to keep it safe.\n\nThe Daedra have been torching every book they can find. All except one. It's a tome of some kind, kept locked away.
Target: The Cane and the something, something …. It's fiction. Useless. But it's still part of our heritage. We have to keep it safe.\n\nThe Daedra have been torching every book they can find. All except one. It's a tome of some kind, kept locked away.

Source: The Daedra have toppled our idols, shattered our relics, and imprisoned our clergy. Now they seek to destroy our sacred oils! J'Reeza cannot watch them destroy another instrument of faith.\n\nI have a way to stop them … but I hesitate to use it.
Target: The Daedra have toppled our idols, shattered our relics, and imprisoned our clergy. Now they seek to destroy our sacred oils! J'Reeza cannot watch them destroy another instrument of faith.\n\nI have a way to stop them … but I hesitate to use it.

Source: Yeah. I don't know all the details. Just heard a loud rumble and miners scrambling out of the mine shouting and coughing.\n\nWay I hear it, some workers are still trapped inside. Not sure what the chief plans to do about it, honestly. Ugly business.
Target: Yeah. I don't know all the details. Just heard a loud rumble and miners scrambling out of the mine shouting and coughing.\n\nWay I hear it, some workers are still trapped inside. Not sure what the chief plans to do about it, honestly. Ugly business.

Source: I do. Kurog was my friend once. And he was a great Orc before his ambition got the better of him.\n\nBesides, the people need to know the whole truth, the good as well as the bad. A traditional Orc requiem is just what we need to get past this.
Target: I do. Kurog was my friend once. And he was a great Orc before his ambition got the better of him.\n\nBesides, the people need to know the whole truth, the good as well as the bad. A traditional Orc requiem is just what we need to get past this.

Source: It's overrun with mindless beasts! An enormous storm appeared over the town as I came up the road. When I got there, it was chaos. Monsters attacking any who still lived. I barely escaped with my life.
Target: It's overrun with mindless beasts! An enormous storm appeared over the town as I came up the road. When I got there, it was chaos. Monsters attacking any who still lived. I barely escaped with my life.

Source: Custom to place the arms and armor on a fallen warrior's cairn. Grandfather fell not far from here. Managed to retrieve his body, but saw an ogre with his helm.\n\nWant to go back for it, but … it's a big ogre.
Target: Custom to place the arms and armor on a fallen warrior's cairn. Grandfather fell not far from here. Managed to retrieve his body, but saw an ogre with his helm.\n\nWant to go back for it, but … it's a big ogre.

Source: That's the spirit! \n\nOur sappers have established a forward base in the city's sewers. The position is defensible, but they need more troops. The Daedra are dug in like hoarvors, and the Pact and Dominion are making steady gains.
Target: That's the spirit! \n\nOur sappers have established a forward base in the city's sewers. The position is defensible, but they need more troops. The Daedra are dug in like hoarvors, and the Pact and Dominion are making steady gains.

Source: When the mine collapsed, creatures attacked from below. Thulsgreg and his wife, Mazog, locked the door to keep the beasts contained, then Mazog hid the key.\n\nWe need to get in there, but making either of them see reason has proven … difficult.
Target: When the mine collapsed, creatures attacked from below. Thulsgreg and his wife, Mazog, locked the door to keep the beasts contained, then Mazog hid the key.\n\nWe need to get in there, but making either of them see reason has proven … difficult.

Source: You did it! Just look at them all—on display and waiting to be played. Maestro Nel would be happy to see them back, I think.\n\nNo more reveries! We must celebrate this historic occasion. It is time for a salskap!
Target: You did it! Just look at them all—on display and waiting to be played. Maestro Nel would be happy to see them back, I think.\n\nNo more reveries! We must celebrate this historic occasion. It is time for a salskap!

Target: So, you remember the deal? Bait and reset my Ogrim traps using this Daedrat meat, and cut down any Legion Zero soldiers you see. An honest day's work for an honest day's pay. I'll meet you in your alliance base when you've finished the job!

Target: I'm a humble healer from Dragon Bridge. My family—my brother, my sister, and I—we came to gather plants and other medicinal ingredients. \n\nHedrynne wandered too close to this cave. That's when the chaurus attacked her.

Source: A temple dedicated to Meridia, the Lady of Light. Pilgrims come from across Skyrim to pray and seek blessings, especially at this time of the year.\n\nPlease, talk to Priest Bavian. You'll find her in the nearby cave, tending to the injured.

Source: Hunting. Surprised? I'll tell you the truth—there's a lot of money to be made here. Daedra hearts, Ogrim tusks, Dremora horns … the alchemists and Khajiiti smugglers can't get enough.\n\nI'll cut you in on the action, if you lend me a hand.

Source: The ballistae! We've got to cull the herd a bit, or there won't be a city left to save, yeah? \n\nI know they look all dark and spooky, but they burn well enough. Trust me. Put a few to the torch. That'll put a bee up Legion Zero's britches.

Source: Not right now. Other members of the Ravenwatch came here ahead of me. They'll be interested in the vampire we saw and I need to get word to them.\n\nBesides, I want to follow the trail while it's fresh. So, it only makes sense that you warn Solitude.

Source: Information. The Icereach Coven … at work in the west. Just need more proof.\n\nGo! They're coming.

Source: QUEST: Incidental Damage
Target: QUEST: Incidental Damage

Source: A storm exploded above our temple, but it was unlike any weather ever seen in Skyrim. It raged like a thing alive, hungry and violent.\n\nI gathered who I could and led them to this cave, but the others are still out there. They need our help.
Target: A storm exploded above our temple, but it was unlike any weather ever seen in Skyrim. It raged like a thing alive, hungry and violent.\n\nI gathered who I could and led them to this cave, but the others are still out there. They need our help.

Source: Unfortunately, we've only recovered a few of the medallions. And Magister Fridelja hasn't determined what enchantment the medallions use to provide their protection.\n\nWe need another solution.
Target: Unfortunately, we've only recovered a few of the medallions. And Magister Fridelja hasn't determined what enchantment the medallions use to provide their protection.\n\nWe need another solution.

Source: You're right. I know you're right. It's just—he's my father!\n\nNo, I have to focus. There's a harrowstorm coming. We have to save the city. That's what's important right now.

Source: Tusk if I know. I heard that something sordid occurred at the palace, but she wouldn't give me any details.\n\nSomething to do with the high king. She did mention an impending doom, though. Hence, my suddenly sober outlook.
Target: Tusk if I know. I heard that something sordid occurred at the palace, but she wouldn't give me any details.\n\nSomething to do with the high king. She did mention an impending doom, though. Hence, my suddenly sober outlook.

Source: Uh … look up. It's hard to miss.\n\nLady Essenia, the Blood Queen, holds court inside. Or at least she did. Apparently, she bent the knee to some ancient vampire from the west. She's called on every vampire in Skyrim to join her here and do likewise.
Target: Uh … look up. It's hard to miss.\n\nLady Essenia, the Blood Queen, holds court inside. Or at least she did. Apparently, she bent the knee to some ancient vampire from the west. She's called on every vampire in Skyrim to join her here and do likewise.

Source: A storm straight out of Mauloch's guts rose up as I returned from patrol.  It twisted everyone I know into monsters.\n\nIn the chaos, I saw my brother Hafskjar and his friend Bjora take people to the barrow west of town. But I've heard nothing since.
Target: A storm straight out of Mauloch's guts rose up as I returned from patrol.  It twisted everyone I know into monsters.\n\nIn the chaos, I saw my brother Hafskjar and his friend Bjora take people to the barrow west of town. But I've heard nothing since.

Source: The Bards College, of course. We who pluck heart strings and chill the blood. \n\nYears ago, our prized antique instruments were, uh, borrowed by an overzealous member. She meant to heal a rift within the college, but it only made things worse.

Target: Got into a tangle with a spriggan in the Shadowgreen. Think it wanted to take root in my guts. I'll live, provided I can get off this mountain before it explodes.\n\nFriendly word of warning: the mountain's going to explode.

Source: That daft artificer, Raynor Vanos, has put in a contract with the company. He wants us to collect information on some rusty old Dwarf junk down in Zthenganaz. Says its going to "further his experiments." Don't much like the sound of that.
Target: That daft artificer, Raynor Vanos, has put in a contract with the company. He wants us to collect information on some rusty old Dwarf junk down in Zthenganaz. Says its going to \\"further his experiments.\"\" Don't much like the sound of that."

Source: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are hereby ordered to secure the Arena District rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."
