Source: QUEST: A Crossroad
Target: QUEST: A Crossroad

Source: What do you think? The princess just learned that her father is an evil vampire and he's about to unleash a harrowstorm on Solitude! She needs to figure out how to stop him—and she needs your help to do it!
Target: What do you think? The princess just learned that her father is an evil vampire and he's about to unleash a harrowstorm on Solitude! She needs to figure out how to stop him—and she needs your help to do it!

Source: He is my mate. My life partner. He came to the Caravan to bet on the games, to win gold so that we could make a life together. Foolish <<1>>. No coin is worth his life.
Target: He is my mate. My life partner. He came to the Caravan to bet on the games, to win gold so that we could make a life together. Foolish <<1>>. No coin is worth his life.

Source: Solitude has been through much. Now is the time to heal and rebuild. But they can't do it alone. They need Princess Svana.\n\nAnd Princess Svana needs your counsel.
Target: Solitude has been through much. Now is the time to heal and rebuild. But they can't do it alone. They need Princess Svana.\n\nAnd Princess Svana needs your counsel.

Source: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are hereby ordered to secure the Temple District rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."
Target: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are hereby ordered to secure the Temple District rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."

Source: Suit yourself. Just south of my home, you'll find the Petitioning Stone.\n\nJust touch it. Probably, nothing will happen. If he wants to speak with you though, he'll appear when you touch that stone.
Target: Suit yourself. Just south of my home, you'll find the Petitioning Stone.\n\nJust touch it. Probably, nothing will happen. If he wants to speak with you though, he'll appear when you touch that stone.

Source: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are hereby ordered to secure the Nobles District rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."
Target: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are hereby ordered to secure the Nobles District rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."

Source: Princess Svana, of course. Her father still refuses to act, so the princess has decided to take matters into her own hands.\n\nLuckily, she has my darling Fennorian to assist her. He has a plan for dealing with the harrowstorms, I hear.
Target: Princess Svana, of course. Her father still refuses to act, so the princess has decided to take matters into her own hands.\n\nLuckily, she has my darling Fennorian to assist her. He has a plan for dealing with the harrowstorms, I hear.

Source: Hmm. This one might tug on the old heart strings.\n\nOur client, Thazeg, represents a whole mess of Orcs who lost loved ones to that dung-heel sorcerer, Gorlar the Dark. Sounds like most of their friends and relatives got turned into undead thralls.
Target: Hmm. This one might tug on the old heart strings.\n\nOur client, Thazeg, represents a whole mess of Orcs who lost loved ones to that dung-heel sorcerer, Gorlar the Dark. Sounds like most of their friends and relatives got turned into undead thralls.

Source: Every moment, the spirit of High Kinlord Rilis jeers and plays tricks on me.\n\nHe haunts these walls—and I am his Keeper, his warden. The only one left. Rilis has swayed the other Keepers to his side, and plans to attack Tamriel from his prison.
Target: Every moment, the spirit of High Kinlord Rilis jeers and plays tricks on me.\n\nHe haunts these walls—and I am his Keeper, his warden. The only one left. Rilis has swayed the other Keepers to his side, and plans to attack Tamriel from his prison.

Source: I need a Giant slayer. And not just any Giant, a Sea Giant. Made landfall just today and promptly slaughtered a patrol of the king's soldiers on the coast, save for the one who brought us word.
Target: I need a Giant slayer. And not just any Giant, a Sea Giant. Made landfall just today and promptly slaughtered a patrol of the king's soldiers on the coast, save for the one who brought us word.

Source: Says here the client needs someone to head down into the Kennel. She wants to get her hands on some of their special durzog chow. Apparently the slop they're slinging down there is as good as it gets.\n\nFunny. I thought durzogs just ate other durzogs.
Target: Says here the client needs someone to head down into the Kennel. She wants to get her hands on some of their special durzog chow. Apparently the slop they're slinging down there is as good as it gets.\n\nFunny. I thought durzogs just ate other durzogs.

Source: To make them more effective, of course! The guardians protect the village, and now we can imbue each of them with different elemental tactics. \n\nAnd the best part is that building them isn't even hard. It's easy!
Target: To make them more effective, of course! The guardians protect the village, and now we can imbue each of them with different elemental tactics. \n\nAnd the best part is that building them isn't even hard. It's easy!

Source: Lyris Titanborn reminds you that the Skald-King's business hasn't been concluded. The plans of the Icereach Coven remain a mystery.\n\nBut I understand that the two of you discovered something important in the Ratway.
Target: Lyris Titanborn reminds you that the Skald-King's business hasn't been concluded. The plans of the Icereach Coven remain a mystery.\n\nBut I understand that the two of you discovered something important in the Ratway.

Source: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are ordered to secure the Elven Gardens District rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."
Target: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are ordered to secure the Elven Gardens District rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."

Source: QUEST: Aldcroft Manor
Target: QUEST: Aldcroft Manor

Source: QUEST: Thieving from Thieves
Target: QUEST: Thieving from Thieves

Source: Dying. No amount of healing magic can fix smashed brains.\n\nSoon as he goes, Shatul is in for dark times. The clan will tear itself apart without a good contender for chief. I want to prevent that.
Target: Dying. No amount of healing magic can fix smashed brains.\n\nSoon as he goes, Shatul is in for dark times. The clan will tear itself apart without a good contender for chief. I want to prevent that.

Source: Well, not me, exactly. I came to Wrothgar to elevate my status and here I am running errands for the Orcs. Somewhat ignoble, but what can I say?\n\nAnyway, your assistance against the Winterborn and in recovering their supplies hasn't gone unnoticed.
Target: Well, not me, exactly. I came to Wrothgar to elevate my status and here I am running errands for the Orcs. Somewhat ignoble, but what can I say?\n\nAnyway, your assistance against the Winterborn and in recovering their supplies hasn't gone unnoticed.

Source: I have many names in many places. In this plane, in this place, you shall know me as the Groundskeeper. I am one of the few survivors of this city. I tend to its needs. Keep its magic strong.
Target: I have many names in many places. In this plane, in this place, you shall know me as the Groundskeeper. I am one of the few survivors of this city. I tend to its needs. Keep its magic strong.

Source: The Orcs near Mor Khazgur hold tests of strength to find worthy leaders. The victors often go on to rule clans or lead armies.\n\nUnfortunately, the newest champion has been accused of cheating, and that's got the Orcs in an uproar.
Target: The Orcs near Mor Khazgur hold tests of strength to find worthy leaders. The victors often go on to rule clans or lead armies.\n\nUnfortunately, the newest champion has been accused of cheating, and that's got the Orcs in an uproar.

Source: A Covenant force lead by a mage named Alexandra Conele has invaded Vivec's Antlers. They're after a powerful artifact called the Coral Heart.\n\nWe tried to take Vivec's Antlers back, but her army almost wiped us out.
Target: A Covenant force lead by a mage named Alexandra Conele has invaded Vivec's Antlers. They're after a powerful artifact called the Coral Heart.\n\nWe tried to take Vivec's Antlers back, but her army almost wiped us out.

Source: Orsinium may have started as a home for the Orcs, but it's becoming a city of immigrants. More arrive by the hour—mostly by caravan. Unfortunately, the trip can be treacherous. Riekr attacks have increased tenfold since the king opened the borders.
Target: Orsinium may have started as a home for the Orcs, but it's becoming a city of immigrants. More arrive by the hour—mostly by caravan. Unfortunately, the trip can be treacherous. Riekr attacks have increased tenfold since the king opened the borders.

Source: I had someone else in mind. Argonian keepers know the history and legends of their lands. I'm positive one of the keepers at <<A:1>> could tell us of <<A:2>>.
Target: I had someone else in mind. Argonian keepers know the history and legends of their lands. I'm positive one of the keepers at <<A:1>> could tell us of <<A:2>>.

Source: You've heard about Dragon Mounds, right? They're ancient Dragon burial sites. Centuries old, the Dragon War, the Dragon Cult —\n\nI'm overexplaining. The job is simple. I just need some charcoal rubbings from those mounds.
Target: You've heard about Dragon Mounds, right? They're ancient Dragon burial sites. Centuries old, the Dragon War, the Dragon Cult —\n\nI'm overexplaining. The job is simple. I just need some charcoal rubbings from those mounds.

Source: I have no idea, although I did hear something or other about a moot of some kind.\n\nI suppose the best way to find out is to go and see the king.
Target: I have no idea, although I did hear something or other about a moot of some kind.\n\nI suppose the best way to find out is to go and see the king.

Source: I'd like you to cut down every Dominion soldier you see, but a quieter approach is more prudent.\n\nEither way, find <<1>>. He'll know how to buy time until I arrive with reinforcements.
Target: I'd like you to cut down every Dominion soldier you see, but a quieter approach is more prudent.\n\nEither way, find <<1>>. He'll know how to buy time until I arrive with reinforcements.

Source: A goatherd has been complaining about wolves preying on his goats for weeks. Normally, that wouldn't be of much concern, but the last volunteer we sent came back on his shield with his guts torn out. Turns out the goat snatchers are werewolves.
Target: A goatherd has been complaining about wolves preying on his goats for weeks. Normally, that wouldn't be of much concern, but the last volunteer we sent came back on his shield with his guts torn out. Turns out the goat snatchers are werewolves.

Source: <<1>> is one of our little fish, our eyes and ears. He signals when he possesses urgent information for the vicecanons. A short while ago, we received his signal.\n\nBe swift and silent as currents in a stream. Speak with <<1>> on our behalf.
Target: <<1>> is one of our little fish, our eyes and ears. He signals when he possesses urgent information for the vicecanons. A short while ago, we received his signal.\n\nBe swift and silent as currents in a stream. Speak with <<1>> on our behalf.

Source: One of our elder shamans insists there's an arcane corruption spreading through the hills and forests of Wrothgar. Says it's been stirring up the animals and making them more aggressive. If that's true, this blight will have to be cleansed.
Target: One of our elder shamans insists there's an arcane corruption spreading through the hills and forests of Wrothgar. Says it's been stirring up the animals and making them more aggressive. If that's true, this blight will have to be cleansed.

Source: Ah yes. You're the one he mentioned. He'll be glad you're here.\n\nThe Veiled Heritance were one thing, but the undead are too much. They're Blackroot Clan. They were a cruel lot even when they were living, and now, they're even worse.
Target: Ah yes. You're the one he mentioned. He'll be glad you're here.\n\nThe Veiled Heritance were one thing, but the undead are too much. They're Blackroot Clan. They were a cruel lot even when they were living, and now, they're even worse.

Source: I have no idea. Reading other people's messages is rude and unladylike. I never engage in such actions!\n\nBut the princess had no such qualms about opening the letter. She said if I did happen to see you, that I was to send you to the Blue Palace.
Target: I have no idea. Reading other people's messages is rude and unladylike. I never engage in such actions!\n\nBut the princess had no such qualms about opening the letter. She said if I did happen to see you, that I was to send you to the Blue Palace.

Source: Mercenaries roil Stormhold's waters for no good reason. They move amongst my people, swaggering and taking what they will. Strange they never bother the Dark Elves, yes?\n\nNone here lift a claw to stop them. But you aren't from here, and I have gold.
Target: Mercenaries roil Stormhold's waters for no good reason. They move amongst my people, swaggering and taking what they will. Strange they never bother the Dark Elves, yes?\n\nNone here lift a claw to stop them. But you aren't from here, and I have gold.

Source: Malacath's pyre, at the heart of Old Orsinium. My order lights it every decade, but those of us chosen to set it aflame were ambushed.
Target: Malacath's pyre, at the heart of Old Orsinium. My order lights it every decade, but those of us chosen to set it aflame were ambushed.

Source: We spotted Bloodthorn Cult at Carzog's Demise, an old Ayleid ruin. Warchief Tazgol took our army out there to crush them.\n\nLambur thinks they're walking into a trap. She sent me to find you.
Target: We spotted Bloodthorn Cult at Carzog's Demise, an old Ayleid ruin. Warchief Tazgol took our army out there to crush them.\n\nLambur thinks they're walking into a trap. She sent me to find you.

Source: The market is the beating heart of the city. Our trade policies have brought wealth, yes, but there is no commerce without risk.\n\nTake this Khajiit, Birkhu. He peddles strange Dwarven baubles. They seemed harmless enough, but now I'm not so sure.
Target: The market is the beating heart of the city. Our trade policies have brought wealth, yes, but there is no commerce without risk.\n\nTake this Khajiit, Birkhu. He peddles strange Dwarven baubles. They seemed harmless enough, but now I'm not so sure.

Source: Wow, really? That's uncharacteristically gracious of her. Huh. Well anyway, let's get started.\n\nIt all begins with concentration. The Eye wants to show you what you seek. So, clear your thoughts and conjure up a picture of the relic in your mind.
Target: Wow, really? That's uncharacteristically gracious of her. Huh. Well anyway, let's get started.\n\nIt all begins with concentration. The Eye wants to show you what you seek. So, clear your thoughts and conjure up a picture of the relic in your mind.

Source: <<1>>, a Daedric ruin southeast of here. It's big enough to harbor a substantial enemy force and close enough to trouble Stormhold. Besides, my scouts report signs of activity within.\n\nI'll take a regiment to <<1>>. Don't want to take any chances.
Target: <<1>>, a Daedric ruin southeast of here. It's big enough to harbor a substantial enemy force and close enough to trouble Stormhold. Besides, my scouts report signs of activity within.\n\nI'll take a regiment to <<1>>. Don't want to take any chances.

Source: I've received some troubling reports about Worm Cult activity in Wrothgar. If the worms are here, the king wants them eradicated.\n\nI've already consulted with the Redguard priest, Lilyameh. She says the cultists are trying to summon something.
Target: I've received some troubling reports about Worm Cult activity in Wrothgar. If the worms are here, the king wants them eradicated.\n\nI've already consulted with the Redguard priest, Lilyameh. She says the cultists are trying to summon something.

Source: I was captured shortly after Meridia pushed her city into this dread realm. This prison relies on darkness. Early on, I almost broke free.\n\nNow Molag Bal shapes the darkness itself to bind me, suppressing my attempts to escape.
Target: I was captured shortly after Meridia pushed her city into this dread realm. This prison relies on darkness. Early on, I almost broke free.\n\nNow Molag Bal shapes the darkness itself to bind me, suppressing my attempts to escape.

Source: Fennorian asked me to keep my eyes and ears open. Wants me to pass along news and messages between here and the surface.\n\nI ran into the most interesting Orc on my last visit to Solitude. He was looking for you on behalf of Princess Svana.
Target: Fennorian asked me to keep my eyes and ears open. Wants me to pass along news and messages between here and the surface.\n\nI ran into the most interesting Orc on my last visit to Solitude. He was looking for you on behalf of Princess Svana.

Source: A lifetime of failure. For thirty years, I've hunted my brother's killer. Tracked it all across Skyrim, seeking justice. Somehow, it always managed to vanish.\n\nTell me, have you heard any stories of a monster called the Pale Man?
Target: A lifetime of failure. For thirty years, I've hunted my brother's killer. Tracked it all across Skyrim, seeking justice. Somehow, it always managed to vanish.\n\nTell me, have you heard any stories of a monster called the Pale Man?

Source: The University of Gwylim's most prestigious historical society. We scour the continent for lost antiquities, collecting and cataloging as we go.\n\nWe've made hundreds of discoveries, thanks in no small part to our scrying tool—the Antiquarian's Eye.
Target: The University of Gwylim's most prestigious historical society. We scour the continent for lost antiquities, collecting and cataloging as we go.\n\nWe've made hundreds of discoveries, thanks in no small part to our scrying tool—the Antiquarian's Eye.

Source: If Orsinium is to become the rival of other great cities, we'll need more than buildings. The king wants culture as well.\n\nWe commissioned a High Elf scholar named Cirantille to deliver some of her books to the city, but her shipment was attacked.
Target: If Orsinium is to become the rival of other great cities, we'll need more than buildings. The king wants culture as well.\n\nWe commissioned a High Elf scholar named Cirantille to deliver some of her books to the city, but her shipment was attacked.

Source: Laborers from all over Tamriel have come to Orsinium, eager to carve out a better life. I'm sure I don't need to tell you, it's arduous work. They need hearty meals to stay strong, and there's not enough to go around.
Target: Laborers from all over Tamriel have come to Orsinium, eager to carve out a better life. I'm sure I don't need to tell you, it's arduous work. They need hearty meals to stay strong, and there's not enough to go around.

Source: Dark clouds are gathering over the western kingdom. Harrowstorms, they're called. The conjurings of Reachmen witchcraft.\n\nUnfortunately, there are more reports of these unholy storms than folk willing to brave them.
Target: Dark clouds are gathering over the western kingdom. Harrowstorms, they're called. The conjurings of Reachmen witchcraft.\n\nUnfortunately, there are more reports of these unholy storms than folk willing to brave them.

Source: QUEST: Example Strings
Target: QUEST: Example Strings

Source: Kurog summoned the chiefs of Wrothgar to besiege the Winterborn. One of our biggest problems are those briarheart monstrosities. For every one we kill, two more take its place.\n\nI know there's a solution, but damn if it doesn't keep eluding us!
Target: Kurog summoned the chiefs of Wrothgar to besiege the Winterborn. One of our biggest problems are those briarheart monstrosities. For every one we kill, two more take its place.\n\nI know there's a solution, but damn if it doesn't keep eluding us!

Source: You don't know? Some kind of disease has spread throughout Blackreach. It's turning werewolves mad … feral, almost. And our only hope to find a cure vanished without a trace.
Target: You don't know? Some kind of disease has spread throughout Blackreach. It's turning werewolves mad … feral, almost. And our only hope to find a cure vanished without a trace.

Source: Who do I get to kill next?
Target: Who do I get to kill next?

Source: Do you not remember? Collect Grievous Twilight claws, anoint them with ritual wine, then burn them in a sanctified brazier. I've placed one nearby.\n\nIf you sprinkle the ashes over our casks of consecrated oil, they should be safe from the Daedra.
Target: Do you not remember? Collect Grievous Twilight claws, anoint them with ritual wine, then burn them in a sanctified brazier. I've placed one nearby.\n\nIf you sprinkle the ashes over our casks of consecrated oil, they should be safe from the Daedra.

Source: QUEST: TM01_OUTOFDATE
Target: QUEST: TM01_OUTOFDATE

Source: I serve aboard Materre's Fortune—or at least I did before we wrecked upon the ice.\n\nWe were bringing the ambassador to Wrothgar when a horrendous storm blew up. Sent the fleet off course and crashed us into the frozen shore.
Target: I serve aboard Materre's Fortune—or at least I did before we wrecked upon the ice.\n\nWe were bringing the ambassador to Wrothgar when a horrendous storm blew up. Sent the fleet off course and crashed us into the frozen shore.

Source: The esteemed Goblin-scholar Landal Gavont has commissioned the Coterie to seek evidence of a previously undiscovered tribe living within Chillwind Depths. \n\nAs you'd imagine, the Coterie is eager to substantiate this claim.
Target: The esteemed Goblin-scholar Landal Gavont has commissioned the Coterie to seek evidence of a previously undiscovered tribe living within Chillwind Depths. \n\nAs you'd imagine, the Coterie is eager to substantiate this claim.

Source: <This merchant's permit gives three traders from Daggerfall—Jaeloreh, Travofia, and Nammadin—the rights and privileges necessary to establish a bookseller's shop in Orsinium, and to buy and sell legally within the city.>
Target: <이 상점 허가증은 대거폴에서 온 세명의 무역상들-야엘로레(Jaeloreh), 트라보피아(Travofia), 그리고 나마딘(Nammadin)-에게 오시리움의 서점을 설립할 권리와 도시에서 책을 사고 팔 특권을 주는 허가증이다.>

Source: You should enjoy this. It's a fascinating study! \n\nOne of our scholars is doing research for a treatise on ancient Nord embalming practices, specifically how they might help to improve modern healing techniques. He needs help acquiring samples.
Target: You should enjoy this. It's a fascinating study! \n\nOne of our scholars is doing research for a treatise on ancient Nord embalming practices, specifically how they might help to improve modern healing techniques. He needs help acquiring samples.

Source: That's the mess. If they're smart, they retreated to a defensible position.\n\nMy scouts here spotted a cave in the ruins. Before I return to my regiment and order an assault, I need someone to break through enemy lines and confirm they're alive.
Target: That's the mess. If they're smart, they retreated to a defensible position.\n\nMy scouts here spotted a cave in the ruins. Before I return to my regiment and order an assault, I need someone to break through enemy lines and confirm they're alive.

Source: Yes … he used to visit these ruins, once or twice a year, on what he said were academic pilgrimages. He would be gone for a few days, then return looking tired but satisfied.\n\nIt's been three weeks since we saw him last.
Target: Yes … he used to visit these ruins, once or twice a year, on what he said were academic pilgrimages. He would be gone for a few days, then return looking tired but satisfied.\n\nIt's been three weeks since we saw him last.

Source: Inside the story.\n\nYou must also enter the story in order to help her.
Target: Inside the story.\n\nYou must also enter the story in order to help her.

Source: Blackreach isn't for the faint of heart. When we first came down here, we lost people to animal attacks. That's gotten better, but now everyone's spooked about a few missing miners.\n\nMost don't realize it's not uncommon for workers to wander off.
Target: Blackreach isn't for the faint of heart. When we first came down here, we lost people to animal attacks. That's gotten better, but now everyone's spooked about a few missing miners.\n\nMost don't realize it's not uncommon for workers to wander off.

Source: The better question is, what isn't the problem? I've got missing equipment, trolls, a spriggan infestation, woodcutters who refuse to work—it's a disaster!\n\nI'm sorry, I'm a bit upset. My lumber camp is ruined. Ruined!
Target: The better question is, what isn't the problem? I've got missing equipment, trolls, a spriggan infestation, woodcutters who refuse to work—it's a disaster!\n\nI'm sorry, I'm a bit upset. My lumber camp is ruined. Ruined!

Source: Why indeed? Svana wishes to speak with you in the Lonely Troll and she's banished me from the place until I find you!\n\nShe's been terribly depressed since the events at the palace. Even refuses to drink with me, if you can imagine such a thing!
Target: Why indeed? Svana wishes to speak with you in the Lonely Troll and she's banished me from the place until I find you!\n\nShe's been terribly depressed since the events at the palace. Even refuses to drink with me, if you can imagine such a thing!

Source: The Twin Champions require your aid to destroy the corruption here at <<1>> and defeat the <<2>>.
Target: The Twin Champions require your aid to destroy the corruption here at <<1>> and defeat the <<2>>.

Source: Indeed! I was conducting an ambitious experiment when my tools gave out.\n\nSomeone or something ransacked this ruin some time ago, but I believe valuable power nodes and a master scepter still exist within. Perhaps you'd like to help me acquire them?
Target: Indeed! I was conducting an ambitious experiment when my tools gave out.\n\nSomeone or something ransacked this ruin some time ago, but I believe valuable power nodes and a master scepter still exist within. Perhaps you'd like to help me acquire them?

Source: Mostly freezing to death. I volunteered to find help, but there's nothing out here but bears and things I've never seen before.\n\nOur fleet was taking the ambassador to Orsinium when we got caught in a storm. Smashed all our ships into the ice.
Target: Mostly freezing to death. I volunteered to find help, but there's nothing out here but bears and things I've never seen before.\n\nOur fleet was taking the ambassador to Orsinium when we got caught in a storm. Smashed all our ships into the ice.

Source: A comfortable seat, a flagon of bog-iron ale, some lively company. Instead, I'm a messenger for her royal highness. Svana wants to see you. She's at the Blue Palace rubbing shoulders with the jarls.\n\nAh, I could also use a shoulder rub.
Target: A comfortable seat, a flagon of bog-iron ale, some lively company. Instead, I'm a messenger for her royal highness. Svana wants to see you. She's at the Blue Palace rubbing shoulders with the jarls.\n\nAh, I could also use a shoulder rub.

Source: These damnable cultists bested me! The witless fools believe they can summon a Dragon and return the Dragon Cult to prominence. Ha! \n\nOne of their mages bound my soul to this doll and left me to spend eternity as this repulsively adorable plaything.
Target: These damnable cultists bested me! The witless fools believe they can summon a Dragon and return the Dragon Cult to prominence. Ha! \n\nOne of their mages bound my soul to this doll and left me to spend eternity as this repulsively adorable plaything.

Source: I was minding my own business when I spotted this old crypt. I needed some gold to buy my sister a wedding present, so I figured why not see what was lying around.\n\nWho knew the place was crawling with these Stormfist bastards? Obviously, not me!
Target: I was minding my own business when I spotted this old crypt. I needed some gold to buy my sister a wedding present, so I figured why not see what was lying around.\n\nWho knew the place was crawling with these Stormfist bastards? Obviously, not me!

Source: Yeah, well, they're long gone—across the water—and my Nelfthea with them. She should have just run off with me. We'd have scraped by without more of their dirty money.\n\nDon't know why she's so loyal. After all they've made us do.
Target: Yeah, well, they're long gone—across the water—and my Nelfthea with them. She should have just run off with me. We'd have scraped by without more of their dirty money.\n\nDon't know why she's so loyal. After all they've made us do.

Source: <A wooden whistle carved with woodland animals rests inside the backpack. Perhaps this whistle has an effect on durzogs. Someone in Orsinium might be interested in it if it actually works.>
Target: <A wooden whistle carved with woodland animals rests inside the backpack. Perhaps this whistle has an effect on durzogs. Someone in Orsinium might be interested in it if it actually works.>

Source: <On closer inspection, this appears to be a well-made burial urn. Among the designs that decorate the urn is a name: <<1>> of Windhelm.>
Target: <On closer inspection, this appears to be a well-made burial urn. Among the designs that decorate the urn is a name: <<1>> of Windhelm.>

Source: Raynor and I got hired by the local mining consortium to investigate this Dwarven vault, Nchuthnkarst. Raynor jumped on it. Said something about this place unlocking secrets about Dwarven tonal architecture.\n\nBut it's more trouble than it's worth.
Target: Raynor and I got hired by the local mining consortium to investigate this Dwarven vault, Nchuthnkarst. Raynor jumped on it. Said something about this place unlocking secrets about Dwarven tonal architecture.\n\nBut it's more trouble than it's worth.

Source: Got a strange one for you. Says here that our client is looking for high quality werewolf pelts—from Argent Mine, no less. Word 'round the campfire is you've been there a few times. I figure you're right for the job.
Target: Got a strange one for you. Says here that our client is looking for high quality werewolf pelts—from Argent Mine, no less. Word 'round the campfire is you've been there a few times. I figure you're right for the job.

Source: I work for Captain Blackheart and I want out. But I can't just walk away. Not until I've taken care of something very important. But I'll need help.
Target: I work for Captain Blackheart and I want out. But I can't just walk away. Not until I've taken care of something very important. But I'll need help.

Source: You must have heard of the great Narsis Dren! I'm his trusted servant and Berrice over there is his able assistant.\n\nMaster Dren promised to take care of the draugr problem for Mazgroth and the Orcs. He entered the barrow but he hasn't returned.
Target: You must have heard of the great Narsis Dren! I'm his trusted servant and Berrice over there is his able assistant.\n\nMaster Dren promised to take care of the draugr problem for Mazgroth and the Orcs. He entered the barrow but he hasn't returned.

Source: It seems a dark ritual was performed at the ruins. Laganakh sent me to investigate, but I've found no one.\n\nI welcome your help, if you're willing.
Target: It seems a dark ritual was performed at the ruins. Laganakh sent me to investigate, but I've found no one.\n\nI welcome your help, if you're willing.

Source: That's not a question I've heard from a stranger. Fancy yourself a bloodhound, do you?\n\nI'd never doubt Stormhold's guards in a siege, but we've seen no progress with these murders. We'll gladly pay a bounty if you find the killer.
Target: That's not a question I've heard from a stranger. Fancy yourself a bloodhound, do you?\n\nI'd never doubt Stormhold's guards in a siege, but we've seen no progress with these murders. We'll gladly pay a bounty if you find the killer.

Source: Skald-King sent Rigurt to Western Skyrim for an important mission: to talk to Thane Hraldi and Thane Svyne about a peace treaty with Windhelm.\n\nHelping Rigurt meet them is Jarl Morryn of Whiterun, Skyrim's greatest diplomat! After Rigurt, of course.
Target: Skald-King sent Rigurt to Western Skyrim for an important mission: to talk to Thane Hraldi and Thane Svyne about a peace treaty with Windhelm.\n\nHelping Rigurt meet them is Jarl Morryn of Whiterun, Skyrim's greatest diplomat! After Rigurt, of course.

Source: Yes, they set up camp not far from here and have been attacking the dreugh, goading them into a frenzy.\n\nIt won't be long before they learn of Bogmother's holy relics.
Target: Yes, they set up camp not far from here and have been attacking the dreugh, goading them into a frenzy.\n\nIt won't be long before they learn of Bogmother's holy relics.

Source: The Winterborn, from the Reach. They ambushed us … leaped out of the damn snow.\n\nIt's like they knew we were coming. After that it was all a blur. By the gods, they turned people into ice! They shattered them!
Target: The Winterborn, from the Reach. They ambushed us … leaped out of the damn snow.\n\nIt's like they knew we were coming. After that it was all a blur. By the gods, they turned people into ice! They shattered them!

Source: "The xanmeers of Sunscale Strand are amazing. My ancestors built them before Duskfall and they remain nearly intact to this day. I hope Barvyn and I can discover their secrets before we have to abandon the camp."
Target: \\"The xanmeers of Sunscale Strand are amazing. My ancestors built them before Duskfall and they remain nearly intact to this day. I hope Barvyn and I can discover their secrets before we have to abandon the camp.\"\""

Source: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are hereby ordered to secure the Memorial District rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."
Target: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are hereby ordered to secure the Memorial District rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."

Source: No, no, no—I didn't say that! I just don't want you running around crying murder, especially with the Pact delegations here. Think of how fragile our alliance already is.\n\nYou should speak to Lord Vurlop. Tell him what you told me.
Target: No, no, no—I didn't say that! I just don't want you running around crying murder, especially with the Pact delegations here. Think of how fragile our alliance already is.\n\nYou should speak to Lord Vurlop. Tell him what you told me.

Source: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are hereby ordered to secure the Arboretum rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."
Target: By order of the General:\n\nScouts are hereby ordered to secure the Arboretum rally point in preparation for an assault. Proceed to the surface via the ladder-works, establish control, then plant the Alliance banner to signal the "all clear."

Source: That's what they're saying down at the tavern. Ghosts appearing from snow storms. Undead attacks on the road. Just as I left, a group of farmers came into town shouting about skeleton wolves. These woods are cursed!
Target: That's what they're saying down at the tavern. Ghosts appearing from snow storms. Undead attacks on the road. Just as I left, a group of farmers came into town shouting about skeleton wolves. These woods are cursed!

Source: I do, in fact. This Wood Elf merchant, Nednor, wants us to collect some eggs from Coldperch Cavern. Says they're "special," or something. I told him the less I know, the better. That place gives me the creeps.
Target: I do, in fact. This Wood Elf merchant, Nednor, wants us to collect some eggs from Coldperch Cavern. Says they're \\"special
column4: \"\" or something. I told him the less I know
column5: the better. That place gives me the creeps."

Source: After what you said the Stormfists have already accomplished, how can we trust anyone on the other side of the keep's gate?\n\nI know King Jorunn requested privacy for his meeting with the ambassadors, but I can't just assume everything is all right.
Target: After what you said the Stormfists have already accomplished, how can we trust anyone on the other side of the keep's gate?\n\nI know King Jorunn requested privacy for his meeting with the ambassadors, but I can't just assume everything is all right.

Source: You can't smell their soggy, rotting flesh? Just walk down the causeway there, you'll see them—a damned army of them.\n\nQuestion is, why aren't the Sentinel guards doing anything?
Target: You can't smell their soggy, rotting flesh? Just walk down the causeway there, you'll see them—a damned army of them.\n\nQuestion is, why aren't the Sentinel guards doing anything?

Source: <A blood-stained chalice clattered to the floor as Lord Falgravn fell. I should deliver this ghastly cup to Thane Ogvar as proof of the vampire's defeat.>
Target: <A blood-stained chalice clattered to the floor as Lord Falgravn fell. I should deliver this ghastly cup to Thane Ogvar as proof of the vampire's defeat.>

Source: This one really twists my tusks. Looks like those damn Bretons up in Watcher's Hold are at it again. Stinkin' Orc-haters. Way I hear it, Emeric told them to get out—but they aren't budging. They've even started stockpiling supplies again.
Target: This one really twists my tusks. Looks like those damn Bretons up in Watcher's Hold are at it again. Stinkin' Orc-haters. Way I hear it, Emeric told them to get out—but they aren't budging. They've even started stockpiling supplies again.

Source: Like I said, a fleet of Sea Giants and vampires stormed the island, bent on slaughter. Our soldiers fought bravely, but the invaders pushed the last of our troops back to the keep. They'll land the decisive blow any minute!\n\nWe need help!
Target: Like I said, a fleet of Sea Giants and vampires stormed the island, bent on slaughter. Our soldiers fought bravely, but the invaders pushed the last of our troops back to the keep. They'll land the decisive blow any minute!\n\nWe need help!

Source: I was on my way to Orsinium with a group of crafters and artisans, just minding my own business, when these fanatics attacked us. It was like they were hunting baby horkers! Whacked us in the head and tossed us in a cart.\n\nI managed to slip away.
Target: I was on my way to Orsinium with a group of crafters and artisans, just minding my own business, when these fanatics attacked us. It was like they were hunting baby horkers! Whacked us in the head and tossed us in a cart.\n\nI managed to slip away.

Source: I don't know. There are monsters here that none of us have ever faced before. And our two strongest warriors are missing. If only we had Halfara Black-Bear and Methas Andavel with us, things might be different.
Target: I don't know. There are monsters here that none of us have ever faced before. And our two strongest warriors are missing. If only we had Halfara Black-Bear and Methas Andavel with us, things might be different.

Source: Aye. A blood-drinking beast. A fiend of ice and fog.\n\nThe sea's been rough for days, you see. Bitter winds, cold rain that rakes at the eyes and clings to your beard. Thought it was just foul weather. But then we saw Lord Falgravn's longships.
Target: Aye. A blood-drinking beast. A fiend of ice and fog.\n\nThe sea's been rough for days, you see. Bitter winds, cold rain that rakes at the eyes and clings to your beard. Thought it was just foul weather. But then we saw Lord Falgravn's longships.

Source: <<1>> ordered us to stay away from a nearby hill. If it was his skin-stealer, he must've held us back for a reason.\n\nI bet he's hiding below the hill's surface. The buried temple complex must have an entrance there.
Target: <<1>> ordered us to stay away from a nearby hill. If it was his skin-stealer, he must've held us back for a reason.\n\nI bet he's hiding below the hill's surface. The buried temple complex must have an entrance there.

Source: <A vile, bat-shaped amulet hangs loose around Lord Falgravn's throat. I should deliver it to Thane Ogvar as proof of the vampire's defeat.>
Target: <A vile, bat-shaped amulet hangs loose around Lord Falgravn's throat. I should deliver it to Thane Ogvar as proof of the vampire's defeat.>

Source: We were on the Little Alkosh, part of the Dominion fleet sailing for <<1>>. Then a hurricane blew up out of nowhere. Sails tore, hulls cracked, and we were thrown into the ocean.\n\nI ended up here, but I can't find the rest of my squad.
Target: We were on the Little Alkosh, part of the Dominion fleet sailing for <<1>>. Then a hurricane blew up out of nowhere. Sails tore, hulls cracked, and we were thrown into the ocean.\n\nI ended up here, but I can't find the rest of my squad.

Source: An unpleasant ship captain dropped us off without so much as a "by your leave!"\n\nHe was supposed to take us to Hammerfell, to explore a Dwarven ruin. We're scholars of some renown, you know. Although my sister prefers the term, "dungeon-delvers."
Target: An unpleasant ship captain dropped us off without so much as a \\"by your leave!\"\"\n\nHe was supposed to take us to Hammerfell
column4: to explore a Dwarven ruin. We're scholars of some renown
column5: you know. Although my sister prefers the term

Source: <Take the ring.>
Target: <Take the ring.>

Source: While my people still lived, we sealed the temple with a magic ward to keep angry spirits and undead from following us out.\n\nSay "betrux" to the temple door to unseal it.
Target: While my people still lived, we sealed the temple with a magic ward to keep angry spirits and undead from following us out.\n\nSay \\"betrux\"\" to the temple door to unseal it."

Source: Oh, just discrediting Grand Chanter Surus and his Society of the Dragon. They claim to be a religious order, but they're nothing more than a cult that loves Akatosh a bit too much. And anyone who questions their faith tends to disappear.
Target: Oh, just discrediting Grand Chanter Surus and his Society of the Dragon. They claim to be a religious order, but they're nothing more than a cult that loves Akatosh a bit too much. And anyone who questions their faith tends to disappear.

Source: The Veiled Heritance was here raising them. They're not raising them anymore. Heh.\n\nOf course, word is that they're led by none other than Prince Naemon—or whatever dark entity has assumed his form. Seems the prince was raised too.
Target: The Veiled Heritance was here raising them. They're not raising them anymore. Heh.\n\nOf course, word is that they're led by none other than Prince Naemon—or whatever dark entity has assumed his form. Seems the prince was raised too.

Source: I'm the wise woman of the Kagesh tribe of Ashlanders. My tribe is divided because our Ashkhan, the man who should be guiding us wisely, is a fool.\n\nHe's decided to attack the Tribunal Temple to the south. It's a fatal mistake.
Target: I'm the wise woman of the Kagesh tribe of Ashlanders. My tribe is divided because our Ashkhan, the man who should be guiding us wisely, is a fool.\n\nHe's decided to attack the Tribunal Temple to the south. It's a fatal mistake.

Source: I can abide fees at an honest port, but Anvil presents a non-stop barrage of whatever the Governor's lackeys feel like enforcing! Uneven gangplank fees, loose mooring taxes, barnacle inspection!\n\nHmm. You're not from around here, are you?
Target: I can abide fees at an honest port, but Anvil presents a non-stop barrage of whatever the Governor's lackeys feel like enforcing! Uneven gangplank fees, loose mooring taxes, barnacle inspection!\n\nHmm. You're not from around here, are you?

Source: I couldn't just leave the wasps! I made a mixture that fooled them into thinking we're part of their hive. I thought they'd be wonderful guard creatures but—not so much.\n\nBut I've got a new formula that should turn them into an angry army.
Target: I couldn't just leave the wasps! I made a mixture that fooled them into thinking we're part of their hive. I thought they'd be wonderful guard creatures but—not so much.\n\nBut I've got a new formula that should turn them into an angry army.

Source: Where do you think we'll find Prince Naemon's Shade?
Target: Where do you think we'll find Prince Naemon's Shade?

Source: What about Prince Naemon's Shade?
Target: What about Prince Naemon's Shade?

Source: Whether <<1>> continues or ends. Preserve the <<z:2>> and we remain as we are, in this state between life and death. Destroy it and you end the curse, allowing us a final rest.
Target: Whether <<1>> continues or ends. Preserve the <<z:2>> and we remain as we are, in this state between life and death. Destroy it and you end the curse, allowing us a final rest.

Source:
"<<1>>,

"I deciphered my father's ledger! Come by my rooftop retreat when you have a moment.

"<<1>>,

"I deciphered my father's ledger! Come by my rooftop retreat when you have a moment.

Source: If you have the chance to capture him, we could put him on trial in Stormhold. Make him answer for all he's done.\n\nBut I'm happy to fit his head for a pike. As I believe <<1>> would say, "stab the Elf in his crumpets."
Target: If you have the chance to capture him, we could put him on trial in Stormhold. Make him answer for all he's done.\n\nBut I'm happy to fit his head for a pike. As I believe <<1>> would say, \\"stab the Elf in his crumpets.\"\""

Source: The Imperial noble, Lord Quintus Jarol, has been marked for death by the Black Sacrament.\n\nYour task is simple. Find Jarol and kill him.
Target: The Imperial noble, Lord Quintus Jarol, has been marked for death by the Black Sacrament.\n\nYour task is simple. Find Jarol and kill him.

Source: You have to help me! These necromancers will force my soul into their … "animus geodes," I think they called them. They already killed my guards and siphoned their spirits inside those horrible purple stones!
Target: You have to help me! These necromancers will force my soul into their … \\"animus geodes

Target: Where is Vanus?

Target: <Continue reading>

Source: <Take the map.>

Source: "A special request has come in for a stash of Daedric idols being sequestered in <<1>> and time is of the essence. Our buyers are standing by with coin in hand but if the job isn't done quickly and quietly, they're gone."
Target: "A special request has come in for a stash of Daedric idols being sequestered in <<1>> and time is of the essence. Our buyers are standing by with coin in hand but if the job isn't done quickly and quietly, they're gone."

Target: Where can I find Vanus Galerion?

Source: Where did you hear this about Naemon becoming a lich?
Target: Where did you hear this about Naemon becoming a lich?

Source:
I've paid you a hefty fee to track down and kill Wardiya. You've given me nothing but excuses. This is your final chance. Rumor has her back in Bruma.

Find her. Kill her. Make me happy.

- G.
Target:
I've paid you a hefty fee to track down and kill Wardiya. You've given me nothing but excuses. This is your final chance. Rumor has her back in Bruma.

Target: <Keep reading.>

Source: He was one of Divad Hunding's companions. He died fighting Goblins. He was also my ancestor. \n\nI have spent seven years in the desert searching for Sabasad's remains. My wife deemed this a fool's errand … she has probably given up on me by now ….
Target: He was one of Divad Hunding's companions. He died fighting Goblins. He was also my ancestor. \n\nI have spent seven years in the desert searching for Sabasad's remains. My wife deemed this a fool's errand … she has probably given up on me by now ….

Source: The disciple of our Tribunal Temple has lost his faith. He says the Three no longer speak to him. \n\nHe sent me to pray for him at shrines to Almalexia, Vivec, and Sotha Sil just outside town. But I was driven away by a foul smell and angry alit.
Target: The disciple of our Tribunal Temple has lost his faith. He says the Three no longer speak to him. \n\nHe sent me to pray for him at shrines to Almalexia, Vivec, and Sotha Sil just outside town. But I was driven away by a foul smell and angry alit.

Source: If you really want to help, buy something! Well, there is something else you can do. We've run out of food and drink for the few patrons we have. \n\nCould you take this order to Hafza in Bruma and ask her to send someone with supplies?
Target: If you really want to help, buy something! Well, there is something else you can do. We've run out of food and drink for the few patrons we have. \n\nCould you take this order to Hafza in Bruma and ask her to send someone with supplies?

Source: <<1>> … we were egg-cousins when we were young. He fell in love and went to the <<2>> to follow her. All the while, he was blind to my affections.\n\nAt first, he sent letters back. Then none came. I even wrote to his lover to ask what became of him.
Target: <<1>> … we were egg-cousins when we were young. He fell in love and went to the <<2>> to follow her. All the while, he was blind to my affections.\n\nAt first, he sent letters back. Then none came. I even wrote to his lover to ask what became of him.

Source: "Crawled out of cave. Can go no farther. Egg brother Bosekus was right. Should have moved with him to Cropsford."
Target: \\"Crawled out of cave. Can go no farther. Egg brother Bosekus was right. Should have moved with him to Cropsford.\"\""

Source: So what do you want me to do?
Target: So what do you want me to do?

Source: "It is believed this relic can awaken ancient Ayleid 'Alasil pilasters,' but I've yet to determine how precisely it works. Perhaps Neeja-Meen will know more. I should ask the next time she travels through Hissmir."\n\n"—Scholar Kizibael"
Target: \\"It is believed this relic can awaken ancient Ayleid 'Alasil pilasters

Source: I'm part of an expedition from <<1>>. While we explored <<Ac:2>>, the dead began to rise. The others fled, but my master never emerged.\n\n<<3>> taught me to know when I should ask for help. Well, I'm asking.
Target: I'm part of an expedition from <<1>>. While we explored <<Ac:2>>, the dead began to rise. The others fled, but my master never emerged.\n\n<<3>> taught me to know when I should ask for help. Well, I'm asking.

Source: Where is this village?
Target: Where is this village?

Source: Not as much as I'd like. But I think the constructs received their orders from the rod through those resonators. \n\nThe spheres cannibalize dead spiders for parts. What if we interfered with that process?
Target: Not as much as I'd like. But I think the constructs received their orders from the rod through those resonators. \n\nThe spheres cannibalize dead spiders for parts. What if we interfered with that process?

Source: We're out here in the middle of Coldharbour and that's the best question you can come up with? I am most definitely not talking to myself. I am speaking to the alchemist.\n\nBe quiet, you mangy cat! I can't hear myself think with all that racket!
Target: We're out here in the middle of Coldharbour and that's the best question you can come up with? I am most definitely not talking to myself. I am speaking to the alchemist.\n\nBe quiet, you mangy cat! I can't hear myself think with all that racket!

Source: I'll head to Hectahame, then.
Target: I'll head to Hectahame, then.

Source: I know that. But Dolril isn't the only one who won't abandon the afflicted.\n\nI can't just leave. Someone has to collect the medallions of the fallen.
Target: I know that. But Dolril isn't the only one who won't abandon the afflicted.\n\nI can't just leave. Someone has to collect the medallions of the fallen.

Source: How can I do that?
Target: How can I do that?

Source: What is it?
Target: What is it?

Source: What about the Countess and the Shornhelm Guard?
Target: What about the Countess and the Shornhelm Guard?

Source: <<1>> is the jewel of the southern seas, a free port with trade ties to half of Tamriel. Ambassadors from the Dominion arrived weeks ago to negotiate its admission into the alliance. Unfortunately, things have not gone smoothly.
Target: <<1>> is the jewel of the southern seas, a free port with trade ties to half of Tamriel. Ambassadors from the Dominion arrived weeks ago to negotiate its admission into the alliance. Unfortunately, things have not gone smoothly.

Source: I'm entertaining important people. We have no time for uninvited guests.
Target: I'm entertaining important people. We have no time for uninvited guests.

Source: Haj Uxith is a place out of time, an ancient Argonian settlement plucked from the Black Marsh and deposited into this dread realm.\n\nWe know of your mission to Coldharbour and we would like to help, but unfortunately my people are divided.
Target: Haj Uxith is a place out of time, an ancient Argonian settlement plucked from the Black Marsh and deposited into this dread realm.\n\nWe know of your mission to Coldharbour and we would like to help, but unfortunately my people are divided.

Source: Get on their ship, take their things, and escape alive. It's a simple plan.\n\nThe Dominion's landing is right outside. I'll have a boat to haul the treasure. We can't go back the way we came.
Target: Get on their ship, take their things, and escape alive. It's a simple plan.\n\nThe Dominion's landing is right outside. I'll have a boat to haul the treasure. We can't go back the way we came.

Source: When you find yourself in the middle of a lake, does it matter which shore you swim to? Enemies are everywhere. One dead Daedra will do just as well as another. Go and wreak havoc. Once we have thinned their ranks, then we will march on the tower.
Target: When you find yourself in the middle of a lake, does it matter which shore you swim to? Enemies are everywhere. One dead Daedra will do just as well as another. Go and wreak havoc. Once we have thinned their ranks, then we will march on the tower.

Source: Pick a direction and start swinging. Can't walk ten paces in this city without bumping into some ugly beast, or thick-headed bannerman.\n\nI could bore you with grand strategy, but it won't make a bit of difference if we don't thin the enemy's ranks.
Target: Pick a direction and start swinging. Can't walk ten paces in this city without bumping into some ugly beast, or thick-headed bannerman.\n\nI could bore you with grand strategy, but it won't make a bit of difference if we don't thin the enemy's ranks.

Source: As you seek out the Mage and the King, I'm sure you shall meet others who require your aid. Look for those you trust and who would be willing to join us here.
Target: As you seek out the Mage and the King, I'm sure you shall meet others who require your aid. Look for those you trust and who would be willing to join us here.

Source: I'm Saryvn, a soldier from the fort. I, er, might have crept down to the river to enjoy a quiet drink away from my superiors. \n\nDon't look at me like that. Anyway, these stupid cultists grabbed me. Next thing I knew, I was locked in here.
Target: I'm Saryvn, a soldier from the fort. I, er, might have crept down to the river to enjoy a quiet drink away from my superiors. \n\nDon't look at me like that. Anyway, these stupid cultists grabbed me. Next thing I knew, I was locked in here.

Source: So you're not running for the hills, ay? Going to stay and fight? All right then, let's get to work.\n\nI need you to help clear this place out. We've barely got enough room to breathe. Hunt down enemy bannermen and those Daedric beasts and slay them.
Target: So you're not running for the hills, ay? Going to stay and fight? All right then, let's get to work.\n\nI need you to help clear this place out. We've barely got enough room to breathe. Hunt down enemy bannermen and those Daedric beasts and slay them.

Source: By Vivec, you're the only one who cared. \n\nHere, take my herding rod. Use it to poke my loose guar in the ribs. They'll recognize the feeling and know they should return home. Then check back with me!
Target: By Vivec, you're the only one who cared. \n\nHere, take my herding rod. Use it to poke my loose guar in the ribs. They'll recognize the feeling and know they should return home. Then check back with me!

Target: <항아리에는 고대의 노드의 작은 수집품들이 담겨있다 .>

Source: Father's given you the key then. Excellent! I'll make a mark on your map. You should find a cave there that leads to the path up the slope.
