Source: Undoubtedly, it's the corruption of Prince Naemon's Shade spreading through the forest and somehow affecting the people here.\n\nThe blight emanates from the trees … which may offer us an opportunity to at least contain it using the Standing Stones.
Target: Undoubtedly, it's the corruption of Prince Naemon's Shade spreading through the forest and somehow affecting the people here.\n\nThe blight emanates from the trees … which may offer us an opportunity to at least contain it using the Standing Stones.

Source: Me? I won't do anything. However, someone else could deliver a good lesson.\n\nThe docks crawl with foreign "merchants" tempting the local crews with their sweet High Elf gold. A little bloodshed will send them a message.
Target: Me? I won't do anything. However, someone else could deliver a good lesson.\n\nThe docks crawl with foreign \\"merchants\"\" tempting the local crews with their sweet High Elf gold. A little bloodshed will send them a message."

Source: You're not inspiring confidence, that's for sure.\n\nYou need to guarantee that High Priestess Solgra survives. She knows the temple better than anyone. If there's a way to the moot in there, she'll know about it. I just hope we're not too late.
Target: You're not inspiring confidence, that's for sure.\n\nYou need to guarantee that High Priestess Solgra survives. She knows the temple better than anyone. If there's a way to the moot in there, she'll know about it. I just hope we're not too late.

Source: Renegades from my tribe are besieging the Tribunal Temple at Iliath.\n\nOur wise woman needs help persuading our Ashkhan this is a terrible mistake.
Target: Renegades from my tribe are besieging the Tribunal Temple at Iliath.\n\nOur wise woman needs help persuading our Ashkhan this is a terrible mistake.

Source: The Dominion took <<A:1>>. They've killed any who attempt to leave, but have given little cause for their presence.\n\nWe must learn their plans before the hatching ritual begins.
Target: The Dominion took <<A:1>>. They've killed any who attempt to leave, but have given little cause for their presence.\n\nWe must learn their plans before the hatching ritual begins.

Source: The tomb is buried in the mountainside. There's a tunnel that will take you right to its entrance.\n\nYou can find the tunnel by leaving Kragenmoor through the western pass.
Target: The tomb is buried in the mountainside. There's a tunnel that will take you right to its entrance.\n\nYou can find the tunnel by leaving Kragenmoor through the western pass.

Source: Raiders. The dark-skinned ones attack, hoping to take our mine and make us slaves once more.\n\nThey even summoned a Daedra. That was a mistake. The Daedra took everyone away, Argonian and raider, and only left their soul crystals behind.
Target: Raiders. The dark-skinned ones attack, hoping to take our mine and make us slaves once more.\n\nThey even summoned a Daedra. That was a mistake. The Daedra took everyone away, Argonian and raider, and only left their soul crystals behind.

Source: Tanval Indoril entered town at the head of his personal Vanguard and demanded an audience with the grandmaster. \n\nNow the Vanguard patrols the streets. They command in Kragenmoor.
Target: Tanval Indoril entered town at the head of his personal Vanguard and demanded an audience with the grandmaster. \n\nNow the Vanguard patrols the streets. They command in Kragenmoor.

Source:
"<<1>>,

"There's a place near <<c:2>> where I go to think. Can you come by when you have a free moment? I need your help with a personal matter.

"—<<3>>

"PS: The mustard stain doesn't represent anything."
Target:
"<<1>>,

"There's a place near <<c:2>> where I go to think. Can you come by when you have a free moment? I need your help with a personal matter.

"—<<3>>

"PS: The mustard stain doesn't represent anything."

Source: <<1>> went to see for herself. Ordered us to stay here and guard the approach.\n\nI speak out of turn, but I see how <<2>> weighs upon her. Perhaps she endangers herself because she fears putting more of us at risk.
Target: <<1>> went to see for herself. Ordered us to stay here and guard the approach.\n\nI speak out of turn, but I see how <<2>> weighs upon her. Perhaps she endangers herself because she fears putting more of us at risk.

Source: Quest Bestowal. Are you ready?
Target: Quest Bestowal. Are you ready?

Source: The same as you, I presume. Seeking any sign of <<1>>'s designs for <<A:2>>. We can't thwart his plans unless we know what they are.
Target: The same as you, I presume. Seeking any sign of <<1>>'s designs for <<A:2>>. We can't thwart his plans unless we know what they are.

Source: Then you must inform <<1>> immediately. She left for the ruins above, to scout the aftermath of a battle between Dominion and lamias. Go quickly and quietly.
Target: Then you must inform <<1>> immediately. She left for the ruins above, to scout the aftermath of a battle between Dominion and lamias. Go quickly and quietly.

Source: Arcane wardstones that make the Maulborn immune to the plague—a gift from someone called Vox.\n\nSure would be a shame if those alits came down with their own plague. How about you smash those wards that're protecting them?
Target: Arcane wardstones that make the Maulborn immune to the plague—a gift from someone called Vox.\n\nSure would be a shame if those alits came down with their own plague. How about you smash those wards that're protecting them?

Source: You mean … you aren't here about the notice?\n\nWell, allow me to explain! I need a partner for a difficult job. It pays well, but it involves travel, and there is some danger. Does that sound like the sort of thing that might interest you?
Target: 그 말은 … 너 공고를 보고 여기 온 게 아니구나?\n\n음, 설명해 줄게! 난 어려운 작업을 할 거고, 그러려면 파트너가 필요해. 돈은 많이 벌 수 있지만, 여행을 해야 하고, 약간의 위험이 따를 거야. 흥미가 있어?

Source: It's just that my wife, Elsenia, was among the lost, and while some have returned, she never came back. I don't know if she's dead or just lost out there, alone. I've searched for days, but there's no sign of her. I've just about given up hope.
Target: It's just that my wife, Elsenia, was among the lost, and while some have returned, she never came back. I don't know if she's dead or just lost out there, alone. I've searched for days, but there's no sign of her. I've just about given up hope.

Source: The moors have always been a wild place, covered in thick fog. But for us who've known them our whole lives, it's home. Now, though, people've been disappearing into the mist. We find their bodies later, torn up and drained of blood.
Target: The moors have always been a wild place, covered in thick fog. But for us who've known them our whole lives, it's home. Now, though, people've been disappearing into the mist. We find their bodies later, torn up and drained of blood.

Source: <You received a letter from Forge-Mother Alga, King Kurog gro-Orsinium's mother, which invites you and adventurers like you to come visit their home of Wrothgar. Caravans await in Daggerfall, Davon's Watch, and Vulkhel Guard for transport.>
Target: <You received a letter from Forge-Mother Alga, King Kurog gro-Orsinium's mother, which invites you and adventurers like you to come visit their home of Wrothgar. Caravans await in Daggerfall, Davon's Watch, and Vulkhel Guard for transport.>

Source: The Vereansu—heathen Ashlanders—attacked Muth Gnaar! This is a place of healing and refuge. We're a simple order, using the <<1>> to help those afflicted by the Llodos plague.\n\nThey killed monks and afflicted alike without mercy.
Target: The Vereansu—heathen Ashlanders—attacked Muth Gnaar! This is a place of healing and refuge. We're a simple order, using the <<1>> to help those afflicted by the Llodos plague.\n\nThey killed monks and afflicted alike without mercy.

Source: Yes, praise Sithis. The Black Sacrament has been performed and we have a new target. The Night Mother awaits her due.
Target: Yes, praise Sithis. The Black Sacrament has been performed and we have a new target. The Night Mother awaits her due.

Source: We sent refugees from the town south, to meet Captain Janeve at Camp Tamrith, but the mayor of Crestshade refused to leave. Said she had to save her people.\n\nShe begged us to warn Shornhelm. If she's still alive, she could use some help.
Target: We sent refugees from the town south, to meet Captain Janeve at Camp Tamrith, but the mayor of Crestshade refused to leave. Said she had to save her people.\n\nShe begged us to warn Shornhelm. If she's still alive, she could use some help.

Source: I accept this contract.
Target: I accept this contract.

Source: Gladly.
Target: Gladly.

Source: I will.
Target: I will.

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: I want one.
Target: I want one.

Source: You see the spriggans? The lurchers? They're here because they feel something coming. A terrible force. Daedra.\n\nI am the last priest of the Wooded Eye. We were charged with protecting this grove, but the wards have failed. We have failed.
Target: You see the spriggans? The lurchers? They're here because they feel something coming. A terrible force. Daedra.\n\nI am the last priest of the Wooded Eye. We were charged with protecting this grove, but the wards have failed. We have failed.

Source: Yes.
Target: Yes.

Source: We're sending out messengers to summon help. They have to travel light, so we need to set up supply drops for them.\n\nWould you bring supplies to a supply cache the runners will use?
Target: We're sending out messengers to summon help. They have to travel light, so we need to set up supply drops for them.\n\nWould you bring supplies to a supply cache the runners will use?

Source: No. These dungy little monsters are opposed to the Dominion, and to Queen Ayrenn specifically. Why? Who knows? They will not give Hazazi a straight answer. They'd rather pull his tail!\n\nIt's not fair. Hazazi always gets the worst assignments!
Target: No. These dungy little monsters are opposed to the Dominion, and to Queen Ayrenn specifically. Why? Who knows? They will not give Hazazi a straight answer. They'd rather pull his tail!\n\nIt's not fair. Hazazi always gets the worst assignments!

Source: All right, I'll speak to your priestess.
Target: All right, I'll speak to your priestess.

Source: "… and I will pay you a handsome sum in coins! Bards will speak your name in taverns across the March. Seek me out at the Fighters Guild drinking hall in Rawl'kha! And earn your coin today!\n\n- Panreth the Bold, Freelance Hunter and Benefactor"
Target: \\"… and I will pay you a handsome sum in coins! Bards will speak your name in taverns across the March. Seek me out at the Fighters Guild drinking hall in Rawl'kha! And earn your coin today!\n\n- Panreth the Bold
column4: Freelance Hunter and Benefactor\"\""

Source: Who can be certain? I suspect he merely seeks to find a ship and flee back to the Summerset Isles. Perhaps he is determined to see Prince Naemon's body laid to rest there?\n\nRazum-dar has his own suspicions though, and he seemed quite concerned.
Target: Who can be certain? I suspect he merely seeks to find a ship and flee back to the Summerset Isles. Perhaps he is determined to see Prince Naemon's body laid to rest there?\n\nRazum-dar has his own suspicions though, and he seemed quite concerned.

Source: Where are you going to be?
Target: Where are you going to be?

Source: And you've had no luck?
Target: And you've had no luck?

Source: Spoken like someone who's never seen a friend torn limb from limb! Go out there and see what we face every day, I dare you.
Target: Spoken like someone who's never seen a friend torn limb from limb! Go out there and see what we face every day, I dare you.

Source: Evermore's princess is here?
Target: Evermore's princess is here?

Source: <A small key slips out of the center of the rolled scroll. The scroll has been sealed in wax. >
Target: <A small key slips out of the center of the rolled scroll. The scroll has been sealed in wax. >

Source: I should look around and see if I can determine what happened to the Fighters Guild members.
Target: I should look around and see if I can determine what happened to the Fighters Guild members.

Source: <The dead man clutches a diary. It describes a pleasant visit with a cousin <<1>> in Fort Amol before spiralling into a horrific account of how a family became trapped in Icehammer's Vault.>
Target: <The dead man clutches a diary. It describes a pleasant visit with a cousin <<1>> in Fort Amol before spiralling into a horrific account of how a family became trapped in Icehammer's Vault.>

Source: All right, I'll speak to your priestess.
Target: All right, I'll speak to your priestess.

Source: The Hollow City?
Target: The Hollow City?

Source: A Shadowed Path magister. He lives in what's left of my home, across from this manor. The Dremora and Shadowed Path cultists in Bruma all answer to him. Kill him for us!
Target: A Shadowed Path magister. He lives in what's left of my home, across from this manor. The Dremora and Shadowed Path cultists in Bruma all answer to him. Kill him for us!

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: As you say. I have an important report to make, medicinal herbs for the Arenthian resistance, and a small scroll case to pass on to Cariel. It has some critical letters and papers inside.
Target: As you say. I have an important report to make, medicinal herbs for the Arenthian resistance, and a small scroll case to pass on to Cariel. It has some critical letters and papers inside.

Source: Hjorik thinks the Dremora have opened invisible portals inside the manor, preparing to attack. I have a crystal that reveals hidden objects, but my leg prevents me from looking. Would you search the manor for these portals?
Target: Hjorik thinks the Dremora have opened invisible portals inside the manor, preparing to attack. I have a crystal that reveals hidden objects, but my leg prevents me from looking. Would you search the manor for these portals?

Source: There's something about Pelidil's orders … the reference to Asteril seems strange, and Oromin still refuses to believe she betrayed us.\n\nEither way, Asteril's the key to unraveling this mess. We need to question her and find out what she knows.
Target: There's something about Pelidil's orders … the reference to Asteril seems strange, and Oromin still refuses to believe she betrayed us.\n\nEither way, Asteril's the key to unraveling this mess. We need to question her and find out what she knows.

Source: What book did she want?
Target: What book did she want?

Source: Everything. I've lived in this forest my whole life, but I've never seen it so angry. Spriggans and lurchers everywhere, and a grove I've never seen before.
Target: Everything. I've lived in this forest my whole life, but I've never seen it so angry. Spriggans and lurchers everywhere, and a grove I've never seen before.

Source: Do you know what they want?
Target: Do you know what they want?

Source: King Emeric must be informed that without the Dream Shard, we won't be able to supply him the dreamless potions that protect him from the Supernal Dreamers. \n\nHis Majesty might reward the one who brings him word of this. Would you do it?
Target: King Emeric must be informed that without the Dream Shard, we won't be able to supply him the dreamless potions that protect him from the Supernal Dreamers. \n\nHis Majesty might reward the one who brings him word of this. Would you do it?

Source: Outside the gate and across the bridge. You can see the smoke and flames from a distance.\n\nBut why would you want to go there? My brother Bernard sent me to call out the King's soldiers. Why risk yourself for strangers?
Target: Outside the gate and across the bridge. You can see the smoke and flames from a distance.\n\nBut why would you want to go there? My brother Bernard sent me to call out the King's soldiers. Why risk yourself for strangers?

Source: Not all of us swore oaths to Legion Zero when they betrayed the city. My commanding officer, Captain Caudex, marshaled what forces he could after the insurrection and took the forum. Turned it into a garrison.\n\nWe're holding on, but we need help.
Target: Not all of us swore oaths to Legion Zero when they betrayed the city. My commanding officer, Captain Caudex, marshaled what forces he could after the insurrection and took the forum. Turned it into a garrison.\n\nWe're holding on, but we need help.

Source: As chief-daughter, her duty is to be wed to another clan, to forge an alliance. Some seek to escape this honor. Lokra is on the verge of such a mistake. Perhaps you could dissuade her.
Target: As chief-daughter, her duty is to be wed to another clan, to forge an alliance. Some seek to escape this honor. Lokra is on the verge of such a mistake. Perhaps you could dissuade her.

Source: Well, Captain Caudex has pledged his soldiers to the cause. Father Egnatius is examining that ancient scroll you recovered. We also know the Cathedral's location, and we have a key to help us gain entry.\n\nI'm sure we can come up with something.
Target: Well, Captain Caudex has pledged his soldiers to the cause. Father Egnatius is examining that ancient scroll you recovered. We also know the Cathedral's location, and we have a key to help us gain entry.\n\nI'm sure we can come up with something.

Source: I had a drink with him earlier today. Discussed our favorite foods, our love lives, his plans for world domination, that sort of thing.\n\nNo, I have no idea where Angof is. I will find him though. That much I promise.
Target: I had a drink with him earlier today. Discussed our favorite foods, our love lives, his plans for world domination, that sort of thing.\n\nNo, I have no idea where Angof is. I will find him though. That much I promise.

Source: I … need your help.\n\nMy tribe seeks <<A:1>>, a token of Malacath's favor. When we find it, we will march to the nearest stronghold and raze it to the ground. Then the next, and the next.
Target: I … need your help.\n\nMy tribe seeks <<A:1>>, a token of Malacath's favor. When we find it, we will march to the nearest stronghold and raze it to the ground. Then the next, and the next.

Source: That's a welcome change. We're dangerously low on everything. Drinkable water and clean bandages especially. \n\nNo one I've sent out has made it past the Dremora. Are you willing to try?
Target: That's a welcome change. We're dangerously low on everything. Drinkable water and clean bandages especially. \n\nNo one I've sent out has made it past the Dremora. Are you willing to try?

Source: I apologize for even asking, but I have no qualms admitting that I am no match for even one Riekr, let alone a dozen of the foul creatures.\n\nIf, during your travels, you happen upon a gold pendant … well, it belongs to me.
Target: I apologize for even asking, but I have no qualms admitting that I am no match for even one Riekr, let alone a dozen of the foul creatures.\n\nIf, during your travels, you happen upon a gold pendant … well, it belongs to me.

Source: Zahra asks you that question! Skulking about, sneaking up. Announce yourself next time. Zahra might have clawed you to shreds. What would you do then?\n\nJekos … I thought you were one of them!
Target: Zahra asks you that question! Skulking about, sneaking up. Announce yourself next time. Zahra might have clawed you to shreds. What would you do then?\n\nJekos … I thought you were one of them!

Source: I'm not entirely certain, of course—one can never be certain of these things—but I think I've discovered the location of a major relic. \n\nIf I'm correct, it belonged to <<1>>, founder of Orsinium, and creator of its Bear-Rider cavalry!
Target: I'm not entirely certain, of course—one can never be certain of these things—but I think I've discovered the location of a major relic. \n\nIf I'm correct, it belonged to <<1>>, founder of Orsinium, and creator of its Bear-Rider cavalry!

Source: Oh, it was a disaster! We were on our way to Orsinium, my wife and I. She's Lady Sovelle, ambassador to the High King. She was coming to negotiate a trade agreement.\n\nBut the ships went off course, crashed in the storm. And now Sovelle is missing.
Target: Oh, it was a disaster! We were on our way to Orsinium, my wife and I. She's Lady Sovelle, ambassador to the High King. She was coming to negotiate a trade agreement.\n\nBut the ships went off course, crashed in the storm. And now Sovelle is missing.

Source: <The armor's fused joints make a thorough search difficult. You find a small, leather-bound journal and a tiny crystal phial in the remains.>
Target: <The armor's fused joints make a thorough search difficult. You find a small, leather-bound journal and a tiny crystal phial in the remains.>

Source: I know you will. I've seen you in action!\n\nI have a feeling that the fate of Wrothgar depends on what we do next. Our actions, whether we succeed or fail, will determine the future of Orsinium and the Orc people.
Target: I know you will. I've seen you in action!\n\nI have a feeling that the fate of Wrothgar depends on what we do next. Our actions, whether we succeed or fail, will determine the future of Orsinium and the Orc people.

Source: <As you reach out your hands, the room grows cold.>
Target: <As you reach out your hands, the room grows cold.>

Source: I'll speak to Captain Odreth.
Target: I'll speak to Captain Odreth.

Source: Who. When the anchors fell, I made contact with a priest named Egnatius. He's old … with very distracting teeth, but wiser than most. I'm certain he can help us stop whatever Molag Bal has planned for the city.\n\nUnfortunately, he's been captured.
Target: Who. When the anchors fell, I made contact with a priest named Egnatius. He's old … with very distracting teeth, but wiser than most. I'm certain he can help us stop whatever Molag Bal has planned for the city.\n\nUnfortunately, he's been captured.

Source: <The dead Orc clutches some sort of broadsheet and a handful of large, sharp crocodile teeth.>
Target: <The dead Orc clutches some sort of broadsheet and a handful of large, sharp crocodile teeth.>

Source: Of course, but it'll take time—time Evermore doesn't have. You could go now. \n\nThey need someone like you to rally the city's defenses. After what you've accomplished here, I have no doubt you can make a difference. Will you go, wayfarer?
Target: Of course, but it'll take time—time Evermore doesn't have. You could go now. \n\nThey need someone like you to rally the city's defenses. After what you've accomplished here, I have no doubt you can make a difference. Will you go, wayfarer?

Source: All your friends are dead?
Target: All your friends are dead?

Source: Midnight Union is very different in recent days. S'rashi's boss is not so patient. S'rashi needs gold fast.\n\nThis one cannot help his brother anymore, but you will go see S'rashi upstairs in the inn, yes? Offer to help him, yes? He will pay.
Target: Midnight Union is very different in recent days. S'rashi's boss is not so patient. S'rashi needs gold fast.\n\nThis one cannot help his brother anymore, but you will go see S'rashi upstairs in the inn, yes? Offer to help him, yes? He will pay.

Source: She's locked herself up in the house we were staying in. I knocked on the door. I even begged her to come.\n\nYou think you could try to persuade her? Her name is Marlene.
Target: She's locked herself up in the house we were staying in. I knocked on the door. I even begged her to come.\n\nYou think you could try to persuade her? Her name is Marlene.

Source: Who's the Outsider?
Target: Who's the Outsider?

Source: I've put him for safekeeping in the guest house across the courtyard. \n\nI'd welcome him at our celebration, but he spurns us. Even a son can stand only so much.
Target: I've put him for safekeeping in the guest house across the courtyard. \n\nI'd welcome him at our celebration, but he spurns us. Even a son can stand only so much.

Source: <Read the rest of the orders.>
Target: <Read the rest of the orders.>

Source: Bored! The Rat is so very bored! No more fights in the arena—no, no. Just Daedra feeding people to their ugly pets. Day and night, it's nothing but merchants, and tailors, and stable boys screaming and soiling their pants. What sport is that?
Target: Bored! The Rat is so very bored! No more fights in the arena—no, no. Just Daedra feeding people to their ugly pets. Day and night, it's nothing but merchants, and tailors, and stable boys screaming and soiling their pants. What sport is that?

Source: There must be some form of communication between her and the Supernals.\n\nIf you can find, say, letters from the cult to Adima, I could use them to clear Hosni's name when this is all over. I'd suggest searching their camp on the beach.
Target: There must be some form of communication between her and the Supernals.\n\nIf you can find, say, letters from the cult to Adima, I could use them to clear Hosni's name when this is all over. I'd suggest searching their camp on the beach.

Source: Adima's been giving my son potions. If you can figure out which one puts him into dreaming sleep—and take some yourself—I think you'll be able to enter his dreams, as she does.\n\nTalk to Hosni's bard, Destane. He's in on all Hosni's secrets.
Target: Adima's been giving my son potions. If you can figure out which one puts him into dreaming sleep—and take some yourself—I think you'll be able to enter his dreams, as she does.\n\nTalk to Hosni's bard, Destane. He's in on all Hosni's secrets.

Source: I'll speak to your captain.
Target: I'll speak to your captain.

Source: What then?
Target: What then?

Source: I'll speak to Captain Odreth.
Target: I'll speak to Captain Odreth.

Source: Yes.
Target: Yes.

Source: Who is this Frozen Man?
Target: Who is this Frozen Man?

Source: "We've intercepted the marines. Their extra gear has been stashed for future use. As ordered, none were slain in the ambush. They're bound in the cellar beneath the meeting point. \n\nFor the Veil!"
Target: \\"We've intercepted the marines. Their extra gear has been stashed for future use. As ordered
column4: none were slain in the ambush. They're bound in the cellar beneath the meeting point. \n\nFor the Veil!\"\""

Source: Badly. But what else is new? A scout just reported that more Dremora are nearing Bruma. It could be a feint, to draw off our guards. I can't risk weakening our defenses.\n\nWould you be willing to help?
Target: Badly. But what else is new? A scout just reported that more Dremora are nearing Bruma. It could be a feint, to draw off our guards. I can't risk weakening our defenses.\n\nWould you be willing to help?

Source: Me? I could use more powerful restoration scrolls. With all these wounded to take care of, I'm just about out. Want to make some for me?
Target: Me? I could use more powerful restoration scrolls. With all these wounded to take care of, I'm just about out. Want to make some for me?

Source: Yes, I do.
Target: Yes, I do.

Source: I was hiding from the other guys. All they've done since I joined is pick on me. Being a bandit isn't anything like my brother and I thought it'd be.\n\nPlease, it's too late for me but not for him. Take this to <<1>>, he'll know what it means.
Target: I was hiding from the other guys. All they've done since I joined is pick on me. Being a bandit isn't anything like my brother and I thought it'd be.\n\nPlease, it's too late for me but not for him. Take this to <<1>>, he'll know what it means.

Source: Definitely.
Target: Definitely.

Source: <There's a note nearby.>
Target: <There's a note nearby.>

Source: Your actions have revealed a vulnerability.\n\nI thought my tribe safe on our island. This Bloodthorn attack proved me wrong. Only you and your friends on the Spearhead, united, were able to save this island.
Target: Your actions have revealed a vulnerability.\n\nI thought my tribe safe on our island. This Bloodthorn attack proved me wrong. Only you and your friends on the Spearhead, united, were able to save this island.

Source: I accept.
Target: I accept.

Source: I have to stop some local bandits. I'll burn their supplies and rescue their prisoners.
Target: I have to stop some local bandits. I'll burn their supplies and rescue their prisoners.

Source: Consider it done.
Target: Consider it done.

Source: Yes.
Target: Yes.

Source: I'll find your dog. And your husband, if I can.
Target: I'll find your dog. And your husband, if I can.

Source: We can really use some help. The Dremora attacked us without warning. Many villagers are missing. Would you search the town for survivors? Any you find, tell them to make their way here, to safety.
Target: We can really use some help. The Dremora attacked us without warning. Many villagers are missing. Would you search the town for survivors? Any you find, tell them to make their way here, to safety.

Source: Yes.
Target: Yes.

Source: You need to rest.
Target: You need to rest.

Source: There's no shortage of it here, my friend.\n\nBlood loss from wounds is our biggest enemy right now. There is a special mushroom that stops bleeding, but we've run out of it. Would you get some more for us?
Target: There's no shortage of it here, my friend.\n\nBlood loss from wounds is our biggest enemy right now. There is a special mushroom that stops bleeding, but we've run out of it. Would you get some more for us?

Source: The senche?
Target: The senche?

Source: Your betrothed's across the river?
Target: Your betrothed's across the river?

Source: What's the problem?
Target: What's the problem?

Source: What do you mean?
Target: What do you mean?

Source: What's happening here?
Target: What's happening here?

Source: What's going on?
Target: What's going on?

Source: Don't worry, I'll have you out of here before they get back.
Target: Don't worry, I'll have you out of here before they get back.

Source: Why did they only take the women?
Target: Why did they only take the women?

Source: You had us bring the troops all the way up here just to stand guard?
Target: You had us bring the troops all the way up here just to stand guard?

Source: Verandis was going to investigate the matter himself.
Target: Verandis was going to investigate the matter himself.

Source: How do I stop Mother Murk?
Target: How do I stop Mother Murk?

Source: Baron Montclair started the civil war?
Target: Baron Montclair started the civil war?

Source: Do not disparage, youth. These are Vivec's children. They died for Morrowind and for him. \n\nWe must provide for their rest. Anoint any remains you find with this sacred oil. That will soothe their spirits.
Target: Do not disparage, youth. These are Vivec's children. They died for Morrowind and for him. \n\nWe must provide for their rest. Anoint any remains you find with this sacred oil. That will soothe their spirits.

Source: The very worst kind—a vampire lord roams these caves. Zalar-do revealed her presence in Anvil when she captured two innocents. I tracked the cat to these caves.\n\nIf she has tasted the blood of these innocents, my blade shall taste hers.
Target: 가장 끔찍한 위험이 있지 - 흡혈귀 군주가 이 동굴을 돌아다닌다. 제라-도는 앤빌에 나타나 무고한 이 두 명을 납치했지. 난 그 고양이가 이 동굴로 들어오는 것을 추적했다.\n\n만약 그녀가 희생자들의 피를 맛 보았다면, 내 칼날이 그녀를 쓰러뜨릴 것이다.

Source: Only the notorious Butcher of Bravil—Captain Jena Apinia! My talkative prisoner finally revealed the Captain's location. And she's close. Very close.\n\nSoon, with your assistance, Raz will make her pay for her crimes of war and terror.
Target: 브라빌의 악명 높은 도살자 제나 아피니아 지휘부관이야! 내 말 많은 포로가 마침내 지휘부관의 위치를 누설했어. 그리고 그녀가 가까이 있어. 아주 가까이 말이야.\n\n라즈는 곧 너의 도움으로 그녀가 저지른 전쟁 범죄와 테러에 대한 대가를 치르게 할 거야.

Source: There's some kind of trouble on the road outside Seyda Neen. Apparently, a Buoyant Armiger was wounded while on a mission for Lord Vivec. I should locate Canon Valasa, who's with the wounded Armiger.

Source: Our bumbling town watch allowed the Duke to get kidnapped, that's what happened. \n\nPlease, you look like you can handle yourself. Surely someone with your talents can help us.
Target: Our bumbling town watch allowed the Duke to get kidnapped, that's what happened. \n\nPlease, you look like you can handle yourself. Surely someone with your talents can help us.

Source: Where then?
Target: Where then?

Source: Rescue Duke Sebastien

Source: I received a letter from Canon Llevule inviting me to travel to Morrowind so I can be introduced to Lord Vivec. He said to find him outside the town of Seyda Neen. Captain Jenassa can take me there from Daggerfall, Davon's Watch, or Vulkhel Guard.
Target: I received a letter from Canon Llevule inviting me to travel to Morrowind so I can be introduced to Lord Vivec. He said to find him outside the town of Seyda Neen. Captain Jenassa can take me there from Daggerfall, Davon's Watch, or Vulkhel Guard.

Source: It seems people have been dying in the Deep Graves. The wisps may have something to do with it.
Target: It seems people have been dying in the Deep Graves. The wisps may have something to do with it.

Source: "<<1>>,\n\n"Come to my garden as soon as you can. I need to talk to you. —V."
Target: "<<1>>,\n\n"Come to my garden as soon as you can. I need to talk to you. —V."

Source: Do you think she tells me things? Can't keep a secret when I'm drinking.\n\nSomething about how someone sold out the guild to the Iron Wheel. And how to put us all back on our feet. Think I'll pass on that.
Target: Do you think she tells me things? Can't keep a secret when I'm drinking.\n\nSomething about how someone sold out the guild to the Iron Wheel. And how to put us all back on our feet. Think I'll pass on that.

Source: Perhaps, but that doesn't make it less true.\n\nDid you know that Prince Hew buried his family's secret shame in his own ancestral tomb? It involved his mad uncle Magnifico Bahraha, who tried to form a necromantic cult under the prince's very nose.
Target: 그럴 지도. 하지만 그런 말을 한다고 이 일이 일어날 가능성이 줄어드는 건 아냐.\n\n휴 왕자가 자기 가족의 비밀스러운 불명예를 조상묘에 묻었다는 거 알아? 왕자의 미친 삼촌인 고관 바라하와 관련되어 있지. 그는 왕자의 면전에서 강령술 종교 집단을 만들려고 했어.

Source: I have a contract. It concerns a corrupt Hlaalu noble hiding in Castle Kvatch. A noble who has to die.\n\nI know you work for the Dark Brotherhood now. Our organizations may despise each other, but you and I are friends. And friends help each other.
Target: 임무가 있다. 크바치 성에 숨어있는 부패한 할루 귀족에 대한 것이다. 죽어야만 하는 어떤 귀족이지.\n\n나는 네가 이제 다크 브라더후드를 위해 일한다는걸 안다. 우리 조직은 서로를 싫어하는 것 같지만, 너와 나는 친구니까. 친구는 서로 돕는 것이지.

Source: Arenthia has been taken by invaders from the north, Colovians. I've been tasked to help the local resistance. It's a ragtag group led by a woman named Kazirra. We have a rough plan, but we need help. To start with, grab a uniform off of this scout.
Target: Arenthia has been taken by invaders from the north, Colovians. I've been tasked to help the local resistance. It's a ragtag group led by a woman named Kazirra. We have a rough plan, but we need help. To start with, grab a uniform off of this scout.

Source: Don't play coy with me. At least not about this. I know you're with the Dark Brotherhood. I'm not, but I'm no threat to you. My target is a corrupt noble of House Hlaalu. He fled Narsis. Caused something of a scandal.\n\nCare to give me a hand?
Target: 내 앞에서 숨길 필요 없어. 적어도 이것에 대해서는 말이야. 나는 네가 다크 브라더후드와 함께 한다는 걸 알고 있어. 나는 아니지만, 널 협박하거나 할 건 아니야. 내 타겟은 할루 가문의 한 부패한 귀족. 그는 나르시스에서 도망쳤지. 무슨 스캔들 때문이었다던데.\n\n나를 도와줄 생각 있어?

Source: I've been thinking about what Gavo said. The temple district makes sense. The resistance kept talking about all the strange lights in that part of town. What do you want to bet that's where the Mane's gone, as well?
Target: I've been thinking about what Gavo said. The temple district makes sense. The resistance kept talking about all the strange lights in that part of town. What do you want to bet that's where the Mane's gone, as well?

Source: Grim? It's worse than that. It's catastrophic!\n\nPrince Hew buried his secret shame in there, but now it's trying to get out and destroy us all! His mad uncle, Magnifico Bahraha the necromancer, damn his eyes! This is all his fault.
Target: Grim? It's worse than that. It's catastrophic!\n\nPrince Hew buried his secret shame in there, but now it's trying to get out and destroy us all! His mad uncle, Magnifico Bahraha the necromancer, damn his eyes! This is all his fault.

Source: I've worked this caravan all my life. These people are my family. What started as a side business for <<1>> is getting out of hand. <<1>>'s a slave-trader. The Khajiit you're looking for isn't working off a debt—he's being sold on the open market!
Target: I've worked this caravan all my life. These people are my family. What started as a side business for <<1>> is getting out of hand. <<1>>'s a slave-trader. The Khajiit you're looking for isn't working off a debt—he's being sold on the open market!

Source: "<<1>>,\n\n"I must once again ask you for your help and advice. I have a solution to the situation with my old friend, but it's hard to explain. I'd prefer to show you in person instead of writing the details here."
Target: "<<1>>,\n\n"I must once again ask you for your help and advice. I have a solution to the situation with my old friend, but it's hard to explain. I'd prefer to show you in person instead of writing the details here."

Source: They keep our eggs in their camps, holding them to keep us docile. They force us to stay near our own nests, hunting us down if we wander too far.\n\nWe want our children back. We need our eggs.
Target: They keep our eggs in their camps, holding them to keep us docile. They force us to stay near our own nests, hunting us down if we wander too far.\n\nWe want our children back. We need our eggs.

Source: There are traditions and protocols for such things. To face the Grand Champion, you must speak to Ishalga and officially challenge her position.
Target: There are traditions and protocols for such things. To face the Grand Champion, you must speak to Ishalga and officially challenge her position.

Source: Mirabelle's outburst doesn't concern you, Assassin. Focus on the task at hand.\n\nCount Carolus still owes us for the Sacrament. He claimed to have information about the Black Dragon. Meet him at the ruins of Dasek Moor and find out what he knows.
Target: Mirabelle's outburst doesn't concern you, Assassin. Focus on the task at hand.\n\nCount Carolus still owes us for the Sacrament. He claimed to have information about the Black Dragon. Meet him at the ruins of Dasek Moor and find out what he knows.

Source: <The note was left here by someone named Tharayya.\n\nShe seems to be a Dwemer researcher looking for a specific artifact called the "Guardian's Eye." The note says her search points her to Yldzuun and she intends to go there.>
Target: <The note was left here by someone named Tharayya.\n\nShe seems to be a Dwemer researcher looking for a specific artifact called the \\"Guardian's Eye.\"\" The note says her search points her to Yldzuun and she intends to go there.>"

Source: You must eventually come to my throne, but not yet. Each of us is a strand to be spun into the story of Valenwood. \n\nYou should seek out the spinner, Maruin. He can tell us how this story began, and where it should end.
Target: You must eventually come to my throne, but not yet. Each of us is a strand to be spun into the story of Valenwood. \n\nYou should seek out the spinner, Maruin. He can tell us how this story began, and where it should end.

Source: "Sniffed out another bunch of squatters making use of <<1>>. Looks like they're holding product too. We should move on it immediately, but try to keep a low profile and we might leech off them for a while before they catch wise."
Target: "Sniffed out another bunch of squatters making use of <<1>>. Looks like they're holding product too. We should move on it immediately, but try to keep a low profile and we might leech off them for a while before they catch wise."

Source: <The note was left here by someone named Tharayya.\n\nShe seems to be a Dwemer researcher looking for a specific artifact called the "Guardian's Eye." The note says her search points her to Aldunz and she intends to go there.>
Target: <The note was left here by someone named Tharayya.\n\nShe seems to be a Dwemer researcher looking for a specific artifact called the \\"Guardian's Eye.\"\" The note says her search points her to Aldunz and she intends to go there.>"

Source: "Have a lead on some buried treasure. No digging required. It's being stashed in the <<1>> and we have a buyer interested in a re-appropriation. This one's not going to sit long, send a professional."
Target: 묻힌 보물 중 일부에 대한 실마리를 찾았다. 땅을 팔 필요는 없다. <<1>>에 숨어 있고 재구매에 관심이 있는 구매자가 있다. 오래 지나지 않아 그 구매자는 곧 전문가를 보낼 것이다.

Source: Because it's all my fault—the Aldmeri. Lady Laurent sent me through the portal to investigate. When the Elves saw me, I ran … and led them to the portal.\n\nSo now she hates me. Please, I beg you. Will you help me get back in her good graces?
Target: Because it's all my fault—the Aldmeri. Lady Laurent sent me through the portal to investigate. When the Elves saw me, I ran … and led them to the portal.\n\nSo now she hates me. Please, I beg you. Will you help me get back in her good graces?

Source: Nosey, aren't you? I can use that. I have a friend who'd be happy to see you. Head north to Bruma. Find Trelon Valen and tell him his wish has come true.
Target: Nosey, aren't you? I can use that. I have a friend who'd be happy to see you. Head north to Bruma. Find Trelon Valen and tell him his wish has come true.

Source: Opening the crate reveals a set of newly tailored robes. A label reads, "Verro Sertorius, Weynon Priory."
Target: Opening the crate reveals a set of newly tailored robes. A label reads, \\"Verro Sertorius
column4: Weynon Priory.\"\""

Source: "Word has it that there's a growing stockpile of valuables accumulating in the <<1>>. Clean 'em out, but get it done before anyone catches wise or we'll take a hit from the buyers."
Target: "Word has it that there's a growing stockpile of valuables accumulating in the <<1>>. Clean 'em out, but get it done before anyone catches wise or we'll take a hit from the buyers."

Source: "My sources say <<1>> has a little more shine today. Rare gems, kept on site, not yet accounted for. Our buyer would like them to disappear without security being unnecessarily compromised."
Target: "My sources say <<1>> has a little more shine today. Rare gems, kept on site, not yet accounted for. Our buyer would like them to disappear without security being unnecessarily compromised."

Source: <The note was left here by someone named Tharayya.\n\nShe seems to be a Dwemer researcher looking for a specific artifact called the "Guardian's Eye." The note says her search points her to Volenfell and she intends to go there.>
Target: <The note was left here by someone named Tharayya.\n\nShe seems to be a Dwemer researcher looking for a specific artifact called the \\"Guardian's Eye.\"\" The note says her search points her to Volenfell and she intends to go there.>"

Source: This journal contains pages of notes about Ayleid wells. Much of it is barely legible; what can be made out is often rambling. The binding is embossed with "Atia Tucca of Weynon Priory."
Target: This journal contains pages of notes about Ayleid wells. Much of it is barely legible; what can be made out is often rambling. The binding is embossed with \\"Atia Tucca of Weynon Priory.\"\""

Source: This one is very worried! Bakhum's sister-in-law's uncle's cousin has been writing strange letters. So strange! Something about the "Maw of Lorkhaj." He is a monk, you see? At the Temple of Seven Riddles. Bakhum fears the worst. You will help, yes?
Target: This one is very worried! Bakhum's sister-in-law's uncle's cousin has been writing strange letters. So strange! Something about the "Maw of Lorkhaj." He is a monk, you see? At the Temple of Seven Riddles. Bakhum fears the worst. You will help, yes?

Source: <Page through the book.>
Target: <Page through the book.>

Source: The kind where you get paid! Just head over to Shark's Teeth Grotto and look for Shalug. She could use some help evicting pirates from our hideout and I'm much too pretty for that sort of work.\n\nDo what she says and the gold will pile up real quick!
Target: 네가 돈을 벌 수 있는 종류의 일이지! 그냥 상어 이빨 동굴로 가서 샬루그를 찾아. 샬루그는 우리 은신처에서 해적들을 몰아내는 데 도움이 필요해. 그리고 난 그런 종류의 일을 하기엔 너무 예쁘고 말이야.\n\n샬루가 말하는 일을 하면 돈더미가 정말 빨리 쌓일 걸!

Source: <<1>> returned <<2>>'s dowry. Seems she's agreed to marry him, to "bind the futures of Taneth and Abah's Landing." How romantic.\n\nOur old guildmaster is behind all this. <<3>> wants <<4>> to pay for his betrayal.
Target: <<1>> returned <<2>>'s dowry. Seems she's agreed to marry him, to "bind the futures of Taneth and Abah's Landing." How romantic.\n\nOur old guildmaster is behind all this. <<3>> wants <<4>> to pay for his betrayal.

Source: Well now, you must have some sharp tusks if you're willing to stand up to the Shark. Don't you know that I lead the meanest crew of cutthroats in Hew's Bane?\n\nThis grotto belongs to the Shark's Teeth and I won't let those pirates ransack it!
Target: 상어에 맞서려면 날카로운 이빨을 가지고 있어야만 할 거야. 내가 휴즈 베인에서 제일 비열한 살인자들을 이끌고 있다는 거 몰라?\n\n이 동굴은 상어 이빨단의 것이고 난 저 해적들이 이곳을 헤집게 두지 않을 거다!

Source: A merchant lord named <<1>> forced <<2>> from his warehouse. <<3>> thinks <<1>> is after the rackets our guild used to control.
Target: <<1>>라는 머천트 로드가 <<2>>를 그의 창고에서 쫓아 냈습니다. <<3>>는 우리 길드가 하곤 했던 돈벌이를  찾고 있어요.

Source: Our failed attempt to steal <<1>>'s dowry. If we left the tomb empty-handed, why does the Iron Wheel think we have it? And if it's gone, who actually stole it?\n\n<<2>> needs you to help her find answers.
Target: 우리는 <<1>>의 지참금을 훔치는 데 실패했습니다. 만약 우리가 그 무덤을 빈 손으로 떠났다면, 왜 아이언 휠이 우리가 지참금을 가지고 있다고 생각하겠습니까? 그리고 지참금이 사라졌다면, 정말은 누가 그걸 훔쳤죠?\n\n<<2>>는 그 답을 찾기 위해 당신을 필요로 합니다.

Source: <Page through the book.>
Target: <Page through the book.>

Source: <Page through the book.>
Target: <Page through the book.>

Source: <The letter, from Forge-Mother Alga, King Kurog gro-Orsinium's mother, invites me and adventurers like me to come visit Wrothgar and the new city of Orsinium. Ambassadors wait in Daggerfall, Davon's Watch, and Vulkhel Guard to provide transport.>
Target: <오시니움의 왕 크로그의 어머니인, 대장간대모 알가에게서 온 편지이다. 나와 다른 여행자들을 로스가와 오시니움의 새 도시로 초대한다는 내용이 담겨져있다. 그들의 사절들이 대거폴, 다본의 감시대, 그리고 벌켈 가드에서 이동 수단을 제공하고 있다고 한다.>

Source: <The corpse carries an official-looking letter. The letter is addressed to you.>
Target: <이 시체는 공적인 내용이 담긴 편지를 전해주려던 것 같다. 이 편지에는 당신의 주소가 적혀있다.>

Source: <Page through the book.>
Target: <Page through the book.>

Source:
"To the Hero of Wrothgar!

"<<1>>, we must speak of your contributions to the  House of Orsimer Glories. Please meet with me as soon as you are able.

"To the Hero of Wrothgar!

Target: 그 말은 … 너 공고를 보고 여기 온 게 아니구나?\n\n음, 설명해 줄게! 난 어려운 작업을 할 거고, 그러려면 파트너가 필요해. 돈은 많이 벌 수 있지만, 여행을 해야 하고, 약간의 위험이 따를 거야. 흥미가 있어?
