Source: The damned Sea Elves are attacking! Both the sanctuary and the grotto. They must've known about this place. \n\nA massive sea serpent has been bound here for centuries in the pool above us. And now, a Maormer mage has broken the seals holding it!
Target: The damned Sea Elves are attacking! Both the sanctuary and the grotto. They must've known about this place. \n\nA massive sea serpent has been bound here for centuries in the pool above us. And now, a Maormer mage has broken the seals holding it!

Source: You know of our botched raid on <<1>>'s tomb. But the Iron Wheel is here to recover her missing dowry. So if we didn't take it, who did?\n\n<<2>> wants answers. She's in <<c:3>>. Go on, now.
Target: <<1>>의 무덤에서 우리가 기습에 실패했다는 걸 알고 있겠지. 그리고 아이언 휠이 그녀의 사라진 지참금을 찾으러 여기 왔어. 그런데 우리가 지참금을 훔치지 못했다면, 누가 훔쳤겠어?\n\n<<2>>는 그 답을 찾고 있어. 그녀는 <<c:3>>에 있지. 당장 가도록 해.

Source: I'm with the Lion Guard—we were responding to reports of a Goblin infestation.\n\nFind them we did, but a fiend ambushed us as we attacked. Daedric, I think, forcing us to retreat to the entrance of the ruin. And now the Goblins have hemmed us in.
Target: I'm with the Lion Guard—we were responding to reports of a Goblin infestation.\n\nFind them we did, but a fiend ambushed us as we attacked. Daedric, I think, forcing us to retreat to the entrance of the ruin. And now the Goblins have hemmed us in.

Source: Back up. Pa'alat is home to gamblers, vagabonds, and the retirement villa of a former Eye of the Queen. A legend, actually, a Khajiit named <<1>>.\n\nUnfortunately, we're pretty sure he's gone rogue.
Target: Back up. Pa'alat is home to gamblers, vagabonds, and the retirement villa of a former Eye of the Queen. A legend, actually, a Khajiit named <<1>>.\n\nUnfortunately, we're pretty sure he's gone rogue.

Source: I want you to kill Artorius and fill the Void with his blood. Let the Order see what it means to challenge the Dark Brotherhood. Show them what happens when you hunt the hunters.\n\nBut reaching Artorius will require all of your Brothers and Sisters.
Target: 아르토리우스를 죽여라. Order에게 다크 브라더후드에게 맞서는게 어떤 의미인지 보여주어라. 사냥꾼을 사냥하면 어떻게 되는지 똑똑히 보여줘야지.\n\n하지만 아르토리우스를 잡기 위해선 모든 힘이 필요하지.

Source: That is good. I believe she has finished … mixing the potion for your initiation. Speak to her when you are ready to begin the trial.\n\nMay Tu'whacca guide your path, initiate … always.
Target: That is good. I believe she has finished … mixing the potion for your initiation. Speak to her when you are ready to begin the trial.\n\nMay Tu'whacca guide your path, initiate … always.

Source: Who … who are you? Thank the gods! You would not believe what I've seen here!\n\nNo, perhaps you would. Please, I need your help. You've got to save them!
Target: Who … who are you? Thank the gods! You would not believe what I've seen here!\n\nNo, perhaps you would. Please, I need your help. You've got to save them!

Source: The monks taught us that a sort of herald would arise in bad times. Blessed by the Manes of old, this person would be the one to guide the Mane of tomorrow. I'm just quoting now. I don't claim to understand half this stuff.
Target: The monks taught us that a sort of herald would arise in bad times. Blessed by the Manes of old, this person would be the one to guide the Mane of tomorrow. I'm just quoting now. I don't claim to understand half this stuff.

Source: Don't play coy. I see it in your eyes. You've killed people. Or you will. You've got the same urges as I do.\n\nJust between us, I hear the Dark Brotherhood is recruiting for some new blood. I'm going to try my best to get their attention.
Target: 숨길 필요 없어. 네 눈에서 보이거든. 넌 사람들을 죽였지. 또는 그럴 예정이거나. 너는 나와 같은 욕망을 가졌어.\n\n우리 사이니까 말인데, 다크 브라더후드가 새 일원을 모집한다는 말을 들었어. 나는 그들의 관심을 끌기 위해 최선을 다 할 생각이야.

Source: No. Due to his seniority and knowledge of the target, that honor's been bestowed upon Green-Venom-Tongue. He's already tracked Lyra to Knightsgrave and is preparing to strike.\n\nI have a different task in mind for you.
Target: 아니. 연공 서열과 목표에 대한 사전지식 때문에 블랙드래곤을 죽일 명예는 Green-Venom-Tongue에게 수여되었다. 그는 이미  Knightsgrave에 있는 라이라를 쫓아 습격을 준비하고 있다.\n\n너에게는 다른 임무르 부여할 것이다.

Source: I came here from <<1>> to see if the storm caused any damage. Then I noticed the Great Tree, covered in some sort of fetid vapor!\n\nI rushed back and told <<2>>. She summoned a spirit to help, but I don't think it worked.
Target: I came here from <<1>> to see if the storm caused any damage. Then I noticed the Great Tree, covered in some sort of fetid vapor!\n\nI rushed back and told <<2>>. She summoned a spirit to help, but I don't think it worked.

Source: Lyra was the most skilled of my Brothers and Sisters. I assumed she died in the purification of my former Sanctuary, along with the rest of my old family.\n\nIf the Black Dragon killed Lyra, why does she use her name? Curiouser and curiouser ….
Target: 라이라는 그 당시 가족들 중에선 가장 훌륭했던 얘였어. 내가 과거에 몸 담았던 성소의 정화 작업 때 다른 가족들과 같이 죽었다고 생각했는데.\n\n만약 블랙 드래곤이 라이라를 죽였다면, 왜 그녀의 이름을 사용했을까? 이상하군 정말 이상해...

Source: You'd help me out? Really? If you're willing, I desperately need some herbs delivered to a customer in Bruma.\n\nThey've already been paid for, but I'm sure Jafola will give you a bonus for speedy delivery.
Target: You'd help me out? Really? If you're willing, I desperately need some herbs delivered to a customer in Bruma.\n\nThey've already been paid for, but I'm sure Jafola will give you a bonus for speedy delivery.

Source: YES YOU WOULD. QUEST GO NOW!
Target: YES YOU WOULD. QUEST GO NOW!

Source: Welcome to the Tower of Lies, a prison designed for Molag Bal's entertainment.\n\nI'm with the Fighters Guild. As soon as we arrived in Coldharbour, Daedra attacked and dragged us down here. We're jammed up but good. I can't get my soldiers organized.
Target: Welcome to the Tower of Lies, a prison designed for Molag Bal's entertainment.\n\nI'm with the Fighters Guild. As soon as we arrived in Coldharbour, Daedra attacked and dragged us down here. We're jammed up but good. I can't get my soldiers organized.

Source: I'll survive. Worse fates await in this ruin.\n\nBattlemage Gaston sent the lot of us down here to get the missing pieces of a stone he found. Seems the Goblins are using them as totems. I managed to take one, but my people are still down there.
Target: I'll survive. Worse fates await in this ruin.\n\nBattlemage Gaston sent the lot of us down here to get the missing pieces of a stone he found. Seems the Goblins are using them as totems. I managed to take one, but my people are still down there.

Source: After Tanek was injured during the Grand Sermonizer incident, Hilde went to pray for him and I haven't seen her since. No one has! It's not like Hilde to just disappear without saying a word to me or Astara.
Target: After Tanek was injured during the Grand Sermonizer incident, Hilde went to pray for him and I haven't seen her since. No one has! It's not like Hilde to just disappear without saying a word to me or Astara.

Source: As it turns out, I'm pregnant. But the father of my baby, Brielus Colus, lives far off in Cheydinhal. He made sure I escaped that warzone but couldn't come with me.\n\nIf he is still alive, he should know he's to be a father.
Target: As it turns out, I'm pregnant. But the father of my baby, Brielus Colus, lives far off in Cheydinhal. He made sure I escaped that warzone but couldn't come with me.\n\nIf he is still alive, he should know he's to be a father.

Source: It's rare, but not unheard of. And the Black Hand agreed to the request, so who am I to complain?\n\nI'd like you to deal with this one, Initiate. Go to Anvil Castle and meet with our client. I'm sure she's got a good reason for altering our protocol.
Target: It's rare, but not unheard of. And the Black Hand agreed to the request, so who am I to complain?\n\nI'd like you to deal with this one, Initiate. Go to Anvil Castle and meet with our client. I'm sure she's got a good reason for altering our protocol.

Source: Among the loot piled here is a fine doctor's bag with the name "Hilio Attius" stitched along the top. Inside, beneath some medical instruments, is a map with the town of Cheydinhal circled.
Target: Among the loot piled here is a fine doctor's bag with the name \\"Hilio Attius\"\" stitched along the top. Inside
column4: beneath some medical instruments
column5: is a map with the town of Cheydinhal circled."

Source: "<<1>>,\n\n"A personal matter has arisen that requires a gentle touch. It involves an old friend and an incident from our past that we need to put behind us."
Target: "<<1>>,\n\n"A personal matter has arisen that requires a gentle touch. It involves an old friend and an incident from our past that we need to put behind us."

Source: I was escorting my brother's wife to Vlastarus; Angiente is waiting for us there. But we ran into these undead last night and they killed Munya. I barely escaped. Now I'm waiting for a chance to run in, grab her body, and bring it to Angiente.
Target: I was escorting my brother's wife to Vlastarus; Angiente is waiting for us there. But we ran into these undead last night and they killed Munya. I barely escaped. Now I'm waiting for a chance to run in, grab her body, and bring it to Angiente.

Source: You are correct. The Dark Elves of Kragenmoor do not swim in the River of Humor. \n\nI came here to delve into a nearby tomb, but the soldiers prevent my entry.
Target: You are correct. The Dark Elves of Kragenmoor do not swim in the River of Humor. \n\nI came here to delve into a nearby tomb, but the soldiers prevent my entry.

Source: Well, one of us is. We fled Pell's Gate, heading for the town of Vlastarus. We got separated in the confusion. I hope she made it. If you're headed there, will you look for her and let her know I'm on my way?
Target: Well, one of us is. We fled Pell's Gate, heading for the town of Vlastarus. We got separated in the confusion. I hope she made it. If you're headed there, will you look for her and let her know I'm on my way?

Source: Yes. The Vanguard made the error of taking advantage of my noble house. I want that error corrected.
Target: Yes. The Vanguard made the error of taking advantage of my noble house. I want that error corrected.

Source: "WANTED: A group of warriors to cleanse an abomination from Hrota Cave.\n\n"For years, Exulus the Wispmother haunted Hrota Cave, draining the life from all who enter. This undead evil must be wiped away. Its many victims cry for justice!"
Target: "WANTED: A group of warriors to cleanse an abomination from Hrota Cave.\n\n"For years, Exulus the Wispmother haunted Hrota Cave, draining the life from all who enter. This undead evil must be wiped away. Its many victims cry for justice!"

Source: It is beyond comprehension. Some of the greatest heroes in Alik'r's history have been laid to rest here.\n\nThey were consecrated—there is no way they can be re-animated. We deemed it an illusion at first, but then they started killing the priests.
Target: It is beyond comprehension. Some of the greatest heroes in Alik'r's history have been laid to rest here.\n\nThey were consecrated—there is no way they can be re-animated. We deemed it an illusion at first, but then they started killing the priests.

Source: Dominion inspectors. Headwoman <<1>> requested their aid to stop smugglers.\n\nWe're honest farmers with good customers. Our moon-sugar is used to spice food, not to brew skooma! When the inspectors learn we can't protect our fields, we're finished!
Target: Dominion inspectors. Headwoman <<1>> requested their aid to stop smugglers.\n\nWe're honest farmers with good customers. Our moon-sugar is used to spice food, not to brew skooma! When the inspectors learn we can't protect our fields, we're finished!

Source: We seek to right an injustice. But we can't do it alone.\n\nUntil the Pact set us free, we were the property of the Volek family. Now the last of the Voleks has come to Mournhold.
Target: We seek to right an injustice. But we can't do it alone.\n\nUntil the Pact set us free, we were the property of the Volek family. Now the last of the Voleks has come to Mournhold.

Source: Our moon-sugar storehouses caught fire. Father thought to save our livelihood. He ran inside, and ….\n\nThe burns weren't bad, but the sweet-smoke ruined his lungs. Without powerful medicine, he won't last the day.
Target: Our moon-sugar storehouses caught fire. Father thought to save our livelihood. He ran inside, and ….\n\nThe burns weren't bad, but the sweet-smoke ruined his lungs. Without powerful medicine, he won't last the day.

Source: I heard sounds of battle, and a voice shouting for someone named <<1>> to run. The Worm Cult likely attacked some unlucky travelers.\n\nMy advice? Find this <<1>> before the Worm Cult adds him to their collection of undead slaves.
Target: I heard sounds of battle, and a voice shouting for someone named <<1>> to run. The Worm Cult likely attacked some unlucky travelers.\n\nMy advice? Find this <<1>> before the Worm Cult adds him to their collection of undead slaves.

Source: He'll likely be tending his barn at the edge of town. Like Kalari said, do not let his surly voice throw you off.\n\nInside, he's like a cuddly cub.
Target: He'll likely be tending his barn at the edge of town. Like Kalari said, do not let his surly voice throw you off.\n\nInside, he's like a cuddly cub.

Source:
"Belya,

Your services are required in Cheydinhal. The rebellion is bearing fruit. You must be our eyes and ears. Take no risks but hasten here.

- Iocundus"
Target: \\"Belya
column4:
Your services are required in Cheydinhal. The rebellion is bearing fruit. You must be our eyes and ears. Take no risks but hasten here.

- Iocundus"""

Source: He wasn't wrong.\n\nThe Veiled Heritants subjected my brother's body to an unnatural resurrection—as a lich. He has the Staff of Magnus and is using it to suppress Hectahame's necromantic wards and raise an undead army.
Target: He wasn't wrong.\n\nThe Veiled Heritants subjected my brother's body to an unnatural resurrection—as a lich. He has the Staff of Magnus and is using it to suppress Hectahame's necromantic wards and raise an undead army.

Source: <<1>>'s ledger? The blackmail you stole from <<2>>? This is our blueprint to pulling heists, just like we used to.\n\nWe can hit our rivals where it hurts. Take their ill-gotten gains for ourselves. Use it to rebuild.
Target: <<1>>'s ledger? The blackmail you stole from <<2>>? This is our blueprint to pulling heists, just like we used to.\n\nWe can hit our rivals where it hurts. Take their ill-gotten gains for ourselves. Use it to rebuild.

Source: "A young Khajiit wandered into camp last night, said he's looking for <<1>>. If anyone asks where I am, I'm dragging this fool off to <<2>>. He'll see the boss before his head and body part ways."
Target: \\"A young Khajiit wandered into camp last night
column4: said he's looking for <<1>>. If anyone asks where I am
column5: I'm dragging this fool off to <<2>>. He'll see the boss before his head and body part ways.\"\""

Source: "<<1>>,\n\n"Narahni and I are doing well. She wants to talk to you."
Target: "<<1>>,\n\n"Narahni and I are doing well. She wants to talk to you."

Source: Mane Akkhuz-ri and many soldiers are stranded in the old merchant tunnel to the north, surrounded by Prince Naemon's undead. \n\nIndaenir's actually already volunteered the two of you to go after them.
Target: Mane Akkhuz-ri and many soldiers are stranded in the old merchant tunnel to the north, surrounded by Prince Naemon's undead. \n\nIndaenir's actually already volunteered the two of you to go after them.

Source: "Esteemed thieves, I need your help. My wealth is vast and my wants are few. What I cherish most is that which I cannot simply buy. Well-lived objects, near and dear to their owners, from all walks of life. It is my last pleasure. Details attached."
Target: "Esteemed thieves, I need your help. My wealth is vast and my wants are few. What I cherish most is that which I cannot simply buy. Well-lived objects, near and dear to their owners, from all walks of life. It is my last pleasure. Details attached."

Source: My son, Donus. He fled from Cheydinhal when the Imperials tried to force him to join their fight against the rebels.\n\nI'm sure my wife is worried about both of us. If you go to Cheydinhal, tell Kirandas that I'm fine and still looking for Donus.
Target: My son, Donus. He fled from Cheydinhal when the Imperials tried to force him to join their fight against the rebels.\n\nI'm sure my wife is worried about both of us. If you go to Cheydinhal, tell Kirandas that I'm fine and still looking for Donus.

Source: "An elderly noblewoman was recently robbed of her engagement ring. The burglars were last seen heading towards <<1>>. A reward is offered for the return of the ring. Deliver it to <<2>> to collect."
Target: "An elderly noblewoman was recently robbed of her engagement ring. The burglars were last seen heading towards <<1>>. A reward is offered for the return of the ring. Deliver it to <<2>> to collect."

Source: A fool, who paid the ultimate price for ambition. But I would see none fall as I did.\n\nYou must leave. The book before you is cursed, as are its two siblings. Can't you hear it call to you?
Target: A fool, who paid the ultimate price for ambition. But I would see none fall as I did.\n\nYou must leave. The book before you is cursed, as are its two siblings. Can't you hear it call to you?

Source: "A captain and his crew ran afoul of Maormer at Thrall Cove. The captain wants any crewmen that survived rescued, but also the return of his treasured spyglass. Only seasoned adventurers need apply. See <<1>> with the spyglass to collect the reward."
Target: "A captain and his crew ran afoul of Maormer at Thrall Cove. The captain wants any crewmen that survived rescued, but also the return of his treasured spyglass. Only seasoned adventurers need apply. See <<1>> with the spyglass to collect the reward."

Source: He was. Some of our soldiers said they saw Naemon leading his skeleton army into the pass. But that was some time ago—before our forces were scattered. \n\nNow the undead near the gates of Marbruk itself. The city may soon be overrun.
Target: He was. Some of our soldiers said they saw Naemon leading his skeleton army into the pass. But that was some time ago—before our forces were scattered. \n\nNow the undead near the gates of Marbruk itself. The city may soon be overrun.

Source: This is the Trollfight Arena! A place of gladiatorial combat, where the mightiest of trolls live and die!
Target: This is the Trollfight Arena! A place of gladiatorial combat, where the mightiest of trolls live and die!

Source: "An old sailor seeks the return of the favorite wooden pipe of his youth, lost in a scuffle in <<1>>. A reward is offered for anyone who finds it. Deliver it to <<2>> to collect."
Target: "An old sailor seeks the return of the favorite wooden pipe of his youth, lost in a scuffle in <<1>>. A reward is offered for anyone who finds it. Deliver it to <<2>> to collect."

Source: We have lizards and we line 'em up and race them. That's pretty much it.
Target: We have lizards and we line 'em up and race them. That's pretty much it.

Source: Halindor's made it clear to me that Ezreba didn't help the cultists willingly. But I still believe she should be punished. There is a part of me that feels she should be banished from Greenhill.
Target: Halindor's made it clear to me that Ezreba didn't help the cultists willingly. But I still believe she should be punished. There is a part of me that feels she should be banished from Greenhill.

Source: "A man seeks the return of his late wife's necklace, lost among the swamps after his courier was attacked. The necklace could be damaged or broken. Deliver to <<1>> to collect. No reimbursement for death, dismemberment, or disease.
Target: "A man seeks the return of his late wife's necklace, lost among the swamps after his courier was attacked. The necklace could be damaged or broken. Deliver to <<1>> to collect. No reimbursement for death, dismemberment, or disease.

Source: We need you two to rescue Mane Akkhuz-ri. The Mane's party was cut off from the rest of our forces when Prince Naemon and his undead army first attacked. \n\nThe last thing we need is the Mane's death on our hands.
Target: We need you two to rescue Mane Akkhuz-ri. The Mane's party was cut off from the rest of our forces when Prince Naemon and his undead army first attacked. \n\nThe last thing we need is the Mane's death on our hands.

Source: That oily fat cat tried to bribe me with a fine wine to keep an eye out for you!\n\nOf course I took his bribe. Why do you think we're talking? Said to meet him in <<c:1>>, quick as you can.
Target: 그 기름 지고 뚱뚱한 고양이가 널 계속 감시해 달라고 포도주로 날 매수하려 했지!\n\n물론 난 뇌물을 받았어. 우리가 왜 이야기를 하고 있다고 생각해? <<c:1>>에서 그를 만난나. 가능한 한 빨리.

Source: The crate is full of debris. Buried under it is a small silver flute. \n\nAn inscription on the flute reads: "Halion of Chorrol."
Target: The crate is full of debris. Buried under it is a small silver flute. \n\nAn inscription on the flute reads: \\"Halion of Chorrol.\"\""

Source: "Rye's Reacquisitions!" I track down items that have gone missing. As you might expect, quite a bit turns up here, but I specialize in objects of purely sentimental value. My finder's fee for the guild is usually well above the items' material worth.
Target: "Rye's Reacquisitions!" I track down items that have gone missing. As you might expect, quite a bit turns up here, but I specialize in objects of purely sentimental value. My finder's fee for the guild is usually well above the items' material worth.

Source: Someone offering to help me? Well, that's a first.\n\nI wrote a letter to my cousin Asvorn in Chorrol. But I can't leave here and no one will deliver it for me. Would you bring it to him?
Target: Someone offering to help me? Well, that's a first.\n\nI wrote a letter to my cousin Asvorn in Chorrol. But I can't leave here and no one will deliver it for me. Would you bring it to him?

Source: Great! I'm glad you love Spikeball so much!
Target: Great! I'm glad you love Spikeball so much!

Source: Do you see that strange miasma? It appeared on the Great Tree after the hurricane, like a sickness. I've done what I can, but I fear it's not enough.
Target: Do you see that strange miasma? It appeared on the Great Tree after the hurricane, like a sickness. I've done what I can, but I fear it's not enough.

Source: "A coward hides among the Lion Guard. My kin's blood is on their hands. So shall their blood be on yours."
Target: "A coward hides among the Lion Guard. My kin's blood is on their hands. So shall their blood be on yours."

Source: "I'm being muscled out of my trade by a well-connected competitor. I'll pay handsomely for the Brotherhood to show how cutthroat business can really be."
Target: "I'm being muscled out of my trade by a well-connected competitor. I'll pay handsomely for the Brotherhood to show how cutthroat business can really be."

Source: The thieves went straight to the reliquary. They took the chalice, and a number of other relics. The relics have little monetary value, but we know the Chalice of Mara has divine mystical properties. I suspect they had help.
Target: The thieves went straight to the reliquary. They took the chalice, and a number of other relics. The relics have little monetary value, but we know the Chalice of Mara has divine mystical properties. I suspect they had help.

Source: <<1>> thinks someone sold out the guild to the Iron Wheel. She wants to deal with this mess fast, before everyone starts pointing fingers.
Target: <<1>> thinks someone sold out the guild to the Iron Wheel. She wants to deal with this mess fast, before everyone starts pointing fingers.

Source: I don't want to get into details with the lamia standing nearby. Meet me at the bridge to the east of here. We'll talk there.\n\nJust be careful. Any other lamias you meet won't be as friendly as Tzik'nith.
Target: I don't want to get into details with the lamia standing nearby. Meet me at the bridge to the east of here. We'll talk there.\n\nJust be careful. Any other lamias you meet won't be as friendly as Tzik'nith.

Source: As if the Grand Sermonizer didn't have enough vices to rage about, now she's preaching against the Brotherhood. She says we are weak, powerless. A toothless dragon that inspires ridicule instead of fear.\n\nThese lies must be silenced—permanently.
Target: 대 설교사가 난동을 부릴 만큼 충분한 악의가 없는 것처럼 굴더니, 이젠 브라더후드에 반대하는 설교를 하고 있다. 그녀는 우리가 약하고, 힘이 없다고 말하고 있지. 공포가 아닌 조롱을 불러 일으키는 이빨 빠진 드래곤이라고 말이다.\n\n이 거짓말을 침묵시켜야 할 것이다. 영원히.

Source: Better than usual. Might you be traveling to Chorrol? My friend, Hannura, lives there. She loves fish and could use a treat, given Chorrol's troubles. Would you bring her some of my catch?
Target: Better than usual. Might you be traveling to Chorrol? My friend, Hannura, lives there. She loves fish and could use a treat, given Chorrol's troubles. Would you bring her some of my catch?

Source: "A spy hides among the refugees at the camp in Aldcroft. It would not be flattering for the Covenant to raise their hand against the helpless, but the Brotherhood has no such reservations. Root out this canker and you shall be rewarded."
Target: "A spy hides among the refugees at the camp in Aldcroft. It would not be flattering for the Covenant to raise their hand against the helpless, but the Brotherhood has no such reservations. Root out this canker and you shall be rewarded."

Source:
"Jena-

This is your last chance to settle your debt. It has cost me a great deal to find you. Cheydinhal wasn't far enough.

-M"
Target:
\"Jena-

This is your last chance to settle your debt. It has cost me a great deal to find you. Cheydinhal wasn't far enough.

-M"""

Source: Something about the bastard who forced <<1>> from his own warehouse. <<2>>, I think? Some fancy-pantalooned merchant lord who might be after the guild's old rackets.
Target: <<1>>에게 창고에서 나가라고 강요했던 개자식에 대한 거라네. <<2>>라지? 길드의 오랜 사업을 쫓고 있는 지도 모르는 화려한 나팔 바지를 입은 어떤 머천트 로드 말이야.

Source: My father's very sick. So are many of our warriors. Many have even died.\n\nOur water was poisoned, probably by these foul necromancers—the Withered Hand. They seek to weaken the Ash'abah so that we cannot stand against them.
Target: My father's very sick. So are many of our warriors. Many have even died.\n\nOur water was poisoned, probably by these foul necromancers—the Withered Hand. They seek to weaken the Ash'abah so that we cannot stand against them.

Source: "I can't tolerate thieves—and there's one who's been smuggling my goods from Daggerfall's port. The only thing I would like to see disappear from the docks is this sticky-fingered cur."
Target: "I can't tolerate thieves—and there's one who's been smuggling my goods from Daggerfall's port. The only thing I would like to see disappear from the docks is this sticky-fingered cur."

Source: Looking for supplies. The members of the Mages Guild below will need all the aid I can muster.\n\nWe've sent an expedition into the Hollow, unwise as that may be.
Target: Looking for supplies. The members of the Mages Guild below will need all the aid I can muster.\n\nWe've sent an expedition into the Hollow, unwise as that may be.

Source: "I am positive that one of the staff has been stealing from Daggerfall Castle, and as seneschal it falls on me to resolve the problem. I can't afford to reveal this failure to my liege, so please ensure the problem is resolved … unconventionally."
Target: "I am positive that one of the staff has been stealing from Daggerfall Castle, and as seneschal it falls on me to resolve the problem. I can't afford to reveal this failure to my liege, so please ensure the problem is resolved … unconventionally."

Source: Fahara'jad sent you to ask for our help? Now? The nerve of this king!\n\nHmmph. Well, if you seek my father, you should know he—and many other of our warriors—are extremely ill. Some are dead. Our water was poisoned.
Target: Fahara'jad sent you to ask for our help? Now? The nerve of this king!\n\nHmmph. Well, if you seek my father, you should know he—and many other of our warriors—are extremely ill. Some are dead. Our water was poisoned.

Source: You want me to get the list?
Target: You want me to get the list?

Source: Just waiting to be asked stupid questions by strangers, what else? I'm watching. And waiting for my brother Klovag, who's late as usual. When he finally gets here, we're gonna wipe this place out.
Target: Just waiting to be asked stupid questions by strangers, what else? I'm watching. And waiting for my brother Klovag, who's late as usual. When he finally gets here, we're gonna wipe this place out.

Source: And you know where we can find him?
Target: And you know where we can find him?

Source: I'm right behind you.
Target: I'm right behind you.

Source: Must remember, talk slower and louder. Let me start over.\n\nI am Rigurt! We're brand-new diplomats, here to learn about Dark Elf way of life and spread word about our glorious Nord culture. Such knowledging will strengthen our alliance!
Target: Must remember, talk slower and louder. Let me start over.\n\nI am Rigurt! We're brand-new diplomats, here to learn about Dark Elf way of life and spread word about our glorious Nord culture. Such knowledging will strengthen our alliance!

Source: "Make no mistake, no one leaves the pack, ever. I want Engitaale found. Scouts reported seeing her near Vlastarus. Bring her to me, dead or alive.\n\n- Geneura"
Target: \\"Make no mistake
column4: no one leaves the pack
column5: ever. I want Engitaale found. Scouts reported seeing her near Vlastarus. Bring her to me

Source: Bold words, but your Divines can't protect you here. \n\nYour goddess hides in her Temple while Vox wields the power of Oblivion. How do you hope to stand against that?
Target: Bold words, but your Divines can't protect you here. \n\nYour goddess hides in her Temple while Vox wields the power of Oblivion. How do you hope to stand against that?

Source: Vampires. The region beyond is crawling with them! Worse, anyone we send in there is turned into one of the foul monsters.\n\nAnd do you see the structure that looms on the horizon? I believe that's one of Molag Bal's infamous Harvest Hearts.
Target: Vampires. The region beyond is crawling with them! Worse, anyone we send in there is turned into one of the foul monsters.\n\nAnd do you see the structure that looms on the horizon? I believe that's one of Molag Bal's infamous Harvest Hearts.

Source: Are you sure your husband's there?
Target: Are you sure your husband's there?

Source: My brothers and I made a pact to burn the Vereansu supplies. They killed our father when they attacked Muth Gnaar. \n\nI tried to imagine which crates I would burn, but don't think I can do it. I'm not the violent type.
Target: My brothers and I made a pact to burn the Vereansu supplies. They killed our father when they attacked Muth Gnaar. \n\nI tried to imagine which crates I would burn, but don't think I can do it. I'm not the violent type.

Source: Walk the Two Moons Path. It's been my destiny since I was a cub. I know that now. We walk the path, and I become the new Mane. Then we get my sister back.
Target: Walk the Two Moons Path. It's been my destiny since I was a cub. I know that now. We walk the path, and I become the new Mane. Then we get my sister back.

Source: Is there anything I can do?
Target: Is there anything I can do?

Source: Help? It's too late for that. We were caring for the afflicted when the Vereansu attacked us without warning. They killed everyone in the Muth Gnaar monastery and set everything on fire. They threw people into the flames!
Target: Help? It's too late for that. We were caring for the afflicted when the Vereansu attacked us without warning. They killed everyone in the Muth Gnaar monastery and set everything on fire. They threw people into the flames!

Source: Excellent. The Queen, the Silvenar—even the fallen light Akkhuz-ri is within. This one's superior, Kauzanabi-jo, awaits you at the dais. Follow Hadam-do, Hallowed.
Target: Excellent. The Queen, the Silvenar—even the fallen light Akkhuz-ri is within. This one's superior, Kauzanabi-jo, awaits you at the dais. Follow Hadam-do, Hallowed.

Source: <<1>> is a simple fishing village, but the Ayleid once called it home. Ancient artifacts and dark secrets hide beneath the swamp.\n\nAgents went in to uncover the Dominion's purpose. <<2>>, <<3>>, and <<4>>. They haven't returned.
Target: <<1>> is a simple fishing village, but the Ayleid once called it home. Ancient artifacts and dark secrets hide beneath the swamp.\n\nAgents went in to uncover the Dominion's purpose. <<2>>, <<3>>, and <<4>>. They haven't returned.

Source: Walk the Two Moons Path, of course. It's been my destiny since I was a cub. I know that now. We walk the path, I become Mane. Then we get my sister back.
Target: Walk the Two Moons Path, of course. It's been my destiny since I was a cub. I know that now. We walk the path, I become Mane. Then we get my sister back.

Source: Recover? Is he alive?
Target: Recover? Is he alive?

Source: <Take the note.>
Target: <Take the note.>

Source: Yes. The moons tell me that the spirits of the past spoke of a temple. The holy temple of Moonmont. Its walls once sang of moonlight. And now drip with the corruption of the Dark Mane.
Target: Yes. The moons tell me that the spirits of the past spoke of a temple. The holy temple of Moonmont. Its walls once sang of moonlight. And now drip with the corruption of the Dark Mane.

Source: Who's the new constable?
Target: Who's the new constable?

Source: What happened when you decided to leave?
Target: What happened when you decided to leave?

Source: My clutch-brothers and I came seeking our brother, but we're too late. Filth-ridden Goblins have taken over the <<1>> mine. If <<2>> is still alive, the Goblins are between us and him.\n\nWe're not warriors, but you could save him.
Target: My clutch-brothers and I came seeking our brother, but we're too late. Filth-ridden Goblins have taken over the <<1>> mine. If <<2>> is still alive, the Goblins are between us and him.\n\nWe're not warriors, but you could save him.

Source: It does look like these people are expecting that.
Target: It does look like these people are expecting that.

Source: I'll talk to Holgunn.
Target: I'll talk to Holgunn.

Source: I'll see what I can do to help.
Target: I'll see what I can do to help.

Source: Nothing better than causing massive damage on the battlefield, is there?\n\nIf you want to know more about rams and oil, talk to Lirtis. For trebuchets, catapults, and ballistae, speak with Looks-Forward.
Target: Nothing better than causing massive damage on the battlefield, is there?\n\nIf you want to know more about rams and oil, talk to Lirtis. For trebuchets, catapults, and ballistae, speak with Looks-Forward.

Source: So many people died! But they remain here, as angry and vengeful spirits.
Target: So many people died! But they remain here, as angry and vengeful spirits.

Source: Not likely. You need training. Let's start with an easy task. Mirrored-Skin waits at the Southern Morrowind gate with munitions for the siege range. Use the Transitus Shrine to get there and back. Vother Herendas can tell you more about it.
Target: Not likely. You need training. Let's start with an easy task. Mirrored-Skin waits at the Southern Morrowind gate with munitions for the siege range. Use the Transitus Shrine to get there and back. Vother Herendas can tell you more about it.

Source: There's an injured woman on the road to Selfora. Find her and get her to safety.
Target: There's an injured woman on the road to Selfora. Find her and get her to safety.

Source: Not so fast. First you need training. Start with Zahreh at the Northern High Rock gate. She has munitions to be delivered to the siege range. The Transitus Shrine is the best way to get there and back. Felycie Canis can tell you more about it.
Target: Not so fast. First you need training. Start with Zahreh at the Northern High Rock gate. She has munitions to be delivered to the siege range. The Transitus Shrine is the best way to get there and back. Felycie Canis can tell you more about it.

Source: Speak with the Protector Galiel at the Elder Scroll temple of Chim. He will show you what we fight for.
Target: Speak with the Protector Galiel at the Elder Scroll temple of Chim. He will show you what we fight for.

Source: Is there anything I can do for him?
Target: Is there anything I can do for him?

Source: We entered the ruins to recover the stolen relics, but the bandits got the drop on us. Quick, break the lock on these chains. Get me out of here!
Target: We entered the ruins to recover the stolen relics, but the bandits got the drop on us. Quick, break the lock on these chains. Get me out of here!

Source: I will go try to solve the problem in Rivenspire then.
Target: I will go try to solve the problem in Rivenspire then.

Source: Is there anything I can do?
Target: Is there anything I can do?

Source: Yeah, well … the fools got themselves carried off into the dungeon. Then our guide ran away.\n\nWe were hired to find out why the springs down there are making people sick, but they didn't say anything about lamias!
Target: Yeah, well … the fools got themselves carried off into the dungeon. Then our guide ran away.\n\nWe were hired to find out why the springs down there are making people sick, but they didn't say anything about lamias!

Source: We've walked the Two Moons Path, the path of Jone and Jode. But there is a third moon: The Dark Moon, the enemy of the Khajiit. Lorkhaj, the Missing God. This is the secret at the end of the Path … we must travel to the Den of Lorkhaj.
Target: We've walked the Two Moons Path, the path of Jone and Jode. But there is a third moon: The Dark Moon, the enemy of the Khajiit. Lorkhaj, the Missing God. This is the secret at the end of the Path … we must travel to the Den of Lorkhaj.

Source: Ebonheart Pact delegates are here?
Target: Ebonheart Pact delegates are here?

Source: The Sacred Lady doesn't share all her secrets with those who serve her. But as far as I know, no attack has yet occurred within the confines of the city.
Target: The Sacred Lady doesn't share all her secrets with those who serve her. But as far as I know, no attack has yet occurred within the confines of the city.

Source: Why would someone have done that?
Target: Why would someone have done that?

Source: Maybe we can talk to her.
Target: Maybe we can talk to her.

Source: Anything I can do to help?
Target: Anything I can do to help?

Source: I'll see to Barasatii.
Target: I'll see to Barasatii.

Source: What do I need to do?
Target: What do I need to do?

Source: I'll talk to Holgunn.
Target: I'll talk to Holgunn.

Source: I'll find your dog. And your husband, if I can.
Target: I'll find your dog. And your husband, if I can.

Source: What can I do?
Target: What can I do?

Source: I'm one of the vicecanon's scouts. I've been watching Dominion activity in <<1>> for days.\n\n<<1>> has been abandoned for years, the only one who lives there now is a crazy Kothringi. The Dominion tied him up in the center of the village.
Target: I'm one of the vicecanon's scouts. I've been watching Dominion activity in <<1>> for days.\n\n<<1>> has been abandoned for years, the only one who lives there now is a crazy Kothringi. The Dominion tied him up in the center of the village.

Source: Take word of what we've accomplished to <<1>> in Hissmir. They already know the situation here at Murkwater, but they should know more.\n\nIt's not far from here, just to the northwest.
Target: Take word of what we've accomplished to <<1>> in Hissmir. They already know the situation here at Murkwater, but they should know more.\n\nIt's not far from here, just to the northwest.

Source: First, you need training. It starts with an easy task. Fangil waits at the Western Elsweyr gate with munitions for the siege range. The Transitus Shrine is the best way to get there and back. Viriniel can tell you more about it.
Target: First, you need training. It starts with an easy task. Fangil waits at the Western Elsweyr gate with munitions for the siege range. The Transitus Shrine is the best way to get there and back. Viriniel can tell you more about it.

Source: Did what I was taught to do. When outnumbered, I hide. Not the bravest move, but it kept the two of us alive.\n\nListen, if you're going down there, I could use your help. I need some things from the camp.
Target: Did what I was taught to do. When outnumbered, I hide. Not the bravest move, but it kept the two of us alive.\n\nListen, if you're going down there, I could use your help. I need some things from the camp.

Source: "WANTED: Experienced warriors to thrill our spectators with their martial prowess!\n\n"Are you an experienced mercenary or gladiator looking to make a name for yourself? Prove your prowess by braving the gauntlet of the Kvatch Arena!"
Target: "WANTED: Experienced warriors to thrill our spectators with their martial prowess!\n\n"Are you an experienced mercenary or gladiator looking to make a name for yourself? Prove your prowess by braving the gauntlet of the Kvatch Arena!"

Source: He took some troops to the southern side of the Gorge. He's looking for the Maulborn leader. The alchemist.\n\nI don't know if he made it that far or not.
Target: He took some troops to the southern side of the Gorge. He's looking for the Maulborn leader. The alchemist.\n\nI don't know if he made it that far or not.

Source: The Iron Wheel is about to put <<1>> on a prison ship to Taneth. <<2>> found out when it's going to happen.\n\nThis is the only chance we'll have to recover our guildmaster before she's locked away in a Taneth dungeon.
Target: The Iron Wheel is about to put <<1>> on a prison ship to Taneth. <<2>> found out when it's going to happen.\n\nThis is the only chance we'll have to recover our guildmaster before she's locked away in a Taneth dungeon.

Source: You're going to think I'm crazy. But there's a cave not far from here. My apprentice and I camped there to get out of the weather, and when we woke up … a whole village had appeared out of nowhere! Full of Elves and homes and everything!
Target: You're going to think I'm crazy. But there's a cave not far from here. My apprentice and I camped there to get out of the weather, and when we woke up … a whole village had appeared out of nowhere! Full of Elves and homes and everything!

Source: <<1>>—the one with the missing dowry? <<2>> "found" it, returned it, and now she's agreed to marry him. "For the future of Taneth," or some drivel.\n\n<<3>> thinks our old guildmaster is behind this. She wants <<4>> to pay for betraying us. So do I!
Target: <<1>>—the one with the missing dowry? <<2>> "found" it, returned it, and now she's agreed to marry him. "For the future of Taneth," or some drivel.\n\n<<3>> thinks our old guildmaster is behind this. She wants <<4>> to pay for betraying us. So do I!

Source: The situation? We're well and truly flummoxed! Before we could cross the Chasm, before we could confront Molag Grunda, we were stopped by a few pesky focus stones!\n\nThe wee ginger mage says that we have to break the stones, but good luck with that!
Target: The situation? We're well and truly flummoxed! Before we could cross the Chasm, before we could confront Molag Grunda, we were stopped by a few pesky focus stones!\n\nThe wee ginger mage says that we have to break the stones, but good luck with that!

Source: I can try to find Puddles.
Target: I can try to find Puddles.

Source: His home is just up the hill behind this one's farm. Make sure when you see Milk-Eyes, you tell him he still owes Ezzag for their last match.
Target: His home is just up the hill behind this one's farm. Make sure when you see Milk-Eyes, you tell him he still owes Ezzag for their last match.

Source: "The Gold Coast Trading Company has invited disaster to our shores.  By secretly using the ruins of Garlas Agea to house dangerous monstrosities, the company has put the very safety of the general public in question."
Target: "The Gold Coast Trading Company has invited disaster to our shores.  By secretly using the ruins of Garlas Agea to house dangerous monstrosities, the company has put the very safety of the general public in question."

Source: I won't let you down.
Target: I won't let you down.

Source: What business is it of yours, outsider?\n\nForgive me. That's the pain speaking. My friends and I were scavenging in the swamp as we always do, but the creatures there suddenly went mad and attacked us. I barely got out alive.
Target: What business is it of yours, outsider?\n\nForgive me. That's the pain speaking. My friends and I were scavenging in the swamp as we always do, but the creatures there suddenly went mad and attacked us. I barely got out alive.

Source: "WANTED: Mercenaries needed to investigate unnatural occurrences reported at Tribune's Folly.\n\n"Our dig has been disrupted by the otherworldly intrusion of disembodied voices, hostile shadows, and rumblings that shake the foundation of the site."
Target: \\"WANTED: 용병들은 트리뷴의 어리석음에서 보고된 비정상적인 사건을 조사 해주십시오.\n\n\"\"우리의 발굴이  비현실적인 알 수 없는 곳에서 나오는 목소리와 적대적인 그림자
column4: 그리고 현장의 토대를 뒤흔드는 소리들로 인해 차질을 빚었습니다. \"\""

Source: Who would respond? The Pact holds the Covenant at bay. The only troops they've sent are their wounded and dying.\n\nYou've helped the grievously injured, but wounded soldiers can't protect us.
Target: Who would respond? The Pact holds the Covenant at bay. The only troops they've sent are their wounded and dying.\n\nYou've helped the grievously injured, but wounded soldiers can't protect us.

Source: Yes, Akkhuz-ri. For all he has been through, he is still wise. Travel now to Rawl'kha. I am certain the Mane … I am certain Akkhuz-ri will do the same.
Target: Yes, Akkhuz-ri. For all he has been through, he is still wise. Travel now to Rawl'kha. I am certain the Mane … I am certain Akkhuz-ri will do the same.

Source: A common enemy?
Target: A common enemy?

Source: Thanks, I think. Why are you tied up here?
Target: Thanks, I think. Why are you tied up here?

Target: What is the plan?

Source: What do you intend to do?
Target: What do you intend to do?

Source: What kind of threats?
Target: What kind of threats?

Source: That is a good name you have.\n\nSo, Well-Named, would you like to help me with a problem?
Target: That is a good name you have.\n\nSo, Well-Named, would you like to help me with a problem?

Source: The moonlight sings to Kauzanabi-jo. Sings of the darkness inside Mane Akkhuz-ri. He is in league with the Colovians who have taken the city. It is your duty … you must help the people of the city, and do what you can for Akkhuz-ri.
Target: The moonlight sings to Kauzanabi-jo. Sings of the darkness inside Mane Akkhuz-ri. He is in league with the Colovians who have taken the city. It is your duty … you must help the people of the city, and do what you can for Akkhuz-ri.

Source: Oh, yes. It's the most excitement we've seen in years.
Target: Oh, yes. It's the most excitement we've seen in years.

Source: I was trying to figure out how to sneak past all these Ashlanders so I could burn their supplies. They killed our father, and me and my brothers vowed revenge.\n\nIt's just a foolish dream. I'm about as stealthy as a herd of guar.
Target: I was trying to figure out how to sneak past all these Ashlanders so I could burn their supplies. They killed our father, and me and my brothers vowed revenge.\n\nIt's just a foolish dream. I'm about as stealthy as a herd of guar.

Source:
"If you ever read this, Marodeen, do not follow me to Mist Morrow Vale. I should have listened to you and stayed in Vlastarus.

Remember me,
Azara."

column5: do not follow me to Mist Morrow Vale. I should have listened to you and stayed in Vlastarus.\n\nRemember me

Target: <Inside you find a list of instructions and several strips of white linen. The signature on the instructions reads \\"Alchemist <<1>>.\"\">"

Source: You haven't met her, have you? Oh, you'll like her. \n\nShe's one of the last Veiled Heritants. They'll play the antagonists in this story. If you don't change the story, they end up killing the Wilderking. That would be very bad.
Target: You haven't met her, have you? Oh, you'll like her. \n\nShe's one of the last Veiled Heritants. They'll play the antagonists in this story. If you don't change the story, they end up killing the Wilderking. That would be very bad.

Source: Necromancers, led by Uwafa and Alasan, the sons of a man named Suturah I defeated many moons ago.  \n\nThe problem is the dead they raise. There is no greater dishonor in Alik'r than striking our ancestors. My soldiers will not fight the undead.
Target: Necromancers, led by Uwafa and Alasan, the sons of a man named Suturah I defeated many moons ago.  \n\nThe problem is the dead they raise. There is no greater dishonor in Alik'r than striking our ancestors. My soldiers will not fight the undead.

Source: She says her house is haunted. Ezzag's brother, Enak-do, owned that house for years before he passed. He never had any problems with dead people. Hmph. Anyway, this one has never known her to lie. Ezzag's niece is good people.
Target: She says her house is haunted. Ezzag's brother, Enak-do, owned that house for years before he passed. He never had any problems with dead people. Hmph. Anyway, this one has never known her to lie. Ezzag's niece is good people.

Source: At the Elder Scroll temple of Mnem, Protector Arfire waits. She has much to tell you.
Target: At the Elder Scroll temple of Mnem, Protector Arfire waits. She has much to tell you.

Source: At least you managed to escape.
Target: At least you managed to escape.

Source: Xal Ithix relies on scavenging for its livelihood. Instead of hunting their usual prey, stranglers now attack the scavengers.
Target: Xal Ithix relies on scavenging for its livelihood. Instead of hunting their usual prey, stranglers now attack the scavengers.

Source: Siege weapons are fascinating, yes? There is much to learn. There are several types, each very useful in its way.\n\nTo learn about rams and flaming oil, talk to Miniel by the tower. For trebuchets, catapults, and ballistae, talk to Firamo.
Target: Siege weapons are fascinating, yes? There is much to learn. There are several types, each very useful in its way.\n\nTo learn about rams and flaming oil, talk to Miniel by the tower. For trebuchets, catapults, and ballistae, talk to Firamo.

Target: What do you need me to do?

Target: I paid the ultimate price for my hubris. Three books, each with the same curse. I thought myself strong enough to destroy them.\n\nBut they are a trap for the weak-minded. Listen carefully. Can't you hear them call to you?

Source: You mean … you aren't here about the notice?\n\nWell, allow me to explain! I need a partner for a difficult job. It pays well, but it involves travel, and there is some danger. Does that sound like the sort of thing that might interest you?
Target: 그 말은 … 너 공고를 보고 여기 온 게 아니구나?\n\n음, 설명해 줄게! 난 어려운 작업을 할 거고, 그러려면 파트너가 필요해. 돈은 많이 벌 수 있지만, 여행을 해야 하고, 약간의 위험이 따를 거야. 흥미가 있어?

Source: "We've got a problem with some laborers coming to a head. They aren't scared anymore, they've started refusing to pay their protection money. Need some filchers to deprive them of their tools as a gentle reminder of who's in charge."
Target: "We've got a problem with some laborers coming to a head. They aren't scared anymore, they've started refusing to pay their protection money. Need some filchers to deprive them of their tools as a gentle reminder of who's in charge."

Source: "House Dorell has an agent keeping careful watch of the traffic through Oldgate. I wish them blinded for a time. My payment upon the watcher's death."
Target: "House Dorell has an agent keeping careful watch of the traffic through Oldgate. I wish them blinded for a time. My payment upon the watcher's death."

Source: "My prey has fled farther than I have reach, but the Brotherhood does not share my limitation. Find them in the Dusklight Inn and deliver your form of judgment. Prove you can't run from the past."
Target: "My prey has fled farther than I have reach, but the Brotherhood does not share my limitation. Find them in the Dusklight Inn and deliver your form of judgment. Prove you can't run from the past."

Source: "They don't listen! They never listen! Those creatures walking in their midst, plain as day, not a concern in the world! They may not see it, but I do! And if they won't do anything about it, I will! Or, you will, thanks to me!"
Target: "They don't listen! They never listen! Those creatures walking in their midst, plain as day, not a concern in the world! They may not see it, but I do! And if they won't do anything about it, I will! Or, you will, thanks to me!"

Source: "I have been dishonored in battle. Maimed in a duel that leaves me unable to even avenge myself. There is no redemption in this, but I will not let this grievance  go unanswered. Deliver my vengeance and you will earn more than my gratitude."
Target: "I have been dishonored in battle. Maimed in a duel that leaves me unable to even avenge myself. There is no redemption in this, but I will not let this grievance  go unanswered. Deliver my vengeance and you will earn more than my gratitude."

Source: We killed Tzinghalis and brought back a map and a communique. The enemy calls itself the Gray Host.
Target: We killed Tzinghalis and brought back a map and a communique. The enemy calls itself the Gray Host.

Source: "There are spies in the court of Fahara'jad. Perhaps he does not see, or merely chooses not to give them notice, but my eyes are sharp—and so are your blades. Cut out this disease."
Target: "There are spies in the court of Fahara'jad. Perhaps he does not see, or merely chooses not to give them notice, but my eyes are sharp—and so are your blades. Cut out this disease."

Source: "An agitator stalks my docks. Talks about organizing a guild of dock workers. I won't have it. Shut this fool up with extreme prejudice."
Target: "An agitator stalks my docks. Talks about organizing a guild of dock workers. I won't have it. Shut this fool up with extreme prejudice."

Source: "Those who serve powerful people should learn to keep out of earshot. There's an eavesdropper in Castle Wayrest that must be silenced. My gratitude will be substantial."
Target: "Those who serve powerful people should learn to keep out of earshot. There's an eavesdropper in Castle Wayrest that must be silenced. My gratitude will be substantial."

Source: "Lost the best job I ever had at Alcaire Castle over a simple misunderstanding! Gossipers think their lies are harmless, but it's my life they're playing with. It's my turn to play with theirs."
Target: "Lost the best job I ever had at Alcaire Castle over a simple misunderstanding! Gossipers think their lies are harmless, but it's my life they're playing with. It's my turn to play with theirs."

Source: "A jealous busybody in Koeglin Village conspired with the Ember-Eye Slavers to take my love from me. Taking their life is the least I can do in return. I will pay any price."
Target: "A jealous busybody in Koeglin Village conspired with the Ember-Eye Slavers to take my love from me. Taking their life is the least I can do in return. I will pay any price."

Source: "My advancement in the Fighters Guild seems to have plateaued. Thrice now, I've watched whelps pass me by in rank. It won't happen again! Kill my rival in Stormhaven so that I might finally get my due."
Target: "My advancement in the Fighters Guild seems to have plateaued. Thrice now, I've watched whelps pass me by in rank. It won't happen again! Kill my rival in Stormhaven so that I might finally get my due."

Source: "Halls of Judgment? Pah, a gilded, empty promise! Any sense of justice there has long since been strangled by the bickering of lawyers. Deliver my judgment to one of these vermin and give me hope for change."
Target: "Halls of Judgment? Pah, a gilded, empty promise! Any sense of justice there has long since been strangled by the bickering of lawyers. Deliver my judgment to one of these vermin and give me hope for change."

Source: My people and I are of the village that used to stand here. Before Graccus came.\n\nHe burned our homes and built a manor over the remains. I am the last villager, the last Spinner. Kept alive for stories of ones who worshipped ancient, dark gods.

Source: "Some of the entertainers working our territory think they don't need to keep up their payments and need a reminder that they don't work without our say so. Having to buy their tools of the trade out of hock ought to make the point."
Target: "Some of the entertainers working our territory think they don't need to keep up their payments and need a reminder that they don't work without our say so. Having to buy their tools of the trade out of hock ought to make the point."

Source: You're from the shipwreck, then? Watch your step, a fire hit this plantation and set the skeevers on edge.\n\nShame about <<1>>. Seems her father burned himself in the fire.
Target: You're from the shipwreck, then? Watch your step, a fire hit this plantation and set the skeevers on edge.\n\nShame about <<1>>. Seems her father burned himself in the fire.

Source: A foolish spirit. My ambition brought me low, but I won't allow it to happen to another.\n\nThe book before you bears a terrible curse, as do two others. You can hear it call to you, yes?
Target: A foolish spirit. My ambition brought me low, but I won't allow it to happen to another.\n\nThe book before you bears a terrible curse, as do two others. You can hear it call to you, yes?

Source: "Got some straitlaced types organizing watches, snitching to the guards, and otherwise making our lives difficult. We need to make a show of our displeasure. Maybe they'll hold their tongues when their own personal items start going missing."
Target: "Got some straitlaced types organizing watches, snitching to the guards, and otherwise making our lives difficult. We need to make a show of our displeasure. Maybe they'll hold their tongues when their own personal items start going missing."

Source: "After years of searching, enduring a maddening hunt, I've found it. The treasure beyond all gold is buried somewhere beneath this Bosmer town."\n\n"I will clear the village away—and the villagers will make ideal diggers."
Target: \\"After years of searching
column4: enduring a maddening hunt
column5: I've found it. The treasure beyond all gold is buried somewhere beneath this Bosmer town.\"\"\n\n\"\"I will clear the village away—and the villagers will make ideal diggers.\"\""

Target: "Got some straitlaced types organizing watches, snitching to the guards, and otherwise making our lives difficult. We need to make a show of our displeasure. Maybe they'll hold their tongues when their own personal items start going missing."

Source: Bosmer marines—one female, two male. We were on the Little Alkosh, part of the Dominion fleet sailing to <<1>>. Then a hurricane knocked us into the shoals.\n\nI've been looking for my squad, but I've had no luck.
Target: Bosmer marines—one female, two male. We were on the Little Alkosh, part of the Dominion fleet sailing to <<1>>. Then a hurricane knocked us into the shoals.\n\nI've been looking for my squad, but I've had no luck.

Source: "Rumors that the guild isn't a threat are starting to gain credence. A good string of safebox robberies ought to dispel that myth real quick. If you've got deft fingers, put them to work!"
Target: "Rumors that the guild isn't a threat are starting to gain credence. A good string of safebox robberies ought to dispel that myth real quick. If you've got deft fingers, put them to work!"

Source: This, my friend is the calm before the storm. Our storm. \n\nThe Maormer believe that holding hostages will prevent us from taking action, but we will not allow such cowardice to determine our course. We will act and we will act decisively!
Target: This, my friend is the calm before the storm. Our storm. \n\nThe Maormer believe that holding hostages will prevent us from taking action, but we will not allow such cowardice to determine our course. We will act and we will act decisively!

Source: "Rumors that the guild isn't a threat are starting to gain credence. A good string of safebox robberies ought to dispel that myth real quick. If you've got deft fingers, put them to work!"
Target: "Rumors that the guild isn't a threat are starting to gain credence. A good string of safebox robberies ought to dispel that myth real quick. If you've got deft fingers, put them to work!"

Source: We've got a number of beehives, right? We've been looking to clear some of the forest, expand out, and hired a Mage to help make it happen. The buzz around town is that there's a problem. I don't know the details, though.
Target: We've got a number of beehives, right? We've been looking to clear some of the forest, expand out, and hired a Mage to help make it happen. The buzz around town is that there's a problem. I don't know the details, though.

Source: Frankly, no. We hired an Altmer Mage to clear the forest above the village, to make room for our beehives. It's been days, now, and if he doesn't complete the contract soon … well. I don't want him to have to eat his wife.
Target: Frankly, no. We hired an Altmer Mage to clear the forest above the village, to make room for our beehives. It's been days, now, and if he doesn't complete the contract soon … well. I don't want him to have to eat his wife.

Source: "Rumors that the guild isn't a threat are starting to gain credence. A good string of safebox robberies ought to dispel that myth real quick. If you've got deft fingers, put them to work!"
Target: "Rumors that the guild isn't a threat are starting to gain credence. A good string of safebox robberies ought to dispel that myth real quick. If you've got deft fingers, put them to work!"

Source: I'll find Muran.
Target: I'll find Muran.

Source: You should get to Seaside Sanctuary as soon as possible. \n\nIf we strike the Maormer hard enough there, we might be able to drive them back out to sea before they get a foothold on the shore.
Target: You should get to Seaside Sanctuary as soon as possible. \n\nIf we strike the Maormer hard enough there, we might be able to drive them back out to sea before they get a foothold on the shore.

Source: So I hear. A contract. Some kind of special request. The Matron asked for you specifically, so you better get a move on.
Target: So I hear. A contract. Some kind of special request. The Matron asked for you specifically, so you better get a move on.

Source: <The name <<1>> is carved on the back of this finely crafted lute.>
Target: <The name <<1>> is carved on the back of this finely crafted lute.>

Source: "I am forced to reside with a vassal of a rival house at the Mournhold Fighters Guild. I will not tolerate it. House first, guild second. I trust the Brotherhood has no qualms about infringing on Morag Tong territory—for the right incentive."
Target: \\"I am forced to reside with a vassal of a rival house at the Mournhold Fighters Guild. I will not tolerate it. House first

Source: Help me out of this mortifying predicament, mate. I'm too willful for the Admiral's crown to work on me, so he had me busted to bits and me bones thrown away. \n\nAnd the only thing worse than being a living skeleton is being just a talking skull.
Target: Help me out of this mortifying predicament, mate. I'm too willful for the Admiral's crown to work on me, so he had me busted to bits and me bones thrown away. \n\nAnd the only thing worse than being a living skeleton is being just a talking skull.

Source: "There's an employee in the bank at Mournhold City Center who's skimming from the tills. I know the thief, but I can't prove it to the authorities. I'd like to settle their account. Permanently."
Target: \\"There's an employee in the bank at Mournhold City Center who's skimming from the tills. I know the thief
column4: but I can't prove it to the authorities. I'd like to settle their account. Permanently.\"\""

Source: No, no, no! Everyone … everyone who ran, died. Please, let me stay with you. And … and we should look for others. I think I heard other survivors!
Target: No, no, no! Everyone … everyone who ran, died. Please, let me stay with you. And … and we should look for others. I think I heard other survivors!

Source: "Revelers making camp outside of Fort Amol are creating morale problems for the garrison stuck guarding the walls. We need the troops, but the loss of a camp follower or two should put a chill on their party. See to it."
Target: \\"Revelers making camp outside of Fort Amol are creating morale problems for the garrison stuck guarding the walls. We need the troops
column4: but the loss of a camp follower or two should put a chill on their party. See to it.\"\""

Source: No! I'm not going anywhere by myself! Let me stay with you, brave soul that you are! And … we should look for the others. I think I heard other survivors.
Target: No! I'm not going anywhere by myself! Let me stay with you, brave soul that you are! And … we should look for the others. I think I heard other survivors.

Source: "I seek to give an offering to the Anticipations, but my pleas to the Morag Tong go unanswered. I wish the blood of an innocent spilled upon the floor of the Tribunal Temple in Mournhold. Fulfill my prayer, if you please."
Target: \\"I seek to give an offering to the Anticipations
column4: but my pleas to the Morag Tong go unanswered. I wish the blood of an innocent spilled upon the floor of the Tribunal Temple in Mournhold. Fulfill my prayer
