Source: Venturing into the story of Aranias' past has sown the seeds of her transformation, but they have yet to sprout.\n\nEven now, she and Andur blaze a trail of destruction toward the Wilderking's throne. Their intention is to destroy him.
Target: Venturing into the story of Aranias' past has sown the seeds of her transformation, but they have yet to sprout.\n\nEven now, she and Andur blaze a trail of destruction toward the Wilderking's throne. Their intention is to destroy him.

Source: Astara sent word. There's a situation in Kvatch that requires immediate attention. Go to the Sanctuary and the Matron will tell you all about it.
Target: Astara sent word. There's a situation in Kvatch that requires immediate attention. Go to the Sanctuary and the Matron will tell you all about it.

Source: <The names <<1>> and <<2>> are engraved into the back of this pendant.>
Target: <The names <<1>> and <<2>> are engraved into the back of this pendant.>

Source: It's Green-Venom-Tongue. Ever since he started digging into that journal you brought back, he's had that funny look in his eyes. You know the one. The one that means he's planning to do something foolhardy—and dangerous.
Target: It's Green-Venom-Tongue. Ever since he started digging into that journal you brought back, he's had that funny look in his eyes. You know the one. The one that means he's planning to do something foolhardy—and dangerous.

Source: "The seeds of mistrust are sown easily among the Dark Elves. Tal'Deic Fortress already stands on shaky ground. An assassination there could be the tipping point. Plant the seeds of fear and you will be rewarded."
Target: \\"The seeds of mistrust are sown easily among the Dark Elves. Tal'Deic Fortress already stands on shaky ground. An assassination there could be the tipping point. Plant the seeds of fear and you will be rewarded.\"\""

Source: "Our trip to Coldharbour has gone somewhat awry. I do hope this doesn't prove too inconvenient for dear Lady Laurent. She so expects things to go smoothly.\n\nI find myself separated from the others and in the clutches of extremely beautiful Daedra."
Target: \\"Our trip to Coldharbour has gone somewhat awry. I do hope this doesn't prove too inconvenient for dear Lady Laurent. She so expects things to go smoothly.\n\nI find myself separated from the others and in the clutches of extremely beautiful Daedra.\"\""

Source: Not me. Kor asked that I send you to him in the Sanctuary if I happened to run into you.\n\nSomething about Hildegard. She hasn't returned to the Sanctuary and Kor is starting to worry.
Target: Not me. Kor asked that I send you to him in the Sanctuary if I happened to run into you.\n\nSomething about Hildegard. She hasn't returned to the Sanctuary and Kor is starting to worry.

Source: They took our souls. They fed them to some sort of <<1>> and now I'm the only one left.\n\nCan you destroy the gem before I wind up like the rest of these wretches?
Target: They took our souls. They fed them to some sort of <<1>> and now I'm the only one left.\n\nCan you destroy the gem before I wind up like the rest of these wretches?

Source: The infirmary is below the Great Hall. Speak to the healer there, Odette. Get her assessment of his condition.  \n\nAgain, I would plead with you—if his actions are truly driven by madness—show mercy.
Target: The infirmary is below the Great Hall. Speak to the healer there, Odette. Get her assessment of his condition.  \n\nAgain, I would plead with you—if his actions are truly driven by madness—show mercy.

Source: The Listener sent me to deliver the Litany of Blood. I placed it before the Night Mother's shrine. She said the book is meant for the killer who tasted death.\n\nWhile that could refer to anyone in the Sanctuary, I believe she intends it for you.
Target: 청취자께서는 피의 기도를 전달하라고 말씀하셨어. 밤의 어머니의 제단 앞에 두었지. 그 분께서는 이 책이 죽음을 맛본 살인자들을 위한 것이라고 말씀하셨어.\n\n성소에 있는 다른 이가 이 책을 위한 사람일 수도 있지만, 내 생각에는 널 위해 이 책을 전달하라고 하신 것 같아.

Source: "I've been cursed, not out of malice, but through incompetence. One of those hired fools at the Mages Guild in Evermore passed off my task to an apprentice who botched the job. My life is in shambles! Enact my retribution."
Target: "I've been cursed, not out of malice, but through incompetence. One of those hired fools at the Mages Guild in Evermore passed off my task to an apprentice who botched the job. My life is in shambles! Enact my retribution."

Source: "The cheeriness of the brewer at the Anchor's Point Inn annoys me. Kindly murder one of her friends during their visit. Maybe that will muffle her insipid blather for a while."
Target: "The cheeriness of the brewer at the Anchor's Point Inn annoys me. Kindly murder one of her friends during their visit. Maybe that will muffle her insipid blather for a while."

Source: "Covenant dissidents have begun to gather openly in Shornhelm, spreading their slander to anyone who will listen in the town square. Silence one, permanently, and perhaps the rest will scurry back to their nests."
Target: "Covenant dissidents have begun to gather openly in Shornhelm, spreading their slander to anyone who will listen in the town square. Silence one, permanently, and perhaps the rest will scurry back to their nests."

Source: "I've been denied apprenticeship at the prestigious Evermore smithy. Not for lack of potential, oh no, but because my would-be mentor already has a lax apprentice. I hope he will have an opening again soon, if you take my meaning."
Target: "I've been denied apprenticeship at the prestigious Evermore smithy. Not for lack of potential, oh no, but because my would-be mentor already has a lax apprentice. I hope he will have an opening again soon, if you take my meaning."

Source: "I'm at peak capacity for my next voyage, but I've got a deadbeat I'm contractually obligated to bring along. I'd like to have the dead weight become a lot more dead so that I can cut it loose."
Target: "I'm at peak capacity for my next voyage, but I've got a deadbeat I'm contractually obligated to bring along. I'd like to have the dead weight become a lot more dead so that I can cut it loose."

Source: I'm a connoisseur of battle, so I keep track of likely recruits. Your reputation precedes you. \n\nI've converted my realm into an arena where I plan to train the greatest warriors in the Aurbis. I offer you an opportunity to take my arena challenge.
Target: 나는 전투의 감정가지. 그래서 계속 신병들을 추적하고있어. 넌 너의 명성이 널 앞서고 있더군.\n\n나는 내 영역을 Aurbis에서 가장 위대한 전사를 훈련시킬 경기장으로 변환했지. 너에게 나의 경기장에 도전할 기회를 주지.

Source: Go to the Elder Scroll temple of Alma Ruma and speak with Protector Yseline. She plays a vital part in the Covenant's mission to conquer Cyrodiil.
Target: Go to the Elder Scroll temple of Alma Ruma and speak with Protector Yseline. She plays a vital part in the Covenant's mission to conquer Cyrodiil.

Source: The Ruins of Mazzatun! A city under constant construction. Built up and torn down without any rhyme or reason. The Argonians living there decided it must not be going fast enough. Started enslaving other tribes. Can't have that, can we?
Target: The Ruins of Mazzatun! A city under constant construction. Built up and torn down without any rhyme or reason. The Argonians living there decided it must not be going fast enough. Started enslaving other tribes. Can't have that, can we?

Source: Like I tell all the new recruits, siege weapons rule the battlefield. So you need to know how to use them. To hear about trebuchets, ballistae, and catapults, talk to Jaleel. For battering rams and flaming oil, go find Marc.
Target: Like I tell all the new recruits, siege weapons rule the battlefield. So you need to know how to use them. To hear about trebuchets, ballistae, and catapults, talk to Jaleel. For battering rams and flaming oil, go find Marc.

Source: It is a place of decay, a place even the gods do not acknowledge. It is where the dishonored dead are sent. \n\nWhen one has shamed themselves beyond redemption, his or her body is dumped here, unwashed, and unconsecrated.
Target: It is a place of decay, a place even the gods do not acknowledge. It is where the dishonored dead are sent. \n\nWhen one has shamed themselves beyond redemption, his or her body is dumped here, unwashed, and unconsecrated.

Source: "This voucher provides the bearer with one cake for special occasions from the renowned baker, Chef Donolon."
Target: "This voucher provides the bearer with one cake for special occasions from the renowned baker, Chef Donolon."

Source: Poisoned gas … I'm … I'm dying. Please … look for the other guardians.
Target: Poisoned gas … I'm … I'm dying. Please … look for the other guardians.

Source: "Got some straitlaced types organizing watches, snitching to the guards, and otherwise making our lives difficult. We need to make a show of our displeasure. Maybe they'll hold their tongues when their own personal items start going missing."
Target: 감시자를 조직하고, 경비병에 일러바치고, 다른 한편으로 우리의 삶을 어렵게 만드는 몇몇 고지식한 유형의 사람들을 알아냈다. 우리는 불만을 표현할 필요가 있다. 아마 그들의 물건이 사라지기 시작하면 그들도 입을 다물겠지.

Source: Because it's all my fault—the Aldmeri. Lady Laurent sent me through the portal to investigate. When the Elves saw me, I ran … and led them to the portal.\n\nSo now she hates me. Please, I beg you. Will you help me get back in her good graces?
Target: Because it's all my fault—the Aldmeri. Lady Laurent sent me through the portal to investigate. When the Elves saw me, I ran … and led them to the portal.\n\nSo now she hates me. Please, I beg you. Will you help me get back in her good graces?

Source: "We've got a problem with some laborers coming to a head. They aren't scared anymore, they've started refusing to pay their protection money. Need some filchers to deprive them of their tools as a gentle reminder of who's in charge."
Target: "We've got a problem with some laborers coming to a head. They aren't scared anymore, they've started refusing to pay their protection money. Need some filchers to deprive them of their tools as a gentle reminder of who's in charge."

Source: Felari has been working with a Wood Elf to bridge the divide between our peoples. Before the Dominion, you might know, the March saw much violence between Valenwood and Elsweyr. We've worked to return home the bones and relics of our ancestors.
Target: Felari has been working with a Wood Elf to bridge the divide between our peoples. Before the Dominion, you might know, the March saw much violence between Valenwood and Elsweyr. We've worked to return home the bones and relics of our ancestors.

Source: I came to join the Saltwalker Militia, but a bunch of bandits stopped me, roughed me up, and tossed me to the side of the road.
Target: I came to join the Saltwalker Militia, but a bunch of bandits stopped me, roughed me up, and tossed me to the side of the road.

Source: "Some of the entertainers working our territory think they don't need to keep up their payments and need a reminder that they don't work without our say so. Having to buy their tools of the trade out of hock ought to make the point."
Target: "Some of the entertainers working our territory think they don't need to keep up their payments and need a reminder that they don't work without our say so. Having to buy their tools of the trade out of hock ought to make the point."

Source: The Staff of Magnus.
Target: The Staff of Magnus.

Source: Indeed! Rumor has it that an ancient forest spirit dwells amongst the trees here, and we mean to seek out and study it.\n\nYou could handle this forest's Bosmer natives should they become hostile against us during our research.
Target: Indeed! Rumor has it that an ancient forest spirit dwells amongst the trees here, and we mean to seek out and study it.\n\nYou could handle this forest's Bosmer natives should they become hostile against us during our research.

Source: Stay close and follow my every command. Taking down the Great Shackle—the primary conduit for the Planemeld—requires precision and the careful application of destructive spells.\n\nAs it so happens, I am a master of destructive spells.
Target: Stay close and follow my every command. Taking down the Great Shackle—the primary conduit for the Planemeld—requires precision and the careful application of destructive spells.\n\nAs it so happens, I am a master of destructive spells.

Source: "We've got a problem with some laborers coming to a head. They aren't scared anymore, they've started refusing to pay their protection money. Need some filchers to deprive them of their tools as a gentle reminder of who's in charge."
Target: "We've got a problem with some laborers coming to a head. They aren't scared anymore, they've started refusing to pay their protection money. Need some filchers to deprive them of their tools as a gentle reminder of who's in charge."

Source: I'll look for the scroll and do everything I can for Rozenn.
Target: I'll look for the scroll and do everything I can for Rozenn.

Source: Tanval Indoril entered town at the head of his personal Vanguard and demanded an audience with the grandmaster. \n\nNow the Vanguard patrols the streets. They command in Kragenmoor.
Target: Tanval Indoril entered town at the head of his personal Vanguard and demanded an audience with the grandmaster. \n\nNow the Vanguard patrols the streets. They command in Kragenmoor.

Source: What brings a hero of the Pact to Kragenmoor? \n\nOn most days, I'd be honored to welcome you to my city. Today, however, important matters distract me.
Target: What brings a hero of the Pact to Kragenmoor? \n\nOn most days, I'd be honored to welcome you to my city. Today, however, important matters distract me.

Source: Traveler, the moons have already blessed your life. You've stood beside their children and fought for the soul of the Khajiit. This one believes … you may be one soul in thousands. You may be the Moon Hallowed.
Target: Traveler, the moons have already blessed your life. You've stood beside their children and fought for the soul of the Khajiit. This one believes … you may be one soul in thousands. You may be the Moon Hallowed.

Source: "This one sees the way one of the stable workers stares with unsavory eyes. Sizing up the flanks of the steeds. This one does not wish to know what the worker seeks, but trusts it is not anything good. Ensure the safety of the Rawl'kha stables!"
Target: \\"This one sees the way one of the stable workers stares with unsavory eyes. Sizing up the flanks of the steeds. This one does not wish to know what the worker seeks

Source: Good. The sooner we're underway, the sooner we can catch Pelidil. Raise anchor!
Target: Good. The sooner we're underway, the sooner we can catch Pelidil. Raise anchor!

Source: "No more Thalmor in Greenshade! I won't provoke war by attacking them directly, but their sympathizers deserve no mercy. There's someone at the Thalmor headquarters in Woodhearth I'd like you to take care of."
Target: \\"No more Thalmor in Greenshade! I won't provoke war by attacking them directly
column4: but their sympathizers deserve no mercy. There's someone at the Thalmor headquarters in Woodhearth I'd like you to take care of.\"\""

Source: I'll hold the gate to <<1>> until the survivors make it out. I've sent runners to muster our defenses, but we're spread thin across <<2>>. We need every available hand if we're going to hold this town.
Target: I'll hold the gate to <<1>> until the survivors make it out. I've sent runners to muster our defenses, but we're spread thin across <<2>>. We need every available hand if we're going to hold this town.

Source: Praise Y'ffre, someone who isn't going on about Argonian spies!\n\nLast year, this tribe arrived in <<1>> as refugees. But because we're all part of the Dominion now, my superiors can't decide what to do with them.
Target: Praise Y'ffre, someone who isn't going on about Argonian spies!\n\nLast year, this tribe arrived in <<1>> as refugees. But because we're all part of the Dominion now, my superiors can't decide what to do with them.

Source: This is Deepcrag Den, a kwama mine. But something's gone wrong.\n\nSome kind of fumes have filled the mine, and the kwama are going crazy. They're attacking the workers. I've been making potions to counter the fumes, but I'm running out of ingredients.
Target: This is Deepcrag Den, a kwama mine. But something's gone wrong.\n\nSome kind of fumes have filled the mine, and the kwama are going crazy. They're attacking the workers. I've been making potions to counter the fumes, but I'm running out of ingredients.

Source: "S'ren-ja is a quiet place where one can spend the days in the sun and warm breeze without a care in the world—but now a Daedra worshiper conducts unclean rituals hidden in the dark of night. I have seen it. This evil cannot take root. Cut it out."
Target: \\"S'ren-ja is a quiet place where one can spend the days in the sun and warm breeze without a care in the world—but now a Daedra worshiper conducts unclean rituals hidden in the dark of night. I have seen it. This evil cannot take root. Cut it out.\"\""

Source: <Among other belongings in the pack is a simple Bosmeri handaxe. It glows with an unusual purple energy.>
Target: <Among other belongings in the pack is a simple Bosmeri handaxe. It glows with an unusual purple energy.>

Source: "I have a customer—former customer—who slanders my good name. So imported water I sold was not free of parasites, I made no such claim! Now they attempt to ruin my trade at the Rawl'kha Bazaar. I must defend my honor, so you must murder them."
Target: \\"I have a customer—former customer—who slanders my good name. So imported water I sold was not free of parasites

Source: Ha! Is that right?\n\nWell then. Sounds to me like you could be one of the Undaunted.
Target: Ha! Is that right?\n\nWell then. Sounds to me like you could be one of the Undaunted.

Source: "There's a thief who's been quietly lifting historical pieces from the Fighters Guild in Marbruk. The skooma addict is too well-connected to suffer the consequences of justice. I look to you to help protect these treasures, in your own way."
Target: \\"There's a thief who's been quietly lifting historical pieces from the Fighters Guild in Marbruk. The skooma addict is too well-connected to suffer the consequences of justice. I look to you to help protect these treasures

Source: Don't think about trying to cut in! <<1>>'s got an exclusive relationship with the magistrate. She gets wind of any shenanigans ….
Target: Don't think about trying to cut in! <<1>>'s got an exclusive relationship with the magistrate. She gets wind of any shenanigans ….

Source: I was. Now I am but a remnant of my former glory. \n\nMagistrix Vox shattered my reliquary and reduced me to this diminished form. You need my blessing to defeat her, but I cannot bestow it in my current state.
Target: I was. Now I am but a remnant of my former glory. \n\nMagistrix Vox shattered my reliquary and reduced me to this diminished form. You need my blessing to defeat her, but I cannot bestow it in my current state.

Source: "My spouse believes that escaping our marriage is as simple as hopping on the nearest ship to distant shores. If my spouse truly desires a release from our marriage, who am I to deny their heart? Our vow was to the death. Make that vow come true."
Target: \\"My spouse believes that escaping our marriage is as simple as hopping on the nearest ship to distant shores. If my spouse truly desires a release from our marriage
column4: who am I to deny their heart? Our vow was to the death. Make that vow come true.\"\""

Source: Of course. I'm yours to command.
Target: Of course. I'm yours to command.

Source: "King Aeradan has many concerns that require his attention. Foreign petitioners hovering at the gates of his throne room are not among them. Shove one off in the most certain terms possible, so the King needn't be bothered any further."
Target: \\"King Aeradan has many concerns that require his attention. Foreign petitioners hovering at the gates of his throne room are not among them. Shove one off in the most certain terms possible
column4: so the King needn't be bothered any further.\"\""

Source: Why do you want her to leave?
Target: Why do you want her to leave?

Source: I don't know the details, but I understand she received word from the Black Hand. I'm sure it has something to do with whatever you and Green-Venom-Tongue have been up to.\n\nWhat are you waiting for? Get to the Sanctuary and see what Astara wants.
Target: I don't know the details, but I understand she received word from the Black Hand. I'm sure it has something to do with whatever you and Green-Venom-Tongue have been up to.\n\nWhat are you waiting for? Get to the Sanctuary and see what Astara wants.

Source: What kind of valuables?
Target: What kind of valuables?

Source: We're here because of me. So many have died. I've shamed myself and my house. \n\nThere's no guarantee we'll survive what comes next. Whether we do or not, you must promise me something.
Target: We're here because of me. So many have died. I've shamed myself and my house. \n\nThere's no guarantee we'll survive what comes next. Whether we do or not, you must promise me something.

Source: "You don't thumb your nose at the Wilderking. Not even in jest. There's a loudmouth in Bramblebreach with opinions of our King that ought not be shared. Stuff an apple in their gob and stick them on a spit, I say."
Target: \\"You don't thumb your nose at the Wilderking. Not even in jest. There's a loudmouth in Bramblebreach with opinions of our King that ought not be shared. Stuff an apple in their gob and stick them on a spit
column4: I say.\"\""

Source: You're an Imperial soldier. Why should I help you?
Target: You're an Imperial soldier. Why should I help you?

Source: <Take the amulet.>
Target: <Take the amulet.>

Source: Who would be so treacherous?
Target: Who would be so treacherous?

Source: Perhaps I can help the Clan Mother instead?
Target: Perhaps I can help the Clan Mother instead?

Source: Where did you send the knights?
Target: Where did you send the knights?

Source: Take this quest to test conversations
Target: Take this quest to test conversations

Source: Followers of Mehrunes Dagon have set fire to our city.\n\nThey've opened an Oblivion Gate, and we can barely keep the incoming Daedra contained. Perhaps our home is lost, but we have to do something about that Gate, or this entire forest is doomed.
Target: Followers of Mehrunes Dagon have set fire to our city.\n\nThey've opened an Oblivion Gate, and we can barely keep the incoming Daedra contained. Perhaps our home is lost, but we have to do something about that Gate, or this entire forest is doomed.

Source: Vox has scores of fanatics in the ruins, yet only a handful of Ordinators stand against them. At any moment, they could overwhelm us with a single advance. \n\nWe just don't have the numbers to hold them off.
Target: Vox has scores of fanatics in the ruins, yet only a handful of Ordinators stand against them. At any moment, they could overwhelm us with a single advance. \n\nWe just don't have the numbers to hold them off.

Source: Fourth victim in as many years! Should seek more out, easy pickings so far. Not much on them, but that doesn't matter. It's the hunt that counts.\n\nStash away a souvenir, sell the rest, move on to the next victim.
Target: Fourth victim in as many years! Should seek more out, easy pickings so far. Not much on them, but that doesn't matter. It's the hunt that counts.\n\nStash away a souvenir, sell the rest, move on to the next victim.

Source: The Dominion happened. They invaded my village and slew my people. Even worse, they destroyed the Hist Tree, trapping my fellow Argonians in a nightmare between life and death. Unable to rest, they have begun fighting each other, endlessly tormented.
Target: The Dominion happened. They invaded my village and slew my people. Even worse, they destroyed the Hist Tree, trapping my fellow Argonians in a nightmare between life and death. Unable to rest, they have begun fighting each other, endlessly tormented.

Source: Very good. I assume you've met Tholbor, then. He'll set you up for the qualifying rounds at the Summoner Arena. \n\nSee you around. If you survive, that is.
Target: Very good. I assume you've met Tholbor, then. He'll set you up for the qualifying rounds at the Summoner Arena. \n\nSee you around. If you survive, that is.

Source: A Dremora army guards the walls of the citadel. But there are those among us who recognize the city, who knew it well before it was pulled from Nirn.\n\nWe can use the guild halls inside to launch a surprise attack, provided someone prepares the way.
Target: A Dremora army guards the walls of the citadel. But there are those among us who recognize the city, who knew it well before it was pulled from Nirn.\n\nWe can use the guild halls inside to launch a surprise attack, provided someone prepares the way.

Source: In case it needs to be said, the Black Forge creates all of Molag Bal's vile weapons, including the dark anchors and the Great Shackle.\n\nWith the Great Shackle destroyed, the threat of the Planemeld should come to an end.
Target: In case it needs to be said, the Black Forge creates all of Molag Bal's vile weapons, including the dark anchors and the Great Shackle.\n\nWith the Great Shackle destroyed, the threat of the Planemeld should come to an end.

Source: Traveler! You've got to help me. I'm trying for an apprenticeship with Telenger the Artificer. He gave me several relics to study, and I was supposed to write a paper about each one. I, uhh … might have started celebrating early?
Target: Traveler! You've got to help me. I'm trying for an apprenticeship with Telenger the Artificer. He gave me several relics to study, and I was supposed to write a paper about each one. I, uhh … might have started celebrating early?

Source: Pariel, my bold, brave, beloved Pariel. My wife.\n\nThe Wood Orcs captured us. They did unspeakable things …. They were going to kill me. She couldn't watch me die. She killed them all, but now she's missing.
Target: Pariel, my bold, brave, beloved Pariel. My wife.\n\nThe Wood Orcs captured us. They did unspeakable things …. They were going to kill me. She couldn't watch me die. She killed them all, but now she's missing.

Source: Who is <<1>>?
Target: Who is <<1>>?

Source: I'll speak with <<1>>.
Target: I'll speak with <<1>>.

Source: How can you breathe? You just do, without thinking much about it. It's the same with me and talking, or Worm Cultists digging up old bones.\n\nDidn't ask if they belonged to anyone, did they? The Wormies just started making skeletons.
Target: How can you breathe? You just do, without thinking much about it. It's the same with me and talking, or Worm Cultists digging up old bones.\n\nDidn't ask if they belonged to anyone, did they? The Wormies just started making skeletons.

Source: The Undaunted? What's that?
Target: The Undaunted? What's that?

Source: Now stand back and give me a moment.
Target: Now stand back and give me a moment.

Source: Do you think I should investigate?
Target: Do you think I should investigate?

Source: I see. I will take it to the castle.
Target: I see. I will take it to the castle.

Source: <One of the tree-minder's hands clutches a broken piece of wood. It resembles the headpiece of a staff.>\n\n<Beside her you see the torn cover of an ancient book. Its pages are missing.>
Target: <One of the tree-minder's hands clutches a broken piece of wood. It resembles the headpiece of a staff.>\n\n<Beside her you see the torn cover of an ancient book. Its pages are missing.>

Source: "You'd think there wasn't a war going on by the looks of Skywatch these days. We aren't out here bleeding so layabouts can drink their cares away day and night. Send a reminder to the loafers at Market-side Meadery that the world is a cruel place."
Target: \\"You'd think there wasn't a war going on by the looks of Skywatch these days. We aren't out here bleeding so layabouts can drink their cares away day and night. Send a reminder to the loafers at Market-side Meadery that the world is a cruel place.\"\""

Source: Only the most important military advancement in the Second Era! \n\nThese ships you see here—I designed them—they're going to revolutionize naval warfare! But not if we lose the designs!
Target: Only the most important military advancement in the Second Era! \n\nThese ships you see here—I designed them—they're going to revolutionize naval warfare! But not if we lose the designs!

Source: He thinks he's a magical genius. To prove a point, he's transformed his brother into a Goblin … a lady Goblin.\n\nThe chieftain of the nearby Shadowsilk tribe has taken him prisoner. He has every intent of taking Dithis as his tribal matron.
Target: He thinks he's a magical genius. To prove a point, he's transformed his brother into a Goblin … a lady Goblin.\n\nThe chieftain of the nearby Shadowsilk tribe has taken him prisoner. He has every intent of taking Dithis as his tribal matron.

Source: "The Queen has more enemies than the Veil. An agent of one such adversary occupies a position at Skywatch Manor that is too close for comfort. Eliminate this threat. Discretion is preferred, but not required."
Target: \\"The Queen has more enemies than the Veil. An agent of one such adversary occupies a position at Skywatch Manor that is too close for comfort. Eliminate this threat. Discretion is preferred
column4: but not required.\"\""

Source: Kanniz does not want to try. Do you think he would still be hiding here if it was safe? He will come with you. And, please … we must look for other survivors. This one knows he heard others after the attack.
Target: Kanniz does not want to try. Do you think he would still be hiding here if it was safe? He will come with you. And, please … we must look for other survivors. This one knows he heard others after the attack.

Source: The ritual Father gave me to rebind Balreth isn't working. Something's gone wrong. Daedra are pouring from the volcano, and I'm worried about the nearby towns. We need answers, and we need them fast.
Target: The ritual Father gave me to rebind Balreth isn't working. Something's gone wrong. Daedra are pouring from the volcano, and I'm worried about the nearby towns. We need answers, and we need them fast.

Source: The guild has accepted an unusual contract. We've agreed to eradicate Daedric Anchors when they drop from the sky. Wherever they appear, Molag Bal's minions soon follow.
Target: The guild has accepted an unusual contract. We've agreed to eradicate Daedric Anchors when they drop from the sky. Wherever they appear, Molag Bal's minions soon follow.

Source: We found you floating in the water. I'd seen corpses with more life in them, but Captain Kaleen dove in and fished you out anyway.
Target: We found you floating in the water. I'd seen corpses with more life in them, but Captain Kaleen dove in and fished you out anyway.

Source: You may have heard Stonefalls is under attack. This makes some things very lucrative. \n\nTake wine. If I had a particular bottle, there's a party who'd pay well for it.
Target: You may have heard Stonefalls is under attack. This makes some things very lucrative. \n\nTake wine. If I had a particular bottle, there's a party who'd pay well for it.

Source: Bleakrock Island. Off the coast of Skyrim. <<1>> found you washed up on the shore.\n\nCaptain Rana will want to know you're awake.
Target: Bleakrock Island. Off the coast of Skyrim. <<1>> found you washed up on the shore.\n\nCaptain Rana will want to know you're awake.

Source: Good. Since we were cubs, Khali and I have studied the Path. I've read many accounts of past trials. What the Hallowed and the candidate went through … but nothing can prepare you. I know that now.
Target: Good. Since we were cubs, Khali and I have studied the Path. I've read many accounts of past trials. What the Hallowed and the candidate went through … but nothing can prepare you. I know that now.

Source: "I cannot abide loiterers. Popular or not, the Outside Inn is an upstanding establishment. It shouldn't have to suffer beggars and buskers crowding its landing like some cheap Daggerfall brothel. A little pest control would do the place good."
Target: \\"I cannot abide loiterers. Popular or not
column4: the Outside Inn is an upstanding establishment. It shouldn't have to suffer beggars and buskers crowding its landing like some cheap Daggerfall brothel. A little pest control would do the place good.\"\""

Source: I need you to click a chest and a rock.
Target: I need you to click a chest and a rock.

Source: We are all Brothers and Sisters, children of the Night Mother and our Dread Father. Even lone assassins need a family.\n\nIntroduce yourself to the others. They can provide advice and information, even support for your more challenging contracts.
Target: We are all Brothers and Sisters, children of the Night Mother and our Dread Father. Even lone assassins need a family.\n\nIntroduce yourself to the others. They can provide advice and information, even support for your more challenging contracts.

Source: "I was passing through the Vulkhel Guard Market, on my way to an audience with the Queen, when some lowly cur had the audacity to cross my path. Kindly dispose of this trash so I don't tread over it in the future."
Target: \\"I was passing through the Vulkhel Guard Market
column4: on my way to an audience with the Queen
column5: when some lowly cur had the audacity to cross my path. Kindly dispose of this trash so I don't tread over it in the future.\"\""

Source: We are a respected school of swordsmanship. Our blademasters are matchless, our students disciplined and sharp.\n\nI've been ordered to find more recruits for our school. Once, we were very selective on who would be allowed in. But now ….
Target: We are a respected school of swordsmanship. Our blademasters are matchless, our students disciplined and sharp.\n\nI've been ordered to find more recruits for our school. Once, we were very selective on who would be allowed in. But now ….

Source: "Queen Ayrenn's court is full of sycophants hanging on her every word and trying to gain her attention. It's sickening! How am I supposed to make an impression with all of them in my way? Kindly make some room at Vulkhel Guard Manor, if you please."
Target: \\"Queen Ayrenn's court is full of sycophants hanging on her every word and trying to gain her attention. It's sickening! How am I supposed to make an impression with all of them in my way? Kindly make some room at Vulkhel Guard Manor

Source: Yes. We called in several favors to do it, but we've cracked her code.\n\nIn service to her dark master, <<1>> was after something hidden in a Dwarven ruin. A place known as <<2>>.
Target: Yes. We called in several favors to do it, but we've cracked her code.\n\nIn service to her dark master, <<1>> was after something hidden in a Dwarven ruin. A place known as <<2>>.

Source: "The Spinners at the Elden Tree have gone stale, their stories rehashed and uninspired. They need a spark to ignite their imagination. I think the Dark Brotherhood could give them a fresh tale to spin."
Target: \\"The Spinners at the Elden Tree have gone stale
column4: their stories rehashed and uninspired. They need a spark to ignite their imagination. I think the Dark Brotherhood could give them a fresh tale to spin.\"\""

Source: "Jone and Jode, my mane is in tangles with these caravans. How are Khajiiti to make a simple profit when traders gouge them at every chance? This one requests you gouge them in return."
Target: \\"Jone and Jode
column4: my mane is in tangles with these caravans. How are Khajiiti to make a simple profit when traders gouge them at every chance? This one requests you gouge them in return.\"\""

Source: We teach the way of fighting. Any fool can win a duel. Only a master knows who will challenge her and where it will occur.\n\nYou must learn to think as the masters did. Learn not just how they fought, but when and why.
Target: We teach the way of fighting. Any fool can win a duel. Only a master knows who will challenge her and where it will occur.\n\nYou must learn to think as the masters did. Learn not just how they fought, but when and why.

Source: "There's a burr in my paw at the Vulkhel Guard Docks whom I would like to see sleep with the fishes. I'm told this phrase connotes murder, but to eliminate any confusion I don't desire any sleeping, only death. Fishes I might consider, if fresh."
Target: \\"There's a burr in my paw at the Vulkhel Guard Docks whom I would like to see sleep with the fishes. I'm told this phrase connotes murder

Source: This manor, it's not what it seems. And now poor Stibbons has been caught in its embrace. Without help, he will surely die, just like the others.\n\nIt will be dangerous, but perhaps you can convince him to leave before it's too late.
Target: This manor, it's not what it seems. And now poor Stibbons has been caught in its embrace. Without help, he will surely die, just like the others.\n\nIt will be dangerous, but perhaps you can convince him to leave before it's too late.

Source: Stonefalls is under attack, and some of the finer things in life are suddenly precious. Certain goods can be very lucrative when paired with the right buyer. \n\nTake wine, for instance.
Target: Stonefalls is under attack, and some of the finer things in life are suddenly precious. Certain goods can be very lucrative when paired with the right buyer. \n\nTake wine, for instance.

Source: "Every day I suffer the visitation of an insipid fool. Every day, poking and inspecting my wares as if they weren't the same as the day before. Not once has gold crossed my palm, only small talk and stupid smiles. Why? I don't care! It must stop."
Target: \\"Every day I suffer the visitation of an insipid fool. Every day

Source: This manor, it's not what it seems. And now poor <<1>> has been caught in its embrace. Without help, he will surely die, just like the others.\n\nIt will be dangerous, but perhaps you can go inside and convince him to leave before it's too late.
Target: This manor, it's not what it seems. And now poor <<1>> has been caught in its embrace. Without help, he will surely die, just like the others.\n\nIt will be dangerous, but perhaps you can go inside and convince him to leave before it's too late.

Source: It's not important. My sister Kireth went into that Dwemer ruin, but she forgot to take my new control rod. I built it to deal with the spider constructs that infest the place.\n\nShe may not believe me, but she needs that rod.
Target: It's not important. My sister Kireth went into that Dwemer ruin, but she forgot to take my new control rod. I built it to deal with the spider constructs that infest the place.\n\nShe may not believe me, but she needs that rod.

Source: A nix-hound attacked our caravan. He savaged my leg and carried off one of our guar.
Target: 닉스 하운드가 우리의 캐러밴을 공격했어. 내 다리를 물어뜯고 구아 한 마리를 물고갔지.

Source: "A glorious death is a warrior's privilege. I won't let some milk-drinker claim the same right as me because they can wave a sword in the direction of the enemy. Kill the pretender and leave battle to the real warriors."
Target: \\"A glorious death is a warrior's privilege. I won't let some milk-drinker claim the same right as me because they can wave a sword in the direction of the enemy. Kill the pretender and leave battle to the real warriors.\"\""

Source: The boss hired a matchmaker named <<1>> to find a groom for his daughter, and he sent me out here to recruit someone. \n\nHe says he'll pay well. He's up at our camp now. Can you help? I've been out here long enough.
Target: The boss hired a matchmaker named <<1>> to find a groom for his daughter, and he sent me out here to recruit someone. \n\nHe says he'll pay well. He's up at our camp now. Can you help? I've been out here long enough.

Source: "Some new faces in the Thieves Guild. Before we send you to pick the pockets of bigger and richer targets, we need to know you can handle yourself.\n\n"Lucky for you, the Iron Wheel has pulled their patrols out of Abah's Landing."
Target: "Some new faces in the Thieves Guild. Before we send you to pick the pockets of bigger and richer targets, we need to know you can handle yourself.\n\n"Lucky for you, the Iron Wheel has pulled their patrols out of Abah's Landing."

Source: They're in league with the damned Withered Hand …! As if we didn't have enough necromancers to deal with already!\n\nNo matter what, we can't allow the Imperials to get a foothold here. We're going to take the city back and kill them, all of them.
Target: They're in league with the damned Withered Hand …! As if we didn't have enough necromancers to deal with already!\n\nNo matter what, we can't allow the Imperials to get a foothold here. We're going to take the city back and kill them, all of them.

Source: I think she was on her way back from a scouting mission. Something to do with Count Carolus of Kvatch, as far as I could ascertain.\n\nMirabelle mentioned she had to convince Astara and then she was off, heading in the direction of the Sanctuary.
Target: I think she was on her way back from a scouting mission. Something to do with Count Carolus of Kvatch, as far as I could ascertain.\n\nMirabelle mentioned she had to convince Astara and then she was off, heading in the direction of the Sanctuary.

Source: "There is a criminal seeking asylum in the Dominion Embassy at Elden Root. I might not be able to touch them there, but I wager the Brotherhood won't be troubled by such politics."
Target: \\"There is a criminal seeking asylum in the Dominion Embassy at Elden Root. I might not be able to touch them there

Source: He is at the shipyards town of Tava's Blessing. The Withered Hand is there and he needs you to come as soon as possible.\n\nThe scholar Zohreh said something about that being the birthplace of one of the Ansei, whatever that means.
Target: He is at the shipyards town of Tava's Blessing. The Withered Hand is there and he needs you to come as soon as possible.\n\nThe scholar Zohreh said something about that being the birthplace of one of the Ansei, whatever that means.

Source: "One of the refugees at Tanglehaven watched my daughter dragged off in a raid. Never lifted a finger to help. Was their life exchanged for my bright-eyed little girl? Every moment they draw breath is an affront to her memory. Let us both find peace."
Target: \\"One of the refugees at Tanglehaven watched my daughter dragged off in a raid. Never lifted a finger to help. Was their life exchanged for my bright-eyed little girl? Every moment they draw breath is an affront to her memory. Let us both find peace.\"\""

Source: Everything you've done convinces me … I almost feel silly saying it, but it's all there. The Mane has fallen and you've saved my city. Traveler, I believe you are the Moon Hallowed.
Target: Everything you've done convinces me … I almost feel silly saying it, but it's all there. The Mane has fallen and you've saved my city. Traveler, I believe you are the Moon Hallowed.

Source: "Vulkwasten is very welcoming of visitors, but a deference to the forest is expected by any who tread here. There is a visitor here now who has desecrated the wood and must be punished for it. Please avenge the Green on my behalf."
Target: \\"Vulkwasten is very welcoming of visitors
column4: but a deference to the forest is expected by any who tread here. There is a visitor here now who has desecrated the wood and must be punished for it. Please avenge the Green on my behalf.\"\""

Source: The moonlight sings to Kauzanabi-jo. Sings of the two Champions who will decide our fate. The women from the First Mane's vision. They await you at Rawl'kha. Where this one will perform a ritual of great importance.
Target: The moonlight sings to Kauzanabi-jo. Sings of the two Champions who will decide our fate. The women from the First Mane's vision. They await you at Rawl'kha. Where this one will perform a ritual of great importance.

Source: "One careless jest cost my brother his life. A playful shove into the frigid waters off the Windhelm Docks and he was gone. I don't care that they tried to save him. That it was an accident. My brother is dead, and they must answer for it."
Target: \\"One careless jest cost my brother his life. A playful shove into the frigid waters off the Windhelm Docks and he was gone. I don't care that they tried to save him. That it was an accident. My brother is dead

Source: With the combined forces of the Fighters Guild and the Mages Guild, we must take the battle to Molag Bal and reach the portal to the planar vortex.\n\nIt all starts at the Chasm. Scouts are already in place, gathering information ahead of your arrival.
Target: With the combined forces of the Fighters Guild and the Mages Guild, we must take the battle to Molag Bal and reach the portal to the planar vortex.\n\nIt all starts at the Chasm. Scouts are already in place, gathering information ahead of your arrival.

Source: "My kin dishonors our name. Sleeps on watch. Drinks to excess. Makes our ancestors weep in Sovngarde. No punishment has made a difference, so I wash my hands of the laggard. Make it quick, if you can."
Target: \\"My kin dishonors our name. Sleeps on watch. Drinks to excess. Makes our ancestors weep in Sovngarde. No punishment has made a difference

Source: We among the lunar clergy have heard of your bravery. You've stood beside their children of Jone and Jode, and fought for the soul of the Khajiit. Some of us believe you may be one soul in thousands. You may be the Moon Hallowed.
Target: We among the lunar clergy have heard of your bravery. You've stood beside their children of Jone and Jode, and fought for the soul of the Khajiit. Some of us believe you may be one soul in thousands. You may be the Moon Hallowed.

Source: "Urgent matter. Very dangerous. Pays well. You will risk your life performing this job. Only the most skilled adventurers need apply. \n\nCome to the inn in Kvatch and look for an Imperial named Reman Mevavius to obtain more details."
Target: \\"Urgent matter. Very dangerous. Pays well. You will risk your life performing this job. Only the most skilled adventurers need apply. \n\nCome to the inn in Kvatch and look for an Imperial named Reman Mevavius to obtain more details.\"\""

Source: Well done! Then we still have a chance!\n\nWe sent in a small force to cause a distraction. They probably won't survive, but they should keep the enemy busy while we get the rest of our troops inside. We need to make sure their sacrifice isn't in vain.
Target: Well done! Then we still have a chance!\n\nWe sent in a small force to cause a distraction. They probably won't survive, but they should keep the enemy busy while we get the rest of our troops inside. We need to make sure their sacrifice isn't in vain.

Source: "Some fool keeps feeding the thunderbugs around Valeguard. At best they're distracting to the Spinners, at worst they'll attack one. The guards can handle bugs, but I want the playful idiot who's been attracting them to feed the worms from now on."
Target: \\"Some fool keeps feeding the thunderbugs around Valeguard. At best they're distracting to the Spinners

Source: Sure. I can help.
Target: Sure. I can help.

Source: I'd better take some of this wine with me.
Target: I'd better take some of this wine with me.

Source: My father, Rulantaril, is missing. He disappeared from his workshop in Davon's Watch. \n\nI think his disappearance has some connection to this place. I want to know what, and then find him if I can.
Target: My father, Rulantaril, is missing. He disappeared from his workshop in Davon's Watch. \n\nI think his disappearance has some connection to this place. I want to know what, and then find him if I can.

Source: What sort of noises?

Source: Can I release them somehow?
Target: Can I release them somehow?

Source: I'll go to <<1>> as soon as I can.

Source: There are two people still trapped in the town, a young man and a woman. But the magical fire closes in on them.

Source: I wondered about that.

Source: Fallowstone Hall?

Source: This is the council of province generals. They run the guild under the direction of the Guildmaster. And they're very concerned. I've been speaking to them about our experiences with the ghost of Jofnir and the attack on the Earth Forge.
Target: This is the council of province generals. They run the guild under the direction of the Guildmaster. And they're very concerned. I've been speaking to them about our experiences with the ghost of Jofnir and the attack on the Earth Forge.

Source: What's that?

Target: I met Vanus Galerion in the Mages Guild. Turns out, he had a message for me from an Oracle. It must be important for the Great Mage to deliver it personally.

Target: The Worm Cult happened. Killed my father and some of the farm hands before we could stop them. The screams riled up the giants that live nearby. Kyne protect us!

Source: A tree spirit. It could speak—had a face out of a fever dream. It leads an entire army of cultists in the caverns ahead.\n\nIt slaughtered us, showed us … showed us a vision of what it plans to do to all of Tamriel.
Target: A tree spirit. It could speak—had a face out of a fever dream. It leads an entire army of cultists in the caverns ahead.\n\nIt slaughtered us, showed us … showed us a vision of what it plans to do to all of Tamriel.
