Source: Please, don't let them kill me too!
Target: Please, don't let them kill me too!

Source: The guild has accepted an unusual contract. We've agreed to eradicate Daedric Anchors when they drop from the sky. Wherever they appear, Molag Bal's minions soon follow.
Target: The guild has accepted an unusual contract. We've agreed to eradicate Daedric Anchors when they drop from the sky. Wherever they appear, Molag Bal's minions soon follow.

Source: Because those Supernal Dreamers have stolen a Crystal of Power, and shattered it!
Target: Because those Supernal Dreamers have stolen a Crystal of Power, and shattered it!

Source: I'm dead. In life, I was called Gasteau Chamrond.\n\nAnd you are trapped here, with me. If you'll lend me your strength, I'll show you the way out of here.
Target: I'm dead. In life, I was called Gasteau Chamrond.\n\nAnd you are trapped here, with me. If you'll lend me your strength, I'll show you the way out of here.

Source: Supernal Dreamers have stolen my Crystal of Power to fuel their terrible rituals.
Target: Supernal Dreamers have stolen my Crystal of Power to fuel their terrible rituals.

Source: I believe the temple holds the secret to ending the Celestial threat.\n\nA vast library called the Seeker's Archive waits inside. I've visited it before, looking for answers to impossible questions. But since the Anka-Ra appeared, the way is sealed.
Target: I believe the temple holds the secret to ending the Celestial threat.\n\nA vast library called the Seeker's Archive waits inside. I've visited it before, looking for answers to impossible questions. But since the Anka-Ra appeared, the way is sealed.

Source: Someone in Woodhearth may offer a reward for proof of the death of such a fearsome creature.
Target: Someone in Woodhearth may offer a reward for proof of the death of such a fearsome creature.

Source: The Anka-Ra. The cursed Yokudan army that has invaded Craglorn! They serve the Celestial Warrior, but their true master is their general, a man of unmatched cruelty named Tarish-Zi.\n\nI can help defeat him and the Anka-Ra, if you'll only listen.
Target: The Anka-Ra. The cursed Yokudan army that has invaded Craglorn! They serve the Celestial Warrior, but their true master is their general, a man of unmatched cruelty named Tarish-Zi.\n\nI can help defeat him and the Anka-Ra, if you'll only listen.

Source: No, we just normally have samples for people. But we've been shipping so much to the Khajiit lately that we don't have our samples prepared. In fact, we hired this Mage to clear some of the forest. Make room for more hives.
Target: No, we just normally have samples for people. But we've been shipping so much to the Khajiit lately that we don't have our samples prepared. In fact, we hired this Mage to clear some of the forest. Make room for more hives.

Source: Me? Oh, I'm just picking up supplies for the observatory. Not a task for someone who has seen and done all that you have. \n\nErold, on the other hand, was going on about ancient ruins and magical amulets or some such. It all sounded very exciting.
Target: Me? Oh, I'm just picking up supplies for the observatory. Not a task for someone who has seen and done all that you have. \n\nErold, on the other hand, was going on about ancient ruins and magical amulets or some such. It all sounded very exciting.

Source: Any questions or complaints related to the Argonian presence in <<c:1>> should be directed to <<2>> at the northern barricade.\n\nOr are you looking for work? She needs outside help to help resolve this … situation.
Target: Any questions or complaints related to the Argonian presence in <<c:1>> should be directed to <<2>> at the northern barricade.\n\nOr are you looking for work? She needs outside help to help resolve this … situation.

Source: Ssk! The Reachmen assaulted the town and hold the mine. They hide behind this magical shield. We must bring it down, for the Pact and glory.
Target: Ssk! The Reachmen assaulted the town and hold the mine. They hide behind this magical shield. We must bring it down, for the Pact and glory.

Source: A few days ago, our research team was sent to excavate this ruined city.\n\nBut things turned bad quickly. The water inside is cursed. Half the researchers are insane or dead. We sent a runner for reinforcements, but I guess he didn't make it.
Target: A few days ago, our research team was sent to excavate this ruined city.\n\nBut things turned bad quickly. The water inside is cursed. Half the researchers are insane or dead. We sent a runner for reinforcements, but I guess he didn't make it.

Source: Last year these Argonians showed up and begged for asylum. The Wood Elves gave them <<c:1>>—their business, really.\n\nBut now there's a Dominion, so it's our business. We're containing the tribe until we know what to do with them.
Target: Last year these Argonians showed up and begged for asylum. The Wood Elves gave them <<c:1>>—their business, really.\n\nBut now there's a Dominion, so it's our business. We're containing the tribe until we know what to do with them.

Source: I need to get my hands on another <<z:1>> from Aldunz. That means your hands need to pull the levers used to cool down the furnace, smash its guardian, and reach inside to grab the <<z:1>>.\n\nUnless you're worried about catching fire.
Target: I need to get my hands on another <<z:1>> from Aldunz. That means your hands need to pull the levers used to cool down the furnace, smash its guardian, and reach inside to grab the <<z:1>>.\n\nUnless you're worried about catching fire.

Source: We are reconstructing animals! Dead ones, of course. Wouldn't do such a thing to live ones. That would be barbaric, not to mention impractical.\n\nSpecifically, we are creating an elixir that will cause small dead animals to wriggle about as if alive.
Target: We are reconstructing animals! Dead ones, of course. Wouldn't do such a thing to live ones. That would be barbaric, not to mention impractical.\n\nSpecifically, we are creating an elixir that will cause small dead animals to wriggle about as if alive.

Source: Those darn dreamers, they stole my antique crystal! Split it up and is usin' the pieces to summon fire lizards or somethin'.
Target: Those darn dreamers, they stole my antique crystal! Split it up and is usin' the pieces to summon fire lizards or somethin'.

Source: You ever hear of the colorful metal chunks known as "<<mz:1>>?" They're actually runoff from an old Dwemer furnace in Aldunz.\n\nI want you to bring me one. First, find the furnace and smash its guardian.
Target: You ever hear of the colorful metal chunks known as \\"<<mz:1>>?\"\" They're actually runoff from an old Dwemer furnace in Aldunz.\n\nI want you to bring me one. First
column4: find the furnace and smash its guardian."

Source: The Supernal Dreamers have stolen my Crystal of Power.  They plan to use the crystal to fuel daedric summoning rituals.  Do you thing you can get the all the shards back?
Target: The Supernal Dreamers have stolen my Crystal of Power.  They plan to use the crystal to fuel daedric summoning rituals.  Do you thing you can get the all the shards back?

Source: I'm an initiate in the Order of Star-Gazers. We study the stars and their influence on Tamriel.\n\nNot long ago, we noticed irregularities in three of the star signs. Shortly thereafter, strange armies overran Craglorn.
Target: I'm an initiate in the Order of Star-Gazers. We study the stars and their influence on Tamriel.\n\nNot long ago, we noticed irregularities in three of the star signs. Shortly thereafter, strange armies overran Craglorn.

Source: Our honeymead has become very popular now that we're trading with the Altmer and Khajiit, and it's been hard to keep up. We hired a Mage to help us clear the forest above town, but I heard from Ragalvir that there's some problem.
Target: Our honeymead has become very popular now that we're trading with the Altmer and Khajiit, and it's been hard to keep up. We hired a Mage to help us clear the forest above town, but I heard from Ragalvir that there's some problem.

Source: Supernal Dreamers stole one of my Crystals of Power. They plan to use it to fuel daedric summoning rituals. To that end, they shattered the crystal into five pieces.
Target: Supernal Dreamers stole one of my Crystals of Power. They plan to use it to fuel daedric summoning rituals. To that end, they shattered the crystal into five pieces.

Source: I've learned from certain ancient writings that this may not be the first time the Celestials have appeared in Craglorn!\n\nThese legends describe a link between Mundus and the stars, right here in Craglorn. Apex Stones, they call them.
Target: I've learned from certain ancient writings that this may not be the first time the Celestials have appeared in Craglorn!\n\nThese legends describe a link between Mundus and the stars, right here in Craglorn. Apex Stones, they call them.

Source: The skooma peddlers in Claw's Strike have a new mascot. The mush-brains somehow managed to train another bantam guar. I hear it dances on command.\n\nSo kill their leader and take the guar. I bet that will be a sharp kick to their spirits.
Target: The skooma peddlers in Claw's Strike have a new mascot. The mush-brains somehow managed to train another bantam guar. I hear it dances on command.\n\nSo kill their leader and take the guar. I bet that will be a sharp kick to their spirits.

Source: Yes. The Night Mother whispered and the Listener has spoken. Our Dread Father demands blood.
Target: Yes. The Night Mother whispered and the Listener has spoken. Our Dread Father demands blood.

Source: Your greatness awaits you. But not here, yes? You must travel to the temple at Moonmont. Seek the one who waits by the pathside. They will guide you to where you must go.
Target: Your greatness awaits you. But not here, yes? You must travel to the temple at Moonmont. Seek the one who waits by the pathside. They will guide you to where you must go.

Source: To the city of Rawl'kha. Speak to the acolyte known as Saifa. She is a quiet girl, but you will find that she knows of many things. And like Zaddo, she knows the paths you must walk if you are to reach your goal.
Target: To the city of Rawl'kha. Speak to the acolyte known as Saifa. She is a quiet girl, but you will find that she knows of many things. And like Zaddo, she knows the paths you must walk if you are to reach your goal.

Source: Among the people in my organization you have a certain reputation. Look, there's a situation at the city of Arenthia. One of your skills could make or break our efforts there. Can we count on you?
Target: Among the people in my organization you have a certain reputation. Look, there's a situation at the city of Arenthia. One of your skills could make or break our efforts there. Can we count on you?

Source: Yes. The Night Mother whispered to the Listener and the Listener has spoken. Our Dread Father demands blood.
Target: Yes. The Night Mother whispered to the Listener and the Listener has spoken. Our Dread Father demands blood.

Source: Your recent deeds demonstrate that you take an interest in matters on <<1>>. Likewise, those on <<1>> take an interest in you.
Target: Your recent deeds demonstrate that you take an interest in matters on <<1>>. Likewise, those on <<1>> take an interest in you.

Source: It's a dark place—the largest necropolis in all Alik'r. It's just west of Satakalaam. \n\nIf the Withered Hand's there, I know the prince needs help. I'll send troops as soon as we're done in the city, but I suggest you join him now if you can.
Target: It's a dark place—the largest necropolis in all Alik'r. It's just west of Satakalaam. \n\nIf the Withered Hand's there, I know the prince needs help. I'll send troops as soon as we're done in the city, but I suggest you join him now if you can.

Source: Yes. The Night Mother has whispered and the Listener has spoken. Our Dread Father demands blood.
Target: Yes. The Night Mother has whispered and the Listener has spoken. Our Dread Father demands blood.

Source: I suppose you must. But be warned, the Night Terror takes many forms and has countless methods of inflicting pain and fear. No wonder the king suffers so. \n\nHurry then. Azura be with you, friend.
Target: I suppose you must. But be warned, the Night Terror takes many forms and has countless methods of inflicting pain and fear. No wonder the king suffers so. \n\nHurry then. Azura be with you, friend.

Source: I have recovered Z'Maja's amulet. I should bring it to <<1>>.
Target: I have recovered Z'Maja's amulet. I should bring it to <<1>>.

Source: I have recovered Z'Maja's necklace chain. I should bring it to <<1>>.
Target: I have recovered Z'Maja's necklace chain. I should bring it to <<1>>.

Source: "These ruins are the perfect place to contemplate the light of Jone and Jode. Their cooling rays slice through the crack in the ceiling. They fill me with calm, with peace."
Target: \\"These ruins are the perfect place to contemplate the light of Jone and Jode. Their cooling rays slice through the crack in the ceiling. They fill me with calm
column4: with peace.\"\""

Source: Some more collectors asked me about your last trip to the Crypt of the Exiles. That means more work for you. Remember to slay the toughest creature you find inside—that will break the curse on the <<z:1>>.\n\nThink you can handle it?
Target: Some more collectors asked me about your last trip to the Crypt of the Exiles. That means more work for you. Remember to slay the toughest creature you find inside—that will break the curse on the <<z:1>>.\n\nThink you can handle it?

Source: I might be.\n\nSome collectors want to study old armor and weapons from the Crypt of the Exiles. Not full sets, you understand? Just the bits and pieces that haven't fallen to dust.
Target: I might be.\n\nSome collectors want to study old armor and weapons from the Crypt of the Exiles. Not full sets, you understand? Just the bits and pieces that haven't fallen to dust.

Source: Your recent deeds demonstrate that you take an interest in matters on <<1>>. Likewise, those on <<1>> take an interest in you.
Target: Your recent deeds demonstrate that you take an interest in matters on <<1>>. Likewise, those on <<1>> take an interest in you.

Source: A pair of Dark Elf siblings want <<Cmz:1>>. The brother wouldn't stop talking about mechanisms, articulation, and other things I care nothing about.\n\nThe sister was another story. She said the Inner Sea Armature was a good source.
Target: A pair of Dark Elf siblings want <<Cmz:1>>. The brother wouldn't stop talking about mechanisms, articulation, and other things I care nothing about.\n\nThe sister was another story. She said the Inner Sea Armature was a good source.

Source: "Valencia Nasica, the Exalted Bard of Dune."
Target: \\"Valencia Nasica
column4: the Exalted Bard of Dune.\"\""

Source: Sheogorath! He's made this process insufferable. I translated the last book you retrieved, but it doesn't make any sense.\n\nI can't find anything that might lead us to the next trial. I must be missing something.
Target: Sheogorath! He's made this process insufferable. I translated the last book you retrieved, but it doesn't make any sense.\n\nI can't find anything that might lead us to the next trial. I must be missing something.

Source: The <<mz:1>> you placed in the Corpse Garden aren't working. Not your fault—the angry spirits learn to ignore them over time.\n\nI need you to place some more around the tomb. And make an example of the toughest spirit inside. Can you handle that?
Target: The <<mz:1>> you placed in the Corpse Garden aren't working. Not your fault—the angry spirits learn to ignore them over time.\n\nI need you to place some more around the tomb. And make an example of the toughest spirit inside. Can you handle that?

Source: Indeed, that is my saddest of fates. I lack just one essential ingredient—Red Mountain Ash. But alas, I cannot leave my shop to gather it.\n\nBut perhaps you, brave one, might aid me?
Target: Indeed, that is my saddest of fates. I lack just one essential ingredient—Red Mountain Ash. But alas, I cannot leave my shop to gather it.\n\nBut perhaps you, brave one, might aid me?

Source: That's the attitude! The town's under constant threat and a horde of Reachmen took over the mine and sealed themselves inside.
Target: That's the attitude! The town's under constant threat and a horde of Reachmen took over the mine and sealed themselves inside.

Source: Wormroot Depths is home to a surprising number of Ayleid trinkets. The cult infesting the place must have unearthed them.\n\nI want you to go there and get me some souvenirs. A matching set that would look good in a display case. Surprise me.
Target: Wormroot Depths is home to a surprising number of Ayleid trinkets. The cult infesting the place must have unearthed them.\n\nI want you to go there and get me some souvenirs. A matching set that would look good in a display case. Surprise me.

Source: Our patron, Master Pellingare, went missing nights ago. His children passed away recently, in these very sewers—we thought he came to mourn.
Target: 우리의 주인, 펠링게어 영주님은 몇 밤 전에 실종되셨어. 그의 자식들이 최근에 바로 이 하수도에서 죽었지. 우리는 그가 애도하러 왔다고 생각했어.

Source: I don't know what they're looking for, but the bastards are all over the mine. They've slaughtered most of my miners. I think a few are still alive, held captive. Find them and free them, if you can!
Target: I don't know what they're looking for, but the bastards are all over the mine. They've slaughtered most of my miners. I think a few are still alive, held captive. Find them and free them, if you can!

Source: Another request from the Dark Elf siblings for <<Cmz:1>> from the Inner Sea Armature.\n\nOh, and the Dwarven creature you smashed is no longer smashed. So … smash it again. With any luck, it will stay a pile of cracked brass and oil this time.
Target: Another request from the Dark Elf siblings for <<Cmz:1>> from the Inner Sea Armature.\n\nOh, and the Dwarven creature you smashed is no longer smashed. So … smash it again. With any luck, it will stay a pile of cracked brass and oil this time.

Source: The Maormer attack <<1>> from the sea! <<2>> holds the line at the docks. She needs help stopping the Maormer before they push into <<3>>.\n\n<<4>> will find more to help. Be swift, slowpaws!
Target: The Maormer attack <<1>> from the sea! <<2>> holds the line at the docks. She needs help stopping the Maormer before they push into <<3>>.\n\n<<4>> will find more to help. Be swift, slowpaws!

Source: Shael Ruins is haunted. Don't know why, don't especially care. Something powerful riled the spirits, which means something worth putting to rest.\n\nSo? Think you can handle that?
Target: Shael Ruins is haunted. Don't know why, don't especially care. Something powerful riled the spirits, which means something worth putting to rest.\n\nSo? Think you can handle that?

Source: There's a place called the Corpse Garden which …. Look, I don't name these things. Local bumpkins hear noises in old tombs and give them flowery labels.\n\nThis time, the bumpkins are right. The Corpse Garden is actually full of angry spirits.
Target: There's a place called the Corpse Garden which …. Look, I don't name these things. Local bumpkins hear noises in old tombs and give them flowery labels.\n\nThis time, the bumpkins are right. The Corpse Garden is actually full of angry spirits.

Source: Ah, playing hard to get, eh? A canny customer, I see. Nirnroot wine is the best wine ever! One bottle and you'll never want, or need, another. It's my own special recipe, you can get it only from me. Or you could, if I had some.
Target: Ah, playing hard to get, eh? A canny customer, I see. Nirnroot wine is the best wine ever! One bottle and you'll never want, or need, another. It's my own special recipe, you can get it only from me. Or you could, if I had some.

Source: The restless spirits in Shael Ruins are … well, they're restless. It's causing problems.\n\nIf you still have the guts, here's more <<z:1>> to place around the ruins. That should bind the spirits—that and killing whatever riled them this time.
Target: The restless spirits in Shael Ruins are … well, they're restless. It's causing problems.\n\nIf you still have the guts, here's more <<z:1>> to place around the ruins. That should bind the spirits—that and killing whatever riled them this time.

Source: Yes! Thalara has a recipe for turning Nirnroot into wine, the best wine you'll ever taste! Most unusual. No more can be said at this time. \n\nPerhaps you would help Thalara?
Target: Yes! Thalara has a recipe for turning Nirnroot into wine, the best wine you'll ever taste! Most unusual. No more can be said at this time. \n\nPerhaps you would help Thalara?

Source: Three descendants of Gjadil the Keel-Hauler have traveled to Summerset to collect her buried treasure. Unable to trust each other after a death of a party member, they've requested I find the chest and bring it back to them.
Target: Three descendants of Gjadil the Keel-Hauler have traveled to Summerset to collect her buried treasure. Unable to trust each other after a death of a party member, they've requested I find the chest and bring it back to them.

Source: Yes. I had Naryu investigate the evidence you retrieved from the Maulborn camp. She discovered something she wants to share. Find her back in town.
Target: Yes. I had Naryu investigate the evidence you retrieved from the Maulborn camp. She discovered something she wants to share. Find her back in town.

Source: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the mine at Drakelowe Keep. We need its stone to help fortify our castles. Warriors are needed immediately!\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the mine at Drakelowe Keep. We need its stone to help fortify our castles. Warriors are needed immediately!\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: Stone from the mine near Castle Alessia is helping the enemy strengthen their castle walls. Orders from Grand Warlord Sorcalin are to capture this mine for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Stone from the mine near Castle Alessia is helping the enemy strengthen their castle walls. Orders from Grand Warlord Sorcalin are to capture this mine for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: Stone from the mine near Castle Brindle is helping the enemy strengthen their castle walls. Orders from Grand Warlord Sorcalin are to capture this mine for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Stone from the mine near Castle Brindle is helping the enemy strengthen their castle walls. Orders from Grand Warlord Sorcalin are to capture this mine for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: The creature speaks! My loneliness falls away like the autumn leaf. The wintry shiver of apprehension sets in: do I dare ask the many questions I have? Do I dare hear the answers?\n\nHow? When? Why? Why am I cursed with the burden of thought?
Target: The creature speaks! My loneliness falls away like the autumn leaf. The wintry shiver of apprehension sets in: do I dare ask the many questions I have? Do I dare hear the answers?\n\nHow? When? Why? Why am I cursed with the burden of thought?

Source: I'm … I'm beyond help. I heard you talking to the commander. The Reach … all of this for nothing. Please. Make my death worth something.
Target: I'm … I'm beyond help. I heard you talking to the commander. The Reach … all of this for nothing. Please. Make my death worth something.

Source: The mine at Castle Black Boot must be ours, warriors. Gather in a large pack and swarm over the enemy defenders.\n\n- General Atahba
Target: The mine at Castle Black Boot must be ours, warriors. Gather in a large pack and swarm over the enemy defenders.\n\n- General Atahba

Source: Mages Guild. They were excavating this ruin for artifacts, but they woke something up. Some of the acolytes are still trapped inside.\n\nIf I don't do something, those acolytes are done for. But I've lost a lot of blood.
Target: Mages Guild. They were excavating this ruin for artifacts, but they woke something up. Some of the acolytes are still trapped inside.\n\nIf I don't do something, those acolytes are done for. But I've lost a lot of blood.

Source: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the mine at Castle Bloodmayne. We need its stone to help fortify our castles. Warriors are needed immediately!\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the mine at Castle Bloodmayne. We need its stone to help fortify our castles. Warriors are needed immediately!\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: The Reachmen. They've descended on Boulderfall Pass. Our troops barely hold the line.
Target: The Reachmen. They've descended on Boulderfall Pass. Our troops barely hold the line.

Source: Warden Farm supplies the enemy with enough food to outlast any siege. Grand Warlord Sorcalin's orders are to take the farm and deprive our foes of those resources.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Warden Farm supplies the enemy with enough food to outlast any siege. Grand Warlord Sorcalin's orders are to take the farm and deprive our foes of those resources.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: <<AC:1>> was thought to be the resting place of Mannimarco's most powerful disciple.\n\nWe were searching the site—carefully, mind you—when the shades awoke.
Target: <<AC:1>> was thought to be the resting place of Mannimarco's most powerful disciple.\n\nWe were searching the site—carefully, mind you—when the shades awoke.

Source: Name's Bragur. I tend the books and the artifacts here. A thousand stories in every one. You're up and around. Ask your help? Pint of mead in it for you! If I ever go drinking again.
Target: Name's Bragur. I tend the books and the artifacts here. A thousand stories in every one. You're up and around. Ask your help? Pint of mead in it for you! If I ever go drinking again.

Source: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the mine at Castle Roebeck. We need its stone to help fortify our castles. Warriors are needed immediately!\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the mine at Castle Roebeck. We need its stone to help fortify our castles. Warriors are needed immediately!\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: This has been the worst day, let me tell you. I went to get some firewood for my master's camp, but the Orcs chased me over here. I tried to retreat into the cave, but now there's a whole village in there! \n\nIt was empty just last week!
Target: This has been the worst day, let me tell you. I went to get some firewood for my master's camp, but the Orcs chased me over here. I tried to retreat into the cave, but now there's a whole village in there! \n\nIt was empty just last week!

Source: Narsis sent me to investigate Quarantine Serk. Now that I know a mad cult is poisoning our people, I'm even more concerned.\n\nThe Maulborn are a menace.
Target: Narsis sent me to investigate Quarantine Serk. Now that I know a mad cult is poisoning our people, I'm even more concerned.\n\nThe Maulborn are a menace.

Source: Name's Bragur. I tend the books and the artifacts here. Ask your help? I've so much to do, now I'm back on my feet. Pint of mead in it for you!
Target: Name's Bragur. I tend the books and the artifacts here. Ask your help? I've so much to do, now I'm back on my feet. Pint of mead in it for you!

Source: Sharp claws on you, my friend. You know, since we were cubs Shazah and I prepared for this day. I studied the combat techniques of past Manes, past Moon Hallowed. Nothing can really prepare you, though.
Target: Sharp claws on you, my friend. You know, since we were cubs Shazah and I prepared for this day. I studied the combat techniques of past Manes, past Moon Hallowed. Nothing can really prepare you, though.

Source: Sinmur. The giant led the Reachmen from Shor's Stone. I arrived just in time to see the Watch Captain throw herself into the fray. I need to restore order here. Can I press you into service once again?
Target: Sinmur. The giant led the Reachmen from Shor's Stone. I arrived just in time to see the Watch Captain throw herself into the fray. I need to restore order here. Can I press you into service once again?

Source: The water's been contaminated. To top it off, whatever's tainted the johads seems to attract the desert beetles.\n\nWorkers won't go near the johads, and with good reason. But I still need to find out what's contaminated our lifeblood.
Target: The water's been contaminated. To top it off, whatever's tainted the johads seems to attract the desert beetles.\n\nWorkers won't go near the johads, and with good reason. But I still need to find out what's contaminated our lifeblood.

Source: On to our next assignment! We don't get a lot of down time. We're always on the job, always watching.\n\nAre you heading to Mournhold now?
Target: On to our next assignment! We don't get a lot of down time. We're always on the job, always watching.\n\nAre you heading to Mournhold now?

Source: Belron left the camp. He muttered something about further research. Head into the field and find that Dark Elf. Lend him whatever aid you can.
Target: Belron left the camp. He muttered something about further research. Head into the field and find that Dark Elf. Lend him whatever aid you can.

Source: The mine at Castle Faregyl must be ours, warriors. Gather in a large pack and swarm over the enemy defenders.\n\n- General Atahba
Target: The mine at Castle Faregyl must be ours, warriors. Gather in a large pack and swarm over the enemy defenders.\n\n- General Atahba

Source: The magister in Shornhelm sent me out here to recover a relic called the Tear of Anurraame—it's incredibly valuable …. \n\nI don't think he even expects me to succeed. I think he's just trying to get me killed.
Target: The magister in Shornhelm sent me out here to recover a relic called the Tear of Anurraame—it's incredibly valuable …. \n\nI don't think he even expects me to succeed. I think he's just trying to get me killed.

Source: The bounty of Rayles Farm has fed our foes for too long. All warriors are urged to join in attacking this enemy settlement.\n\n- General Atahba
Target: The bounty of Rayles Farm has fed our foes for too long. All warriors are urged to join in attacking this enemy settlement.\n\n- General Atahba

Source: Grand Warlord Sorcalin believes the enemy farm at Kingscrest Keep is vulnerable. An attack is ordered immediately.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin believes the enemy farm at Kingscrest Keep is vulnerable. An attack is ordered immediately.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: The name's Paldeen. A band of Khajiit kidnapped me. They're forcing me to decipher the Yokudan runes on the relics they're looting. Damned grave robbers.\n\nThing is, I think I've discovered something valuable down here. More so than wealth.

Target: Hiding from the dead of Crestshade. By Tall Papa's scratchy beard, I think the town is lost. Some insane Argonian came through and turned everyone into bloodfiends!\n\nWe gathered survivors to escort out of town, but I got separated in the confusion.

Source: Then how can we defeat them?
Target: Then how can we defeat them?

Source: What would you have me do?
Target: What would you have me do?

Source: Those Supernal Dreamers captured me. Who knows what they might do to me?
Target: Those Supernal Dreamers captured me. Who knows what they might do to me?

Source: I'm a member of the Hounds. Maybe you heard of us. Sport hunters, mainly, although sometimes people hire us to do the occasional good deed.\n\nLike killing a troll that's been terrorizing other hunters. Unfortunately, the troll got the better of me.
Target: I'm a member of the Hounds. Maybe you heard of us. Sport hunters, mainly, although sometimes people hire us to do the occasional good deed.\n\nLike killing a troll that's been terrorizing other hunters. Unfortunately, the troll got the better of me.

Source: Thank you! I'd be done for without your help. You know, this reminds me of-
Target: Thank you! I'd be done for without your help. You know, this reminds me of-

Source: Rahni'Za was once one of the great sword-schools, rivaled only by the Abbey of Blades.\n\nBut a betrayer gained entry through deception and trickery. He turned the mighty Sword-Disciples into thralls of the dread Celestial Serpent.
Target: Rahni'Za was once one of the great sword-schools, rivaled only by the Abbey of Blades.\n\nBut a betrayer gained entry through deception and trickery. He turned the mighty Sword-Disciples into thralls of the dread Celestial Serpent.

Source: That's what I said, isn't it? The mammoth went into the water and I lost its trail. Care to try your hand at tracking it?
Target: That's what I said, isn't it? The mammoth went into the water and I lost its trail. Care to try your hand at tracking it?

Source: I was captued by the Supernal Dreamers to be used as a sacrifie to futher their plans to control the world.
Target: I was captued by the Supernal Dreamers to be used as a sacrifie to futher their plans to control the world.

Source: I've been captured by the Dreamers, but they've said nothing about a ransom.

Source: Could you murder the leader of the supernals for me?

Source: Me? Look at me. I'm hurt. \n\nJust beat them a little then blow this whistle. They're trained to return to the mine.
Target: Me? Look at me. I'm hurt. \n\nJust beat them a little then blow this whistle. They're trained to return to the mine.

Source: Then here's the finish. Kill their leader, Gruznak the Impatient. \n\nIf there's one thing an Orc can't resist, it's a challenge. Blow the great horn by the gate—that'll bring him out. Meanwhile, I'll go find reinforcements.

Source: I've concocted a ritual to summon spirits present on that day. Talk to whoever appears. This should imbue you with the essence of that moment. \n\nYou'll also need to find the heartstones. Then we can open the gateway to the past.
Target: I've concocted a ritual to summon spirits present on that day. Talk to whoever appears. This should imbue you with the essence of that moment. \n\nYou'll also need to find the heartstones. Then we can open the gateway to the past.

Target: What can I do for you, Bragur?

Source: Ulrich's our champion. He belonged to the Lion Guard before King Emeric swore them into his personal service.\n\nHe's strong as a giant. Brave as a bear. He led us to Silaseli when the Reachmen attacked our farms.
Target: Ulrich's our champion. He belonged to the Lion Guard before King Emeric swore them into his personal service.\n\nHe's strong as a giant. Brave as a bear. He led us to Silaseli when the Reachmen attacked our farms.

Source: I've been tracking the beast for weeks. I call him Deathclaw. \n\nI finally caught up to him, but it … well, it went badly.
Target: I've been tracking the beast for weeks. I call him Deathclaw. \n\nI finally caught up to him, but it … well, it went badly.

Source: New orders, warriors. The enemy uses wood from Faregyl Lumbermill to build their siege engines. We need to take this from them. Answer the Dominion's call!\n\n- General Atahba
Target: New orders, warriors. The enemy uses wood from Faregyl Lumbermill to build their siege engines. We need to take this from them. Answer the Dominion's call!\n\n- General Atahba

Source: That's the problem. We wanted to avenge Father's death so we split up to find a way, but I'm not that brave. There's too many of them. I'd just be throwing my life away. \n\nYou look tougher than me. Maybe you'd take this torch and burn their supplies?
Target: That's the problem. We wanted to avenge Father's death so we split up to find a way, but I'm not that brave. There's too many of them. I'd just be throwing my life away. \n\nYou look tougher than me. Maybe you'd take this torch and burn their supplies?

Source: They think their families were stolen in the middle of the night. I've heard everything from a plot by the House leaders to Elf-eating banekin roaming the countryside.\n\nThe kinhouse is looking into it.
Target: They think their families were stolen in the middle of the night. I've heard everything from a plot by the House leaders to Elf-eating banekin roaming the countryside.\n\nThe kinhouse is looking into it.

Source: My wife'll kill me if I lost her axe. My head! \n\nHey, you could find that screeching witch and get the axe back. I think we had a small camp nearby. I'll catch up to you after my head stops hurting.
Target: My wife'll kill me if I lost her axe. My head! \n\nHey, you could find that screeching witch and get the axe back. I think we had a small camp nearby. I'll catch up to you after my head stops hurting.

Source: Oh, you can't make a highborn serve! You need flattery. If we're properly respectful, he may appear.\n\nMy scrolls say there's a shrine on the east rise and one on the west. Honor him at both. Then meet me at the center of Othrenis.
Target: Oh, you can't make a highborn serve! You need flattery. If we're properly respectful, he may appear.\n\nMy scrolls say there's a shrine on the east rise and one on the west. Honor him at both. Then meet me at the center of Othrenis.

Source: He died. It was so sudden. I wasn't even allowed to attend his funeral, but I know we will reunite in death.\n\nI can't find his tomb. I just want to talk to him one more time. Will you help me find him?
Target: He died. It was so sudden. I wasn't even allowed to attend his funeral, but I know we will reunite in death.\n\nI can't find his tomb. I just want to talk to him one more time. Will you help me find him?

Source: Ritual implements—a skull and a candle. Unless tomb robbers got them, look in the vaults to the east and west. \n\nThere's a puzzle lock on each one, and no, I don't remember the solution. Good luck with that.
Target: Ritual implements—a skull and a candle. Unless tomb robbers got them, look in the vaults to the east and west. \n\nThere's a puzzle lock on each one, and no, I don't remember the solution. Good luck with that.

Source: Some people are missing?
Target: Some people are missing?

Source: The king doesn't know about the undead?
Target: The king doesn't know about the undead?

Source: Those wounds look bad.
Target: Those wounds look bad.

Source: Thank you, I'll speak to Telenger, then.
Target: Thank you, I'll speak to Telenger, then.

Source: Perhaps. What do I have to do?
Target: Perhaps. What do I have to do?

Source: <This Breton corpse has knife wounds on its back and sides. A viscous green ichor cakes the edges of the wounds.>
Target: <This Breton corpse has knife wounds on its back and sides. A viscous green ichor cakes the edges of the wounds.>

Source: I always have a plan. These Red Rooks make use of trained wolves to guard their camp. Increases their confidence, I suppose. \n\nIt also makes them careless. That's where my plan comes in.
Target: I always have a plan. These Red Rooks make use of trained wolves to guard their camp. Increases their confidence, I suppose. \n\nIt also makes them careless. That's where my plan comes in.

Source: Bandits attacked a caravan up the road. We've got them pinned in a noble's house, but they're holding the family hostage. If we attack, they'll kill everyone.
Target: Bandits attacked a caravan up the road. We've got them pinned in a noble's house, but they're holding the family hostage. If we attack, they'll kill everyone.

Source: Where should I start?
Target: Where should I start?

Source: Return the Ansei Wards to their rightful place—the Impervious Vault. The vault is stronger, and it will protect the wards so that we can again protect the Alik'r.\n\nI have opened this portal to the vault. You may use it if you wish.
Target: Return the Ansei Wards to their rightful place—the Impervious Vault. The vault is stronger, and it will protect the wards so that we can again protect the Alik'r.\n\nI have opened this portal to the vault. You may use it if you wish.

Source: It certainly doesn't look natural.
Target: It certainly doesn't look natural.

Source: Raising the dead … the consecrated dead. The very dangerous consecrated dead. \n\nThe most evil people who ever walked the sands of the Alik'r are entombed in the Motalion Necropolis. Prince Azah and I came to stop them, but we were overpowered.
Target: Raising the dead … the consecrated dead. The very dangerous consecrated dead. \n\nThe most evil people who ever walked the sands of the Alik'r are entombed in the Motalion Necropolis. Prince Azah and I came to stop them, but we were overpowered.

Source: <The dog looks down the road and then back at you, as if it wants you to follow.>
Target: <The dog looks down the road and then back at you, as if it wants you to follow.>

Source: The manor?
Target: The manor?

Source: Normally?
Target: Normally?

Source: My mate and our spiritual leader. She was in the village when the pirates attacked.\n\nI'm just an old saltrice farmer, outsider. I beg you! Find her and bring her back.
Target: My mate and our spiritual leader. She was in the village when the pirates attacked.\n\nI'm just an old saltrice farmer, outsider. I beg you! Find her and bring her back.

Source: Saalu Othrys is our overseer. Her husband, Garvas, was organizing a defense of the stables. I didn't see where the matriarch and her daughter went, but her boys headed for the pools.\n\nPoor folks. They were a good sort … for fieldmasters, that is.
Target: Saalu Othrys is our overseer. Her husband, Garvas, was organizing a defense of the stables. I didn't see where the matriarch and her daughter went, but her boys headed for the pools.\n\nPoor folks. They were a good sort … for fieldmasters, that is.

Source: Go find Vara-Zeen. He's our elder. He told me to run and find help.\n\nI've run so fast I can't run anymore. Talk to Vara-Zeen. He'll know what to do.
Target: Go find Vara-Zeen. He's our elder. He told me to run and find help.\n\nI've run so fast I can't run anymore. Talk to Vara-Zeen. He'll know what to do.

Source: Just so. The Nedes' warchief is named Ornskar. Kill her and cut out her heart. When you have these sacrifices in hand, head to the ritual altar in the center of the temple.\n\nWe'll be waiting.
Target: Just so. The Nedes' warchief is named Ornskar. Kill her and cut out her heart. When you have these sacrifices in hand, head to the ritual altar in the center of the temple.\n\nWe'll be waiting.

Source: I don't know. I have to stay here to defend what's left of the stead. I can't just leave.\n\nThe last I saw my boys, Dedras and Mevis, they were running south to the sulfur pools. I have no idea where my wife and daughter have gone. I wish I knew.
Target: I don't know. I have to stay here to defend what's left of the stead. I can't just leave.\n\nThe last I saw my boys, Dedras and Mevis, they were running south to the sulfur pools. I have no idea where my wife and daughter have gone. I wish I knew.

Source: Aye. She's ready to summon the portal for you. I'll meet you in the Isles. Just … hurry if you please, adept. I'm worried.
Target: Aye. She's ready to summon the portal for you. I'll meet you in the Isles. Just … hurry if you please, adept. I'm worried.

Source: Warden Lumbermill provides wood for many of the enemy's siege weapons. Grand Warlord Sorcalin needs warriors to assault this lumbermill and capture it for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Warden Lumbermill provides wood for many of the enemy's siege weapons. Grand Warlord Sorcalin needs warriors to assault this lumbermill and capture it for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: Aye, trolls take them. I blame myself. I took our finest warriors with me to Shor's Stone. The recruits left behind didn't have a chance.\n\nWe must retake the Hall!
Target: Aye, trolls take them. I blame myself. I took our finest warriors with me to Shor's Stone. The recruits left behind didn't have a chance.\n\nWe must retake the Hall!

Source: New orders, warriors. The enemy uses wood from Rayles Lumbermill to build their siege engines. We need to take this from them. Answer the Dominion's call!\n\n- General Atahba
Target: New orders, warriors. The enemy uses wood from Rayles Lumbermill to build their siege engines. We need to take this from them. Answer the Dominion's call!\n\n- General Atahba

Source: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the enemy lumbermill at Glademist attacked. All warriors are urged to participate.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the enemy lumbermill at Glademist attacked. All warriors are urged to participate.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: Brindle Farm supplies the enemy with enough food to outlast any siege. Grand Warlord Sorcalin's orders are to take the farm and deprive our foes of those resources.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Brindle Farm supplies the enemy with enough food to outlast any siege. Grand Warlord Sorcalin's orders are to take the farm and deprive our foes of those resources.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source:
"Dearest Tavo,

"Please try to return to Sentinel as quickly as you can. If the debt collector comes and we come up short, I fear what he might do. A dozen relics should more than cover our debt.

"Yours forever,
Nahrina"
Target: \\"Dearest Tavo
column4: \n\n\"\"Please try to return to Sentinel as quickly as you can. If the debt collector comes and we come up short
column5: I fear what he might do. A dozen relics should more than cover our debt.\n\n\"\"Yours forever

Target: The bounty of Black Boot Farm has fed our foes for too long. All warriors are urged to join in attacking this enemy settlement.\n\n- General Atahba

Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin believes the enemy farm at Castle Bloodmayne is vulnerable. An attack is ordered immediately.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Target: What can I do to help?

Target: Why don't you strike first, then?

Source: Alessia Farm supplies the enemy with enough food to outlast any siege. Grand Warlord Sorcalin's orders are to take the farm and deprive our foes of those resources.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Target: The bounty of Faregyl Farm has fed our foes for too long. All warriors are urged to join in attacking this enemy settlement.\n\n- General Atahba

Source: So we'll drug the rest of the mercenaries?
Target: So we'll drug the rest of the mercenaries?

Source: <<1>> would like to see you as soon as possible. She said the journal has revealed something about "the Vivicus," whatever that is. She awaits you at the Guildhall.
Target: <<1>> would like to see you as soon as possible. She said the journal has revealed something about \\"the Vivicus
column4: \"\" whatever that is. She awaits you at the Guildhall."

Source: Grand Warlord Sorcalin believes the enemy farm at Castle Roebeck is vulnerable. An attack is ordered immediately.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin believes the enemy farm at Castle Roebeck is vulnerable. An attack is ordered immediately.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: Just a little advice. Start at that large tent. That's where I'd hide my key if I were a Khajiit.\n\nIf you are not killed and left to the crabs, I will meet you at the meditation mound when you are finished.
Target: Just a little advice. Start at that large tent. That's where I'd hide my key if I were a Khajiit.\n\nIf you are not killed and left to the crabs, I will meet you at the meditation mound when you are finished.

Source: Why did they slaughter the Voljars?
Target: Why did they slaughter the Voljars?

Source: My middle son, <<1>>, is leading the search for Bjorick west of the hall.\n\nGo speak to him. Help him find his missing brother and end this nightmare.
Target: My middle son, <<1>>, is leading the search for Bjorick west of the hall.\n\nGo speak to him. Help him find his missing brother and end this nightmare.

Source: And we need to do it fast. Problem is the slavers took the focusing crystals and all my oil.\n\nSome of it is still on the island, but they also put some on their ship!
Target: And we need to do it fast. Problem is the slavers took the focusing crystals and all my oil.\n\nSome of it is still on the island, but they also put some on their ship!

Source: You'll find spider cocoons along the beach east of the manor house. Look there.\n\nShow no mercy to these craven Goblins and their spider pets.
Target: You'll find spider cocoons along the beach east of the manor house. Look there.\n\nShow no mercy to these craven Goblins and their spider pets.

Source: Fildgor's launching multiple attacks?
Target: Fildgor's launching multiple attacks?

Source: Did I mention they're dumb? Put a harness back on them, say a few calm words, and they'll run back here.\n\nThe hard part would be finding harnesses. I've only got one here. The rest are scattered with the guar. You'll have to find them in the pools.
Target: Did I mention they're dumb? Put a harness back on them, say a few calm words, and they'll run back here.\n\nThe hard part would be finding harnesses. I've only got one here. The rest are scattered with the guar. You'll have to find them in the pools.

Source: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the enemy lumbermill at Drakelowe Keep attacked. All warriors are urged to participate.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the enemy lumbermill at Drakelowe Keep attacked. All warriors are urged to participate.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Target: Alessia Lumbermill provides wood for many of the enemy's siege weapons. Grand Warlord Sorcalin needs warriors to assault this lumbermill and capture it for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: <Continue reading.>
Target: <Continue reading.>

Source: You should get out while you can.
Target: You should get out while you can.

Source: Do you know what this place is? Pinepeak Caverns? This is where one of Ysagramor's Companions was buried. Hakra was her name.\n\nWe came to ensure that her tomb was safe, but the Worms were already here. They ambushed us inside, and we barely escaped.
Target: Do you know what this place is? Pinepeak Caverns? This is where one of Ysagramor's Companions was buried. Hakra was her name.\n\nWe came to ensure that her tomb was safe, but the Worms were already here. They ambushed us inside, and we barely escaped.

Source: New orders, warriors. The enemy uses wood from Arrius Lumbermill to build their siege engines. We need to take this from them. Answer the Dominion's call!\n\n- General Atahba
Target: New orders, warriors. The enemy uses wood from Arrius Lumbermill to build their siege engines. We need to take this from them. Answer the Dominion's call!\n\n- General Atahba

Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the enemy lumbermill at Kingscrest Keep attacked. All warriors are urged to participate.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: Charadin. When the cultists attacked, everyone ran. Charadin and I were alone, lost in the caverns. They captured him, there was a ritual. Oh, what they did to him!\n\nI should have tried to rescue him. But I didn't, I just ran.
Target: Charadin. When the cultists attacked, everyone ran. Charadin and I were alone, lost in the caverns. They captured him, there was a ritual. Oh, what they did to him!\n\nI should have tried to rescue him. But I didn't, I just ran.

Source: Farragut Lumbermill provides wood for many of the enemy's siege weapons. Grand Warlord Sorcalin needs warriors to assault this lumbermill and capture it for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Farragut Lumbermill provides wood for many of the enemy's siege weapons. Grand Warlord Sorcalin needs warriors to assault this lumbermill and capture it for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: Yes. We are in no shape to make the journey. If the Worm Cult is already there, then there is little we could do anyways.\n\nYou, however, could help there as you have here. Taarengrav is to the south. Please go. Valdur's spirit must be protected.
Target: Yes. We are in no shape to make the journey. If the Worm Cult is already there, then there is little we could do anyways.\n\nYou, however, could help there as you have here. Taarengrav is to the south. Please go. Valdur's spirit must be protected.

Target: Where is this Sigil?

Source: The Reachmen are gathering in the Wood. Gjakil needs all able blades to head there right away!
Target: The Reachmen are gathering in the Wood. Gjakil needs all able blades to head there right away!

Source: New orders, warriors. The enemy uses wood from Aleswell Lumbermill to build their siege engines. We need to take this from them. Answer the Dominion's call!\n\n- General Atahba
Target: New orders, warriors. The enemy uses wood from Aleswell Lumbermill to build their siege engines. We need to take this from them. Answer the Dominion's call!\n\n- General Atahba

Source: Where can I find her?
Target: Where can I find her?

Source: Dominion soldiers brought us here for that alchemist's experiments. <<1>>, I heard them say. None of my students survived, and now the lamias took their corpses.\n\nA Shadowscale freed me and offered to recover the bodies, but she needs help.
Target: Dominion soldiers brought us here for that alchemist's experiments. <<1>>, I heard them say. None of my students survived, and now the lamias took their corpses.\n\nA Shadowscale freed me and offered to recover the bodies, but she needs help.

Source: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the enemy lumbermill at Fort Dragonclaw attacked. All warriors are urged to participate.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Grand Warlord Sorcalin wants the enemy lumbermill at Fort Dragonclaw attacked. All warriors are urged to participate.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: Where can I find her?
Target: Where can I find her?

Source: The Pact needs help. The vicecanons, more specifically. Vicecanon Hrondar, to be completely specific.\n\nActually, we need his gerent, Saervild. He's in charge of an expedition to recover Argonian relics from the Bogmother ruins.
Target: The Pact needs help. The vicecanons, more specifically. Vicecanon Hrondar, to be completely specific.\n\nActually, we need his gerent, Saervild. He's in charge of an expedition to recover Argonian relics from the Bogmother ruins.

Source: Chalman Lumbermill provides wood for many of the enemy's siege weapons. Grand Warlord Sorcalin needs warriors to assault this lumbermill and capture it for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin
Target: Chalman Lumbermill provides wood for many of the enemy's siege weapons. Grand Warlord Sorcalin needs warriors to assault this lumbermill and capture it for the Dominion.\n\n- Scribe Fireluin

Source: Put a harness on them. Say a few calm words. They're like children or Breton slaves.\n\nI've only got one harness left. The rest got scattered in the attack, but I bet you can find them. When you're done, speak to <<1>>.
Target: Put a harness on them. Say a few calm words. They're like children or Breton slaves.\n\nI've only got one harness left. The rest got scattered in the attack, but I bet you can find them. When you're done, speak to <<1>>.

Source: The Ternion monks?
Target: The Ternion monks?

Source: Why must you hide? Can't you fight back?
Target: Why must you hide? Can't you fight back?

Source: After the gates are unbarred, look for Serien in the fortress keep. We think he's holed up inside, studying his spellbooks.\n\nBlood for the Pact!
Target: After the gates are unbarred, look for Serien in the fortress keep. We think he's holed up inside, studying his spellbooks.\n\nBlood for the Pact!

Source: I just want to help.
Target: I just want to help.

Source: You're the only one I trust. Go to the front lines. I know this sounds gruesome, but I need you to inspect the bodies of Covenant troops after they fall.\n\nBring me anything … well, unusual. And keep this between us. I don't want any panic.
Target: You're the only one I trust. Go to the front lines. I know this sounds gruesome, but I need you to inspect the bodies of Covenant troops after they fall.\n\nBring me anything … well, unusual. And keep this between us. I don't want any panic.

Source: What?
Target: What?

Source: There's only one place he could have gone: Kragenmoor. The city is the gateway to Tormented Spire. To get past the wards at the base of the mountain, he'd need to talk to the Dres' grandmaster that holds the key. Go! And stop him.
Target: There's only one place he could have gone: Kragenmoor. The city is the gateway to Tormented Spire. To get past the wards at the base of the mountain, he'd need to talk to the Dres' grandmaster that holds the key. Go! And stop him.

Source: I hope so. The sorcerous undead on the hill have captured some of the locals who strayed too near. I tried to save them, but was driven back by the hideous, heinous power of their benighted ….\n\nAnyway, I was driven back.
Target: I hope so. The sorcerous undead on the hill have captured some of the locals who strayed too near. I tried to save them, but was driven back by the hideous, heinous power of their benighted ….\n\nAnyway, I was driven back.

Source: You'll face the dead. I don't know how he's doing it, but Serien has transformed our warriors into undead slaves. \n\nOnce the ward is down, enter the gate. Make your way to the keep and confront <<1>>. We'll join you as soon as we can.
Target: You'll face the dead. I don't know how he's doing it, but Serien has transformed our warriors into undead slaves. \n\nOnce the ward is down, enter the gate. Make your way to the keep and confront <<1>>. We'll join you as soon as we can.

Source: The Lord of Coldharbour! Molag Bal! The necromancers plan to place us where they can spy on his enemies. Even now, he looks upon you through me!\n\nGather the cursed skulls. Cast us upon the charnel heap in the tower. End our torment.
Target: The Lord of Coldharbour! Molag Bal! The necromancers plan to place us where they can spy on his enemies. Even now, he looks upon you through me!\n\nGather the cursed skulls. Cast us upon the charnel heap in the tower. End our torment.

Source: No. Vaermina and her minion still have the general in their grips.\n\nYou've done this before, so I think you should do it again. We need to get Godrun back.
Target: No. Vaermina and her minion still have the general in their grips.\n\nYou've done this before, so I think you should do it again. We need to get Godrun back.

Source: How do we enter Sadal's prison?
Target: How do we enter Sadal's prison?

Source: My mission is clear. No one from the Redguard camp allowed in the castle. I'm a Knight of the Flame and I will enforce that directive to my dying breath.\n\nSir Hughes is the head of our order. If you have concerns, speak to him inside the castle.
Target: My mission is clear. No one from the Redguard camp allowed in the castle. I'm a Knight of the Flame and I will enforce that directive to my dying breath.\n\nSir Hughes is the head of our order. If you have concerns, speak to him inside the castle.

Source: Don't I deserve a proper burial? A final resting place?\n\nAt the entrance to the mine is a small shrine. If my bones could just be buried there, away from the monsters that killed me .... I think I could find some solace in that.
Target: Don't I deserve a proper burial? A final resting place?\n\nAt the entrance to the mine is a small shrine. If my bones could just be buried there, away from the monsters that killed me .... I think I could find some solace in that.

Source: Garyn Indoril is leading the charge. You can find him at the command tent west of here. Word is we've got General Serien backed into a corner.\n\nMay Kyne speed you. Split some Covenant skulls for me!
Target: Garyn Indoril is leading the charge. You can find him at the command tent west of here. Word is we've got General Serien backed into a corner.\n\nMay Kyne speed you. Split some Covenant skulls for me!

Source: No, he just needs you to talk. House Dres isn't popular. The Nords and Argonians in Ebonheart won't speak to him. And the other Dark Elf Houses don't like the Dres much either.\n\nConvince the townspeople to work together. Then speak to Othral.
Target: No, he just needs you to talk. House Dres isn't popular. The Nords and Argonians in Ebonheart won't speak to him. And the other Dark Elf Houses don't like the Dres much either.\n\nConvince the townspeople to work together. Then speak to Othral.

Source: <Search the dead Imperial.>
Target: <Search the dead Imperial.>

Source: Any ideas on how to find Giron and Ralden?
Target: Any ideas on how to find Giron and Ralden?

Source: I can aid you. What needs to be done?
Target: I can aid you. What needs to be done?

Source: Then my place is at your side.
Target: Then my place is at your side.

Source: What treasure?
Target: What treasure?

Source: You want me to find him?
Target: You want me to find him?

Source: But they're dead, right?
Target: But they're dead, right?

Source: Just that I arrived in town right before the attack. It's absurd. \n\nNerves are on edge at the castle so I was sent to help protect the village. A messenger should've arrived ahead of me, but Constable Pascal says he never received the message.
Target: Just that I arrived in town right before the attack. It's absurd. \n\nNerves are on edge at the castle so I was sent to help protect the village. A messenger should've arrived ahead of me, but Constable Pascal says he never received the message.

Source: Because we who rule Ebonheart are of House Dres. We are not well loved, even by other Dunmer.\n\nI need you to visit the Argonians, Nords, and Dunmer of <<1>>. Convince them to work together before the Covenant attacks.
Target: Because we who rule Ebonheart are of House Dres. We are not well loved, even by other Dunmer.\n\nI need you to visit the Argonians, Nords, and Dunmer of <<1>>. Convince them to work together before the Covenant attacks.

Source: We've made a potion to help the afflicted, but we've run out, and we need components to make more. \n\nGather <<zm:1>> by slaying cursed spirits, and collect <<zm:2>> from the dead. Then take them south to Merarii.
Target: We've made a potion to help the afflicted, but we've run out, and we need components to make more. \n\nGather <<zm:1>> by slaying cursed spirits, and collect <<zm:2>> from the dead. Then take them south to Merarii.

Source: He says that securing the town comes first, but the town seems perfectly secure to me!\n\nSomeone has to help my baby!
Target: He says that securing the town comes first, but the town seems perfectly secure to me!\n\nSomeone has to help my baby!

Source: It's an ancient vault built to hold dangerous magical items. This one contains a hidden room, where the most dangerous objects were kept. No doubt that's where the Daggers released the curse. \n\nKeeper Vildras can lead you there. Good luck.
Target: It's an ancient vault built to hold dangerous magical items. This one contains a hidden room, where the most dangerous objects were kept. No doubt that's where the Daggers released the curse. \n\nKeeper Vildras can lead you there. Good luck.

Source: Who are you?
Target: Who are you?

Source: If you want to waste your time, I won't argue, but we're packing up and leaving.\n\nMy daughter Ganise is over there sifting through the ashes. Would you mind telling her to come back to the house?
Target: If you want to waste your time, I won't argue, but we're packing up and leaving.\n\nMy daughter Ganise is over there sifting through the ashes. Would you mind telling her to come back to the house?

Source: Ulov Stormwall, my commander. Something happened while I was away patrolling the road. When I came back to report, he was covered in blood. He was butchering Khelendii.\n\nHe saw me and came at me. He's up the road. I need to get out of here.
Target: Ulov Stormwall, my commander. Something happened while I was away patrolling the road. When I came back to report, he was covered in blood. He was butchering Khelendii.\n\nHe saw me and came at me. He's up the road. I need to get out of here.

Source: Yes. Missus Nurin and Ganise… they won't give up, but we've been looking all day. \n\nHe's gone, probably dead, and I'm not sticking around to join him. If you want to help, talk to Missus Nurin.
Target: Yes. Missus Nurin and Ganise… they won't give up, but we've been looking all day. \n\nHe's gone, probably dead, and I'm not sticking around to join him. If you want to help, talk to Missus Nurin.

Source: The best we can do is fertilize it. We're using mudcrab meat wrapped in ashreed. Both are common around the quarter.\n\nWe've also set guards around the tree to keep the Dunmer away.
Target: The best we can do is fertilize it. We're using mudcrab meat wrapped in ashreed. Both are common around the quarter.\n\nWe've also set guards around the tree to keep the Dunmer away.

Target: What can I do to help you?

Target: Then what are you doing here?

Target: And you want me to destroy it?

Source: Burn their boats, kill the bastards, but most of all, get their wretched captain! I want Captain Sa'dir dead! He sleeps in his ship's rigging while we suffer. Ring the ship's warning bell to wake the cur.\n\nHere. Use this torch to burn their boats.
Target: Burn their boats, kill the bastards, but most of all, get their wretched captain! I want Captain Sa'dir dead! He sleeps in his ship's rigging while we suffer. Ring the ship's warning bell to wake the cur.\n\nHere. Use this torch to burn their boats.

Target: I just might. Thanks.

Target: I had to kill them. They were changing.\n\nDo you think I'm mad? See for yourself. I was in the cellar of that stable when it copied one of my troops. I locked it down there. Here's the key. Go ahead and introduce yourself.

Source: Sure.
Target: Sure.

Target: I did. I'm going to join the guild in Ebonheart. Their scales will be moist with envy when I show them my concoction. It's a potion that imitates the visions we get when we lick the Hist tree.\n\nI just need the final reagent.

Target: My son, Wideem-Voh. The accursed Dominion dryskins dragged several young ones out of the village. A few came back, but not my son.\n\nYou helped our village. Please, can you look for him? The Dominion must've set up camps nearby.

Target: 여기 에본하트에는 <<1>>의 술이 있습니다. 그것을 소유한 전쟁 마법사는 은퇴한 후 이곳에서 여관을 열었죠.\n\n<<2>>가 그 술을 전쟁터에서 가져온 사람입니다. 지금 그 술병은 그녀의 개인 저장고에서 먼지만 쌓이고 있어요.

Source: I don't want any more of my carriers hurt, but I must recover the manifest and at least part of the cargo. The house noble who owns this cargo will flay me alive if I come back empty-handed. \n\nThe raiders took everything up the hill.

Target: Each has a thing I require, and you must get all three and then decide which should be mine. What you know of me may help you decide which to give me, but what my friends know may be more important.

Source: You will lend a claw? Moons bless you, walker.\n\nThe only way to drive out the dro-m'Athra is to sanctify the seals scattered throughout the temple. It is a long walk, full of bent cats. But if you clear the way, I can sing the beasts back to Lorkhaj.

Source: Hidden within the icy tombs of Skyrim.\n\nYou must travel to Stormcrag Crypt, a Nord tomb in Eastmarch. Find the scroll, bring it back to Zahari, and our scholars will do the rest. Simple, no?

Target: Travel to Shroud Hearth, a Nord tomb in the Rift. Search for the scroll hidden within its icy depths. The information it contains could very well turn the tide of battle.

Source: You're an Iron Orc and you're asking for my help?
Target: You're an Iron Orc and you're asking for my help?

Source: Icehammer Vault, a Nord tomb in Eastmarch. \n\nFind the scroll within its icy depths, and return to Zahari. She will then make sure it is sent to our scholars. After all, ancient Nord is not this one's first language.
Target: Icehammer Vault, a Nord tomb in Eastmarch. \n\nFind the scroll within its icy depths, and return to Zahari. She will then make sure it is sent to our scholars. After all, ancient Nord is not this one's first language.

Source: What can the Scaled Court do with the nirncrux?
Target: What can the Scaled Court do with the nirncrux?

Source: Isn't that a little extreme?
Target: Isn't that a little extreme?

Source: I'll find your guards. Where did the Iron Orcs take them?
Target: I'll find your guards. Where did the Iron Orcs take them?

Source: Supposedly, those leeches brought down the Dragon with the help of a Dragonguard. Not one of those pretenders with hand-me-down equipment. The real deal.\n\nGive him a taste of Hollowfang blood-alchemy to get his heart thumping before you thump him.
Target: Supposedly, those leeches brought down the Dragon with the help of a Dragonguard. Not one of those pretenders with hand-me-down equipment. The real deal.\n\nGive him a taste of Hollowfang blood-alchemy to get his heart thumping before you thump him.

Source: It's hubris to believe any vampire could tame the power in a Dragon's blood. It could kill him.\n\nI must get Grundwulf to see reason, but I can't do that with all these Hollowfangs in my way. I need a diversion. Perhaps you could help me with that?
Target: It's hubris to believe any vampire could tame the power in a Dragon's blood. It could kill him.\n\nI must get Grundwulf to see reason, but I can't do that with all these Hollowfangs in my way. I need a diversion. Perhaps you could help me with that?

Source: Who is Alkosh? Gak! Riddle'Thar has kicked sand over the First Cat so long that his name is forgotten!\n\nAlkosh is the first divine: the Dragon King of Cats! Khajiit have strayed from him, but he's returned to right our path! Come, see for yourself!
Target: Who is Alkosh? Gak! Riddle'Thar has kicked sand over the First Cat so long that his name is forgotten!\n\nAlkosh is the first divine: the Dragon King of Cats! Khajiit have strayed from him, but he's returned to right our path! Come, see for yourself!

Source: The Dragon's lair is seething with the seeds of its corruption, like some kind of rotten nest. Give'em a swift kick and see if Maarselok comes after you like a swarm of angry hornets. At least Dragons don't sting, right?
Target: The Dragon's lair is seething with the seeds of its corruption, like some kind of rotten nest. Give'em a swift kick and see if Maarselok comes after you like a swarm of angry hornets. At least Dragons don't sting, right?

Source: I have King Camoran's blessing to petition the nature spirit, Selene, to help us protect Valenwood from Maarselok's poison.\n\nIt's a gamble, but it's all we've got. Even that might not be enough …. I don't suppose you're the betting type?
Target: I have King Camoran's blessing to petition the nature spirit, Selene, to help us protect Valenwood from Maarselok's poison.\n\nIt's a gamble, but it's all we've got. Even that might not be enough …. I don't suppose you're the betting type?

Target: And that's bad?

Source: I can help with that.
Target: I can help with that.

Target: All right, I'll do it.
