Target: <Continue studying the old book.>

Source: I can recover stolen relics.
Target: I can recover stolen relics.

Source: No, walker, a god! The first of the Divine Litter. Alkosh! Maybe you know him by his other names? Akatosh, Dragon God of Time? Auri-El? All aspects of the First Cat.\n\nHave faith, when we reach Sunspire you will see I speak the truth!
Target: No, walker, a god! The first of the Divine Litter. Alkosh! Maybe you know him by his other names? Akatosh, Dragon God of Time? Auri-El? All aspects of the First Cat.\n\nHave faith, when we reach Sunspire you will see I speak the truth!

Source: Can't you just send him back to his own time?
Target: Can't you just send him back to his own time?

Source:
It needs to be cleansed, but I'm only a novice. I just want to return to the Abbey with the relics. 

Oh, and there was another Spirit Warden here, trying to help me. I think he was captured. Could you look for him too? 

Please say you'll help.
Target:
It needs to be cleansed, but I'm only a novice. I just want to return to the Abbey with the relics. 

Oh, and there was another Spirit Warden here, trying to help me. I think he was captured. Could you look for him too? 

Please say you'll help.

Source: I'll find Titus in Belkarth.
Target: I'll find Titus in Belkarth.

Source: Where can I find Little Leaf?
Target: Where can I find Little Leaf?

Source: I'll go to Dragonstar and look for Regent Cassipia.
Target: I'll go to Dragonstar and look for Regent Cassipia.

Source: The Combat Dragonhorn is charged, but we still do not know its full capabilities. We must not waste its energy, so we will save it until absolutely necessary.\n\nWe should make our way to the Moon Gate now. Tell our companions, it is time.
Target: The Combat Dragonhorn is charged, but we still do not know its full capabilities. We must not waste its energy, so we will save it until absolutely necessary.\n\nWe should make our way to the Moon Gate now. Tell our companions, it is time.

Source: I've gotten pretty good at alchemy. If we could rig it to hit her with a simple transformation potion? No harm, just fun and fur. We'd need canis root from the base of the ruin. Oh! And Rotmeth starter from the vat in their camp. That'll do it.
Target: I've gotten pretty good at alchemy. If we could rig it to hit her with a simple transformation potion? No harm, just fun and fur. We'd need canis root from the base of the ruin. Oh! And Rotmeth starter from the vat in their camp. That'll do it.

Source: A Dwemer stronghold Quintus had been searching for before he died. I managed to discern its location using what I learned about the Wrathstone and Garlas Malatar. I believe the other half of the tablet is here. We just need to excavate it.
Target: A Dwemer stronghold Quintus had been searching for before he died. I managed to discern its location using what I learned about the Wrathstone and Garlas Malatar. I believe the other half of the tablet is here. We just need to excavate it.

Source: Gods no, he's rich! He's a prince from Glenumbra.\n\nHe promised to whisk me away from my family and make me his princess. But now he's going to die in the Grave, while I'm forced to return home.
Target: Gods no, he's rich! He's a prince from Glenumbra.\n\nHe promised to whisk me away from my family and make me his princess. But now he's going to die in the Grave, while I'm forced to return home.

Source: Saviwa threw a big party. Everyone was having fun until a jeek bumped the urn, and woke my ancestor from the dead. Now, Saviwa needs to get the urn to our family tomb so he can rest, but warring cultists are blocking the way.\n\nYou will help, yes?
Target: Saviwa threw a big party. Everyone was having fun until a jeek bumped the urn, and woke my ancestor from the dead. Now, Saviwa needs to get the urn to our family tomb so he can rest, but warring cultists are blocking the way.\n\nYou will help, yes?

Source: The Mabrigash are Ashlanders, but more isolated than most. They worship a snake spirit and craft unique snakeskin leather. That's what really interested Raston.\n\nThe tribe refuses to speak to anyone from House Hlaalu, but maybe they'll talk to you.
Target: The Mabrigash are Ashlanders, but more isolated than most. They worship a snake spirit and craft unique snakeskin leather. That's what really interested Raston.\n\nThe tribe refuses to speak to anyone from House Hlaalu, but maybe they'll talk to you.

Source: Master Raston went to talk to the leaders of the Mabrigash tribe and never came back. Tevynni can tell you more, if you're interested.
Target: Master Raston went to talk to the leaders of the Mabrigash tribe and never came back. Tevynni can tell you more, if you're interested.

Source: What I want and what I do are usually very different things, my friend.\n\nLet's just get down there and see what's going on. With any luck, we'll be done before the cornerclub serves tonight's flaming nix stew. And the drinks will be on me.
Target: What I want and what I do are usually very different things, my friend.\n\nLet's just get down there and see what's going on. With any luck, we'll be done before the cornerclub serves tonight's flaming nix stew. And the drinks will be on me.

Source: Gharesh-ri has placed the defense of the city in Khamira's hands. She moves the Desert Wind adepts, every volunteer she could muster, and what remains of the militia like pieces on a game board.\n\nReport to her and she'll give you your orders.
Target: Gharesh-ri has placed the defense of the city in Khamira's hands. She moves the Desert Wind adepts, every volunteer she could muster, and what remains of the militia like pieces on a game board.\n\nReport to her and she'll give you your orders.

Source: "They stared at us like they were sizing up cattle for slaughter. I'm afraid they'll be back. Please, send help!"\n\n<The note is signed, "Treva.">
Target: \\"They stared at us like they were sizing up cattle for slaughter. I'm afraid they'll be back. Please
column4: send help!\"\"\n\n<The note is signed

Source: To be blunt, you couldn't keep up.\n\nDon't be offended. I can travel through the forest at great speed. I'll perform a few emissarial duties here, and still beat you to Dra'bul.
Target: To be blunt, you couldn't keep up.\n\nDon't be offended. I can travel through the forest at great speed. I'll perform a few emissarial duties here, and still beat you to Dra'bul.

Source: Mad cultists who worship Merrunz, the Fire-Cat, took the cave for themselves. We might have been able to sneak around them, but now they summon huge Daedra by the pawful!\n\nIf you ruin these silly summoning rituals, Nisuzi will pay you handsomely.
Target: Mad cultists who worship Merrunz, the Fire-Cat, took the cave for themselves. We might have been able to sneak around them, but now they summon huge Daedra by the pawful!\n\nIf you ruin these silly summoning rituals, Nisuzi will pay you handsomely.

Source: There you go, then! Just touch the door and we'll see what happens. Oh! And just in case we never have the chance to speak again, it's been a pleasure meeting you.
Target: There you go, then! Just touch the door and we'll see what happens. Oh! And just in case we never have the chance to speak again, it's been a pleasure meeting you.

Source: A good question, five-claw. This one doesn't think so, but what does Lyrrsazhi know about military engagements? We do have a new queen, though, so that is something.\n\nGo to Riverhold and talk to Tharn. He should be able to allay your concerns.
Target: A good question, five-claw. This one doesn't think so, but what does Lyrrsazhi know about military engagements? We do have a new queen, though, so that is something.\n\nGo to Riverhold and talk to Tharn. He should be able to allay your concerns.

Source: I'm not the one to tell the tale. The Lunar Champions themselves are leading the fight to hold the fort. \n\nLet me take you to <<1>>. She can tell you what you need to know.
Target: I'm not the one to tell the tale. The Lunar Champions themselves are leading the fight to hold the fort. \n\nLet me take you to <<1>>. She can tell you what you need to know.

Source: Look for his belongings. He's always dropping things because of his numbing hand fungus. I would do it myself if it weren't for my responsibilities. If he's dead, someone has to carry on our sacred duties.\n\nWhat do you say? Will you rescue Marthine?
Target: Look for his belongings. He's always dropping things because of his numbing hand fungus. I would do it myself if it weren't for my responsibilities. If he's dead, someone has to carry on our sacred duties.\n\nWhat do you say? Will you rescue Marthine?

Source: This one wouldn't be Lord Gharesh-ri's best spy if she didn't listen at closed doors. The Usurper Queen marches on Riverhold. Tharn needs you to help defend the city.\n\nBut this one doesn't know these things and never said a word.
Target: This one wouldn't be Lord Gharesh-ri's best spy if she didn't listen at closed doors. The Usurper Queen marches on Riverhold. Tharn needs you to help defend the city.\n\nBut this one doesn't know these things and never said a word.

Source: I think the best tactic is to defeat the Dragons at their hunting grounds. When they eat, we can stop them. Permanently.\n\nWhat do you say? Are you willing to help?
Target: I think the best tactic is to defeat the Dragons at their hunting grounds. When they eat, we can stop them. Permanently.\n\nWhat do you say? Are you willing to help?

Source: Follow the Coiled Path to the Fang Spires. Collect exactly eight bog rats along the way to make a proper offering. \n\nFew ever reach the Spires. Serpentbound ghosts will challenge you every step of the way. They already sense your presence.
Target: Follow the Coiled Path to the Fang Spires. Collect exactly eight bog rats along the way to make a proper offering. \n\nFew ever reach the Spires. Serpentbound ghosts will challenge you every step of the way. They already sense your presence.

Source: Some dungy wizard placed a hex on many of the relics. The spell draws minotaurs to the tomb. Minotaurs, walker!\n\nOur soothsayer created a magic yowling-powder to chase this enchantment away. We just need you to sprinkle it on the relics. Simple, yes?
Target: Some dungy wizard placed a hex on many of the relics. The spell draws minotaurs to the tomb. Minotaurs, walker!\n\nOur soothsayer created a magic yowling-powder to chase this enchantment away. We just need you to sprinkle it on the relics. Simple, yes?

Source: Sweets from Elsweyr. They're usually harmless, but if a Khajiit eats too many, there can be consequences.\n\nFeluz has been missing for hours, and I'm really worried. Can you help me find him?
Target: Sweets from Elsweyr. They're usually harmless, but if a Khajiit eats too many, there can be consequences.\n\nFeluz has been missing for hours, and I'm really worried. Can you help me find him?

Source: Great beasts stalk Predator Mesa. Kill them, then collect their blood in this vessel. Once you have the blood, smear it on ritual altars dedicated to Hircine near the center of the Rise.\n\nDo this, and the Hungry Cat will know we honor him.
Target: Great beasts stalk Predator Mesa. Kill them, then collect their blood in this vessel. Once you have the blood, smear it on ritual altars dedicated to Hircine near the center of the Rise.\n\nDo this, and the Hungry Cat will know we honor him.

Source: I suspect they want to raise the centerpiece of my collection, the Ayleid Warlord Ceyran! People come here just to see him.\n\nCeyran worshiped Daedra, and was generally an unpleasant fellow. Excellent as a museum attraction, terrifying as an undead.
Target: I suspect they want to raise the centerpiece of my collection, the Ayleid Warlord Ceyran! People come here just to see him.\n\nCeyran worshiped Daedra, and was generally an unpleasant fellow. Excellent as a museum attraction, terrifying as an undead.

Source: Yes, magic trinkets! And Nisuzi knows just where to find them.\n\nSeek out the Abode of Ignominy—a collapsed temple, filled with undead. Whoever raised them left many charms behind. Bring back three, or so, and this one will be very grateful!
Target: Yes, magic trinkets! And Nisuzi knows just where to find them.\n\nSeek out the Abode of Ignominy—a collapsed temple, filled with undead. Whoever raised them left many charms behind. Bring back three, or so, and this one will be very grateful!

Source: Good. This map marks where we've hidden them.\n\nRecover the relics and get them to Orthuna, who will know what to do with them—she should be at the entrance to this ruin. No matter how many of us perish when this day is over, our work must continue.
Target: Good. This map marks where we've hidden them.\n\nRecover the relics and get them to Orthuna, who will know what to do with them—she should be at the entrance to this ruin. No matter how many of us perish when this day is over, our work must continue.

Source: Our friends in the adeptoriums treasure their scrolls. In sour times, these adepts hide our wagons—they give us shelter and warm food. It is only fair that we repay the favor, yes?\n\nPlease, snatch up some of these scrolls before the Euraxians do.
Target: Our friends in the adeptoriums treasure their scrolls. In sour times, these adepts hide our wagons—they give us shelter and warm food. It is only fair that we repay the favor, yes?\n\nPlease, snatch up some of these scrolls before the Euraxians do.

Source: The Maiden's just a pile of driftwood now, thanks to the Sea Drakes. As for Lerisa, you've found her.\n\nCaptain Helane's got my crew. I won't leave without them. Help me rescue them, and I'll owe you.
Target: The Maiden's just a pile of driftwood now, thanks to the Sea Drakes. As for Lerisa, you've found her.\n\nCaptain Helane's got my crew. I won't leave without them. Help me rescue them, and I'll owe you.

Source: This work requires some special talents. You help me recruit the folks I need, you get a cut of the take.
Target: This work requires some special talents. You help me recruit the folks I need, you get a cut of the take.

Source: Not just any tea! The Samar Pekoe! The finest tea in all of Tamriel.\n\nMmm. Such smooth, tanic flavor. Such a sweet, citrusy finish! The mouth waters at the very thought, yes? Pluck the finest, tenderest leaves, and Nisuzi will see you well-paid!

Source: "I stole a gem from the Bitterhand Bandits, but they caught me and will soon kill me. If you are reading this, please, fulfill my last wish. Take the gem to Ozalan in Hoarfrost Downs and trade it for Fadeel's freedom."\n\n-Handre

Source: Good. This map marks where we've hidden them.\n\nRecover the relics and get them to Orthuna, who will know what to do with them—she should be at the entrance to this ruin. No matter how many of us perish when this day is over, our work must continue.

Source: Well, the sugar traders tell me that a few of their camels are still alive. Wily Kee'va corralled them into Talon Gulch, you see? Intending to eat them later, no doubt.\n\nSet those camels loose, and I'll see that it's worth your while.

Target: Yes! Believe me, all of Northern Elsweyr will sing your praises. Those two have nearly choked the life out of honest trade.\n\nAlso, you'll probably find a pile of contraband in their lair. Skooma packed in crates, and such. Smash it to splinters!

Source: Well, Dragons need to eat, and when they find a source of food, we notice. Then I share their current hunting grounds with those interested in taking them down.\n\nIf you choose to help, I'd give you that information, plus a reward when you're done.
Target: Well, Dragons need to eat, and when they find a source of food, we notice. Then I share their current hunting grounds with those interested in taking them down.\n\nIf you choose to help, I'd give you that information, plus a reward when you're done.

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: I'm not hiding, I'm waiting. Thought I might sneak into camp at an opportune moment and get back what's mine, but I've been out here for nearly a day now.\n\nI should probably just get back to Riverhold before I pass out.
Target: I'm not hiding, I'm waiting. Thought I might sneak into camp at an opportune moment and get back what's mine, but I've been out here for nearly a day now.\n\nI should probably just get back to Riverhold before I pass out.

Source: A Khajiit woman—Cathay by the look of her. She wore the attire of a sorcerer, but then, I could put on a tin crown and claim I am an Emperor.\n\nShe strays there heedlessly or lingers with bad intentions. Either way, no good can come of it.
Target: A Khajiit woman—Cathay by the look of her. She wore the attire of a sorcerer, but then, I could put on a tin crown and claim I am an Emperor.\n\nShe strays there heedlessly or lingers with bad intentions. Either way, no good can come of it.

Source: What's the pledge today?
Target: What's the pledge today?

Source: Dragon blight?
Target: Dragon blight?

Source: What's the pledge today?
Target: What's the pledge today?

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: Who are the Hollowfang Clan?
Target: Who are the Hollowfang Clan?

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: What's going on here?
Target: What's going on here?

Source: He didn't elaborate on either topic. Just mentioned a threat to Southern Elsweyr. Between Tharn's cryptic letter and Nahfahlaar's strange mood, I'm feeling out of sorts.\n\nTalk to Nahfahlaar. Find out what troubles him while I prepare for Tharn.
Target: He didn't elaborate on either topic. Just mentioned a threat to Southern Elsweyr. Between Tharn's cryptic letter and Nahfahlaar's strange mood, I'm feeling out of sorts.\n\nTalk to Nahfahlaar. Find out what troubles him while I prepare for Tharn.

Source: In their tombs. I'll search one, you the other—using this Dragonguard seal.\n\nThe seal will activate three glyphs that will reveal the entrance to the tomb. Between the both of us, I pray we find the wisdom my student seeks. Will you help me?
Target: In their tombs. I'll search one, you the other—using this Dragonguard seal.\n\nThe seal will activate three glyphs that will reveal the entrance to the tomb. Between the both of us, I pray we find the wisdom my student seeks. Will you help me?

Source: I do. But I do not know where he hides. I leave that task to you, as the Dragonguard of old were known to be accomplished trackers.\n\nSeek the aid of a companion who knows this land well and let them guide you. Now go, hunter. Find Yahgrondu.
Target: I do. But I do not know where he hides. I leave that task to you, as the Dragonguard of old were known to be accomplished trackers.\n\nSeek the aid of a companion who knows this land well and let them guide you. Now go, hunter. Find Yahgrondu.

Source: <Make a note of the request.>
Target: <Make a note of the request.>

Source: All Sai would say was that Abnur Tharn mentioned a threat to Southern Elsweyr. I could tell the letter troubled him, which makes me downright terrified.\n\nWill you go and meet with them?
Target: All Sai would say was that Abnur Tharn mentioned a threat to Southern Elsweyr. I could tell the letter troubled him, which makes me downright terrified.\n\nWill you go and meet with them?

Source: Dragons! The terrible beasts have returned to ravage the land of the Khajiit, but it won't be long before they endanger all of Tamriel.\n\nBlademaster Kasura sent me to find help. I found you.
Target: Dragons! The terrible beasts have returned to ravage the land of the Khajiit, but it won't be long before they endanger all of Tamriel.\n\nBlademaster Kasura sent me to find help. I found you.

Source: Do you know where he's been taken?
Target: Do you know where he's been taken?

Source: How much time do we have?
Target: How much time do we have?

Source: Is something wrong?
Target: Is something wrong?

Source: What's the job?
Target: What's the job?

Source: Your Jakarn was buried?
Target: Your Jakarn was buried?

Source: What do you need help with?
Target: What do you need help with?

Source: At least I made it back before Euraxia's soldiers started their attack.
Target: At least I made it back before Euraxia's soldiers started their attack.

Source: What are you doing out here?
Target: What are you doing out here?

Source: Hold on. What's going on at Sunspire Temple?
Target: Hold on. What's going on at Sunspire Temple?

Source: How do we do that?
Target: How do we do that?

Source: <Make a note of the request.>
Target: <Make a note of the request.>

Source: <Read the note.>
Target: <Read the note.>

Source: Problems with one of your relatives?
Target: Problems with one of your relatives?

Source: What's wrong?
Target: What's wrong?

Source: What's the problem?
Target: What's the problem?

Source: The Great Cat returned?
Target: The Great Cat returned?

Source: As far as I know, this is the first time the Dragonguard has faced this particular obstacle.\n\nWe need to find a way to get up to that island and we need to do so quickly. Talk to Queen Khamira. Her portal magic may turn out to be our only option.
Target: As far as I know, this is the first time the Dragonguard has faced this particular obstacle.\n\nWe need to find a way to get up to that island and we need to do so quickly. Talk to Queen Khamira. Her portal magic may turn out to be our only option.

Source: There is hope, but exorcising dro-m'Athra carries great risk. They will claw at this one to silence her song, or try to twist her tune until she too sways her tail to the Bent Dance. Cantors normally walk with a pride of sharp-claws to do this.
Target: There is hope, but exorcising dro-m'Athra carries great risk. They will claw at this one to silence her song, or try to twist her tune until she too sways her tail to the Bent Dance. Cantors normally walk with a pride of sharp-claws to do this.

Source: If there's cult activity in the city, Renmus should know something about it. I want you to see if he has any leads you can follow.\n\nAeliah's agreed to get you into the palace. No need to schedule another appointment.
Target: If there's cult activity in the city, Renmus should know something about it. I want you to see if he has any leads you can follow.\n\nAeliah's agreed to get you into the palace. No need to schedule another appointment.

Source: Despite its age, the map included with the journal clearly shows where we must go. A dormant volcano in Southern Elsweyr.\n\nI ask you, friend, will you make this journey with me?
Target: Despite its age, the map included with the journal clearly shows where we must go. A dormant volcano in Southern Elsweyr.\n\nI ask you, friend, will you make this journey with me?

Source: Not since he flew off in a huff. Something about making sure the lesser Dragons didn't rally to Kaalgrontiid's side. We could use him, but I can see the wisdom in reducing the number of Dragons we need to deal with.\n\nWill you return to the sanctum?
Target: Not since he flew off in a huff. Something about making sure the lesser Dragons didn't rally to Kaalgrontiid's side. We could use him, but I can see the wisdom in reducing the number of Dragons we need to deal with.\n\nWill you return to the sanctum?

Source: Yes. Daini set them on the caravaners. Only to scare them! But the birds gobbled the guards up. Bad luck for them and for Daini. The goods I meant to steal are ruined!\n\nDaini can fix this. I just … I really need help. You will help, yes?
Target: Yes. Daini set them on the caravaners. Only to scare them! But the birds gobbled the guards up. Bad luck for them and for Daini. The goods I meant to steal are ruined!\n\nDaini can fix this. I just … I really need help. You will help, yes?

Source: Couldn't really tell from where I was sitting. Eyes aren't what as they used to be.\n\nThought I saw a Khajiit prowling around nearby, though. Might be a guard, or someone trying to pick the wreck clean. Either way, she probably knows what happened.
Target: Couldn't really tell from where I was sitting. Eyes aren't what as they used to be.\n\nThought I saw a Khajiit prowling around nearby, though. Might be a guard, or someone trying to pick the wreck clean. Either way, she probably knows what happened.

Source: General Renmus, leader of Senchal's military forces, could commandeer a ship to sail us to the island. We need to arrange a meeting with the general and convince him to support us.\n\nWhat say you, warrior? Will you help me slay this Dragon?
Target: General Renmus, leader of Senchal's military forces, could commandeer a ship to sail us to the island. We need to arrange a meeting with the general and convince him to support us.\n\nWhat say you, warrior? Will you help me slay this Dragon?

Source: Upstairs, in his chamber. He seems … troubled about everything that happened.\n\nTalk to him. Find out what occurred on Dragonhold after we left.
Target: Upstairs, in his chamber. He seems … troubled about everything that happened.\n\nTalk to him. Find out what occurred on Dragonhold after we left.

Source: They scattered like skeevers after the theft. She has learned that their leader, Nishzo, has a hideout in a cave on the coast north of Senchal, but even if he is still there Bebbia couldn't confront him herself.\n\nShe can afford a bounty though.
Target: They scattered like skeevers after the theft. She has learned that their leader, Nishzo, has a hideout in a cave on the coast north of Senchal, but even if he is still there Bebbia couldn't confront him herself.\n\nShe can afford a bounty though.

Source: Eh, sort of. Stormhaven seems to be full of them but we got no way to find them, except one. There was a group of bandits who used to run an operation out of Windridge Cave. Got a map that belonged to them pointing to an Akaviri grave. Find it.
Target: Eh, sort of. Stormhaven seems to be full of them but we got no way to find them, except one. There was a group of bandits who used to run an operation out of Windridge Cave. Got a map that belonged to them pointing to an Akaviri grave. Find it.

Source: Brain them. Actually, brain them anyway. One less cultist to give us trouble. Take any messages you find and bring them to me. But be discreet. The Orcs in Malak's Maw aren't friendly. Less so if they're working with the New Moon now.
Target: Brain them. Actually, brain them anyway. One less cultist to give us trouble. Take any messages you find and bring them to me. But be discreet. The Orcs in Malak's Maw aren't friendly. Less so if they're working with the New Moon now.

Source: Journey to Senchal and speak with General Renmus. I don't expect him to join us in our fight, but he may have reports concerning Nahfahlaar and Laatvulon's battle.
Target: Journey to Senchal and speak with General Renmus. I don't expect him to join us in our fight, but he may have reports concerning Nahfahlaar and Laatvulon's battle.

Source: Yeah. Real charmers.\n\nThey planned to put us in some kind of exhibition. The kind you don't walk away from, I wager. I'm not going to miss that cart, but the other prisoners, Tajahir and Marekki, are good folk. I mean to rescue them. Want to help?
Target: Yeah. Real charmers.\n\nThey planned to put us in some kind of exhibition. The kind you don't walk away from, I wager. I'm not going to miss that cart, but the other prisoners, Tajahir and Marekki, are good folk. I mean to rescue them. Want to help?

Source: What's the job?
Target: What's the job?

Source: What do you mean?
Target: What do you mean?

Source: What's wrong?
Target: What's wrong?

Source: We were taking my uncle's gourmet moon-sugar to the market in Rimmen. We had just set up camp for the night when we were attacked. My cat, Winks, ran away. My guard, Maezi, chased after the thieves ….\n\nI love—I mean, I'm worried about them.
Target: We were taking my uncle's gourmet moon-sugar to the market in Rimmen. We had just set up camp for the night when we were attacked. My cat, Winks, ran away. My guard, Maezi, chased after the thieves ….\n\nI love—I mean, I'm worried about them.

Source: As I heard the tale, the journals spoke of the Dragon Vahlokzin, who stole the Horn of Ja'darri from the ancient Dragonguard. The blademaster plans to kill the Dragon and retrieve the horn.\n\nWith your help, of course. I prepared a horse for you.
Target: As I heard the tale, the journals spoke of the Dragon Vahlokzin, who stole the Horn of Ja'darri from the ancient Dragonguard. The blademaster plans to kill the Dragon and retrieve the horn.\n\nWith your help, of course. I prepared a horse for you.

Source: Should our shrines stay soiled, the sojourners who seek sanctification here will steep in soured skooma! Shazar shudders to surmise what sickness spawns from these suspect waters!\n\nIt must be expelled!
Target: Should our shrines stay soiled, the sojourners who seek sanctification here will steep in soured skooma! Shazar shudders to surmise what sickness spawns from these suspect waters!\n\nIt must be expelled!

Source: I do not know what they seek specifically, but this cavern contains vast piles of ash and bone—the remains of an unholy army called the Gray Host. A treasure trove for necromancers.\n\nPlease, wayfarer, can you help me drive these trespassers off?
Target: I do not know what they seek specifically, but this cavern contains vast piles of ash and bone—the remains of an unholy army called the Gray Host. A treasure trove for necromancers.\n\nPlease, wayfarer, can you help me drive these trespassers off?

Source: Ha! I knew you came looking for a real challenge. Your funeral, I guess.\n\nWay I hear it, these witches really treasure their wicker totems and trinkets. Burn one of them up, and I bet the witches will give you a bloody good time.
Target: Ha! I knew you came looking for a real challenge. Your funeral, I guess.\n\nWay I hear it, these witches really treasure their wicker totems and trinkets. Burn one of them up, and I bet the witches will give you a bloody good time.

Source: Witches. The Icereach Coven. We drove them into the sea years ago—back to this accursed isle. But now they've returned, with a horde of Reachmen in tow.\n\nThey came down on us like an avalanche. If you mean to face them, please try to find my mates.
Target: Witches. The Icereach Coven. We drove them into the sea years ago—back to this accursed isle. But now they've returned, with a horde of Reachmen in tow.\n\nThey came down on us like an avalanche. If you mean to face them, please try to find my mates.

Source: Well, I'm no necromancer, but I hear that their rituals are anything but stable. If you find a totem of some kind and kick it over, you're sure to stir up some real trouble!
Target: Well, I'm no necromancer, but I hear that their rituals are anything but stable. If you find a totem of some kind and kick it over, you're sure to stir up some real trouble!

Source: Why are you in a cage?
Target: Why are you in a cage?

Source: What can I do to help?
Target: What can I do to help?

Source: What was stolen?
Target: What was stolen?

Source: Music?
Target: Music?

Source: What's going on here?
Target: What's going on here?

Source: Within the burial grounds of Shada's Tear, I encountered an undead Nede named Nhalan, who told me about the curse Shada placed on the waters of the city.
Target: Within the burial grounds of Shada's Tear, I encountered an undead Nede named Nhalan, who told me about the curse Shada placed on the waters of the city.

Source: I … I don't know. I just can't shake the feeling that my mother has unfinished business in the citadel. Something to do with her necklace and that man.\n\nPerhaps you could take the necklace inside for me? It's the key to this mystery, I know it.
Target: I … I don't know. I just can't shake the feeling that my mother has unfinished business in the citadel. Something to do with her necklace and that man.\n\nPerhaps you could take the necklace inside for me? It's the key to this mystery, I know it.

Source: Greetings. You mentioned an investigation?
Target: Greetings. You mentioned an investigation?

Source: What are you talking about?
Target: What are you talking about?

Source: What is this place?
Target: What is this place?

Source: Is there a problem?
Target: Is there a problem?

Source: Ha. You're a funny one. <<1>> made off with everything, so draw your own conclusions. The quartermaster needs the rice to provision folk. And I don't want to stare down a plate of overly sweet Khajiiti food again.\n\nWill you do it? Pays well.
Target: Ha. You're a funny one. <<1>> made off with everything, so draw your own conclusions. The quartermaster needs the rice to provision folk. And I don't want to stare down a plate of overly sweet Khajiiti food again.\n\nWill you do it? Pays well.

Source: The Goutfangs are tight-lipped, but I poked around. <<1>> studied forbidden fighting techniques and now teaches them to students. Not sure what these techniques are, but I bet you find out if you fight them.\n\nInterested?
Target: The Goutfangs are tight-lipped, but I poked around. <<1>> studied forbidden fighting techniques and now teaches them to students. Not sure what these techniques are, but I bet you find out if you fight them.\n\nInterested?

Source: Well, I'm sure I wouldn't know. This client prides himself on his erudition. I suppose he thinks he can open them? Makes little difference to me—I can't read Akaviri!\n\nI just need you to enter the Forsaken Citadel and gather up a few. What say you?
Target: Well, I'm sure I wouldn't know. This client prides himself on his erudition. I suppose he thinks he can open them? Makes little difference to me—I can't read Akaviri!\n\nI just need you to enter the Forsaken Citadel and gather up a few. What say you?

Source: I read a bulletin in Belkarth that mentions a dire threat to Craglorn. A group known as the Star-Gazers, led by someone named Hara, has asked for assistance.
Target: I read a bulletin in Belkarth that mentions a dire threat to Craglorn. A group known as the Star-Gazers, led by someone named Hara, has asked for assistance.

Source: One with lots of sharp edges. Meridian temple, so I'd say Meridian guardian. And we all know that Meridia's not all sweetrolls and smiles.\n\nCan you kill the guardian and bring back some of those arrows? There's a reward in it for you.
Target: One with lots of sharp edges. Meridian temple, so I'd say Meridian guardian. And we all know that Meridia's not all sweetrolls and smiles.\n\nCan you kill the guardian and bring back some of those arrows? There's a reward in it for you.

Source: Something with lots of blades. Meridian, given that the temple's Meridian. Scholars … smart in some ways, not so much in others. Should've taken along skilled protectors.\n\nWill you kill the guardian and find the notes?
Target: Something with lots of blades. Meridian, given that the temple's Meridian. Scholars … smart in some ways, not so much in others. Should've taken along skilled protectors.\n\nWill you kill the guardian and find the notes?

Source: In terms of pay, which is handsome, no. Consider it more of an efficiency. Besides, you can't collect the dust if you don't deal with the guardian.\n\nHit it a few extra times for me. That is, if you're interested.
Target: In terms of pay, which is handsome, no. Consider it more of an efficiency. Besides, you can't collect the dust if you don't deal with the guardian.\n\nHit it a few extra times for me. That is, if you're interested.

Source: "Those wishing to take the Pledge must sign the Tome of the Undaunted, signaling their intent. If you've never run with the Undaunted before, this is your chance!"\n\n"Directions to the camp follow. See you there! - Maj"
Target: \\"서약을 받기 원하는 사람들은 언던티드의 두꺼운 책에 그들이 원했던 것처럼 서명을 남겨야 합니다. 만약 당신이 이전에 언던티드와 함께 일해본 적이 한 번도 없다면
column4: 이번이 그 기회가 될 것입니다!\"\"\n\n\"\"캠프로 가는 길을 따라가세요. 그곳에서 다시 만납시다! - 마즈\"\""

Source: <Open and accept the contract.>
Target: <Open and accept the contract.>

Source: What kind of impending doom are we talking about?
Target: What kind of impending doom are we talking about?

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: No one sent me. What are you doing?
Target: No one sent me. What are you doing?

Source: What's the job?
Target: What's the job?

Source: Names match a Dragonguard roster we got. Can't be that many Akaviri stuffed in the Corpse Garden, right? How about you see if those Dark Elves buried them with honors? Bring any Dragonguard relics you find back here.
Target: Names match a Dragonguard roster we got. Can't be that many Akaviri stuffed in the Corpse Garden, right? How about you see if those Dark Elves buried them with honors? Bring any Dragonguard relics you find back here.

Source: Rumor is, Ethruin's been looking to raise an army of giant skeletons from under an even more giant tree called the Barrowbough. Head to the Barrowbough in the Bone Orchard of Grahtwood and break up their parley by killing the New Moon ambassador.
Target: Rumor is, Ethruin's been looking to raise an army of giant skeletons from under an even more giant tree called the Barrowbough. Head to the Barrowbough in the Bone Orchard of Grahtwood and break up their parley by killing the New Moon ambassador.

Source: What's going on in the Ashen Scar, exactly?
Target: What's going on in the Ashen Scar, exactly?

Source: The Hidden Moon adepts?
Target: The Hidden Moon adepts?

Source: What do you mean, gateways?
Target: What do you mean, gateways?

Source: Some outfit called the Supernal Dreamers—whatever that means. Devotees of Vaermina. I hear they got a camp northwest of Koeglin Village.\n\nHead out and put the New Moon's recruiter to sleep for good. Bring any notes you find back with you.
Target: Some outfit called the Supernal Dreamers—whatever that means. Devotees of Vaermina. I hear they got a camp northwest of Koeglin Village.\n\nHead out and put the New Moon's recruiter to sleep for good. Bring any notes you find back with you.

Source: Burn, of course! Well, I hope so at any rate. I haven't tried them out. Moving on!\n\nThe herbs and enchantments contained in the wax should ease the burdens of restless spirits. That's what she told me, anyway. I guess we'll find out. Good luck, hero!
Target: Burn, of course! Well, I hope so at any rate. I haven't tried them out. Moving on!\n\nThe herbs and enchantments contained in the wax should ease the burdens of restless spirits. That's what she told me, anyway. I guess we'll find out. Good luck, hero!

Source: If you could, that would be greatly appreciated. One of our injured scouts reported a command camp nearby, across the bridge from the tower.\n\nBring any messages you find to Captain Gilame. She's patrolling up near the tower.
Target: If you could, that would be greatly appreciated. One of our injured scouts reported a command camp nearby, across the bridge from the tower.\n\nBring any messages you find to Captain Gilame. She's patrolling up near the tower.

Source: My client insists that an old battlemage placed a hex on them. Now, before you object, Guybert knows a little something about curses! Handling these weapons is quite safe. Probably.\n\nPull a few from their resting places and we'll share the profits!
Target: My client insists that an old battlemage placed a hex on them. Now, before you object, Guybert knows a little something about curses! Handling these weapons is quite safe. Probably.\n\nPull a few from their resting places and we'll share the profits!

Source: Titus Valerius sent word that I should meet him near the observatory in Belkarth. The messenger had few details, but the situation sounds urgent.
Target: Titus Valerius sent word that I should meet him near the observatory in Belkarth. The messenger had few details, but the situation sounds urgent.

Source: Don't it? From what I gathered, our Dragonguard scrollbearer went to Grahtwood. Left behind a letter in code. I'm guessing for folk like us to recover the scrolls when needed.\n\nHe hid them in the Hall of Might in the ruins of the Reliquary of Stars.
Target: Don't it? From what I gathered, our Dragonguard scrollbearer went to Grahtwood. Left behind a letter in code. I'm guessing for folk like us to recover the scrolls when needed.\n\nHe hid them in the Hall of Might in the ruins of the Reliquary of Stars.

Source: Indeed! Simple as that.\n\nNow, please don't feel underutilized. That cove runneth over with smugglers, bandits, and other such scoundrels. So, if slaking a thirst for blood is a must for you, this cave provides ample opportunity! Good luck!
Target: Indeed! Simple as that.\n\nNow, please don't feel underutilized. That cove runneth over with smugglers, bandits, and other such scoundrels. So, if slaking a thirst for blood is a must for you, this cave provides ample opportunity! Good luck!

Source: The client used to plant lilies there in her grandmother's memory. Alas, she's getting on in age, and the prospect of sneaking around piles of bloodthirsty smugglers no longer appeals.\n\nSo, I'd like you to take these lilies and plant them for her.
Target: The client used to plant lilies there in her grandmother's memory. Alas, she's getting on in age, and the prospect of sneaking around piles of bloodthirsty smugglers no longer appeals.\n\nSo, I'd like you to take these lilies and plant them for her.

Source: That's the right attitude! Don't just defeat them. Crush them! \n\nRead the Obelisk Tome. Bless them with Molag Bal's might. Then butcher the Xivkyn Sovereign and her minions. Prince of Domination my arse!
Target: That's the right attitude! Don't just defeat them. Crush them! \n\nRead the Obelisk Tome. Bless them with Molag Bal's might. Then butcher the Xivkyn Sovereign and her minions. Prince of Domination my arse!

Source: Track the beasts to their hunting grounds. There, they grow fat and lazy. In that moment of weakness, gather your allies and slay them. A simple task, but a grave one.\n\nThe Dragons must die, walker. Will you do this for the Dragonguard?
Target: Track the beasts to their hunting grounds. There, they grow fat and lazy. In that moment of weakness, gather your allies and slay them. A simple task, but a grave one.\n\nThe Dragons must die, walker. Will you do this for the Dragonguard?

Source: Then listen, just so you know. We're set up in a hideout near the docks. Come find us when you finish recruiting. Look for Lambur outside the door.
Target: Then listen, just so you know. We're set up in a hideout near the docks. Come find us when you finish recruiting. Look for Lambur outside the door.

Source: Track the beasts to their hunting grounds. There, they grow fat and lazy. In that moment of weakness, gather your allies and slay them. A simple task, but a grave one.\n\nThe Dragons must die, walker. Will you do this for the Dragonguard?
Target: Track the beasts to their hunting grounds. There, they grow fat and lazy. In that moment of weakness, gather your allies and slay them. A simple task, but a grave one.\n\nThe Dragons must die, walker. Will you do this for the Dragonguard?

Source: Word is this Dwarven vault is a death trap meant to keep what's there from ever seeing the light of day. I want you to raise the alarm before you face its guardian and smash your way through every last contraption those crafty bastards left behind.
Target: Word is this Dwarven vault is a death trap meant to keep what's there from ever seeing the light of day. I want you to raise the alarm before you face its guardian and smash your way through every last contraption those crafty bastards left behind.

Source: <Take the brochure.>
Target: <Take the brochure.>

Source: <Take the brochure.>
Target: <Take the brochure.>

Source: How so?
Target: How so?

Source: I believe that beneath the ruins of the Imperial fort here is an Ayleid city containing an artifact of enormous historical significance. Help me recover it and whatever treasures we find in Garlas Malatar are yours to keep.\n\nIt's a generous offer.
Target: I believe that beneath the ruins of the Imperial fort here is an Ayleid city containing an artifact of enormous historical significance. Help me recover it and whatever treasures we find in Garlas Malatar are yours to keep.\n\nIt's a generous offer.

Source: Stay here. I'll save your father.
Target: Stay here. I'll save your father.

Source: A naked man fell from the sky?
Target: A naked man fell from the sky?

Source: So you've trapped these sick egg-hands in the mine?
Target: So you've trapped these sick egg-hands in the mine?

Source: The elders stand by our traditions even as the tribe sinks into quicksand. They refuse to reach out for any aid that isn't prescribed by the tree-minder or the ka-deelith.\n\nPerhaps you could help Kishi? As an outsider, you aren't bound by our laws.
Target: The elders stand by our traditions even as the tribe sinks into quicksand. They refuse to reach out for any aid that isn't prescribed by the tree-minder or the ka-deelith.\n\nPerhaps you could help Kishi? As an outsider, you aren't bound by our laws.

Source: Armor. Specifically, Imperial armor from the First Era. According to Tia, the cavern should literally be filled with the stuff. Helmets, breastplates, whatever you can find. Then bring it back to me and I'll compensate you for your efforts.
Target: Armor. Specifically, Imperial armor from the First Era. According to Tia, the cavern should literally be filled with the stuff. Helmets, breastplates, whatever you can find. Then bring it back to me and I'll compensate you for your efforts.

Source: Meridia loathes disorder. If slaughtering her Purified doesn't get her angry enough, burn the dictates on her altar before you beat some discord into her Symphony of Blades.\n\nNothing she hates more than free will and defiance.
Target: Meridia loathes disorder. If slaughtering her Purified doesn't get her angry enough, burn the dictates on her altar before you beat some discord into her Symphony of Blades.\n\nNothing she hates more than free will and defiance.

Source: The vampire master of the coven is said to savor the blood of innocents. Put an end to him without another drop of it being spilled and you will be worthy of the name, Undaunted.
Target: The vampire master of the coven is said to savor the blood of innocents. Put an end to him without another drop of it being spilled and you will be worthy of the name, Undaunted.

Source: Kind of you to offer … I guess that'd be all right, since you're not an envoy from the local tribes. Don't say I didn't warn you.\n\nYou'll want to speak to our tree-minder, Pavu. She'll know what to do, and give you a proper welcome.
Target: Kind of you to offer … I guess that'd be all right, since you're not an envoy from the local tribes. Don't say I didn't warn you.\n\nYou'll want to speak to our tree-minder, Pavu. She'll know what to do, and give you a proper welcome.

Source: Oh ho! Well, if a gang of vicious cutthroats pose no challenge … why don't you delve into the dwemer ruins beneath and invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle on the nastiest piece of Dwarven cogwork you can find?
Target: Oh ho! Well, if a gang of vicious cutthroats pose no challenge … why don't you delve into the dwemer ruins beneath and invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle on the nastiest piece of Dwarven cogwork you can find?

Source: Tamira needs superior dreugh wax and ash basil leaves to create her candles. You can find both in Stonefalls.\n\nOnce you gather the items, deliver them to her workshop in Davon's Watch. Bring me a batch of her candles, and be quick-quick!
Target: Tamira needs superior dreugh wax and ash basil leaves to create her candles. You can find both in Stonefalls.\n\nOnce you gather the items, deliver them to her workshop in Davon's Watch. Bring me a batch of her candles, and be quick-quick!

Source: Visit the taverns in Mournhold, Stros M'Kai, and Vulkhel Guard. Post these handbills near the entrance to each.\n\nThe trick is getting people to notice. If you put on these dancing leathers and perform an Argonian reel, that will get some attention!
Target: Visit the taverns in Mournhold, Stros M'Kai, and Vulkhel Guard. Post these handbills near the entrance to each.\n\nThe trick is getting people to notice. If you put on these dancing leathers and perform an Argonian reel, that will get some attention!

Source: She'll craft the curatives, but we need to provide the necessary components. Mindileth needs gloom morel mushrooms, a flask of barbleberry juice, and a few venom sacs from Scuttle Pit spiders.\n\nTake them to her at the Vineshade Lodge in Grahtwood.
Target: She'll craft the curatives, but we need to provide the necessary components. Mindileth needs gloom morel mushrooms, a flask of barbleberry juice, and a few venom sacs from Scuttle Pit spiders.\n\nTake them to her at the Vineshade Lodge in Grahtwood.

Source: Try to destroy the construct that's protecting the source of all this mayhem without deactivating any of its defenses. That's what I would do.
Target: Try to destroy the construct that's protecting the source of all this mayhem without deactivating any of its defenses. That's what I would do.

Source: Forgive me. I beg you. I had sellswords with me. They charged through the Gate, but I was attacked by Daedra. I fled ….\n\nIf you'll help, give me another chance at this, I don't care what it costs. I'm going through that portal.
Target: Forgive me. I beg you. I had sellswords with me. They charged through the Gate, but I was attacked by Daedra. I fled ….\n\nIf you'll help, give me another chance at this, I don't care what it costs. I'm going through that portal.

Source: Most assuredly so. It is our most important ceremony of the year. The whole village will be bubbling with activity to ensure it goes smoothly. Knowing that I will return soon with supplies would be one less burden on the tree-minder's mind.
Target: Most assuredly so. It is our most important ceremony of the year. The whole village will be bubbling with activity to ensure it goes smoothly. Knowing that I will return soon with supplies would be one less burden on the tree-minder's mind.

Source: What do you want me to do about it?
Target: What do you want me to do about it?

Source: You need someone to look into that?
Target: You need someone to look into that?

Source: And where exactly can I meet your patron?
Target: And where exactly can I meet your patron?

Source: I'm interested. Tell me more about it.
Target: I'm interested. Tell me more about it.

Source: You think an enemy is responsible for your energy loss?
Target: You think an enemy is responsible for your energy loss?

Source: Just so. I made contact with a reputable salt-maker—a Nord named Hervod—who can meet our demand, but he's no butcher. He did mention that the mammoth are plentiful in The Rift this season. \n\nPerhaps you could travel there and collect both for us?
Target: Just so. I made contact with a reputable salt-maker—a Nord named Hervod—who can meet our demand, but he's no butcher. He did mention that the mammoth are plentiful in The Rift this season. \n\nPerhaps you could travel there and collect both for us?

Source: Hmph. Everyone's a critic. You want a challenge? Invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before facing Canonreeve Oraneth and see how well she takes your critiques.
Target: Hmph. Everyone's a critic. You want a challenge? Invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before facing Canonreeve Oraneth and see how well she takes your critiques.

Source: Long years of bitter disappointment have trained me to measure my expectations. We will find something in the grove, I am certain of it. But this dream-wallow business ….\n\nThe Hist will not make this easy. Not for you, and certainly not for me.
Target: Long years of bitter disappointment have trained me to measure my expectations. We will find something in the grove, I am certain of it. But this dream-wallow business ….\n\nThe Hist will not make this easy. Not for you, and certainly not for me.

Source: I'll speak to her.
Target: I'll speak to her.

Source: A local Argonian tribe has a tradition. To cleanse an area of evil influences, they place sacred candles beside unburied remains. Tia wants us to enter Tsofeer Cavern and place the candles next to any Imperial remains we find. And by we, I mean you.
Target: A local Argonian tribe has a tradition. To cleanse an area of evil influences, they place sacred candles beside unburied remains. Tia wants us to enter Tsofeer Cavern and place the candles next to any Imperial remains we find. And by we, I mean you.

Source: A copper-tongued skink! It's a lizard, you see? Specially trained to sniff out and eat any foods that explorers ought to avoid. Can you get one for me?\n\nA trapper named Arlowe Viducia should have some for sale. You can find him in Sentinel.
Target: A copper-tongued skink! It's a lizard, you see? Specially trained to sniff out and eat any foods that explorers ought to avoid. Can you get one for me?\n\nA trapper named Arlowe Viducia should have some for sale. You can find him in Sentinel.

Source: Daedra tend to have a flare for the dramatic. All doom and gloom. \n\nSeek out this overwrought dire portent called the Opus of Torment, then burn that trash and scatter the ashes across Oblivion. See how they like that!
Target: Daedra tend to have a flare for the dramatic. All doom and gloom. \n\nSeek out this overwrought dire portent called the Opus of Torment, then burn that trash and scatter the ashes across Oblivion. See how they like that!

Source: Army of cutthroats not scary enough for you? All right, invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before quashing the instigator of this rebellion and return Undaunted!
Target: Army of cutthroats not scary enough for you? All right, invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before quashing the instigator of this rebellion and return Undaunted!

Source: Priestess Hodyette. They say that the goddess Kyne has blessed her with the ability to see the patterns of storms, days before they arrive. \n\nTravel to Priestess Hodyette's camp in Eastmarch and implore her to help our cause.
Target: Priestess Hodyette. They say that the goddess Kyne has blessed her with the ability to see the patterns of storms, days before they arrive. \n\nTravel to Priestess Hodyette's camp in Eastmarch and implore her to help our cause.

Source: Before you raise your hand to the twin wardens of the crypt, invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle. If you are not made their eternal slave, you may claim yourself Undaunted.
Target: Before you raise your hand to the twin wardens of the crypt, invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle. If you are not made their eternal slave, you may claim yourself Undaunted.

Source: A legend. Some say it's a massive gem. Others a magical egg. Either way, I fear Eshraf and Dinia's disappearance is linked to their search.\n\nXukas agreed to look into it, and it seems he's found something. Could you speak with him?
Target: A legend. Some say it's a massive gem. Others a magical egg. Either way, I fear Eshraf and Dinia's disappearance is linked to their search.\n\nXukas agreed to look into it, and it seems he's found something. Could you speak with him?

Source: If you're looking for an extra challenge, allow four of Nerien'eth's followers to survive until he takes up the dark blade. Face the ruins unafraid. And return Undaunted.
Target: If you're looking for an extra challenge, allow four of Nerien'eth's followers to survive until he takes up the dark blade. Face the ruins unafraid. And return Undaunted.

Source: While you're returning the Pellingares to their rightful graves, don't forget to set their lackeys along with them! Smite them by the handful and don't lose count! I want to know how many you piled up before the deed's done.
Target: While you're returning the Pellingares to their rightful graves, don't forget to set their lackeys along with them! Smite them by the handful and don't lose count! I want to know how many you piled up before the deed's done.

Source: The instrument of my people! For many Argonians, the dulcet croaks of a vossa-satl remind them of the sounds of home.\n\nAct as my envoy and bring this opportunity to Captain Jimila. Help me secure a trade agreement and I will compensate you.
Target: The instrument of my people! For many Argonians, the dulcet croaks of a vossa-satl remind them of the sounds of home.\n\nAct as my envoy and bring this opportunity to Captain Jimila. Help me secure a trade agreement and I will compensate you.

Source: So they attacked?
Target: So they attacked?

Source: That sounds simple enough. What would I do?
Target: That sounds simple enough. What would I do?

Source: All right, I'll celebrate the Stonetooth Bash.
Target: All right, I'll celebrate the Stonetooth Bash.

Source: No, no, no. This is archeological. Besides, the bones you'll be looking for didn't get a proper burial anyway. Don't worry about that.\n\nWhat ought to concern you are the Blackguards that took the place over. Criminal scum. Best poke around quickly.
Target: No, no, no. This is archeological. Besides, the bones you'll be looking for didn't get a proper burial anyway. Don't worry about that.\n\nWhat ought to concern you are the Blackguards that took the place over. Criminal scum. Best poke around quickly.

Source: All right, I'll do it.
Target: All right, I'll do it.

Source: Unlike most of the old ruins around here, the Teeth of Sithis site was still being used. Not for its original purpose—more like a museum of ancient Argonian faith—but the ritual objects there are in better condition than we'll ever see again.
Target: Unlike most of the old ruins around here, the Teeth of Sithis site was still being used. Not for its original purpose—more like a museum of ancient Argonian faith—but the ritual objects there are in better condition than we'll ever see again.

Source: All right, I'll walk the War Orphan's Sojourn.
Target: All right, I'll walk the War Orphan's Sojourn.

Source: What do they want with heads?
Target: What do they want with heads?

Source: Then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and challenge the witch Drodda in the seat of her power. Remain Undaunted or know the shame of having your folly preserved in ice.
Target: Then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and challenge the witch Drodda in the seat of her power. Remain Undaunted or know the shame of having your folly preserved in ice.

Source: That's the sting. The thief left behind a book of riddles, describing each tablet's location. \n\nHowever, I must admit that I am … unfamiliar with much of Murkmire. It took me days to piece together the first tablet's location.
Target: That's the sting. The thief left behind a book of riddles, describing each tablet's location. \n\nHowever, I must admit that I am … unfamiliar with much of Murkmire. It took me days to piece together the first tablet's location.

Source: Paraxeeh travels among the tribes, spreading the dark word. Last I heard, he was headed to the Bright-Throat Village. You'll most likely find him there.\n\nAnd please, do not mention the theft. I'd rather my mentor not learn of my incompetence.
Target: Paraxeeh travels among the tribes, spreading the dark word. Last I heard, he was headed to the Bright-Throat Village. You'll most likely find him there.\n\nAnd please, do not mention the theft. I'd rather my mentor not learn of my incompetence.

Source: You seek death? Then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and present yourself to the queen of the lamia to court your demise.
Target: You seek death? Then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and present yourself to the queen of the lamia to court your demise.

Source: That's the sting. The thief left behind a book of riddles, describing each tablet's location. \n\nHowever, I must admit that I am … unfamiliar with much of Murkmire. It took me days to piece together the first tablet's location.
Target: That's the sting. The thief left behind a book of riddles, describing each tablet's location. \n\nHowever, I must admit that I am … unfamiliar with much of Murkmire. It took me days to piece together the first tablet's location.

Source: You wish to brand your deeds upon those woods? If you invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before you clip Razor Master Erthas from the tree, you may leave your mark.
Target: You wish to brand your deeds upon those woods? If you invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before you clip Razor Master Erthas from the tree, you may leave your mark.

Source: I've struck a deal with Drakeeh, the leader of the Blackguards. If I can defeat their gauntlet challenge, he'll release Seeks. Unfortunately, I'm more of a sneak than a fighter.\n\nBut you! I bet you've got combat skills aplenty. Mind helping me out?
Target: I've struck a deal with Drakeeh, the leader of the Blackguards. If I can defeat their gauntlet challenge, he'll release Seeks. Unfortunately, I'm more of a sneak than a fighter.\n\nBut you! I bet you've got combat skills aplenty. Mind helping me out?

Source: What about Eoki? Can you free him now?
Target: What about Eoki? Can you free him now?

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: Is she working on the plan to free you?
Target: Is she working on the plan to free you?

Source: Did Khamira say anything else?
Target: Did Khamira say anything else?

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: Anything I can do to help?
Target: Anything I can do to help?

Source: What do I need to do?
Target: What do I need to do?

Source: Then it is a warning to many. Our Root-Heralds held a moot with our allies and learned that Danlai was not the only Saxhleel to suffer this fate.\n\nXukas says you are one to be trusted. Would you please help prevent this from happening again?
Target: Then it is a warning to many. Our Root-Heralds held a moot with our allies and learned that Danlai was not the only Saxhleel to suffer this fate.\n\nXukas says you are one to be trusted. Would you please help prevent this from happening again?

Source: What do I need to do?
Target: What do I need to do?

Source: I'd not ask this of you if it wasn't a matter of grave importance. The box contains a memento from my village that I simply cannot lose.\n\nWill you help?
Target: I'd not ask this of you if it wasn't a matter of grave importance. The box contains a memento from my village that I simply cannot lose.\n\nWill you help?

Source: Why would a Mages Guild wizard try to steal your business?
Target: Why would a Mages Guild wizard try to steal your business?

Source: Ah, well, if you don't mind. To introduce the issue, if nothing else.\n\nThe dispute is between Nurhei and Paheiza, who both claim rights to a nearby saltrice farm. They've already both agreed to accept Sulahkeesh's decision.
Target: Ah, well, if you don't mind. To introduce the issue, if nothing else.\n\nThe dispute is between Nurhei and Paheiza, who both claim rights to a nearby saltrice farm. They've already both agreed to accept Sulahkeesh's decision.

Source: How could I assist in your investigation?
Target: How could I assist in your investigation?

Source: Varona saw some ancient Argonian stonework out in the swamp. She loves to study the techniques of long-dead masons.\n\nUse this whistle and Drooler should come running. If you pet him and tell him he's a good boy, he'll lead you directly to Varona.
Target: Varona saw some ancient Argonian stonework out in the swamp. She loves to study the techniques of long-dead masons.\n\nUse this whistle and Drooler should come running. If you pet him and tell him he's a good boy, he'll lead you directly to Varona.

Source: What's so dangerous about the current job?
Target: What's so dangerous about the current job?

Source: <<1>> said most attacks come from the north. There are some caves, an old mine, and a ruined Imperial tower in that direction. If you find <<2>>, do what you must to stop him.\n\nYou do so with my husband's authority. With my authority.
Target: <<1>> said most attacks come from the north. There are some caves, an old mine, and a ruined Imperial tower in that direction. If you find <<2>>, do what you must to stop him.\n\nYou do so with my husband's authority. With my authority.

Source: I'll have you know I paid a lot for that information! But Stibbons is exceedingly slow and requires constant supervision. Why, I can't even spare a moment to look for the hand-mirror he lost.\n\nWould you mind ever so much finding it for me, please?
Target: I'll have you know I paid a lot for that information! But Stibbons is exceedingly slow and requires constant supervision. Why, I can't even spare a moment to look for the hand-mirror he lost.\n\nWould you mind ever so much finding it for me, please?

Source: Then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before you face what mechanized guardians must surely watch over the place. Should you prevail, we will know you are Undaunted.
Target: Then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle before you face what mechanized guardians must surely watch over the place. Should you prevail, we will know you are Undaunted.

Source: You can help make my sap-dreams a reality! Everyone knows the comfort of being lulled to sleep by the bubbling bog and croaking of frogs, but there's so much more to the music of the swamp!\n\nWe just need to assemble a quartet of swamp jellies!
Target: You can help make my sap-dreams a reality! Everyone knows the comfort of being lulled to sleep by the bubbling bog and croaking of frogs, but there's so much more to the music of the swamp!\n\nWe just need to assemble a quartet of swamp jellies!

Source: Magical sickness. <<1>> handles all that. Me, I guard the gate.\n\nKnow anything about stopping curses? Head inside. Shaman said he needs another set of hands.
Target: Magical sickness. <<1>> handles all that. Me, I guard the gate.\n\nKnow anything about stopping curses? Head inside. Shaman said he needs another set of hands.

Source: The Maormer Stormreeve can sheer your flesh with the winds and shatter your bones with the waves, but if that is not enough you have only to invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle. I will listen for the breaking sky.
Target: The Maormer Stormreeve can sheer your flesh with the winds and shatter your bones with the waves, but if that is not enough you have only to invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle. I will listen for the breaking sky.

Source: She's tended the chief since he fell ill. You've shown you stand with the stronghold, and for that you'll remain welcome.\n\nBut if you wish to stop the poisoner, you'll need her approval or the others won't help.
Target: She's tended the chief since he fell ill. You've shown you stand with the stronghold, and for that you'll remain welcome.\n\nBut if you wish to stop the poisoner, you'll need her approval or the others won't help.

Source: You must travel to echoes of our past: Tsofeer Cavern, the Teeth of Sithis, and the Tomb of Many Spears. There, you will gather pieces from our Days of Stone-Nests.\n\nWhen all is collected, then I shall create.
Target: You must travel to echoes of our past: Tsofeer Cavern, the Teeth of Sithis, and the Tomb of Many Spears. There, you will gather pieces from our Days of Stone-Nests.\n\nWhen all is collected, then I shall create.

Source: Captain Blackheart has a fearsome reputation, but if that fails to impress you then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle. What inventive form of torture and death awaits you in failure? I do not know.
Target: Captain Blackheart has a fearsome reputation, but if that fails to impress you then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle. What inventive form of torture and death awaits you in failure? I do not know.

Source: If this description is accurate, the entrance lies somewhere in the Hall of Might. \n\nBut there's something else. Would you come with me?
Target: If this description is accurate, the entrance lies somewhere in the Hall of Might. \n\nBut there's something else. Would you come with me?

Source: "My love, I can stand it no longer. Though I rebuked you, my heart yearns for your touch. To utter such words aloud is sacrilege, so I put these words down in hope you find them.\n\n"Find my second page, and you will find the mate."
Target: \\"My love
column4: I can stand it no longer. Though I rebuked you
column5: my heart yearns for your touch. To utter such words aloud is sacrilege
column6: so I put these words down in hope you find them.\n\n\"\"Find my second page
column7: and you will find the mate.\"\""

Source: These past weeks the Hist has been agitated. It has given me signs that I believed were warnings for the bonding to come, but now I feel that I've misinterpreted.\n\nIt is this clutch that is in peril … and it is you who can save it.
Target: These past weeks the Hist has been agitated. It has given me signs that I believed were warnings for the bonding to come, but now I feel that I've misinterpreted.\n\nIt is this clutch that is in peril … and it is you who can save it.

Source: She wanted you to kill her?
Target: She wanted you to kill her?

Source: I should bring this artifact to Divayth Fyr so that he can examine it.
Target: I should bring this artifact to Divayth Fyr so that he can examine it.

Source: All right, I'll do it.
Target: All right, I'll do it.

Source: I should bring this artifact to Divayth Fyr so that he can examine it.
Target: I should bring this artifact to Divayth Fyr so that he can examine it.

Source: Though it grows abundantly, the aloe is surrounded by creatures most dreadful. Even our greatest warriors balk to enter Vakka-Bok.\n\nBut you are Rootmender, Bringer of the Remnant. Surely you can help us?
Target: Though it grows abundantly, the aloe is surrounded by creatures most dreadful. Even our greatest warriors balk to enter Vakka-Bok.\n\nBut you are Rootmender, Bringer of the Remnant. Surely you can help us?

Source: Flying lizards that fill the skies and attack our tribes. I've heard the Dark Elves liken them to cliff striders. Their hide happen to make excellent leather, despite the dangers in hunting them down.\n\nWill you aid us in this task?
Target: Flying lizards that fill the skies and attack our tribes. I've heard the Dark Elves liken them to cliff striders. Their hide happen to make excellent leather, despite the dangers in hunting them down.\n\nWill you aid us in this task?

Source: You want me to acquire the staff called Sunna'rah?
Target: You want me to acquire the staff called Sunna'rah?

Source: The Mad Architect is the only mortal to make pacts with multiple Daedric Princes. Your sanity would shatter merely looking upon him. If you wish to dive headlong in to madness, you need only invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and meet the maker.
Target: The Mad Architect is the only mortal to make pacts with multiple Daedric Princes. Your sanity would shatter merely looking upon him. If you wish to dive headlong in to madness, you need only invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and meet the maker.

Source: The slavers took most of the crew up the beach, but Salach, Lidenar, and Ozor are still there. Other captives too, but they're no concern of mine.\n\nI'm too waterlogged to fight, but if you'll free my men, I'll make it worth your while.
Target: The slavers took most of the crew up the beach, but Salach, Lidenar, and Ozor are still there. Other captives too, but they're no concern of mine.\n\nI'm too waterlogged to fight, but if you'll free my men, I'll make it worth your while.

Source: Though our envoy escaped, all of her possessions were taken by the Blackguards. If we fail to retrieve them, we risk disrespecting the very tribes who have already offered their help.\n\nWill you aid us, Rootmender?
Target: Though our envoy escaped, all of her possessions were taken by the Blackguards. If we fail to retrieve them, we risk disrespecting the very tribes who have already offered their help.\n\nWill you aid us, Rootmender?

Source: The Lava Queen has held the Brimstone Crown for centuries, but if you believe she is past her prime then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle. The spectacle may be worthy of memory, even if you do not survive it.
Target: The Lava Queen has held the Brimstone Crown for centuries, but if you believe she is past her prime then invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle. The spectacle may be worthy of memory, even if you do not survive it.

Source: I have no doubt it was the Blackguards. We've already had a few skirmishes with them, and they continue to attack our hunters. They probably saw our envoys as easy targets.\n\nWe need someone to search the Blackguard Caravan and rescue them.
Target: I have no doubt it was the Blackguards. We've already had a few skirmishes with them, and they continue to attack our hunters. They probably saw our envoys as easy targets.\n\nWe need someone to search the Blackguard Caravan and rescue them.

Source: You think the relic you found caused her to kill someone?
Target: You think the relic you found caused her to kill someone?

Source: Selene is ruler of her domain. It bends to her command. Prove that you will not bow as well. Invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and cut the threads binding her life.
Target: Selene is ruler of her domain. It bends to her command. Prove that you will not bow as well. Invoke the Scroll of Glorious Battle and cut the threads binding her life.

Source: Our village is new and our supplies are low. If we are to be self-sufficient, we must quickly create farmsteads to sustain us. Such fertilizer is vital to ensuring this.\n\nWill you help us, Rootmender?
Target: Our village is new and our supplies are low. If we are to be self-sufficient, we must quickly create farmsteads to sustain us. Such fertilizer is vital to ensuring this.\n\nWill you help us, Rootmender?

Source: My workers. They're like family, the kind that doesn't know their way around a marsh. Not like you.\n\nHey, if you run across them, would you mind keeping them safe? Especially <<1>>, my cook. As long as she's all right, I'll be all right.
Target: My workers. They're like family, the kind that doesn't know their way around a marsh. Not like you.\n\nHey, if you run across them, would you mind keeping them safe? Especially <<1>>, my cook. As long as she's all right, I'll be all right.

Source: That's where the pledge comes in. It's a verbal handshake, a … you know what? Go talk to Glirion the Redbeard. He'll tell you everything you need to know.
Target: That's where the pledge comes in. It's a verbal handshake, a … you know what? Go talk to Glirion the Redbeard. He'll tell you everything you need to know.

Source: Suppose it's a bit troubling.\n\nSay, would you happen to be headed into the ruins? I have this report to finish, but if you could check on <<1>>, it'd set my mind at ease.
Target: Suppose it's a bit troubling.\n\nSay, would you happen to be headed into the ruins? I have this report to finish, but if you could check on <<1>>, it'd set my mind at ease.

Source: Hist knows, we have been gracious hosts to the suitors of our neighboring tribes—plying them with feasts and phlegmwine—but now that it's time to renew vows of kinship, they're limp as wilting lilies when they should be rising to the occasion!
Target: Hist knows, we have been gracious hosts to the suitors of our neighboring tribes—plying them with feasts and phlegmwine—but now that it's time to renew vows of kinship, they're limp as wilting lilies when they should be rising to the occasion!

Source: You're a gust of wind on calm waters, friend. I warn you, though—this might not be be easy.\n\nThe slavers took the focusing crystals and my combustion oil and we'll need to get it all back before we can relight the fire.
Target: You're a gust of wind on calm waters, friend. I warn you, though—this might not be be easy.\n\nThe slavers took the focusing crystals and my combustion oil and we'll need to get it all back before we can relight the fire.

Source: <<1>> can take care of himself, but the other workers? They're used to city walls and cobbled streets, not stranglers and quicksand.\n\nIf you're traveling through the marsh, could you make sure they're safe? I would appreciate it.
Target: <<1>> can take care of himself, but the other workers? They're used to city walls and cobbled streets, not stranglers and quicksand.\n\nIf you're traveling through the marsh, could you make sure they're safe? I would appreciate it.

Source: What? No! They're dead. What I need is their journals.\n\nEach researcher kept notes on their finds. If I can get the journals to Elden Root, the expedition isn't a complete waste. But I won't risk going in there. Would be safer running off a cliff.
Target: What? No! They're dead. What I need is their journals.\n\nEach researcher kept notes on their finds. If I can get the journals to Elden Root, the expedition isn't a complete waste. But I won't risk going in there. Would be safer running off a cliff.

Source: "If you care about history and seek to correct the mistakes of the past, then Cyrodilic Collections wants you. Please look for <<1>> in Vulkhel Guard, Davon's Watch, or Daggerfall. Help us beat the competition and preserve Argonian culture."
Target: \\"If you care about history and seek to correct the mistakes of the past
column4: then Cyrodilic Collections wants you. Please look for <<1>> in Vulkhel Guard
column5: Davon's Watch
column6: or Daggerfall. Help us beat the competition and preserve Argonian culture.\"\""

Source: Where can I find Great Zexxin?
Target: Where can I find Great Zexxin?

Source: What else can you tell me about this deadly nix-hound?
Target: What else can you tell me about this deadly nix-hound?

Source: This has all been a ploy to find the Clockwork City?
Target: This has all been a ploy to find the Clockwork City?

Source: A nereid?
Target: A nereid?

Source: What's a memory stone?
Target: What's a memory stone?

Source: What do I need to do?
Target: What do I need to do?

Source: So she hasn't shared her next plan with you?
Target: So she hasn't shared her next plan with you?

Source: There must be something we can do.
Target: There must be something we can do.

Source: Not according to the official record. The Imperials built a fort here around three hundred years ago, but it was lost to some unspoken calamity and abandoned. Unofficially, an item of similar description was unearthed here not long before then.
Target: Not according to the official record. The Imperials built a fort here around three hundred years ago, but it was lost to some unspoken calamity and abandoned. Unofficially, an item of similar description was unearthed here not long before then.

Source: They're buried at all four ends of the island. On a bluff outside Vulkhel Guard, just outside of Tanzelwil, near Castle Rilis. And on a hill overlooking Phaer.\n\nMy children loved the water. Loved the sight of it.
Target: They're buried at all four ends of the island. On a bluff outside Vulkhel Guard, just outside of Tanzelwil, near Castle Rilis. And on a hill overlooking Phaer.\n\nMy children loved the water. Loved the sight of it.

Source: Well … there are things people want which aren't illegal, not exactly, but which the Dominion dislikes.\n\nLook, the pirates took some goods used to produce such things. If I don't get the goods to my contact, we'll lose our business. You see?
Target: Well … there are things people want which aren't illegal, not exactly, but which the Dominion dislikes.\n\nLook, the pirates took some goods used to produce such things. If I don't get the goods to my contact, we'll lose our business. You see?

Source: Then what are you doing here? Famia will not last long without your help, new blood! And if she dies, who will Zadaza work for and make fun of?\n\nYou should go find her, yes?
