Target: Then what are you doing here? Famia will not last long without your help, new blood! And if she dies, who will Zadaza work for and make fun of?\n\nYou should go find her, yes?

Source: How do I find Writhing Sveeth?
Target: How do I find Writhing Sveeth?

Source: Follow the path east until you find the central chamber marked by the large Welkynd Stone growths.\n\nYou'll find the door there.
Target: Follow the path east until you find the central chamber marked by the large Welkynd Stone growths.\n\nYou'll find the door there.

Source: Anything else I should know before I hunt a giant mudcrab?
Target: Anything else I should know before I hunt a giant mudcrab?

Source: Talk to <<1>> or <<2>>. They've both got runners. Otherwise, you could talk to one of the foreigners. Who knows what they have?
Target: Talk to <<1>> or <<2>>. They've both got runners. Otherwise, you could talk to one of the foreigners. Who knows what they have?

Source: These mer have been sentenced to death. Find them, and carry out the order. We have records of their last known location, that should help.\n\nReturn with proof of their demise, if you please.
Target: These mer have been sentenced to death. Find them, and carry out the order. We have records of their last known location, that should help.\n\nReturn with proof of their demise, if you please.

Source: Simply put, I just acquired two halves of an ancient tablet. The Wrathstone. It forms a map that will lead us to a weapon capable of forcing all sides to cease their aggressive behavior.\n\nHelp me find this weapon and we can end the war.
Target: Simply put, I just acquired two halves of an ancient tablet. The Wrathstone. It forms a map that will lead us to a weapon capable of forcing all sides to cease their aggressive behavior.\n\nHelp me find this weapon and we can end the war.

Source: Thank you. I happen to know some of the nobles in town collect Dwemer parts as baubles. \n\nIf you could find me a ring, a gear, and a tube, I'd have Leggy jumping around good as new in no time.
Target: Thank you. I happen to know some of the nobles in town collect Dwemer parts as baubles. \n\nIf you could find me a ring, a gear, and a tube, I'd have Leggy jumping around good as new in no time.

Source: Could they be interested in the Moon Gate of Anequina? It lies in that direction.\n\nI wonder if this pertains to Euraxia's final order? A soldier mentioned it after we captured her, but she refused to elaborate. Maybe you can help Tharn find out more.
Target: Could they be interested in the Moon Gate of Anequina? It lies in that direction.\n\nI wonder if this pertains to Euraxia's final order? A soldier mentioned it after we captured her, but she refused to elaborate. Maybe you can help Tharn find out more.

Source: I should find <<1>> in Eastmarch.
Target: I should find <<1>> in Eastmarch.

Source: Yes. The song affected everything in there. Even the kwama.
Target: Yes. The song affected everything in there. Even the kwama.

Source: I could help you.
Target: I could help you.

Source: We care for many rare animals. A juicy target, yes?\n\nJust yesterday, a group of them stole this one's training whistle. To lure out our beasts, you see? We have little gold, but Numaia would pay you to retrieve her whistle and punish those muskarses!
Target: We care for many rare animals. A juicy target, yes?\n\nJust yesterday, a group of them stole this one's training whistle. To lure out our beasts, you see? We have little gold, but Numaia would pay you to retrieve her whistle and punish those muskarses!

Source: Still inside! A Daedroth caught us sniffing around, right? Hadaz tried to tell it that joke he knows. To make friends, yes? Doubt it worked, but who knows. This one took off running.\n\nI feel a little bad about leaving Hadaz. Would you look for him?
Target: Still inside! A Daedroth caught us sniffing around, right? Hadaz tried to tell it that joke he knows. To make friends, yes? Doubt it worked, but who knows. This one took off running.\n\nI feel a little bad about leaving Hadaz. Would you look for him?

Source: Forgive me, but I can't duplicate his imperious inflections. Ahem. "The great Abnur Tharn requires your assistance. With it, we can end the Three Banners War. Report to me immediately if not sooner."\n\nHe asked me to mark his location on your map.
Target: Forgive me, but I can't duplicate his imperious inflections. Ahem. \\"The great Abnur Tharn requires your assistance. With it
column4: we can end the Three Banners War. Report to me immediately if not sooner.\"\"\n\nHe asked me to mark his location on your map."

Source: Can you provide me with any additional information?
Target: Can you provide me with any additional information?

Source: Challenging an army is suicide. But you're on your way to face Vox, so you already understand that.\n\nIf you take out some of the cultists along the way, that would help. Every enemy that falls tips the favor to our side.
Target: Challenging an army is suicide. But you're on your way to face Vox, so you already understand that.\n\nIf you take out some of the cultists along the way, that would help. Every enemy that falls tips the favor to our side.

Source: Who said anything about a direct assault? Subterfuge is called for. I suggest a small group. Slip into the palace, locate Euraxia, and remove her from the throne—by any means necessary.\n\nTalk to Gharesh-ri. He knows someone who can get us inside.
Target: Who said anything about a direct assault? Subterfuge is called for. I suggest a small group. Slip into the palace, locate Euraxia, and remove her from the throne—by any means necessary.\n\nTalk to Gharesh-ri. He knows someone who can get us inside.

Source: I want someone to take them out, I don't care who does it or how. But whoever does will be well rewarded.
Target: I want someone to take them out, I don't care who does it or how. But whoever does will be well rewarded.

Source: Don't know. Old stones, old gates and levers. Who can say for sure?\n\nI overheard the adepts discussing the trouble. A young one, Vazbi, seems keen to solve the issue. If you want to know more, she's the person to ask.
Target: Don't know. Old stones, old gates and levers. Who can say for sure?\n\nI overheard the adepts discussing the trouble. A young one, Vazbi, seems keen to solve the issue. If you want to know more, she's the person to ask.

Source: What is this artifact?
Target: What is this artifact?

Source: No. And we never will if Silhu-jo gets his way. He yowls about the risks, but Vazbi is not the saucer-eyed kitten she was when Silhu-jo found her. This one must fix this!\n\nYou're a warrior, yes? Would you escort Vazbi to investigate the aqueduct?
Target: No. And we never will if Silhu-jo gets his way. He yowls about the risks, but Vazbi is not the saucer-eyed kitten she was when Silhu-jo found her. This one must fix this!\n\nYou're a warrior, yes? Would you escort Vazbi to investigate the aqueduct?

Source: So now they refuse to help you.
Target: So now they refuse to help you.

Source: I would need to first create an antidote. However, I require samples from corpses that have absorbed the fumes.\n\nNo easy task, given that something has awoken Cicatrice's dead. They now guard the ruins from any invaders.
Target: I would need to first create an antidote. However, I require samples from corpses that have absorbed the fumes.\n\nNo easy task, given that something has awoken Cicatrice's dead. They now guard the ruins from any invaders.

Source: Both, but look for Brother Hakam first. \n\nWith the Scroll of Return, you can get Abbot Durak back here sooner, where I hope he'll be able to put out that big fire.
Target: Both, but look for Brother Hakam first. \n\nWith the Scroll of Return, you can get Abbot Durak back here sooner, where I hope he'll be able to put out that big fire.

Source: Oh, you have no idea! Especially the way Kireth operates. We're on the verge of a major Dwemer discovery. That's why the king invited us here. We're experts, you know.\n\nCould you rescue my sister? I'd help, but I don't do that sort of thing.
Target: Oh, you have no idea! Especially the way Kireth operates. We're on the verge of a major Dwemer discovery. That's why the king invited us here. We're experts, you know.\n\nCould you rescue my sister? I'd help, but I don't do that sort of thing.

Source: It's a personal matter, pertaining to my grandfather's legacy. Painful as it is to say, my family's reputation depends on proving this rumor false.\n\nYou wouldn't happen to be looking for work, would you? I could use a lending hand.
Target: It's a personal matter, pertaining to my grandfather's legacy. Painful as it is to say, my family's reputation depends on proving this rumor false.\n\nYou wouldn't happen to be looking for work, would you? I could use a lending hand.

Source: <It appears that Ranev's pilgrimage began and ended at a standing stone to the southwest of Dragonstar known as the "Gray Menhir." The other destinations are scattered throughout Craglorn, deep within various caves and tombs.>
Target: <It appears that Ranev's pilgrimage began and ended at a standing stone to the southwest of Dragonstar known as the \\"Gray Menhir.\"\" The other destinations are scattered throughout Craglorn
column4: deep within various caves and tombs.>"

Source: I'm afraid so. His wife, Rosalie, and their daughter, Ganise, are still up there searching.\n\nIf you have the time to spare, I know they could certainly use some help.
Target: I'm afraid so. His wife, Rosalie, and their daughter, Ganise, are still up there searching.\n\nIf you have the time to spare, I know they could certainly use some help.

Source: Half-sister. And I have no hesitation in this regard.\n\nTo best Euraxia, however, we need to reach the Halls of Colossus ahead of her. Give me and Khamira a moment to negotiate an accord we can both live with. Then meet us by the wagon I chartered.
Target: Half-sister. And I have no hesitation in this regard.\n\nTo best Euraxia, however, we need to reach the Halls of Colossus ahead of her. Give me and Khamira a moment to negotiate an accord we can both live with. Then meet us by the wagon I chartered.

Source: Mister Nurin's wife is still up there, but she says she's calling off the search. She's giving up too soon, you see?\n\nYou need to go offer to help. Don't tell her you spoke with me, though. She dismissed me. Go on now. Go help.
Target: Mister Nurin's wife is still up there, but she says she's calling off the search. She's giving up too soon, you see?\n\nYou need to go offer to help. Don't tell her you spoke with me, though. She dismissed me. Go on now. Go help.

Source: Cadwell's visions strike more frequently now. With more urgency. Tharn believes Zumog Phoom is close to reassembling Cadwell's dismembered body. I want you to stop him.\n\nThe Betrayer of legend must not be reborn.
Target: Cadwell's visions strike more frequently now. With more urgency. Tharn believes Zumog Phoom is close to reassembling Cadwell's dismembered body. I want you to stop him.\n\nThe Betrayer of legend must not be reborn.

Source: Tell me about the enemy you face.
Target: Tell me about the enemy you face.

Source: The Forge?
Target: The Forge?

Source: I'll go talk to the Archcanon.
Target: I'll go talk to the Archcanon.

Source:
"I send my <<z:1>> with this offer of total amnesty and a chest of gold provided in good faith. Report immediately to <<2>> in Orsinium or I will send the Lion Guard to exterminate you all.

—Yours truly,
High-King Emeric"
Target: \\"I send my <<z:1>> with this offer of total amnesty and a chest of gold provided in good faith. Report immediately to <<2>> in Orsinium or I will send the Lion Guard to exterminate you all.\n\n—Yours truly
column4: \nHigh-King Emeric\"\""

Source: Please! I can't spare any troops from town, so I hope you're willing to help.\n\nThorn Lodge is to the northwest. Bring back any valuables you find and I'll split the profits with you.
Target: Please! I can't spare any troops from town, so I hope you're willing to help.\n\nThorn Lodge is to the northwest. Bring back any valuables you find and I'll split the profits with you.

Source: Just one concern?
Target: Just one concern?

Source: Well, the keys are still on their bodies you see. Three merchants. All killed in the attack.\n\nIf you could grab those keys and get the items from the chests, I'll make sure the goods are taken care of. Please. Do it for the dead.
Target: Well, the keys are still on their bodies you see. Three merchants. All killed in the attack.\n\nIf you could grab those keys and get the items from the chests, I'll make sure the goods are taken care of. Please. Do it for the dead.

Source: What exactly do you need accomplished?
Target: What exactly do you need accomplished?

Source: Profit, of course! Durzogs make the perfect guard animals, but they're impossible to tame. If I could train and sell just one of those beasts, I'd make a fortune!\n\nIf you can acquire the whistle and figure out how it works, we'll split the profits.
Target: Profit, of course! Durzogs make the perfect guard animals, but they're impossible to tame. If I could train and sell just one of those beasts, I'd make a fortune!\n\nIf you can acquire the whistle and figure out how it works, we'll split the profits.

Source: The Speaker for the Mane! Showed up with a bunch of hard-charging Khajiit soldiers and gave a rousing speech. Even left his top warrior behind to defend us!\n\n<<1>> will put you to work, like she did for me. I'm watching for pirates!
Target: The Speaker for the Mane! Showed up with a bunch of hard-charging Khajiit soldiers and gave a rousing speech. Even left his top warrior behind to defend us!\n\n<<1>> will put you to work, like she did for me. I'm watching for pirates!

Source: Who knows what relics and knowledge are inside an untouched Dwemer ruin? That's what <<1>> said, and now he's dead like all the rest. Well, he might be alive. We got separated when we ran for our lives.\n\nBut he's probably dead.
Target: Who knows what relics and knowledge are inside an untouched Dwemer ruin? That's what <<1>> said, and now he's dead like all the rest. Well, he might be alive. We got separated when we ran for our lives.\n\nBut he's probably dead.

Source: Not a word, and it smells like Elf mischief to me.\n\nMy husband, Chief Ramash, went down into the quarry to look for the Elf and find out what happened to our workers. He came back covered in blood. And I can tell you, Ramash doesn't bleed easily.
Target: Not a word, and it smells like Elf mischief to me.\n\nMy husband, Chief Ramash, went down into the quarry to look for the Elf and find out what happened to our workers. He came back covered in blood. And I can tell you, Ramash doesn't bleed easily.

Source: Across the river. Some is in a house and the rest inside the old church. May Akatosh watch over you!
Target: Across the river. Some is in a house and the rest inside the old church. May Akatosh watch over you!

Source: Now that you mention it, I was hoping to collect a Dwarven power core. But the only one I saw was protected by a Ztheng Guardian!\n\nIf you could get the core, I'd appreciate it. Raynor loves those things! Uses them to build all kinds of devices.
Target: Now that you mention it, I was hoping to collect a Dwarven power core. But the only one I saw was protected by a Ztheng Guardian!\n\nIf you could get the core, I'd appreciate it. Raynor loves those things! Uses them to build all kinds of devices.

Source: Retrieve the totem, rescue my employees, and you will be rewarded. Try not to kill all the Goblins, we need a workforce to be profitable. Use this rotten food to distract them.\n\nOh, and if you see <<1>>, tell him to start looking for another job.
Target: Retrieve the totem, rescue my employees, and you will be rewarded. Try not to kill all the Goblins, we need a workforce to be profitable. Use this rotten food to distract them.\n\nOh, and if you see <<1>>, tell him to start looking for another job.

Source: Hmm? No, the correct question is "how?" This bizarre experimentation was done with great purpose.\n\nI would know the true meaning and goal behind such techniques. Should you encounter any evidence, do return it to me, yes? Yes, good.
Target: Hmm? No, the correct question is \\"how?\"\" This bizarre experimentation was done with great purpose.\n\nI would know the true meaning and goal behind such techniques. Should you encounter any evidence
column4: do return it to me
column5: yes? Yes

Source: Indeed. Myself and these others were exiled for standing against Sir Croix, but we are too few at present to retake the keep. \n\nThere are other knights in the keep who are questioning Sir Croix. Could you go in and look for those who would join us?
Target: Indeed. Myself and these others were exiled for standing against Sir Croix, but we are too few at present to retake the keep. \n\nThere are other knights in the keep who are questioning Sir Croix. Could you go in and look for those who would join us?

Source: "A reward is hereby offered for all Dwarven relics delivered in good working order. Monies paid depend on condition, rarity, and usefulness of said relic. Pieces of relics are also accepted, depending on condition.\n\n"—Rulorn"
Target: \\"A reward is hereby offered for all Dwarven relics delivered in good working order. Monies paid depend on condition
column4: rarity
column5: and usefulness of said relic. Pieces of relics are also accepted

Source: Chief Ramash and Hunt-Wife Bolgar decided to enter the quarry and find out what was going on. We went with them. Worst decision I ever made.\n\nBolgar's still down there. Looking for her daughter. Last we knew, she was with the Elf.
Target: Chief Ramash and Hunt-Wife Bolgar decided to enter the quarry and find out what was going on. We went with them. Worst decision I ever made.\n\nBolgar's still down there. Looking for her daughter. Last we knew, she was with the Elf.

Source: A spy reported that they're in the graveyard to the east, under guard. Still eager to help?
Target: A spy reported that they're in the graveyard to the east, under guard. Still eager to help?

Source: "A reward is hereby offered for all Dwarven relics delivered in good working order. Monies paid depend on condition, rarity, and usefulness of said relic. Pieces of relics are also accepted, depending on condition.\n\n"—Rulorn"
Target: \\"A reward is hereby offered for all Dwarven relics delivered in good working order. Monies paid depend on condition

Source: "A reward is hereby offered for all Dwarven relics delivered in good working order. Monies paid depend on condition, rarity, and usefulness of said relic. Pieces of relics are also accepted, depending on condition.\n\n"—Rulorn"
Target: \\"A reward is hereby offered for all Dwarven relics delivered in good working order. Monies paid depend on condition

Source: "A reward is hereby offered for all Dwarven relics delivered in good working order. Monies paid depend on condition, rarity, and usefulness of said relic. Pieces of relics are also accepted, depending on condition.\n\n"—Rulorn"
Target: \\"A reward is hereby offered for all Dwarven relics delivered in good working order. Monies paid depend on condition
column4: rarity
column5: and usefulness of said relic. Pieces of relics are also accepted

Source: They've erected Daedric stones at the estate. The Shadowed Path mages use the stones to summon powerful atronachs. These monsters have been waylaying travelers and even some of my soldiers.\n\nWill you destroy the stones?
Target: They've erected Daedric stones at the estate. The Shadowed Path mages use the stones to summon powerful atronachs. These monsters have been waylaying travelers and even some of my soldiers.\n\nWill you destroy the stones?

Source: The Silver Dawn is a sacred order of werewolf hunters. The Magnar Pack are werewolves.\n\nThey attacked our stronghold in the Argent Mine. I barely escaped, but I had to leave our sacred banner behind. Without it, the order can't rise again.
Target: The Silver Dawn is a sacred order of werewolf hunters. The Magnar Pack are werewolves.\n\nThey attacked our stronghold in the Argent Mine. I barely escaped, but I had to leave our sacred banner behind. Without it, the order can't rise again.

Source: An excellent suggestion. I believe this automaton can unseal the door, if it can be controlled. \n\nI have its control rod but two focusing crystals seem to be missing. They are nearby but the local creatures dissuade me from claiming them.
Target: An excellent suggestion. I believe this automaton can unseal the door, if it can be controlled. \n\nI have its control rod but two focusing crystals seem to be missing. They are nearby but the local creatures dissuade me from claiming them.

Source: "I fear that the hagraven isn't restricting her transformations to just prisoners. I think she's using the totem on our own people! You should leave as soon as possible. I will—"\n\n<A smear of dried blood obscures the rest of this letter.>
Target: \\"I fear that the hagraven isn't restricting her transformations to just prisoners. I think she's using the totem on our own people! You should leave as soon as possible. I will—\"\"\n\n<A smear of dried blood obscures the rest of this letter.>"

Source: I followed you around and collected hearts from the Dremora you killed. Easiest job I've had in weeks!\n\nDalen can make strong healing potions out of them. It's a wonder that something beneficial can come from these creatures.
Target: I followed you around and collected hearts from the Dremora you killed. Easiest job I've had in weeks!\n\nDalen can make strong healing potions out of them. It's a wonder that something beneficial can come from these creatures.

Source: Ha ha ha! An interesting proposal.\n\nLet's see if your bite is as fierce as your bark.
Target: Ha ha ha! An interesting proposal.\n\nLet's see if your bite is as fierce as your bark.

Source: I used to collect items from Ayleid ruins. Nothing valuable, just little bits of things. I was about to explore the ruins of Vahtacen when war broke out. I haven't been able to leave town since. Would you search Vahtacen for me?
Target: I used to collect items from Ayleid ruins. Nothing valuable, just little bits of things. I was about to explore the ruins of Vahtacen when war broke out. I haven't been able to leave town since. Would you search Vahtacen for me?

Source: Yes. Speak with the Arch-Mage. He's meditating on the challenges ahead. I'm still somewhat … drained from my efforts, so he'll open the portal to the Shivering Isles for you.
Target: Yes. Speak with the Arch-Mage. He's meditating on the challenges ahead. I'm still somewhat … drained from my efforts, so he'll open the portal to the Shivering Isles for you.

Source: We're tired of sailing independently. We planned to hand over the treasure to the Thalmor so they could make us privateers.\n\nBut <<1>> led a mutiny, captured most of my crew, and kidnapped my wife. Once he has the treasure, he'll kill them all.
Target: We're tired of sailing independently. We planned to hand over the treasure to the Thalmor so they could make us privateers.\n\nBut <<1>> led a mutiny, captured most of my crew, and kidnapped my wife. Once he has the treasure, he'll kill them all.

Source: Where was this creature spotted?
Target: Where was this creature spotted?

Source: What do I need to do?
Target: What do I need to do?

Source: So your strict observance of rules and obligations caused this rift between you and your daughter?
Target: So your strict observance of rules and obligations caused this rift between you and your daughter?

Source: What do I need to do?
Target: What do I need to do?

Source: I'll think about it, but I'm not your assassin.
Target: I'll think about it, but I'm not your assassin.

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: How do I find this ancient cliff strider?
Target: How do I find this ancient cliff strider?

Source: Do you have any leads on where to find a King Razor-Tusk?
Target: Do you have any leads on where to find a King Razor-Tusk?

Source: Maybe, but I prefer facts to speculation. I don't know who she is or why she is in a Goblin cave, but I'm not prepared to go in there alone.\n\nYou willing to help the investigation? I'm going to set up a signal fire outside.
Target: Maybe, but I prefer facts to speculation. I don't know who she is or why she is in a Goblin cave, but I'm not prepared to go in there alone.\n\nYou willing to help the investigation? I'm going to set up a signal fire outside.

Source: That's the Five Finger Dance! The greatest party in all the worlds. But I tell you dearie, things have been so boring the last few years. Why don't we see what mischief we can get into? It'll be fun!
Target: That's the Five Finger Dance! The greatest party in all the worlds. But I tell you dearie, things have been so boring the last few years. Why don't we see what mischief we can get into? It'll be fun!

Source: You want me to figure out who put out the flame?
Target: You want me to figure out who put out the flame?

Source: What I think doesn't matter. I'm just following orders, and right now those orders are to be ready.\n\nDame Falhut's really the one in charge out here. She's up at the castle's main gate.
Target: What I think doesn't matter. I'm just following orders, and right now those orders are to be ready.\n\nDame Falhut's really the one in charge out here. She's up at the castle's main gate.

Source: What would that entail?
Target: What would that entail?

Source: What will you do now?
Target: What will you do now?

Source: Where can I find this shrine?
Target: Where can I find this shrine?

Source: What do you need me to do?

Source: The exciting part! Gaze into the Eye and focus on the facets in the glass. Take a breath and try to unify the symbols into a single pattern. Eventually, you'll stop looking at the lens and start looking through it.\n\nWhy don't we just give it a try?
Target: The exciting part! Gaze into the Eye and focus on the facets in the glass. Take a breath and try to unify the symbols into a single pattern. Eventually, you'll stop looking at the lens and start looking through it.\n\nWhy don't we just give it a try?

Source: Doesn't matter. Light the brazier to begin the Rites of Praise and Scorn. Malacath will guide you through Hammer's Bypass and Temper's Fork, if you are worthy of his regard. \n\nVengeance, for Malacath. Promise me you'll light the pyre—swear it!
Target: 상관 없습니다. 화로에 불을 붙여서 찬양과 경멸의 의식을 시작하십시오. 당신이 자격이 있다면 말라카스께서 Hammer 's Bypass와 Temper 's Fork를 통해 당신을 인도할 것입니다.\n\n말라카스를 위해 복수해 주십시요. 장작에 불을 붙이겠다고 약속해 주십시요. 맹세해 주세요!

Source: An invention of our university's founder, Tjurhane Fyrre. It allows the wielder's mind to travel vast distances and find buried relics. Truths lost to history.\n\nGazing into the Eye requires both skill and talent. How talented are you, I wonder?
Target: An invention of our university's founder, Tjurhane Fyrre. It allows the wielder's mind to travel vast distances and find buried relics. Truths lost to history.\n\nGazing into the Eye requires both skill and talent. How talented are you, I wonder?

Source: Look for the mud huts. Don't ask for him by name, or he'll think you a debt collector.\n\nRemain discreet. If <<1>> found the scent of <<2>>, follow it until its end.
Target: Look for the mud huts. Don't ask for him by name, or he'll think you a debt collector.\n\nRemain discreet. If <<1>> found the scent of <<2>>, follow it until its end.

Source: Something that stalks the moonlit snows. It steals loved ones away without a sound.\n\nA couple folks sent letters saying they had new sightings. These old legs are much too ruined for travel now. Would you be willing to hear them out for some gold?
Target: Something that stalks the moonlit snows. It steals loved ones away without a sound.\n\nA couple folks sent letters saying they had new sightings. These old legs are much too ruined for travel now. Would you be willing to hear them out for some gold?

Source: What are you and your assistants doing out here?
Target: What are you and your assistants doing out here?

Source: <<1>> is in charge of the city's food stores. She tells me we're almost out of meat and we need more in a hurry. Hunt mammoths, bears … any big animal you can find.\n\nAlso, kill some of those damned poachers. Bagrugbesh can give you more details.
Target: <<1>>은 도시의 식료품점을 담당하고 있어. 그녀는 고기가 거의 다 떨어졌고 급히 많은 양이 필요하다고 요청했지. 맘모스, 곰 같은 커다란 동물이 보이면 사냥하도록 해.\n\n도한, 망할놈의 밀렵꾼 놈들 좀 죽여줘. Bagrugbesh가 자세한 이야기를 해 줄거야.

Source: What the Swords of Solitude needs is a group of volunteers with the guts to wade into a few of these harrowstorms and stop the accursed witch-work causing these fel winds to blow.
Target: What the Swords of Solitude needs is a group of volunteers with the guts to wade into a few of these harrowstorms and stop the accursed witch-work causing these fel winds to blow.

Source: He says he uncovered some Dwarf junk buried in the snow up north, and it led to something big. "Nyzchaleft," I think? Bah. Dwarf mischief.\n\nInvestigate the machines and take care of this thing he discovered. He's over there if you want more details.
Target: He says he uncovered some Dwarf junk buried in the snow up north, and it led to something big. "Nyzchaleft," I think? Bah. Dwarf mischief.\n\nInvestigate the machines and take care of this thing he discovered. He's over there if you want more details.

Source: I intended to! I hired this cart and everything. But as you can see, that didn't work out.\n\nMaybe I was foolish to try and do this on my own. I don't have a lot of field experience. Almost none. But you! You could handle this right? I'll pay you!
Target: I intended to! I hired this cart and everything. But as you can see, that didn't work out.\n\nMaybe I was foolish to try and do this on my own. I don't have a lot of field experience. Almost none. But you! You could handle this right? I'll pay you!

Source: Encourage them to leave, blue reed. How you do it is your concern. Then I fill your purse, yes?\n\nPerhaps you should pretend to consider a purchase. Or perhaps you should consider a purchase, hmm? Such prices, unheard of in all of Stormhold.
Target: Encourage them to leave, blue reed. How you do it is your concern. Then I fill your purse, yes?\n\nPerhaps you should pretend to consider a purchase. Or perhaps you should consider a purchase, hmm? Such prices, unheard of in all of Stormhold.

Source: At first? Robbery. But now they're abducting travelers and taking them off into the wilderness. That Imperial caravaneer over there, <<1>>, has leads on where. I'll mark the locations on your map.\n\nShe's also identified their leader, King-Chief Edu.
Target: 처음엔? 강도였습니다. 하지만 이젠 그들은 여행자들을 납치해 오지로 데려가고 있습니다. 저기 있는 임페리얼 대상단인 <<1>>가 어디에 있는지 단서를 가지고 있습니다. 당신의 지도에 위치를 표시해 놓겠습니다.\n\n그녀는 또한 그들의 우두머리인, 족장왕 에두가 있다는걸 확인 했습니다.

Source: <<1>> and I must rally the remnants of Stormhold's forces to <<A:2>>. If the skin-stealers took <<3>>, they'll know what he knew.\n\nRendezvous with our forces at <<A:2>>. We must learn what the Dominion plans for the <<A:4>>.
Target: <<1>> and I must rally the remnants of Stormhold's forces to <<A:2>>. If the skin-stealers took <<3>>, they'll know what he knew.\n\nRendezvous with our forces at <<A:2>>. We must learn what the Dominion plans for the <<A:4>>.

Source: This totem should do the trick—take it. <<1>> says it has the power to disperse pockets of corruption.\n\n<<2>> is behind this, I know it. When you eliminate the corruption, eliminate him too. Ushang might know more. He's just over there.
Target: This totem should do the trick—take it. <<1>> says it has the power to disperse pockets of corruption.\n\n<<2>> is behind this, I know it. When you eliminate the corruption, eliminate him too. Ushang might know more. He's just over there.

Source: Don't ask me. We're at a standstill as far as I'm concerned. I'm not even sure what's at stake—until I know more, we're hunkering down here.\n\nIndaenir's been running around though. He's probably got a plan, but you two are on your own for now.
Target: Don't ask me. We're at a standstill as far as I'm concerned. I'm not even sure what's at stake—until I know more, we're hunkering down here.\n\nIndaenir's been running around though. He's probably got a plan, but you two are on your own for now.

Source: Just that she was still having trouble convincing her father about the extent of the coven threat. And she seemed very interested in getting Fennorian to help you with that.\n\nI'm sure Fennorian will assist you in any way he can. He's good like that.
Target: Just that she was still having trouble convincing her father about the extent of the coven threat. And she seemed very interested in getting Fennorian to help you with that.\n\nI'm sure Fennorian will assist you in any way he can. He's good like that.

Source: You freed me from the Dominion's clutches before those skin-stealing milk drinkers could kill me and wear my face. Of course I could use your help.\n\nMeet my regiment at <<1>>. Keep your blades sharp. I'll find a way to turn you loose on the Dominion.
Target: You freed me from the Dominion's clutches before those skin-stealing milk drinkers could kill me and wear my face. Of course I could use your help.\n\nMeet my regiment at <<1>>. Keep your blades sharp. I'll find a way to turn you loose on the Dominion.

Source: A beast called Zandadunoz the Reborn. That name is well-earned. He just won't stay dead.\n\nThe worms have built a series of obelisks on the frontier. Examine these pillars and and kill any cultists you find. Talk to Lilyameh if you need some guidance.
Target: A beast called Zandadunoz the Reborn. That name is well-earned. He just won't stay dead.\n\nThe worms have built a series of obelisks on the frontier. Examine these pillars and and kill any cultists you find. Talk to Lilyameh if you need some guidance.

Source: Molag Bal has trapped me within a pillar of darkness infused with his own vile energy and powered by the Light of Meridia. That, however, will be his undoing!\n\nThe Light of Meridia can also banish this darkness, but you have to bring it to me.
Target: Molag Bal has trapped me within a pillar of darkness infused with his own vile energy and powered by the Light of Meridia. That, however, will be his undoing!\n\nThe Light of Meridia can also banish this darkness, but you have to bring it to me.

Source: Not specifically, but let me think …. Oh, yes, I remember! She wants to talk to you at the Lonely Troll before she pleads your case to High King Svargrim.\n\nThat's all I've got. Please let Fennorian know how helpful I was, if you would.
Target: Not specifically, but let me think …. Oh, yes, I remember! She wants to talk to you at the Lonely Troll before she pleads your case to High King Svargrim.\n\nThat's all I've got. Please let Fennorian know how helpful I was, if you would.

Source: Dreugh showed up in the middle of the battle and started slaughtering everyone.\n\nIf you want to pitch in, report to Captain Noris. He's the officer in charge here. He's encamped to the north.
Target: Dreugh showed up in the middle of the battle and started slaughtering everyone.\n\nIf you want to pitch in, report to Captain Noris. He's the officer in charge here. He's encamped to the north.

Source: Divided over the fate of our Hist tree. But tradition demands that you pass our trials and prove your worth before I reveal all of our secrets to you, outsider.\n\nPlease, head down this path to the city. I will follow you.
Target: Divided over the fate of our Hist tree. But tradition demands that you pass our trials and prove your worth before I reveal all of our secrets to you, outsider.\n\nPlease, head down this path to the city. I will follow you.

Source: The king himself has requested your presence at his private tavern here in Orsinium.\n\nYou must have made quite an impression! You'll have to share your secrets with me some time.
Target: 왕께선 직접 이곳 오시니움에 있는 자신의 술집에 당신이 참석하길 요청하셨습니다.\n\n당신이 정말 인상 깊었나보군요! 언젠간 저와 비밀을 공유해야 할 겁니다.

Source: The city's original name no longer matters. Now it is but the Hollow City. A perfect place to begin an assault on Molag Bal.\n\nThis city can be a tool, a weapon. Armor against the hazards of Coldharbour. It just needs life to fill it once more.
Target: The city's original name no longer matters. Now it is but the Hollow City. A perfect place to begin an assault on Molag Bal.\n\nThis city can be a tool, a weapon. Armor against the hazards of Coldharbour. It just needs life to fill it once more.

Source: Right now the Orcs are only hurling accusations, but soon they'll be throwing more than insults and that'll turn into a civil war that'll spill into our holds. We need to remove Skreg and provide proof that he wasn't worthy of being champion first.
Target: Right now the Orcs are only hurling accusations, but soon they'll be throwing more than insults and that'll turn into a civil war that'll spill into our holds. We need to remove Skreg and provide proof that he wasn't worthy of being champion first.

Source: In the throne room, up at the keep. Hopefully he won't be in too foul of a mood when you get there. \n\nHe seemed out of sorts when I told him this was the last message I was going to deliver. Either he finds something else for me to do or I'm leaving.
Target: In the throne room, up at the keep. Hopefully he won't be in too foul of a mood when you get there. \n\nHe seemed out of sorts when I told him this was the last message I was going to deliver. Either he finds something else for me to do or I'm leaving.

Source: And save those goats. <<1>> can't afford to pay otherwise. Werewolves should have the sense not to slaughter all their prey at once, so there's a good chance at least a few are still alive. Feed them these berries and they'll wander home, supposedly.
Target: And save those goats. <<1>> can't afford to pay otherwise. Werewolves should have the sense not to slaughter all their prey at once, so there's a good chance at least a few are still alive. Feed them these berries and they'll wander home, supposedly.

Source: Nonsense. The Vanguard is my priority right now. I'm sure one of your abilities can find ample employment elsewhere. \n\nIf you have further questions—and I'm sure you do—speak to my seneschal, <<1>>.
Target: Nonsense. The Vanguard is my priority right now. I'm sure one of your abilities can find ample employment elsewhere. \n\nIf you have further questions—and I'm sure you do—speak to my seneschal, <<1>>.

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: You seemed confident that Sun-in-Shadow would free you before. What happened?
Target: You seemed confident that Sun-in-Shadow would free you before. What happened?

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: The braziers atop the Xanmeers of First Light and Setting Sun? Light them as part of hatching ritual, and listen as you walk among the Dominion. See if they mean us harm.\n\nAlso, if she still lives, send <<1>> to me. I'll need her for the ritual.
Target: The braziers atop the Xanmeers of First Light and Setting Sun? Light them as part of hatching ritual, and listen as you walk among the Dominion. See if they mean us harm.\n\nAlso, if she still lives, send <<1>> to me. I'll need her for the ritual.

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: Long ago, before the Green Pact, the Standing Stones were used to protect the people from the aggression of the forest. \n\nIf we can activate the stones, it could prevent the trees from spreading the blight to anyone else.
Target: Long ago, before the Green Pact, the Standing Stones were used to protect the people from the aggression of the forest. \n\nIf we can activate the stones, it could prevent the trees from spreading the blight to anyone else.

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: <Accept the contract.>
Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: Fah! They're no good to me injured. But the Dominion lackeys are another matter.\n\nPut the fear of One-Eye and her crew into them. That should loosen some tongues. Then find out where our Khajiit is hiding.
Target: Fah! They're no good to me injured. But the Dominion lackeys are another matter.\n\nPut the fear of One-Eye and her crew into them. That should loosen some tongues. Then find out where our Khajiit is hiding.

Source: How could it not? The temple, the moot. This is the battle that tests our resolve. We need to stop Kurog. His good intentions have become twisted, corrupted.\n\nBesides, if Solgra doesn't live to refute Kurog's story, we'll all be branded as traitors.
Target: How could it not? The temple, the moot. This is the battle that tests our resolve. We need to stop Kurog. His good intentions have become twisted, corrupted.\n\nBesides, if Solgra doesn't live to refute Kurog's story, we'll all be branded as traitors.

Source: There should be two wardstones at the entrance, each attuned to a constellation. The Atronach and the Tower, if I recall. The key should allow you to disrupt those stones, and any others you encounter on your journey.\n\nThree guide your steps!
Target: There should be two wardstones at the entrance, each attuned to a constellation. The Atronach and the Tower, if I recall. The key should allow you to disrupt those stones, and any others you encounter on your journey.\n\nThree guide your steps!

Source: One other thing.\n\nThere's a woman here in the city—a Dragonguard warrior calling herself the "Drake of Blades." She's brought us some valuable intelligence, but she's clearly up to something. I don't like it. If you meet her, be watchful.
Target: One other thing.\n\nThere's a woman here in the city—a Dragonguard warrior calling herself the "Drake of Blades." She's brought us some valuable intelligence, but she's clearly up to something. I don't like it. If you meet her, be watchful.

Source: Go west, beyond the Moonless Walk. There, you shall find the Ayleid King held within a tower of darkness.\n\nVanus the Mage is somewhere in the eastern plane. His exact location is hidden from me.
Target: Go west, beyond the Moonless Walk. There, you shall find the Ayleid King held within a tower of darkness.\n\nVanus the Mage is somewhere in the eastern plane. His exact location is hidden from me.

Source: Me? Ha! This mind is for planning, not swordfighting and bloodletting. \n\nOh, and counting coins. I am very good at that. This plan is reasonable, no?
Target: Me? Ha! This mind is for planning, not swordfighting and bloodletting. \n\nOh, and counting coins. I am very good at that. This plan is reasonable, no?

Source: If he won't listen, she must. We Ashlanders just don't ignore the advice of our wise women. Our Ashkhan defying her wishes … it's wrong.\n\nPlease. If you can help, seek her north of the temple.
Target: If he won't listen, she must. We Ashlanders just don't ignore the advice of our wise women. Our Ashkhan defying her wishes … it's wrong.\n\nPlease. If you can help, seek her north of the temple.

Source: My people and even some enemies languish in the Daedra's Oblivion realm.\n\nThe raiders seized an Argonian gel called firesap. Find some. It should overheat the crystals and cause them to crack. Then you can return my people.
Target: My people and even some enemies languish in the Daedra's Oblivion realm.\n\nThe raiders seized an Argonian gel called firesap. Find some. It should overheat the crystals and cause them to crack. Then you can return my people.

Source: Ah—one more thing.\n\nThere is a woman here in the city—a Dragonguard warrior calling herself the "Drake of Blades." She has brought us valuable intelligence, but her motives are too murky for my liking. If you meet her, be watchful.
Target: Ah—one more thing.\n\nThere is a woman here in the city—a Dragonguard warrior calling herself the "Drake of Blades." She has brought us valuable intelligence, but her motives are too murky for my liking. If you meet her, be watchful.

Source: One of those Maulborn must have the key. \n\nAnd one more thing—one of them was carrying around a creepy Daedric book when they brought me in. They took it into the lower tunnels. If you get the book, I can use it to explain my absence.
Target: One of those Maulborn must have the key. \n\nAnd one more thing—one of them was carrying around a creepy Daedric book when they brought me in. They took it into the lower tunnels. If you get the book, I can use it to explain my absence.

Source: One last thing.\n\nThere's a woman here in the city—a Dragonguard warrior calling herself the "Drake of Blades." She's brought us some valuable intelligence, but she's up to some mischief, I know it. If you meet her, stay watchful.
Target: One last thing.\n\nThere's a woman here in the city—a Dragonguard warrior calling herself the "Drake of Blades." She's brought us some valuable intelligence, but she's up to some mischief, I know it. If you meet her, stay watchful.

Source: Jester Queen Ayrenn said the troupe would be moving on to Daggerfall and invited me to follow along. She mentioned I might be able to help Jester King Emeric as I helped her.
Target: Jester Queen Ayrenn said the troupe would be moving on to Daggerfall and invited me to follow along. She mentioned I might be able to help Jester King Emeric as I helped her.

Source: After helping Jester King Jorunn, he suggested I join the Festival of Fools in Vulkhel Guard and speak to Jester Queen Ayrenn.
Target: After helping Jester King Jorunn, he suggested I join the Festival of Fools in Vulkhel Guard and speak to Jester Queen Ayrenn.

Source: A few more moments—
Target: A few more moments—

Source: I'll return when I've won three matches.
Target: I'll return when I've won three matches.

Source: I'll return when I've participated in five matches.
Target: I'll return when I've participated in five matches.

Source: Oracles of Azura?
Target: Oracles of Azura?

Source: Fair enough. I'll meet Rhea in Wayrest.
Target: Fair enough. I'll meet Rhea in Wayrest.

Source: I heard them crying out in the darkness. The plague's taken them. They've … turned.\n\nThe wards. Concentrate on the wards. There're three of them. Smash them all.
Target: I heard them crying out in the darkness. The plague's taken them. They've … turned.\n\nThe wards. Concentrate on the wards. There're three of them. Smash them all.

Source: It's a reckless curiosity drives a person to look for cause in such things. Me, I'll take ignorance and a long, happy life in Marbruk or Woodhearth.\n\nBut if you got to know, you might talk to Breduin in his hut in town. He's staying, poor fool.
Target: It's a reckless curiosity drives a person to look for cause in such things. Me, I'll take ignorance and a long, happy life in Marbruk or Woodhearth.\n\nBut if you got to know, you might talk to Breduin in his hut in town. He's staying, poor fool.

Source: I gathered as many survivors as I could, but not everyone got out. Those monsters, the Vereansu, are tossing captives into the burning buildings.\n\nOur leader, <<1>>, rushed back in to search for survivors and try to protect the <<2>>. He needs help.
Target: I gathered as many survivors as I could, but not everyone got out. Those monsters, the Vereansu, are tossing captives into the burning buildings.\n\nOur leader, <<1>>, rushed back in to search for survivors and try to protect the <<2>>. He needs help.

Source: Before I give you the name, I would like to propose a challenge. An opportunity to demonstrate your prowess. Indulge me and I will reward you. \n\nMy challenge is, of course, a secondary concern. As long as the target dies, the Sacrament is fulfilled.
Target: 네게 이름을 주기 전에, 몇 가지 도전을 제안하지. 네 활약을 보여줄 기회다. 날 만족시키면 추가적인 보상을 약속하마.\n\n물론, 내 도전은 부차적인 것이니. 표적이 죽기만 하면 세례는 충분한 것으로 간주하겠다.

Source: What kind of help do you need?
Target: What kind of help do you need?

Source: Truly? Then we must find <<1>> and stop him from this madness.\n\nCrack open this camp. Pull any inklings of his methods like meat from the shell. I'll rally my soldiers and prepare to assault the ruins.
Target: Truly? Then we must find <<1>> and stop him from this madness.\n\nCrack open this camp. Pull any inklings of his methods like meat from the shell. I'll rally my soldiers and prepare to assault the ruins.

Source: I don't know, but when he came out from talking to our grandmaster, he was in charge. Our House Elves and slaves alike are terrified. \n\nIf you want to help, please speak with our grandmaster. Maybe he'll listen to a new voice.
Target: I don't know, but when he came out from talking to our grandmaster, he was in charge. Our House Elves and slaves alike are terrified. \n\nIf you want to help, please speak with our grandmaster. Maybe he'll listen to a new voice.

Source: Would you? With the mist returning to normal now, it might be easier to find her. That's what I hope, at least.
Target: Would you? With the mist returning to normal now, it might be easier to find her. That's what I hope, at least.

Source: I received a mysterious letter from an oracle of Azura named Rhea Opacarius. Some malevolent force conspires to destroy her order and, perhaps, all of Tamriel.
Target: I received a mysterious letter from an oracle of Azura named Rhea Opacarius. Some malevolent force conspires to destroy her order and, perhaps, all of Tamriel.

Source: It would ease my mind to know she's with the hero of <<1>>. \n\nThe Dominion camp atop this hill fell to the lamias. She went to scout the wreckage.
Target: It would ease my mind to know she's with the hero of <<1>>. \n\nThe Dominion camp atop this hill fell to the lamias. She went to scout the wreckage.

Source: I'll return when I've shown my contribution to my team.
Target: I'll return when I've shown my contribution to my team.

Source: That isn't a question we ask. Suffice to say, he offended someone enough to get them to perform the Black Sacrament. The Night Mother heard the prayer and now Jarol must die.\n\nThis is the task I have set before you.
Target: 그런건 중요한 게 아닐세. 그가 검은 세례의 제물로 선택될 만큼 우리의 심기를 건드렸다는 것만 알아두게. 나이트 마더께서 기도에 응하셨고 이제 재롤은 죽어야만 하네.\n\n이것이 자네가 끝마쳐야 하는 임무일세.

Source: What needs to be done to stop them?
Target: What needs to be done to stop them?

Source: Experiencing our curse uniquely suits you to deciding our fate.\n\nYou should hear the counsel of <<1>> and <<2>> before making your decision.
Target: Experiencing our curse uniquely suits you to deciding our fate.\n\nYou should hear the counsel of <<1>> and <<2>> before making your decision.

Source: I didn't until my sister Josseline joined them. She has no idea what Surus does to people.\n\nTake these notes and preach the word of Boethiah around town. After the Grand Chanter arrests you for heresy, my sister will see how he treats you and leave.
Target: I didn't until my sister Josseline joined them. She has no idea what Surus does to people.\n\nTake these notes and preach the word of Boethiah around town. After the Grand Chanter arrests you for heresy, my sister will see how he treats you and leave.

Source: Couldn't say. But the problem right now isn't the prince. It's the damn Blackroot Clan—cruel in life and downright vicious in death. We can't get through them.\n\nIndaenir seems to have some ideas, though. You want to help, you should talk to him.
Target: Couldn't say. But the problem right now isn't the prince. It's the damn Blackroot Clan—cruel in life and downright vicious in death. We can't get through them.\n\nIndaenir seems to have some ideas, though. You want to help, you should talk to him.

Source: What do you propose?
Target: What do you propose?

Source: Untie me so I can make a break for it! And free my guards. Their names were Nerys, Liam, Wilhem, and Gerren.\n\nI overheard a necromancer say geodes with souls are fragile, and would release them if broken. Please, set them free!
Target: Untie me so I can make a break for it! And free my guards. Their names were Nerys, Liam, Wilhem, and Gerren.\n\nI overheard a necromancer say geodes with souls are fragile, and would release them if broken. Please, set them free!

Source: So she hasn't shared her next plan with you?
Target: So she hasn't shared her next plan with you?

Source: The House Dunmer monks must understand we're not enemies. Take them a gift of herbs and potions from the supply in our camp. \n\nThe Ashkhan has warriors protecting it. Fight through them. Take the medicine. Deliver it to the temple. Can you do this?
Target: The House Dunmer monks must understand we're not enemies. Take them a gift of herbs and potions from the supply in our camp. \n\nThe Ashkhan has warriors protecting it. Fight through them. Take the medicine. Deliver it to the temple. Can you do this?

Source: Care to help me turn the tide on these crooks then? I happen to know that their swindler of a Dock Master doesn't trust his gold to Anvil's banks. \n\nIf you help me pay the fool out of his own pocket, you can keep the lion's share of the bounty.
Target:
그럼 내가 이 사기꾼들을 엿먹이는걸 좀 도와주세요. 제가 우연히 알게된 사실인데, 독마스터와 한 패인 그 사기꾼들은 앤빌 은행에 돈을 넣어두지 않는다고 하더군요.

만약 당신이 그걸 훔쳐서 저한테 다시 주고, 그걸로 그놈들을 엿먹일 수 있게 해주신다면 이 사자가 보상을 드리겠습니다.

Source: I'm not sure. The language of the sea confuses me.\n\nWe just need to charter a ship to Sentinel, but that disagreeable captain took the last of our gold. We want to work, but no one will hire us. Perhaps you could serve as our agent in this matter?
Target: 모르겠어. 바닷사람의 언어가 날 혼란스럽게 만들었어.\n\n센티넬에 가려면 배를 구해야 하지만, 그 선장은 우리의 마지막 남은 재산을 가지고 가버렸지. 일이라도 하고 싶지만, 우릴 고용하는 사람은 없어. 어떻게 하면 좋을까?

Source: Let's see—a half dozen wasp gizzards. But then you would have to get to my hut on the shore to make the concoction. I left my alchemy journal there.\n\nWhen it's made, toss the mixture onto the tree outside my hut. That will rile the wasps up!
Target: Let's see—a half dozen wasp gizzards. But then you would have to get to my hut on the shore to make the concoction. I left my alchemy journal there.\n\nWhen it's made, toss the mixture onto the tree outside my hut. That will rile the wasps up!

Source: It means "open" in my language. I used to speak so many languages, but I've forgotten most of them.\n\nThere's much I can't remember. Go, I'll be fine. I just need some time to rest.
Target: It means \\"open\"\" in my language. I used to speak so many languages
column4: but I've forgotten most of them.\n\nThere's much I can't remember. Go
column5: I'll be fine. I just need some time to rest."

Source: I thought I heard one of them calling out, but the ocean twists up sounds. If they're wounded or pinned down ….\n\nCould you keep an eye out for my soldiers? They answer to <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>>. Two of us can cover more ground.
Target: I thought I heard one of them calling out, but the ocean twists up sounds. If they're wounded or pinned down ….\n\nCould you keep an eye out for my soldiers? They answer to <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>>. Two of us can cover more ground.

Source: After helping King Emeric, he suggested I head to Ebonheart to join King Jorunn's royal roast.
Target: After helping King Emeric, he suggested I head to Ebonheart to join King Jorunn's royal roast.

Source: How can I help you reward people?
Target: How can I help you reward people?

Source: Anything I can do to help?
Target: Anything I can do to help?

Source: What happened at Tel Fyr?
Target: What happened at Tel Fyr?

Source: <<1>> has an old treaty with the Maormer. They claim the Dominion fleet intended to invade their home waters. It's a sticking point in the negotiations. <<2>> could use some help. Find him, give him this token. He'll know you are a friend.
Target: <<1>> has an old treaty with the Maormer. They claim the Dominion fleet intended to invade their home waters. It's a sticking point in the negotiations. <<2>> could use some help. Find him, give him this token. He'll know you are a friend.

Source: Exactly. So if you smash any spheres or spiders, take their resonators. You can bring them to me for study.\n\nWhile you're at it, destroy any repair stations you see. Then they can't make more resonators. All right?
Target: Exactly. So if you smash any spheres or spiders, take their resonators. You can bring them to me for study.\n\nWhile you're at it, destroy any repair stations you see. Then they can't make more resonators. All right?

Source: Patience, Zur. I'll explain everything.\n\nI am with the Mages Guild. We stepped through the portal and wound up in this Vile Laboratory. Daedra experimented on us. They merged our two souls. Now we're wasting away as this soul-meld kills us.
Target: Patience, Zur. I'll explain everything.\n\nI am with the Mages Guild. We stepped through the portal and wound up in this Vile Laboratory. Daedra experimented on us. They merged our two souls. Now we're wasting away as this soul-meld kills us.

Source: Two magical wards seal the temple, marked by emblems of a scorpion and a spider. If you can keep the undead away while I disrupt the wards, we can search for <<1>> together.\n\nHow about it?
Target: Two magical wards seal the temple, marked by emblems of a scorpion and a spider. If you can keep the undead away while I disrupt the wards, we can search for <<1>> together.\n\nHow about it?

Source: Yes. I think I'll stop by her house to check on her.
Target: Yes. I think I'll stop by her house to check on her.

Source: The medallions focus the power of the Tear of Saint Veloth. Wear one and the effects of the plague are slowed. \n\nWhen the Ashlanders attacked, the medallions were scattered. We have so few of them. They won't do anyone any good on these husks.
Target: The medallions focus the power of the Tear of Saint Veloth. Wear one and the effects of the plague are slowed. \n\nWhen the Ashlanders attacked, the medallions were scattered. We have so few of them. They won't do anyone any good on these husks.

Source: And why won't he evaporate me for delivering these mushrooms?
Target: And why won't he evaporate me for delivering these mushrooms?

Source: Nothing! There was never a reply.\n\nI'm leaving these swamps. I'm going to go to the drylands. This is my last letter to <<1>>. Will you deliver it to him? If not into his hands, then his grave. I fear the worst.
Target: Nothing! There was never a reply.\n\nI'm leaving these swamps. I'm going to go to the drylands. This is my last letter to <<1>>. Will you deliver it to him? If not into his hands, then his grave. I fear the worst.

Source: I don't know. The smell may have driven the beasts into a frenzy. \n\nPerhaps, if you'd be willing … would you burn these flowers at each shrine? If the Three respond, tell Disciple Sildras. Perhaps that will restore his faith.
Target: I don't know. The smell may have driven the beasts into a frenzy. \n\nPerhaps, if you'd be willing … would you burn these flowers at each shrine? If the Three respond, tell Disciple Sildras. Perhaps that will restore his faith.

Source: Soon, yes. First though, I must take proof of my find to the Temple in Satakalaam and ask the priests to ensure this is turned into a proper shrine.\n\nI wonder … would you consider taking word to her, telling Falisa I live, that I have succeeded?
Target: Soon, yes. First though, I must take proof of my find to the Temple in Satakalaam and ask the priests to ensure this is turned into a proper shrine.\n\nI wonder … would you consider taking word to her, telling Falisa I live, that I have succeeded?

Source: I hid in an offal pile. I thought I was doomed, but a Shadowscale named <<1>> found me and helped me escape. I don't know what happened to him after that. \n\nIf you want to help, go see him. He might still be there.
Target: I hid in an offal pile. I thought I was doomed, but a Shadowscale named <<1>> found me and helped me escape. I don't know what happened to him after that. \n\nIf you want to help, go see him. He might still be there.

Source: The wind has not whispered that to me. There have always been <<mz:1>>, but never this dangerous.\n\nMy mind would be eased to see travelers free of this threat. Life here is hard enough already.
Target: The wind has not whispered that to me. There have always been <<mz:1>>, but never this dangerous.\n\nMy mind would be eased to see travelers free of this threat. Life here is hard enough already.

Source: Now that you ask, I have a sack of fertilizer here for Skulreid Foxbite of Cropsford. It's no ordinary fertilizer, however. It's so fragrant, it's like having a bag of roses on your shoulder.\n\nWould you finish the delivery for me?
Target: Now that you ask, I have a sack of fertilizer here for Skulreid Foxbite of Cropsford. It's no ordinary fertilizer, however. It's so fragrant, it's like having a bag of roses on your shoulder.\n\nWould you finish the delivery for me?

Source: An Ayleid ruin. We don't really know what it was for.\n\nCaptain Ethrel and Sergeant Galandir took scouts to investigate, but they were captured. The Daedra are holding them for some kind of ritual. We need to save them.
Target: An Ayleid ruin. We don't really know what it was for.\n\nCaptain Ethrel and Sergeant Galandir took scouts to investigate, but they were captured. The Daedra are holding them for some kind of ritual. We need to save them.

Source: That's it. Just ensure the letter reaches Octavimus and we'll all be happy.
Target: That's it. Just ensure the letter reaches Octavimus and we'll all be happy.

Source: He didn't disturb the bodies. It's something else.\n\nI want to understand him, but he won't discuss it with me. He's set up camp not far from here. Perhaps there are some clues there.
Target: He didn't disturb the bodies. It's something else.\n\nI want to understand him, but he won't discuss it with me. He's set up camp not far from here. Perhaps there are some clues there.

Source: Just a small pouch of sand. Hisham is my old comrade. He will surely pay for the delivery.\n\nCropsford is far and far from here—southeast of Castle Alessia. Consider that, wayfarer.

Source: They stood watch over Ash Mountain for centuries. All we need to do is grab their attention again. Kill Daedra, take their hearts, then burn them at the ruin altars. That should draw them out.\n\nWalks-in-Ash is waiting for you at the top. Good luck!
Target: They stood watch over Ash Mountain for centuries. All we need to do is grab their attention again. Kill Daedra, take their hearts, then burn them at the ruin altars. That should draw them out.\n\nWalks-in-Ash is waiting for you at the top. Good luck!

Target: Oh, didn't I mention? It's none other than the self-proclaimed Provincial Governor of Anvil, the Pirate Queen Fortunata ap Dugal.\n\nI expect you to handle this like any other contract. Acquire your target, plan your attack, and make your kill.

Target: <Accept the contract.>

Source: I want to pretend I never read that journal, but I can't resist a mystery. The Black Dragon killed Lyra and destroyed my former Sanctuary, or Lyra is the Black Dragon. Either way, I need to know the truth.\n\nWill you come with me, Assassin?
Target: I want to pretend I never read that journal, but I can't resist a mystery. The Black Dragon killed Lyra and destroyed my former Sanctuary, or Lyra is the Black Dragon. Either way, I need to know the truth.\n\nWill you come with me, Assassin?

Source: Don't worry. I'll save the king.
Target: Don't worry. I'll save the king.

Source: The fat-bastard ogrims dragged away my friends. We joined the Guild together. It ain't right, them getting tortured by ogrims.\n\nYou rescue Sinfray, Borgath, and Vikord. I'll locate Overseer Aruz. Then you and me can deal with him, all permanent like.
Target: The fat-bastard ogrims dragged away my friends. We joined the Guild together. It ain't right, them getting tortured by ogrims.\n\nYou rescue Sinfray, Borgath, and Vikord. I'll locate Overseer Aruz. Then you and me can deal with him, all permanent like.

Source: One man hiding behind thick walls and guarded by a small army. \n\nTanek is in Kvatch, seeking a way for you to breach the Cathedral's defenses. Astara and the rest of your brethren will follow after you. Reach Artorius and kill well, Assassin.
Target: One man hiding behind thick walls and guarded by a small army. \n\nTanek is in Kvatch, seeking a way for you to breach the Cathedral's defenses. Astara and the rest of your brethren will follow after you. Reach Artorius and kill well, Assassin.

Source: Need to repair this Welkynd Stone next to me—it's the focus of a powerful binding spell.\n\nI think it contained the freed Daedra, and unfortunately, it seems our Goblin friends have broken it. They've made four of the pieces into totems.
Target: Need to repair this Welkynd Stone next to me—it's the focus of a powerful binding spell.\n\nI think it contained the freed Daedra, and unfortunately, it seems our Goblin friends have broken it. They've made four of the pieces into totems.

Source: I want you to follow Green-Venom-Tongue and make sure the deed is done. I don't doubt his loyalty, but they were friends once. If he falters in the slightest, it will be his blood that stains the ground.\n\nNo matter what, the Black Dragon must die.
Target: I want you to follow Green-Venom-Tongue and make sure the deed is done. I don't doubt his loyalty, but they were friends once. If he falters in the slightest, it will be his blood that stains the ground.\n\nNo matter what, the Black Dragon must die.

Source: Some sort of nature spirit. It entered the cave where the Great Tree's roots emerge, but something's wrong.\n\nI heard horrible noises inside the cave. The spirit cried out, as if in pain. The Great Tree will die if the spirit can't do its work!
Target: Some sort of nature spirit. It entered the cave where the Great Tree's roots emerge, but something's wrong.\n\nI heard horrible noises inside the cave. The spirit cried out, as if in pain. The Great Tree will die if the spirit can't do its work!

Source: Yes … at least the last few. They're Lion Guard, like me. Renard, Elise, Laroche. I saw them alive as I fled.\n\nI know Gaston. He thinks my people expendable. Please, you have to bring them back. Until they're safe, nobody gets the fragment I took.
Target: Yes … at least the last few. They're Lion Guard, like me. Renard, Elise, Laroche. I saw them alive as I fled.\n\nI know Gaston. He thinks my people expendable. Please, you have to bring them back. Until they're safe, nobody gets the fragment I took.

Source: She loves temples, but the trouble in Kvatch has made her avoid the big Cathedral. Lately she's been visiting the Great Chapel of Dibella in Anvil. I think the rituals soothe her.\n\nWill you come to Anvil and help me find Hildegard?
Target: She loves temples, but the trouble in Kvatch has made her avoid the big Cathedral. Lately she's been visiting the Great Chapel of Dibella in Anvil. I think the rituals soothe her.\n\nWill you come to Anvil and help me find Hildegard?

Source: Oh, but please! My Brielus is a fine and noble man. He'll be delighted to hear this news.\n\nIf you go to Cheydinhal, please let him know I will wait for him in Vlastarus, forever if need be!
Target: Oh, but please! My Brielus is a fine and noble man. He'll be delighted to hear this news.\n\nIf you go to Cheydinhal, please let him know I will wait for him in Vlastarus, forever if need be!

Source: My guards and my partner, <<1>>, were taken. Horrible men and skeletons attacked us … I think they're members of the Worm Cult!\n\nI got away, but I heard screams coming from their camp, just down the hill. Can you help me?
Target: My guards and my partner, <<1>>, were taken. Horrible men and skeletons attacked us … I think they're members of the Worm Cult!\n\nI got away, but I heard screams coming from their camp, just down the hill. Can you help me?

Source: Moon Hallowed. And right now it's just a suspicion between the two of us. We need you to go and find out. Head to the Moonlit Clearing, just north of Senalana. Speak to the priestess there and we'll know for sure.
Target: Moon Hallowed. And right now it's just a suspicion between the two of us. We need you to go and find out. Head to the Moonlit Clearing, just north of Senalana. Speak to the priestess there and we'll know for sure.

Source: He's selling secrets. Dominion secrets. His lovely little resort town is lousy with agents of the Ebonheart Pact and Daggerfall Covenant. \n\nI need to find proof, steal back what he's stolen, and take him out. Will you help me?
Target: He's selling secrets. Dominion secrets. His lovely little resort town is lousy with agents of the Ebonheart Pact and Daggerfall Covenant. \n\nI need to find proof, steal back what he's stolen, and take him out. Will you help me?

Source: What would that entail?
Target: What would that entail?

Source: You never heard of Tamriel's most elite guild of assassins? Rumor has it that if you take an innocent life and they notice, they'll offer you a place in the Dark Brotherhood. There, killers are free to pursue their true passion.\n\nThink about it.
Target: You never heard of Tamriel's most elite guild of assassins? Rumor has it that if you take an innocent life and they notice, they'll offer you a place in the Dark Brotherhood. There, killers are free to pursue their true passion.\n\nThink about it.

Source: At this point, I'm unsure if I should accept any food or drink you offer me.
Target: At this point, I'm unsure if I should accept any food or drink you offer me.

Source: Perhaps. We got scattered in the fray. <<1>> and half the squad are missing.\n\nI sent a scout to look for them, but she hasn't reported back. I hate to ask, but if you're going in there ….
Target: Perhaps. We got scattered in the fray. <<1>> and half the squad are missing.\n\nI sent a scout to look for them, but she hasn't reported back. I hate to ask, but if you're going in there ….

Target: What should I do?

Target: You think something is wrong with him?

Target: Who are you? How can you help?

Target: I don't know. When they attacked, it was a rout. We couldn't defend ourselves, but the Thalmor … it might be possible.\n\nThis is a lot to ask, but could you have a look? Maybe someone's still alive in there.

Target: [Take the book.]

Source: One of my clients is trying to develop a treatment, but she needs high-quality blood samples.\n\nSkooma addicts often gather in Moonlit Cove. I know it's macabre, but you could probably find a corpse or two worth examining there.
Target: One of my clients is trying to develop a treatment, but she needs high-quality blood samples.\n\nSkooma addicts often gather in Moonlit Cove. I know it's macabre, but you could probably find a corpse or two worth examining there.

Target: What's so important about Fort Amol?

Source: "We sent out the scouting party but no word as yet. Captain Gilame has been forced to engage the Dominion at Farwatch. Without scouting reports, we're fighting blind. Worse, the scouting party consisted of mainly new recruits. This is a disaster!"
Target: \\"We sent out the scouting party but no word as yet. Captain Gilame has been forced to engage the Dominion at Farwatch. Without scouting reports

Source: The damned Nords won't stay dead! They keep wandering out of the barrow, and that's just not right. We have no problem dealing with any draugr that get close to the village, but we won't enter a Nord barrow.\n\nI just hope the Dark Elf is all right.
Target: 이 빌어먹을 노드는 죽어서도 돌아다닐테지! 이것들은 계속해서 고분을 빠져 나오는데, 이건 옳지 않아. 우리는 마을 근처로 다가오는 드로거를 처리하는데 문제가 없긴하지만 , 노드의 고분안으로 들어가진 않을거야.\n\n난 그냥 그 다크 엘프가 무사했으면 좋겠어.

Source: For morale, mostly. The tower was lit when the war started; the townsfolk think our good luck is tied to it. They're pretty superstitious around here.\n\nWill you help us?
Target: For morale, mostly. The tower was lit when the war started; the townsfolk think our good luck is tied to it. They're pretty superstitious around here.\n\nWill you help us?

Source: The best stuff, I assure you! It contains—hey, nice try, but no way I'm going to reveal my secret recipe!\n\nUnfortunately, I seem to have misplaced my last three bottles of ingredients. Must have lost them while I was watching the sand-whales.
Target: The best stuff, I assure you! It contains—hey, nice try, but no way I'm going to reveal my secret recipe!\n\nUnfortunately, I seem to have misplaced my last three bottles of ingredients. Must have lost them while I was watching the sand-whales.

Source: Malacath alone knows why <<1>> ran off. Wounded pride sent her to <<2>>, no doubt.\n\nIdiot! The girl will end up as ogre dung or a spider hatchery.
Target: 왜 <<1>>가 도망쳤는지 말라카스님 혼자 알고 계실테지. 자존심이 상해 <<2>>에게 그녀를 보낸건 의심할 여지조차 없어.\n\n멍청이! 그 소녀는 결국 오거 똥이나 거미 부화장이 되면서 최후를 맞이하겠지.

Source: The Hedorans collected valuable items. The family no longer has any use for them, and I'd rather us have them than the bandits.\n\nI'd like you to investigate the Hedoran estate and bring back anything valuable you find.
Target: The Hedorans collected valuable items. The family no longer has any use for them, and I'd rather us have them than the bandits.\n\nI'd like you to investigate the Hedoran estate and bring back anything valuable you find.

Source: The cultists retreated after the initial assault; they came here to steal that scroll, I'm sure of it. But why? Have they set a trap for us? We must know before the chief decides to attack.
Target: The cultists retreated after the initial assault; they came here to steal that scroll, I'm sure of it. But why? Have they set a trap for us? We must know before the chief decides to attack.

Source: We ran in different directions once the cultists started chasing us. I lost sight of them while fleeing for my life!\n\nI ducked under here and have been hiding ever since. Could you look for my friends, please?
Target: We ran in different directions once the cultists started chasing us. I lost sight of them while fleeing for my life!\n\nI ducked under here and have been hiding ever since. Could you look for my friends, please?

Source: Really? You would help? You are too kind!\n\nThe ambassador's aide, Rulfala, said I need to collect delicious Orcish delicacies, but I can't leave the clanhold! If you could find these things, I can prepare a romantic meal and win Lazdutha's love.
Target: 정말? 도와주는거야? 넌 정말 친절하다니까!\n\n대사의 보좌관인 룰파라는 맛있는 오크들의 진미를 모아야한다고 했지만, 지금 난 부족들을 떠날 수가 없어! 네가 이걸 찾아준다면, 난 낭만적인 식사를 준비해 라즈두싸의 사랑을 쟁취할 수 있을 거야!

Source: "We're going to Del's Claim tonight. The old mine near South Beacon. They're going to kill the miners. I can't let them do that, can I? I have to stop them. Somehow. I love you, mother. Always know, I love you.\n\n- Vareldur"
Target: \\"We're going to Del's Claim tonight. The old mine near South Beacon. They're going to kill the miners. I can't let them do that

Source: Of course. We slaughtered most; the rest fled. They stole something from the chief, but we'll get it back.\n\nWe'll mop them up as soon as Chief Tazgol raises the army. You want to know more, ask Lambur.
Target: Of course. We slaughtered most; the rest fled. They stole something from the chief, but we'll get it back.\n\nWe'll mop them up as soon as Chief Tazgol raises the army. You want to know more, ask Lambur.
