Target: 네가 고려 해야할만한 문제라면 간악한 짐승, 살을 에는 듯한 바람, 떨어지는 얼음등이 있지.\n\n우리는 산을 등반하려고 세 번을 시도했는데, 각각의 실패는 이전의 실패보다 더 장관이었다. 만약 네가 관심이있다면, 레이디 로런트께선 도움이 필요할꺼다.

Source: We cannot bring violence to the spirits of our ancestors, who attack anyone trying to enter Moriseli.\n\nBut you are not of our tribe. You could activate the keystones and enter Moriseli. You could restore peace to our honored dead.
Target: We cannot bring violence to the spirits of our ancestors, who attack anyone trying to enter Moriseli.\n\nBut you are not of our tribe. You could activate the keystones and enter Moriseli. You could restore peace to our honored dead.

Source: The Shadow of Sotha Sil used a pool of darkness to escape the Incarnatorium.
Target: The Shadow of Sotha Sil used a pool of darkness to escape the Incarnatorium.

Source: I suppose I could acquire some additional pieces.
Target: I suppose I could acquire some additional pieces.

Source: I should find Curinure at the Mages Guild.
Target: I should find Curinure at the Mages Guild.

Source: Sure, a sub-contract, as it were. For a share of the gold, of course.\n\nMaybe you'll have better luck in there than we did. Or, at least, you won't have to deal with quite as many skeletons.
Target: 좋아요, 말하자면, 하청 계약이군요. 물론, 돈도 공평하게 배분하고요.\n\n어쩌면 당신은 우리보다 운이 좋을지도 몰라요. 아니면, 적어도, 당신은 스켈레톤을 좀 적게 다룰지도 모르는 일이겠죠.

Source: I'm an herbalist. I prepare an herbal remedy that maintains the health of my customers. The faster it's delivered, the greater its medicinal value.\n\nGet my produce to the people on this list before it spoils and I'll throw in something extra.
Target: I'm an herbalist. I prepare an herbal remedy that maintains the health of my customers. The faster it's delivered, the greater its medicinal value.\n\nGet my produce to the people on this list before it spoils and I'll throw in something extra.

Source: What did it tell you?
Target: What did it tell you?

Source: Sounds good, let's talk about the Fighters Guild.
Target: Sounds good, let's talk about the Fighters Guild.

Source: It's a good thing I like you, because the last person who asked me these sorts of questions had the curiosity beaten out of him!\n\nBut I don't want to fight with you. That's not why I called you here. Are you ready to listen?
Target: 내가 너를 좋아해서 다행이야, 왜냐하면 내게 이런 질문을 한 마지막 사람의 궁금증을 없애버렸거든!\n\n하지만 나는 너와 싸우고 싶지 않다네. 그래서 널 부른게 아니야. 이야기를 들을 준비는 되었나?

Source: The rules are simple: win or die. Enter each arena, defeat all opponents, then move on to the next. \n\nSurvive them all, and I'll offer you a place in my officer corps. So—interested? Or would you rather just return to Tamriel and fight mudcrabs?
Target: The rules are simple: win or die. Enter each arena, defeat all opponents, then move on to the next. \n\nSurvive them all, and I'll offer you a place in my officer corps. So—interested? Or would you rather just return to Tamriel and fight mudcrabs?

Source: I can't get close enough to kill it—the filthy thing's too wary. But Chef Amadour feeds it. Maybe if you got some of its food, I could add a special ingredient.\n\nPlease go ask the chef. His house is just up the hill.
Target: I can't get close enough to kill it—the filthy thing's too wary. But Chef Amadour feeds it. Maybe if you got some of its food, I could add a special ingredient.\n\nPlease go ask the chef. His house is just up the hill.

Source: I was in a hurry. I had … an appointment … I had to keep.\n\nAnyway, could you help me? I'm ruined without my sewing box, silken threads, and book of patterns. Gather them and meet me on the other side of the pass. I'll take the long way around.
Target: I was in a hurry. I had … an appointment … I had to keep.\n\nAnyway, could you help me? I'm ruined without my sewing box, silken threads, and book of patterns. Gather them and meet me on the other side of the pass. I'll take the long way around.

Source: There's a chest hidden by the waterfall just northeast of town. Would you take some of these books and place them in the chest?
Target: There's a chest hidden by the waterfall just northeast of town. Would you take some of these books and place them in the chest?

Source: You'd do that? Murukh took two hunters and went after Zubesha and Thereg, but we're all tired and not used to being out on our own. \n\nIf you can kill the Riekr chief and acquire his totem, I'll be able to save face with the clan elders.
Target: 정말 도와주는거야? 무룩은 두 명의 사냥꾼을 데리고 주베샤와 더렉을 뒤쫓아갔지만, 우리 모두 지치고 우리끼리 행동하는건 익숙치가 않아.\n\n리클 족장을 죽이고 그의 토템을 얻을 수 있다면, 부족 장로들한테서 체면을 세울 수 있을거야.

Source: None to be found. Black Heights is a spotless community. You tell that to that cantor if you see her too. Any trouble followed her here.
Target: None to be found. Black Heights is a spotless community. You tell that to that cantor if you see her too. Any trouble followed her here.

Target: Anything else I need to do?

Source: High King Emeric said I could trust you.
Target: High King Emeric said I could trust you.

Target: Magical gunk?

Target: Sai Sahan seemed eager to talk to you and Nahfahlaar. I'd suggest you go to Nahfahlaar's Chamber and poke your nose in.

Target: Divayth Fyr?

Target: What can I do to help?

Target: Can I help? What do you need?

Target: Who are these intruders?

Source: Trinimac smiles upon us then! My son, King Kurog, has already traveled to Frostbreak Fortress to deal with Warlord Ice-Heart directly. Without a strong leader, the Winterborn threat will fade away.\n\nYou must go and tell the king about the supplies.
Target: 트리니막님께서 우리에게 미소짓는 군요. 내 아들 쿠로그 왕이 이미 전쟁군주 얼음 심장을 직접 상대하기위해 위해 서리붕괴 요새로 향했습니다. 강한 지도자가 없으면 윈터본의 위협이 사라질 것입니다.\n\n당신은 가서 왕에게 물품에 관해 알려야합니다.

Source: His magic enabled him to pass the spirits undetected. I suspect he looks to reach the inner ruins. Seek him near the doorway, beyond the fields where the dead roam.
Target: His magic enabled him to pass the spirits undetected. I suspect he looks to reach the inner ruins. Seek him near the doorway, beyond the fields where the dead roam.

Source: Help me track down the coven and figure out their ultimate plan. Between the two of us, we can cover more ground and determine the full extent of this threat.\n\nAs long as the magic provided by Jorunn's wizards works as promised, that is.
Target: Help me track down the coven and figure out their ultimate plan. Between the two of us, we can cover more ground and determine the full extent of this threat.\n\nAs long as the magic provided by Jorunn's wizards works as promised, that is.

Target: What's this about?

Source: Exactly! Oh, you meant … ah.\n\nListen, my father is Morkul's chief. If you help me find my clan's lost forge-hammer, I'll make sure you're rewarded. Deal?
Target: 정확해! 오, 네 말은 그러니까 ... 어.\n\n들어봐, 내 아빠는 모쿨의 족장이야. 만약 네가 우리 부족의 잃어버린 대장간-망치를 찾는데 도움을 준다면, 그에 맞는 보상을 너한테 꼭 줄게. 어때?

Source: Do you think the defenses might slow the Shadow down?
Target: Do you think the defenses might slow the Shadow down?

Source: In <<1>>, not too far. Saw it on the big one with the most dung smeared on him. Might be the chief?\n\nGrandfather used to stamp his name on his armor. Should say "Corgrak" inside.
Target: <<1>>에서 그리 멀진 않습니다. 가장 배설물이 많이 묻어있는 커다란 놈 한명을 봤었습니다. 아마도 대장 일겁니다?\n\n할아버지께선 자신의 이름이 찍힌 방어구를 사용 했었습니다. 안에 \\"크로그락\"\"이라 써져 있을겁니다."

Source: Oh, I'll make you a list. There's all sorts of parts that are useful in alchemy and what have you.\n\nYou can start with something easy while I write this up. I need you to get me some Dragon spit.
Target: Oh, I'll make you a list. There's all sorts of parts that are useful in alchemy and what have you.\n\nYou can start with something easy while I write this up. I need you to get me some Dragon spit.

Source: What should I tell him?
Target: What should I tell him?

Source: And you haven't gone to look for her because …?
Target: And you haven't gone to look for her because …?

Source: Can I go in?
Target: Can I go in?

Source: The king's hearth-wife is holding a competition to celebrate Orc culture. Without my assistant, I can't finish my classic Orc recipes.\n\nUnless you'd care to make some coin? If you're interested, I can get you a list of ingredients.
Target: The king's hearth-wife is holding a competition to celebrate Orc culture. Without my assistant, I can't finish my classic Orc recipes.\n\nUnless you'd care to make some coin? If you're interested, I can get you a list of ingredients.

Source: Yes … at least this is what <<1>> tells everyone.\n\nHe sells artifacts, from secret places. Very secret! You should hurry! They sell like sweetmeats when the moons are full! Do not be late!
Target: Yes … at least this is what <<1>> tells everyone.\n\nHe sells artifacts, from secret places. Very secret! You should hurry! They sell like sweetmeats when the moons are full! Do not be late!

Source: You don't fear death.\n\nGood. We could well use one such as yourself. Push the lamias out of this area and we might gain some traction on this damned beach.
Target: You don't fear death.\n\nGood. We could well use one such as yourself. Push the lamias out of this area and we might gain some traction on this damned beach.

Source: If Vijari is not yet lost to the Great Darkness, then there is hope, but exorcising dro-m'Athra is risky, as you know. The Bent Cats will do all they can to silence Adara'hai's song or twist it to their tune.\n\nShe brought no sharp-claws on this trip.
Target: If Vijari is not yet lost to the Great Darkness, then there is hope, but exorcising dro-m'Athra is risky, as you know. The Bent Cats will do all they can to silence Adara'hai's song or twist it to their tune.\n\nShe brought no sharp-claws on this trip.

Source: The Daggers! They're out gathering … information … about the harpies. Know your enemy and all that.\n\nYou'll get paid once I have enough to …  um … complete my research. Take this Dagger with you. He knows what to do.
Target: The Daggers! They're out gathering … information … about the harpies. Know your enemy and all that.\n\nYou'll get paid once I have enough to …  um … complete my research. Take this Dagger with you. He knows what to do.

Source: Only that she's waiting for you in the city. At the Fighters Guild. Something to do with a plot that threatens not only Skyrim, but potentially all of Tamriel.\n\nWill you go talk to the Skald-King's agent?
Target: Only that she's waiting for you in the city. At the Fighters Guild. Something to do with a plot that threatens not only Skyrim, but potentially all of Tamriel.\n\nWill you go talk to the Skald-King's agent?

Source: Bazrag wants to start a war, then damn it all to Oblivion, we have to stop him!\n\nHis forces are powerful enough to overwhelm the lesser clans. And he's no slouch when it comes to fighting, either. If he were to make a challenge for the throne ….
Target: Bazrag wants to start a war, then damn it all to Oblivion, we have to stop him!\n\nHis forces are powerful enough to overwhelm the lesser clans. And he's no slouch when it comes to fighting, either. If he were to make a challenge for the throne ….

Source: You must get the Claw, take it somewhere safe. You'll need the blessings of our high priests to see you safely through. I think the Stonefire have taken them prisoner. Seek them out in the shrines east and west of the main temple.
Target: You must get the Claw, take it somewhere safe. You'll need the blessings of our high priests to see you safely through. I think the Stonefire have taken them prisoner. Seek them out in the shrines east and west of the main temple.

Source: Apprentice? What is this place?
Target: Apprentice? What is this place?

Source: Why are they opposed to Queen Ayrenn?
Target: Why are they opposed to Queen Ayrenn?

Source: Do I have a choice?
Target: Do I have a choice?

Source: Why the rush?
Target: Why the rush?

Source: <<1>> swears this is <<2>>'s tomb! Orc stone in Orc lands, honoring the murderer of Wrothgar's greatest hero? Preposterous!
Target: <<1>>는 이 무덤이<<2>>의 무덤이라며 맹세하고 있습니다! 오크의 땅에서 오크의 건축물로 로스가의 가장 위대한 영웅을 살해한 자를 기른다고요? 가당치도 않군요!

Source: Your people are under attack right now?
Target: Your people are under attack right now?

Source: And cultists are stealing these memories?
Target: And cultists are stealing these memories?

Source: You are … most gracious. I would be grateful. \n\nYou could rescue the Orcish and Khajiiti leaders—they're all that's left of their villages. Tell them I have what we need to escape. They'll understand.
Target: You are … most gracious. I would be grateful. \n\nYou could rescue the Orcish and Khajiiti leaders—they're all that's left of their villages. Tell them I have what we need to escape. They'll understand.

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Source: Help! Yes! There are three tears, holes in the world where Tamriel is falling into Oblivion. There's a tear in each village.\n\nThis one can seal the tears, but fighting is beyond me. If you can handle the Daedra, this one might get some work done!
Target: Help! Yes! There are three tears, holes in the world where Tamriel is falling into Oblivion. There's a tear in each village.\n\nThis one can seal the tears, but fighting is beyond me. If you can handle the Daedra, this one might get some work done!

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Source: I don't know! They weren't exactly explaining themselves as they went along. Their leader called himself Glothun the Recruiter. He said we'd all be true believers in no time.\n\nI'm afraid he's going to hurt Shalda and the others. I feel so helpless.
Target: 저도 몰라요! 그들은 가는 동안 자신들을 뭐라 정확히 설명한다거나 하는건 없었어요. 그들의 리더는 자신을 글루썬 리쿠르터라고 소개 했습니다. 그는 우리 모두가 곧 진정한 신자가 될 것이라고 말했습니다.\n\n전 그가 샬다와 다른이들을 해칠까봐 두려워요. 전 너무 무력 합니다.

Source: The talking? Yes, that's very unusual.
Target: The talking? Yes, that's very unusual.

Source: Ah, outsider, my apologies. The king's mood has set everyone on edge. You could literally cut the tension in the court with a knife, and I fear it will get worse before it gets better.\n\nGo. Talk to the king. Perhaps you can raise his low spirits.
Target: Ah, outsider, my apologies. The king's mood has set everyone on edge. You could literally cut the tension in the court with a knife, and I fear it will get worse before it gets better.\n\nGo. Talk to the king. Perhaps you can raise his low spirits.

Source: There's a sky-key in the Sea Vipers' camp. You'll need it to enter the ruins. Take it from them and meet with <<1>> at the ruins entrance.\n\nIf the Sea Vipers take the sphere, they'll wreak havok up and down the coast. They must not succeed.
Target: There's a sky-key in the Sea Vipers' camp. You'll need it to enter the ruins. Take it from them and meet with <<1>> at the ruins entrance.\n\nIf the Sea Vipers take the sphere, they'll wreak havok up and down the coast. They must not succeed.

Source: Magic. Dark magic! The guards were dead before we could drive him … it off. It fled north. I think it's heading toward the March. You must find him! Stand back. I can cast a small spell … find where he's headed.
Target: Magic. Dark magic! The guards were dead before we could drive him … it off. It fled north. I think it's heading toward the March. You must find him! Stand back. I can cast a small spell … find where he's headed.

Source: He decided to rebuild one of those Dwarven sphere things. And, of course, he had to make alterations. Nothing's ever good enough as it is for my brother!\n\nThe sphere went berserk and knocked me out. And now Raynor's missing! This is bad, really bad.
Target: He decided to rebuild one of those Dwarven sphere things. And, of course, he had to make alterations. Nothing's ever good enough as it is for my brother!\n\nThe sphere went berserk and knocked me out. And now Raynor's missing! This is bad, really bad.

Source: I am no longer hearth-wife of Shatul. My husband's life was stolen from me by his hunt-wife … my own clan-sister.\n\nI want justice.
Target: 나는 더이상 샤툴의 난로 부인이 아니다. 내 남편의 목숨은 그의 사냥 부인 ... 내 부족의 동생에게 빼앗기고 말았다.\n\n나는 정의를 원해.

Source: I haven't a clue … and I don't have time to worry about it. We need to focus on the living, not the dead. \n\nMane Akkhuz-ri and several soldiers are stranded in the old merchant tunnel up the northern path. Think you could get to them?
Target: I haven't a clue … and I don't have time to worry about it. We need to focus on the living, not the dead. \n\nMane Akkhuz-ri and several soldiers are stranded in the old merchant tunnel up the northern path. Think you could get to them?

Source: Strong talk; prove it. I bet my axe that any of my hunters could best you in a duel.
Target: Strong talk; prove it. I bet my axe that any of my hunters could best you in a duel.

Source: What's happening at Hel Ra Citadel?
Target: What's happening at Hel Ra Citadel?

Source: Kyne's Breath?
Target: Kyne's Breath?

Source: The Undaunted? What's that?
Target: The Undaunted? What's that?

Source: Burn these herbs at each shrine. You will receive a vision of things to come. \n\nI will be in my longhouse, should you have questions.
Target: Burn these herbs at each shrine. You will receive a vision of things to come. \n\nI will be in my longhouse, should you have questions.

Source: Gone! <<1>> was a fool to trust him. This one remembers he mentioned his "camp." Why would a traveler have a camp, unless he was a bandit?\n\nPlease, free <<1>>! She has nowhere else to turn.
Target: Gone! <<1>> was a fool to trust him. This one remembers he mentioned his "camp." Why would a traveler have a camp, unless he was a bandit?\n\nPlease, free <<1>>! She has nowhere else to turn.

Source: Find <<1>>. Let him know we could use some reinforcements for the perimeter here, and then do whatever he asks.\n\nWe're going to be fine here. I know it.
Target: Find <<1>>. Let him know we could use some reinforcements for the perimeter here, and then do whatever he asks.\n\nWe're going to be fine here. I know it.

Source:
"Entry 299
All that work for an ugly mug?

"Entry 300
No fence will touch this! Need to set up a meet with <<1>> at the Greedy Gut. She'll buy anything. Stashing this north of <<2>> until things settle.

"X = aqueduct legs, narrow tree, gray serpent"
Target:
"Entry 299
All that work for an ugly mug?

"Entry 300
No fence will touch this! Need to set up a meet with <<1>> at the Greedy Gut. She'll buy anything. Stashing this north of <<2>> until things settle.

"X = aqueduct legs, narrow tree, gray serpent"

Source: She and a few of our bravest warriors have gone ahead into the city. They're trying to stem the tide of Daedra, ease up the pressure on our troops here. If you will, Hallowed? I'm sure she'd appreciate the help.
Target: She and a few of our bravest warriors have gone ahead into the city. They're trying to stem the tide of Daedra, ease up the pressure on our troops here. If you will, Hallowed? I'm sure she'd appreciate the help.

Source: You help them finish the job! Really, are we speaking the same language?\n\nI'll even give you an assistant. One of the Daggers who actually managed to find his way back to camp. He can fill you in on all the details. Why are you still standing here?
Target: You help them finish the job! Really, are we speaking the same language?\n\nI'll even give you an assistant. One of the Daggers who actually managed to find his way back to camp. He can fill you in on all the details. Why are you still standing here?

Source: What can I do to help?
Target: What can I do to help?

Source: Necromancers often brand skeletons to bind them to a specific task. In this case, digging.\n\nIf you can steal a Daedric Brand and a chapel key from one of these cultists, we might be able to discover what Molag Bal and his skeletons are digging for.
Target: Necromancers often brand skeletons to bind them to a specific task. In this case, digging.\n\nIf you can steal a Daedric Brand and a chapel key from one of these cultists, we might be able to discover what Molag Bal and his skeletons are digging for.

Source: Well, I need you to go and find them. You can take the one Dagger who managed to find his way back to camp with you. He can fill you in on the details.\n\nI'd send my guards, but then they wouldn't be protecting me. I'm sure you understand.
Target: Well, I need you to go and find them. You can take the one Dagger who managed to find his way back to camp with you. He can fill you in on the details.\n\nI'd send my guards, but then they wouldn't be protecting me. I'm sure you understand.

Source: Really. I'm here to help.
Target: Really. I'm here to help.

Source: The soldiers placed guards at all the exits, even the back one. Damned if I know how they found out about that.\n\nThe soldiers won't let anyone in until they've finished the "king's work," whatever that is. Bunch of stiff boots, the lot of them!
Target: The soldiers placed guards at all the exits, even the back one. Damned if I know how they found out about that.\n\nThe soldiers won't let anyone in until they've finished the "king's work," whatever that is. Bunch of stiff boots, the lot of them!

Source: My son, At'avar was one of those I left here. My friends Faulor and Mereel can take care of themselves, but At'avar is still young. I have to make sure he's all right, and I cannot make it through these bandits on my own. Please, will you help me?
Target: My son, At'avar was one of those I left here. My friends Faulor and Mereel can take care of themselves, but At'avar is still young. I have to make sure he's all right, and I cannot make it through these bandits on my own. Please, will you help me?

Source: "For more details and to obtain a list of desired relics, inquire with Curator Umutha at the House of Orsimer Glories in the city of Orsinium."
Target: "For more details and to obtain a list of desired relics, inquire with Curator Umutha at the House of Orsimer Glories in the city of Orsinium."

Source: Please talk to <<1>>. I begged her to return my lute so I might earn the coin to pay her, but she refused to give it back.\n\nShe suggested another game of riddles, but I have nothing left to gamble.
Target: Please talk to <<1>>. I begged her to return my lute so I might earn the coin to pay her, but she refused to give it back.\n\nShe suggested another game of riddles, but I have nothing left to gamble.

Source: Due to a clerical error, the Empire sent poison downriver in a trash shipment. Certain people feel we are responsible.\n\nSloshing about in the muck is beneath me, but you don't seem to mind. How about it? Solid Imperial coin for cleaning up this mess?
Target: Due to a clerical error, the Empire sent poison downriver in a trash shipment. Certain people feel we are responsible.\n\nSloshing about in the muck is beneath me, but you don't seem to mind. How about it? Solid Imperial coin for cleaning up this mess?

Source: Of course! But before I ask you to go traipse around in search of historic treasures, why don't you take this downstairs and put it on display?\n\nIt's the Agra Crun, the blood shield. It was recently donated to the museum by an anonymous adventurer.
Target: 당연하죠! 하지만 제가 당신에게 역사적인 보물들을 찾아 헤매라고 부탁하기 전에, 이것을 아래층으로 가지고 가서 전시해 보는 게 어때요?\n\n이건 아그라 크런, 피의 방패이죠. 그것은 최근에 익명의 모험가에 의해 박물관에 기증되었습니다.

Source: I boasted I'd hunt Shadowfen, collecting ingredients from exotic animals: an alit's heart, a kagouti's ribs, eggs of a giant wasp, and delicious mudcrab claw meat. I'd meet him in Hissmir and prepare a feast to prove it.\n\nBut I can't hunt!
Target: I boasted I'd hunt Shadowfen, collecting ingredients from exotic animals: an alit's heart, a kagouti's ribs, eggs of a giant wasp, and delicious mudcrab claw meat. I'd meet him in Hissmir and prepare a feast to prove it.\n\nBut I can't hunt!

Source: That sounds useful. Go ahead.
Target: That sounds useful. Go ahead.

Source: Calm down, soldier. Did you see where they took him?
Target: Calm down, soldier. Did you see where they took him?

Source: You want to discuss geography? Now? My wife is missing! We need to find Lady Sovelle!\n\nShe was helping people off one of the wrecks, the other survivors. Captain Henrisa won't risk any more sailors, but perhaps you could search the ice for me?
Target: 너는 지리에 대해 의논하고 싶은건가? 지금? 내 아내가 실종됬어! 우리는 레이디 소우벨을 찾아야해!\n\n그녀는 난파선들 중 한 곳에서, 다른 생존자들을 구출하고 있었다. 헨라이사 선장은 더이상 선원들에게 부담을 안줄려하지만, 너라면 날 위해 빙판을 수색해줄수 있겠지?

Source: If you are a true warrior, go to the arena. Kill their gladiators. Slay their stupid beasts. Put on a show! Do this, and The Rat will tell you a secret about Molag Bal's plots. It's one you won't want to miss.\n\nThe Rat is waiting. Start killing!
Target: 네가 진정한 전사라면 투기장으로 가. 검투사들을 죽여. 그들의 멍청한 짐승들도 죽이고. 공연을 보여줘! 그러면 쥐가 너에게 몰라그 발의 음모에 대한 비밀을 알려줄 거야. 놓치고 싶지 않을걸?\n\n쥐가 기다리고 있어. 어서 죽여!

Source: How could it not? The temple, the moot. Those are the fires that will test our mettle. We'll either come out stronger or be consumed in the flames.\n\nNow go help Solgra!
Target: How could it not? The temple, the moot. Those are the fires that will test our mettle. We'll either come out stronger or be consumed in the flames.\n\nNow go help Solgra!

Source: This is going to sound stupid. Truthfully, it is stupid, but I don't pick our allies. I found a rodent with a map tied to its tail—a message from that vagrant, The Rat. He's apparently left us an urgent letter out in the sewer. Can you find it?
Target: This is going to sound stupid. Truthfully, it is stupid, but I don't pick our allies. I found a rodent with a map tied to its tail—a message from that vagrant, The Rat. He's apparently left us an urgent letter out in the sewer. Can you find it?

Source: A squad of Lion Guard soldiers headed north to track him down. There's been no word from them, but who knows what was lost in all this werewolf nonsense.\n\nThat's as good a place as any to start. Maybe they found something.
Target: A squad of Lion Guard soldiers headed north to track him down. There's been no word from them, but who knows what was lost in all this werewolf nonsense.\n\nThat's as good a place as any to start. Maybe they found something.

Source: <<1>>'s bear—<<2>>—was a mountain among hills. When <<1>> died, Torug entombed her remains in a cave long thought lost. Until now, according to this report!\n\nSo? Will you retrieve <<Cz:3>> for the House of Orsimer Glories?
Target: <<1>>'s bear—<<2>>—was a mountain among hills. When <<1>> died, Torug entombed her remains in a cave long thought lost. Until now, according to this report!\n\nSo? Will you retrieve <<Cz:3>> for the House of Orsimer Glories?

Source: Not yet. Molag Bal obviously knows his value. They don't keep him in one place for long.\n\nDaedra have been torturing the city's clergy near the shrines to the Eight. We should split up and free these priests. Hopefully Egnatius will be among them.
Target: 아직 몰라요. 몰라그 발은 분명히 그 사람의 가치를 알고 있어요. 한 곳에 오래 머무르게 하질 않고 있거든요.\n\n데이드라는 여덟 디바인의 성소 근처에서 도시의 사제들을 고문하고 있어요. 우린 따로 움직이면서 그 사제들을 풀어줘야 해요. 에그나티우스가 그 사이에 있길 바라보죠.

Source: I want you to find <<A:1>> and take it from this place. If it's never found, there is no Vengeful March. My tribe returns to the Reach, the strongholds remain standing … we both win.
Target: 나는 이 곳에서 <<A:1>> 를 찾아 너가 가져가길 원한다. 만약 그걸 찾지 못한다면, 복수심에 불타는 행진을 하지 않겠지. 내 부족은 다시 리치에게로 돌아가고, 요새는 멀쩡히 있겠지 ... 우리 둘다 이기는것이다.

Source: Scavenge what you can from the ruins. Townsfolk left everything behind when the Dremora attacked.\n\nIf you can't find bandages, linens or clothing will do. Here's a jug for water—you can fill it from a well in town.
Target: Scavenge what you can from the ruins. Townsfolk left everything behind when the Dremora attacked.\n\nIf you can't find bandages, linens or clothing will do. Here's a jug for water—you can fill it from a well in town.

Source: You've seen the big building that still flies Imperial colors, right? That's us … at least, the eight of us that remain. It's been a tough few months.\n\nI don't care which banner you fight for. We need your help. At least talk to Captain Caudex.
Target: You've seen the big building that still flies Imperial colors, right? That's us … at least, the eight of us that remain. It's been a tough few months.\n\nI don't care which banner you fight for. We need your help. At least talk to Captain Caudex.

Source: It is because you are not of our clan that she might listen to you. If she departs without the blessing of the clan, she will be an exile. We cannot lose our only daughter, nor is Lokra ready to face the life of the clanless.
Target: It is because you are not of our clan that she might listen to you. If she departs without the blessing of the clan, she will be an exile. We cannot lose our only daughter, nor is Lokra ready to face the life of the clanless.

Source: In light of all the lives lost, it may seem trivial, but I spent a month's wages on the pendant. It was to be a betrothal gift for my lovely Alani. Thoughts of her beauty helped me survive this terrible disaster.\n\nFind it, and I will be in your debt.
Target: 잃어 버린 지난 날에 비추어 본다면, 사소하게 보일진 몰라도, 내 한달 치 임금을 그 펜던트에 썼다. 내 사랑 알라니에게 청혼할때 줄려고 산 펜던트이지. 그녀의 아름다움이 나를 이 끔찍한 재앙에서 구해낸것임에 분명하다고 난 생각하고 있어.\n\n그걸 찾아줘, 네게 빚은 꼭 갚도록 할게.

Source: This place crawls with Fenlords' servants, left behind when they created the <<1>>.\n\n<<2>> came here looking for it, but did not expect so much resistance. You will help, yes? <<2>> will make it worth your while!
Target: This place crawls with Fenlords' servants, left behind when they created the <<1>>.\n\n<<2>> came here looking for it, but did not expect so much resistance. You will help, yes? <<2>> will make it worth your while!

Source: <Keep reading>
Target: <Keep reading>

Source: Why don't the Clockwork Apostles just seal the portal?
Target: Why don't the Clockwork Apostles just seal the portal?

Source: Do you have any idea how to unseal the temple?
Target: Do you have any idea how to unseal the temple?

Source: What kind of treats are we talking about?
Target: What kind of treats are we talking about?

Source: I should find Basile at the Fighters Guild.
Target: I should find Basile at the Fighters Guild.

Source: So what do you want me to do about it?
Target: So what do you want me to do about it?

Source: <Continue reading the scroll.>
Target: <Continue reading the scroll.>

Source: I should find Nemarc at the Mages Guild.
Target: I should find Nemarc at the Mages Guild.

Source: What exactly do you want me to bring you?
Target: What exactly do you want me to bring you?

Source: Sounds good, let's talk about the Fighters Guild.
Target: Sounds good, let's talk about the Fighters Guild.

Source: But they can't hide forever. I mixed a few invisibility potions in case we had to evacuate. Give one to each person you find. That should enable them to arrive safely.
Target: But they can't hide forever. I mixed a few invisibility potions in case we had to evacuate. Give one to each person you find. That should enable them to arrive safely.

Source: In Capstone Cave, to the northwest. But be wary! The cave has been taken over by the Black Dagger gang. With our troubles here, we haven't the strength to drive them out.
Target: In Capstone Cave, to the northwest. But be wary! The cave has been taken over by the Black Dagger gang. With our troubles here, we haven't the strength to drive them out.

Source: Where can I find the Imperfect?
Target: Where can I find the Imperfect?

Source: You should get clear. Who should I talk to?

Source: My Ogrim traps are all sprung. I need you to take this sack of Daedrat meat—bait the traps and reset the triggers. Shouldn't take long.\n\nThe real problem is Legion Zero. Damned soldiers just won't stay off my back. I need you to take care of them.
Target: My Ogrim traps are all sprung. I need you to take this sack of Daedrat meat—bait the traps and reset the triggers. Shouldn't take long.\n\nThe real problem is Legion Zero. Damned soldiers just won't stay off my back. I need you to take care of them.

Source: One of the giant insects I told you about.\n\nMy brother needs to stay by Hedrynne's side, so I'm trying to enter the cave. If I can gather a few special ingredients, I can make an elixir to heal my sister. Could you … would you … help me?
Target: One of the giant insects I told you about.\n\nMy brother needs to stay by Hedrynne's side, so I'm trying to enter the cave. If I can gather a few special ingredients, I can make an elixir to heal my sister. Could you … would you … help me?

Source: Nah, we can do better! These louts have a stockpile of tar tucked away near the thoroughfare crossing. Least I think it's tar. Lots of foul, black liquids around here ….\n\nPour it into that huge forge in the west quarter. That'll really turn heads!
Target: Nah, we can do better! These louts have a stockpile of tar tucked away near the thoroughfare crossing. Least I think it's tar. Lots of foul, black liquids around here ….\n\nPour it into that huge forge in the west quarter. That'll really turn heads!

Source: We need someone to verify this claim and—if this tribe exists—bring definitive proof. Landal is specifically interested in objects of cultural significance in order to learn how socially advanced they are.\n\nTry not to disrupt the tribe too much.
Target: We need someone to verify this claim and—if this tribe exists—bring definitive proof. Landal is specifically interested in objects of cultural significance in order to learn how socially advanced they are.\n\nTry not to disrupt the tribe too much.

Source: Snowberries. They are quite popular among Giants and mammoths, and look how large they grow. I don't think that's a coincidence.\n\nI need you to add a copious amount to my mixture and consume it immediately to observe the results.
Target: Snowberries. They are quite popular among Giants and mammoths, and look how large they grow. I don't think that's a coincidence.\n\nI need you to add a copious amount to my mixture and consume it immediately to observe the results.

Source: How do we stop it?
Target: How do we stop it?

Source: She's the ranking priest after High Priest Varkour, but we haven't seen the high priest since the storm hit. Bavian led a group of us to safety, but there are more priests and pilgrims out there.\n\nIf you're willing to help, please talk to Bavian.
Target: She's the ranking priest after High Priest Varkour, but we haven't seen the high priest since the storm hit. Bavian led a group of us to safety, but there are more priests and pilgrims out there.\n\nIf you're willing to help, please talk to Bavian.

Source: They sent me to find help, but I'm practically useless when it comes to navigating on dry land.\n\nLook, go talk to Lord Ethian at our camp. The survivors gathered there but his wife, the ambassador, is still missing. He's worried sick about her.
Target: 그들은 내게 도움을 청할 곳을 찾아보라고 보냈지만, 나는 이런 곳에서 길을 찾는건 영 젬병이라.\n\n이봐, 우리 야영지의 에시안 경과 대화를 나눠볼 수 있겠나? 생존자들은 그곳에 모였지만 그 분의 아내이자, 대사는 여전히 실종 상태라. 그 분께선 아내를 굉장히 걱정하고 있을꺼다.

Source: I'll try to find the necklace.
Target: I'll try to find the necklace.

Source: We need to get inside the fort. Find out where they're spawning those abominations. But the damn harpies! We can't walk five steps without becoming bird food!\n\nSiege Commander Dulph's working on a plan. I hope it's a good one—for all our sakes.
Target: 우리는 요새 안으로 들어가야 하네. 저 혐오스런 것들이 어디서 생겨나는지 알아보게. 그리고 빌어먹을 하피들! 우린 새 먹이가 되지 않고는 다섯 걸음을 옮기질 못하고 있네.\n\n공성 사령관 덜프가 작전을 짜고 있네. 난 우리 모두를 위하여 그것이 잘 통했으면 좋겠어.

Source: Alchemist Rasir said he was close to developing one and then disappeared. \n\nTranya can tell you more. She's down below in the caverns with the others, putting together an effort to search for him. Please, if you can spare any help, we'd be grateful.

Source: The Frostbite Raiders. Bastards. Every one. Except, Nelfthea. We've had enough of the bloodshed. She promised to come with me once she's gotten her share from our last raid, but … I hear fighting on the Frozen Coast. She's in trouble. I know it.

Source: What? I'm no traitor! My sister serves as a soldier in the Skald-King's army, for Kyne's sake! \n\nLook, I really want to be there for her wedding. If you let me free, I'll reward you for your trouble. Just find me in Jorunn's Stand when you can.
Target: What? I'm no traitor! My sister serves as a soldier in the Skald-King's army, for Kyne's sake! \n\nLook, I really want to be there for her wedding. If you let me free, I'll reward you for your trouble. Just find me in Jorunn's Stand when you can.

Source: Not specifically, but I'm quite sure it has something to do with fulfilling her promise to you. She's adamant about pleading your case to the high king.\n\nAnyway, I've done my duty. Now I can go back to my favorite location—the tavern!
Target: Not specifically, but I'm quite sure it has something to do with fulfilling her promise to you. She's adamant about pleading your case to the high king.\n\nAnyway, I've done my duty. Now I can go back to my favorite location—the tavern!

Source: Obviously! These idiots aren't infallible. \n\nThey stripped me of my belongings before leaving me to my fate. If you can retrieve three of my things and place them upon a summoning altar, the spell will break and my body will be returned to me.
Target: Obviously! These idiots aren't infallible. \n\nThey stripped me of my belongings before leaving me to my fate. If you can retrieve three of my things and place them upon a summoning altar, the spell will break and my body will be returned to me.

Source: You … you mean I actually found some help?\n\nFind Lord Ethian in our camp. You can still see our smashed ships out on the ice from there. Last I saw, he was a nervous wreck. With Lady Sovelle missing, he's beside himself with worry.
Target: 네 말은 ... 내가 정말로 도움을 구했다는건가?\n\n야영지에서 에시안 경을 찾아라. 저기 빙판 위에서 우리들의 부숴진 배들을 찾을 수 있을거다. 내가 마지막으로 그를 봤을 당시에는, 신경이 과민한데다 망신창이 였었다. 레이디 소우벨이 실종되자, 그는 걱정으로 제정신이 아니야.

Source: Svana said something about a message from a friend of yours, but I wasn't really listening. She wants you to get this Fennorian to help with whatever she's trying to convince High King Svargrim to do.\n\nOr maybe she wanted you to join her for lunch?
Target: Svana said something about a message from a friend of yours, but I wasn't really listening. She wants you to get this Fennorian to help with whatever she's trying to convince High King Svargrim to do.\n\nOr maybe she wanted you to join her for lunch?

Source: Tilenra, a Telvanni healer and herbalist, has served the people of Suran for years. Unfortunately, a Mages Guild healer named Menaldinion has opened a shop of his own, and he's taken a keen interest in disrupting Tilenra's business.
Target: Tilenra, a Telvanni healer and herbalist, has served the people of Suran for years. Unfortunately, a Mages Guild healer named Menaldinion has opened a shop of his own, and he's taken a keen interest in disrupting Tilenra's business.

Source: Absolutely.
Target: Absolutely.

Source: Everything here is off. Tremors, strange creatures, crazed people and things that shouldn't even be down here.\n\nI told Raynor we needed to turn back, but he ran inside while I was fighting off the worst of them. Think you could go check on him?
Target: Everything here is off. Tremors, strange creatures, crazed people and things that shouldn't even be down here.\n\nI told Raynor we needed to turn back, but he ran inside while I was fighting off the worst of them. Think you could go check on him?

Source: Really? When we tried to enter the camp, we were besieged by trolls! My trusty clerk Eginir volunteered to sneak in and find my logging chief, Jafelma. He hasn't returned and I'm worried about him.\n\nIf you could help, I'll pay you for your trouble.
Target: Really? When we tried to enter the camp, we were besieged by trolls! My trusty clerk Eginir volunteered to sneak in and find my logging chief, Jafelma. He hasn't returned and I'm worried about him.\n\nIf you could help, I'll pay you for your trouble.

Source: Rigurt is supposed to meet them soon, but there is something wrong with his aide. He is meaner and hungrier than usual. Rigurt cannot meet the thanes without an aide! He needs a new one who will not start things off on the wrong hoof! Can you help?
Target: Rigurt is supposed to meet them soon, but there is something wrong with his aide. He is meaner and hungrier than usual. Rigurt cannot meet the thanes without an aide! He needs a new one who will not start things off on the wrong hoof! Can you help?

Source: You know, the dead Nords that get up and walk? They've been wandering out of the barrow and bothering the Orcs down in the village.\n\nI was going to go look for Master Dren, but then I remembered the spiders. Can't be too careful around spiders!
Target: 당신도 알다시피, 죽은 노드가 일어나 걸어다니는건 알고 있을테죠? 그것들은 고분을 벗어나 아래에 있는 오크 마을들을 괴롭히고 있어요\n\n저는 마스터 드렌을 찾으러 갈려했지만, 거미를 본 기억이 나요. 주위에 있는 거미를 조심하세요!

Source: Then speak to Laganakh in the village. She might have learned more since I've been gone.

Source: No. My wife, Elle, hired them. She said they'd ease people's minds, but the horkers are only making things worse.\n\nYou look capable. If you could expose them for the charlatans they are, Elle would kick them out. What do you say? It's a paying job.
Target: No. My wife, Elle, hired them. She said they'd ease people's minds, but the horkers are only making things worse.\n\nYou look capable. If you could expose them for the charlatans they are, Elle would kick them out. What do you say? It's a paying job.

Target: This is Labyrinthian, an ancient city from the First Era. I don't know what my grandfather's interest in it is, but I've heard terrible sounds coming from within.\n\nYou seem sturdy. Might I request your aid in looking for him?

Target: Once we enter the Scraps, we'll need to locate dormant Dwemer spiders. With my control rod, I'll command them to retrieve the power nodes for us. \n\nI'll need you to gallantly protect me from their more irritable brethren. I'd pay you for your effort.

Source: Those sacred stones help calm the dreugh. If the Dominion takes them ….\n\n<<1>> and his son Njorlund came to protect the bog. Please speak with Saervild; his camp's beside the main road. Maybe he'll have some advice.

Target: 우리는 오시니움에 음식과 보급품을 가져가고 있었습니다. 일단 그곳에 도착하면, 모든 보급품들은 그들이 겨울을 날수 있게끔 외지 집단에게 분배되었어야 했습니다.\n\n그 보급품들이 없다면, 많은 오크들이 죽을것입니다. 저는 그것에 대한 책임을 지고 싶지 않습니다.

Source: The people want their loved ones' spirits freed and that necromancer dead.\n\nTake this. If you beat a skeleton or zombie almost to pieces, you can use this <<1>> to cut its spirit loose. Thazeg can tell you more. He's over there by the shrine.
Target: The people want their loved ones' spirits freed and that necromancer dead.\n\nTake this. If you beat a skeleton or zombie almost to pieces, you can use this <<1>> to cut its spirit loose. Thazeg can tell you more. He's over there by the shrine.

Source: You are a hardened lot. Very well, I have a gamble in mind. We do what Rilis wants and disable the stones that bind his soul to this prison.\n\nHe will then enter this plane, where we can slay him. Though, he could do the same to us. Can I rely on you?
Target: You are a hardened lot. Very well, I have a gamble in mind. We do what Rilis wants and disable the stones that bind his soul to this prison.\n\nHe will then enter this plane, where we can slay him. Though, he could do the same to us. Can I rely on you?

Source: Get up to the surface and go to the Blue Palace. I'm sure the princess and Fenn have a plan. They'll fill you in on it when you arrive.\n\nGood luck and gods speed, adventurer.
Target: Get up to the surface and go to the Blue Palace. I'm sure the princess and Fenn have a plan. They'll fill you in on it when you arrive.\n\nGood luck and gods speed, adventurer.

Source: I'm not sure. I haven't had a chance to talk to him since the events at Tzinghalis's stronghold.\n\nLook, Svana and Fenn need you. They're waiting at the Blue Palace.
Target: I'm not sure. I haven't had a chance to talk to him since the events at Tzinghalis's stronghold.\n\nLook, Svana and Fenn need you. They're waiting at the Blue Palace.

Source: I never said it was complicated. Besides, by scaring off those Wood Orcs, you just might have improved your chances. The Wilderking sees these things, you know.\n\nAll right. Run along now. And may the forest part to reveal your path!
Target: I never said it was complicated. Besides, by scaring off those Wood Orcs, you just might have improved your chances. The Wilderking sees these things, you know.\n\nAll right. Run along now. And may the forest part to reveal your path!

Source: Yeah. I don't know if she sees her as competition or some sort of threat, but <<1>> also wants you to kill <<2>>. She was willing to pay extra for that. I'm all for extra pay.\n\nIf you want more details, you can ask her yourself. She's right outside.
Target: Yeah. I don't know if she sees her as competition or some sort of threat, but <<1>> also wants you to kill <<2>>. She was willing to pay extra for that. I'm all for extra pay.\n\nIf you want more details, you can ask her yourself. She's right outside.

Source: Well, you see … the husks are the same, grown from local flora. It's the guardian's guts that make it special.\n\nBring me some thunderbug bellies, dew bugs, and hive seeds from outside the village, and I'll show you how to make one.
Target: Well, you see … the husks are the same, grown from local flora. It's the guardian's guts that make it special.\n\nBring me some thunderbug bellies, dew bugs, and hive seeds from outside the village, and I'll show you how to make one.

Source: Titanborn hasn't shared all the particulars. She just sent me to track you down. Meet her in Riften so you can travel together to Eastmarch.\n\nMay Kyne's kiss grant you safe passage.
Target: Titanborn hasn't shared all the particulars. She just sent me to track you down. Meet her in Riften so you can travel together to Eastmarch.\n\nMay Kyne's kiss grant you safe passage.

Source: We know which giant smashed the chief. I want to return the favor. That'll show the clan I'm a good contender, which would help keep the clan together.\n\nThing is, I'm no tracker. Care to help me find the bastard?
Target: 우리는 어는 거인이 족장을 박살냈는지 알고있다. 난 이 호의를 독톡히 갚아줄거다. 내가 쓸만한 도전자란걸 보여주면, 부족이 함께 뭉치는데 도움이 될지도 모르지.\n\n문제는, 난 사냥꾼이 아니란거다. 그 개자식을 잡는걸 도와줄수 있겠나?

Source: Tricky to navigate? How so?
Target: Tricky to navigate? How so?

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: His father and sister joined me in the search, and told me of a woman named <<1>>. She works for Hadran himself. Might even know where my boy has gone … but would not speak to us. Please, will you try to speak to her?
Target: His father and sister joined me in the search, and told me of a woman named <<1>>. She works for Hadran himself. Might even know where my boy has gone … but would not speak to us. Please, will you try to speak to her?

Source: A Buoyant Armiger warned me of pilgrims being attacked on the roads and directed me to speak to Captain Naros at Molag Mar if I wanted to know more.
Target: A Buoyant Armiger warned me of pilgrims being attacked on the roads and directed me to speak to Captain Naros at Molag Mar if I wanted to know more.

Source: Do you want me to seek him out?
Target: Do you want me to seek him out?

Source: All right. I'll do it.
Target: All right. I'll do it.

Source: I will retrieve this trophy in honor of your sacrifice.
Target: I will retrieve this trophy in honor of your sacrifice.

Source: All right. I'll give Phylgaux the message.
Target: All right. I'll give Phylgaux the message.

Source: I'll look for Sir Dubroc in the area of Jackdaw Cove.
Target: I'll look for Sir Dubroc in the area of Jackdaw Cove.

Source: I'll look for Scout Nadira at Bangkorai Pass.
Target: I'll look for Scout Nadira at Bangkorai Pass.

Source: I'll recover their things.
Target: I'll recover their things.

Source: Could any of these pilgrims still be alive?
Target: Could any of these pilgrims still be alive?

Source: And if they don't agree?
Target: And if they don't agree?

Source: And how do you challenge him properly?
Target: And how do you challenge him properly?

Source: What's happening at Hel Ra Citadel?
Target: What's happening at Hel Ra Citadel?

Source: Yes! Pieces of me are all over the place. It's rather disconcerting!\n\nI'm probably not the first skeleton you've had to reassemble, and I doubt I'll be the last. But once I'm walking again, we can figure out what the Wormies want with <<Ac:1>>. Deal?
Target: Yes! Pieces of me are all over the place. It's rather disconcerting!\n\nI'm probably not the first skeleton you've had to reassemble, and I doubt I'll be the last. But once I'm walking again, we can figure out what the Wormies want with <<Ac:1>>. Deal?

Source: So what do you need me to do?
Target: So what do you need me to do?

Source: Did they want something?
Target: Did they want something?

Source: The risks?
Target: The risks?

Source: Pariel … broke our pact with Y'ffre. She called upon Hircine, Master of the Hunt. He changed her. Now, by Y'ffre's command, I must end her before she hurts others.\n\nShe fled into these caves. She knows my scent. I can't get close.
Target: Pariel … broke our pact with Y'ffre. She called upon Hircine, Master of the Hunt. He changed her. Now, by Y'ffre's command, I must end her before she hurts others.\n\nShe fled into these caves. She knows my scent. I can't get close.

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Source: Turn this … tighten that … and … finished!\n\nThat should do it. Should we see what this thing does?
Target: Turn this … tighten that … and … finished!\n\nThat should do it. Should we see what this thing does?

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Source: No need to concern yourself. I'm sure I have this well in hand. I imagine I've already destroyed the Great Shackle and even now we're celebrating our victory over the Lord of Brutality.\n\nYes, I'm sure that's what has happened.
Target: No need to concern yourself. I'm sure I have this well in hand. I imagine I've already destroyed the Great Shackle and even now we're celebrating our victory over the Lord of Brutality.\n\nYes, I'm sure that's what has happened.

Source: Maritus Blasio of Vlastarus, Divyth Dorvayn of Bruma, Enide Geta of Chorrol, Varana Scaeva of Cropsford. List grows longer every year.\n\nKeepsakes to remember them by.
Target: Maritus Blasio of Vlastarus, Divyth Dorvayn of Bruma, Enide Geta of Chorrol, Varana Scaeva of Cropsford. List grows longer every year.\n\nKeepsakes to remember them by.

Source: Find a way inside and locate the Fighters Guild.\n\nWards protect the hall, making it impossible for anyone to get in or out of the building. We know a secret tunnel that leads into the hall, but we'll be trapped inside until the wards are deactivated.
Target: Find a way inside and locate the Fighters Guild.\n\nWards protect the hall, making it impossible for anyone to get in or out of the building. We know a secret tunnel that leads into the hall, but we'll be trapped inside until the wards are deactivated.

Source: I have to finish writing, and get those relics back. There's no way I can do both in the condition I'm in. Can you track down the relics for me while I finish my work? I've done all the research, I just have to get it written down.
Target: I have to finish writing, and get those relics back. There's no way I can do both in the condition I'm in. Can you track down the relics for me while I finish my work? I've done all the research, I just have to get it written down.

Source: Strike a blow for the Three! A direct attack may convince them we're stronger than we appear.\n\nAnd any losses you inflict will improve our odds of holding them back immensely.
Target: Strike a blow for the Three! A direct attack may convince them we're stronger than we appear.\n\nAnd any losses you inflict will improve our odds of holding them back immensely.

Source: That is … generous of you. \n\nWe're being attacked on three fronts, and I need my archers here just to keep the Daedra from breaking through. If you could stop them from pushing the north and south fronts, we might have a chance.
Target: That is … generous of you. \n\nWe're being attacked on three fronts, and I need my archers here just to keep the Daedra from breaking through. If you could stop them from pushing the north and south fronts, we might have a chance.

Source: The Hist Tree must be restored. If you can recover the three parts of my broken staff, we may be able to use magic to calm the spirits, and then we can do what we can for the tree itself. But beware—Argonian ghosts are unnatural and very dangerous.
Target: The Hist Tree must be restored. If you can recover the three parts of my broken staff, we may be able to use magic to calm the spirits, and then we can do what we can for the tree itself. But beware—Argonian ghosts are unnatural and very dangerous.

Source: Where is <<1>> now?
Target: Where is <<1>> now?

Source: Where's Captain Kaleen?
Target: Where's Captain Kaleen?

Source: Anything else?
Target: Anything else?

Source: Isn't that a little extreme?
Target: Isn't that a little extreme?

Source: You want their numbers culled?
Target: You want their numbers culled?

Source: Where are the Undaunted now?
Target: Where are the Undaunted now?

Source: So you want me to track down the books?
Target: So you want me to track down the books?

Source: I'll deal with him.
Target: I'll deal with him.

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: I believe so, but I thought it best not to speak about it through other parties. Once again, I need you to be my eyes and ears. Razum-dar here waits only for you to leave. He'll meet you in Skywatch, and together you will speak on my behalf.
Target: I believe so, but I thought it best not to speak about it through other parties. Once again, I need you to be my eyes and ears. Razum-dar here waits only for you to leave. He'll meet you in Skywatch, and together you will speak on my behalf.

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: Help with what?
Target: Help with what?

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: What kind of help do you need?
Target: What kind of help do you need?

Source: In time, comrade. First you and I must travel afield, to the ruined city Abagarlas. It was there the Ayleids went, to stop the Mortuum Vivicus. Together we will understand the threat to the present in the events of the past.
Target: In time, comrade. First you and I must travel afield, to the ruined city Abagarlas. It was there the Ayleids went, to stop the Mortuum Vivicus. Together we will understand the threat to the present in the events of the past.

Source: Heh. It's stupid. I snagged my foot on a root and tripped. While the others were slaughtered, I was face down in the mud.\n\nI know I should avenge them, but I'm a coward. Please, help me. Destroy that … thing.
Target: Heh. It's stupid. I snagged my foot on a root and tripped. While the others were slaughtered, I was face down in the mud.\n\nI know I should avenge them, but I'm a coward. Please, help me. Destroy that … thing.

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: Believe it or not, <<1>> and I are researching Argonian ruins, and the pirates are in our way. I'm sure they have plenty of loot, but that's not what we're after.\n\nIf you're interested, ask <<1>> to fill you in. He's watching the lower road.
Target: Believe it or not, <<1>> and I are researching Argonian ruins, and the pirates are in our way. I'm sure they have plenty of loot, but that's not what we're after.\n\nIf you're interested, ask <<1>> to fill you in. He's watching the lower road.

Source: <<1>>. Said she was <<2>>'s betrothed. She went in after him, and that's the last person I've let in since.\n\nThat is, unless you see fit to go in after them?
Target: <<1>>. Said she was <<2>>'s betrothed. She went in after him, and that's the last person I've let in since.\n\nThat is, unless you see fit to go in after them?

Source: Do just that. The Dominion can't afford mercy for traitors. Justice must be served, and swiftly. \n\nHe cannot be far from here. There's a reward out for his head. Find him before I do, and there'll be coin in it for you.
Target: Do just that. The Dominion can't afford mercy for traitors. Justice must be served, and swiftly. \n\nHe cannot be far from here. There's a reward out for his head. Find him before I do, and there'll be coin in it for you.

Source: I heard pirates beg <<1>> for mercy. Then, screams. That's the other Fang's influence at work.\n\nI'll take the first Fang of Sithis to our secondary camp not far from here. Get the other Fang away from the pirates and meet me there.
Target: I heard pirates beg <<1>> for mercy. Then, screams. That's the other Fang's influence at work.\n\nI'll take the first Fang of Sithis to our secondary camp not far from here. Get the other Fang away from the pirates and meet me there.

Source: The artifacts below are dangerous. I need to review my notes and see if I can figure out what we're dealing with. Tell <<1>> to wait, or we may walk into some serious trouble.
Target: The artifacts below are dangerous. I need to review my notes and see if I can figure out what we're dealing with. Tell <<1>> to wait, or we may walk into some serious trouble.

Source: No. Well, not exactly. We want to search the ruins for ancient relics, and the pirates are in the way.\n\nMy partner, <<1>>, is up at our camp. He can tell you more about what we're after, if you're interested.
Target: No. Well, not exactly. We want to search the ruins for ancient relics, and the pirates are in the way.\n\nMy partner, <<1>>, is up at our camp. He can tell you more about what we're after, if you're interested.

Source: More than that. Ask anyone, if they're willing to talk. Ask <<1>>, hiding in the town hall where it's safe.\n\nI smell the fear. Mine. Theirs. Ask about the harpies. And the Gold Coast. Mercenaries. There's no gold and no coast, just mercenaries! Hah!
Target: More than that. Ask anyone, if they're willing to talk. Ask <<1>>, hiding in the town hall where it's safe.\n\nI smell the fear. Mine. Theirs. Ask about the harpies. And the Gold Coast. Mercenaries. There's no gold and no coast, just mercenaries! Hah!

Source: So you think Erilthel is dead?
Target: So you think Erilthel is dead?

Source: What happened when you opened that portal?
Target: What happened when you opened that portal?

Source: What would I have to do?
Target: What would I have to do?

Source: So someone stole the relics?
Target: So someone stole the relics?

Source: Who are you? How do you know so much about the curse?
Target: Who are you? How do you know so much about the curse?

Source: Long after the body's wounds have closed, hardened into scars, the mind's wounds still pierce. Still sear.\n\nBut I know that gleam in your eye. Like me, you can't help but desire the pale senche's ivory hide.
Target: Long after the body's wounds have closed, hardened into scars, the mind's wounds still pierce. Still sear.\n\nBut I know that gleam in your eye. Like me, you can't help but desire the pale senche's ivory hide.

Source: Do you need me to warn the Sapiarchs?
Target: Do you need me to warn the Sapiarchs?

Source: Why are the notes so important?
Target: Why are the notes so important?

Source: Ah yes, I have her flute from our courtship. We used it to meet secretly in the woods. When you play it, you hear the music from its twin.\n\nI tried to use it to find her, but I just got lost. I'm not cut out for traipsing around the woods.
Target: Ah yes, I have her flute from our courtship. We used it to meet secretly in the woods. When you play it, you hear the music from its twin.\n\nI tried to use it to find her, but I just got lost. I'm not cut out for traipsing around the woods.

Source: How can I help?
Target: How can I help?

Source: They captured Halalin, Fanrel, Nielas … and the others. Took them away to torture and who knows what else?\n\nOh, Divines, what if they're dead? I should've fought. I should've cut their throats. I ran. Why did I run?
Target: They captured Halalin, Fanrel, Nielas … and the others. Took them away to torture and who knows what else?\n\nOh, Divines, what if they're dead? I should've fought. I should've cut their throats. I ran. Why did I run?

Source: How did you fail?
Target: How did you fail?

Source: No, it's no use. The guards are in league with the brigands. Paid off. \n\nPlease, no one else will help me.
Target: No, it's no use. The guards are in league with the brigands. Paid off. \n\nPlease, no one else will help me.

Source: <Touch the necklace.>
Target: <Touch the necklace.>

Source: A hulkynd? What's that?
Target: A hulkynd? What's that?

Source: My kidn— no, ha, Laurosse couldn't kidnap a puppy that followed him home because he had a bone in his pocket.\n\nHe's my betrothed. He's … an Altmer. Yeah, it wasn't a popular match. But he's not like the other Altmer. Divines, I miss him.
Target: My kidn— no, ha, Laurosse couldn't kidnap a puppy that followed him home because he had a bone in his pocket.\n\nHe's my betrothed. He's … an Altmer. Yeah, it wasn't a popular match. But he's not like the other Altmer. Divines, I miss him.

Source: We're waiting to depart for Shad Astula, the Academy of Magic.\n\nThe Academy sends invitations to only the most promising mages. Trains them to become leaders for the Houses and the Ebonheart Pact. My apologies, I thought that was common knowledge.
Target: We're waiting to depart for Shad Astula, the Academy of Magic.\n\nThe Academy sends invitations to only the most promising mages. Trains them to become leaders for the Houses and the Ebonheart Pact. My apologies, I thought that was common knowledge.

Source: What do you plan to do?
Target: What do you plan to do?

Source: A pearl?
Target: A pearl?

Source: You think the ruins are the source of the disappearances?
Target: You think the ruins are the source of the disappearances?

Source: Yes, that should work!\n\n Find the houses in which they are trapped and save them.
Target: Yes, that should work!\n\n Find the houses in which they are trapped and save them.

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: The invaders put our library to the torch. However, I'm sure some of our lore has survived, as our most precious scrolls are treated with a flame-resistant unguent.\n\nRescue the scrolls and my fellow devotees: <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>>.
Target: The invaders put our library to the torch. However, I'm sure some of our lore has survived, as our most precious scrolls are treated with a flame-resistant unguent.\n\nRescue the scrolls and my fellow devotees: <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>>.

Source: We feel … the council feels that we need to further investigate Jofnir's death. You will be their eyes and ears, with Aelif assisting you. She can explain in more detail when you speak to her.
Target: We feel … the council feels that we need to further investigate Jofnir's death. You will be their eyes and ears, with Aelif assisting you. She can explain in more detail when you speak to her.

Source: You think they ran into trouble?
Target: You think they ran into trouble?

Source: There are people trapped here?
Target: There are people trapped here?

Source: Those soldiers are terrorizing our people. Kill them! Rescue everyone you can, and please look for <<1>>.\n\nI don't know what the Dominion's doing here, but they said something about crystals. I'll sneak back in. Meet me near the village center.
Target: Those soldiers are terrorizing our people. Kill them! Rescue everyone you can, and please look for <<1>>.\n\nI don't know what the Dominion's doing here, but they said something about crystals. I'll sneak back in. Meet me near the village center.

Source: He was there one day and gone the next. His notes call this place "Crow's Wood." It's the only clue I have.\n\nI thought I saw an old house up the trail. Could you take a look? I need to stabilize this portal.
Target: He was there one day and gone the next. His notes call this place \\"Crow's Wood.\"\" It's the only clue I have.\n\nI thought I saw an old house up the trail. Could you take a look? I need to stabilize this portal."

Source: I'll find your guards. Where did the Iron Orcs take them?
Target: I'll find your guards. Where did the Iron Orcs take them?

Source: I'll deal with him.
Target: I'll deal with him.

Source: You're an Iron Orc and you're asking for my help?
Target: You're an Iron Orc and you're asking for my help?

Source: Before you arrived, my visions revealed those three to me. They are to play an important part in future events directly related to the success of the Pact.\n\nHelp them. They must pass their tests and complete their training.
Target: Before you arrived, my visions revealed those three to me. They are to play an important part in future events directly related to the success of the Pact.\n\nHelp them. They must pass their tests and complete their training.

Source: There are supplies scattered throughout Selfora.
Target: There are supplies scattered throughout Selfora.

Source: We must take appropriate measures! I'll gather the students and make sure the grounds are secure.\n\nI'd like you to use the trapdoor to investigate the library vaults. I haven't heard from the librarian, and that fills me with nameless apprehension.
Target: We must take appropriate measures! I'll gather the students and make sure the grounds are secure.\n\nI'd like you to use the trapdoor to investigate the library vaults. I haven't heard from the librarian, and that fills me with nameless apprehension.

Source: She was a decorated soldier in the Ebonheart Pact. Now she tends to guests at the Ebony Flask. \n\nHer nightflower servants probably know her best. If you want to know how to get that bottle, talk to one.
Target: She was a decorated soldier in the Ebonheart Pact. Now she tends to guests at the Ebony Flask. \n\nHer nightflower servants probably know her best. If you want to know how to get that bottle, talk to one.

Source: We tried to close the portals, but Vox was clever—she used dark magic to tie each portal to a watcher. You have to kill the watchers to close the portals. That's how many of us died. \n\nPlease close them, then find me by the central dais.
Target: We tried to close the portals, but Vox was clever—she used dark magic to tie each portal to a watcher. You have to kill the watchers to close the portals. That's how many of us died. \n\nPlease close them, then find me by the central dais.

Source: Then … well … things will go badly for you. Droppings on your shiny clothes. Yes, that's it! And incessant cawing! We'll keep you awake all through the night.\n\nDo not cross Blackfeather Court, intruder.
Target: Then … well … things will go badly for you. Droppings on your shiny clothes. Yes, that's it! And incessant cawing! We'll keep you awake all through the night.\n\nDo not cross Blackfeather Court, intruder.

Source: Magistrix Vox attacked the shrine, but I don't know any more than that.\n\nSaint Veloth's fading spirit asked me to send help. He's on the stairs leading to the shrine, near the bridge to Tal'Deic Fortress. Hurry, before he vanishes forever.
Target: Magistrix Vox attacked the shrine, but I don't know any more than that.\n\nSaint Veloth's fading spirit asked me to send help. He's on the stairs leading to the shrine, near the bridge to Tal'Deic Fortress. Hurry, before he vanishes forever.

Source: Yes! Yes! Grub grass? Could you? It grows at the base of a waterfall near here. Meanwhile, I'll work on the brew.\n\nThe river always provides.
Target: Yes! Yes! Grub grass? Could you? It grows at the base of a waterfall near here. Meanwhile, I'll work on the brew.\n\nThe river always provides.

Source: Well, you get me some Red Mountain Ash and I'll whip up a batch and maybe give you a bottle.\n\nHead down to Lake Rumare and look for Red Mountain Tuffs along the shore. You can harvest the ash from those. Bring it here and I'll get right to work.

Source: Good, because more Daedra have infested Norvulk Ruins. They're back to spreading cursed baubles throughout the land.\n\nI want you to slay whatever Daedra is behind this plan and return these relics to their altars. That should break the curse.

Target: Thalara's recipe requires Red Mountain Ash. The mountain's eruption spewed ash as clumps of tuff, yes? If you gather it for Thalara, the reward would be great. Search the shores of Lake Rumare for the tuff.

Source: <<1>> is trying to break into the mine. We have to get in there. People are trapped inside, and we need to understand what in Oblivion the Reach are up to!
Target: <<1>> is trying to break into the mine. We have to get in there. People are trapped inside, and we need to understand what in Oblivion the Reach are up to!

Source: Around Wormroot Depths. Off the cultists. Doesn't matter, as long as there's no blood on them before you hand them over.\n\nAnd while you're there, send the toughest Daedra they've summoned back to Oblivion. If you can manage.
Target: Around Wormroot Depths. Off the cultists. Doesn't matter, as long as there's no blood on them before you hand them over.\n\nAnd while you're there, send the toughest Daedra they've summoned back to Oblivion. If you can manage.

Source: He was last seen heading into these tunnels. The whole thing is a sordid affair. The poor bastard must be mad with grief. You'd have to be to stay down here.\n\nWe could use some help, if you're willing—there's a lot of ground to cover.
Target: He was last seen heading into these tunnels. The whole thing is a sordid affair. The poor bastard must be mad with grief. You'd have to be to stay down here.\n\nWe could use some help, if you're willing—there's a lot of ground to cover.

Source: Tell me about this message.
Target: Tell me about this message.

Source: Daedra … I can't stand them. Always so smug, acting like they own all of Tamriel.\n\nThere's a mass of them in <<1>>. Kill the fool who summoned them, of course. But I want you to banish enough Daedra that Oblivion takes note.
Target: Daedra … I can't stand them. Always so smug, acting like they own all of Tamriel.\n\nThere's a mass of them in <<1>>. Kill the fool who summoned them, of course. But I want you to banish enough Daedra that Oblivion takes note.

Source: By all means. "Circus of Cheerful Slaughter" is just there on the desk. \n\nBut be careful. The treachery of the Mad God knows no bounds.
Target: By all means. \\"Circus of Cheerful Slaughter\"\" is just there on the desk. \n\nBut be careful. The treachery of the Mad God knows no bounds."

Source: "I made it past the front door, but stealth was never really my strong suit. I didn't expect the place to be crawling with skeletons! I'm going to hide until they settle down. I should be fine if the damned scuttler doesn't give me away."\n\n—<<1>>
Target: \\"I made it past the front door
column4: but stealth was never really my strong suit. I didn't expect the place to be crawling with skeletons! I'm going to hide until they settle down. I should be fine if the damned scuttler doesn't give me away.\"\"\n\n—<<1>>"

Source: Yes! They led <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>> away through the mines. Find them, please!

Source: Just what you can carry. And be sure to find the largest Dwarven … creature? Is that the right word?\n\nDoesn't matter. Smash the toughest Dwarven creature you find in there. The siblings want to map the place once the larger dangers are handled.

Target: Deep in the mine, in an ancient Companion tomb …. The Reachmen shamans went into the tomb, then the clansmen used two relics to seal the entrance. Their leaders are in the tomb, but you need those relics to get in.

Target: The Reaper's March chapter sends an urgent request. From the way it reads, Worm Cultists have overrun their lands.\n\nThat hall steward is prone to exaggerate, but they sent the funds, so … destroy any Dark Anchors you find in Reaper's March.

Target: Yes, the cultists drove my family away! Gjakil, my husband. My two daughters, <<1>> and <<2>>.\n\nI … I'm afraid to go after them. Will you look for them?

Source: I'll get you those shards.
Target: I'll get you those shards.

Source: I don't know. And I can feel my mind slipping away. Please, help me. Find my mentor, the great <<1>>. She was at my performance. If anyone knows what's happening, she will. Hurry!
Target: I don't know. And I can feel my mind slipping away. Please, help me. Find my mentor, the great <<1>>. She was at my performance. If anyone knows what's happening, she will. Hurry!

Source: I want you to pick a fight with whoever leads those marauders. I want you to win. And then I want you to bring back the heirlooms.\n\nTry not to get any blood on them. It might upset the owner.
Target: I want you to pick a fight with whoever leads those marauders. I want you to win. And then I want you to bring back the heirlooms.\n\nTry not to get any blood on them. It might upset the owner.

Source: I'll look for them.
Target: I'll look for them.

Source: I'll take care of it.
Target: I'll take care of it.

Source: Of course. I can go check on your wife.
Target: Of course. I can go check on your wife.

Source: You can count on me.
Target: You can count on me.

Source: All right. I'll go see what I can find.
Target: All right. I'll go see what I can find.

Source: If I see anything, I'll take care of it.
Target: If I see anything, I'll take care of it.

Source: I'll take the ore to Aleeto.
Target: I'll take the ore to Aleeto.

Source: You can count on me.
Target: You can count on me.

Source: Can I do anything to help?
Target: Can I do anything to help?

Source: Where are your wine bottles now?
Target: Where are your wine bottles now?

Source: What's the problem?
Target: What's the problem?

Source: What do you need me to do?
Target: What do you need me to do?

Source: The Nords of <<1>> celebrate by traveling to remote places, stripping down to smallclothes, and leaping into the freezing water.\n\nYou should take the Snow Bear Plunge! It is quite invigorating.
Target: The Nords of <<1>> celebrate by traveling to remote places, stripping down to smallclothes, and leaping into the freezing water.\n\nYou should take the Snow Bear Plunge! It is quite invigorating.

Source: Treethane Rolon sent me to look for outside help. I don't know what he intends.\n\nHe said something about a horrible crime—I think he thinks the forest is trying to exact justice for something. He's in the sacred cave with the others.
Target: Treethane Rolon sent me to look for outside help. I don't know what he intends.\n\nHe said something about a horrible crime—I think he thinks the forest is trying to exact justice for something. He's in the sacred cave with the others.

Source: Ever hear of Orc's Finger Ruins? Not my favorite name, but that's where the <<z:1>> grow. They smell nice—real nice.\n\nI want you to find the biggest one you can and pluck it right off its stalk.
Target: Ever hear of Orc's Finger Ruins? Not my favorite name, but that's where the <<z:1>> grow. They smell nice—real nice.\n\nI want you to find the biggest one you can and pluck it right off its stalk.

Source: There's folk buried under rubble, and fires everywhere. My healers tell me we need to burn the dead. They don't want disease to spread. It's a mess.
Target: There's folk buried under rubble, and fires everywhere. My healers tell me we need to burn the dead. They don't want disease to spread. It's a mess.

Source: There was a girl, Luala, who left us years ago to study with the Thronekeepers.\n\nSeek her out. Bring her home. There are many here that could use her services.
Target: There was a girl, Luala, who left us years ago to study with the Thronekeepers.\n\nSeek her out. Bring her home. There are many here that could use her services.

Source: More bandits spotted in Orc's Finger Ruins. Seems they remember you from last time, and none too fondly.\n\nI dare you to find <<z:1>> in the ruins, eat the biggest you can find, and show the bandit leader you have guts—even when they're gurgling.
Target: More bandits spotted in Orc's Finger Ruins. Seems they remember you from last time, and none too fondly.\n\nI dare you to find <<z:1>> in the ruins, eat the biggest you can find, and show the bandit leader you have guts—even when they're gurgling.

Source: It gets worse, they're … doing something. To the Reachmen. \n\nI need to keep watch for any other soldiers coming through. Talk to Dajaheel and the Centurion if you want to pitch in. Good luck.
Target: It gets worse, they're … doing something. To the Reachmen. \n\nI need to keep watch for any other soldiers coming through. Talk to Dajaheel and the Centurion if you want to pitch in. Good luck.

Source: We have conflicting reports on that concern, but Razum-dar is investigating.\n\nRegardless, your first priority is to inform the queen of our victory and this unfortunate news about her brother. Give her this letter. It contains all the details.
Target: We have conflicting reports on that concern, but Razum-dar is investigating.\n\nRegardless, your first priority is to inform the queen of our victory and this unfortunate news about her brother. Give her this letter. It contains all the details.

Source: I want to be certified for jewelry crafting. I'll create a ring.
Target: I want to be certified for jewelry crafting. I'll create a ring.

Target: As we speak, two of my guardians investigate rumored anchor sites. Merric and Aelif are the best the guild has to offer. Meet up with them on the beach east of Vulkhel Guard. You can proceed from there.

Target: Where's the Ritemaster now?

Source: Yes! They led <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>> away through the mines. Please find them.
Target: Yes! They led <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>> away through the mines. Please find them.

Target: A vision of the future. A future where that spirit escapes these caverns and runs rampant across the continent. I saw the cities of Tamriel, shattered and over-grown.\n\nThat spirit wants us dead—Men, Mer, Khajiit. It doesn't give a damn.

Target: If the vipers are here in numbers strong enough to assault Khenarthi, all of the southern seas are in danger. The Queen is in Auridon right now, beginning a royal visit. Raz would ask you to head to Vulkhel Guard and report to <<1>>.

Target: He wants to harm you over a garden?

Target: Lord Vivec sent the three of us to seek guidance at the Andrano ancestral tomb. We were attacked when we got there and our guard was seriously hurt. I barely got her to safety, but we failed to complete the mission Lord Vivec bestowed upon us.

Source: I think so - <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>>. They took them away, might still be alive. Now get me out!
Target: I think so - <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>>. They took them away, might still be alive. Now get me out!

Source: I can perform the tasks, just tell me what I need to do.
Target: I can perform the tasks, just tell me what I need to do.

Source: It is. They can use it to fuel a daedric summoning ritual! I can repair it and seal it awa, but you must retrieve its pieces, first.
Target: It is. They can use it to fuel a daedric summoning ritual! I can repair it and seal it awa, but you must retrieve its pieces, first.

Source: Yes! They led <<1>>, <<2>>, and <<3>> away through the mines. Please find them.

Target: That shouldn't be too much of a problem.

Target: What am I, a monster? Everyone wants a trained bantam guar. If taking it destroys the morale of some skooma peddlers, all the better.\n\nBut to be safe, you should kill their leader. Best to stab both kidneys at once, you know?
