Target: I'll look for her.

Target: I'll get your mammoths back.

Target: These are the Vaults of Madness, constructed by the Mad Architect. It's an eternal prison for his enemies. For me.\n\nI cannot leave until I am whole—a Harvester has taken my soul. Find it, defeat it, and we'll leave together.

Target: I'll find him.

Target: Why do you want me to go to the Royal Palace in Alinor?

Source: One of our order, Hara, is leading our efforts to stop these attacks. But we're not warriors. \n\nThis cart will take you to Belkarth, in Craglorn, where you can speak to her personally. Please, help us.
Target: One of our order, Hara, is leading our efforts to stop these attacks. But we're not warriors. \n\nThis cart will take you to Belkarth, in Craglorn, where you can speak to her personally. Please, help us.

Target: Treethane Ranneth oversees everything that goes on here in town. She's in the big two-bulb house right here in town. Can't miss it! You have a good day, friend!

Target: I don't know. All I know is them dreamers better not be scratchin' up my crystal shards. Can you kill some of them Dreamers and get my crystal shards back?

Source: Call me Titus. It's a long story, but I'm familiar with Tarish-Zi and his army of Anka-Ra.\n\nCenturies ago, they were part of the Ra Gada, the Yokudan invasion force that subdued and conquered Craglorn. But Tarish-Zi and his army were among the worst.
Target: Call me Titus. It's a long story, but I'm familiar with Tarish-Zi and his army of Anka-Ra.\n\nCenturies ago, they were part of the Ra Gada, the Yokudan invasion force that subdued and conquered Craglorn. But Tarish-Zi and his army were among the worst.

Source: I'm not actually sure! If you listen to Ragalvir, he thinks there's some problem. I'll put my trust in Treethane Ranneth, though. She knows what she's doing.\n\nShe's the one you should ask if you have any questions. She lives in the big double-bulb.
Target: I'm not actually sure! If you listen to Ragalvir, he thinks there's some problem. I'll put my trust in Treethane Ranneth, though. She knows what she's doing.\n\nShe's the one you should ask if you have any questions. She lives in the big double-bulb.

Source: They shattered the crystal into five shards. I need you to recover the crystal shards  for me.
Target: They shattered the crystal into five shards. I need you to recover the crystal shards  for me.

Source: Well, as it turns out, we're fresh out of parts. Rat parts, I mean. \n\nI need you to bring us the head, legs, body, and tail from four different rats, so we can combine them into an animated rodent assemblage!
Target: Well, as it turns out, we're fresh out of parts. Rat parts, I mean. \n\nI need you to bring us the head, legs, body, and tail from four different rats, so we can combine them into an animated rodent assemblage!

Source: Collect the five shards, so that my wizard might repair and secure the crystal.
Target: Collect the five shards, so that my wizard might repair and secure the crystal.

Source: I know where to find one of these stones—a great mundus stone dedicated to the Celestial Warrior.\n\nBut it's locked deep in the ruins of Kardala. Only a Skystone amulet, the kind worn by ancient Nedic priests, can open the way.
Target: I know where to find one of these stones—a great mundus stone dedicated to the Celestial Warrior.\n\nBut it's locked deep in the ruins of Kardala. Only a Skystone amulet, the kind worn by ancient Nedic priests, can open the way.

Source: A researcher. Very bright, but often too absorbed in his work, if you ask me. Still, I like to help him when I can. Right now, he's on the trail of … oh, it's better if you just ask him about it. \n\nI'd just get it all wrong.
Target: A researcher. Very bright, but often too absorbed in his work, if you ask me. Still, I like to help him when I can. Right now, he's on the trail of … oh, it's better if you just ask him about it. \n\nI'd just get it all wrong.

Target: Not for me to say. <<1>> can tell you what she needs. Stay vigilant, citizen.

Target: The initiates of Rahni'Za prove their mastery by completing five increasingly arduous tests of strength and skill. \n\nI do not know how he did it, but the betrayer overcame the trials and killed Master Timen.

Target: Crouch low and look for traces of its passing. Mammoths aren't the most graceful creatures. Look for tracks, broken branches and the like. \n\nTrack it, kill it, and bring me its tusk as proof.

Source: Yes, please cut me loose. And I'll meet you outside the camp.
Target: Yes, please cut me loose. And I'll meet you outside the camp.

Target: The temple door can be opened by activating beams in the surrounding ruins.\n\nWe need to find the source of the beams and activate them to open the door. But we must be careful, as powerful Anka-Ra surely guard these locations.

Target: Outside of town, dark shamans disturb the dead, imbuing their bodies with corruption. Use this talisman to draw out the magicka and return the dead to peace. See me when the talisman is full.

Source: All I know is that anyone who drinks the water gets strong—really strong—and then attacks anything that moves.\n\nOur leader, Sali'ma, is inside, looking for a way to end the curse and save our researchers. If you want to help, talk to him.
Target: All I know is that anyone who drinks the water gets strong—really strong—and then attacks anything that moves.\n\nOur leader, Sali'ma, is inside, looking for a way to end the curse and save our researchers. If you want to help, talk to him.

Source: We're at war. We can't have Pact sympathizers plotting in the shadow of <<1>>.\n\nLook, <<2>> wants outside help to "resolve the Argonian issue." You can find her by the main entrance.
Target: We're at war. We can't have Pact sympathizers plotting in the shadow of <<1>>.\n\nLook, <<2>> wants outside help to \\"resolve the Argonian issue.\"\" You can find her by the main entrance."

Source: Well if you want the Supernal Dreamers to rule the wrld, then no. Otherwise free me.

Target: I'll head into the mine and do what I can.

Target: Thanks, I may do that.

Target: It won't be easy. But you look like you can handle yourself. \n\nDo you know how to track? Crouch low to the ground and look carefully. You'll see signs of the troll's passing. Track it and kill it, and bring me its arm as proof.

Target: That's what I need you to learn.\n\nA conjurer named Kelmen Locke was present when the atronachs were first summoned. When they turned, his fellow summoners were killed. He was the only one to escape, and I fear he is in grave danger.

Target: Piqued your interest, have I? Capital.\n\nMy brother Benar and I share ownership of the mine, but I suspect he's hiding something from me. The little weasel's even locked down the entrance. Only his personal guards are allowed inside.

Target: Well, how about you kill him?

Source: In all my long years, the thought of death has rarely troubled me. But thanks to Savarak, I've gained new perspective. My illness took me to the brink of the void. The tip of the scythe.\n\nSomeday I may welcome death, but for now, steps must be taken.
Target: In all my long years, the thought of death has rarely troubled me. But thanks to Savarak, I've gained new perspective. My illness took me to the brink of the void. The tip of the scythe.\n\nSomeday I may welcome death, but for now, steps must be taken.

Source: Find and kill Remelie, the leader of the Supernal Dreamers. That should send them fleeing back to Stormhaven.
Target: Find and kill Remelie, the leader of the Supernal Dreamers. That should send them fleeing back to Stormhaven.

Source: Not at all, fangless. This isn't the first time Cloggg has misappropriated my bongos.
Target: Not at all, fangless. This isn't the first time Cloggg has misappropriated my bongos.

Source: I'll do it!
Target: I'll do it!

Source: Wood Elf immigrants to Auridon introduced the locals of <<1>> to Mud Ball Merriment. \n\nIt is as you'd expect—mud balls thrown at everyone. But each year, there is a specific target the Wood Elves agree most needs to be humbled.
Target: Wood Elf immigrants to Auridon introduced the locals of <<1>> to Mud Ball Merriment. \n\nIt is as you'd expect—mud balls thrown at everyone. But each year, there is a specific target the Wood Elves agree most needs to be humbled.

Target: Yes, you have to stop him.

Source: The new wizard-magistrate. When Mistress Dratha fell ill, House Telvanni put Savarak in charge of Vos. It was all honey and orchids for a time, but not anymore.\n\nThe people are desperate for Dratha to return. I'm beginning to lose hope.
Target: The new wizard-magistrate. When Mistress Dratha fell ill, House Telvanni put Savarak in charge of Vos. It was all honey and orchids for a time, but not anymore.\n\nThe people are desperate for Dratha to return. I'm beginning to lose hope.

Source: Oh, what does an outlander know about the complexities of Dunmeri love …? But you're only trying to help and maybe I do need a simpler perspective.\n\nHow does an outlander convince an overbearing mother that the object of their affection is worthy?
Target: Oh, what does an outlander know about the complexities of Dunmeri love …? But you're only trying to help and maybe I do need a simpler perspective.\n\nHow does an outlander convince an overbearing mother that the object of their affection is worthy?

Source: I'm … I'm fine, adept. I'm just tired. It's become very draining to translate these tomes. Don't worry about me. I can open the portal to the Isles for you straight away. Shalidor should be waiting. If you'll allow me?
Target: I'm … I'm fine, adept. I'm just tired. It's become very draining to translate these tomes. Don't worry about me. I can open the portal to the Isles for you straight away. Shalidor should be waiting. If you'll allow me?

Source: Once, very briefly, the city of <<1>> decreed dancing to be illegal. The Dark Elves promptly invented the Lava Foot Stomp, which they called a necessity should their boots ever catch aflame.\n\nThey practiced it in taverns, while wearing a small pin.
Target: Once, very briefly, the city of <<1>> decreed dancing to be illegal. The Dark Elves promptly invented the Lava Foot Stomp, which they called a necessity should their boots ever catch aflame.\n\nThey practiced it in taverns, while wearing a small pin.

Source: Khajiit of <<1>> honor their trickster god Rajhin with the Trial of Five-Clawed Guile.\n\nTravel to Reaper's March and speak with <<2>>. She'll help you celebrate the New Life with the slightest of hand!
Target: Khajiit of <<1>> honor their trickster god Rajhin with the Trial of Five-Clawed Guile.\n\nTravel to Reaper's March and speak with <<2>>. She'll help you celebrate the New Life with the slightest of hand!

Source: Why come to me for help?
Target: Why come to me for help?

Source: That's what I said—a witch! Oh, she might look like a Dark Elf, but don't let that heaving bosom fool you! I agreed to escort her to Vivec City. Then last night she went crazy and started throwing spells around.\n\nShe bewitched me when I ran away!
Target: That's what I said—a witch! Oh, she might look like a Dark Elf, but don't let that heaving bosom fool you! I agreed to escort her to Vivec City. Then last night she went crazy and started throwing spells around.\n\nShe bewitched me when I ran away!

Source: Molag Bal? I'll make him stop.
Target: Molag Bal? I'll make him stop.

Source: All right. I'll take word to Commander Ahla.
Target: All right. I'll take word to Commander Ahla.

Source: Redguards of <<1>> have the Signal Fire Sprint. It honors an ancestor who saved their city from certain doom, a true gift of New Life.\n\nGo there, to the Alik'r Desert, and speak with <<2>>. She can explain!
Target: Redguards of <<1>> have the Signal Fire Sprint. It honors an ancestor who saved their city from certain doom, a true gift of New Life.\n\nGo there, to the Alik'r Desert, and speak with <<2>>. She can explain!

Source: Yes, I want to be one of the Undaunted.
Target: Yes, I want to be one of the Undaunted.

Source: The Rule of Three?
Target: The Rule of Three?

Source: We need to tell Sotha Sil that the Ritemaster is dead.
Target: We need to tell Sotha Sil that the Ritemaster is dead.

Source: He doesn't know what the words mean?
Target: He doesn't know what the words mean?

Source: I'll go talk to Razum-dar.
Target: I'll go talk to Razum-dar.

Source: Someone has to tell Ordinator Kilao what happened here. You appear to be available for the job. \n\nI'm sure we'll run into each other again. Hopefully, it won't be because your name's on a contract.
Target: Someone has to tell Ordinator Kilao what happened here. You appear to be available for the job. \n\nI'm sure we'll run into each other again. Hopefully, it won't be because your name's on a contract.

Source: So Brengas and Niralin were captured by these werewolves?
Target: So Brengas and Niralin were captured by these werewolves?

Source: Where can I find the Ritemaster?
Target: Where can I find the Ritemaster?

Source: Get my books back! Her nightmares crawled all over the shelves, pulled out anything that referenced herself or her Dreamers. Now they're out there in the cold, getting ratty.
Target: Get my books back! Her nightmares crawled all over the shelves, pulled out anything that referenced herself or her Dreamers. Now they're out there in the cold, getting ratty.

Source: I do. The workers have rest camps in between the johads. If someone brought in this poison, there may be evidence of it there.\n\nIf you can find something of import, bring it to me. I'll be at the main johad down the road.
Target: I do. The workers have rest camps in between the johads. If someone brought in this poison, there may be evidence of it there.\n\nIf you can find something of import, bring it to me. I'll be at the main johad down the road.

Source: You mean … you would go and get the Tear of Anurraame for me?\n\nYes. Of course. If you'll go get the Tear and bring it back to Magister Wulfdis in Shornhelm, that would show the old bastard. I think I could even claim credit.
Target: You mean … you would go and get the Tear of Anurraame for me?\n\nYes. Of course. If you'll go get the Tear and bring it back to Magister Wulfdis in Shornhelm, that would show the old bastard. I think I could even claim credit.

Source: I should find a navigator and take a boat to Summerset.
Target: I should find a navigator and take a boat to Summerset.

Source: Get me books back! Her nightmares crawled all over the shelves, pulled out anything that referenced herself or her Dreamers. Now they're out there in the cold, getting ratty.
Target: Get me books back! Her nightmares crawled all over the shelves, pulled out anything that referenced herself or her Dreamers. Now they're out there in the cold, getting ratty.

Source: They're appearing all across Deshaan. Even Narsis is in danger.\n\nI need to stay here and finish my investigation. If you're heading south, would you carry a message to Guard Verilu at Narsis? She needs to know what happened here.
Target: They're appearing all across Deshaan. Even Narsis is in danger.\n\nI need to stay here and finish my investigation. If you're heading south, would you carry a message to Guard Verilu at Narsis? She needs to know what happened here.

Source: Sounds crazy, but I know what I saw.\n\nI overheard the villagers talking about a caretaker, and a tree. Maybe you could find this tree and discover what they want? I hope they're not invaders. It's much too freakish for my blood.
Target: Sounds crazy, but I know what I saw.\n\nI overheard the villagers talking about a caretaker, and a tree. Maybe you could find this tree and discover what they want? I hope they're not invaders. It's much too freakish for my blood.

Source: As you say.
Target: As you say.

Source: Your first priority: get pressure off of the troops. Help out the soldiers on the front lines, as best you can. Then locate <<1>>. We can't lose another capable officer.
Target: Your first priority: get pressure off of the troops. Help out the soldiers on the front lines, as best you can. Then locate <<1>>. We can't lose another capable officer.

Source: My dying wish. I want them to pay. The leaders of the three tribes here—Boneshaper, Rageclaw, Stonetalon. Kill them … and raise the Pact banner at the top of the hill. For me, please.
Target: My dying wish. I want them to pay. The leaders of the three tribes here—Boneshaper, Rageclaw, Stonetalon. Kill them … and raise the Pact banner at the top of the hill. For me, please.

Source: I'm a tree. But I think. I feel. How? Other trees have no such faculties, do they?\n\nI even have memories. Movement. Walking. A cave … but then nothing. There's something about the cave. It's near. Will you search inside for the answers I have lost?
Target: I'm a tree. But I think. I feel. How? Other trees have no such faculties, do they?\n\nI even have memories. Movement. Walking. A cave … but then nothing. There's something about the cave. It's near. Will you search inside for the answers I have lost?

Source: What's your better plan?
Target: What's your better plan?

Source: The Bretons of <<1>> have a curious tradition called the Castle Charm Challenge.\n\nLong ago, after a terrible war, the steward declared a contest. Any performer who most delighted the castle's survivors would win great renown.
Target: The Bretons of <<1>> have a curious tradition called the Castle Charm Challenge.\n\nLong ago, after a terrible war, the steward declared a contest. Any performer who most delighted the castle's survivors would win great renown.

Source: I don't know! They poured out of the ground. The soldiers rushed me back to camp, and now I'm the only one remaining.\n\n<<1>> won't let me venture from the camp, but you have no such restriction. Please, find my acolytes! Some must still live!
Target: I don't know! They poured out of the ground. The soldiers rushed me back to camp, and now I'm the only one remaining.\n\n<<1>> won't let me venture from the camp, but you have no such restriction. Please, find my acolytes! Some must still live!

Source: And if I can handle more?
Target: 더 할 일은요?

Source: Is that all?
Target: 그게 전부에요?

Source: Is that all?
Target: 그게 전부에요?

Source: I'll go to Dragonstar and look for Regent Cassipia.
Target: I'll go to Dragonstar and look for Regent Cassipia.

Source: Where can I find Little Leaf?
Target: Where can I find Little Leaf?

Source: Hairy, squirmy, squeaky little rats! They've infested the plantation since the storm.\n\nThe inspectors will ask, if we can't protect our fields from those dung-dropping sugar-eaters, how can we protect them from skooma-brewing thieves?
Target: Hairy, squirmy, squeaky little rats! They've infested the plantation since the storm.\n\nThe inspectors will ask, if we can't protect our fields from those dung-dropping sugar-eaters, how can we protect them from skooma-brewing thieves?

Source: And if I can handle more?
Target: 더 할 일은요?

Source: Very. According to Indaenir, Hectahame guards the Heart of Valenwood. He believes Naemon is corrupting it, and this corruption turns any soldiers we send forth … feral. \n\nIndaenir knows more. He waits for you at the gate.
Target: Very. According to Indaenir, Hectahame guards the Heart of Valenwood. He believes Naemon is corrupting it, and this corruption turns any soldiers we send forth … feral. \n\nIndaenir knows more. He waits for you at the gate.

Source: I want to be certified as a blacksmith.
Target: 저는 대장장이 인증을 받고 싶어요.

Source: Help us get revenge for generations of slavery!\n\nFind Betina Volek. Lure her to her family's townhouse. Bring her there and we will have our revenge.
Target: Help us get revenge for generations of slavery!\n\nFind Betina Volek. Lure her to her family's townhouse. Bring her there and we will have our revenge.

Source: Father tried to save our alchemical tools. If they survived the fire, I could trade them for medicine.\n\nPlease, it's all I can do to keep my father alive. This one begs you to salvage the tools from our storehouses!
Target: Father tried to save our alchemical tools. If they survived the fire, I could trade them for medicine.\n\nPlease, it's all I can do to keep my father alive. This one begs you to salvage the tools from our storehouses!

Source: "Whoever bears proof of Exulus's destruction may claim their reward from Cleric Arvina. We also ask that you retrieve the pauldrons of Arkay's warriors who fell fighting Exulus, so that they may be honored for their sacrifice.\n\n"Arkay bless you!"
Target: \\"Whoever bears proof of Exulus's destruction may claim their reward from Cleric Arvina. We also ask that you retrieve the pauldrons of Arkay's warriors who fell fighting Exulus
column4: so that they may be honored for their sacrifice.\n\n\"\"Arkay bless you!\"\""

Source: No. Our ancestors are sacred. We cannot strike them down, even in such a … state.\n\nWe must know why this has happened before we do anything. I need to get word to King Fahara'jad immediately. Will you travel to Sentinel for me, wayfarer?
Target: No. Our ancestors are sacred. We cannot strike them down, even in such a … state.\n\nWe must know why this has happened before we do anything. I need to get word to King Fahara'jad immediately. Will you travel to Sentinel for me, wayfarer?

Source: Grandmaster Indoril appointed his senior aide to command the Vanguard. I believe the man's name is <<1>>.\n\nKill him. That is the price of affronting the Dres.
Target: Grandmaster Indoril appointed his senior aide to command the Vanguard. I believe the man's name is <<1>>.\n\nKill him. That is the price of affronting the Dres.

Source: I heard a whisper of a sacred Dark Elf performance. Those who performed it splashed in the River of Humor. And the Dark Elves … laughed.\n\nIf you tread the dust of the tomb, will you seek the rite for me?
Target: I heard a whisper of a sacred Dark Elf performance. Those who performed it splashed in the River of Humor. And the Dark Elves … laughed.\n\nIf you tread the dust of the tomb, will you seek the rite for me?

Source: They're searching for a magical relic called a keystone. If they find it, they could cause much havoc in Shadowfen.\n\nMaybe that Kothringi can help us find it before the Dominion does. Could you infiltrate Zuuk and rescue him?
Target: They're searching for a magical relic called a keystone. If they find it, they could cause much havoc in Shadowfen.\n\nMaybe that Kothringi can help us find it before the Dominion does. Could you infiltrate Zuuk and rescue him?

Source: Would you go to Vlastarus and let Angiente know that Munya is dead? I don't dare show up without her. I'll bring her body as soon as I can, but if you'd get word to him, I'd really appreciate it.
Target: Would you go to Vlastarus and let Angiente know that Munya is dead? I don't dare show up without her. I'll bring her body as soon as I can, but if you'd get word to him, I'd really appreciate it.

Source: "A sum of gold has been set aside for anyone capable of destroying the beast known as <<1>> before it escapes to ravage the land. Seizure of company ledgers is also required to complete the job.\n\n"See Laronen with questions or to claim the reward."
Target: \\"A sum of gold has been set aside for anyone capable of destroying the beast known as <<1>> before it escapes to ravage the land. Seizure of company ledgers is also required to complete the job.\n\n\"\"See Laronen with questions or to claim the reward.\"\""

Source: As the mud is my mother, I have no idea. I've been scavenging in Xal Ithix for years. It's not entirely safe, but nothing like this has ever happened.\n\nYou should talk to <<1>>. He's at his hut, at the end of the village. I'm sure he has some idea.
Target: As the mud is my mother, I have no idea. I've been scavenging in Xal Ithix for years. It's not entirely safe, but nothing like this has ever happened.\n\nYou should talk to <<1>>. He's at his hut, at the end of the village. I'm sure he has some idea.

Source: "The source of these intrusions must be discovered and dealt with so that the excavation may resume. Recovery of relics from the abandoned site is also desired.\n\n"Interested parties should make their claims to Finia Sele in Kvatch's Market Square."
Target: \\"The source of these intrusions must be discovered and dealt with so that the excavation may resume. Recovery of relics from the abandoned site is also desired.\n\n\"\"Interested parties should make their claims to Finia Sele in Kvatch's Market Square.\"\""

Target: 좋아요. 어떻게 하는지 알려 주세요.

Source: Do what you want. One of them asked what year it is. I didn't wait to find out if it was a Daedric trick or if I was just crazy.\n\nNone of them followed me outside, thankfully.
Target: Do what you want. One of them asked what year it is. I didn't wait to find out if it was a Daedric trick or if I was just crazy.\n\nNone of them followed me outside, thankfully.

Target: Things that are too important to fall into the hands of the Maulborn. They're in three locked chests, so you'll need to get the keys first.

Source: There is still a source of power left to us: the Tribunal. Perhaps the Three will show us a way through these trying times.\n\nGo to the sanctuary on this floor and pray at the shrine. Perhaps the Tribunal will answer you.
Target: There is still a source of power left to us: the Tribunal. Perhaps the Three will show us a way through these trying times.\n\nGo to the sanctuary on this floor and pray at the shrine. Perhaps the Tribunal will answer you.

Source: The Temple of the Dance at Rawl'kha is central to the March. It is a place of holy worship in the region, and one where the next steps can be taken. I cannot go. I must remain and see to my city. But I wish you bright moons and sharp claws.
Target: The Temple of the Dance at Rawl'kha is central to the March. It is a place of holy worship in the region, and one where the next steps can be taken. I cannot go. I must remain and see to my city. But I wish you bright moons and sharp claws.

Source: Nothing other than the multitude of Dremora sitting on top of them! I could handle this myself, but I didn't want to demoralize the troops by making a spectacle of my awesome battle skills.\n\nBut, you, on the other hand. They're used to that from you.

Target: Go to Vlastarus and look for the laziest person in town. That'll be Klovag. Tell him to get his carcass over here.

Source: Eager and confident. I like that! \n\nI need you to collect blood from the vampires. It's an integral component in the pacification ritual I will perform. Use the blood to mark their lairs. I'll meet you near the Heart when you're finished.
Target: Eager and confident. I like that! \n\nI need you to collect blood from the vampires. It's an integral component in the pacification ritual I will perform. Use the blood to mark their lairs. I'll meet you near the Heart when you're finished.

Source: It gets worse. Legend says that the Missing God is dead. That the Den … it is his body. The great emptiness of the Den is the decaying corpse of a dead god. I don't know … what's that?
Target: It gets worse. Legend says that the Missing God is dead. That the Den … it is his body. The great emptiness of the Den is the decaying corpse of a dead god. I don't know … what's that?

Source: We've been ordered not to discuss the entirety of the situation in public. To prevent panic, you understand.\n\nThe Lady summons you. Go.
Target: We've been ordered not to discuss the entirety of the situation in public. To prevent panic, you understand.\n\nThe Lady summons you. Go.

Source: Not dead, at least not yet. The lamia bit them and carried the four of them off. I'm in over my head.\n\nListen, I have an antivenom kit. Could you go in and see if you can help them? The kit's easy to use. You just need snake venom.
Target: Not dead, at least not yet. The lamia bit them and carried the four of them off. I'm in over my head.\n\nListen, I have an antivenom kit. Could you go in and see if you can help them? The kit's easy to use. You just need snake venom.

Source: It's your skin. If you think you're ready, speak with Grand Warlord Zimmeron. Only he can excuse you from training.\n\nGo to Mirrored-Skin at the Southern Morrowind gate to start training, or see Zimmeron to skip training. Either way, move along.
Target: It's your skin. If you think you're ready, speak with Grand Warlord Zimmeron. Only he can excuse you from training.\n\nGo to Mirrored-Skin at the Southern Morrowind gate to start training, or see Zimmeron to skip training. Either way, move along.

Source: I … I think they got Talania. I saw her stabbed. Decanus and Veranus, though. I think they might still be alive, somewhere deeper in the complex.
Target: I … I think they got Talania. I saw her stabbed. Decanus and Veranus, though. I think they might still be alive, somewhere deeper in the complex.

Source: Confident, aren't we? If you think you don't need training, speak with Grand Warlord Dortene. Only she can excuse you from it.\n\nGo see either Zahreh or Dortene, your choice.
Target: Confident, aren't we? If you think you don't need training, speak with Grand Warlord Dortene. Only she can excuse you from it.\n\nGo see either Zahreh or Dortene, your choice.

Source: I think so, but probably not far. I need to go to the inn. That's where survivors were gathering.
Target: I think so, but probably not far. I need to go to the inn. That's where survivors were gathering.

Source: Speak to the overseer, <<1>>. She knows more of the Goblins and those accursed mines.\n\nDo not trust her completely. She was master here in the terrible time before the Pact.
Target: Speak to the overseer, <<1>>. She knows more of the Goblins and those accursed mines.\n\nDo not trust her completely. She was master here in the terrible time before the Pact.

Source: You'd better; that's what they're here for.  Spend a few minutes using each weapon. Hit the practice dummies with them.\n\nTalk to Looks-Forward and Lirtis if you want more information. See me when you're done.
Target: You'd better; that's what they're here for.  Spend a few minutes using each weapon. Hit the practice dummies with them.\n\nTalk to Looks-Forward and Lirtis if you want more information. See me when you're done.

Source: Shor's bones! What would we do without you? Bring down the ward, and I'll lead the boys in. \n\nGo on ahead and find Walks-in-Ash.
Target: Shor's bones! What would we do without you? Bring down the ward, and I'll lead the boys in. \n\nGo on ahead and find Walks-in-Ash.

Source: I don't know, but <<1>> might. He's been in Xal Ithix as long as I can remember. If anyone knows what's wrong with the swamp, he will.\n\nLook for the tree-minder in his hut. He's usually there, consulting with the elders or communing with the Hist.
Target: I don't know, but <<1>> might. He's been in Xal Ithix as long as I can remember. If anyone knows what's wrong with the swamp, he will.\n\nLook for the tree-minder in his hut. He's usually there, consulting with the elders or communing with the Hist.

Source: He's the sadist who slaughtered innocents and hatchlings. They call him <<1>>. I've seen his filthy banner over their camp.\n\nBurn his banner. Defile his camp. He's too proud to ignore an insult. Cut out his heart, if he has one, and bring it to me.
Target: He's the sadist who slaughtered innocents and hatchlings. They call him <<1>>. I've seen his filthy banner over their camp.\n\nBurn his banner. Defile his camp. He's too proud to ignore an insult. Cut out his heart, if he has one, and bring it to me.

Source: I don't know, but <<1>> might. He's been in Xal Ithix as long as I can remember. If anyone knows what's wrong with the swamp, he will.\n\nLook for the tree-minder in his hut. He's usually there, consulting with the elders or communing with the Hist.
Target: I don't know, but <<1>> might. He's been in Xal Ithix as long as I can remember. If anyone knows what's wrong with the swamp, he will.\n\nLook for the tree-minder in his hut. He's usually there, consulting with the elders or communing with the Hist.

Source: What are you worried about? You have Veloth's Blessing. It's your connection to this world. Believe in yourself and in Veloth. The saint will protect you. \n\nAnd I can't wait to see how all this turns out. Don't disappoint me.
Target: What are you worried about? You have Veloth's Blessing. It's your connection to this world. Believe in yourself and in Veloth. The saint will protect you. \n\nAnd I can't wait to see how all this turns out. Don't disappoint me.

Source: I'll find Titus in Belkarth.
Target: I'll find Titus in Belkarth.

Source: And if I can handle more?
Target: 더 할 일은요?

Source: All right. Tell me what you can certify.
Target: All right. Tell me what you can certify.

Source: Can't you just send him back to his own time?
Target: Can't you just send him back to his own time?

Source: Speak with them, my friend. Perhaps you can earn their trust. One awaits you on the platform in the center of the caldera.\n\nVivec walk with you.
Target: Speak with them, my friend. Perhaps you can earn their trust. One awaits you on the platform in the center of the caldera.\n\nVivec walk with you.

Source: I have a feeling she's going to want your help. Tales of your exploits already spread through Narsis. Find the Argonian, and I'd wager that before you say a word, she asks you to meet with her companions.
Target: I have a feeling she's going to want your help. Tales of your exploits already spread through Narsis. Find the Argonian, and I'd wager that before you say a word, she asks you to meet with her companions.

Source: "Day Eight: No sign of additional inscriptions. I'll need to look elsewhere for clues as to how to open the vault in Razak's Wheel.\n\nThis construct must hold some clue. I should take it apart. There's a loud buzzing behind one of its compartments."
Target: \\"Day Eight: No sign of additional inscriptions. I'll need to look elsewhere for clues as to how to open the vault in Razak's Wheel.\n\nThis construct must hold some clue. I should take it apart. There's a loud buzzing behind one of its compartments.\"\""

Source: A number of Argonian relics are scattered throughout this swamp. I've been told that they're powerful enough to turn the tide of the war in our favor.\n\nI was skeptical, but the Dominion presence here seems to confirm it. We need to get to them first.
Target: A number of Argonian relics are scattered throughout this swamp. I've been told that they're powerful enough to turn the tide of the war in our favor.\n\nI was skeptical, but the Dominion presence here seems to confirm it. We need to get to them first.

Source: You're welcome to try. We need that keystone.\n\nLook for <<1>>, an old Imperial general they left here to rot. He's the prisoners' leader.
Target: You're welcome to try. We need that keystone.\n\nLook for <<1>>, an old Imperial general they left here to rot. He's the prisoners' leader.

Source: They're dead, too … somewhere in here. The Imperials took them away from me.\n\nPlease bury us beneath the tree just outside the cave entrance to the prison. Inter us in the open air, away from this dank place.
Target: They're dead, too … somewhere in here. The Imperials took them away from me.\n\nPlease bury us beneath the tree just outside the cave entrance to the prison. Inter us in the open air, away from this dank place.

Source: <<1>> might be able to help you. He's in the dungeon, foraging for supplies.\n\nHere, let me put this ointment on you. It'll mask your scent from the ferals. But not for long.
Target: <<1>> might be able to help you. He's in the dungeon, foraging for supplies.\n\nHere, let me put this ointment on you. It'll mask your scent from the ferals. But not for long.

Source: No, it is not our way. If her spirit is to return to the Hist, some part of her must be buried properly.\n\nThen she would be reunited with us, even after all this time.
Target: No, it is not our way. If her spirit is to return to the Hist, some part of her must be buried properly.\n\nThen she would be reunited with us, even after all this time.

Source: The Orcs of Betnikh celebrate through the Stonetooth Bash—a constant party, not the repeated punching of faces. Though sometimes there is punching.\n\n<<1>> is an old friend. Seek her out on Betnikh! She will show you.
Target: The Orcs of Betnikh celebrate through the Stonetooth Bash—a constant party, not the repeated punching of faces. Though sometimes there is punching.\n\n<<1>> is an old friend. Seek her out on Betnikh! She will show you.

Source: Ugly business. A deal gone bad.\n\nI work for an Orc-boss named Khartag. We're Ropefish. People smugglers. Slaves pay us out the arse for a trip to the mainland. When the Camonna Tong found out, they wanted in. Khartag told them to tusk off.
Target: Ugly business. A deal gone bad.\n\nI work for an Orc-boss named Khartag. We're Ropefish. People smugglers. Slaves pay us out the arse for a trip to the mainland. When the Camonna Tong found out, they wanted in. Khartag told them to tusk off.

Target: I will go speak to Zohreh.

Source: I'm ready whenever you are.
Target: I'm ready whenever you are.

Source: The Argonians of <<1>> have the Fish Boon Feast, one of Shadowfen's oldest celebrations.\n\nIt's quite simple—those who are able, bring fish. Those who are not, eat fish.
Target: The Argonians of <<1>> have the Fish Boon Feast, one of Shadowfen's oldest celebrations.\n\nIt's quite simple—those who are able, bring fish. Those who are not, eat fish.

Source: The Veiled Heritance attacked some Wood Elves traveling to Naril Nagaia. The Heritance must be using the old ruins for something worth stopping.\n\nThe Wood Elves want justice, and are willing to pay for a pile of Heritance heads.
Target: The Veiled Heritance attacked some Wood Elves traveling to Naril Nagaia. The Heritance must be using the old ruins for something worth stopping.\n\nThe Wood Elves want justice, and are willing to pay for a pile of Heritance heads.

Source: More Veiled Heritance scum spotted in Naril Nagaia. Seems they didn't realize the locals want to have them for lunch.\n\nBring back a pile of their heads—enough for them to notice—and the liver of whoever leads them. That should scare them away.
Target: More Veiled Heritance scum spotted in Naril Nagaia. Seems they didn't realize the locals want to have them for lunch.\n\nBring back a pile of their heads—enough for them to notice—and the liver of whoever leads them. That should scare them away.

Target: The High Elves of <<1>> have the War Orphan's Sojourn. They travel to a temple in the heart of Grahtwood and donate what they can.\n\nI'll mark your map. It's quite simple—give what you are able to give.

Source: Until recently, <<1>> was my tenant. When I learned she used my property to run a skooma operation, she broke into my office and absconded with the deed!\n\nWithout it, the Guard does nothing. They don't believe I own the place! It's a total loss.
Target: Until recently, <<1>> was my tenant. When I learned she used my property to run a skooma operation, she broke into my office and absconded with the deed!\n\nWithout it, the Guard does nothing. They don't believe I own the place! It's a total loss.

Source: Just watching my business fall into ruin! People used to rely on me to heal their children and mend their injuries, but now it's all "Menaldinion this," and "Menaldinion that!" Damned Guild lackey.\n\nHe's even pinning up signs to slander my work!
Target: Just watching my business fall into ruin! People used to rely on me to heal their children and mend their injuries, but now it's all \\"Menaldinion this
column4: \"\" and \"\"Menaldinion that!\"\" Damned Guild lackey.\n\nHe's even pinning up signs to slander my work!"

Source: Ever heard of the caldera north of Balmora? A rather nasty nix-ox has decided to nest there, and it has a craving for the strange mushrooms that grow in the ashy soil. Normally not an issue, but Bravosi Felder is attempting to research the fungus.
Target: Ever heard of the caldera north of Balmora? A rather nasty nix-ox has decided to nest there, and it has a craving for the strange mushrooms that grow in the ashy soil. Normally not an issue, but Bravosi Felder is attempting to research the fungus.

Target: I will help light the braziers.

Source: My outfit specializes in spirit intervention. Investigating hauntings and putting lingering spirits to rest.\n\nSpirits aren't always welcoming though. In cases like our current job, we need someone to watch our backs.
Target: My outfit specializes in spirit intervention. Investigating hauntings and putting lingering spirits to rest.\n\nSpirits aren't always welcoming though. In cases like our current job, we need someone to watch our backs.

Source: Dinor Salvi is having trouble over at the Missir-Dadalit Egg Mine. Seems they had a recent influx of kwama coming in, and now there's far too many for the miners to handle. I heard there's a particularly nasty kwama warrior nestled up with the queen.
Target: Dinor Salvi is having trouble over at the Missir-Dadalit Egg Mine. Seems they had a recent influx of kwama coming in, and now there's far too many for the miners to handle. I heard there's a particularly nasty kwama warrior nestled up with the queen.

Source: Yes. I garden like a caterpillar … one leaf at a time. Even so, I accomplish more in one day than these Dark Elves do in a week. But my words wander.\n\nI bring news from my heart. She wishes to see you in her new dwelling-place.
Target: Yes. I garden like a caterpillar … one leaf at a time. Even so, I accomplish more in one day than these Dark Elves do in a week. But my words wander.\n\nI bring news from my heart. She wishes to see you in her new dwelling-place.

Source: Bandits. I wish all my work were this simple.\n\nI'm investigating some … irregularities in Suran's justice system. The town's lead constable, Marshal Hlaren, may be arresting people without cause. I pray that I'm wrong, but I could use an ally.
Target: Bandits. I wish all my work were this simple.\n\nI'm investigating some … irregularities in Suran's justice system. The town's lead constable, Marshal Hlaren, may be arresting people without cause. I pray that I'm wrong, but I could use an ally.

Target: My wife's remains were sent here, unjustly. She was a good woman. I have to come to see her remains consecrated, but it has proven difficult.\n\nI wonder if you could assist me. If so, come to the gates of the burial grounds, and I will explain.

Source:

Source: Ha! I'm glad I have one of us fooled. The Imperial curs actually have one up on us. They're holding hostages and the king doesn't want their blood on his hands.\n\nI need someone … unofficial … to go in and free the hostages. What do you say?
Target: Ha! I'm glad I have one of us fooled. The Imperial curs actually have one up on us. They're holding hostages and the king doesn't want their blood on his hands.\n\nI need someone … unofficial … to go in and free the hostages. What do you say?

Source: The Mane has fallen and so a new Mane must be chosen. The Moon Hallowed is the one to make that choice. But don't ask me about this. Go to the Moonlit Clearing, north of Senalana. The lunar clergy can answer your questions.

Source: It means you may be the one to walk beside the next Mane. This is a harrowing path and one not lightly taken. Go to the Moonlit Clearing, just north of Senalana. Speak to Priestess Kauzanabi-jo there and she will tell you truly.
Target: It means you may be the one to walk beside the next Mane. This is a harrowing path and one not lightly taken. Go to the Moonlit Clearing, just north of Senalana. Speak to Priestess Kauzanabi-jo there and she will tell you truly.

Target: It means you may be the one chosen by the bright moons to walk beside the next Mane. This is a harrowing path and one not lightly taken. But your role is not for this one to decide. Please, will you pray at the altar? Allow the moons to speak?

Source:

I have a matter of some urgency to discuss with you. The fate of all Tamriel may hang upon this meeting. Find me at the Cloudy Dregs Inn, in Wayrest, and I promise to explain everything.

Yours in Twilight,

Rhea Opacarius, Oracle of Azura"
column4: \n\nI have a matter of some urgency to discuss with you. The fate of all Tamriel may hang upon this meeting. Find me at the Cloudy Dregs Inn

Source: Naryu has responsibilities to tend to. Morag Tong responsibilities. Understand? She left me to keep Veya company, but I'm not very good at spouting words of comfort and solace.\n\nUnless I can kill something. I'm very good at that.
Target: Naryu has responsibilities to tend to. Morag Tong responsibilities. Understand? She left me to keep Veya company, but I'm not very good at spouting words of comfort and solace.\n\nUnless I can kill something. I'm very good at that.

Source: Just so! This one is heartsick without his betrothed. What good is all this food and drink without the one you love to pick it from your teeth?\n\nBut Jorunn is forbidden to see his bride-to-be until the day of our vowels.
Target: Just so! This one is heartsick without his betrothed. What good is all this food and drink without the one you love to pick it from your teeth?\n\nBut Jorunn is forbidden to see his bride-to-be until the day of our vowels.

Target: I don't know what you're talking about.

Source: What's going on in the mine?
Target: What's going on in the mine?

Target: What's happened?

Source: Oh, just a little jaunt over to Daggerfall for some mischief. Poor Emeric had such grand plans for today, but his dour queen will surely have something to say about that!\n\nI'm certain he'll seek out a champion after we arrive. You should volunteer!
Target: Oh, just a little jaunt over to Daggerfall for some mischief. Poor Emeric had such grand plans for today, but his dour queen will surely have something to say about that!\n\nI'm certain he'll seek out a champion after we arrive. You should volunteer!

Source: Tell me what happened.
Target: Tell me what happened.

Source: Time-honored Nord traditions! Fighting, food, foolishness and fortification …! Fun? Close enough. Sometimes Jorunn has trouble wrestling all the great words he knows.\n\nWhen it is Jester's Day, everyone is a child of Skyrim!
Target: Time-honored Nord traditions! Fighting, food, foolishness and fortification …! Fun? Close enough. Sometimes Jorunn has trouble wrestling all the great words he knows.\n\nWhen it is Jester's Day, everyone is a child of Skyrim!

Source: Well, if you must know, it's a celebration in honor of my rival rulers: the Festival of Fools!\n\nDaggerfall is a center of cultural exchange, even backward-silly-idiot-culture. It'll all be quite fun, I assure you.
Target: Well, if you must know, it's a celebration in honor of my rival rulers: the Festival of Fools!\n\nDaggerfall is a center of cultural exchange, even backward-silly-idiot-culture. It'll all be quite fun, I assure you.

Source:
"By decree of your most majestic majesties,
From the depths of their magnificent magnanimity,
Today begins a rule of foolishness and frivolities!
Abolished are concerns of toil, tax, and responsibility,
For this silly season of winsome glee!"
Target: \\"By decree of your most majestic majesties
column4: \nFrom the depths of their magnificent magnanimity
column5: \nToday begins a rule of foolishness and frivolities!\nAbolished are concerns of toil
column8: \nFor this silly season of winsome glee!\"\""

Source: Oh my! An innocence to rival my own! You are so fortunate to learn of the Jester's Festival from someone virtuous as I, and not a cad like Emeric!\n\nHere we put aside decorum to embrace whimsy … and mischief!
Target: Oh my! An innocence to rival my own! You are so fortunate to learn of the Jester's Festival from someone virtuous as I, and not a cad like Emeric!\n\nHere we put aside decorum to embrace whimsy … and mischief!

Source: Off to Ebonheart for a royal roast! There's only one thing I trust Jorunn's expertise in, and that's eating.\n\nYou should join us as a guest of honor!
Target: Off to Ebonheart for a royal roast! There's only one thing I trust Jorunn's expertise in, and that's eating.\n\nYou should join us as a guest of honor!

Source: The Prince of Schemes, the Harvester of Souls. Do not force me to speak his name.  \n\nOne of his Dark Anchors has planted itself in the ruins of what was once the town Gil-Var-Delle. Those who came to destroy it have gone missing. We must find them.
Target: The Prince of Schemes, the Harvester of Souls. Do not force me to speak his name.  \n\nOne of his Dark Anchors has planted itself in the ruins of what was once the town Gil-Var-Delle. Those who came to destroy it have gone missing. We must find them.

Source: I'll blow the horn. Be ready.
Target: I'll blow the horn. Be ready.

Target: What about the others?

Source: Really! That's so kind. Puddles loves day-old fish. You can probably get some at the docks. I hear <<1>> catches more than he can sell. And he has a soft spot for adorable creatures.\n\nAnd take it from me. Nothing is more adorable than my Puddles!
Target: Really! That's so kind. Puddles loves day-old fish. You can probably get some at the docks. I hear <<1>> catches more than he can sell. And he has a soft spot for adorable creatures.\n\nAnd take it from me. Nothing is more adorable than my Puddles!

Target: Why indeed! Rahannal, the thrice-damned traitor, that's why! He wants to overthrow this place now that he's freed himself. \n\nI saw him lurking by the mine entrance to the east. Free me and we will free this place, with or without him!

Source: He's there, or he's dead. If you'd be willing to take on the vampires, take my dog whistle. Xandier's been trained to come straight to anyone that blows it. He's a smart dog … smarter than my husband, sometimes. Xandier will find him for you.
Target: He's there, or he's dead. If you'd be willing to take on the vampires, take my dog whistle. Xandier's been trained to come straight to anyone that blows it. He's a smart dog … smarter than my husband, sometimes. Xandier will find him for you.

Source: That's the thing! No one even knows him. Gavendien—that's his name. He and his bailiff sauntered into town last week, and now he's constable? Something smells wrong. \n\nSay, think you could poke around and try to find out what's really going on?
Target: That's the thing! No one even knows him. Gavendien—that's his name. He and his bailiff sauntered into town last week, and now he's constable? Something smells wrong. \n\nSay, think you could poke around and try to find out what's really going on?

Source: I saw a few soldiers by the windmill. They must be setting up defenses just outside the city.\n\nFind their captain, and do what you can to help him.
Target: I saw a few soldiers by the windmill. They must be setting up defenses just outside the city.\n\nFind their captain, and do what you can to help him.

Source: Let me know if you change your mind.
Target: Let me know if you change your mind.

Source: Who's Tasnasi?
Target: Who's Tasnasi?

Source: You want me to take part in a robbery?
Target: You want me to take part in a robbery?

Source: The kwama miners of Matus-Akin have developed a dangerous breeding method which produces highly aggressive kwama. While their methods are questionable, we would still like to know more. What they've developed may ultimately turn out to be profitable.
Target: The kwama miners of Matus-Akin have developed a dangerous breeding method which produces highly aggressive kwama. While their methods are questionable, we would still like to know more. What they've developed may ultimately turn out to be profitable.

Source: Well, as you can see, they did not like that. They say I know too much, that I cannot just float away down the river. \n\nThey will soon kill me … unless a kind soul like yourself would release me. Then I can go and put down new roots in Shornhelm.
Target: Well, as you can see, they did not like that. They say I know too much, that I cannot just float away down the river. \n\nThey will soon kill me … unless a kind soul like yourself would release me. Then I can go and put down new roots in Shornhelm.

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: First, my assistants from the Mages Guild disappeared without so much as a by-your-leave. Then my useless man-servant, Stibbons, vanished! Said he was going to solve the mystery but now he's disappeared as well. And it's almost tea time. Intolerable!
Target: First, my assistants from the Mages Guild disappeared without so much as a by-your-leave. Then my useless man-servant, Stibbons, vanished! Said he was going to solve the mystery but now he's disappeared as well. And it's almost tea time. Intolerable!

Source: What kind of monster are we talking about?
Target: What kind of monster are we talking about?

Source: Bandits are occupying a cave called Zainsipilu. They're under the delusion that they have access to a monopoly of moon-sugar grasses, a plant that isn't able to naturally grow here in Vvardenfell. We'd like to keep them preoccupied.
Target: Bandits are occupying a cave called Zainsipilu. They're under the delusion that they have access to a monopoly of moon-sugar grasses, a plant that isn't able to naturally grow here in Vvardenfell. We'd like to keep them preoccupied.

Source: Talk to <<1>>. He'll tell you what needs to be done.
Target: Talk to <<1>>. He'll tell you what needs to be done.

Source: What spirit?
Target: What spirit?

Source: Unless the bears' spirits power the wards, we can't enter our own temple. Without the wards, the bears are wild, and we can't reach the altar to ask Hircine why he abandoned us. \n\nCan you kill the bears and free their spirits?
Target: Unless the bears' spirits power the wards, we can't enter our own temple. Without the wards, the bears are wild, and we can't reach the altar to ask Hircine why he abandoned us. \n\nCan you kill the bears and free their spirits?

Source: I'm pretty strong.
Target: I'm pretty strong.

Source: Demented how?
Target: Demented how?

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: Exactly. So I have to choose. Countess Tamrith or Baron Dorell. Frankly, since you've recently fought alongside the two of them, I would appreciate your counsel.\n\nSpeak to them if you wish, think about it, and then give me your recommendation.
Target: Exactly. So I have to choose. Countess Tamrith or Baron Dorell. Frankly, since you've recently fought alongside the two of them, I would appreciate your counsel.\n\nSpeak to them if you wish, think about it, and then give me your recommendation.

Source: So you've been hired to find someone?
Target: So you've been hired to find someone?

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Source: And then there's the personal matter—that damn guillotine. \n\nFor reasons you might recall, I want it demolished. I've given the order to Captain Ernele, but on your way out of Wayrest, I would ask that you ensure it's being done thoroughly.
Target: And then there's the personal matter—that damn guillotine. \n\nFor reasons you might recall, I want it demolished. I've given the order to Captain Ernele, but on your way out of Wayrest, I would ask that you ensure it's being done thoroughly.

Source: My fighters are exhausted, but if you push into the caves and clear out the spiders, we'll use fire to destroy their eggs. If Guardian Sud-Hareem is still alive, we need to find him. \n\nJust don't listen to the whispers. They'll drive you mad!
Target: My fighters are exhausted, but if you push into the caves and clear out the spiders, we'll use fire to destroy their eggs. If Guardian Sud-Hareem is still alive, we need to find him. \n\nJust don't listen to the whispers. They'll drive you mad!

Source: There's one thing I haven't tried yet. There's a flower that's been known to cure a fever. It's called Kyne's Breath. It grows around the rune stones that decorate the grove.\n\nA handful may help save Droi's life. Can you get some for me?
Target: There's one thing I haven't tried yet. There's a flower that's been known to cure a fever. It's called Kyne's Breath. It grows around the rune stones that decorate the grove.\n\nA handful may help save Droi's life. Can you get some for me?

Source: If you're smart, you'll stay away from there. I don't see any good coming out of that place for the foreseeable future. \n\nBut if you really want to help, find Eiraki Frostwind. She's at the fishing camp down the road.
Target: If you're smart, you'll stay away from there. I don't see any good coming out of that place for the foreseeable future. \n\nBut if you really want to help, find Eiraki Frostwind. She's at the fishing camp down the road.

Source: Of course! In addition to attending the Konunleikar, the Pact leaders have important business to attend to. Important business!\n\nNow hurry along. You can find Thane Mera at the center of town, right in front of the Palace of Ysgramor.
Target: Of course! In addition to attending the Konunleikar, the Pact leaders have important business to attend to. Important business!\n\nNow hurry along. You can find Thane Mera at the center of town, right in front of the Palace of Ysgramor.

Source: You can't reason with Daedric witches! We've all suffered losses, but they took my soldiers and turned them into mindless slaves! I can't forgive her for that.\n\nThey need to die! Every last one of them. I … argh! What's wrong with me?
Target: You can't reason with Daedric witches! We've all suffered losses, but they took my soldiers and turned them into mindless slaves! I can't forgive her for that.\n\nThey need to die! Every last one of them. I … argh! What's wrong with me?

Source: Someone was probably, no, definitely drunk.\n\nLook, I didn't think he was really going to do it! I must have passed out because when I woke up he was gone. He's my best friend. You got to help him.
Target: Someone was probably, no, definitely drunk.\n\nLook, I didn't think he was really going to do it! I must have passed out because when I woke up he was gone. He's my best friend. You got to help him.

Source: Rest easy, soldier. I'll find <<1>>.
Target: Rest easy, soldier. I'll find <<1>>.

Source: I'll speak with Priestess Sermenh then.
Target: I'll speak with Priestess Sermenh then.

Source: Maybe I can find out what's going on.
Target: Maybe I can find out what's going on.

Source: Intercept messages and take them to Captain Gilame. Got it.
Target: Intercept messages and take them to Captain Gilame. Got it.

Source: How do I acquire Daedric souls?
Target: How do I acquire Daedric souls?

Source: So the mural is broken?
Target: So the mural is broken?

Source: Meaning what?
Target: Meaning what?

Source: Do you need help escaping?
Target: Do you need help escaping?

Source: "I have a request to cater a themed banquet. The details are included. I'll be in the capital when you're done." — Rolis Hlaalu.
Target: \\"I have a request to cater a themed banquet. The details are included. I'll be in the capital when you're done.\"\" — Rolis Hlaalu."

Source: "Requested: One article of clothing tailored to resemble an adventurer's. Measurements included. Find me when you're finished." — Rolis Hlaalu.
Target: \\"Requested: One article of clothing tailored to resemble an adventurer's. Measurements included. Find me when you're finished.\"\" — Rolis Hlaalu."

Source: "A somewhat terse request for a wooden weapon. I'm sure you'll know what to do." — Rolis Hlaalu.
Target: \\"A somewhat terse request for a wooden weapon. I'm sure you'll know what to do.\"\" — Rolis Hlaalu."

Source: "Requested: One shield 'to satisfy an Orcish parable.' I can tell you no more than that. Find me when you've made it." — Rolis Hlaalu.
Target: \\"Requested: One shield 'to satisfy an Orcish parable.' I can tell you no more than that. Find me when you've made it.\"\" — Rolis Hlaalu."

Source: Good question. You wish to serve the Camoran throne? You can start by asking <<1>> why his people aren't fulfilling their promises. He's the one who seems to have the entire Elden Tree lodged up his flue.\n\nI can say that. I'm the king.
Target: Good question. You wish to serve the Camoran throne? You can start by asking <<1>> why his people aren't fulfilling their promises. He's the one who seems to have the entire Elden Tree lodged up his flue.\n\nI can say that. I'm the king.

Target: \\"This client is looking for a particular glyph for 'academic purposes'. I'll be in the capital when it's ready.\"\" — Rolis Hlaalu."

Source: Truly? Here, this letter outlines our grievances. If you would bring it to the king, we would be in your debt.\n\nUnless you wish to help pull termites from our "embassy."
Target: Truly? Here, this letter outlines our grievances. If you would bring it to the king, we would be in your debt.\n\nUnless you wish to help pull termites from our \\"embassy.\"\""

Target: \\"Some adventurers prefer their plate-and-chain to complete a specific ensemble. Enclosed are the particulars.\"\" — Rolis Hlaalu."

Source: The Stormfist clan hasn't been seen in a decade, but they returned for these games. Since then, there have been numerous injuries and a few deaths. And there are rumors of worse things prowling the shadows.\n\nThe clan stays at the Cold Moon Inn.
Target: The Stormfist clan hasn't been seen in a decade, but they returned for these games. Since then, there have been numerous injuries and a few deaths. And there are rumors of worse things prowling the shadows.\n\nThe clan stays at the Cold Moon Inn.

Source: Shando-ri told me the enchantment on the blade needs to be restored.
Target: Shando-ri told me the enchantment on the blade needs to be restored.

Source: Your farmhands have gone missing?
Target: Your farmhands have gone missing?

Target: \\"Our client needs a particular weapon for an upcoming duel with a family member. Find me when it's done.\"\" — Rolis Hlaalu."

Source: "Final Entry: I finally won the confidence of the troll patriarch, Grimtooth. My work here is done. I wish you could have been here, Gothurg, but I'll see you soon in Shornhelm. I'm going to give Grimtooth a hug goodbye and then I'm on my way."
Target: \\"Final Entry: I finally won the confidence of the troll patriarch
column4: Grimtooth. My work here is done. I wish you could have been here
column5: Gothurg

Source: Maybe I can help.
Target: Maybe I can help.

Source: I want you to enter the next event—the Footrace of the Nine Holds. I name you Windhelm's new Champion. That should confuse our enemies.\n\nIf you're willing, go talk to the race organizer, Lenning. He's along the western wall.
Target: I want you to enter the next event—the Footrace of the Nine Holds. I name you Windhelm's new Champion. That should confuse our enemies.\n\nIf you're willing, go talk to the race organizer, Lenning. He's along the western wall.

Source: Adusa would sniff him out. But for you, something more subtle. Start at the west gate. Find the courier named Guitaut. Follow him. Watch him.\n\nHe will try to pass a message. Watch and see who comes to find it.
Target: Adusa would sniff him out. But for you, something more subtle. Start at the west gate. Find the courier named Guitaut. Follow him. Watch him.\n\nHe will try to pass a message. Watch and see who comes to find it.

Source: Do you think any of their knowledge remains?
Target: Do you think any of their knowledge remains?

Source: All right? I still suffer the bite of the Dark Elves' lash. My egg-kin still eat nothing but kwama-gruel. We wait and wait, and … nothing.\n\nI know my heart works hard to free us, but the sun dips low on the horizon. My people cannot wait forever.
Target: All right? I still suffer the bite of the Dark Elves' lash. My egg-kin still eat nothing but kwama-gruel. We wait and wait, and … nothing.\n\nI know my heart works hard to free us, but the sun dips low on the horizon. My people cannot wait forever.

Source: What does any exile want? Needless to say, to announce his presence in this manner can't bode well for King Jorunn.\n\nThe final event has started in the Hall of Trials. I'll send guards to the camp. You need to go to the hall and help the king!
Target: What does any exile want? Needless to say, to announce his presence in this manner can't bode well for King Jorunn.\n\nThe final event has started in the Hall of Trials. I'll send guards to the camp. You need to go to the hall and help the king!

Source: I just heard pirates attacked <<1>>! I need to head back and see if they ransacked my home.\n\nIf you're here to petition the king, would you bring him my letter? I wasn't boasting, I did fight by his side. My seal will let you bypass the line.
Target: I just heard pirates attacked <<1>>! I need to head back and see if they ransacked my home.\n\nIf you're here to petition the king, would you bring him my letter? I wasn't boasting, I did fight by his side. My seal will let you bypass the line.

Source: But it's a stone mural. How can it play music?
Target: But it's a stone mural. How can it play music?

Source: It gets worse. Legend says that the Missing God is dead. That the Den … it is his body. The great emptiness of the Den is the decaying corpse of a dead god. I don't know if … what's that?
Target: It gets worse. Legend says that the Missing God is dead. That the Den … it is his body. The great emptiness of the Den is the decaying corpse of a dead god. I don't know if … what's that?

Source: Necromancers. Their kind has not been seen in the Alik'r desert for years, but that only makes them more dangerous.\n\nIf you can go to Sentinel and just ensure all is well, it would be a relief. I have made travel arrangements, if you are willing.
Target: Necromancers. Their kind has not been seen in the Alik'r desert for years, but that only makes them more dangerous.\n\nIf you can go to Sentinel and just ensure all is well, it would be a relief. I have made travel arrangements, if you are willing.

Source: The treethane wants his bow back. And if I can't give it to him, he's going to have me hauled in and whipped. \n\nLast I heard, <<1>> was headed toward <<2>>. The treethane won't let me leave town. Could you look for <<1>>?
Target: The treethane wants his bow back. And if I can't give it to him, he's going to have me hauled in and whipped. \n\nLast I heard, <<1>> was headed toward <<2>>. The treethane won't let me leave town. Could you look for <<1>>?

Source: Koruni sent word that she plans to sneak into the central barracks. If you could liberate the soldiers that were captured during the battle, you could assist the lieutenant when she tries to retake the barracks.
Target: Koruni sent word that she plans to sneak into the central barracks. If you could liberate the soldiers that were captured during the battle, you could assist the lieutenant when she tries to retake the barracks.

Source: I think Firaelion hoped to gather their silk to make the dress. Foolish Elf.\n\nThere are stories about a spider the size of a bear and twice as fierce that makes its home there. Oh gods, if something happened to him …..
Target: I think Firaelion hoped to gather their silk to make the dress. Foolish Elf.\n\nThere are stories about a spider the size of a bear and twice as fierce that makes its home there. Oh gods, if something happened to him …..

Source: Nords, if you can believe it. They bear the markings of the Stormfist clan, and they captured a few of our soldiers during the battle.\n\nIf you can set the soldiers free, we can try to take back the barracks. Rendezvous with me there.
Target: Nords, if you can believe it. They bear the markings of the Stormfist clan, and they captured a few of our soldiers during the battle.\n\nIf you can set the soldiers free, we can try to take back the barracks. Rendezvous with me there.

Target: Or what's left of her. Whatever state she's in, please bring her back.

Source: Nothing as yet. I found the ruin crawling with Worm Cultists. I'm just an old man, more at home in books than battle, so there was no way I could reach the Ayleid Well on my own.\n\nStill, I hoped they'd have cleared out by now.
Target: Nothing as yet. I found the ruin crawling with Worm Cultists. I'm just an old man, more at home in books than battle, so there was no way I could reach the Ayleid Well on my own.\n\nStill, I hoped they'd have cleared out by now.

Target: Do you still want to help me?

Source: I fear there will be more. Rumors swirl of a necromancer named Atirion living in Howling Cave, next to the graveyard. I think he's responsible for this.\n\nWould you go there and end this threat?
Target: I fear there will be more. Rumors swirl of a necromancer named Atirion living in Howling Cave, next to the graveyard. I think he's responsible for this.\n\nWould you go there and end this threat?

Source: "Been with the Bitterhand a few days, but I've already earned more gold than I've seen in three months. Sent most of it back to sister … I wish it didn't have to be this way. However I end up in the ground, I go knowing I took care of my family."
Target: \\"Been with the Bitterhand a few days

Target: What's wrong?

Target: What do you want me to do?

Source: You would venture up to Jackdaw Cove? Uela's influence has corrupted everything there. It's wretched, but if you are willing, I will not try to dissuade you.\n\nSearch for my sisters near Jackdaw Cove. Perhaps with your help, Uela can be destroyed.
Target: You would venture up to Jackdaw Cove? Uela's influence has corrupted everything there. It's wretched, but if you are willing, I will not try to dissuade you.\n\nSearch for my sisters near Jackdaw Cove. Perhaps with your help, Uela can be destroyed.

Source: I'll go talk to her.
Target: I'll go talk to her.

Source: The Gray Vipers make their lair in the ruins of Nornalhorst, to the south. These bandits preyed on many of the refugees who made it to Vlastarus. Would you go to the ruins to see if you can recover any stolen items?
Target: The Gray Vipers make their lair in the ruins of Nornalhorst, to the south. These bandits preyed on many of the refugees who made it to Vlastarus. Would you go to the ruins to see if you can recover any stolen items?

Source: No idea. He went to scout around and hasn't come back yet. Maybe you could go find him.\n\nWe did learn that they're using soldiers to keep people away from Northpoint. Only the officers seem to know what's going on inside, though.
Target: No idea. He went to scout around and hasn't come back yet. Maybe you could go find him.\n\nWe did learn that they're using soldiers to keep people away from Northpoint. Only the officers seem to know what's going on inside, though.

Source: The Nords usually do this for me, but they got distracted. Happens all the time. Probably the mead they never stop guzzling. \n\nHere's a torch. Use a campfire to light it. Then light the fires near the south and east gates.
Target: The Nords usually do this for me, but they got distracted. Happens all the time. Probably the mead they never stop guzzling. \n\nHere's a torch. Use a campfire to light it. Then light the fires near the south and east gates.

Target: \\"The darkness grows within me. I have been chosen for a sacred duty. I just wish … my dear Kala. My dear sister. I wish I could see you again in sweet S'ren-ja. I know I can hold this thing here

Source: Not infected. Chosen. But we can't talk about this here. Too public.\n\nHere, take the scent from my glove. Embrace your new gift and follow the scent to our packmaster, Songamdir. He'll teach you the ways of the hunt, the ways of the pack.

Target: You think it's just an elaborate suicide plot? Afraid I don't share your optimism. But what is she doing in there? I'd say \\"only the gods know\"\"
