column5: there's only one way to find out."

Source: Caves are often homes to such spiders. If you release me, it will likely feel the webs twitch, and present itself to you. \n\nFree me, then please help me locate <<1>>. He should not be left alone for very long.
Target: Caves are often homes to such spiders. If you release me, it will likely feel the webs twitch, and present itself to you. \n\nFree me, then please help me locate <<1>>. He should not be left alone for very long.

Source: I'm here to rescue Captain Lerisa of the Maiden's Breath.
Target: I'm here to rescue Captain Lerisa of the Maiden's Breath.

Source: <The crumpled wanted poster is barely legible through smeared blood. It calls for the head of the Orc Sgolag, last spotted near Mobar Mine. He is wanted for theft, murder, and abduction. A reward is offered by <<1>> in <<2>>.>
Target: <The crumpled wanted poster is barely legible through smeared blood. It calls for the head of the Orc Sgolag, last spotted near Mobar Mine. He is wanted for theft, murder, and abduction. A reward is offered by <<1>> in <<2>>.>

Source: If there's a portal—and I'll eat my armor if there isn't—we need to seal it before reinforcements arrive. \n\nA lone scout will have an easier time than a full force. We don't have the numbers to face them head-on anyway.
Target: If there's a portal—and I'll eat my armor if there isn't—we need to seal it before reinforcements arrive. \n\nA lone scout will have an easier time than a full force. We don't have the numbers to face them head-on anyway.

Source: Well, there you have it. Thievery and desecration. Still, these orders seem to imply there's more to it than that. \n\nPerhaps you could go below, return these items, and make sure everything is all right. The entrance is behind this building.
Target: Well, there you have it. Thievery and desecration. Still, these orders seem to imply there's more to it than that. \n\nPerhaps you could go below, return these items, and make sure everything is all right. The entrance is behind this building.

Source: If you wish to reject it, a wretched priest of Arkay will gladly take your coin to do so.\n\nOtherwise, listen to the blood that pulses through you. Let it guide you to Rahaja. She will show you the way to Mother Lamae's embrace.
Target: If you wish to reject it, a wretched priest of Arkay will gladly take your coin to do so.\n\nOtherwise, listen to the blood that pulses through you. Let it guide you to Rahaja. She will show you the way to Mother Lamae's embrace.

Source: We had visitors yesterday. Some of them looked pretty shifty. Jurana thought they might be bandits. After they left, I noticed that my banner was missing.\n\nThere's a bandit camp in the old towers west of here. Would you go look for my banner?
Target: We had visitors yesterday. Some of them looked pretty shifty. Jurana thought they might be bandits. After they left, I noticed that my banner was missing.\n\nThere's a bandit camp in the old towers west of here. Would you go look for my banner?

Source: I wouldn't know. I've been relieved of duty. The Lion Guard has taken over the investigation. One of their officers, a Lieutenant Harim, went to scout out the lighthouse. \n\nOh, what if the Duke has been killed? How will I be able to live with that?
Target: I wouldn't know. I've been relieved of duty. The Lion Guard has taken over the investigation. One of their officers, a Lieutenant Harim, went to scout out the lighthouse. \n\nOh, what if the Duke has been killed? How will I be able to live with that?

Source: I'm in.
Target: I'm in.

Source: They were everywhere. All around us! There were so many of them. I—\n\nBy the Three! Look out!
Target: They were everywhere. All around us! There were so many of them. I—\n\nBy the Three! Look out!

Source: It's your neck, I guess. Burroot Mine isn't far—just at the bottom of the waterfall. \n\nBut my campsite was deep inside the mine, near the bottom, where the kwama nests were. That's where I left the notes.
Target: It's your neck, I guess. Burroot Mine isn't far—just at the bottom of the waterfall. \n\nBut my campsite was deep inside the mine, near the bottom, where the kwama nests were. That's where I left the notes.

Source: I'll try.
Target: I'll try.

Source: Just have my money ready.
Target: Just have my money ready.

Source: Anything else?
Target: Anything else?

Source: What type of training did you have in mind?
Target: What type of training did you have in mind?

Source: Any idea what the high priestess wants us to do?
Target: Any idea what the high priestess wants us to do?

Source: What type of training did you have in mind?
Target: What type of training did you have in mind?

Source: Where is Iokkas now?
Target: Where is Iokkas now?

Source: You want me to be your valet?
Target: You want me to be your valet?

Source: We've no time to request help from our troops in <<1>>, and the soldiers will die unless someone saves them.\n\nThe spiders trussed their victims up and dragged them deeper into the ruins. We'll pay you for your help.
Target: We've no time to request help from our troops in <<1>>, and the soldiers will die unless someone saves them.\n\nThe spiders trussed their victims up and dragged them deeper into the ruins. We'll pay you for your help.

Source: Tell me more.
Target: Tell me more.

Source: Opportunity! Or that's what I thought, until I angered Divayth Fyr by failing to deliver the special mushrooms he ordered on time. Lost the shipment.\n\nNow I'm in a bind. I have the mushrooms, but I'm afraid Fyr will evaporate me for late delivery.
Target: Opportunity! Or that's what I thought, until I angered Divayth Fyr by failing to deliver the special mushrooms he ordered on time. Lost the shipment.\n\nNow I'm in a bind. I have the mushrooms, but I'm afraid Fyr will evaporate me for late delivery.

Source: Those cultists need to be taught a lesson!  Kill them and take what's left of my Crystal back.  I'll get my personal wizard to put it back together…
Target: Those cultists need to be taught a lesson!  Kill them and take what's left of my Crystal back.  I'll get my personal wizard to put it back together…

Source: We need anyone who can lift a sword or cast a spell to travel to the Front and join in the fighting.\n\nReport to Cyrodiil right away. I can even teleport you there. Speak with <<1>>. She'll give you your orders.
Target: We need anyone who can lift a sword or cast a spell to travel to the Front and join in the fighting.\n\nReport to Cyrodiil right away. I can even teleport you there. Speak with <<1>>. She'll give you your orders.

Source: Splendid! Now that he's finished grieving for that harpy, Ralasa, I mean. He even paid me a compliment! Something like, "I suppose you're not totally useless." It's a start!\n\nI won't keep you. I'm sure you have much to discuss with Sun-in-Shadow.
Target: Splendid! Now that he's finished grieving for that harpy, Ralasa, I mean. He even paid me a compliment! Something like, \\"I suppose you're not totally useless.\"\" It's a start!\n\nI won't keep you. I'm sure you have much to discuss with Sun-in-Shadow."

Source: Oh, stranger, you are kind beyond measure. \n\nI called upon Adeena's twin sister, Izzara, two days ago. She's a powerful mage, you see? I thought she'd deal with the monster and be back by sundown. But she still has not returned.
Target: Oh, stranger, you are kind beyond measure. \n\nI called upon Adeena's twin sister, Izzara, two days ago. She's a powerful mage, you see? I thought she'd deal with the monster and be back by sundown. But she still has not returned.

Source: Start with Thane Harvald. He's a close friend of my father's. If any of the thanes can be counted on, it's Harvald.
Target: Start with Thane Harvald. He's a close friend of my father's. If any of the thanes can be counted on, it's Harvald.

Source: The Daedra cast some kind of ward on the door. A clever but futile gesture.\n\nThe barrier is powered by an Ayleid spell key. A simple relic, easily dealt with. Unfortunately it's being protected by several focus stones. Destroy them so we can get in.
Target: The Daedra cast some kind of ward on the door. A clever but futile gesture.\n\nThe barrier is powered by an Ayleid spell key. A simple relic, easily dealt with. Unfortunately it's being protected by several focus stones. Destroy them so we can get in.

Source: "Gratitude is its own reward," I once told the crowds in Ebonheart. But I've found that some of my followers appreciate something more tangible.\n\nHelp me reward those who aided in the saving of Vvardenfell so we can reassure my people.
Target: \\"Gratitude is its own reward
column4: \"\" I once told the crowds in Ebonheart. But I've found that some of my followers appreciate something more tangible.\n\nHelp me reward those who aided in the saving of Vvardenfell so we can reassure my people."

Source: First we gather baskets of fresh apples and bags of hearty grain, then we burn them on the sacrifical altar, in his honor. \n\nAfter that, comes the feast! Help us gather the offering and I'll see that you get a seat of honor!
Target: First we gather baskets of fresh apples and bags of hearty grain, then we burn them on the sacrifical altar, in his honor. \n\nAfter that, comes the feast! Help us gather the offering and I'll see that you get a seat of honor!

Source: Go into the camp and find Captain Janeve. I saw Countess Tamrith and Darien head in there, too\n\nYou need to warn her. Let her know that Reezal-Jul is still out there. He's going to be drawn to the refugees like a wild boar to mud.
Target: Go into the camp and find Captain Janeve. I saw Countess Tamrith and Darien head in there, too\n\nYou need to warn her. Let her know that Reezal-Jul is still out there. He's going to be drawn to the refugees like a wild boar to mud.

Source: Where are these scrolls now?
Target: Where are these scrolls now?

Source: My twin and I are apprentices to the great Divayth Fyr. I'm here on his behalf, to report to the priests about an incident which occurred near the growth site of his new tower, Tel Fyr.
Target: My twin and I are apprentices to the great Divayth Fyr. I'm here on his behalf, to report to the priests about an incident which occurred near the growth site of his new tower, Tel Fyr.

Source: A mage crafted this crystal. It is attuned to the flame atronachs at <<1>> and will absorb their essences. When you kill an atronach, the crystal does the rest. Will you take it and rid us of some of these atronachs?
Target: A mage crafted this crystal. It is attuned to the flame atronachs at <<1>> and will absorb their essences. When you kill an atronach, the crystal does the rest. Will you take it and rid us of some of these atronachs?

Source: We need to sneak in slowly, one at a time. Wandering around as a group would just be inviting trouble.\n\nThe tunnel is supposed to lead through the lighthouse. We need to get inside and find a place we can use to get the lay of the land.
Target: We need to sneak in slowly, one at a time. Wandering around as a group would just be inviting trouble.\n\nThe tunnel is supposed to lead through the lighthouse. We need to get inside and find a place we can use to get the lay of the land.

Source: What can I do?
Target: What can I do?

Source: Until recently, <<1>> was my tenant. When I learned she used my property to run a skooma operation, she broke into my office and absconded with the deed!\n\nWithout it, the Guard does nothing. They don't believe I own the place! It's a total loss.
Target: Until recently, <<1>> was my tenant. When I learned she used my property to run a skooma operation, she broke into my office and absconded with the deed!\n\nWithout it, the Guard does nothing. They don't believe I own the place! It's a total loss.

Source: What type of training did you have in mind?
Target: What type of training did you have in mind?

Source: What type of training did you have in mind?
Target: What type of training did you have in mind?

Source: The Stormfists captured the giants' mammoths. They plan to use them against Fort Amol. If you oppose the Stormfists, then you are an ally of the big folk.\n\nTake this horn and blow it at the nearby cave. It will summon a giant to your side.
Target: The Stormfists captured the giants' mammoths. They plan to use them against Fort Amol. If you oppose the Stormfists, then you are an ally of the big folk.\n\nTake this horn and blow it at the nearby cave. It will summon a giant to your side.

Source: I'll go get a lizard.
Target: I'll go get a lizard.

Source: I'll defeat them.
Target: I'll defeat them.

Source: Don't worry. I'll cleanse the shrines.
Target: Don't worry. I'll cleanse the shrines.

Source: I'll bring back your partner, or at least the supplies.
Target: I'll bring back your partner, or at least the supplies.

Source: I'll recover the relics, Nenaron.
Target: I'll recover the relics, Nenaron.

Source: I can deal with the enforcers.
Target: I can deal with the enforcers.

Source: I'll find the shard-keys.
Target: I'll find the shard-keys.

Source: How do you plan to deal with the blight?
Target: How do you plan to deal with the blight?

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Source: Within Brackenleaf's Forest. Just outside of <<1>>, bordered by the Long Coast.\n\nOur leader's name is <<2>>. If you choose to seek her out, do yourself a favor. Be respectful, and she'll do the same for you.
Target: Within Brackenleaf's Forest. Just outside of <<1>>, bordered by the Long Coast.\n\nOur leader's name is <<2>>. If you choose to seek her out, do yourself a favor. Be respectful, and she'll do the same for you.

Source: I should talk to <<1>> in Rimmen about what these tasks entail.
Target: I should talk to <<1>> in Rimmen about what these tasks entail.

Source: I should give this talisman to Adara'hai so that she can return it to the Moon-Bishops.
Target: I should give this talisman to Adara'hai so that she can return it to the Moon-Bishops.

Source: Each day I carry a vessel of the waters blessed in this shrine and feed it into that which flows into the darkened vale. Its strength will remind the earth what it once was. But my body grows weak with age even if my resolve holds.\n\nWill you help me?
Target: Each day I carry a vessel of the waters blessed in this shrine and feed it into that which flows into the darkened vale. Its strength will remind the earth what it once was. But my body grows weak with age even if my resolve holds.\n\nWill you help me?

Source: How so?
Target: How so?

Source: We think Fildgor wants to use the dragonshrine to steal Queen Nurnhilde's soul and force the Crown of Freydis to recognize him as the true ruler of Skyrim.\n\nMeet Scout Snowhunter to the north and east. He'll show you how to reach Skuldafn.
Target: We think Fildgor wants to use the dragonshrine to steal Queen Nurnhilde's soul and force the Crown of Freydis to recognize him as the true ruler of Skyrim.\n\nMeet Scout Snowhunter to the north and east. He'll show you how to reach Skuldafn.

Source: Where can I find one?
Target: Where can I find one?

Source: What do you propose?
Target: What do you propose?

Source: I should give this talisman to Adara'hai so that she can return it to the Moon-Bishops.
Target: I should give this talisman to Adara'hai so that she can return it to the Moon-Bishops.

Source: The Dremora killed many of my circle. Their undead bones wander these tunnels, clutching the gems we used in the ceremony. \n\nBring me some of them. If the Dremora is banished, I can use them to prevent him from ever returning to this realm.
Target: The Dremora killed many of my circle. Their undead bones wander these tunnels, clutching the gems we used in the ceremony. \n\nBring me some of them. If the Dremora is banished, I can use them to prevent him from ever returning to this realm.

Source: Grand! If you could, pick up the shipment and bring it back to me.\n\nI'd go myself, but <<1>> and I … well, we're not on the best of terms. A misunderstanding, but hazardous to my health. Tell her you're there for "Treeshade Imports."
Target: Grand! If you could, pick up the shipment and bring it back to me.\n\nI'd go myself, but <<1>> and I … well, we're not on the best of terms. A misunderstanding, but hazardous to my health. Tell her you're there for \\"Treeshade Imports.\"\""

Source: Met some nomad called Zanammu of the Zainab tribe. Smart man. Told me his tribe has done well dealing with outlanders. We Ashlanders aren't quick to change our ways, but perhaps we should try.
Target: Met some nomad called Zanammu of the Zainab tribe. Smart man. Told me his tribe has done well dealing with outlanders. We Ashlanders aren't quick to change our ways, but perhaps we should try.

Source: Ah, you've never been here, have you? This is a temple to the spinners, the Bosmer who make reality with their tales.\n\nLet me take you to <<1>> in <<2>>, and perhaps you'll see why the story must be corrected.
Target: Ah, you've never been here, have you? This is a temple to the spinners, the Bosmer who make reality with their tales.\n\nLet me take you to <<1>> in <<2>>, and perhaps you'll see why the story must be corrected.

Source: It could be were I able to get my hands on the other fragments. Without them, this piece is useless. Still, the fact that the fisherman found it on the shore could be valuable information. Perhaps there are more ruins somewhere off the coast.
Target: It could be were I able to get my hands on the other fragments. Without them, this piece is useless. Still, the fact that the fisherman found it on the shore could be valuable information. Perhaps there are more ruins somewhere off the coast.

Source: These are troubling times. We have the strength and the will to weather any storm, but that does not mean we should turn away potential allies when they make themselves known. If you continue to aid the tribes, perhaps in time I will call you friend.
Target: These are troubling times. We have the strength and the will to weather any storm, but that does not mean we should turn away potential allies when they make themselves known. If you continue to aid the tribes, perhaps in time I will call you friend.

Source: None of us know the area well enough to resolve these matters. Now we're a carnival with nothing but a fortune-teller. Huzzah.\n\nI'd gladly pay the coin provided by the Summerset Cultural Expansion Council to anyone who would help us put on the show.
Target: None of us know the area well enough to resolve these matters. Now we're a carnival with nothing but a fortune-teller. Huzzah.\n\nI'd gladly pay the coin provided by the Summerset Cultural Expansion Council to anyone who would help us put on the show.

Source: "Due to the volume of requests for aid from our loyal citizens, a system of brokering jobs between those in need and those willing to help has been established. See Unel Darano in the Hall of Justice for more information."
Target: \\"Due to the volume of requests for aid from our loyal citizens
column4: a system of brokering jobs between those in need and those willing to help has been established. See Unel Darano in the Hall of Justice for more information.\"\""

Source: It's been a year since the Grahtwood civil war ended. And the Blacksap Rebellion still operates in a city called Cormount north east of here.\n\nWith your help, the Vinedusk can end the rebellion. If you agree, I'll open a portal to a secure location.
Target: It's been a year since the Grahtwood civil war ended. And the Blacksap Rebellion still operates in a city called Cormount north east of here.\n\nWith your help, the Vinedusk can end the rebellion. If you agree, I'll open a portal to a secure location.

Source: The annual gathering at Ald'ruhn is a time to reflect, but also to look forward. Our leaders have noted how strong the Zainab tribe has grown due to their willingness to work with outsiders. They encourage us to do the same.
Target: The annual gathering at Ald'ruhn is a time to reflect, but also to look forward. Our leaders have noted how strong the Zainab tribe has grown due to their willingness to work with outsiders. They encourage us to do the same.

Source: We sighted a ship offshore. I've sent my troops to investigate. If it's the vanguard of an invasion … well, we'll need to evacuate.
Target: We sighted a ship offshore. I've sent my troops to investigate. If it's the vanguard of an invasion … well, we'll need to evacuate.

Source: One grain of sand at a time, my friend. It's true we don't have the troops to go traipsing off into the desert, but one person can scout Hallin's Stand and see if Septima's there.\n\nIf only I had a loyal and capable friend here ….
Target: One grain of sand at a time, my friend. It's true we don't have the troops to go traipsing off into the desert, but one person can scout Hallin's Stand and see if Septima's there.\n\nIf only I had a loyal and capable friend here ….

Source: Not exactly, but now that we're certain the affliction isn't natural, we can pursue a proper solution. I suspect we'll need Chodala's staff.\n\nHow the Ashlander got his hands on Sotha Sil's tool and turned it into a weapon, I have no idea.
Target: Not exactly, but now that we're certain the affliction isn't natural, we can pursue a proper solution. I suspect we'll need Chodala's staff.\n\nHow the Ashlander got his hands on Sotha Sil's tool and turned it into a weapon, I have no idea.

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Source: We guard the ancient burial site of Ouze from those who'd disturb the spirits. But that part of the story's not important yet! You have to save her!\n\nGo along the road. Look for the altar in the water. Please!
Target: We guard the ancient burial site of Ouze from those who'd disturb the spirits. But that part of the story's not important yet! You have to save her!\n\nGo along the road. Look for the altar in the water. Please!

Source: We're tracking a spy. Naruk. He worked for King Fahara'jad until he turned on the Covenant. Now he's inciting war.\n\nKaleen left to meet Sigil, a contact with info on Naruk. They were to meet outside town, off the road. She hasn't come back.
Target: We're tracking a spy. Naruk. He worked for King Fahara'jad until he turned on the Covenant. Now he's inciting war.\n\nKaleen left to meet Sigil, a contact with info on Naruk. They were to meet outside town, off the road. She hasn't come back.

Source: Who is Alkosh?
Target: Who is Alkosh?

Source: I'll get her out.
Target: I'll get her out.

Source: Whatever you say, Razum-dar.
Target: Whatever you say, Razum-dar.

Source: Fine. For the Queen.
Target: Fine. For the Queen.

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: 더 할 일은 없나요?

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Source: I'll investigate. Thank you.
Target: I'll investigate. Thank you.

Source: Maybe I could help.
Target: Maybe I could help.

Source: What if I wanted to help?
Target: What if I wanted to help?

Source: I'd be happy to.
Target: I'd be happy to.

Source: Not sure, but I'll take a look.
Target: Not sure, but I'll take a look.

Source: What can I do to help you?
Target: What can I do to help you?

Source: How?
Target: How?

Source: What's the plan?
Target: What's the plan?

Source: <The fragment is etched with runic symbols you cannot decipher. It appears to be part of a larger tablet.>
Target: <The fragment is etched with runic symbols you cannot decipher. It appears to be part of a larger tablet.>

Source: I'll let you know when I'm ready.
Target: I'll let you know when I'm ready.

Source: Because the fools' password is a combination of letters from the Raiders' names and professions—totally forgotten now.\n\nAll four Raiders are buried here, but their gravestones are worn. I found a few clues. I have coin if you can figure this out.
Target: Because the fools' password is a combination of letters from the Raiders' names and professions—totally forgotten now.\n\nAll four Raiders are buried here, but their gravestones are worn. I found a few clues. I have coin if you can figure this out.

Source: <Turn to the bookmarked page.>
Target: <Turn to the bookmarked page.>

Source: Warlord Lob and his lieutenants have made the arena at the heart of Cradlecrush their headquarters. Use the horn there to sound our attack and strike fear into the invaders' hearts!
Target: Warlord Lob and his lieutenants have made the arena at the heart of Cradlecrush their headquarters. Use the horn there to sound our attack and strike fear into the invaders' hearts!

Source: I'll go speak to her.
Target: I'll go speak to her.

Source: Is there any way I can help?
Target: Is there any way I can help?

Source: My editor gave me a list of other scholars who have gone missing here, presumably to frighten me!\n\nAminyas and Dechery are their names, and I want you to search for their camps and see if they had research I can … cite.
Target: My editor gave me a list of other scholars who have gone missing here, presumably to frighten me!\n\nAminyas and Dechery are their names, and I want you to search for their camps and see if they had research I can … cite.

Source: Do you need me to do anything?
Target: Do you need me to do anything?

Source: <Pull a Writ from the Board.>
Target: <게시판에서 의뢰서를 떼어간다.>

Source: You should join us! It'll be a night to remember. We even have a bard! He was passing by and agreed to perform at the party. \n\nGo talk to Berj Stoneheart, right up the road. He's our overseer. I'm sure he'll let you crash the party.
Target: You should join us! It'll be a night to remember. We even have a bard! He was passing by and agreed to perform at the party. \n\nGo talk to Berj Stoneheart, right up the road. He's our overseer. I'm sure he'll let you crash the party.

Source: Imperial invaders perhaps, giant chains dropping from the sky—or maybe she just got spooked by a crow. Not sure. Anyway, she ran straight through those Daedra, and this one isn't going after that one.\n\nWill you help get her to safety?
Target: Imperial invaders perhaps, giant chains dropping from the sky—or maybe she just got spooked by a crow. Not sure. Anyway, she ran straight through those Daedra, and this one isn't going after that one.\n\nWill you help get her to safety?

Source: Could be anything. Last time this happened, she fled from Wayrest because she thought the rain was dissolving her hide.\n\nJust find her and figure out what she needs. What do you say, walker? Can you do that for me?
Target: Could be anything. Last time this happened, she fled from Wayrest because she thought the rain was dissolving her hide.\n\nJust find her and figure out what she needs. What do you say, walker? Can you do that for me?

Source: By Mauloch, yes. I could use a partner on this one. Like I said, the pickup's out in the Silaseli Ruins.\n\nMeet me out there and we'll make some coin together.
Target: By Mauloch, yes. I could use a partner on this one. Like I said, the pickup's out in the Silaseli Ruins.\n\nMeet me out there and we'll make some coin together.

Source: You're not going to believe it, but I got here, and this stupid mage … well, you better just see for yourself. Follow me.
Target: You're not going to believe it, but I got here, and this stupid mage … well, you better just see for yourself. Follow me.

Source: We guard the ancient burial site of Ouze from those who'd disturb the spirits. But that part of the story's not important yet! You have to save her!\n\nGo along the road. Look for the altar in the water. Please!
Target: We guard the ancient burial site of Ouze from those who'd disturb the spirits. But that part of the story's not important yet! You have to save her!\n\nGo along the road. Look for the altar in the water. Please!

Source: I was a soldier before joining the work crew. My sword and shield saw me through many battles. But I am a shadow of my former self. The creatures took my items and left me to die.\n\nI want my sword and shield with me for my final journey.
Target: I was a soldier before joining the work crew. My sword and shield saw me through many battles. But I am a shadow of my former self. The creatures took my items and left me to die.\n\nI want my sword and shield with me for my final journey.

Source: "Saw <<1>> in <<2>> today—she's the Barkbite chief's third wife. I dropped hints she's in charge because of me, but nothing stuck. She doesn't have a foul bone in her body! Felt wrong to push her, so I wished her a good day. Must be getting soft."
Target: \\"Saw <<1>> in <<2>> today—she's the Barkbite chief's third wife. I dropped hints she's in charge because of me
column4: but nothing stuck. She doesn't have a foul bone in her body! Felt wrong to push her
column5: so I wished her a good day. Must be getting soft.\"\""

Source: I will slay Istraga.
Target: I will slay Istraga.

Source: Good luck on the road.
Target: Good luck on the road.

Source: I will, thanks.
Target: I will, thanks.

Source: I'll do that.
Target: I'll do that.

Source: Thanks.
Target: Thanks.

Source: I'll speak to Commander Ales.
Target: I'll speak to Commander Ales.

Source: Does the Silvenar know what caused this?
Target: Does the Silvenar know what caused this?

Source: You don't seem too worried.
Target: You don't seem too worried.

Source: You want me to get rid of them?
Target: You want me to get rid of them?

Source: <Pull a Writ from the Board.>
Target: <게시판에서 의뢰서를 떼어간다.>

Source: Problems? What kind of problems?
Target: Problems? What kind of problems?

Target: I have an idea, but we must confer with Merric. He's returned to the Earth Forge, to finish work on the Prismatic Core. Aelif is ready to open a portal, take us straight to his side. Are you prepared?

Target: If Shor's willing, yes. I brought a bag of incense to burn as an offering. The bone men got me before I could try the ritual.\n\nYou might have better luck. What do you say?

Source: I fear he is either dead or taken captive. We were attacked by so many, so fast … I tried to find him, but to no avail. I came back to catch my breath.\n\nWith you here, though … I am willing to try again. If you are … that is.
Target: I fear he is either dead or taken captive. We were attacked by so many, so fast … I tried to find him, but to no avail. I came back to catch my breath.\n\nWith you here, though … I am willing to try again. If you are … that is.

Source: I need someone who can get in quietly, grab some wolf's woe, and take it to the hostages. With that plant, the hostages can walk out without attracting the attention of the wolves.\n\nThe hostages are locked in a house, so you also need to find a key.
Target: I need someone who can get in quietly, grab some wolf's woe, and take it to the hostages. With that plant, the hostages can walk out without attracting the attention of the wolves.\n\nThe hostages are locked in a house, so you also need to find a key.

Source: I know! Take my hunting horn. It's upstairs. Then clear the traps and create a diversion. Set something on fire. That should keep the Red Rooks too busy to notice us.\n\nSound the horn to signal us that it's safe. Meanwhile, I'll untie the others.
Target: I know! Take my hunting horn. It's upstairs. Then clear the traps and create a diversion. Set something on fire. That should keep the Red Rooks too busy to notice us.\n\nSound the horn to signal us that it's safe. Meanwhile, I'll untie the others.

Source: Good. Talk to Sasana at-Abbas. She oversees the docks. Tell her what you discovered and she'll help in any way she can.\n\nNow hurry. The King's life is in danger.
Target: Good. Talk to Sasana at-Abbas. She oversees the docks. Tell her what you discovered and she'll help in any way she can.\n\nNow hurry. The King's life is in danger.

Target: The bandit leader, an Orc named Tharkul. He took it. The box only opens if you're a member of the family. I told him but he didn't care. \n\nIf you retrieve it, I can arrange a reward.

Source: Our purpose now is just to get these people out of here. My sisters and I can figure everything else out later.\n\nI can construct a ward to protect the villagers, but my oath prevents me from harming these creatures. I'm at a loss.
Target: Our purpose now is just to get these people out of here. My sisters and I can figure everything else out later.\n\nI can construct a ward to protect the villagers, but my oath prevents me from harming these creatures. I'm at a loss.

Target: I don't know. There might be a way to help the other villagers. A group of women showed up as we fled. Threw spells around and called themselves the Wyrd Sisters.\n\nThey helped us escape. Maybe they know what's going on out there.

Source: A very dangerous artifact is being held in the city of Marbruk—the Staff of Magnus.\n\nQueen Ayrenn wants to make sure the staff does not fall into the wrong hands. She wants a personal representative to make sure the staff is secure.
Target: A very dangerous artifact is being held in the city of Marbruk—the Staff of Magnus.\n\nQueen Ayrenn wants to make sure the staff does not fall into the wrong hands. She wants a personal representative to make sure the staff is secure.

Source: Ah, I see it—that look in your eye. You mean to go in there and break the curse of the Direnni Acropolis, don't you? Ha. You newcomers are an ambitious lot, I'll give you that.\n\nThere's a ghost in there called Lauriel. She's the root of it.
Target: Ah, I see it—that look in your eye. You mean to go in there and break the curse of the Direnni Acropolis, don't you? Ha. You newcomers are an ambitious lot, I'll give you that.\n\nThere's a ghost in there called Lauriel. She's the root of it.

Source: Put simply, I've found records of an ancient temple, somewhere in this very forest. I've come to study what secrets it may hold.\n\nI will warn you, Ebon Stadmont can be tricky to navigate. You'll have to keep a look out.
Target: Put simply, I've found records of an ancient temple, somewhere in this very forest. I've come to study what secrets it may hold.\n\nI will warn you, Ebon Stadmont can be tricky to navigate. You'll have to keep a look out.

Source: Damn it all to Skyrim and back! I don't understand what's delaying my shipment. Artisans Craftworks has such a good reputation—and my own brother runs the place!\n\nWithout that shipment, I'm ruined. Could you help me?
Target: Damn it all to Skyrim and back! I don't understand what's delaying my shipment. Artisans Craftworks has such a good reputation—and my own brother runs the place!\n\nWithout that shipment, I'm ruined. Could you help me?

Source: Yes, I'm sorry.\n\nThe last time I saw him, he was agitated. Scared. I asked him what was wrong, but he left without a word. The guards arrived later. They said he turned himself in—that he was involved in a plot to kill our Sapiarch, Aicantar.
Target: Yes, I'm sorry.\n\nThe last time I saw him, he was agitated. Scared. I asked him what was wrong, but he left without a word. The guards arrived later. They said he turned himself in—that he was involved in a plot to kill our Sapiarch, Aicantar.

Source: The locals call this tower the Aetherian Archive. It was built thousands of years ago, and sealed until crisis struck Craglorn. But the Undaunted and I heard rumors that its door had opened.\n\nWe Undaunted agreed to meet here; climb the Archive.
Target: The locals call this tower the Aetherian Archive. It was built thousands of years ago, and sealed until crisis struck Craglorn. But the Undaunted and I heard rumors that its door had opened.\n\nWe Undaunted agreed to meet here; climb the Archive.

Source: From what I gather, soldiers at Cey-Tarn Keep have been disappearing in the night, only to have their desiccated bodies show up days later. The garrison's completely spooked.\n\nI came to look into it, but the Divine Prosecution beat me here.
Target: From what I gather, soldiers at Cey-Tarn Keep have been disappearing in the night, only to have their desiccated bodies show up days later. The garrison's completely spooked.\n\nI came to look into it, but the Divine Prosecution beat me here.

Target: \\"In the event of enemy forces sighted approaching the mainland
column4: our top priority is to secure Dhalmora's shoreline watchtower and ensure the fires are lit. Delay is death!\n\n—Holgunn One-Eye\"\""

Target: Worse. An acting troupe.\n\nThe House of Reveries may be famous across Summerset, but my brother is one of the most gifted academics of our generation. For him to waste his talents performing for rich nobles is just … irresponsible!

Source: "Do not be worried. You are fitting right in, yes? In this, we are alike."\n\n"But alas, I am a busy Khajiit. I have no time to uncover why the dead rise in <<Ac:1>>. Nor why the Sea Vipers pick through smashed Dominion ships at <<2>>."

Source: I may have unleashed a powerful enchantment on the Academy. Quite by accident, mind you!\n\nThere's this book you see—the Illuminus. I stole just the briefest of peeks. Barely even a peek, honestly. More like a fleeting glimpse!
Target: I may have unleashed a powerful enchantment on the Academy. Quite by accident, mind you!\n\nThere's this book you see—the Illuminus. I stole just the briefest of peeks. Barely even a peek, honestly. More like a fleeting glimpse!

Source: A few insignificant echoes and a name to apply to it, but nothing to tell us who created it or what kind of magic it employs. It isn't Daedric in origin, though, despite the false Aldarch's allegiance.\n\nIt's time to utilize more drastic means.
Target: A few insignificant echoes and a name to apply to it, but nothing to tell us who created it or what kind of magic it employs. It isn't Daedric in origin, though, despite the false Aldarch's allegiance.\n\nIt's time to utilize more drastic means.

Source: My memories return slowly, a little at a time. While you searched for the knight, a memory came back to me. A woman's voice, barely a whisper. Beautiful but speaking in a language I can't understand. Repeating the same words over and over.
Target: My memories return slowly, a little at a time. While you searched for the knight, a memory came back to me. A woman's voice, barely a whisper. Beautiful but speaking in a language I can't understand. Repeating the same words over and over.

Target: Another Sapiarch named Haladan. Emile arrived at the gates of Lillandril carrying Haladan's body and confessed to the crime. But he seemed shocked—confused.\n\nI know Emile better than anyone. He's not capable of something like this, I swear it.

Target: This is the Asylum Sanctorium. A sanctuary for the troubled Saints of old to convalesce, but their hopes of recovery have long past. I simply provide what comfort I can and keep them from harming themselves or others. That too may be beyond me soon.

Target: Water filters are of vital importance to the Halls of Regulation. Failing to replace even one in a timely manner could mean contamination of our reservoir. The repair factotums would normally do this task, but they're currently malfunctioning.

Target: We require someone to replace several commutators within the Halls of Regulation. You'll need to have combat skills, as the repair factotums both refuse to do their work and attack anyone who tries to do it for them.

Source: Ha! Have I few dozen warships lying about?\n\nWe've lost an embarrassing number of vessels in the last few months. Foul weather claimed most of them, but those Maormer de'nts have certainly done their part. It's their pet, you see? Keelsplitter.

Source: Nothing. Just concerned for her is all. Not that she needs looking after. \n\nStill, I know she's taking a lot on going after that Shadow … thing. I'd feel better if she had someone like you by her side.
Target: Nothing. Just concerned for her is all. Not that she needs looking after. \n\nStill, I know she's taking a lot on going after that Shadow … thing. I'd feel better if she had someone like you by her side.

Source: Ominous? No, nothing of the sort. Well, maybe a little of the sort. Depends on how things develop.\n\nThis one has come to Summerset at the behest of Queen Ayrenn. To make sure her decree regarding the opening of the island proceeds as she directed.
Target: Ominous? No, nothing of the sort. Well, maybe a little of the sort. Depends on how things develop.\n\nThis one has come to Summerset at the behest of Queen Ayrenn. To make sure her decree regarding the opening of the island proceeds as she directed.

Target: Where are you headed?

Target: What are we celebrating?

Source: What are we celebrating?
Target: What are we celebrating?

Source: You want me to take care of them for you?
Target: You want me to take care of them for you?

Source: Didn't the Tribunal send you? Well, no matter. I'm just glad you're here.\n\nThis is Serkamora—the Serk. The Llodos plague reached us right before the Maulborn arrived. They claim they're here to help, but I don't trust them.
Target: Didn't the Tribunal send you? Well, no matter. I'm just glad you're here.\n\nThis is Serkamora—the Serk. The Llodos plague reached us right before the Maulborn arrived. They claim they're here to help, but I don't trust them.

Source: Anything else, Lyrrsazhi?
Target: Anything else, Lyrrsazhi?

Source: There is one who might be able to help—the ancient Dark Elf mage, Divayth Fyr. Though we rarely see eye to eye, I must admit that his grasp of Daedric lore is unparalleled.\n\nIf anyone would know more, it's Fyr.
Target: There is one who might be able to help—the ancient Dark Elf mage, Divayth Fyr. Though we rarely see eye to eye, I must admit that his grasp of Daedric lore is unparalleled.\n\nIf anyone would know more, it's Fyr.

Source: Yes, she's down in the big city getting ready for her speech. The kick off to her grand tour of Auridon, you know. \n\nI guess she's due up here with her retinue afterwards. I've been hired to amuse the nobles while they're on the road.
Target: Yes, she's down in the big city getting ready for her speech. The kick off to her grand tour of Auridon, you know. \n\nI guess she's due up here with her retinue afterwards. I've been hired to amuse the nobles while they're on the road.

Source: Ever since our confrontation with the shadow summoner, I've been reaching out with the Obscuros—trying to find our mysterious Daedric artifact.\n\nI have not located it yet, but I did discover something interesting. Divayth Fyr is looking for it too.
Target: Ever since our confrontation with the shadow summoner, I've been reaching out with the Obscuros—trying to find our mysterious Daedric artifact.\n\nI have not located it yet, but I did discover something interesting. Divayth Fyr is looking for it too.

Source: Where are you headed?
Target: Where are you headed?

Source: Yes, our sister city to the south. I've been given a sealed message to deliver into the arms of the Watch. They're to convey it to the Queen's retinue.
Target: Yes, our sister city to the south. I've been given a sealed message to deliver into the arms of the Watch. They're to convey it to the Queen's retinue.

Source: Beyond whatever Daedric horrors the Shadow left in its wake?\n\nThe Cogitum shifted into its strongbox configuration as soon as the alarm sounded. So now we have to contend with inaccessible platforms, hostile factotums, unleashed fabricants ….
Target: Beyond whatever Daedric horrors the Shadow left in its wake?\n\nThe Cogitum shifted into its strongbox configuration as soon as the alarm sounded. So now we have to contend with inaccessible platforms, hostile factotums, unleashed fabricants ….

Source: We wouldn't want just anyone getting in there, would we?\n\nA meeting of this size is no great secret. It's hard enough keeping all the spies and assassins out without laying our doors wide open.
Target: We wouldn't want just anyone getting in there, would we?\n\nA meeting of this size is no great secret. It's hard enough keeping all the spies and assassins out without laying our doors wide open.

Source: It seems I must delay my work for a time.\n\nWhen I reclaimed my shadow, I learned a great deal. Daedric plots. Alliances and betrayals. The return of things lost in time … the loss of things the world thought certain. I have much to do.
Target: It seems I must delay my work for a time.\n\nWhen I reclaimed my shadow, I learned a great deal. Daedric plots. Alliances and betrayals. The return of things lost in time … the loss of things the world thought certain. I have much to do.

Source: I fear it is too late. Once events have progressed to this point, there remains little chance of reversing the process.\n\nConfronting the intruders would be beneficial, but even now, they blaze a trail of destruction toward the Wilderking's throne.
Target: I fear it is too late. Once events have progressed to this point, there remains little chance of reversing the process.\n\nConfronting the intruders would be beneficial, but even now, they blaze a trail of destruction toward the Wilderking's throne.

Source: Portals aren't a common occurrence in the Clockwork City. When Acolyte Variah and I approached to investigate, I had a sudden urge to leap inside. I was able to resist its pull, but Variah stepped through the portal and hasn't returned.
Target: Portals aren't a common occurrence in the Clockwork City. When Acolyte Variah and I approached to investigate, I had a sudden urge to leap inside. I was able to resist its pull, but Variah stepped through the portal and hasn't returned.

Source: None. Lord Seht designed the Cogitum to be virtually impenetrable.\n\nEven so, these Whispering Shadow cultists move through the city unhindered. I don't know how. Perhaps if we discover how they navigate the city, we can use that against them.
Target: None. Lord Seht designed the Cogitum to be virtually impenetrable.\n\nEven so, these Whispering Shadow cultists move through the city unhindered. I don't know how. Perhaps if we discover how they navigate the city, we can use that against them.

Source: What did this person look like?
Target: What did this person look like?

Source: I have been called far worse. But I prefer to think of myself and my companions as gifted. We are not ashamed of our condition. We are not monsters.\n\nNow this is the part where you gasp and ask calmly, "But how can I trust you?"
Target: I have been called far worse. But I prefer to think of myself and my companions as gifted. We are not ashamed of our condition. We are not monsters.\n\nNow this is the part where you gasp and ask calmly, \\"But how can I trust you?\"\""

Target: Is that why you're hiding here?

Source: Short of tearing a bloody swath through Montclair's forces, striking the head off that villainous cur, and putting an end to his wretched army of the screaming dead once and for all?\n\nI don't know. Get word to Baron Dorell. That would be a start.
Target: Short of tearing a bloody swath through Montclair's forces, striking the head off that villainous cur, and putting an end to his wretched army of the screaming dead once and for all?\n\nI don't know. Get word to Baron Dorell. That would be a start.

Source: <<1>>, a rare exception to my general hate of mages, discovered that the runestones here have magical gunk coated on them. You'll need a runelight to figure out where the stuff is sticking, but from there you should be able to just scrape it off.
Target: <<1>>, a rare exception to my general hate of mages, discovered that the runestones here have magical gunk coated on them. You'll need a runelight to figure out where the stuff is sticking, but from there you should be able to just scrape it off.

Source: Alchemy plants aren't exactly easy to come by here, and once we get some we tend not to let them go to waste. That's where the alchemical satchels come in. They can keep the plants fresh for years.\n\n<<1>> can tell you more if you got questions.
Target: Alchemy plants aren't exactly easy to come by here, and once we get some we tend not to let them go to waste. That's where the alchemical satchels come in. They can keep the plants fresh for years.\n\n<<1>> can tell you more if you got questions.

Target: I'll be careful. Is there anything else you need me to do out there?

Source: Vatola Telem's squad. They're scouting the old fort. But I really think we should wait for Naryu.
Target: Vatola Telem's squad. They're scouting the old fort. But I really think we should wait for Naryu.

Target: What does this oracle of Azura want?

Source: I'm looking for a challenge.
Target: I'm looking for a challenge.

Source: I'm looking for a challenge.
Target: I'm looking for a challenge.

Source: You're building a model of Vvardenfell?
Target: You're building a model of Vvardenfell?

Source: You can see the future?
Target: You can see the future?

Source: <Accept mission.>
Target: <Accept mission.>

Source: <Accept mission.>
Target: <Accept mission.>

Source: Oh, drat. Look, it's easier to explain once we're inside the Mnemonic Planisphere. That's where Lord Seht stores his memories by—well, it's just easier to show you first.
Target: Oh, drat. Look, it's easier to explain once we're inside the Mnemonic Planisphere. That's where Lord Seht stores his memories by—well, it's just easier to show you first.

Source: I'll speak to her and see what's going on.
Target: I'll speak to her and see what's going on.

Source: There's a whole slavering army of Reachmen and minotaurs laying siege to Falkreath Hold as we speak. The Nords won't hold off another attack, not without help anyway, and who better to stand with them against certain death than the Undaunted?
Target: There's a whole slavering army of Reachmen and minotaurs laying siege to Falkreath Hold as we speak. The Nords won't hold off another attack, not without help anyway, and who better to stand with them against certain death than the Undaunted?

Source: I'm from Clan Drilladan. Undead attacked our village weeks ago. We fled here and found this place just … abandoned. No one here. \n\nIt seemed perfect, so we settled in, and then these stone men—the Hollow—just burst from the ground and attacked!
Target: I'm from Clan Drilladan. Undead attacked our village weeks ago. We fled here and found this place just … abandoned. No one here. \n\nIt seemed perfect, so we settled in, and then these stone men—the Hollow—just burst from the ground and attacked!

Source: Gascone insisted that talking crows stole the key from him, right? We should start with them.\n\nAccording to the constables, the birds started stealing things as soon as they arrived. I've never seen a crow before. Is that sort of thing unusual?
Target: Gascone insisted that talking crows stole the key from him, right? We should start with them.\n\nAccording to the constables, the birds started stealing things as soon as they arrived. I've never seen a crow before. Is that sort of thing unusual?

Source: The Bloodroot Forge. Legend says it beats and thumps like a living thing, pounding out hot steel with the force of a mountain.\n\nMy kind of place, if it weren't crawling with Reachmen and minotaurs eager to quench their fresh blades in blood.
Target: The Bloodroot Forge. Legend says it beats and thumps like a living thing, pounding out hot steel with the force of a mountain.\n\nMy kind of place, if it weren't crawling with Reachmen and minotaurs eager to quench their fresh blades in blood.

Source: Threat facing Elsweyr?
Target: Threat facing Elsweyr?

Source: Not yet … but it is possible. The Elves in this part of the Valenwood do not follow King Camoran. They claim to be subjects of the "Wilderking," some forest spirit no one has ever seen.\n\nThey mock the Dominion and call Queen Ayrenn an enemy!
Target: Not yet … but it is possible. The Elves in this part of the Valenwood do not follow King Camoran. They claim to be subjects of the \\"Wilderking
column4: \"\" some forest spirit no one has ever seen.\n\nThey mock the Dominion and call Queen Ayrenn an enemy!"

Source: <<1>> craves your attention. He awaits you on a lower tier in the city. You must hurry!
Target: <<1>> craves your attention. He awaits you on a lower tier in the city. You must hurry!

Source: And where do you hope to uncover the Dragonguard's wisdom?
Target: And where do you hope to uncover the Dragonguard's wisdom?

Source: Today is the day that Lector Naril declares a new apprentice. I've improved my botanical knowledge and skills considerably since the selection day last year. I hope he sees how much I can help him in his work.
Target: Today is the day that Lector Naril declares a new apprentice. I've improved my botanical knowledge and skills considerably since the selection day last year. I hope he sees how much I can help him in his work.

Source: What's so urgent that Sai sent you to find me?
Target: What's so urgent that Sai sent you to find me?

Source: You want Yahgrondu to join us?
Target: You want Yahgrondu to join us?

Source: Your aid, in exchange for a sizable stipend. Divayth Fyr seeks a powerful artifact and requires a companion. He insists you are the only candidate worth considering. For now.\n\nGo to the Tribunal Temple in Mournhold. Lord Fyr waits for you there.
Target: Your aid, in exchange for a sizable stipend. Divayth Fyr seeks a powerful artifact and requires a companion. He insists you are the only candidate worth considering. For now.\n\nGo to the Tribunal Temple in Mournhold. Lord Fyr waits for you there.

Target: Any news?

Source: Is there anything you need help with?
Target: Is there anything you need help with?

Target: I'm looking to help.

Source: I admit, it was underhanded and unfair to you. I hope we can move past it though, as friends.\n\nCome visit me sometime. I'll make it up to you, all right? I bought some very fine Khajiit tea I've been dying to try.
Target: I admit, it was underhanded and unfair to you. I hope we can move past it though, as friends.\n\nCome visit me sometime. I'll make it up to you, all right? I bought some very fine Khajiit tea I've been dying to try.

Source: Try to talk to Gascone. He clearly doesn't care what I have to say, but he might listen to an exodromal. You remain, you know … a novelty. No offense.\n\nWe can't assemble the congress without the chancellor.
Target: Try to talk to Gascone. He clearly doesn't care what I have to say, but he might listen to an exodromal. You remain, you know … a novelty. No offense.\n\nWe can't assemble the congress without the chancellor.

Source: The Blackfeather Court seeks shiny baubles that glitter and gleam! Bring me ornate and decadent pieces of armor, encrusted with gems and jewels we can pick and pluck. \n\nOur hoard lacks these vital commodities, and only your assets can secure them.
Target: The Blackfeather Court seeks shiny baubles that glitter and gleam! Bring me ornate and decadent pieces of armor, encrusted with gems and jewels we can pick and pluck. \n\nOur hoard lacks these vital commodities, and only your assets can secure them.

Source: I'm not exactly sure. The Buoyant Armiger was accompanying Canon Valasa on a mission for Lord Vivec, but something terrible must have happened!\n\nCanon Valasa sent me to find help. She's on the road, just outside of Seyda Neen. Will you help them?
Target: I'm not exactly sure. The Buoyant Armiger was accompanying Canon Valasa on a mission for Lord Vivec, but something terrible must have happened!\n\nCanon Valasa sent me to find help. She's on the road, just outside of Seyda Neen. Will you help them?

Source: I'm looking to help.
Target: I'm looking to help.

Source: I'd like to help with any work you have available.
Target: I'd like to help with any work you have available.

Source: What seems to be the problem?
Target: What seems to be the problem?

Source: You never realize how much you need glue until you go without. \n\nLucky for us, <<1>> figured out a way to extract some sort of sap from wood husks found in Clockwork. Not quite sure what the stuff is, but it sticks scrap together like nothing else.
Target: You never realize how much you need glue until you go without. \n\nLucky for us, <<1>> figured out a way to extract some sort of sap from wood husks found in Clockwork. Not quite sure what the stuff is, but it sticks scrap together like nothing else.

Source: <The soldier carried a leather folio. Inside, an officer's commission is tucked beside a crude map. A large red mark, south of <<1>>, has been indicated on the map. It appears to be a Lion Guard outpost. The name "Ales" is scrawled beneath it.>
Target: <The soldier carried a leather folio. Inside, an officer's commission is tucked beside a crude map. A large red mark, south of <<1>>, has been indicated on the map. It appears to be a Lion Guard outpost. The name \\"Ales\"\" is scrawled beneath it.>"

Source: Baron Montclair decided to take control of Shornhelm. His troops hold the upper city and prepare to march on the rest. Countess Tamrith sent us to bring Count Ravenwatch to court.\n\nShe wants his counsel, but I'm not sure he's here.
Target: Baron Montclair decided to take control of Shornhelm. His troops hold the upper city and prepare to march on the rest. Countess Tamrith sent us to bring Count Ravenwatch to court.\n\nShe wants his counsel, but I'm not sure he's here.

Source: You got a knack for mining?\n\nThe ores in Clockwork have veins of something we call flash stone. It's thought to be worthless by most, but <<1>> has developed a way to grind it into an incredibly useful powder.
Target: You got a knack for mining?\n\nThe ores in Clockwork have veins of something we call flash stone. It's thought to be worthless by most, but <<1>> has developed a way to grind it into an incredibly useful powder.

Source: <<1>> needs more of the metal strands that are weaved into the clothing of Clockwork. You can find odd bits of cloth in the wilderness, and we'll supply you with a specialized lodestone that attracts the strands.
Target: <<1>> needs more of the metal strands that are weaved into the clothing of Clockwork. You can find odd bits of cloth in the wilderness, and we'll supply you with a specialized lodestone that attracts the strands.

Source: The general says we have to bide our time. We've got the ogres on the defensive, but he wants to wear them down before the final strike.\n\nOur soldiers in Menevia are wondering what in Oblivion's going on, but I can't leave to give them a message.
Target: The general says we have to bide our time. We've got the ogres on the defensive, but he wants to wear them down before the final strike.\n\nOur soldiers in Menevia are wondering what in Oblivion's going on, but I can't leave to give them a message.

Source: "Beware all travelers! The Deep Graves are no longer safe for pilgrims. Do not listen to the wisps."\n\n<Below the notice, there is an addendum in a different hand.>
Target: \\"Beware all travelers! The Deep Graves are no longer safe for pilgrims. Do not listen to the wisps.\"\"\n\n<Below the notice
column4: there is an addendum in a different hand.>"

Source: I'm not bluffing when I say the puddles around here can help fuel fires. \n\n<<1>>, genius she is, made a skimmer tool that collects machine oil from the water. The collection process is pretty painless, but there's a bit of a catch to the request.
Target: I'm not bluffing when I say the puddles around here can help fuel fires. \n\n<<1>>, genius she is, made a skimmer tool that collects machine oil from the water. The collection process is pretty painless, but there's a bit of a catch to the request.

Source: I don't know if that's wise. All this waiting's given me too much time to think. I can't get the idea out of my head that I'm not going to make it out of my next battle alive.\n\nMad as it may be, I've been thinking about making an offering to Azura.
Target: I don't know if that's wise. All this waiting's given me too much time to think. I can't get the idea out of my head that I'm not going to make it out of my next battle alive.\n\nMad as it may be, I've been thinking about making an offering to Azura.

Source: Most of Lady Lleraya's followers fell quickly after you defeated her. But a few of her toughest, most loyal vampires have hidden themselves away like vermin under a rock.\n\nWe've rooted out a few, but the work is dangerous and slow going.
Target: Most of Lady Lleraya's followers fell quickly after you defeated her. But a few of her toughest, most loyal vampires have hidden themselves away like vermin under a rock.\n\nWe've rooted out a few, but the work is dangerous and slow going.

Source: Then may I impose on you, as a fellow seeker? For all my learning, I can think of no escape from my predicament … save one. An experiment performed by one of my order, for which she was cast out from the Clockwork Apostles.\n\nI need you to find her.
Target: Then may I impose on you, as a fellow seeker? For all my learning, I can think of no escape from my predicament … save one. An experiment performed by one of my order, for which she was cast out from the Clockwork Apostles.\n\nI need you to find her.

Source: ACCEPT
Target: ACCEPT

Target: What did you find?

Source: This is about those journals we found in the Dragonguard sanctuaries?
Target: This is about those journals we found in the Dragonguard sanctuaries?

Target: <게시판에서 의뢰서를 떼어간다.>

Source: Someone named Leiborn at the Bards College needs a job done urgently.
Target: Someone named Leiborn at the Bards College needs a job done urgently.

Source: Slow down and tell me what happened.
Target: Slow down and tell me what happened.

Source: I need to meet with Jorunn the Skald-King's agent in Solitude, the capital city of Western Skyrim's Haafingar Hold. The agent is investigating a potential threat to not only Skyrim, but to all of Tamriel.
Target: I need to meet with Jorunn the Skald-King's agent in Solitude, the capital city of Western Skyrim's Haafingar Hold. The agent is investigating a potential threat to not only Skyrim, but to all of Tamriel.

Source: A group of soldiers came to town. They were dressed like the Marines, but … they set fire to the buildings! I heard someone say they were really part of the Veiled Heritance, that splinter group.
Target: A group of soldiers came to town. They were dressed like the Marines, but … they set fire to the buildings! I heard someone say they were really part of the Veiled Heritance, that splinter group.

Target: Is that serious?

Source: <Pull a Writ from the Board.>
Target: <게시판에서 의뢰서를 떼어간다.>

Source: It's the Veiled Heritance! The town is in flames! It all happened so fast. \n\nSilsailen is just north of here. Follow the road, and find the canonreeve's daughter, Elenwen. She'll know what to do.
Target: It's the Veiled Heritance! The town is in flames! It all happened so fast. \n\nSilsailen is just north of here. Follow the road, and find the canonreeve's daughter, Elenwen. She'll know what to do.

Source: I must weave the fine threads of the tertiary connections between the Precursor's parts. That will allow it to remain stable while moving. Not an easy task, believe me.\n\nI need you to go alert my sponsor, Lector Trivura.
Target: I must weave the fine threads of the tertiary connections between the Precursor's parts. That will allow it to remain stable while moving. Not an easy task, believe me.\n\nI need you to go alert my sponsor, Lector Trivura.

Source: Yes. Ignore my nostalgic nonsense—it's just an attempt to pretend my musty past is worth something more than it is. \n\nGetting old isn't easy. My dear Mirilir is passing. We came to see the flowers, but they don't seem to grow here any more.
Target: Yes. Ignore my nostalgic nonsense—it's just an attempt to pretend my musty past is worth something more than it is. \n\nGetting old isn't easy. My dear Mirilir is passing. We came to see the flowers, but they don't seem to grow here any more.

Source: Reflecting … reflecting ….\n\nLord Seht has developed a combat enabled machine named the Imperfect. It requires a variety of challenges to test its weaknesses and improve capabilities. With each defeat, more is learned.
Target: Reflecting … reflecting ….\n\nLord Seht has developed a combat enabled machine named the Imperfect. It requires a variety of challenges to test its weaknesses and improve capabilities. With each defeat, more is learned.

Source: Pup, a scion of Hircine has judged you worthy of joining his great hunt. You must prove yourself as a hunter to Hircine before you join our pack.
Target: Pup, a scion of Hircine has judged you worthy of joining his great hunt. You must prove yourself as a hunter to Hircine before you join our pack.

Source: The Shadow Cleft represents a serious threat to the Clockwork City. Adjunct Daro sent another apostle through the portal to investigate, but he hasn't returned.\n\nWe need someone competent to go in and find <<1>>.
Target: The Shadow Cleft represents a serious threat to the Clockwork City. Adjunct Daro sent another apostle through the portal to investigate, but he hasn't returned.\n\nWe need someone competent to go in and find <<1>>.

Source: "Initiate, a child of Mother Lamae has bestowed a gift upon you. They are the Bloodspeaker. They have chosen you to undergo the ancient rite of the Blood Matron. This is a great honor."
Target: \\"Initiate
column4: a child of Mother Lamae has bestowed a gift upon you. They are the Bloodspeaker. They have chosen you to undergo the ancient rite of the Blood Matron. This is a great honor.\"\""

Source: Once every season, the most brave and desperate members of our community make the journey to request a fortune from the Grand Prognosticator.\n\nNot everyone receives a prediction, but many have died hoping to have their destinies changed.
Target: Once every season, the most brave and desperate members of our community make the journey to request a fortune from the Grand Prognosticator.\n\nNot everyone receives a prediction, but many have died hoping to have their destinies changed.

Source: This guardsman is from the village of Silsailen. They're under attack. He managed to say something about the First Auridon Marines before he succumbed to his wounds. Something about a fire, the village ablaze.
Target: This guardsman is from the village of Silsailen. They're under attack. He managed to say something about the First Auridon Marines before he succumbed to his wounds. Something about a fire, the village ablaze.

Source: The featherless curs that wander this metal monstrosity refuse to display the proper amount of respect to the Court. They decline to pay our tributes! Worse, no plagues or pestilences ravage this land. That means there are no bodies to pick clean!
Target: The featherless curs that wander this metal monstrosity refuse to display the proper amount of respect to the Court. They decline to pay our tributes! Worse, no plagues or pestilences ravage this land. That means there are no bodies to pick clean!

Source: I believe the temple holds the secret to ending the Celestial threat.\n\nA vast library called the Seeker's Archive waits inside. I've visited it before, looking for answers to impossible questions. But since the Anka-Ra appeared, the way is sealed.
Target: I believe the temple holds the secret to ending the Celestial threat.\n\nA vast library called the Seeker's Archive waits inside. I've visited it before, looking for answers to impossible questions. But since the Anka-Ra appeared, the way is sealed.

Source: "Do you hunger for knowledge? The Mages Guild seeks only the most talented, smartest, and skilled for its ranks.\n\nDo you have what it takes? Seek out Nemarc at the Daggerfall Guildhall."
Target: \\"Do you hunger for knowledge? The Mages Guild seeks only the most talented
column4: smartest
column5: and skilled for its ranks.\n\nDo you have what it takes? Seek out Nemarc at the Daggerfall Guildhall.\"\""

Source: The Blackfeather Court likes nothing better than to peck and pick at the discarded carcasses of the most obnoxious creatures. To get at all the best bits, you see.\n\nCould you acquire some choice nibbles for our murder?
Target: The Blackfeather Court likes nothing better than to peck and pick at the discarded carcasses of the most obnoxious creatures. To get at all the best bits, you see.\n\nCould you acquire some choice nibbles for our murder?

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Source: This land of metal provides shiny bits, but there are no morsels to fill the bellies of the Blackfeather Court. We miss our favorite treats terribly!
Target: This land of metal provides shiny bits, but there are no morsels to fill the bellies of the Blackfeather Court. We miss our favorite treats terribly!

Source: And if I can handle more than that?
Target: And if I can handle more than that?

Target: \\"Ready for adventure? The Fighters Guild is looking for strong hearts and stout arms to combat the Daedric threat.\n\nSeek out Basile at the Daggerfall Guildhall
column4: today!\"\""

Source: Do you know what these attackers want?
Target: Do you know what these attackers want?

Source: [You nod your head, but you're not sure why you're doing that to a inscription…]
Target: [You nod your head, but you're not sure why you're doing that to a inscription…]

Source: The worthy crusade of the Fighters Guild! Surely you've heard of it! We have a new Guildmaster, and a new singular purpose. Why don't we talk about it for a moment?
Target: The worthy crusade of the Fighters Guild! Surely you've heard of it! We have a new Guildmaster, and a new singular purpose. Why don't we talk about it for a moment?

Source: Reflecting … reflecting ….\n\nA Daedric presence has been detected within the Radius. Threats include several creatures from the location Evergloam, including one called Wraith-of-Crows. Current patrol factotums are unable to defeat this threat.
Target: Reflecting … reflecting ….\n\nA Daedric presence has been detected within the Radius. Threats include several creatures from the location Evergloam, including one called Wraith-of-Crows. Current patrol factotums are unable to defeat this threat.

Source: Two tasks for the price of one?
Target: Two tasks for the price of one?

Source: What kind of guardian?
Target: What kind of guardian?

Source: What makes this Goutfang a rogue?
Target: What makes this Goutfang a rogue?

Source: So, this Goutfang really likes rice?
Target: So, this Goutfang really likes rice?

Source: Sealed Akaviri tomes? What does your client want with them?
Target: Sealed Akaviri tomes? What does your client want with them?

Source: Rahni'Za was once one of the great sword-schools, rivaled only by the Abbey of Blades.\n\nBut a betrayer gained entry through deception and trickery. He turned the mighty Sword-Disciples into thralls of the dread Celestial Serpent.
Target: Rahni'Za was once one of the great sword-schools, rivaled only by the Abbey of Blades.\n\nBut a betrayer gained entry through deception and trickery. He turned the mighty Sword-Disciples into thralls of the dread Celestial Serpent.

Source: I should talk to <<1>> in Senchal about what these tasks entail.
Target: I should talk to <<1>> in Senchal about what these tasks entail.

Source: The problem is I have the ignominious duty of offering up the redemption of this office's honor to any interested party. All because we're playing minder to newcomers in record numbers.\n\nWhat I'm trying to say is I require help to honor our fallen.
Target: The problem is I have the ignominious duty of offering up the redemption of this office's honor to any interested party. All because we're playing minder to newcomers in record numbers.\n\nWhat I'm trying to say is I require help to honor our fallen.

Source: This place looks dangerous. Do you plan to go inside?
Target: This place looks dangerous. Do you plan to go inside?

Source: Auri-El forgive us. We rendezvoused with a Covenant officer and her husband. She wanted to defect. \n\nThe damned Daggers caught wind of it and chased us all the way from Khefrem.
Target: Auri-El forgive us. We rendezvoused with a Covenant officer and her husband. She wanted to defect. \n\nThe damned Daggers caught wind of it and chased us all the way from Khefrem.

Source: The Sea Sload B'Korgen has turned the Welenkin Cove west of Alinor into a lair of sorts. My scouts report that the vile Sload uses alchemy to empower the other members of the Abyssal Cabal and transform yaghra into even more fearsome creatures.
Target: The Sea Sload B'Korgen has turned the Welenkin Cove west of Alinor into a lair of sorts. My scouts report that the vile Sload uses alchemy to empower the other members of the Abyssal Cabal and transform yaghra into even more fearsome creatures.

Source: I'm here with the Mages Guild expedition run by Telenger the Artificer. He's an obstinate old Elf these days. Some of my friends entered the dig site, but we haven't heard from them for hours. Now there are spirits all over the ruins!
Target: I'm here with the Mages Guild expedition run by Telenger the Artificer. He's an obstinate old Elf these days. Some of my friends entered the dig site, but we haven't heard from them for hours. Now there are spirits all over the ruins!

Source: All gryphons are dangerous, but Haeliata and his mate Nagravia stand out from the rest of their kind. To make matters worse, they've developed a taste for mer flesh. We've received reports of them hunting down travelers.\n\nYou need to take them out.
Target: All gryphons are dangerous, but Haeliata and his mate Nagravia stand out from the rest of their kind. To make matters worse, they've developed a taste for mer flesh. We've received reports of them hunting down travelers.\n\nYou need to take them out.

Source: Me? Oh, I'm just picking up supplies for the observatory. Not a task for someone who has seen and done all that you have. \n\nErold, on the other hand, was going on about ancient ruins and magical amulets or some such. It all sounded very exciting.
Target: Me? Oh, I'm just picking up supplies for the observatory. Not a task for someone who has seen and done all that you have. \n\nErold, on the other hand, was going on about ancient ruins and magical amulets or some such. It all sounded very exciting.

Source: Then you distinguish yourself from many of the newcomers I see.\n\nYour duty today will be to investigate the unholy perversion of our beloved isles. There are unsettling rumors that the curse of Corgrad is spreading. The Sapiarchs desire evidence.
Target: Then you distinguish yourself from many of the newcomers I see.\n\nYour duty today will be to investigate the unholy perversion of our beloved isles. There are unsettling rumors that the curse of Corgrad is spreading. The Sapiarchs desire evidence.

Source: You've probably fought—what—some mudcrabs and malnourished bandits?\n\nUndaunted tackle the big things. Scary things, found only in the dark places of the world. Things with flesh-eating-fists hungry for your face.
Target: You've probably fought—what—some mudcrabs and malnourished bandits?\n\nUndaunted tackle the big things. Scary things, found only in the dark places of the world. Things with flesh-eating-fists hungry for your face.

Source: Caanerin, the indrik matriarch, has returned to her ancestral glade near the center of the Isle. \n\nThe last time this happened, she fawned a whole herd of lesser indrik and destroyed half of Russafeld. Obviously, that will not do.
Target: 인드릭의 우두머리 카네린이 섬의 중심 부근에 있는 그녀 선조들의 습지로 돌아왔네.\n\n전에 그녀가 돌아왔을 때, 그녀는 작은 인드릭의 대군을 만들어 러사펠드의 절반을 파괴했지. 그런 일은 더 이상 일어나서는 안돼.

Source:

(<<2>>): any radish will do.

Deliver to <<4>> in Woodhearth to claim payment."

Source: A few days ago, our research team was sent to excavate this ruined city.\n\nBut things turned bad quickly. The water inside is cursed. Half the researchers are insane or dead. We sent a runner for reinforcements, but I guess he didn't make it.
Target: A few days ago, our research team was sent to excavate this ruined city.\n\nBut things turned bad quickly. The water inside is cursed. Half the researchers are insane or dead. We sent a runner for reinforcements, but I guess he didn't make it.

Source: The Halls of Regulation is in need of vitally important maintenance. This particular task involves oiling a rusty ventilation fan. Simple enough, if not for the malfunctioning repair factotums constantly attacking anyone who enters.
